business.name: Oceana Grill
business.categories: Restaurants, Seafood, Cajun/Creole, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text:
This was an okay bar. The food was not great but It was not horrible. We went twice. The first time we had dinner, which was a side of fettuccine and oysters. The oysters were fine but in all of Louisiana (okay in the French quarters) they don't serve vignette with oysters. Also, these warm
oysters are very mild in flavor. The server was nice but she spent most for her time in eye view outside talking to someone in the courtyard and was not very attentive to our table. The next day we went for brunch, which was a much better experience. The shrimp and grits were delightful, and the server and service was amazing as well!

Our family was visiting from Florida and stopped in. We absolutely loved this place The staff was super friendly from the moment we walked in and all the way through our meal. Our server Corey was AMAZING!!! The food was delicious from start to finish... very impressed all around!! I highly recommend Oceania!!!

The best crab cakes I've ever had. I mean everything was delicious. We were recommended to try Oceana by the concierge of our hotel, straight off the plane and it was one of the best experiences of our trip. The staff was so warm and welcoming and our waiter, with the distinct deep Louisiana voice (who's name escapes me but it starts with an O) gave us the best menu recommendations and the best service. We will be going back on our next trip to NOLA! Crab Cakes and Chargrilled Oysters a must! Oh, and delicious Hurricane cocktail!

If we could give half stars I'd give 2.5. The service was great and crab cakes were good and that's about it. I ordered the Louisiana platter. The gumbo was about 90% rice, the beans were about 60% rice, the jambalaya tasted stale like it was sitting there awhile. On top of that the bathroom was flooded and all dirty inside. Maybe it was a bad day but definitely my least favorite dinner spot during our visit.

Ordered a cup of gumbo and the red beans and rice through DoorDash.  The delivery was fast.  The gumbo and the red beans and rice were very good but the $16 charged for the small quantity of red beans and rice was absolutely ridiculous. Food was 4-5 starts but due to price, I'm giving it 3 stars.  Looks like this place may be in the French Quarter, hence the high prices.  Do go, but hold on to your wallet.

A group of us went to this place on a Friday for a late lunch after arriving in town. There were very few tables occupied but the amount of time it took to get our food and be waited on was disappointing. The overall taste of the food was okay but not the best. We weren't impressed.
The ratatouille in this was amazing, definitely recommend along with the ultimate Long Island

This used to be one of our favorite places after we discovered it when we first moved down here. Tonight we came back and they've removed the tuna options from the menu. Super disappointed. We still like the blackened gator bite appetizer but without our favorite options on the menu, driving down here and paying for parking just aren't worth it. 

Since there wasn't tuna today we ended up with a the red fish under chefs specials. It was ok but not amazing. I really dislike their mixed veggie side as it's not the typical carrot, broccoli, cauliflower mix. The mashed potatoes are really good though.

Great food, excellent service.

We were in New Orleans on a Sunday evening (cruise was next day).  Went walking up Bourbon, looking at restaurants.  Many were 1/4 full or less (it was a Sunday night after all).  But this one was mostly full.  Always a good sign.

Had Justin as our server.  Excellent service.  Very attentive, but not overbearing.  One of our entrees was cold when it was brought to the table, Justin immediately took it back, and had a new one made.  Mistakes happen, it is how you handle them that makes the difference, and Justin handled it perfectly.  Of course this also speaks for the restaurant as a whole, that servers are allowed to make such a decision.  Great all around.

The food was excellent.  Had the Taste of New Orleans, and crab cakes between the two of us.  Both were excellent.  Also had the alligator bites for appetizer, also excellent, and not just one or two tiny pieces (like so many places do), but an actual decent amount.  The alligator bites would actually be enough for a small meal if one was not very hungry.

Only negative - hot sauce.  They had a couple of standards on the table, and Justin said he could have gotten Tabasco,  but none of those are very hot.   I suggest that the restaurant get some real hot sauces (this is New Orleans right???).

Service was great! Atmosphere was good, we ordered the crab cakes to start and they were really good! For our entrees we ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which came out almost cold, like yesterdays food reheated in a microwave. Did not taste fresh at all. We also had the blackened Bayou Duck, which was good nothing over the top spectacular but good. It came with a side of jambalaya that was also cold and not fresh. Overall it was an okay spot, but we wouldn't visit again.

It was my boyfriend and my first time in New Orleans, celebrating accomplishments of 2021 and celebrating a new year of adventures. My brother and his girlfriend recommended we try this place while in NOLA. I am so happy I was able to oblige. The Oceana Oysters and a side of fries were definitely the highlights of our order. It was so good! Corey, our server, was so hospitable! He added to my great evening with his positivity. Thank you for making our first evening in NOLA great!

We decided to eat lunch/dinner here and so glad w did. It was actually recommended by the door staff here at the Omni Hotel. Our server T was great! I had the Taste of New Orleans (so yummy) and a bowl of Seafood Gumbo (so yummy and simple). Totally recommend this spot! Great vibe and building too.

When a restaurant is packed for Saturday lunch in the French Quarter you know this is the place to go.  How many restaurants are in NOLA?  Hundreds?? I had the chef special, Red fish.  Very fresh and tasty.  My waitress Latricia was wonderful and really worked hard,  I shall return.
Great food and spectacular customer service I particularly drive there just to have spinach ravioli and blackened chicken it's my FAVORITE dish on the menu
In town for the weekend and came across this place! Wow the crab cakes are OUT OF THIS WORLD! Our server Errol was THE MAN and gave us great food suggestions! You won't be disappointed!

Holy moly! Everything we had was ridiculously delicious. We had the gator bites, the Taste of New Orleans and Hurricanes. I was in heaven. Not to mention Errol was such an sweet server. What an amazing, authentic experience. Def recommended everyone try this spot.

Ok so super late and I mean LATE post but better late than never.  Honestly I've been bragging and salivating about the next time I'm in New Orleans and how quickly I will be stopping in here!  So I when I was here about 4.5 years ago our concierge recommended this place.  He also stated the best time to go before the crowds.  Basically right before HH!  Why am I obsessed with this place? Let me tell you when I say there's a crowd that lines up to get in.  To me ... it's all about the gator bites!  Best thing ever especially the blackened.  Our first visit yes (we went more that once ... seriously that good) we got the fried/blackened! The other two times just blackened! 
I was super excited at the thought of my potentially traveling to NO next month for work but with the Omnicron spreading like wildfire the trip sadly isn't likely to happen.  Obviously this would been a must have stop for me.  Til next time Oceana!  Please don't take them off the menu and if you ever get into shipping them ... lmk I will certainly be ordering!
I stopped by for breakfast and had Biscuits and Gravy and a side of two eggs over easy. It was good stick-to-your-ribs fare.  Happy with it.
My server Latricia was wonderfully hospitable and the food was delicious! I came here for some good Nola vibes and food and I got both.
Amazing food. Stopped for breakfast. Crepes and omelets were out of this world. Latricia is fantastic!
Great food and even better service! Carly is top notch and will take the best care of you! So personable and caring. 10/5!

Excellent Service
Excellent food
Excellent ambience
Excellent drinks
Everything about this place was amazing, from the gator bites to the Redfish

We chose Oceana Grill at first because it was one of the few restaurants open after 10 PM on a weekday but ended up coming back another time. We ordered to-go both times, and our food was always ready fast and packaged well to avoid any leakage during transportation. 

Thoughts on the following:
- Barbecued Shrimp ($25): The BBQ shrimp is a NOLA classic you have to try, though I would say the name is a bit misleading. It didn't taste anything like traditional barbecue. Instead, it had more of an alcoholic/ cooking wine taste to it. It also was buttery, and tangy. I really enjoyed the shrimp.

- Cajun Jambalaya Pasta ($23): This was absolutely life-changing and hands down the best pasta I've ever had. The flavor of this pasta was so unique and it's something I had never tasted before. The fettuccine pasta was tossed in a creamy creole sauce and had bits of alligator and shrimp in it. It was colorful, well-seasoned, and just flawless. Though creamy and flavorful, the pasta didn't feel too heavy. I feel like people don't think about ordering pasta in New Orleans, or at least I certainly did not, but you have to give this a try. 

- Crawfish Etouffée ($18): the etouffee is a stew with a ball of rice in it and it's topped with bits of crawfish. Winter is not crawfish season, so I was glad to try a bit through the etouffee. Again, the seasoning for anything cajun is just so on point. 

- Fried Soft Shell Crab ($8): Gotta have crabs when you're in New Orleans but I actually struggled to find places with fried soft shell crabs. Fortunately, Oceana had it. I just wanted a taste, so I ordered one crab. It came with a cocktail dipping sauce. The crab was so good and had a texture comparable to shrimp tempura. 

I had Oceana Grill on my first night in New Orleans and it was a great start to the trip. All these flavors were so new to me and worked so well with every dish. My only complaint is that when you order take-out they give you something like Hawaiian bread instead of toasted baguette slices. Other than that, I loved all the food here and highly recommend it. 

Tips and Notes:
- If you order pickup online through their website, there is a slight discount for first-time users. Not sure if this is an ongoing thing, but something to keep in mind. 
- Most of the regular dishes had appetizer/ smaller sized dishes for you to taste and try. So, if you're overwhelmed and don't know what to get, you can get tons of mini dishes.

I decided to order the Blackened Chicken Platter and it did not disappoint. The chicken was very juicy and flavorful with the perfect amount of kick. The side of garlic mashed potatoes was also very good. Would definitely recommend.

This place is delicious! Servers are extremely polite, helpful, and attentive. I tried their redfish plate and the sauce is so good! Blackened chicken was flavorful. Cajun fries are also so good, recommend getting that for the table! It's definitely a pricey place though so don't be surprised. Just my plate and a beer we're about $30 but what can you expect, it's seafood and delicious!

business.name: Cochon
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, Seafood, Restaurants

reviews.text: Definitely the least memorable dining experience I had during my trip to New Orleans. Nothing was actively bad but all of the food was resoundingly "meh". Given the price point and the wealth of other incredible options, I would not go back

The atmosphere was cute, wooden chairs and tables, cozy enough. The rolls that came out were hot and delicious. We ordered the gumbo, which was very flavorful, but it came out room temperature. After 5 minutes, it was cold. Had to ask to have it reheated. Head cheese board was good, but an acquired taste. The pickles that come with it are sweet pickles for those who are picky about their pickles. Mac and cheese was good, but average. Overall a very average meal for high prices.

Order fried alligator and it was good but the chili garlic Mayo tasted just like regular Mayo. The bread was amazing!!!! I loved it and the butter but it came a little too late in my opinion. The service was average. Not going to complain but was far from impressed. As. For an entree I got the fried catfish. That was a mistake. It was so SOUR like someone had squeezed two full limes on top of a finished dish so that was all I tasted. It had zero balance and I even through it was $25+tax I couldn't eat it. I just filled up in bread instead. The greens were horseradish and again hit you straight in the nose. Horseradish and limes.... Gross. The grits were the best part but under seasoned. I mixed it with the bread butter to get it a bit better. I tried some of my friends Mac n cheese as well and thought the roux was gritty and the overall flavor could use a punch up. It was too mellow for me but everyone else loved it. 

TLDR: feels like I ate a meal that was A+ by design but was executed by the reserve squad. Great ideas but less than average execution. I should've stopped at the table bread

I love, love, love this place and it's sister restaurant Peche. This is probably a top 5 meal I have ever had.
I just finished work late, the place was recommended to me. I sat alone at the bar and ordered alligator bites which were the tastiest. I literally can't wait to eat them again. 
The catfish with grits and charred greens blew my mind. Kudos to this amazing chef.

If you like fat and gristle and paying the equivalent of your monthly utility bills for a meal, knock yourself out. I'm sure it's easy to to dupe clueless tourists with this "elevated" Cajun/creole food, but if you've spent any time living in Louisiana you'd probably agree that charging $14 dollars for three slices of hoghead cheese and some stiff crackers is criminal.

Very disappointing small portions.

Ended up paying about $100 of disappointment. 

Pork belly is mostly fat.
Most dishes are essentially overpriced.

They need to work on the portions.

My friends and I have been to NoLa three times, and Cochon has always been a part of our trips. From a party of 8 to a party of 3, our groups always love coming here! The food is delicious and they have a great whiskey/bourbon list as well! The staff is incredibly kind and helpful. We've never had a bad meal from pork (cochon) to rabbit to gator bites to dessert! We are repeat customers!

This restaurant presented the oldest dilemma regarding a restaurant:
What's more important the food or the service?
Even though the food was really excellent I would not go back because of how we were treated.
Let's start with the host. After waiting by the entrance for a while (even though the restaurant was barely at half capacity), the host "found the time" to greet us. We pointed out that there was another group in front of us he replied in the most sarcastic tone: "I know, I was just saying hi". We were really put off but decided to ignore anticipating a great meal.
Then came the waiter. One word to describe him: glacial.
Let's say he was less than enthusiastic to see us there, which strikes me as odd, since I would think servers at a restaurant would be really happy to see any customers on a Tuesday night, when there's a pandemic happening and restaurants are desperately suffering. But that's me.
Bottom line, it's too bad I had to spend the entire review talking about service and didn't even mention the food, which was great.

Went there December 23 2021. Service was awesome and food was delicious. We were waited on by Juan and Stephanie. They were so knowledgeable about the food. I had the pork chop and was the best I've ever eaten. Highly recommend this cozy place
The food was excellent but pricey. The wait staff, Nick, was attentive without being overly intrusive.
Loved the food!! Catfish and grits was delicious, pork good. Only reason for the one less star is we didn't get the app we ordered.

Service was awesome, great drinks, the grilled oysters were wow!!!!! The sauce it's self could be drank. The shrimp app was amazing!!!!! Oyster Poe boy was so so but the rest of our meals were to die for. Great spot must go, best experience while in town, did not lack staffing and if so did a great job.

Unfortunately Cochon has definitely gone downhill since we last ate here. For what you pay, the service is quite sloppy, and the food is somewhat lacking.

For example, our server forgot to review the beef/fish/pork options on the menu when she was taking our drink order; we didn't get bread until long after our appetizers arrived; we ordered a dessert wine with our dessert and were told they couldn't find it after we had already finished the food...

In terms of the main courses: the Cochon tasted good, but there was more fat than actual meat on the portion. My meal partners kept cutting and digging for an inordinate amount of time to actually find bits of meat to eat. We also ordered the gulf fish dish, and it was rather overcooked, the skin was unscaled (and therefore inedible), and it was strangely under-seasoned and flavorless.

All in all, it was pretty disappointing for such an expensive meal. It was the worst meal of our trip to New Orleans.
Good, but not great. We enjoyed the dishes but nothing was a wow. Seemed to be coasting and not trying for fresh ideas and imaginative.

Wonderful food, great service, chef is an awesome person too. We've been coming here for years, whenever we are in town. Often have my birthday dinner here with a large group. Never a disappointment, always a pleasure. Can't wait to return!

I agree with a previous review that stated nothing was wrong but nothing was great. In a place where so many places to eat are outstanding this isn't one I would repeat or recommend if you have one night in NOLA.

That being said, excellent service. The stand outs food wise where the wood fired oysters and the rabbit & dumplings, the boudin, Cochon, and short ribs where as described but not inspiring, the alligator and dessert was not great.

Out of all the restaurants I've tried during my week in New Orleans, Cochon was the best.  I should have gone back to try the rest of the menu.  For my drink, I got a lemonade.   It was house made and refreshing.

To start, we had beautiful warm bread rolls with butter.  They were like King's Hawaiian sweet rolls, but to the next level.  The wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter were incredible!  I've never had oysters served like this.    They came in a hexagon cast iron and you could taste how fresh the oysters were.  I should have ordered one more.  

Fried Alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise.  The alligator had a nice fried coating that was dressed with delectable mayo.  I order alligator whenever I see it on the menu and I would definitely come back for more.

I came for lunch with a group of 8 for lunch.  The space itself was great and had a nice warm/homey feel to it.  We started off with bacon/pork pie and fried boudin. Fried boudin is a cajun meatball with rice and pork in it. Both starters were so delicious.  We were fighting over the leftovers and debated ordering more.  I had the cucumber salad.  It was nice to have that to brighten up my palate before the next course.  The entrée I had was a grilled flank steak with potatoes and mushrooms.  The steak was cooked to perfection and very tender.  The potatoes and mushrooms were a perfect addition to the steak.  My husband had the cochon of the day which was a fried pork chop.  Oh my lord!  It was soo good and I kept getting bites of his. 

The staff were very attentive and friendly.  This is a must-do in NO.  I can't wait to go back!

Hands down the best food in Nola. So good, went back a second night. The rabbit and dumplings has to be number 1 item, followed closely by the spare ribs. Was part of a group and we all did family style so we could taste everything. Honestly, you can't go wrong with any of the dishes.
Sheesh.....get the damn pigs feet. Get the damn catfish. Get the damn rabbit. So damn awesime.

4.5 stars here. our dinner with friends on arrival in New Orleans. Highly regarded Cajun cuisine that works with local farms for a large amount of their ingredients. Menu, though not extensive, looked great before our arrival so was looking very forward to our meal. I would consider it on the pricy side, though maybe not for New Orleans. Very personable service throughout our time here. Once seated we ordered drinks and perused the menu. A bowl of delicious rolls with butter arrived shortly. Having just gotten off a plane and not being all that hungry, along with being budget conscious, we chose to order light. Wife ordered the bacon and pork pie and the cucumbers and herbs in vinegar salad. My choices were the chicken & andouille sausage gumbo along with fried alligator with chili garlic mayo. The pork pie was a bit light on flavor-lacking any discernible seasoning or bacon flavor. More bacon would add a lot. The crust was well made and it was cooked perfectly. Cucumber salad had a large amount, IMO, of red chili flakes not listed on the menu. Avoiding them was difficult but she powered through it, pronouncing it "fine". My gator was delicious, tasting very fresh and lightly breaded. But for me, as I was expecting, the chili mayo was too much for my palate. Very small bits of sauce added to the flavor but it was easy to add too much. The gumbo was the star of the show for me. Deep, rich flavor profile along with tender veggies and sausage that was flavorful without being too hot. I should really have ordered more of this.

I didn't pay as much attention to our companions' meals as I should have but I did try a bite of the wood fired gulf fish served "fishermen's" style that on our visit was redfish. Requested grilled, it had a great seasoning and was very reminiscent, IMO, of a fresh trout, though the person who ordered it compared it to halibut. I didn't think so.  Desserts were a German Chocolate Pie and an Apple Cider donut. The donut was pronounced flavorful by our fellow diners but I never tried it as I was fully involved in our pie. I will say it was not really like a pie IMO as the texture was very firm, not soft and moist like a traditional pie. It resembled to me more of a pecan pie with chocolate and coconut or a 7-layer bar for those who know what those are. Very very good. A really enjoyable meal. I'd come back again for sure.

Making reservations is easy with the app.  Anastasia (sp?) was our server and she is very courteous.  There are so many great appetizers I had to order three!  None of them disappointed. I had the pork pie, boudin balls, and fried alligator.  The fried alligator is served with a mint garnish - excellent.  As an entree I had the rabbit & dumplings which was peppery, velvety, rustic, and filling! I enjoyed it.  It did not taste "gamey" at all.
Fantastic lunch spot. Great service and wine selection. Gumbo was incredible, squash was perfection.

A pleasant surprise of a place after a day at the museum; an easy five minute walk.  Great bar area in a modern atmosphere of a fine, fun dining experience.  Service was good. Braised short ribs were delicious with just a bit of spice and two potatoes with finely diced vegetables. Really good and recommended.  Mac-n-cheese was also good and had some great taste too. I wanted to do the oysters but I felt they were a little pricey on my budget. Great place. Try it!

Great food in a relaxed, modern location. Prices seem to be on the higher side by NOLA standards, but being from the Boston area, these prices are more what I am used to.

For food, I had the gumbo, fried gator, and wood-fired oysters. For drinks: the Ramblin Rose and the Elevation.

The gumbo was pleasant and well-balanced. It had good flavor and spice without overdoing it. Some of the rice felt a little undercooked, but I'm not sure if that's intentional. There was also a small bone in the gumbo (oops). 

The fried gator was a tasty dish as well. It was breaded nicely, and I liked the chili-garlic mayonnaise sauce and other garnishes.  I want to note that some pieces were a little less tender than others, but full disclosure, I'm not sure if that is the nature of gator meat.

The wood-fired oysters were solid. These were cooked oysters in a buttery and slightly spicy sauce. Not at all bad as far as cooked oysters go. 

As for the drinks:

The Ramblin Rose was light and refreshing. I could feel the alcohol within, but this drink is not at all spirit-forward. The Elevation, meanwhile, brought some of those spirits closer forward, as well as some smokey and spicy notes!

The food came out quickly, and the service was kind.

business.name: Ulele
business.categories: Breweries, Food, American (New), Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Seafood

reviews.text: Stop by for lunch & ordered the Seared Scallops, Charboiled Oysters, Garuda Grouper & Juan's Snappers. Let me tell you everything was awesome! So fresh & tasty. For drinks I ordered the Riverwalk Sazerac which was great! Shout out to our server Lennon G! He was great.

Lennon was great! My boyfriend and I are visiting out of state and saw this restaurant on top Tampa restaurants and it definitely delivered! We asked Lennon which entrees were the most popular and we went with his recommendation - my boyfriend ordered the Gouda Grouper, I had Juan's Snapper, and we shared the scallops and 6 charbroiler oysters. Everything was AMAZING! Thanks for the great experience, Lennon!

One of my go to restaurants. For drinks, the indoor bar is one of my favorites but I also don't mind outside. If you're having dinner I suggest eating inside to avoid flies. My most recent trip here was for a birthday dinner with 12 other people. We received exceptional service! 

Drink: The pina con fuego is sweet & smooth. 

Appetizers: Their scallops are a must for me, perfectly cooked with pork belly, asparagus & cherry tomatoes...amazing combo. I'm not a big oyster eater but I love their charbroiled oysters--buttery, garlicky & cheesy with yummy bread but they're best when brought out fresh/hot. The okra fries are interesting, light & crispy without lacking flavor. 

Entree: I enjoyed a great 8 oz cut of medium well filet mignon. It's paired with buttery mashed potatoes & green beans with minced garlic. I split this meal with someone since we had so many appetizers & it was more than enough.
The place was fantastic. The food here was really delicious. I went with my friends and it is a great place to hang out. I would definitely recommend this place.

Really good dishes! Stopped in on a Friday night and got sat really quickly! The beet salad and the oysters were incredible! A little pricey for the oysters but worth it. Leave room for dessert! This ice cream ball had bacon in it ! It was amazing. Can't wait to go back !

Ulele was a great restaurant and truly enjoyed their amazing service and food selection. My one concern was the restaurant's theme. It appears to be all over the place. We could not tell if it was a Native American theme, pirate theme, fairy tale theme, or classic Americana. They have great food but atmosphere was kinda confusing.

Wow ! You have outdone yourself Ulele! Had the pleasure of hosting my baby shower here. Emily, the party coordinator was a delight to work with. Very prompt in her responses, I am an email type of person and do not like phone contact. We visited the venue twice before booking and she was able to accommodate us both times. 
There are several different private areas and rooms to book your event. We originally chose the rooftop patio but due to change in weather we moved it to fireside mezzanine indoors. I had a party of less than 25 guests, and the only minimum for these areas were $1000 worth of food and drink orders, otherwise there is no charge to rent the space: I called around to several other venues in the Tampa area and by far this was the best deal. She was also able to work with me on last-minute changes such as number of guests. They are able to provide  tables in sets of four, five, or eight, and also includes linen. The space itself is beautiful that much not much decoration was needed. 
We had two servers on the day of the event for the ladies. They were phenomenal and were on top of everything from drinkrefills to taking photos to cleaning the crumbs off our tables and re-folding our napkins. There was a good selection of menu and drink items. Everyone had a great time and left with smiles on their face!

The food is excellent and is a must visit if you come to Tampa. 
This place is busy so book a spot if you can!

My blackened Mahi-mahi was bad.
It was well done and barely edible.  
This dish should never have left the kitchen and 
shame on me for attempting to eat it and worse 
paying for it.
Suffice to say, I'll never return 'nor recommend ULELE.

This place came highly recommended from several friends in the state, not Tampa but the state, and we were blown away!! We called ahead and made reservations and when we arrived our table was ready out on the patio with the best view ever. We did not order any food... That's right not one bite!! Hard to believe?? Alison, our server,  told us what to get and WOW...WOW!! First was the fried oysters, succulent and cooked to perfection. Then came one of the best prime ribs I have had in my 64 years, cooked just right and melt in you mouth. My mouth is watering now just thinking about it!! Allison asked us about desert and recommended a Strawberry cheesecake that was the icing on the cake to a fantastic dinner. The food was a 12 /13 out of 10 and the server the best we could have even had. I called the manager over to let him know of our experience and it still bring tears to my eyes to just say thank you so very much. She is the best, your food and atmosphere was superior and when we come back she is the only one we want to be our server. She makes your place better, the best in town.

While in Tampa, Ulele came recommended by several people, so we had to try it out. At first glance I was surprise because it's an attractive restaurant with a huge open space where you can walk to other bars and restaurants. It's a great place to go with family, eat and walk around with some drinks. I did not know this at the time but Ulele is located in the old Tampa Water Works plant building built in 1902, which symbolizes a piece of Tampa's history.... A little fun fact. 

The setting is amazing however what disappointed me was how for the entire weekend we tried calling to make a reservation but nobody answered. Regardless we still went as a walk in and the hostess told us it was going to be a 2 hr wait! I didn't care since we can walk around and kill time, so I put my name and phone number and went to a bar close by to order some drinks. Not even 30 min passed and I received a text saying our table was ready. It was inconvenient since we were expecting a 2 hr wait and we just ordered our drinks, so we had to discard our drinks so we can make it to our table before they gave it to someone else. I noticed a trend where hostess will give a fake time to deter customers, the reason I do not know but it is obnoxious because time is priceless and planning becomes difficult when timing is incorrect.

The scallops were delicious and soft, it melted right in my mouth. Although the green beans and mashed potatoes was delicious, the meat loaf did not look nor taste fresh which was another disappointment because the meal didn't match the price.

Excellent!! Pompano Pallady (named after the best fisherman) over wild rice with cream sauce and tiny shrimp extraordinary! Grouper with smoked Gouda bechemal exquisite! Portobello mushroom stuffed with zucchini bell peppers cranberry beans delicious! Nice combination! Beet and pear salad with goat cheese unusual and far out! Crispy fried carrot ribbons unique as was the fried okra. Presentation was on point. Beautiful setting at old water works with nursery rhyme statues from Lowry Zoo next to original spring. Fabulous! We sat outdoors with flaming pillars! Six or seven stars!!! Oh Jonnie our waitress was efficient, well informed of the food and knowledgeable of the history, sweet friendly and blushing!
Ate here after my wedding, some of best food you will have in Tampa. Great selections!
Great service, atmosphere,  poor food.  Outstanding outdoor area.  Take a pass on the Okra app
Oysters snd scallops are delicious and highly recommended. Bar drinks are great too and the service is outstanding!

Only one word.......Outstanding! This place is great for out with the wifey for lunch and dinner. The art work surrounding the restaurant is Phenomenal! You can eat out Side and have a view of Tampa's great scenery. Look don't take my word for it, just come and check this spot out. And tell Big Will sent me! Lol!
Ulele has great food and a wonderful atmosphere!  It's a go to  to take out of town visitors as well as meeting up with local friends.

While in town in the greater Tampa area, we wanted to try something new, yet homemade fresh ingredients local to Tampa. 

We called to see if we can reserve a table, but the friendly receptionist over the phone advised that todays booking is FULL, and walk-in is still Open. Wait time for indoors will vary from 30 mins or more and outdoor seating will be from 1 hour or more. Best to make reservation in advance if possible. We decided to just visit this sought out establishment and take our chances. 

We arrived and found parking in the nearby Armature Works Parking lot, available all day for $10. You can take your chances on street parking but it requires some waiting and perseverance because it is PACKED!! $10 is worth the time! 

Got to the restaurant and placed our name on the wait list. What was said over the phone is entirely correct. Our outdoor seating will be a 1 hour wait. 

Moments later, after visiting the nearby River Walk Trails and checking out the nearby shops at the Armature Works, our 1 hour wait for our walk-in for outdoor seating was honored. 

After we got the text that our table was ready, our receptionist seated us immediately and our server, Ms. Taylor, greeted us to some water and prepared our menus and napkin kit. 


INDOOR Seating:
-- 15 Tables seating up to 5/6 Upstairs
-- 20 Tables seating up to 5/6 Downstairs
-- Better to reserve in advance; otherwise wait can be 30 minutes or more

OUTDOOR Seating:
-- 19 Tables with up to 5 seats
-- 16 Barstools for the expanded outdoor bar area (first come first serve)
-- Walk-ins wait can be 1 hour or more (even on Mondays, according to our server)

After sitting down and water already provided, we ordered two glass of Blancs de' Blancs Sparkling Wine and two order of Appetizers to start our evening off:  A Dozen of Char-boiled Oysters, Seared Fresh Sea Scallops. 

For our main entrè, we ordered the Seafood Risotto and the 1 LB Crackling Pork Shank. 

The appetizers came out no more than 10 minutes after we placed the ordered. 15 minutes into the appetizers ALL tasting superb and fabulously-tasty, the main dishes came out. Man, what a great customer service and cooking experts at this place. The great things we've heard on YouTube reviews by the locals were spot on correctly described. 

The oysters were so fresh and yummy, not chewy. 
The seared scallops were so tender and fresh as if it wasn't even seared. Melts in the mouth like butter. The Seafood Risotto was probably the best dish we've had. Rice parley with shrimp, lobster , scallops and veggies tasted amazing. The rice was a bit salty but a squeeze of lemon did the trick. The pork shank was meaty and mighty delicious and full of BBQ flavor from meat to bones. The meat fell off the bones and simply melt in your mouth like butter! 

I'm recommending this place for other locals and tourist alike or even for foodie reviewers like myself.  

Wait can be a THING for people but if you dare to wait, I promise the food is fabulous!!
The food is pretty good. When downtown Tampa have special events the wait can be really long. The best time to go is during the week, most of the time we just walk in.

This place was fantastic! I had to drink the Piña con fuego. It's a sweet pineapple tequila drink that was really good and strong! 

For the appetizers we had the charbroiled oysters, calamari and the gator tail bites. Out of the three I did not enjoy the gator tail is was overly fried but the other two were great! The oysters has a great lemon butter garlic sauce. The calamari was cooked well and paired well with the tomato sauce on the side. 

For my entree I had the seafood risotto 5/5 stars. It's the BEST risotto I ever had and comes with a lot of seafood in it. It's was creamy and delectable. My boyfriend had one bite and he wished he gotten the seafood risotto too. He got the shrimp criollo. He loved the shrimp and green beans but not the rice lol. 

For dessert We shared the espresso ice cream which was homemade and very smooth! 

I highly recommend eating here. The atmosphere is alive in that area as well. Get a reservation ahead of time!
The service and food was AMAZING. The atmosphere and ambiance....top notch!! I can't wait to go back! All of the food was delicious!

Found out about Ulele from doing a Google search and decided to try them out. At first when I arrived I was a little skeptical but it was like walking into a wonderland. I loved the decor both in and out. I went for dinner and it was busy so I would recommend a reservation. I was finally seated and my server was awesome! Very friendly explained that everything was made in-house from the dressings to the dessert. I mainly came for the chargrilled oysters but decided to try the calamari as well. First the oysters are the best I've ever had!!! I could've ate three dozen of them easily. The calamari was ok but nothing I would run to get or order again. I ordered a drink I believe it was the princess ulele but it was delicious and I loved the grilled pineapple. Of course after reviewing the menu, I couldn't leave without trying the candied bacon maple ice cream..... oh my! This creation did not disappoint...vanilla ice cream with bacon bits and covered in a corn flake crust with a bourbon cream sauce, a waffle crisp and a strip of candied bacon. Even though the candied bacon was tasty I would've rather had two waffle crisps instead. Whatever you do make sure you walk around the courtyard before you leave. It's absolutely gorgeous
We've had excellent meals here many times. The food and service are always impeccable and we love coming early before our reservation to have a frose outside and feed the fish. Such a fun experience!

The venue is gorgeous.  The locals rave about the brews.  The beer of my choosing was out, but the Spanish white wine alternative was good.  I had a shrimp main course with green beans and rice as accompanied sides and a veggie melange as a side. I think overall, the shrimp butter needed garlic and all needed a kick more spice/herb/salt kick, but I would definitely come back. 

Did I mention that the venue is gorgeous?  Some serious feats of engineering went into creating it without violating ancient historic building codes.

I heard about this place from a friend and always wanted to try once I'm in Tampa. 
Surely didn't disappoint when we went there on the Christmas Eve. Food was great! Ambiance even better. 
Beer wasn't that amazing but still goes well with the vibe. Definitely would go again

business.name: Zahav
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Food, Ethnic Food, Middle Eastern, Vegetarian, Specialty Food, Israeli, Restaurants

reviews.text: Super exclusive. I always stay at the hotel near this area but can rarely get in. Great lamb!

Wow, just wow. On a recent trip to Philadelphia I was shocked at how amazing the food is at Zahav. So many courses and flavors. I can't even pick my favorite because all of them were so good, however the sweet potato cooked like BBQ was over the top! Can't wait to be back.

A work of ingenuity. Came in for my husbands birthday and loved that the entire menu was already taken care of. Whenever I go to a restaurant I always ask- what would you recommend? What does the chef create that is good? The Zatar flatbread bread  smothered with zatar was a miracle and the myriad of 6 dips like  a tart eggplant  ( I need to reread the menu)) perfect tender crunchy carrots, beet salad, best   hummus I have had with this spicy aoli, and my favorite was the crunchy tangy cabbage...reminded me of Indian thali with chutneys.  

I can go on and on with the wine pairings flavors and write an entire novel about the layers flavors ambiance superior hospitality of this restaurant and meal. The chef came to the table- I was thinking how do you do it? Wish I took a picture with him.

Just another thing- my daughter said she was dreaming of the chicken- she is very picky and has eaten in many restaurants around the world ( we all have)-

Came here for my bday dinner and it was such a great experience. The staff were so friendly and accommodating. The food was amazing - lots of food with good size portions. The hummus was spectacular.
Highly recommend!

Went to Zahav in October and had a wonderful sit down dinner with this feast of a spread. The food and service here was amazing - for a world class restaurant there wasn't a shred of false pretense. We were welcomed in like family and dined like royalty.

A couple of tips for the uninitiated - pace yourself. There is a LOT of food that comes with the tasting menu and you will want to eat every single plate and clear it all before the next plate is set down. Don't do that. You'll just end up setting yourself for speed eating and losing out on all the nuanced flavors and appreciation for the technique.

Without question the star of the meal was the lamb shoulder and the rice... I'm really glad I left some room for that. Imagine being stuffed before that shows up at your table? Other personal favorites were the grilled haloumi - ours was served with these insanely umami bomb-like tomatoes that just sends shockwaves into your brain. The veggie salads to start were also a lot of fun, having a little variety to whet your appetite is a great way to start off an epic meal.

Enjoy!

We have wanted to go here for at least 5 years. Finally made it to Philadelphia and couldn't get reservations (as soon as we knew we were headed to Philly, I tried -- several weeks ahead). But I decided to check to see about any cancellations and snagged seats at the bar. First - for anyone who "keeps calling" on the phones... it is very clear on the voicemail that reservations are strictly online and questions need to be emailed. This includes seats at the bar -- they are by reservation. It makes sense. It's fair. There's a place in DC I love (Little Serow) -- they don't even have a phone. So take a deep breath and you'll get in if you're patient and willing to be flexible. We got in last night and the food and service were spectacular. It was fun! It was exciting! And my boyfriend is Israeli and was over the moon. He was so happy, I think I saw tears in his eyes. This is all fresh and beautiful food. Every bite is extraordinary. There is plenty of food (this is NOT a tasting menu where you could possibly walk away hungry. The food is plentiful at Zahav). And it's a fun vibe too. Worth every penny and we can't wait to come back.

Got a bit of a mixed feelings about the place.  Honestly the food and service is great so I can't give it less than 5*.  The amount of food is good.  Not great but really good and if you need extras you get extras.  Family style or rather Israeli style dining is wonderful it is filling and you have variety for all who can do spicy or need not spicy or need something else.  

I haven't seen a better Israeli restaurant anywhere in the US and believe me I've looked.  One thing that gives me pause a little bit is the wine list and the hype.  I get the hype but the wine list could be better.

Zahav is an Israeli restaurant that calls Philadelphia home. And it fills Philly citizens with Mediterranean delights. We citizens filled so rapidly that we requested to-go boxes table-side with each course, such that we could pile away hefty portions for our future selves. The leftovers were later devoured, which should tell you all you must know about the pinnacle of Michael Solomonov's little Israeli food empire. Pomegranate lamb shoulder, hummus, halloumi, eggplant, and a great wine pairing helped vault Zahav to the 2019 James Beard Award for Outstanding Restaurant. Deserved? Who am I, a leading restaurant critic / influencer with a large social following, to say? But you should surely try it yourself.

To echo a number of other review. You get a lot of very good food.  Don't fill up to early. Staff is amazing.  Went for our anniversary.  They ended up sitting us at the bar which was very cool. 

Very great experience. I would note that the experience can take a couple hours so plan accordingly.

Here's the deal:   The experience is too much to type ( which so counterproductive to Yelp)    This place I was every bit of a 5 star experience!     If you're a foodie and want to be taken on a culinary journey this pace is amazing!!    Our sever team lead by Aiden was helpful, attentive, accommodating, knowledgeable!    If you can get here be prepared to say this phase all night  "WOW, that's amazing...how can this  be THAT  good"     Bravo!

Easily the most flavorful food i have ever had at a restaurant. everything was paired so well together and cooked to perfection. Absolutely no complaints about this place. From the first course to the last, and every single dish in between, phenomenal. 100% recommend

Warning: Zahav serves you A LOT of food!!!
I can't believe I was able to eat at here. Zahav's food truly is a work of culinary art. Each dish is such a creative pairing between ingredients that typically wouldn't be paired together.

Everything was delicious but 2 dishes that stood out were the Dry-Aged Ribeye & the Chocolate Kanafi. The Dry-Aged Ribeye literally melts in your mouth. It was a great quality cut of Rib-eye. It was soft and tender, not overly seasoned. It was cooked medium rare and to perfection! The Chocolate Kanafi was phenomenal! The cake was made up of fried coconuts with a rich dark chocolate and pistachio ganache on the inside. The pistachio ganache was a perfect sweet compliment to the chocolate! 

Everything was delicious! I wish I could have eaten more, but each dish seemed salty. During my experience, it felt as if I was drinking more water than eating the food/drinking the wine. The smoked chicken was the saltiest dish. Also, the one guest found a hair in his food but accidents like that happen every so often and it's fine. 

The waiters were so polite, they brought us all boxes to take home the food! 

Zahav was an incredible experience! I will come here again because of excellent food, staff, music, & vibes. This is a great place to bring people!

My fiance has been talking about this restaurant for YEARS and I finally got us a reservation and I have to say I regret waiting so long to try it out. They were doing a tasting menu and I have never eaten so much food at a restaurant before. We had so many dishes they didn't all fit on our table. I did the wine pairing package with it and I do recommend adding it to your meal. The lamb ribs were AMAZING. We had mixed feelings about the appetizers but that what was so great about the tasting menu. We tried a bunch of things we wouldn't normally order. 

The staff was incredible friendly and the atmosphere was fun. We will definitely be going back.

The best Israelian restaurant in Philly, mayhap the best restaurant period. 

I went in having high expectations and they were exceeded. They have shifted to a prefix meal and the course is set up for perfection. We also decided to pair it with wine which made it even better. The only thing I'd caution is don't stuff yourself with bread or you'll be too full to enjoy the later courses. 

The six side dishes you get, which I compare to banChan at Korean restaurants were all tasty and kicked off the meal. The hummus was perfect, which was probably why I ate too much bread. 

The courses served during the Mezza portion were all top notch. Each unique in its own right. I was blown away by the persimmon dish. Each bite was heaven. The course after we're all delicious also with the eggplant standing out. 

Service was impeccable throughout and wine topped off so you were never dry. By the time we headed into the entree, I was nearly full but trekked forward to enjoy the lamb. The desert sealed the deal paired with a desert wine that was not overbearing in sweetness. 

I can see why it's hard to get into this restaurant, but if you can, you won't regret it.
Named one of the best restaurants in the country. I would say it is great but not a 10/10. Still very yummy food.

Zahav is an Israeli restaurant that opened in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 2008. It was founded by head chef Michael Solomonov and his business partner Steven Cook. Solomonov was born in G'nei Yehuda, Israel and raised in Pittsburgh. At the age of 18, he returned to Israel with no Hebrew language skills, taking the only job he could get -working in a bakery- and his culinary career was born. At Zahav (Hebrew for "gold"), Solomonov weaves together the culinary traditions of immigrants to Israel from all over the world with the ancient foodways of Arabia and the Levant. The cooking at Zahav comes from a deep well of Israeli hospitality. 

My wife and I ate at Zahav in April 2015 during our 4-day sightseeing trip to Philadelphia. Zahav is one of Philadelphia's most popular restaurants. It is so popular that I was only able to get a reservation at 9PM on a Sunday night. After scanning the menu, we decided to order the 'Taste or Zahav' experience where you get to try a little bit of everything. Up first was the Salatim course: six different small plates of Israeli vegetable salads (lots of pickled/marinated veggies). Then we had delicious Laffa bread with hummus. The Mezze course consisted of crispy Haloumi, house-smoked sable, fried fingerling potatoes and crispy chicken. For entrees, I had the Duck Kebab and my wife had the Chicken Shishlik. For dessert, I had the Israeli Ice Cream Sandwich and my wife had the Pear Sorbet. This was easily one of the best dining experiences we ever had! My pants were ready to burst by the end, but it was so worth it. We highly recommend Zahav! Make sure to make a reservation well in advance.
Delicious Israeli food! High end decoration and great customer service. The hummus is a must try!
The food is amazing! Everything from creamy hummus, beet salad with tehina to pomegranate, & lamb shoulder was cooked to perfection. The food is delicious here! We enoyed both the food and ambience!

This is our second time to zahav in the last six years (we live in Boston). The first time we were amazed and thought the food was good enough to fly down for again. 

This time- it blew the first visit out of the water. I only remembered to take one picture before we had devoured every other dish. From the laffa bread and hummus to the green apple sorbet at the end- 100% recommend every single dish. 

There was not one single thing we didn't like. The tasting menu was an experience and was worth every single penny. If you haven't been, make a reservation today. It is mouth watering fantastic.
Expensive and never have table available . It used to be a nice restaurant before their name wears on a magazine but after that, it is a different story

Great place with delicious middle eastern food. I love going to a place where I don't know what half the stuff is. My advice is to not worry about what it is and if you'll like it, just stuff it in your face and try something new! I went on Mother's Day with my mother, grandmother, and father. The service was exceptional and fast. The food was delicious as well. The only reason I imagine people wouldn't like it is if they're very picky. This is an adventurous restaraunt for people who are open to new experiences. I probably wouldn't have brought my grandmother if she hadn't lived a few years in Saudi Arabia. We all had a great time. Favorite dish was that crispy cheese roll with elderberry sauce (I forgot the name, haha). The lamb and rice was also delicious, best eaten together like the waiter suggested. Overall great experience, would definitely come back. Due to the difficulty of getting a reservation though I would probably only come for special occasions, haha.

I think Zahav's reputation precedes itself. This place is the real deal. You know when you're going there whether it be the first time or the 10th time that this place has built a name for itself and you know your experience will be lovely, if you can get a reservation. 

My wife and I went in with a fringe Resy that we found earlier this week to celebrate our anniversary. They greeted us at our bar seats with complementary cava and an explanation of the menu and dining structure. 

As the food started rolling in they explained every dish piece by piece and everything was a home run. It's a lotttt of food and justifies the $72 price tag which includes well above average wages for all workers. 

The lamb shoulder, seabass, swordfish, rice, spiced veggies, the HUMMUS, all 10/10. There were no misses on the menu. Must try for any foodie and definitely worth the hype. Sorry about the weird looking pictures, the lighting was dim in there.

Zahav is definitely an experience. I would recommend if you live in Philly or are visiting, eat here at least once. 

The restaurant has a really welcoming vibe, everyone is so friendly. The staff is super informed on all the food and give you ideas on how to eat it. 
In the beginning you're served bread and a lot of little appetizers (Salatim). All of the appetizers were delicious. I even loved the eggplant dish and I'm not a huge fan of eggplant! 

In the mezze portion of the meal, the Haloumi stood out the most. It was just such a play on flavor and texture. I loved it l!

For the entree, we got the lamb. It was delicious but I did find the coating Of the lamb a little bitter. Outside of that the way it was cooked was really well and tender. Maybe I was too full by the time the lamb came out too?

The dessert: there was this green apple sorbet that I didn't expect to like. But it had such a cool and refreshing flavor with ginger. I would go back and eat just that, I sometime crave just the sorbet dish since I went to Zahav in October. Then there was a very decadent chocolate mousse. But the sorbet was a
Combination of flavors I've had no where else. 

Overall- worth the hype, it's a bit pricey but worth it!!!

If only I could get a reservation here... You have to plan months in advance but clear your schedule if you get one and get yourself here! The mediterranean food is unbelievable. You really have to go to understand the hype.
Half the restaurant was empty and we were told that there were no open tables.  Wow at 5 pm.   Poor hospitality and the reception was EXTREMELY snotty.

business.name: Fork
business.categories: American (New), Burgers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text:
Fork has locally sourced food and some seasonal menu items. The asparagus fries were AMAZING and we ate them all before I could get a photo. The two salads we ordered were underwhelming, mostly due to the protein(crispy chicken was a chicken patty, the BCS had over cooked salmon). However the urban burger was cooked perfectly and was completely eaten. 

If this had been my only experience at Fork, I would probably be giving only 3 stars. However, I have been before and had much better food, hence my four star rating. I'll just be avoiding all salads in the future.

This is one of my go-to places for a yummy meal with consistently good service. 

Went for lunch during the nebulous time that is the week between Christmas and New Years. 

Husband had the Huli Huli chicken, it was delicious. I had the shrimp and risotto, which was undercooked, but they gave me another portion that was better.

Also had the asparagus fries, which I get every time I go. For dessert, we splurged and got the butter cake. So decadent!

What's not to love! The food is amazing and I've been here multiple times. The asparagus appetizer is always a hit! I have not been disappointed and even the outdoor seating felt boujee! I am loving this place!
Delicious locally sourced food. The butter cake is to die for... just trust me in this.

So yummy 
I've come here for many years now and they're really quite delicious. The wait time can be a bit challenging but if you have time, it's good.
Great food and cocktails. Family friendly. Definitely worth trying. Recommend making a reservation before.

Fork is one of my favorite restaurants in Boise! The food is always prepared to perfection--photos don't do it justice. 

Our group went for dinner and, as always, we were incredibly impressed. The ambiance is cool, the cocktails are creative and crafted to perfection, and the food is top notch. 

I can't recommend the tomato bisque fondue enough. We knew it would be good, but it ended up being even better than we could have anticipated. 

If you haven't been to Fork, make a reservation ASAP! You can't go wrong with either brunch and dinner.
Great food & cocktails, farm to table ingredients, great flavors and scratch cocktails. Nice bar and friendly service.

We were passing through town and came to The Fork because of the reviews but we were disappointed.  As we just spent the holidays with family and the sinful holiday season, we we're trying to be careful on our journey home.  We ordered what we thought were more healthy choices, we were saddened to not love any of our dishes.  The cauliflower appetizer was ginormous and so rich in butter, we hardly touched it.  The mushroom/polenta appetizer was the same, extremely rich with butter, oil, whipping cream and whatever else they added....we feel uncomfortable.  We had the Cuban sandwich to splurge and that was the best.  We were dissatisfied in the whole experience and would not stop again to the Fork to have a halfway healthy experience!

I think I ordered wrong, cause everything else looked better than mine.  The good news is that all of that other stuff looked so good that I'd like to come back and try again.  

Stay away from the spinach ravioli unless you like really really Al dente pasta (I don't) but say yes to the fried asparagus and yellow butter cake (even if you take it home like I did).  Great service.  Great spot for downtown Boise.

Sub standard for what they charge. We will not be going back again. What makes them think a rainbow beet salad needs raw beets and cheese that break your teeth. Also, what chef in his right mind puts raw greens with hot food. Ridiculously pretentious
The food and a friendly professional staff- always busy though! Highly recommend the lamb appetizer + they support local

We had a great experience on a Sunday evening. Food, service and ambiance were top-notch from cocktails to dessert. 
No reservations available but they took us on their waiting list for the bar.  We waited about 45 seconds before getting a table. 
Absolutely a warm and welcoming experience.  We can't wait to visit again for cocktails and dinner, a premier location for Boise downtown.  

Cheers!

Update 12/13
Used the restroom at Fork for the first time and found it clean, comfortable, and well stocked. If you have young children they will need to use the step stool provided. The faucet is at the very back of a deep sink basin so quite far away from the edge of the counter

Food was once again hot and delicious

We loved our meal here! We came in for a late Sunday dinner and were pleasantly surprised by the fantastic service, great food, and warming atmosphere. This place can get really busy but for a good Sunday meal option, this place is definitely a winner.
Extremely underwhelming. Food wasn't bad but  $60 for brunch .  Not good enough for that. Service was great!

Second time coming to fork. The first was incredible but just so so this time. While there were empty tables they said there would be an hour wait. The wait ended up being bar seating, really who does a wait for open bar seating, ridiculous. Carson is a great bartender though and serves customers well. The hosts were not the most and seemed frustrated with dealing with people.

The cocktail menu is inventive, fresh, diverse and delicious - and they will cater to your every whim.  

I will be forever disappointed in restaurants that do NOT have Asparagus Fries.  The spicy-crispy coating and the light ranch dipping sauce will haunt my dreams forever.  I didn't get to try the lamp chop lollipops, but I drooled all over my shirt as the sizzling platters were laid upon the table next to me.

The food menu was also diverse, with lots of bright and creative options.  Dishes are easily identified by symbols for all the latest dietary requirements. 
 I especially like that vegetarian dishes are featured front and center and not buried at the bottom like an apology or an after-thought.  And they deserve top billing!  The Spinach and Artichoke Ravioli were luscious and savory.  The Spaghetti Squash and Portobello was flavorful with a firm texture, and The Idaho Trout was seasoned and cooked to perfection.

The atmosphere is very nice - calm and dark, and with all the little rooms and alcoves of the old building, you feel cozy even though it is a very bustling place.

Our server, Cassie was top-notch - she's been there for 6 years!  Which to me is a testament of a quality establishment.  I can't wait to return to Boise and eat here again!
Good enough for the California snobs in my party.  Great cocktails, fun atmosphere and tasty food!

Based up on reviews, this is the best place in Boise for a restaurant. Unfortunately, I do not fully agree. It is good, but I feel it is more hyped.

Food - We had asparagus fries - we were pretty disappointed in this dish... The presentation was awesome, but it really lacked flavor and would have almost preferred just roasted asparagus with the same flavor. We also had seared lamb lollipops - these were my favorite of what we ordered. perfectly cooked and the presentation was beautiful. I do wish there was more garnish on it since it did add some great flavor, just not enough on there in my opinion. The prime rib was good, but the flavor just like the asparagus was lacking flavor. It was definitely cooked well and the seasoning on the outside was good, but for $38 and this restaurant being the #1 restaurant in all of Boise, I was expecting more from a flavor profile. 

Service - service was also lacking and we were only asked how we liked our food at the very end of the meal and were only checked in once during the entire experience for filling our water glasses.

I did enjoy the meal, but wouldn't come back again.

First time eating here. 

The food was yummy and excellent service. 

Rachel our server was hospitality and professional with excellent customer service.

Fork did a great job with our party of seven on Halloween.  The food was good and the service was excellent.  So many restaurants roll their eyes when a group drops in without a reservation, but Fork couldn't have been nicer.
Very cool environment inside with seating outside available as well which I really enjoyed. The staff was super friendly and the butter cake was to die for!

On our first visit to Boise this was the first restaurant we ate at and it did not disappoint. From the moment we walked in, the hostess , the vibe and our waiter was A+. The food was delicious and the dessert was even better. Will visit again.

While living in Boise, we enjoyed Fork quite a lot. Had the prime rib once, and the boneless short ribs were always a favorite, as well as their Boise Chopped Salad.

So visiting Boise in September, we decided to revisit a favorite. It felt different. The staff seemed stressed, our particular server rushed us in our order. We ordered favorites (short ribs and BCS) and each a beer.

The BCS was good as always, but when the short ribs arrived, something just seemed odd about it. It wasn't really tender, it was much smaller than we remembered, and the presentation seemed rushed.

The food combined with the service put a pall on what we had hoped to be a pleasant memory of when we had lived in Boise.

We were asked if we wanted dessert, and saw the salted caramel bread pudding. But given the quality of this visit, we instead called Kahootz in Meridian, asked when they closed, and asked if we could get there before closing. Now Kahootz has bread pudding to remember.

It was sad, though, that we had obviously "moved on" from Fork.

business.name: Palace Café
business.categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Cafes, Cajun/Creole, American (New)

reviews.text:
I wanted to like this place, but I just can't.

I ordered a cocktail, two appetizers, and dessert, which is usually a good meal for me.  The portions were so small I had to stop at Popeyes on the way back to my hotel for a chicken biscuit.

The crabmeat cheesecake was good, but bland.  Texture was more like a crabmeat flan than a cheesecake.  Also had the shrimp remoulade, which had a lot of lettuce and three shrimp.  The Bananas Fosters was good.

As for ambiance, I was alone, they sat me at the empty bar at the far end so everyone was passing right behind me all meal.  The bar was empty, so why not seat me more in the middle?
Closed - don't go. We wanted dessert but just found a closed storefront.  Another death from C.
Been going there since they first opened. Consistent, great quality and Brennan's service.

Brennans restaurants are consistently good. They become tourist favorites because of that consistency. If you only go out to a special restaurant occasionally, you know it will be good. It's fun to try new things, but many times I just want the security of knowing it will be good food, good service and a good time - 
And this is the right place

Went to this restaurant for our Anniversary.  We were late getting to restaurant, but they welcomed us anyway.  The food was wonderful.  The staff were so kind and helpful.  James M suggested the crab cheesecake.  It was the best appetizer I have had in my life. It was so good I had to stop myself from licking the plate.  He made our visit special and I will always be grateful.  This is a must when visiting New Orleans.

Well the service started out well with our waiter Walter. He was timely and welcoming. The bread was just bread nothing special about it at all and the butter was bland. I ordered the chicken and waffles thinking it would be be a great first timer meal....boy was I wrong. When our food came out it sat on a serving table and and left. Apparently, whomever was suppose to serve it to us was pre-occupied with other things that mattered...cause we didn't. Once we finally got our food it was ok at best. I dove right into the chicken  and waffles thinking the sauce on the waffles was syrup...it wasn't! Some weird spicy sauce that wasn't even close to sweet. There was peppers served on top the waffles, y I'll never know. The pralene butter..unappetizing; I figured it would be like a sweet honey butter with pecans in it but no, just plain butter and pecans. No flavor. Needless to say I wouldn't try this place again.

Stumbled across this place ahead of the dinner crowd and so glad we did! I got the shrimp and my husband got the andouille-encrusted fish. One of the best meals we've ever had. The drinks were also great--my husband got "the last one" and I had a spicy drink served in a mule cup (can't remember the name). We ended the meal with the bananas foster, which was neat to see being made table-side. Hope to be back soon!

TL;DR go anywhere else 

This is the only place I regret going to in the entirety of my few days in NOLA. Cassie was a good server that was attentive and cared for her job and she earned an extra star for this place. 

A friend wanted to pop in just to try the crabmeat cheesecake. Why not? Told the women at the front and they were hesitant to seat us since we indicated wanting to try one thing and take it on the go. It's not an option which is totally fine but we don't need to be reminded to "leave a good tip" when we arrive at a restaurant. Poor start

Most important, the food and drinks were bad. Really bad. We ordered more to make the being seated worth it and that was a mistake. The shrimp remoulade was the best and it was ok. Crabmeat cheesecake had a cottage cheese consistency and awkward flavor profile. The spritzer drink was somehow flavorless. I unfortunately don't remember all of the other things we ordered because everyone refused to take more than one bite or sip that was at our table.

I'm sure this place may have had a bad outing but there's a Popeyes nearby that would be better suited for a proper New Orleans experience.

Made reservations here for weekend brunch. The food was delicious. Loved my chicken and waffles and the bite of my daughter's eggs Benedict was delicious! Try their version of a hurricane - not as sugary sweet as the ones a block over. Server Ross was excellent and did a great job of making recommendations.
Such a delicious place for happy hour! Great drinks and food :) I had the Dome Daiquiri which was so summery and light. I would definitely have it again and plan too!

Happy hour at the bar was great. Oyster Artichoke Dip was delicious. Appetizers were excellent too.  The mussels were my favorite.  But dinner was subpar.  The Pecan Trout was mushy.  I could not taste the fish. The fried soft shell card was too coated with bread crumbs. The crab I could taste was juicy  and tasty but too much coating.  The dinner meal took 45 minutes from start to finish.  Maybe that is good for some guests but I felt too rushed.  I had not finished my appetizer when the main meal arrived. 
ML

We were excited to eat here being it was another Brennan family restaurant. The food was excellent, but unfortunately the bar not so much. The bartender didn't know what was in a last word cocktail and sent the waitress to ask me so I thought I'd just skip it and order a martini and it was served in a short tumbler with ice. Other than this our visit was ok. It seems like it catches a lot of tourist business from the area.

This place is beautiful. The food was absolutely delicious. The crab cake cheesecake was my favorite. The French onion dip was good but very very thick. Overall great experience! Chef Sylvia is is such a pleasure!

This place was absolutely amazing. I had a cup of turtle soup, some of the oyster loaf for an appetizer as well as the catfish pecan for the main course followed by the white chocolate bread pudding. Everything was very flavorful and the service was excellent. 10/10 would reccomend.

The food was excellent! We ordered it to go due to COVID-19. The first time I called I was transferred to the bar and then they hung up on me. The second time the hostess answered and recognized me and asked if the call was dropped. I told her that They hung up so she made sure that they answered the second  time. The bartender had a very poor attitude on the phone, but I got the order placed. When we arrived to pickup the order it was obvious that the bartender did not want to be bothered with us. When we returned to the hotel we had our food but no utensils to eat it with. Our order was almost $200 and should have included some sort of cutlery. The food was excellent.

this was one of several restaurants recommended to me by a friend. i was excited to be able to get reservations, but the evening was not what i had hoped for. the highlight of the evening was our appetizer, the crab cheesecake. excellent. my husband ordered duck, and i had speckled trout. the duck was tough, and the trout was just okay. it was fun to have bananas foster made table side, but you can get that a lot of places. not a bad meal, but when there are so many other options, choose somewhere else.
This was amazing food and the atmosphere was incredible. This was the perfect restaurant in New Orleans. Drew provided great service!

Great food, great atmosphere and excellent service! Restaurant was recommended by a number of locals, so we decided to give it a go. Got in and got seated right away. Chad who's the bartender there, was pulling double duty as our waiter. He gave us the low down on the menu items etc, which was more than we could remember and after some deciding, got him to take our order. Food was prepared very nicely and was served either hot or cold depending on the items ordered just as you'd expect. No matter the item, I'm sure you won't be disappointed and I would definitely go back there again, but that will have to wait for another time.

#fatjared say...food was above average, bartender was average, host was FAR below average. Bring it all together, and I look back at this was decent, but not great. Average from me.

We did not have a reservation. And I see other reviews that have this common theme. If you are a host or hostess and you are booked up, at least let people know there is a bar they can try for. We walked here from our hotel as a last minute decision, and the host basically tried to turn us away. Said "we're booked you'll have to try again another night." I walked right past him and saw 2 seats at the bar. He was surprised I even asked to sit down, like "O no you did it wrong try again." Just rude man. Not the way to be. Started the night off WAY behind.

The bartender we ordered from was cool, but super short. He was not super busy either. I would ask about dishes, and he would give the most minimal answer. Once he realized I was just curious he started opening up. It's unfortunate when the service almost ruins the experience.


As for the food, they did bring bread, and it was kind of warm, and was good, but nothing to rave about. The guy said they were known for the crab meat cheesecake. I have had one before so I went for it. It was good but not great. The sauce to accompany it was tasty, but nowhere near enough of a crab taste, and the cheesecake was not set enough either. More meat, cooked a bit longer, and it would be amazing. That's just my opinion. 

Being in NO we had to get gumbo, and the turtle soup I thought was unique. Both dishes were above average. Spot on, extremely good. Only issue was the size of the order was not asked, and for a bowl of soup, it seemed like a very small amount.

Overall, the really great soup made this place average for me. If not for that, this would be a 2 star review all the way. Not the nicest people, and some things to fix food wise as well for me. Average

The food was actually awesome. 
We are doing a good tour so we opted in to appetizers.

I had the shrimp remoulade. All I can say is WOW! 
The shrimp were very fresh and the remoulade sauce was amazing!

My favorite part was actually the dessert, we ordered the famous banana foster which is super cool because it is made in front of you! If you have children this is a really awesome experience or even if you yourself enjoy a little history lesson, you will definitely learn! 

The ambiance was very nice and it was not open but they also have a rum bar. 

We did get to try a monitor flight and margarita flight which was very tasty and fun!

If you love fish, you've got to go here for the pecan catfish, OMG is was delicious, even though it comes w no vegetables. 

My only complaint is the male hostess, I don't remember his name but it starts w a D. When he took me to my seat he made a face at his assistant when I told him I was dining alone. No waiter came to greet me/take my order so he took over for whomever was busy. That's when his standoff-ish demeanor changed and he started to spark conversation. At the end of my meal he talked someone and used that to distract me. He selected what he wanted me to tip on the card machine while I was looking in my purse. That's when I realized the tip option was already selected and I think that's a bit RUDE & INCENTIVE. Tips are voluntary and based on MY performance not the performance of staff. I think he was 1 of the owners or apart of the family that runs this establishment. Watch out for his smooth talk, he's tall and that you can't miss.

From beginning to the end of the meal it was a fabulous experience. The decor brings you into an authentic creole encounter. Wait staff were highly attentive and quick to fill drinks and bring out bread. They were accommodating of custom orders. Shrimp and grits set the bar and the mojito flight is adorable! Make sure to make a reservation or you will be turned away!

Beautifully decorated dining room. The four stars are for the great service and the bananas foster. I was brought the wrong entree and it took a while to get my Cochon de Lait Potato Pie so I had some of my best friend's dinner while I waited and some bread and butter. My drink was too sour so the bartender redid it, only to be just okay - I should've ordered wine. Their creme brûlée was mediocre. We had a delicious one the night before.

The highlight was watching our waiter make bananas foster - he was very entertaining and he narrated the history as he was flambéing the bananas. I would come here just for that...

Palace Cafe was delicious, it felt like a retreat from some of the icky stuff we had to walk past to get there....
 Nikki, our server, was great and very attentive. We loved all of our dishes, but the absolute favorite was the Crab Cheesecake, definitely worth it!
Hostess was EXTREMELY rude because we didn't have a reservation.  I would bit recommend this place to ANYONE!!!!

business.name: Cafe Poca Cosa
business.categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Mexican, Latin American

reviews.text: The best of Tucson. Southwestern food reinvented in a New York atmosphere. Elegance and flavor beyond your wildest dreams and different menu every day, lunch and dinner! One of a kind.

Exceptional place. Food is out of this world! Service was outstanding. Have recommended to family & friends
 Definitely great for special occasions.

It's been along time since we've been able to eat here because of COVID-19, but the experience is remarkable and no one in the World make food like Suzanna. I hope it will be open before much longer, it is a five-star experience.
love it here! cozy and delicious food. gem of tucson.

Loved this spot! My mother was visiting from out of town and I took her here for lunch. The menu was interesting and offered a lot of great options. The staff was professional and did an amazing job of presenting the menu and serving food and drinks. Everything we ordered was delicious. I can't wait to go back!
Upscale dining in beautiful downtown! This gem is hidden but once you walk in you know you've arrived someplace special. Delicious food and amazing customer service.

OH MY GAWD. If you ever go to Arizona drive your ass to this restaurant. It will CHANGE YOUR LIFE. This place re-defined what Mexican food meant to me.
