The delicate flavors of their sauces, the succulent, tender meat...I can't even explain the experience of eating here. It isn't even food anymore but just love and the expression of taste.

I don't even have the proper words to describe the food. It is amazing, the servers are incredible, and the owner is amazing. Always coming around to say hello to guests and seeing how everything is. It is expensive but so worth the splurge. I suggest to just go with The Plato, you absolutely cannot go wrong!
Love this place! They treat you like family.  The food is delicious. I generally always go for their specials. Everything is consistent. This is the type of place that makes Tucson special.

The decor is nice and the service is good. We each ordered the sampler (with three different dishes) but did not love it. Everything is on one plate so it feels tight. The flavor is good overall but nothing stands out. I'd still recommend people to try it since my experience is not bad!

Always the most beautiful, smiling happy people to greet you at any time in your service, healthy portions and good vibes   The drinks are well made, generous and tasty- grab some marg pitchers if you can, so satisfying. Warning, the ambiance and music sometimes makes you wanna salsa right into another table (it's a tighter fit) but by the time you see someone else's food walk by, you're ready to grub. 

Some people are  complaining about the salad that comes with, but to be honest, it's wonderful!!
It's the trashy, uppity, self serving demographic that manages to slap a bad name on something that is healthy and helps your GI process your food. 
Somehow I could've eaten 900 tortillas, three margaritas, some meat and dairy- but after those greens I feel accomplished. 

The owner is like a happy love fairy that comes around and blesses your table and is truly dedicated to her craft. 
The fare is to die for here, literally, if I had a last meal or a food to die to, I'd pick Poca Cosa every time.

We came to celebrate our 39th anniversary. Nick was our server. He was efficient, but not really personable or interested in why we were eating there. He just seemed like robotic, not really there. Maybe it was just the same old same old. He never asked if we were celebrating anything special. 
Food was tasty, well presented, but way to much salad greens. It was like the main dish (Pollo side by
Side) was an afterthought. 
Drinks were very tasty as well. 
We noticed a lot of people going to Reilly across the street so we went for dessert. The MOST AMAZING TIRAMISU I HAVE EVER TASTED! The bartenders were obviously experienced mixologists. We will go there for our next night out!

Reservations- highly recommended.
Reserving a table ASAP so you can try out this fantastic restaurant - also highly recommended. 
The entire atmosphere at Cafe Poca Cosa is cozy and wonderful. As soon as you are seated, the servers come over and will explain the menu to you. The menu is written on a chalkboard as it changes daily based on the ingredients they have. Everything sounded fantastic and no one was disappointed with the food they ordered. Drinks were also tasty, I highly recommend the white sangria if you want something sweet but not too sweet!
Unfortunately, we didn't take any pictures because the lighting in the restaurant is dim and wouldn't do it justice, but trust me when I say it looked great and tasted even better!
Overall, this is a great place to go, especially for a special occasion and I can't wait for the next birthday or other event to give me a reason to make a reservation!

Bland food, overpriced, and noisy. Was here two years ago and nothing has improved. The vegetarian option was mostly mashed potatoes. The chicken with cheese had too little cheese to call it cheesy. Both plates had fruit, but does canned pineapple count? Salad greens were on the plate but the dressing was a bottle of oil/vinegar that was hard to shake and serve. No other options. The waiter would not split the bill so no separate billing allowed. This was unpleasant for some nondrinkers.

This has been a favorite place of ours in Tucson for over 25 years. Our most recent visit last Thursday, however, was disappointing from a service standpoint. It's kind of like fast food in an upscale setting - The food must be pre-prepared and ready to go, so if your cocktails are at all delayed, as our were, your food and cocktails arrive at the same time.  Portions are generally excessive, and we took home enough for another whole meal. The salad on the side is gorgeous and better than I remember. So refreshing with shredded jicama, bell pepper, and grapes! The tortilla portion however, wasn't adequate (4 corn tortillas total), and since our server never came to ask how we were doing, we weren't able to request more tortillas.  We love to cloak our meat and sauce in a nice warm tortilla. My husband asked for hot sauce and got instead minced fresh, salted jalapeños! Yum! 

For dessert, we ordered the warm chocolate cake with bananas, which was excessive in size. It was also excessive in price. The prices on the dinner menus are clearly noted on the chalkboard, but if he had told us it was actually a dessert suitable to serve four people and it was $15, we would've declined. Chef- why not offer a smaller portion?  Coffee was just ok, and the waiter forgot the sugar requested, and again since he never checked on us.....

We were a table of two and our server had perhaps seven tables, many of them 4-6 tops. He obviously did not have adequate bussing assistance as he was bussing his own tables, which meant our service suffered.  Further, when the busser filled our water glasses she rested the pitcher ON the glass rim - health alert! 

Next time we are in town we will seek out new dining options. But if you've never been here before, it's worth a try.

There is so much to like about this restaurant. Wonderful salsa, nice ambience and sumptuous margaritas. Too bad our experience was marred this evening by a poorly prepared salmon and mushroom dish. And when we brought this to our servers attention she just ignored the issue and disappeared. Didn't even come back to give us the bill. Sent the hostess instead. Really a shame. What could have been a great night ended on a very sour note.
Some of the best Mexican food on the planet. Chef Davila has some of the best Mole Negro on earth. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an amazing meal.

We started with an order of margaritas at the bar. They're small with little tequila and a bit pricey but they are tasty. Skipped on a second order because too pricey for such a little delivery. Moved on to the food which really was delicious. Fantastic chicken mole. My only complaint was the way of serving everything mounded on one plate. The salad was unwieldy with large clumsy leaves of lettuce. Other than that everything was delicious but a bit rushed. Our server was a charmer though!!
Always my favorite place to visit when in Tucson. Just go.. there is no need to explanation. It's fantastic

I walk past this place all the time and finally had the chance to go. I looked up their menu online and was pleasantly surprised not to find anything. It turns out that their menu changes twice daily which is perfect to keep people coming back. When I walked in I was greeted by the hostess who kindly took us to our table. As we were walking another lady greeted us ( I think she was the owner). The place is a little dark, but in a good intimate way. Our waiter was amazing and very knowledgeable on each of the menu items which he showed us. The menu was on a chalkboard he brought over. The best thing about the menu was the Plato. The Plato is a mystery dish that the chef chooses. It combines three menu items in smaller portions. If you're up for a little mystery then the Plato is the way to go. My favorite part of the Plato that I had was the asada tomatillo. It was perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. If you're in the mood for a little mystery and good food, this is the place to go.

I'll start off by saying they have ~35 dishes in total with a menu that rotates twice daily. So unique! While the outside doesn't look like much, you surely will not be disappointed. I made a last minute reservation and they were quite accommodating to the time I was looking for. Almost every table was full at the time we were seated (6:30) on a Wednesday night, so I highly recommend a reservation. Chips and salsa are already on the table and boy was the salsa good! My boyfriend and I both ordered the Plato which offers 3 smaller portions of the larger entrees and it was more than enough food. My personal favorite was a carne asada dish with guacamole. We were celebrating my boyfriends birthday and treated with a complimentary flan. Of course we also ordered a mango pineapple cheesecake. It was our first time dining and certainly not our last! Kudos Cafe Poca Cosa!

Fresh ingredients chosen daily to serve up some imaginative plated Mexican cuisine presentations that are hearty and delicious. The menu changes daily. Who does that? The chef-owner and kitchen team need imagination knowing what ingredients and flavors work together - to keep us coming in the front door. And we are coming! We needed to make reservations!

I ordered a margarita with smoky tequila, orange liquor and lemon - very good. 

The salsa verde pork I ordered was tender tasty. My wife and our friend went for beef dishes with similar results. You should see the presentation on the plate - see my pics! Looks too good to dig in. 

All entrees on the chalk board are served with a salad. Beans and rice are served up family style. Servers explain all items chalked up with details as to preparation, sauce and spices. 

This Mex-restaurant is clean and classy, but you may come as casual as you are.

Wow, talk about GOT IT TOGETHER! I made a reservation about 2 weeks in advance and when we showed up only 5 minutes before our time to check in, they IMMEDIATELY said "right this way" and showed us to our table which was ready and waiting with water, chips and salsa!!! 

The menu changes DAILY and is presented via chalkboard. My partner and I both got the sampler and every single dish was FANTASTIC!

I'm still thinking about this meal a week after. Service was perfect. Needs anticipated. I'd have to say my fav dishes were the classic chicken mole and the steak w chimichurri sauce. My ONLY one criticism is the salad - presentation wise it's beautiful as more of a garnish. But the reality of eating it is not great because it's on your main entree plate with hot food. Hot salad isn't tasty to me...but it sure was pretty!

We're making Tucson an annual event for the gem show and Cafe Poca Cosa will be an annual reservation as well!!!!

The ambience is delightful and the cocktails are delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and I liked how the menu was presented on a chalkboard although it felt a little rushed. There were 3 chicken, 3 steak, 1 pork, 1 fish and 1 vegetarian choice to choose from. We decided to both get the "plato" which is where the  chef pics three choices off the menu and you get a portion of each, served with what they described as a "vibrant" salad which included fruit, and also tortillas, beans and rice. The food came quickly but I was quite shocked at the small entree sizes. I barely got a serving spoon size of the carne asada which was tasteless, a small serving of chicken and a big spoonful of corn pudding (which was the vegetarian item on the Menu). The vibrant salad, which took up nearly half of the plate, was simply a huge pile of lettuce leaves, red cabbage, a slice of cucumber and a small, thin slice of cantaloupe. We were also given just two tiny corn tortillas, a tiny bowl of rice and beans, which was for us BOTH to share, for $29 per plate. 
Simply put, it just tasted/appeared like all   food was produced on mass scale which they quickly dished out. This is a great "novelty" restaurant for those folks wanting to show visitors a  little southwest  dining style but it's not somewhere I would make a regular dining spot.

My husband and I dined here for our anniversary. The food was absolutely delicious, but for the price and fancy vibe of this place, I was a little disappointed by what a quick service type of meal this ended up being.
When the server told us that every meal included a salad, we were expecting a first and second course. I definitely wasn't a fan of the salad being on the same plate as my dinner.
I ordered the margarita with a warning of it being "very spicy!" and barely even got a kick.
There are plenty of great Mexican restaurants in Tucson with this type of service for less than half the price. Can't say I will be back any time soon.

business.name: Talula's Garden
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants

reviews.text: Not even being dramatic when I say this quite honestly might have been the best meal of my entire life. Everything was absolutely incredible. I would make the trip back to Philly just to eat here again. We got dessert (key lime pie) and I wish I would have taken a pic of it!!! Incredible meal from start to finish.
Fantastic farm to table dining! The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming. Servers were knowledgeable about the menu. Great cocktail, wine and beer options. The food was amazing and clearly fresh!

The outside area in the summer is very beautiful. This inside is a little bit outdated, not amazing vibe interior.  Their dishes are usually hit or miss, they have a rotating menu. Last time we got the risotto, roasted beets, cheddar chive biscuits, cauliflower soup. The cauliflower soup had good texture, lacked a lot of flavor. The roasted beets were pretty disappointing, they tasted like pickled beets with no other added flavors. Cheddar chive biscuits kind of tasted like the red lobster ones, the butter they give with it is good but they don't give enough for all 3 biscuits. The best part of the meal was the risotto, it had really good flavor and the shrimp and scallops were perfectly cooked. I would recommend coming in the summer and sitting outside if you are coming for the ambiance.

One of the best brunch spots! Food and drinks were on point which included a good variety in great portions. Highly recommend the cinnamon bun scones and avocado toast to start! The reason I gave this four stars is because the seatings were placed very close together and the tables were low which was a bit awkward so when you're making a reservation, ask for some space. I hope to come back to enjoy an outdoor meal in garden sometime in the future.

Talula's Garden is so good. Everything we ordered was delicious. The space is beautiful. The service was attentive until the end, when it took him a while to return with our check and so we missed our train.  But it was overall a great experience and I'm looking forward to returning. Oh, but, be prepared to drop some cash. It ain't cheap! But you'll have a great time.
AMAZING!!!!!! I got the seared scallops and shrimp with risotto. Best meal ever! Definitely coming back. We also got the cheese board - devoured it.

I came here last month Dec. 9th Thursday for my friends birthday making note in the reservation and making sure I called twice to make sure it would be a surprise birthday dinner for them and to not mention anything and to make sure that our indoor seat is away from the door since it's really cold. I came in and they were trying to seat us outside and I had to speak up because that's not what my reservation was for. Then they sat us next to the door when almost every seat was open after just sitting two other people in the other room away from the door. This really agitated me because it's like the male host didn't even read my reservation at all and also was randomly choosing seats. Then when I sat down the waiter came by and spoiled the birthday surprise, which irritated me even more. Majority of my problems were from host who didn't read the reservation and didn't at all listen to what I wanted. Didn't pass on the message or anything. 

The food itself is what saved the dinner, but even if the food is good, if the service is not good, I will not come back. I will be giving this place another shot sometime in the future, but I'm very hesitant about the service. 2/5 for service and 4/5 for food.
Great for brunch or just a snack. Stopped by one day after spending the day in the city. So fresh and delicious.

While the food looks really good and the ambience is great I would honestly never go back here. It was extremely overpriced and just not worth it in my opinion. Everything was fine but not worth $200 for brunch.
Had a fabulous dinner here on Christmas Eve 2021. Great service. Charming outdoor eating spaces.

We took kids biking for some air during a break of the rain.   Talula's is open!   What a surprise!  Hopped on OpenTable and got a table in 10 mins.   

Food is excellent as usual.   Their outdoor booth is warm with air conditioning and you can see the park.  We ate at Cotoletta a few days ago.   Their outdoor booth has super cute lightings but blocks the view of the park.

Came to grab dinner before a movie, as I wanted to see what all the hype was about. The food reminded me of a mantra I've heard many times on food television: "Excellent ingredients, cooked well." Our dishes were simple, tasty, and undoubtedly high-quality. But I'm not sure I was sufficiently dazzled for the price ($200 for 2 apps, 2 entrees, 1 side, 2 drinks, and 1 dessert). But I will return, hoping to be sufficiently dazzled in the near-future. Hear that Talula's? The gauntlet has been thrown.

"The Garden Salad": 4/5
Fresh Bakes Cheddar-Chive Biscuits: 5/5
Smoked Pork Belly: 4/5
Seared Sea Scallops & Gulf Shrimp: 4/5
Crispy Brussels and Roasted Pink Apples: 4/5
Key Lime Soufflé Cake: 5/5
Always an excellent experience. Would like to see to see some new options added to the menu though. It's been the same for a long time.

Lovely outdoor ambience with string lights and super service. The crab spaghetti was a must order while we thought the ricotta ravioli was just okay. Nice spot for a special occasion or dinner with friends!

Foods good but I really felt rushed eating. They made us order appetizers and main course at the same time so the order could be put in. Then before we even finished our appetizers our food came out. Our apps weren't large either, it was biscuits. Then, they have an hour and a half time limit for two people which was not enough time to relax and enjoy the food.

Truly a treat. Delicious mains (we had the Pan-fried Branzino filet with spinach and the shrimp/scallops with risotto); impeccable service; and artfully appointed interiors. Entrees are ample and flavorful, so skip the sides to leave room for a dessert (recommend the the Key Lime soufflé).

Wow...this place is amazing. I don't think there was a single dish I didn't enjoy. We started with the Burrata Toast- it was a good combo of buttery ciabatta, arugula, balsamic, and grapes. Our entrees included a branzino, which was complimented by the valencia oranges and a dish with sea scallops and shrimp that contained an amazing lemon risotto. The night ended with a Pumpkin Crème Brûlée. I really liked how the pumpkin taste was subtle and extremely creamy.

wonderful food! only complaint is that the heaters really don't keep you that warm. i got the fried chicken and it was absolutely delicious! food came out very fast and the waiters checked on us often.

Amazing place! Ambiance is fantastic and a bit rustic but very high end at the same time! The apps are insanely good and the mains are even better!! It's on the richer side but seriously the best meals I've ever had!
Flawlessly executed. the branzino skin had a nice crunch, the burrata was balanced by sweet figs and bitter frisee, all in a lovely setting.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB

I arrived at Talulas' Garden at about 11:00 for Brunch. Tallulas Garden, at Washington Square is the fifth Starr Restaurant in my series, and the second collaboration with Starr and Aimee Olexy in my series so far, (See The Love). I found a single seat at the bar, and met my two servers Greg, and Whitney. The U-shaped bar was kind of small, with about ten stools around it... It was especially small behind the bar! Those two kids had about as much room as a pool table! Serving all the patrons at the bar, both seated and standing and getting the drinks for the large wait staff... They were incredible! It was like watching a ballet! It amazed me how they never seemed to get in each other's way! After viewing the cocktail menu, I decided on The Winemaker, Talula's fall spiced pear sangria...crisp white wine, Brandy & orchard fruit. YUM !!!  I started with Creamy Corn Grits, 'caramel sea salt butter'. They were thick FRESH and tasty! They were the consistency of oat meal... The flavor of fresh corn was dominant with the faint flavors of caramel sneaking in. I then had the Kennett Mushroom Omelet, brandied onion and herb roasted mushrooms, Gruyère cheese, crispy potatoes and greens... I ordered it with extra cheese...It didn't come that way. It was very good and the eggs were PERFECT ! Whie there may have been enough cheese for the average person, I think it would have been MUCH better with more cheese...The potatoes were dusted with what I suspect was a combination of paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper and other spices they call Brunch potato spice. They were cooked perfect and had a unique flavor. I had another drink and thanked Greg and Whitney and went on my way!

I'm new(er) to the Philadelphia brunch scene and stumbled upon a last-minute reservation early one morning so I knew I had to check out Talula's to see if it lived up to the hype.

Street parking was fairly easy to find for ~10:30 AM on a Saturday but I can't speak for other days/times. We were seated promptly and the outdoor booths had amazing heating.

Our waitress was knowledgeable and hospitable - bonus points for the doggie water bowl (we love a dog-friendly restaurant!). We ordered the Pumpkin Spice French Toast Sticks to share among the table and those were quickly gobbled up. I ordered the Beet Cured Salmon Gravlax as my main brunch and the rest of the table ordered the Special-of-the-Day which was their burger. 

Thoughts/Impressions:
- The herb cream cheese paired with my smoked salmon was heaven
- If you're a fan of salmon and lox, the Beet Cured Salmon Gravlax is worth a try
- Burgers were a hit but one plate had a grilled pepper and the other plate came without (same dish, someone missed on plating)
- Crispy potatoes were under seasoned
- Pricing was a little steeper than other brunch places in Philly BUT I do think their execution warrants the difference

Overall, a very solid first impression. Left with happy and full stomachs and I would be back again to try more of the menu (I'm eyeing the Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Waffle already).
The place was very cute. The food was delicious. Do not skip dessert. The apple tarte was AMAZING
Many ways very nice restaurant, but overpriced and  very noise inside. Small portions.

Truly a great experience!  I wasn't sure what to expect.  I thought this place might be a little froo froo for me, but I was pleasantly surprised.   We requested outdoor seating which in itself was impressive.  A structure built and enclosed on three sides.  Actually has its own duct system with nice hot air blowing.  We were concerned because it had started to rain on the drive up but this structure gave you plenty of protection from the elements.  Lucky for us the rain stopped and the sun came out.

We were warmly greeted by Tatiana and ordered drinks.  My wife got the Artist which was Prosecco and grapefruit.  It was delicious and refreshing.  My "Happy Camper" appeared to be their take on a whiskey sour that was also delicious.   Ordered starters of mini chocolate croissants and pumpkin spice French toast sticks.  The accompanying whipped Nutella spread on the croissants and the brown sugar whip on the French toast sticks elevated these starters to another level.  We split the Alpine omelette which was filled with mushrooms, spinach and gruyere cheese and an order of the apple chai pancakes.  A side of brioche toast and a cheddar chive biscuit.  Pancakes and omelette were delicious as was the toast. Wife liked the biscuit.  No room for dessert and we really had enough carbs for the week but worth it.  Service was great and unrushed.  Will definitely come back and try dinner.

business.name: Amada
business.categories: Spanish, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Tapas Bars, Iberian

reviews.text: Amada is definitely one of those restaurants that offers both variety and value. I made a reservation for Restaurant week after hearing good things and was not disappointed. The candlelit decor provided charming ambiance while the Spanish style tapas all hit the mark on flavor and presentation. For appetizers, we got the patatas bravas, pimentos de padrons, chorizo pamplona, and aged manchego cheese. The aged manchego cheese definitely proved to be the star of the night: the subtle hint of truffle lavender in the honey paired beautifully with the cheese and set a wonderful precedent for the rest of the night. For entrees, we both settled on the hanger steak (amazing!), paella (just ok), and spanish octopus (another favorite!!). Finally, we ended with their Spanish cheesecake and Catalan xiuxiu (a puff pastry filled with chocolate over apricot jam). Usually I'm not a fan of dessert, but I have to say these hit the spot. The cheesecake had a citrus kick that I loved while the chocolate in xiuxiu was also very yummy without being overbearingly sweet. The service was also extremely prompt and we never found ourselves with an empty plate in front of us! Loved it here and would definitely recommend for a date night :)

The service was a little slow. Although we had a reservation, we had to wait for a while. Additionally, the waitress took a while to take our order and bring our food. The food was average, the flavor and way it was cooked made me feel like I was being scammed. They had cooked a 20+ dollar small piece of steak to well done and the flavor down to the infused oil was all very basic. The spinach puff also did not have anything special to make it worth it. The only dish truly standing out in flavor was the first, the cauliflower.

This is my third time at Amada and it trumped the others. The first was good, second not so good, third 15/10 recommend to all friends. Tonight we got espresso martinis at the bar which were DELICIOUS - so flavorful. We also got the albóndigas (always been a favorite), the Serrano ham (delicious, especially with the olive oil added), and last but not least the CHICKEN WINGS were so good we got two orders. The wings literally fall off the bone and the blue cheese crema is DECADENT. They also gave us a free order of the patas bravas which I must say were not good. I've had them before and they've never been good - They're puffy, large cylinders with spicy aioli on top. They were so covered in paprika that they burned on the outside and tasted just like burnt paprika. They're always too "potatoey", though - need more crisp. The first time we went we also got a duck dish which was phenomenal but no longer on the menu. Skip the octopus, it's chewy and over cooked. I think if you know what to order here, you can't go wrong. Overall the vibes were out of this world (I love a dark, quite bar) and the food was all 10/10. Amada really made a comeback with this one, will be back soon.

Thank you for ruining our NYE.
They sat us by the window in a communite top with half restaurant empty.
Forced a menu without caring about out dietary restrictions.
Waiter was condescending and rude, we had the same plates for 5 corses, no table maintenance, no sharing tools for a menu that it's all shared items.
Food was mediocre to say the best.
To finish, management should know how to take care of guests in case things go wrong, I had to stand up to go look for him.
Once I mentioned that we had a bad experience and that my friends couldn't eat Bz of their dietary restriction, instead of feeding us or making sure that we would leave happy, the manager just took off a pre set menu from the bill (like money was the issue) didn't bring the check, 
Didn't apologize and that is just ridiculous.
My suggestion guys, hospitality is taking care of people not to discount a messed up bill and basically toll their eyes.
I suggest a training for management and foh,
Hospitality is Take care of people period.

Had a private party which accommodated 14 pretty easily, though not great for mobility impaired people (like most of the city).  It was a very popular place and almost full by prime time, including at the bar.

All of the options were delicious and well cooked, very well explained and hosted by the waiters.  The drinks were kept very full.  If you want to explore Spanish cuisine and tapas, this is definitely a place to check out.  The suckling pig entree was juicy and a genuine pork taste with crispy skin you should not miss.

I will say none of the tapas wowed me or made me think I needed to try them again and the time between starters and entree was very long.  But everyone was great in service.  It's a great area in the old historical districts, with parking garages and some street parking as well.

I am obsessed with this place it is truly one of my go to's!! All the food is delicious the drinks are also phenomenal. Very nice romantic ambience perfect for any date night. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. 10000000% recommend

We went here for my fiancé birthday dinner and wow it did not disappoint!! The food and service are amazing, our waitress was very quick and very helpful in deciding which tapas to get. 
With that being said, the tapas were a great portion, I would say it could easily be split with 2 people. 
I recommend the meatballs they were very tasty and the peas were a great addition to the dish. 
We also got the patatas bravas which I thought was okay. 
The piquillos were so delicious, the crab meat was so tasty! The gambas al ajillo were very zesty and if you're a fan of lemon garlic this is perfect. 
Overall I thought it was an amazing place to go for date night or celebrate a birthday!

Love this place since it first opened 15 years ago. It has never disappointed.  Bar service and drinks are perfect. They have a cool back room where, if restaurant is busy, I would request to sit there, especially on a date.  Absolutely everything on their menu is a must try. Be aware that your food will not come out all at once as it's meant to be shared but if you have issues with that tell your waiter.

Romantic Spanish tapas style restaurant. Came here for my surprise birthday dinner and everything on the menu was so exciting. They also have a set course menu (chef's selection of tapas)  but because I forgot my lactase pill we didn't get it. Most of the dishes in the chef selection have some form of dairy but the waitress was friendly and asked the chef for none-dairy substitutes and was able to accommodate if needed (Amazing customer service!). It's a three course meal with each course consisting of 3 tapas, so 9 dishes total. We decided against it since we wanted for pick our own first time here but definitely want to come back another day for the chefs' selection!!

We got the ham arugula salad, octopus, short rib flat bread pizza, and garlic shrimp. Everything was delicious - I'm bias but octopus was my favorite dish! Four tapas was enough for two people. Highly suggesting getting a fresh dish like the salad to even out the rich flavors of the other tapas dishes.

For birthdays they brought out complimentary mini chocolate cream puffs at the end and they were delicious! We need to look into their desserts menu next time we're here! 

This place is perfect for a date night or a fun night with friends. Book your next reservation here and have some fun!

This place was wonderful! The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was just amazing. I was there with a group of 8 and we got the chef's choice tapas/dinner. It was SO much food. Amazing selection and just an excellent deal. The sangria (both red & white) was tasty and I would highly recommend it! We had so much, it's hard to recount it all. But the pics will help. I loved everything, but my faves were the opening plates of tuna with some olive stuff. It was so light yet tasty on the tongue. The lambchops (even though by then I was SO FULL) were delicious. On top of this, the atmosphere was so festive and had a very homey feel. I would highly recommend this place to everyone!

Met a friend on a Tuesday evening and sat at the bar.  Very cool upbeat atmosphere.

We ordered martinis which were delicious and we ordered a few small plates.  The cauliflower was absolutely amazing.  I never tasted cauliflower that tasted that good.  Nice bowl of olives which were yummy too.

Great place for date night or to go with friends.

Unfortunately this place did not meet the mark for me. The service was extremely slow-they brought out the first round of tapas after a reasonable amount of time, but the second round didn't come out for another ~40 minutes. 

I found most of the food to be pretty mediocre. We tried-
Patatas bravas: 1/5 these were extremely bland and did not taste authentic whatsoever. It was basically an under seasoned tator tot with some bland sauce on top. Presentation was nice but would not recommend. 
Pulpo:4/5 this was one of the few dishes that I liked. The octopus had great flavor and didn't have the overly chewy texture that octopus can have sometimes 
Coca de alcachofas: 3/5 this flatbread was ok, but nothing special. I found the truffle too overpowering after just a few bites 
Arroz temporado: 4/5 our waiter was raving about this. It was similar to risotto, and the flavor was pretty good.
Gambas al ajillo: 3/5 this was ok, quite basic and didn't have much other flavor except for garlic 

Not terrible, but I won't be returning.

Delicious tapas selection and extremely helpful/friendly staff. Came here for a birthday and enjoyed all the starters. For locals, the happy hour menu is quite large and differentiated.

Found the main course, paella, to be a little underwhelming, however. Really wished for the price and time we waited for this dish, it was better. Found it to be especially oily.

All in all, a great experience despite the paella miss.

Haven't been to Amada in a few years and was looking forward to it since it has always been excellent. I was very disappointed this time- the meat and cheese board was very good but everything else was downhill. We ordered the short rib flatbread which lacked flavor and the lamb meatballs. The meatballs tasted like beef jerky which was not what I expected. The ensalada verde was fresh and tasty but had too much vinegar. They were out of lamb chops so we ordered the Waygu steak, grilled scallops and tuna plate with a side of wild mushrooms. The meat and mushrooms were over salted and inedible. The scallops were fine but overpriced for 2 scallops cut in half and grilled on a stick. The tuna was good but was served over a wedge salad which didn't seem like the correct pairing. Overall, disappointed, still hungry and $200 poorer.

We ate there on a Monday night but they were happy enough to accommodate our party of four. Excellent food, very pleasant, helpful, and friendly staff! 
Restaurant did not seem too busy and things were clean and organized.
The chef is so passionate about his food and the ambiance in the restaurant is so peaceful!! Definitely recommend this spot for a date night or friends gathering!

Nope. The experience was awful. They are so short staffed. The server wouldn't get back to us for at least 15 minutes because he had so many tables to serve. Terrible. The food came so slowly so the experience was not great. The food also did not live up to the expectations. I'm never coming again to give this place a second chance.
So good! We got a few tapas when we went-lamb meatballs, croquettes, patatas bravas, garlic shrimp. And the paella was delicious. Came for a birthday dinner and staff and food was outstanding!

You know it's good when I forgot to take pictures of most items prior to eating half of it... I did almost just post a simple three word review: truffle. lavender.  honey.   what the literal fuck - it's so good I immediately googled if I can purchase this perfect meld of flavors nectar on Amazon . 

Croquettes were like candy - just gimme a frozen bag for my air fryer. Now please. Albeit- they'd be 10% as good but I'll take that. 

Chefs selection of meat and cheese was totally worth the value of $25. I will say it again - truffle lavender honey and manchego. 

Garlic shrimp sauce I could bathe in. While eating truffle lavender honey of course. 

Lamb chops were great size but overall the weakest item we had. 

Paella was awesome, saffron was on point as were the mussels. Chicken was moist. Portion and labor matched the price. (Albeit mostly rice and little meat but done very well) 

Gin and tonics are totally worth the $15, it is a nice goblet size and yummy. White sangria was on point as well, went down way too easy.
Amada knocks it out if the park every time. Service is great, food is delicious and drinks are strong. Awesome spot for date night!!

As a big fan of Spanish tapas, I'm shocked that it took me this long to eat at Amada. It has been hyped up to me for years and so I decided to give it a try. I visited early on a Friday evening and was able to take advantage of some of the Happy Hour deals, which is always a plus. The patatas bravas were lacking in flavor and incredibly underwhelming, as was the cheese board (chorizo and manchego). The ensalada verde and the duck confit toast were both very good and definitely worth ordering. Also tried the marinated olives and the salt cod rolls, which was probably the best item I had. The cocktails on the happy hour (Spanish mojito and Tie Me Up) were both solid and I wouldn't hesitate to order those again. 

The service was not stellar. After being seated, we waited about 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order and for it being early in the evening, food items took a long time to come out of the kitchen. I know staffing is a problem these days, so I didn't let this bother me much. Overall, I was just not very impressed with the place. Not sure if I'd give it another try with all the great options in Philly.
The service was very bad and the food was mediocre. Don't come here if you're really hungry because it takes forever to get to the table. Also the charcuterie board is not worth it.

I listed during restaurant week and I am so happy we did. The outdoor space was nice, but a bit crowded. The food was decent, but was kinda disappointed by their Spanish tortilla, it was subpar to any decent place in Spain. The arroz  temporado was good. What really put it over the top was the dessert- the tarta de chocolate was delicious and I would definitely go back for that. Overall, besides when one of the waitresses accidentally watered me instead of the plant behind me, it was a very solid experience. Amada means beloved and this place was definitely AM-azing.

Although Matt the bartender was extremely busy, he made us a perfect martini and was very efficient with the tapas we ordered  
The food was delicious;  the lamb chops were cooked perfectly, and the dates and almonds covered with bacon were a winner

I really enjoyed the atmosphere here. The small plates - all of which were delicious- make it easy to share and try a bunch of menu items. Drinks were great and they have a nice selection of mezcals which are my favorite! Definitely plan on going back to try more! We took so long ordering because we couldn't decide what to try first lol.

Beautiful building with a very relaxing and historical feel. Seemed like a good date night spot. We received our first drinks and tapas very quickly. Everything was delicious- we tried the lamb meatballs, bacon dates and ham croquettes.Unfortunately we never received the octopus.. after waiting about 30 minutes we canceled and asked for our check.  It was just the two of us so not a very demanding party. I also thought the serving size was SO small for the price. Not sure if our server or the kitchen was the issue as he never spoke with us about what was going on, just quickly dropped the check off. I would consider returning again but it wouldn't be my first pick

business.name: Luke
business.categories: German, Restaurants, Seafood, Cocktail Bars, French, Brasseries, American (New), Nightlife, Bars, Cajun/Creole, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text: We made a reservation at 5:30 on Sunday and found out they have happy hour til 6pm! Our initial drinks were half off! Pleasant surprise. We ordered a dozen raw oysters to start which were delicious. I started with the Luke Salad which has a variety of items that all paired perfectly. For our entrees we ordered the Jumbo Louisiana shrimp and Grits which I loved! We also had the moules et frites that had great flavor, you just have to love mussels. For dessert we had the apple cider sorbet which was amazing! If you love apple cider and sorbets get this! Service was perfect! There were multiple servers working together. The receipt says Team 1. They were awesome. Highly recommend this place for a nice dinner.
The food was good. I specially enjoyed the gumbo soup and roasted Brussels sprouts. The service was OK.

I had been wanting to try Luke for some time now and never got around to it. My best friend was visiting and we decided to go together. My absolute fav was the pâté & oyster (murder points). I had a Bloody Mary & extra dirty Martin (the dirty was my fav). Our waiter was awesome, he helped us choose the perfect oysters and suggested coming back for HH. I can see this place is going to become a fav for me.
This is a must if you are coming to New Orleans.  Their happy hour is so amazing and we have been coming back numerous times for amazing oysters.

There are plenty of restaurants where you can get a good meal, but there are very few where a great meal is the combination of exquisite food (i.e., crispy Brussel sprouts and oysters on the half shell) and the attention of a waiter (i.e. Richie Rich) that is beyond compare. This was one of those meals/events that make the trip. When you go, try to sit in Richie Rich's section. You won't regret it.

Stopped by for lunch and was not disappointed. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the fried chicken sandwich. Both were cooked to perfection as was the bread pudding. Wait staff was awesome. Would both recommend and return to this restaurant in the future.

We came for happy hour and we ordered the raw oysters, the fried oysters, the fries (not on HH menu), and I got the French 75 cocktail. The raw oysters were quite large, and we enjoyed the fried oysters (the sauce carried a lot of it). The fries were also quite good. Overall it was a good experience but nothing really blew us away.
Great cocktails and oysters. Went during happy hour so can't speak about the other food but loved that you can make reservations for HH.

We had a lovely dinner here! It was very busy when we arrived to our reservation, but were seated right away. Everything from the menu sounded delicious! We ordered oysters, brussels sprouts, calamari & chorizo pasta, jumbo shrimp & grits and flammenkuchen. 
The the drinks were great and the food so rich in flavor! Service was amazing, everyone was so friendly and attentive.
Highly recommend! We will definitely return on our next visit to NOLA.

One thing: the oysters are the best in the town (better than the popular ACME etc). Besides this, the environment is awesome and the waiters are so nice and try to give you the best service they could provide. I ordered my personalized shrimp  , which is fabulous! Would definitely recommend it!

I've been meaning to come here for years and didn't realize it was a Besh restaurant.  I made it for the 3-6 happy hour where oysters on the half shell are half price and speciality cocktails, wine and well are also half off. The host was friendly as was the bartender. I sat at the bar and got the fried oysters, (also a half hour deal i think i got 6 for $8) 
I loved the seasonal cocktail called "Barrely- making it through the holidays" which was a gin drink made with Prosecco and Licor 43 (which in never had before. She described it V as a vanilla flavor)
I ordered the fried oysters  and va the broccolini. As the oysters arrived at my table I could smell the aroma, they were gently fried and came with a white sauce. They were a little salty but V still amazing, likely  the natural sea salt.  The broccoli was perfectly charred with the right amount of crunch on the outside and not too chewy ok the inside.
The pate appetizer is amazing, oysters super fresh, and service super good. Wish I had more time in New Orleans to try more dishes.

I would give 5 stars because we LOVE this restaurant. We eat there every single day for each stay in NOLA. Yesterday we had brunch, it was delicious as usual but were so sad that our favorite dish, baked, crab and shrimp stuffed, P&J oysters was no longer on the menu. Understanding the shortages these days we know crab is expensive but maybe just use shrimp and still offer this awesome dish! We will still come but would so love to see this item added back by the two trips we have in February when we will be back (and already have reservations) for each day we are in the city!

Catherine was our server and had some great suggestions.  We took advantage of happy hour to do an unofficial wine tasting with 4 glasses of different dry reds.  Started with 2  dozen oysters, half raw half fried.  Wife thought fried were the best we've ever had and I'm not sure she is wrong.  Catherine convinced me to try the Shrimp and Grits.  Never really liked them before but these were REALLY good.  Other entree was Grilled Swordfish which was also quite good.  Finished with the best Bread Pudding ever.  We had table 81 which let us watch the kitchen at work.  Go to Luke's. You'll be glad you did.

Highly recommend to come just for oysters and cocktails. All my oyster were delicious! I've been here before years ago for them and I'm glad I tried again. This will be my go to spot for them.

Entree wise, roasted chicken was a waste. The chicken was very basic. I probably could get a better flavor one at Sams Club. The potatoes cubes just didn't make sense. As I tried to eat the dish I felt Unfulfilled. I should have trusted my gut and went with the hamburger.

Order an old fashion made with their well Bourbon and that was really food.

UNBELIEVABLE! We went for the happy hour $1.00 oysters and had to belly up to the bar due to not making a reservation. This ended up being a huge blessing and addition to our fun. The oysters were gigantic and DELICIOUS. The bartender "Lillian" was absolutely amazing!!!  watching  her wait on her folks at the bar in addition to making drink for every customer in a full restaurant was live entertainment that you can't pay for. She was delightful, and never frazzled. 
The Gumbo was the tastiest I have ever eaten and we have lived in the deep South for 45 years. 
To make a great time even better we pulled into a parking space right across the street.

Highly recommend an advance reservation. Visited during a Saints game and was looking to sit at the bar for a quick drink and appetizer. Upon arrival the bar was packed and the restaurant reservations were full and people were turning around. Long extensive drink menu and small plates, not many options for entrées. Ordered The French 75 and brussels sprouts. The brussels sprouts were good more soft than crispy. The sauce and overloaded almonds made it a good dish. French 75 was made with cognac instead of Gin which had a very settled taste instead of the tanginess which I appreciated.

Alright guys. Because the oysters were so impressively large and fat, I came back my 2nd and 3rd day LOL. Oysters were a bit smaller, like average size on the other days, which was fine because we never know what kind of batch we are going to get. Regardless, they were fresh oysters every day! On my last night, I also tried their shrimp grits and bread pudding. Best shrimp grits EVER. I ordered similar food elsewhere in French Quarters but alot of restaurants make food so salty! This dish highly recommended by people who ate at Luke's and I just had to try it. The quality really lived up to these recommendations. Creamy and it felt like I was eating mash potato (haha). So good! Also the bread pudding was so CRAZY GOOD. I only had bread pudding at Mambo's and I had to go back to edit my review because Luke's really set high standard what bread pudding should be. The bread was so soft and puffy. There were.. walnut and they were powdered and roasted I think. It compliments the dish well. There were also vanilla icecream. If you grab some bread and icecream, it literally melts in your mouth with satisfaction. This is one of my top 2 recommendations to come back to!

I went during daily happy hour (3-6pm) and waited for 20 minutes to sit at the bar on Christmas Day. They were completely booked and I can see why due to the quality of food there. I ordered a dozen of LA Gulf oysters ($1) and tried their fried oysters ($8/6). They were amazing! Like have you seen oysters this fat?! Worth my money. The fried oysters just melts in your mouth. I would say between these two, I prefer the raw on, given almost every food I ate in NOLA was fried . But also you can taste the natural sweetness in Raw oysters than fried. I also ordered myself 2 drinks (half off) and they were so good! I also had the best bartender, Lori (I think.. she has green hair). Would highly recommend this place.

As the restaurant for the Intercontinental in NOLA, Luke keeps up to the hotel's high standards. The restaurant decor matched historic NOLA and the food was great. We made reservations beforehand and it was a breeze from there getting seated. Our server was sweet and made sure to check up on us often. We went during happy hour but wasn't given an actual happy hour menu. I'm glad I studied the menu beforehand so we tried their boudin bites, crab bisque, dozen raw oysters, oyster platter, crawfish pot pie and brie burger. My wife and I enjoyed the crawfish pot pie the most. It was creamy and succulent while the crust was flaky and delicious. The bisque had great crab flavor throughout and the raw oysters were decently sized. The Oyster platter allowed to try all 6 broiled oysters but our favorites were the rockefeller and the one with bacon. The other 4 kinds were average and nothing to write home about. The brie burger was humongous and the meat patty was moist throughout. The sesame bun was toasted and the burger was everything you want in a gourmet burger. I would definitely come back to Luke next time I visit NOLA.

Fried oyster salad was mediocre considering the hype; could barely taste the oysters once fried. Good value for the pâté, intriguing taste and paired well with provided toppings. Although the bread was burnt and had to be sent back; wait staff was professional and receptive.

Disappointing online order. Overcooked schnitzel, missing Mushroom vinaigrette, burnt roasted vegetables. Grilled shrimp salad was very good, tasty bacon. Buttermilk dressing not substituted with balsamic per online order. Very little attention to detail.

We went here after a work Christmas party and had a great experience. We ordered so much food. My favorites were the Flammenkuchen and the Louisiana raw oysters. I never would have ordered the flammenkuchen but the manager on duty, Peter, highly recommended it. It didn't disappoint! The oysters were so fresh and had a great salty taste. I was super impressed with the manager who was attentive to our table and noticed I wasn't drinking my cocktail. When asking me about it I said " it was a little too bitter for me but please don't worry about it" instead he took it and immediately doctored it up and then brought it back saying that he would be happy to get me a new one if this didn't help. Well whatever he did to it was delicious and it was so nice to have someone so attentive as fine dining should be. The food was delicious and the service was excellent... both which equally make the expertise of fine dining worth the money.

My party was excited to try out Luke.  We had reservations and were seated immediately.  Luke had this older feel to it. White linen with wooden decor.

To start we had the BBQ P&J Oysters.  They were fine.  My plus one liked this dish because of the bread crumbs and parmesan, which is why we got fresh oysters too.   The fresh ones had a good salty flavor, but I've had fresher and sweeter.  

I did like the pate dish.  Spread that pate on long pieces of toasted bread with pickled cucumbers and watermelon rind.  Mustards as a condiments.   

We also got a bowl of gumbo a la Creole.  Gumbo was OK.  I wasn't my favorite dish.  Every part of the dish was not impressive.  Rice was fine and the included meat was not great.

My favorite was the bacon Luke uses.  We got a small side of it.  Delicious!

Was visiting New Orleans again, my daughter is considering Tulane University. 

Had lunch by myself. Very busy restaurant. Located in a hotel.

Wonderful service. Very loud and robust clientele. Fun atmosphere.

It was delicious. Had a pate which was amazing. Also had a salad. Rosé to boot. Very simple menu. I will definitely be back when I am in New Orleans again.

business.name: Vedge
business.categories: Restaurants, Vegetarian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Vegan, Food

reviews.text: THE BEST VEGETARIAN RESTAURANT IN THE CITY! Amazing vibe and great drinks too. The perfect date night spot or place to celebrate a special occasion. I've taken meat eaters here and they all leave satisfied and surprised at how great veggies can taste

LONG POST but I want the manager to read this since he didn't seem to get it last night;  Also, I requested the owners email address to send my review to him but he refused to respond back so I will just post it on here:

I came in on a Saturday night at 5pm.  We didn't have reservations so we figured we would have to sit at the bar.  This man immediately walked up to me and started asking me questions, he then told me I had to get in line to show my vaccination card. I am not from Philadelphia so I did not have it on me.  I asked him if I could order takeout instead he said yes and to "stand over there away from the guests" (close to the door).  I then see others showing a picture on their phone (which could be anyones card) which I did not know you could do so I asked my husband to text me my card. I sit at the bar to order my food and noticed the manager (Brendan) talking to the host and bartender and looking towards my direction.  When I gave the hostess my card she asks for ID.  She did not ask anyone else for this information, then the bartender who was originally pleasant refused to serve me (per Brendans request I'm sure).  I sit at the bar waiting for my food with my friend when Brendan walks up to me AGAIN asking for ID, we reminded him that no one else was asked for this information, he told me that the host should be asking every guest for ID which is an absolute LIE, he only requested that MY ID be shown.  I just paid for my food and left, very frustrated as I am a mom of three from out of town and never get a chance to go out.  I was looking forward to dining in.  The takeout was just so so.  Not sure what the issue was, hoping its not a race issue and I don't even like to make those assumptions but it was very obvious he was obsessed with me from the moment I walked in. I understand what the law is, I was just not aware as I am not from the area and shouldn't be harassed about it.
Excellent tasting food with an interesting variety of small plate menu options to choose from. Service is quick and friendly. Ample spaces seating
Not sure why my first review didn't pick up the pictures but here is more of their current menu!!

Wonderful food and ambience!! The chocolate covered cannoli ice cream had such a unique lemony creamy favor, a must try. Everything was shared among 5 people and we all left feeling full but not overwhelmingly full. Small portions aren't as small as they seem if everything is shared. The Dan Dan noodles were slightly too spicy for a couple people but was otherwise delicious and had wonderful flavor. Love this place!!

I'm not a vegetarian, but definitely a fan!
Ambiance: Wood-paneled cozy restaurant with a bar to wait at. Combination of groups of friends and people on a date night. Wouldn't recommend for dinner with kids or for business dinner. 
Service: Excellent. We never felt rushed, and the servers were friendly and fast. Not at all the pretentious reception I expected given the rich liberal crowd.
Food; So again, I'm a big meat eater, so I came almost under duress. But I loved it. I had my doubts about a $13 dish of roast broccoli but it was a real eye-opener. Amazingly flavorful. Also tried the dan dan noodles which were perhaps a touch too salty but again had bold flavors with a good kick of spice. Finished with a sticky toffee pudding which was a little dense, but perhaps that was because it was gluten free. Pity, because again the flavors were divine. The one downside was the cocktails which were too clever by half and just weird in taste. With some editing (say removing one or two overpowering ingredients) they could be good.  
Price: Very expensive, hence the clientele. But for a special night out, especially with a long-suffering vegan companion it is well worth it.

I ordered Dan-Dan noodles and thought per the menu descriptions, that the trumpet mushrooms would act as noodles in the dish. Instead I was served spaghetti with ONE very thinly sliced mushroom (seasoned well) that acted more like a garnish than the main event. As a vegan, the veggies are the highlight of my meals. This was a starchetarian meal that tasted good but isn't what's advertised.

Vedge is a revelation. So much technique and palate goes into each dish. It's not so difficult to make a slab of meat taste good--if one can get beyond that's It meat with all that entails--quite another to create culinary magic in a zucchini, but Vedge does that again and again. Delicious and fully satisfying. The staff is very well schooled in subtle attentivenesss, with the exception of the overly rapid plate removal. The setting is coz y/romantic with an airy feeling bar. Vedge is a real treasure, an "occasion" restaurant with delicious, imaginative food and lovely atmosphere. Highly recommend.
Dinner here is a dream for any plant based foodie! Food and service were outstanding. Still thinking about the celery rillettes and Dan dan noodles!

Good but not great.  As an omnivore who desires to lower my consumption of meat, I wanted to believe those who advocate that this restaurant is as good as any place that serves meat.  In my opinion Vedge is good but not great.  They certainly do a great job elevating vegetables to a high culinary level, but ultimately there is as yet no substitute for the flavor of animal products.  

My son and I ordered six dishes:

The rhubarb fondue.  Creamy a little sweet and savory,  Served with a delicious fresh loaf of bread.  A definite winner.

The Dan Dan noodles.  Tasty and a bit spicy.  However similar dishes at many asian restaurants far surpass this.

Mushroom Carpacio.  I appreciate what the chef was trying to do.  The meaty texture of the mushroom was used to simulate the traditional beef dish.  While the chewiness is similar, the lack a fat ultimately has this dish fall short.

Grilled Carrot.  Delicious, smoky, sweet and tender.  I have however done this dish at home many times to similar effect.  The dish was served with easily the best farro that I have ever had.  Perfectly cooked, rich and creamy.  I could  have easily eaten a whole bowl.

Eggplant.  If I was not told I would never have known.  The texture is more like sausage.  Tasty, light, and satisfying.

Fingerling Potatoes.  Nicely cooked and spiced.  Crispy but not dry.  Excellent but not better than many other restaurants.

The service was good, and the restaurant had a cozy ambiance.  

In short if you are a vegetarian, it does not get much better than this.  For me, it is a nice change of pace, but I feel I can do better at many other Philadelphia restaurants.
We ordered salted roast golden beets, campfire carrot and fancy radishes, carrots were slightly overcooked but the flavor was good. The atmosphere is  welcoming. Nice vibe and nice staff.

I had no idea how this place was going to be before I came, and I am surprisingly so shocked at how delicious the food was. Every single dish me and my friend got last Friday was well balanced and perfect. The server was perfect as well. Extremely timely waiter on refilling water, and collecting our plates, knowing exactly when we were done. 

Parking: Street Metered Parking.
Service: Been a long time since I had such great waiting staff for dinner.
Food: Well-balanced, perfect. 
Covid: You have to show your Covid vaccination card when you come in. 
Would I come here again? Yes and I would recommend it again.
Back 3 years later and as good (or even better)! Whether you dine here because of your values, your dietary preference, or you just want a special and unique experience, Vedge shouldn't be missed.
Amazing. I'm not a big eater of "fancy" food, but if I lived in Philly I'd be here all the time. Every dish somehow tasted better than the last.  The creme brûlée is life changing.

Went here for my birthday dinner last night. It was my first time there and I can't wait to go back. The atmosphere and the service inside is outstanding. The fingerling potatoes with cured olives and peanuts were my favorite dish of the night. The spicy Dan Dan noodles had zero spice but the tasty sesame sauce made up for that. The Ssamjang Tofu was hands down the best tofu I have ever had. Blueberry cheesecake was ultra creamy and delicious. My only actual complaint of the night is about the chocolate tart with bbq pecans. I was intrigued when I saw it on the menu. When I went in for my first bite, I thought it was the blackberry jam on top, but it turned out to be straight up bbq sauce. Not a combination I would ever want again, as I couldn't taste any of the chocolate. So we scrapped on the entire top to eat the delectable chocolatey center. All in all a great experience and I will be back soon!!!!
Excellent service, delicious creative cuisine, fun cocktails, friendly host, what more do we need in life?

Shockingly good and shockingly filling. I don't want to use the qualifier of 'for vegan food' but sooooo good for vegan food (and so good regardless of being vegan or not!). Spice levels were great, which is usually what I find lacking in vegan food - not this time though. 

Some of the dishes might've been a bit one-dimensional (broccoli for one, although it was good!), and maybe a tad bit expensive for vegan food, but really a solid experience and great service. Highly recommend even if not vegan.

We come here every visit to Vedge for the best food to have ever eaten. Sure, the dishes are very good, also. The main course comes with two sides. I love the Salt Roasted Gold Beets and Korean Seitan Taco. We generally get fresh food with a great portion as well. There is more than enough food and the service has always been stellar. The restaurant is great with an amazing ambiance and a nice interior setting. Great vibe with romantic. This is a must-visit restaurant. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and the food was great, there was so much we had to take away with us.

Vedge is just really a gem. It's a fully plant based menu and the food is super satisfying and elegant; I always forget it's vegan when I am there. We love to sit at the beautiful bar but the whole restaurant is very pretty and romantic. The bartenders are great and knowledgeable so I enjoy eating dinner at the bar as well. The plates are shareable and small to medium. We recently had the gold bar squash in the saffron rouille which was great, and the best part was the side of basil laced fregola, mmmm. I love their natural wines- ask for recommendations! I will be sad when the gruner veltliner isn't on the menu as they do change the menu- it's one of my favorites!

Wow! I am personally not a vegan or vegetarian but the food here is great. Some of it doesn't even taste like it's not meat. The cocktails are also very good and imaginative. Service is awesome. Staff is awesome. There's really no one thing I could recommend as all of the food is tasty.

WOAH. I've had a lot of extraordinary vegan meals, but this one will go down as one of my of all-time favorites. Absolutely everything was delicious, but the spicy dan dan noodles and the rutabaga fondue were the highlights! Also had peppermint ice cream and the blueberry cheesecake with a side of lavender ice cream - absolutely mind blowing. Best cheesecake I've had in my life! Service was wonderful, drinks were divine, and I can't wait to come back!

This place was awesome! The server Harry was great. I went here for my birthday and it was a beautiful ambiance. The food was great and its good for sharing which made the experience better. Thanks for such a great time and delicious food. 

As far as food, I had the smoked portobello (great/comes cold), rutabaga fondue (best/on the sweeter side), fingerling potatoes (Delicious), spicy Dan Dan noodles (Delicious), grilled tofu (Grilled perfect/Less flavor than the other items). 

Harry did a grapefruit sorbet for my birthday  

I cannot wait to go back

I've been to Vedge a few times and to its phenomenal predecessor, Horizons. I like the place, but it just doesn't wow me. It's all good (hence the three stars, which is NOT a bad review in my book), but it's not amazing.

Located inside a lovely old brownstone, make sure to get reservations if you really want to eat here. Otherwise you'll end up waiting for a table or sitting at the bar (which was fine by us).

We got the stuffed avocado ($12) which was an interesting mix of colors and textures, but not more than the sum of its parts. The avocado was straight-up and the cauliflower rice bland, though I enjoyed the spice of the sauce and the crispiness of the rice cracker that came with the dish.

The braised market greens ($12) were tasty, light and fresh, but this dish was basically just pho without noodles. I felt like I could have had a similarly delicious, and cheaper, meal at a Vietnamese restaurant somewhere.

The spicy dan dan noodles ($17) were nicely cooked, but the dish has little upfront flavor; you put a bite into your mouth and taste little until it goes down, when you get tons of back-spice.

Lastly, the blueberry cheesecake ($12) tasted all right. I liked the lavender ice cream and the freshness of the dish. But the cheesecake was too soft.

The drinks aren't bad and their beer/wine list is decent.

If you're in Philadelphia, it's hard to pass up an experience like Vedge. On the other hand, I think the food at other vegan places like Bar Bombon, Blackbird, Su Xing and Grindcore House is better.
Amazing food, but a very fancy place only reserved for special occasions :)
Meals are: amazing. Service: awesome great. Vibe: just right and love it man.

business.name: Big Fish Grill - Riverfront
business.categories: Bars, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Seafood

reviews.text:
I landed a gig out here in Delaware and wanted to give this spot a look. I was very pleased with the seafood here. 
The serving sizes here will definitely leave you full. 

The spinach and lobster dip was extremely good! I enjoyed every second of it. The pasta was super filling and the fried seafood basket was great as well. I wasn't really a fan of the neva's potatoes. It is similar to scalloped potatoes but the potatoes are shredded like has browns rather then cut into circles. I recommend the nevas potatoes to people who like scalloped potatoes.

We had a very enjoyable, early NYE dinner.  Both the Grilled and Fried Seafood Combo's had fresh, nicely cooked seafood.  Great location on the new Riverfront, facing the Christina River (commend a walk along the Riverwalk to work it all off after the meal!).  The only thing keeping it from 5 stars was the price, which was somewhat high.

The seafood is very, very fresh and well-prepared. I feel that no matter what you choose you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. This is definitely a casual dining establishment and I felt the atmosphere left something to be desired (I really wondered what the interior decorator was thinking). The wait at almost any given time is extremely long so I definitely recommend reserving ahead of time. The food itself is fantastic, but the ambience and general disorganization made me wish I'd ordered to-go. Good for families and casual lunches.

Love the location, food, variety, and portions--even though I get the same thing almost all the times. The blackened salmon salads are amazing (though not on the menu). And they'll swap out almost everything. And the shrimp penne with shitakes, sun-dried tomatoes, and spinach is legit.

Table of 3 on a Tuesday night at 7:15pm.
Foods wasn't as good as my first time here. 
This time I ordered the Lobster w. Asparagus & Fillet mignon again and it gave me an cut up 1 piece lobster craw, unlike the last time it gave me an lobster tail.
The raw clams was not meaty n had some sand.
The oysters wasn't as fresh as last time either.
The host is friendly and our sever was great n courtesy.

Inside: 3/5 
Staff: 4/5
Food: 5/5
Drinks: 3/5
Time Waiting For Food: 2.5/5

Took my girl on a date and we enjoyed every bit of our time. The spinach dip was great and the pumpkin spice drink was bomb tasted just like FALL.

Stopped by on our long drive down to Maryland from NYC and the food was amazing. The oysters were so fresh and caught my boyfriend's eye as soon as we walked in. I ordered the shrimp and lobster linguine fra diavolo and the sauce was perfect. I've been craving a fra diavolo sauce for so long and this really hit the spot. The oysters were definitely very popular with other tables and so was the seafood pasta. 
They also give you crackers and some tuna dip that tasted great while we were waiting for our food to arrive. The food didn't take long at all and the place was pretty busy! The decor of the restaurant is super cute and they have an outdoor dining area but it was just too cold and windy on the day we came. The staff are not masked so if that is a dealbreaker for you, I would pass on this place.
Great service, thanks Jeff! Great food, including options for landlubbers like me! Looking forward to going back.

Our server was very friendly. Went in August 2021. No masks on servers if that is something you want at this time. Food was great. Got the lobster and shrimp pasta and it was the best I ever had. Manager checked on us and was polite and not intrusive. Drinks were also yummy. Prices were more than fair for a place selling fresh seafood. Wait wasn't too long. I plan on going back if I ever vacation in this part of DE again.
This is a great seafood house. We had a variety of seafood based lunches. My Crake Cake sandwich was hot and perfectly seasoned.

I enjoyed dinner here! I came with a group and we were served promptly. I'm picky with seafood having grown up with amazing choices, but I enjoyed the crab cakes. I'd recommend this for an upscale casual choice.

Called restaurant easily ten times the day before to get a reservation. Calls kept going to voice mail asking to leave a message and they may or may not return your call. Arrived at the restaurant the next day and they did not have our reservation but did Seat us. I requested both in the reservation and at the time for a high chair and a booster seat which we did not receive either of. It was my birthday and on the way in my husband tried to sneakily order a piece of birthday cake  with a candle for me which they said they would do and they never did. Food was fine however not sure the lobster spinach dip actually had lobster in it.

Holding Business lunches at the big fish is always a good idea. They always have plenty of room for any size group. 

The service is friendly and fast. 

We started with a recommendation to try the pumpkin soup with crab. It was very good. 

Also ordered the fish tocos and the grilled flounder. Both were very good.

Never had a bad meal here. Food is delicious and service is always fantastic.  Our server was Sam, and she was an absolute gem. Definitely recommend coming here anytime you're in the mood for seafood.

The calamari appetizer was decent but things went downhill for me and my wife when entries arrived. The thai sea bass that was recommended tasted like it was out of a boiling bag with no flavor to even come close to the beautiful description on the menu. The sesame sea scallops my wife had were depressing no flavor at all to our both bland plates. We aren't mad but know not to ever come back :)
I ordered the whole Maine lobster but what I received was a little ramekin with some little bit of lobster meat in it no way did I get what I paid for

2 pm on a September Sunday was the perfect time to visit Big Fish Grill in Wilmington. Without a reservation, our wait was only about a half hour and we were able to take a walk along the Christina River's Riverwalk while we waited.  On Sundays you order from the dinner menu which includes an abundance of specials.  The soups did not disappoint and all of the seafood entrees and sides we ordered were outstanding.  We finished our meal with an apple cobbler with ice cream. All in all, a great meal. My favorite seafood restaurant in Wilmington.

I really wanted a crab cake today and since Trolley Square Oyster House is closed on Mondays, I settled in on big fish grill. I called in my order for crab cake sandwich and fries and was told it would be ready in 15 mins. 

I devoured the sandwich. The actual cake is small, sadly,  but full of lump meat and well seasoned. The fries were plentiful but not a fave. They become soggy quick in the to go containers. 

The 3 stars was for the ease of check out. There were two girls at the front counter. One was on a phone call and the other girl said she'll help you (motioning to the one who is obviously not available). I don't mind waiting, but I'm big on customer perception and associates should eagerly jump in to help out anyone at any time. 

Just my opinion. Food is good. That's not the issue. At all.

When first walking in the greeter was not pleasant. Didn't greet us and made us wait without saying anything. The manager came over and sat us. The kid that made sure we had utensils was very nice and so was our waiter. Overall the food was good.  My cousins reported the corn wasn't that good. The sautéed spinach was good and the lobster. Not a lot of lobster in the meal. The fried rice with shrimp was ok. For the stuffed lobster with 2 sides it was about $40.00. The outside area was packed on a Thursday night. We sat inside. Overall I recommend if you are a seafood lover.

About 20mins wait for a Monday Labor Day night @7:24p and got seated @7:41pm.
Friendly surroundings. Great choice of options on the menus.
Wow..the foods is in perfect portion and tasty. This place is a hiding Gem.
Pricing is very fair and well worth for the taste and quality.

Everything we had was fresh and delicious!!! We ate so fast we didn't have a chance to take photos!! From calamari and lobster spinach dip appetizers to the cod fish sandwiches and fried seafood platter, fresh and lightly battered. Service from Danielle was amazing also. Thank you.

There is nothing bad about the food. There is nothing great either. We ordered sea bass and bourbon glazed shrimp. Neither lived up to the description on the menu. Food was bland and the whole dish was not cohesive; just ingredients on a plate. The saffron rice tasted like normal rice; nothing special.
My family and I went here for my birthday; I had the lobster dinner with a side of shrimp and shallots amazing!!!! The seafood is fresh and delicious.

We stopped here because it looked like a good seafood restaurant with a water view.  First to note -it was a tuesday and for lunch.  however, I must say we were really disappointed.  The view was ok but really buggy.  Ordered the lobster bisque and calamari to start.  The bisque was really pretty good - not amazing but really the highlight of our meal.  The calamari was tough and lackluster.  the dipping sauces really wet.    The fish tacos were incredibly bland.  really really bland.  The fried oysters on the sandwich were great but not sure exactly what was going on with the actual sandwich part -horrible tomato and toppings.  Even the tartar sauce was unremarkable in flavor.  The worst though was the crab cake.  It was downright fishy horrible tasting - almost like it was old or bad.  AND NO sauce.  just the same horrible sandwich, bad toppings with the mushy bad tomato.  it needed something - anything to cover the flavor.   We were so hoping for some sweet crab.  I will say - the french fries had some salt and pepper and were pretty good.  Little crisper and they would have made up for the tomato.   Our server though was very nice.  All and all - $100+ later with tip for lunch - i would say skip.
This place is so goood. I ate here twice and the food is always fresh and the soup is amazing. It is very clean and is very well run and I would recommend to anyone

business.name: NOLA Restaurant
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, American (New), Southern, Restaurants

reviews.text: So many amazing things to say about Nola... definitely get the mussels and duck confeit pizza. You won't regret it!

Nola Restaurant was an amazing experience from the food to the staff, it was a great time. The short rib was humongous and soooo good. The king cake dessert was the icing on the cake to such a great meal!!!

I gave it 4 stars bc it took 45 minutes to seat our party of 12 when we had reservations. We also were given a hard time for being loud from the chefs and management, which made dining uncomfortable. If you know you're having a party of 12, maybe they should've put us in a different location or more private area not at a table in the front of the restaurant that echos. 

The manager ended up comping us a few appetizers for the wait. He gave us the foccacia bread, gator bites, and artichokes. I'm not a gator fan but the flavor was very good and the artichokes are a must have. The bread was well, bread. 

The cocktails were also very good and those didn't disappoint. The daiquiris were spot on. The service at the bar wasn't very good but our server at the table was great. 

For entrees, mostly everyone got the fish which was very good but I got the braised short rib and I requested extra broth. It was delicious, that is a dish I will crave. 

I would come back here, the food was outstanding. 

I would recommend this spot for couples or small groups but not for large parties or kids.

I don't like cornbread, but my wife ordered it...to me it didn't taste like cornbread...it tasted very good. I ordered the gumbo...my wife ended up eating half of that and would have eaten more if I had let her.

The appetizers were followed by Fish Creole and the Garlic Drum fish. Everything was hot, tasty and fork cuttable.
