This is an Emeril restaurant and showed that it was worthy of when he was the Chef at the Commander's Palace.
One if our favorites in Nola. If it's just the two of you, you must sit at the chef counter. "Dinner and a show"
The food was excellent, but our waiter was horrible. He was negative about selections, never filled up our water, and it took a half hour to get our ticket.
Great place to get a fine dining, food was cook perfect a great treat by the waitress. Maybe a little bit expensive but it worth it! Alligators bites was the best!

Be prepared to get SPOILED at NOLA!! The chef is so attentive to detail...everyone works like 1 unit!!
The lady that manages the Brick-Oven always has a smile on her face! I'm here on business & stayed walking distance from NOLA...so of course I'm here 3 nights-in-A-row!! I want to try EVERYTHING on the menu. They do not disappoint

Found this place on Yelp thinking the pictures of the food looked delicious. It had decent reviews and seemed like it could be a real solid place to eat dinner. We went in and were able to be seated immediately which was the only good thing about this place we encountered. We both ordered the Remolaude Shrimp Spaghetti thinking there would be no way that a pasta could ever be less than mediocre at least. We were terribly wrong. From the start, the portion size was so small. The sauce was so acidic from the tomatoes/sour from the ground mustard that it was inedible. The shrimp were the size of the tip of my pinkie finger and were over cooked. We each took two bites, mostly because we couldn't believe the first bite could be real, then asked for the check. The waiter came by to pick up our plates and never once asked why he might be picking up full plates of food. He took forever to bring us our change because he was too busy sanitizing the check holder to be prompt. We left and would NEVER go back. Such a waste of space really...
Delicious. Our server was really helpful. Really glad I tried the Gator tail -- definitely recommend!

The food was just ok, nothing special. The server was pretty bad. Water not refilled and we were told the espresso machine was broken. So we ordered regular coffees. Then, a guy in a suit took over and brought espresso but charged us for all the coffees. It was very noisy, too   It started to rain and they said they would call a cab. We finally ran down the street and found one.  I asked the history of the building and both hostesses said they did not know. A disappointment for sure ...do they train anyone here?

Holy moly me oh my - this place is delicious. Yes the food in French quarter is great. But this is NoLa good without the grease. Felipe was our waiter and is very knowledgeable about the food. He knows how to explain each dish so you know what to expect. The octopus is out of this world!

I think my expectations were a little too high. I had the barbeque shrimp, corn bread and the fish of the night. The best item was the fish of the night. It came with poatoes and green beans beneath it. The cornbread was too salty and the shrimp were too fish. The barbeque sauce was good so we ended up eating the bread dipped in that. 

My friends had the frog legs and were impressed by those. We also got the ice cream sandwich,  the pecan pie and some sorbet. It was all pretty good but I was so let down by the appetizers it soiled me. 

Presentation was amazing and our waiter was the absolute best.  He was so personable,  knew the answer to all of our questions and made us laugh. The restaurant was very nice and while we sat downstairs there was a whole upstairs area as well. Wont go back and wouldnt recommend when looking for a New Orleans experience.

Now this was an exquisite class French quarter New Orleans restaurant. This was our final stop before our trek back to Texas and we went out with a bang 

There was a lot going on at this place, incredible decor and they gave my friends and I seating on the porch on the second floor overlooking the quarter so a great start. We explored the menu here and I'll try to list everything in the picture:

Frog legs (4/5): interesting taste that really wasn't for me. Texture was similar to chicken wings but less meat

Octopus tentacle (5/5): WOW this was amazing, debatably best dish ordered at the table, highly recommend

Gumbo (3/5):  very average. It was an appetizer portion but honestly nothing special about it.

Po'boy (4/5): what more can be said

Food here was pretty awesome. We did the crab cakes (meh), the jambalaya (woo) and the chicken wings(awesome) to start. I also had a good cocktail, True Romance. Not a huge cocktail person and it was super tasty. I chose the shrimp and grits, which was awesome but very rich. My stomach didnt love me the next day. Service was awesome, they were very prompt and a ton of fun!

Great find!  We were only staying in New Orleans for a couple days and our first day struck out with the food. Next day we tried Nola and they did not disappoint. We had the buttermilk fried chicken and stuffed wings. They were Delish. Just enough spice and flavor without going overboard. The House martini was amazing as well. The chef and kitchen staff seemed to be having a good time and the wait staff was attentive. I would definitely recommend stopping in here.

I had the artichoke and the fettuccine with mushrooms--such good quality.  They give you plenty of mushrooms and the pasta tastes homemade.  The service is fantastic.  Ask for Jason.  It was my husband's birthday and he treated him like gold!  We'd go back in a heartbeat.

This is by far the best restaurant in New Orleans! We had the pork chop, fried chicken, drum fish and the fish special grouper. EVERY meal was PERFECT! Chef Philippe personally made recommendations and he was on the money. The entire staff was super friendly. We came back again. FYI, make reservations.

I normally don't post reviews but I was disappointed. Service was average, food was great. It took a while to have our drinks ordered. Our server was great but after the assistant server spilled beer on 2 of our guests and one of the guests was the birthday boy, we would have thought they would have comped one of our drinks or desserts, anything. Nope. I expected more of one of Emeril's restaurants. Definitely won't be coming back.
Classic southern options with an upscale twist. Not your most authentic, but the adequate quality and atmosphere made it worthwhile

I N C R E D I B L E. Three of us went out to dinner at NOLA 2 days ago and we are still raving about it to everyone we talk to. I always read reviews and browse menus before going out and this place did not disappoint. 

Our waiter, Roy, went above and beyond and gave us a taste of exceptional southern hospitality. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped us come to a decision. We ordered the oysters and fried alligator for appetizers. They ran out of the oysters as soon as we ordered but he immediately recommended the artichoke and we went with that. WOW. Both apps were unbelievable. Definitely try both of those if you go!

For dinner, I had the crawfish rigatoni and my boyfriend had the pork chop with apple chutney and bourbon sweet potato mash (Roy recommended the sweet potato mash on side). I sound like a broken record but WOW. The entrees melted in our mouths and we were so happy with our choices. TRY THE PORK CHOP. 

For 3 of us with 2 apps, 3 entrees, and 4 drinks, it was a 5 star dining experience for very fair prices. Thank you for the wonderful dinner experience, Roy! 100% recommend this place.

Was in town for a conference.  Was visiting all sorts of places for my meals.  For my last meal there it was either K-Pauls or here.  I chose NOLA.  Was extremely disappointed they did not have a Rib EYe :-(   Would have loved one of those.

I sat at the counter where I could watch them all cook.  FOr starters I had the BBQ Shrimp.  It was really good.  For Dinner I had a Cajun Pizza.  Noting remarkable about that.  For dessert I had some of their special ice cream...it was pretty good.

Service was excellent.

Some of the best fish I've had in the Louisiana Alabama Mississippi Florida area. The wait staff wants you to have a great dining experience. Even after the wife didn't exactly enjoy her selection. Our waiter (twice)  and manager returned three times offering a change in her selection. They certainly want you to leave with an enjoyable experience. We did. And we'll be back.

If you're looking for a fine dining experience with generous portions and a midline price range, NOLA is definitely a must visit in New Orleans. The restaurant is a little loud/crowded, but their service was still quite fast. We got the cornbread, shrimp and grits, salmon with corn succotash and German chocolate doberge cake. The true standouts of the night were the salmon and the cake. The salmon dish was beautifully cooked with plenty of cajun inspired seasoning and bold, bright flavor. And you definitely do not want to miss out on dessert! The doberge cake was delightful - airy chocolate cake layers with sweet custard between- and definitely a big enough piece for two to share.

We arrived late afternoon to New Orleans.  We hadn't had much time to wander around to check out the French Quarter scene and the local hot spots, but noticed on YELP that NOLA was highly rated and figured if it were an Emeril Lagasse restaurant we couldn't go wrong.  The restaurant located central to our hotel had a nice ambiance and bar.  There was an open kitchen down stairs to view the chefs and staff cook.  A central elevator took us to the second floor where we were seated.  The waitstaff was very hospitable and attentive.  We began our meal with some drinks and apps.  The drinks were very good.  We enjoyed the apps, my favorite was the crab cake.  My husband's fav was the stuffed chicken wings.  Our main entree's were all good.  My only complaint is the price tag.  I get it, we're in the French Quarter but I felt for the dishes we had and the quality it should be lower.  The bill for four of us was close to 200, and if I was amazed by the meals I would be ok with that, but we were not.  Coming from NY where the food is phenomenal my expectations were much higher for a Lagasse restaurant.

business.name: Morimoto
business.categories: Japanese, American (Traditional), American (New), Restaurants, Sushi Bars, Asian Fusion

reviews.text:
I was so excited to dine here because of the hype of the ambiance and food.  My friend and I both came here to try mainly the sushi, but other items like the rice bowl and noodles.  We've observed that everything on the menu was of great value, regardless of the portions.  Every item we ordered was packed with flavor and we were impressed by the way everything melted in our mouths.  Service was also incredible - our server and hosts were extremely quick and attentive to our dining experience.

We were impressed - when we tried our dishes first before our sushi rolls, the server noticed and replaced our dishes with new fresh rolls to ensure freshness.

My fiancé met two years ago in Philadelphia so for his birthday I wanted to reserve somewhere extra special for dinner for the first time back in the city since Covid took over. After careful research online I let out a big sigh and booked a reservation for Morimoto. A back story on us is we like great food but at an affordable price so Morimoto being at its price point is something we would've never even thought about it. Firstly, when you walk in the ambience of the restaurant is simply stunning and breathtaking. It's a unique and modern look with slowly changing LED lights that set the mood. I ordered the "South Pacific" drink, a calpico soda with pineapple and cilantro from the non-alcoholic menu and it was very light and refreshing! For appetizer, we wanted something unique so we got the wagyu hot stone which is a cook at your table dish in which they put a hot stone in the oven and it comes to you very very hot and you cook it yourself at your table with the instruction of the employee. We had never had Wagyu this buttery soft and delicious and wish we could experience it all over again. I mean just WOW!! We ordered the $90 chef's combination for dinner which comes with sashimi, sushi, and sushi rolls. Initially, we were planning on getting two cause we do enjoy feasting but opted out to only getting one and getting more later if we were still hungry. The flavors were absolutely out of this world and nothing we've experienced before. I don't know how many times we said "this place is expensive for a reason" but it was so so worth it and just absolutely melt in your mouth. The portion was also very reasonably sized in which we didn't have to order more afterwards. For dessert, again going on the theme with unique, we ordered the fiery chocolate, that is essentially flourless chocolate cake with meringue, raspberry ice cream, bits of pomegranate encased in a chocolate ball that they light on fire using alcohol. It was so fun and pretty to watch and even more delicious especially the cake. Overall, I would highly recommend this place to everyone to at least openly consider and experience. The staff was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable and we left so happy and content.
Rock shrimp tempura was so good! Koji salmon was awesome as well. Service was impeccable. Very enjoyable night.

I already can't wait to come back!!! My friend got us a reservation here after having our original dinner plans cancelled. Wanted to try as many things on the menu as possible, so we ordered 7 things to split. I can't even pick a favorite dish from this meal because it was so incredible. Such an amazing experience with incredible ambiance.

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary last August. We made reservations & sat by the bar. We loved it. It was mesmerizing watching all the sushi chefs create master pieces.

We did the omakase chefs special where we followed a set number of courses chosen by the chef. Everything was absolutely divine. It was my first time eating at such a high end sushi spot and it did not let me down. I will definitely come back for a special occasion in the future. Staff was attentive and friendly. 

Highly recommend for special occasions, since it is fairly expensive.
Fish piece is so fresh and a shredded daikon radish as well as a fresh wasabi comes with sashimi. It's a real deal! It's the best sushi & sashimi experience in Philly.

We started the dinner with a sake flight and some yummy appetizers. The hamachi ponzu was good but the carpaccio tasted strangely like beef rather than fish. The main course of sushi tasted fresh and they had an extensive seasonal menu to choose from. We ended with some noodles, but these were not really worth the money. The ramen was a simple chicken based noodle soup without that much depth in flavor and the udon caught me off guard because they look like soba noodles. Overall, the meal felt overpriced for the quality they offered.

I like MoriMoto for what it is however I do think it is way over priced. Waygu dumplings are my favorite and I really will go out of my way to get them but I don't think the sushi is exceptional so I'd probably say save your money

It's been a while since going here but this is a 10/10 experience. I did the Morimoto Omakase and it was so fun! Lots of variety that comes out. Huge selection of flavors, textures and aesthetics. Definitely recommend to celebrate a special occasion.
Gorgeous restaurant, excellent food and service.   Some many delicious options.  Hard to make a decision!!
The hype and price of this place is definitely worth it. The ambiance, service, and food quality is outstanding. Although pricey, you can truly taste the freshness of the fish.

Great date night spot. Incredible ambience and wait staff was very attentive. We did the Morimoto 8 course Omakase tasting menu for a birthday celebration and the timing of the food was great, allowed for good resting time during meal. Another amazing Starr restaurant in Philly! Sorry in advance for not labeling some pictures!

If you've never been here, definitely try it out for the omakase experience. However I don't think I would come back for the Omakasè again, I would maybe try something else on their menu. I didn't get the chance to take a picture of each course but there were a total of 7-8 course and our total was somewhere around 300+. The food were delightful, but not enough to fill up an empty stomach. The interior was unique did give off the fancy/luxury vibe. Definitely remember to take a picture outside if you do plan to dine here!

While I'm a huge fan of Royal Izakaya and Sagami sushi, Morimoto had a unique flavor and experience that really quite impressed me. From the service to the interior décor and ambiance, I was quite impressed and pleased. 

For appetizers, we got the rock shrimp tempura and the hot stone wagyu, tuna tartare, and hamachi ponzu. The rock shrimp was good but I wasn't overly impressed. The Wagyu was perfect (especially for those who wants to try wagyu beef) and such a fun experience to be able to cook it on a hot stone. The tuna tartare was perfectly seasoned. The Hamachi ponzu was probably the best appetizer dish. It has a nice kick with the jalapeño, but the ponzu really helped balance it out. The Wasabi rice was also fantastic and not as spicy as you would think.

Dinner we got a Chef's Combo ($90), Black Cod Miso, Australian Wagyu Filet, and a Sukiyaki Udon. I was here with a party of 6 so two orders of the Chef's Combo was perfect with nothing left on the trays. The Black Miso Cod was PHENOMENAL and so flavorful and tender. The Wagyu filet was also nice and tender - perfectly cooked. The Sukiyaki udon was delicious as well (sorry! - no pic of this). 

Dessert was a whole different experience! We got the Fiery Chocolate, Sorbet Trio, ice cream, and the Chocolate mousse cake.  I'm a little biased because I prefer ice cream and sorbet, so these were my favorite. However, the fiery chocolate was a fun entertainment and was also quite delicious. It was a bit on the heavier side. The mousse cake was also delicious, however, I'm not too big of a mousse fan. 

Morimoto is a 5 $$$$$ restaurant that deserves 5 stars in my books!
The atmosphere, the meal, the staff,  the whole experience was fantastic. We did the Morimoto Omikase, and I will recommend that for first timers. If you are nearby or visiting, this is a must go!

another reviewer mentioned the hosts and i have to agree, 5:00pm and half empty, I'm obviously on a date with my wife yet they attempt to sit me at the sushi bar in a half empty restaurant and then act as if they were doing me a favor by giving me a table with the immovable dildo lamp. but it got better, Rock shrimp was plentiful and tasty, $70 sushi/sashimi combo was really good. some of the best tasting sushi I've had, the desert was good ice cream in chocolate that gets hit with fire brandy and melts.. cute gimmick and the dessert was good too. but then the drinks....jeeze $15.00 for a bit ore than a shot of saki, $18.00 for an old fashioned. drinks were $160+ and way too expensive. overall a fun time and would return but just drink water.

Morimoto was definitely an expensive experience, but I thought the items were amazing! The service was really nice and they were extremely attentive. The restaurant itself looked very intriguing, almost like an underwater aquarium vibe.

We ordered the following dishes:

Appetizers
Rock Shrimp Tempura - 5/5, the sauce was really good and the shrimp was very nicely fried
Wagyu Dumplings - 4/5, would say that the sauce was the best part but they weren't bad, just really couldn't tell they were "wagyu"

Mains
Black Cod Miso - 5/5, must get! The fish was so buttery (definitely leans towards people with a sweeter palleted) and honestly one of the best cooked fish dishes I've ever had in my life. The first bite truly surprised us.
Sushi - 5/5, we ordered maguro, chu-toro, o-toro, and uni, all of which was of really high quality.

I would recommend this place and would totally come back, but unfortunately it does lean on the pricer side.

Ordered for dinner last night via caviar and food was delivered hot and arrived quickly, but that's the only good thing I can say. Everything we ordered (wagyu beef dumplings, chicken soup, rock shrimp, shrimp tempura roll & spicy tuna roll) was terribly bland except for the beets that accompany the dumplings 
. For the amount of money I spent and based on the reviews I've read I was so excited for dinner but so disappointed! I've had better sushi from our neighborhood Chinese/Japanese place for 1/4 of the price .

This was my first omakase experience! The omakase came with 7 courses. Each dish was small but it was packed with a LOT of flavor and I enjoyed all of them. I got to try uni, caviar, and wagyu which I never had before! My favorite was the miso fish since it was the only hot dish so it stood out from the rest. 

If I ever do come here in the future, I would probably get the sushi plate since this is the first time I had fresh tasting fish in Philly---and also whatever flaming dessert I saw in the reviews haha. 

The staff explained each dish very well and the timing between the serving of each course was perfect--I was able to just chat and enjoy the ambiance of the place. The place was very relaxing with the dim lights, candles and the cool colored lighting. 

Ps: check out the bathrooms! They are cool

My wife and I came here for our first year wedding anniversary and were blown away by the 8- course Omakase and excellent service! We went all out with the Kobe beef upgrade and even had beluga whale caviar in the first course. 

First off, the aesthetic of the restaurant is gorgeous and modern... almost unforgettable in design with the sculpted wall art and brightly colored booths. The wait staff was knowledgeable about dishes, sake pairings, and details about each dish. 

The standout dishes for us was the Kobe beef cubes, which practically melted on the tongue. Also- they shared that they are one of 10 restaurants in the USA to sell Certified Kobe beef. The custard and beluga whale caviar was outstanding - a variety of textures and flavors from creamy to crunchy, salty to semi-sweet. The uni and beef tartare wrapped in mint leaf - amazing. The tuna tartare - one of my favorites- fatty toro and perfect wasabi sauce. The black cod in miso- more akin to fatty Chilean sea bass in my opinion (it comes from colder waters as well)- perfectly cooked and flavorful!  

I've been here once before and wasn't nearly as impressed... but I think it was because we stuck to what we were used to and didn't venture to try the unique dishes that they prepared for us last night. Absolutely amazing experience!

We dined at Morimoto's Friday 9.10.2021. Hannah took care of us and provided exemplary service. We had the Tuna Pizza, Rock Shrimp Tempura, Wagyu Dumplings, Fried Yukon With Bonito Emulsion, Koji Salmon, Black Cod Miso, and the Fiery Chocolate for dessert. Dinner was paced beautifully and the food was delicious. The Fiery Chocolate was more of a show than I was expecting. It was beyond decadent.  The only thing that is barely worth a mention from the evening is that neither of us enjoyed the Tuna Pizza. The tuna was high quality and fresh. The flavor profile should have worked. There was something off about the ratio of tuna to tortilla and accoutrements that didn't work for me mouth feel or flavor wise. It was awkward to eat and not exciting for me. We definitely should have ordered the Toro Tartare instead.

The food is not bad, the service is good, and prices are fair for what it is: an ambiance-driven restaurant, but I don't think Morimoto is worth it. It's a great place for social dinners, but for a food-oriented experience, I'd go elsewhere.

SKIP if you like to  be treated good. The host that work in this place on sundays afternoons are really rude, we came at 4:30pm looking for a table with my baby, the place was empty and they didn't even want to check for a table, they said they were "full" in a really "don't care" attitude, I understand when restaurants are full, but these two host they simply didn't want to make the effort for a party of 2 on an empty restaurant. Honestly I been there before and for its price people should treat you better at least explain to you in a better way, I know that they don't care if they lose just one good client, but they should care more.

The amazing atmosphere set the stage for what was about to come. Richard, our server, was on point. He knew the menu inside and out and was always there at the right times. We had the Chef's seasonal sushi combination, Chef's Sushi combination and Fiery Chocolate for dessert. From presentation to flavor, everything was spot on. Bravo.

Honey and I came here to celebrate my birthday and we had the legendary chef's omokase, which is expensive but well worth it. Like all chef-ish food, the various courses were full of confusing and mysterious ingredients, yet so delicious that I did not care whatsoever whether I knew what the f*** I was eating.

The omokase is seven courses; they also brought out a wee little amuse-bouche in between somewhere. The whole experience took about 2 hours -- if you choose to do this meal, just leave plenty of time. Obviously Honey and I passed the evening gazing adoringly at each other. 

Rather than rhapsodize about every course, I will just deal with the sushi course which was at the very end. It was five pieces of sushi, and they were small and slender in the more traditional old-school style. If you are a nerd and want to learn more about that, I recommend you watch the documentary Jiro Dreams of Sushi. It is adorable. So the waiter told us to eat the sushi in order from left to right. And we did. The first piece, a tuna which had some sort of intense flavor added to it, was so incredibly good that I burst into tears. I pulled myself together and continued on the flavor journey, and then the last piece, freshwater eel, was again so good that I burst into tears again. 

One note about the sushi: the rice was the absolute best sushi rice I have ever had anywhere. Not too sweet or vinegar-y, gently clinging together in a nice shape but not gummy or sticky, not overcooked even a tiny bit. As I chewed the little morsels, I could feel the texture of each grain of rice in my mouth. Astounding! When I mentioned this to the waitress she smiled and replied that they polish the rice themselves by hand in the kitchen. Which is pretty much the all-time most high-dollar chef-tastic thing I have ever heard.

I was so love-drunk on that food that I can't truly recall whether it would have good handicap access. It should be fine for anyone who's up on two legs with crutches or a walker. Not sure about a wheelchair. It's in Philly near the busy Penns' Landing area so parking will be a bit intense. Honey and I walked over from our hotel.

So. Uh. It might be a while before I can afford it again but I will surely return.

business.name: Sampan
business.categories: Thai, American (New), Restaurants, Chinese, Asian Fusion, Tapas/Small Plates, Pan Asian

reviews.text:
This is the best spot for happy hour, and they do it 4-7pm every day! 

If you do try to go on a weekend when the weather is warmer, I would recommend getting there at 3:55 before the restaurant opens because there's a huge line that starts forming.

Non-happy hour is a fine experience, but it's a lot of the same food just a couple of dollars more expensive. The happy hour menu, though condensed, seem to be some of the most popular items anyway, so the full dining experience doesn't really offer that much more
Always great service! Food and drinks are fantastic. Reservations are encouraged! Highly recommend.

Got a chance to visit a friend for Halloween, and I was recommended Sampan. We saw that they had happy hours, even on the weekends, which is awesome!! Most on the food menu is only $6, and the drinks vary, but they have house offerings for $5. We opted for the Rum Scorpion Bowl ($25) and ordered the following food items:

1. Mushroom Lo Mein
2. Pork Bao
3. Chicken Katsu Bao
4. Korean BBQ Beef Satay
5. Kobe Slider
6. Kung Pao Chicken Wing

Honestly, all of them were great, with the Kobe Slider being the only one where I felt it was lacking - the bread and the patty was a bit dry. My favorite was the Lo Mein and the Chicken Bao. I think for the $$ and quality, it's really hard to beat especially during happy hour. The bowl was also delicious and definitely kept the two of us buzzed for the entire meal  4.5/5

I enjoyed the food. However, it did not meet my expectations and the wait time was a bit too long (50 min). Many people were raving about how good the food was here but personally I don't think it's as good as the hype. I might have to give the Chefs tasting menu a try next time. 
My soup dumplings and wings were my favorite out of all the food items. The bao buns were okay. I've definitely had better in Chinatown. Overall I think the flavors were pretty good. The pricing was reasonable for each item. Our table outside had heating and it was pretty spacious.

I sat on my bed trying to figure out what I should rate this place and I was confused. Confused because it was good, but not as good as I expected. I'm not sure if this is because people speak highly of it or my experience was just subpar. 

I'll explain first why I was confused. The major reason is that our friends got the sampler. They were so kind and accommodated me on the gluten free options. That was wonderful. We got wagyu beef and when I tasted it, I wasn't blown away. It was good but not wonderful. I thought the beef was a little hard to chew though it's supposed to melt in my mouth like butter. 

A dish that was good was the pad Thai. I think next time I would just get the pad Thai alone because the other dishes were just ok for me. 

Despite how people hype it up, I just thought it was okay. When I left, I felt like I didn't really enjoy but I did at the same time. This is why I feel a little confused about whether I really enjoyed it or not. Maybe I'll have to try again  another time. Their drinks are very good though!

Nice place, a little crowded, there was a wait of about 40 minutes but the bar chairs were available so we took those. You can order food at the bar too so it's not too bad. The place was bustling on a Thursday night, but the service was pretty quick and pretty good also. The food was good, spicy chicken wings was very good, the chilies  looks intimidating but the sweetness balances it out, tasted delicious and be prepared to lick your fingers lol.. the teriyaki chicken was pretty good also, my only complain was it did not come with a side of rice, I mean Asian food that doesn't have rice as default side is just sad, I guess you can order rice separately but anyhow, food was good, drinks were good and I would go again.
The food and cocktails were divine... The only issue was with the hostess group at the front, they were all hunched over the hostess stand and seemed a little dazed.

You get a lot for the happy hour entree! I was a huge fan of the shrimp bowl. There was enough shrimp to balance out the rice proportions. Altogether it tasted really good. The Bao was ok, would skip next time. While I really loved the crab Rangoons, they were on the smaller side.

I would give this place a 7 out 5 if i could! What an experience and find on a trip to Philly! I was sceptical of the menu and the place but THEY DELIVERED. We went during the happy hour and sat at the kitchen bar where you can see the food being prepared (highly recommend sitting here for an even cooler experience). We came here to try the cheese steak baos, but tried so much and enjoyed everything. The kobe sliders were good, kimchi fried rice is large serving and i recommend adding that to a meal with a lot of apps. the broccoli was really well prepared and seasoned and steamed to perfection. We tried the chicken and beef skewers and the wagyu beef. Meats were all well marinated and cooked to perfection. Brussel sprouts had a nice balsamic reduction and cooked well. The edamame dumplimgs were the highlight and we ordered another plate as we were so amazed by how they were served and the complex tastes. We also tried the general tsos dumplings! Service was excellent!Would return in a heartbeat and this is now on the must visit again spots for my next return to Philly!

Maybe it's discrimination? Called and asked if they we're still opened. They even said last order for the kitchen was 9:45. Walked in at 8:45 and was turned away. The odd part was before being turned away, a Caucasian woman looked my lady friend up and down and then looked at another female colleague, awkwardly paused in a schemingly manner and looked at us then said no. We returned to check the place out to find that probably weren't the only ones that felt this way. See note from another customer.

Back in August 2020, Double Knot and Sampan had a joint outdoor dining menu which was a neat way to try dishes from both restaurants. I'm only reviewing the items from Sampan's menu in this review and the other items are reviewed in my Double Knot review. 

Food and Drink Ordered:
* worth trying

- [Crab Wonton Taco]: I'm on the fence about recommending it because the flavors aren't anything special but I do like the combination of the crunchy wonton taco shell with the soft crab filling that had small pieces of crunchy pickled shallot mixed throughout. I'm a big texture person so that's a plus in my book. 

- [General Tso Soup Dumpling]: The flavor was good but mild in comparison to the umami flavors you can find in a Dim Sum Garden soup dumpling. 

- [Crispy Rock Shrimp*]: Hands down the BEST rock shrimp I've ever had. It tasted so fresh and the addition of the radish gave a pleasant additional texture and tart flavor.

Would I go back? : I'm not sure. My overall experience was pretty mediocre but I thought the idea behind some of the dishes were pretty creative. If anything, I would definitely go back just to order the crispy rock shrimp.

We did the chef's tasting for $50 a person. It was worth it! This was one of the best meals I've had in Philly hands down. The atmosphere and service were definitely on-par with how the restaurant presents itself.

The food was all decadent, prepared to the highest standard, and honestly mind-blowing. 

I honestly will need to go back a few more times because this is definitely a spot where you'll want to try everything.

Great date night, and highly recommend!
This place has one of the best happy hours in the city! Many drink options including large fishbowls, sushi, fried foods, etc. Good vibes and good service.

Amazing service but not sure if it was worth the wait. We waited 45 minutes for a table which may not seem like it that long given the popularity of this restaurant. But in retrospect we would have been better off just eating at the bar which had available space.
Once seated we ordered appetizers and then shared or made meal. For appetizers we had chicken satay, and dumplings. Our server was extremely attentive and friendly considering how busy he looked. For our main dish we ordered chicken pad Thai I believe it was a beef dish and another chicken dish I don't recall the names but I do remember it being tasty. Definitely would recommend this place but make reservations.

We went here las night, the food and our waitress were amazing! However, the group of hosts/hostesses were some of the rudest people I have ever met. We had a 7:15 reservation and did not get seated until after 7:30, which I totally can understand if they are busy, however that coupled with the rude hostess really make it hard to want to go back.

BEST HAPPY HOUR IN THE CITY. So so so good and affordable. Happy hour daily from 4-7pm. No reservations for happy hour. Can sit at the bar or outside for happy hour - dining room doesn't do it. However I made a reservation and we sat outside and got happy hour menus so not really sure what they're trying to accomplish. Drinks are delicious and their food is amazing - love their fried rice, pork belly bao buns and crispy Brussel sprouts.

I've heard so much about Sampan so I had really high expectations, but in my opinion, the food was really just ok. The pork potstickers were pretty flavorful, but a little too salty imo. The pork bao buns were alright, but I think they're breaded & fried with some sweet and sour sauce, which I feel hides the tenderness of pork belly and made it seem like it could be any meat. I was expecting more of a braised pork belly as is typical because that really allows the pork belly to shine. The Ming Mule was also just fine - I really couldn't taste the lychee much & my glass was cracked unfortunately. If you go, I would probably go for happy hour to save some money but the happy hour prices weren't that great to the portion size in my opinion like one stick of satay for $5 is too much imo. It's alright Asian fusion food but could've been much better & did not live up to the hype in my opinion. The service was nice & so is the ambience but the food is just meh. I would stop by if you haven't been & are looking for a new happy hour, but I personally wouldn't make it a happy hour staple.

SO GOOD! Came here for a pre bar hop dinner with my fiancé. We did the chef's tasting and it was so worth it. Was able to try so many of the menu options. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the cheesesteak bao - it was just okay but it reminded of the one from Trader Joe's if that makes sense?

BUT MY FAVORITES - the wagyu skewers and the kimchi fried rice- if you come here you must get them!

The little ice cream desserts were a nice touch and the perfect little taste of sweet after a filling dinner. 

Drinks were tasty and our waiter was SO nice/helpful and even let us know about other places to check out. 

Will definitely be coming back for more!

A friend and I were catching a show at the Bok building but wanted to do a quick HH beforehand. We decided to get Sampan a few minutes before 4pm which is when they open and start their HH. There was already a pretty big crowd waiting when we got there. Once they opened their doors, we all poured in and it looked like there was a mix of people waiting for their reservations and some for HH also. The bar is first come first served and it got full fast and I moved a couple times to give others a space to sit and enjoy too.

I ordere their Kantoi Road which was really delicious. My friend opted for a cocktail not on their menu but something with Gin and watermelon I think. Their drink ended up being cheaper than mine so definitely ask the bartenders. 

As far as food goes, I got the mushroom lo mein and spicy tuna roll. Both were really good. My friend ordered their edamame dumplings and kimchi fried rice. I didn't get to try the dumplings but I thought their kimchi fried rice was just ok. 

Overall, it's a cool spot and the bartenders were cool. I'd go back for HH but also to try their dinner menu.

I dined with a large group so I had the luxury of trying most dishes on the menu.  Everything was REALLY good. The standouts were the Korean BBQ Satay and Duck Samosa. FYI/ The edamame dumplings were good, but meh. I tasted them towards the end of our dinner so perhaps that's why I wasn't blown away. 

The atmosphere was NICE- lovely decor and lighting but definitely more crowded than expected. Almost uncomfortably so...but I'd definitely come here again.
One of my favorite spots in Philly. Everything I've ordered has been amazing. I love how creative the dishes are too! The experience is incredible as well, beautiful ambiance and great wait staff!

Modern Asian Cuisine: Loved every dish, and the environment was also very chill. Great spot for meeting up with friends, clients, or dates. You will not be disappointed. Adding to my list of must visit when visiting again. The dumplings, Brussel spouts (not your average), rice and SZECHUAN CHICKEN STIR-FRY

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Philly!! Everything is fabulous, especially the salt and pepper seafood, the pork bao, wagyu beef satay, the crispy shrimp, and the shrimp pad Thai. The drinks are phenomenal; I highly recommend the ming mule, Thai punch, and Summer in Okinawa (which I think is seasonal.) They have awesome house-made ice cream for desserts in these tiny cute cones. Great ambience for a date or group of friends. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

Excellent Asian Fusion fine dining experience with top notch service, perfect pacing for the chef's tasting menu and a good value for your money. You must order the truffle edamame dumplings, the broth is perfection and such a rich flavor. The Peking duck is a perfect balance of duck fat to meat and the char siu rib is so tender it falls off the bone. The whole meal was a delight and I highly recommend checking it out if you can. Reservations are recommended! 

The only item I'd swap out is the wagyu because the flavors didn't mesh well together. Also Kim chee fried rice has quite a kick to it!

Came here for happy hour last night and it exceeded my expectations. I think this is the best happy hour menu I've seen. So many great options at awesome prices! A few of our top favorites were the Brussel sprouts, spicy tuna crackers, pork bao buns, tofu tacos and the fried rice. Our waitress Amanda was also great! She was so friendly and made it a wonderful experience.

business.name: Bern's Steak House
business.categories: Arts & Entertainment, Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text: Don't bother going if you don't have a reservation.   Walk up is like Black Friday and despite lining up at 4:15 to try and get a table, folks rushed past us and into the restaurant and when they opened the doors.  Terrible crowd management.  So much for a special dinner for our anniversary.   Even if we'd have stayed the experience was souring.

Not sure who gives this place less than 5 stars right? I drank a bottle of wine from 1984 for $60, which was delicious and I still find amazing. Where else can you do that? The food is 10/10, ALWAYS, everything on the menu, French onion soup is a must have. Also make sure you eat some dessert and have a drink in their upstairs room after the meal, it's a unique experience for sure.

I wanted so bad for this to be an amazing experience. We had put in a reservation months in advance, then changed it near the date and they were great about it, even getting us in earlier. Service was impeccable throughout the night from everyone we dealt with. Now comes the BUT. But the food was just good. All of the meat was good and well cooked (save one entree) but it was just good. Not spectacular like the hype says it should be. And, quite frankly, not anywhere worth the premium we paid. It is a good steakhouse and the service is great, but the meal just does not meet up to the hype. Maybe that's just not possible.

The hype is real here. I've been told by many people I know this has to be one of the places you stop by if you're ever in Tampa, and it's true. This restaurant is an old school steak house that books up real fast so make sure to make a reservation way ahead of time. Service is stellar. All entrees come with their signature salad, soup, and sides. They can even book you a table at the dessert room when you sit down for your dinner. 
Highly recommended!

I will say this, I've never given a 5 star review and then have something I don't like, but I'll get to that in a bit.

 First, service was outstanding and very pleasant. Very attentive with refills. Kevin always made sure we were take. Care of.

 Appetizers and salads were tasty. My wife got a house salad and I got the crab cakes. If you like seafood, you would like the cakes.
 
 Entrees were also amazing. Wife had a 10oz sirloin and I had the flounder. Both of which cut like butter.

 I am still going to give this place five stars but I will say the dessert room was super disappointing. We were better off just stopping at Dairy Queen. Everything we tried was just dry and flavorless. Just a personal opinion, I wouldn't recommend visiting. Everything else is off the five star scale.
Try the three different meat option and the lobster Mac is delicious creme brulee is fire too

Go to this steakhouse each time I'm in Tampa and it doesn't let me down.  Great for rsvp or walk-in at the bar/lounge area.  The steak cuts with sides are reasonably priced and with great flavor.  Dont miss out on the upstairs dessert room and tour of their wine cellars.

There are few people in the Tampa Bay area who have not heard of Bern's. Most people know this local legend and hold it in high regard. Now that I have visited a handful of times I can solemnly swear its reputation is fully deserved.

Everything I've had is so so good and to be honest, even though it is very fancy and seen as expensive, it is actually truly not crazy expensive when you take into consideration that in most instances you are getting soup, salad and sides unlike many of the high class steak houses. You can easily spend double what you would here at a place like Charley's where every little thing you buy is a la carte and I just think the food is better anyway, plus you can't beat the dessert room!

They do book up fast! You can make a reservation online and you should do so in as much advance as possible. For instance I was trying to make a reservation for March the last week of December and they are already booked.

Also make sure you give yourself enough time to visit the dessert room after you eat, it is a whole extra experience and I don't think a visit to Bern's is complete without it.
Love this place! Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere and the desert room is just heaven. Always looking forward to coming here. The macadamia nut ice cream sundae is the best.

I traveled from New Jersey specially to eat at Berns for my birthday after hearing from a lot of people How good it is. I was
Not disappointed. Everything was perfect and we especially loved our server Tyler. Needless to say I will be back again hopefully sooner rather than later.

It's Berns! 5/5 stars all day, everyday! 

I've been coming to Berns since I was a little girl. To this day I remember putting on my best dress and glitter nail polish, which reflected against their velvet chairs. I remember sipping on the rich French onion soup. 

 Now, at almost 30, I still feel the same way. Berns is the place to go when you want to dress up and celebrate. If you're celebrating a special occasion or just making it through another week, Berns is the place to be. 

Anything I've had on their menu is superb. I've never had something I didn't love. My favorite part about Berns is, unlike other steakhouses, your steak comes with all the accompaniments (French onion soup, salad, seasonal vegetable and fully dressed baked potato). Anywhere else I've been, everything is a la carte, so that's a really nice feature. 

Service is always attentive without being overbearing. 

I personally love taking the opportunity to get dressed up. I will say sometimes I'm disappointed to see other people dressed so casually for dinner and I wish Berns would enforce a stricter dress code.

Wow! Best meal ever. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! The restaurant itself used to be a strip mall which is why the set up of it is a little interesting and it has lot of different rooms! Each room is set up differently with a story for each one. I ordered the châteauBriand... I've been to a lot of steak houses in my life and eaten a lot of steak, but this steak was the best steak I've ever had. I order it medium, it was amazing. Words cannot describe. 
Their French onion soup was also perfect! It came as apart of the steak (you get a lot for your money!). 

Last stop in our tour was the dessert room! The fact that there is a whole different section for you to order dessert & dessert drinks is GENIUS! Gives more people an opportunity to eat at the restaurant because people aren't hogging up a table chatting over dessert. 

Overall this place was AMAZING, it was an experience. It was to die for! 10/10 will be coming again!
Excellent from the time you walk in. Staff greets you promptly and courteously. Ambiance is great. Food is Awesome! Don't miss the opportunity to go upstairs for dessert. Another great atmosphere.
Ehhh think it's going down hill with the food but the dessert room is out of this world

Really disappointed in tonight's service. We booked this 3 months in advance - our service was terrible. Also, right in the middle of our meal, the bartender kept bringing us a check from the drinks we ordered in the lounge instead of adding it to our tab like they normally do. Very annoying and unexpected. Also, the salad was terrible.. and the .. collard greens they're serving? Horrible! I normally love collard greens, but these were disgusting. 

The wine specialist knew absolutely nothing about wine, and missed out on pairing 2 courses with wine we ordered to go with the meals. 

Overall - very upsetting experience. I used to love berns - but if I don't get a response back, you'll never have my business again.

Also, the steak I paid good money for was burnt. I thought y'all were better than this.
Bobby and Emily were the absolute best servers ever!! They fully accommodated us and gave us the best recommendations. Definitely will come back to see both of them!

Since I was probably 8 years old, I had it in my mind that Bern's was "the best and fanciest restaurant in Tampa".

Up until last night, I had never been!

I also had it in my head this this place was outrageously expensive.  And, while it's not cheap, the food you get is largely worth the cost.  Where they get you is on alcohol (which is a little overpriced) and on all the little toppers and accessories for your steak (which are hideously overpriced).

I got the grass fed Delmonico (Ribeye), cooked rare.  First of all, it's one of the uh..."rare" steaks that  I've gotten that is actually cooked this way.  Second of all it was good, but not great.  I'm not a steak expert, but after reading 10-12 paragraphs about their steak process...I was just expecting more.  Despite all their verbiage about aggressively cutting away fat, this was a pretty fat ribeye.  I'm the type of person/weirdo that enjoys eating chunks of pure fat on his ribeye and...I left a lot of chunks of fat on the plate.

I love that the steak also comes with everything.  Too many restaurants now serve everything ala cart, and charge you for every little side. The steak here came with soup and salad.  When the steak comes out, it's served with a loaded baked potato and the veggie of the day.  (it was green beans for us)  Everything was good, except for the potato (which wasn't bad, it was fine, just nothing special).  Save room in your stomach for everything else!

Afterwards, we went to the "dessert room".  In my head I always thought this was like...a walk-in cooler where you point at the dessert you want.  I could not have been more wrong!

The Dessert Room is an entirely different restaurant and, in my opinion, a much better one that the steakhouse.  The ambiance here is incredible.  Every table is encased in it's own isolating structure, and they seem to go on forever, like some kind of low-lit labyrinth.  Some of them are apparently RED WOOD (yes, those Redwoods)  wine casks...which I didn't know were a thing.  How delightfully opulent!  I'm not big into dessert, but I loved the offerings on the dessert menu.  Everything was unique and made from scratch.

The service is very good, but very different that most restaurants.  They will make you feel like you're a mob boss, no matter who you are.  If you're into that, you'll love it!

Will I be back?  Probably not.

Am I glad I finally made it?  Hell yes!

Should you go?  Depends.  If you're into desserts...this will probably be the best place you've ever been to!  If you're into steaks...try to get around to coming here, but there's no need to make it your #1 priority.

Words cannot express how happy this restaurant made me feel. I came here with the hubs to celebrate our anniversary. We came from Miami. Friends have always recommended this place but I always thought it was hyped up. It's not. It's amazing. Best restaurant I have EVER been to. 

Their steak is to die for. So juicy. So cooked to perfection. Honestly priced very well. This place was cheaper than a lot of the fancy restaurants in Miami.

The wine is why you come here. This is the only place that you can get vintage wine at an affordable price. We bought a wine from the 1918 and it was only 500 bucks. Considering how old the bottle is , that was sooooo affordable. I never thought in my life I could try something like that. And I loved it!!!! It was so good! They preserved it so well! 

The famous dessert room. Omg come here do not miss it!!!! Amazing! Decorated so nicely and everything was si delicious!!

I Sent my contact info to them immediately as requested so they could "follow up" with me further.  However They have not followed up.  Another indication that Berns has transformed into a mediocre establishment from being iconic for decades. Sad that COVID seems to have hurt them as well as the current generation running the place and not focused on what made Mr Laxer's establishment an institution.  No need to follow up with me at this point.......  before ever going again I will check the reviews to see if they have improved.
Very nice. I brought my fiancé there for he birthday. She loved it as I did as well. The table side service and tour was not available unfortunately.

I am a little late in posting this review.  It took me some time because I am in mourning.  The Bern's I knew and loved so much has truly changed.

Four of us went for dinner, a special occasion, after landing a reservation which required a call 90 days in advance.  90 days.   We arrived early and offered to give up our hard-won table for some seats in the bar because we love the bar.   We were told no.  Absolutely not.   No?  No!   I had never heard that word before at Bern's, which always did whatever it could to make its diners happy, right down to finding okra somewhere when I mentioned how much I love it.   That "no" created a ripple in the Matrix.

So....we found ourselves in the front dining room (not our favorite dining room) with a nice but less experienced Captain.   We ordered drinks and the caviar tasting to get things going, followed by wine and a variety of steaks.  

The Caviar tasting options were quite good, making the tasting itself a true value, but I missed the Bern's butters...long gone now with Bern himself.  We  had to ask for more toasts, which took a bit of time to arrive.  Our drinks arrived sporactically as well.  

We moved somewhat clumsily through the soup and salad courses.  The salads are still served with wonderful housemade dressings including French, something I don't come across often.  You can no longer choose between salads.  House is it.  Anything else is extra.  

The days of soup choices are also long gone.  French onion is what you get.   I opted for the vichysoisse even though I had to pay extra for something that used to be part of the meal.  I love Bern's vichysoisse and as good as the french onion soup may be, the vichysoisse wins with its caviar and truffle oil topping and its housemade chips.   

The moment when my love affair with Bern's changed arrived with the steaks.  Bern's always made a great steak, served on a sizzling platter, with butter still melting on top if you so desired.  Alongside the steak, crispy onion strings, a vegetable grown on Bern's farm and amaretto carrots.  Always amaretto carrots.  Until this night.   Our Captain said they were no longer serving them.

My steak was very good, but no Bern's great.  It was closer to medium than medium rare.  No butter once again.  I received a baked potato with toppings on the side.  The fantastic onion strings were there, a few (4-5) green beans but no amaretto carrots.  No carrots?   How could there be no amaretto carrots?   They are, make that were, a Bern's signature.

The fresh fish tanks are gone.  The soup and salad courses are set. No choices.  The little extras are no more.  The service isn't quite as precise.  Even the wine cellar feels a little lost.  I chalk so much of this up to the pandemic.  And yet, it was the missing carrots that caused me to pause.

I know that restaurants have to evolve with time.  It just feels as if Bern's is eliminating rather than evolving.   It made me sad to sit in Berns with so many of the things I loved about it now gone or an pricey upcharge.   I had to spend some time reconciling this.   Bern's still offers you a very good meal for a very good price in an eccletic environment typically served by a well-trained efficient staff.   It is far better option than any steakhouse chain in America.   I just mourn the loss of the good old days when it didn't say "no" and you were offered you so much more, including those distinctive perfect-with-steak amaretto carrots.

This is a staple in Tampa. In a nutshell it is an old school steak house with an incredible wine list. I have been multiple times and have never had a bad meal or experience. 

Great for happy hour but show up 30 minutes before the restaurant opens or you will wait 1.5+ hours for a bar seat. 

You do need a reservation. They open reservations 3 months out and you basically need to book the second new reservations open. 

Highly recommend!

Celiac friendly! They are super accommodating for dietary restrictions. Our server and the kitchen staff were kind and accommodating. I had a delicious meal with my husband and did not get sick at all! Will be going back!

I only had 2 glasses of wine and I am a large man. I got cut off because I was told I was struggling going upstairs (this was before I went up stairs) It was unprofessional and unacceptable for an establishment this highly regarded. It may be they saw my shaking hand upon ordering, which I have essential tremors disorder, which means they  are violating the ADA laws  Please respond to my inquiry

About a week before our trip to Tampa, we started trying to get a reservation without success but we kept trying and somehow we got lucky and got a reservation the day before. Our waiter was so charming. He made sure not to rush us and explained the menu. The steaks come w soup salad potato and vegetable that was a pleasant surprise.  The French Onion soup was delicious. I ordered the strip steak and it was fantastic.  Pretty amazing the whole upstairs is for dessert. I had a single scoop of the Macadamia Nut and thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend Bern's

business.name: Drago's Seafood Restaurant
business.categories: Restaurants, Seafood

reviews.text:
Upon booking our stay at the Hilton Riverside my fiancé and I learned this restaurant was on property. Upon looking at some of the reviews we decided against planning to come here for a meal. Wellll the reviews are wrong. On this rainy Saturday afternoon, our last full day in Nola, we decided not to leave the hotel for lunch and instead dine at Drago's. This was the best decision!! The service here was incredible. Our server Ashanti was such a sweetheart making sure our drinks were never empty, checking on us about our food and just being a little sunshine on this cloudy day! 

To start we had the chargrilled oysters, cuz after all its what they're famous for! They were outrageous. The flavors on them and the size of them makes them a definite must have when coming here. For our meals I had the seafood gumbo bowl. The flavors in this dish are just perfect!! Definitely recommend dipping some bread in there!!! My fiancé had the seafood pasta which was sooo deliciously creamy!

Overall I would definitely check this place out if you're in Nola. They are a great place with great staff and great food!!!

I was hesitant because I am not one for oysters (and I work at an oyster bar back home) but holy crap, so yummy!!! We were all very impressed with our food. The only complaint is we had a girl in our party who doesn't eat seafood and online showed a much larger menu and we were told we weren't allowed to order certain things, so she couldn't even get chicken tenders. So make sure everyone loves seafood or doesn't have an allergy!

We came here for my moms 70th bday. First our waitress Brittney was great!! We orders the alligator bites for appetizer since neither had them, to chicken to try the charbroiled oysters(which by the way we tried elsewhere). It wasn't even suggested to try even thought that is one of y'all popular menu item. Alligator bites were great as long as they were hot. We ordered the fried catfish and shrimp combo with fries an onion rings and the sirloin(medium) with lobster and mashed potatoes and side Cesar salad. The fried platter was ok, fries seemed dbl fried, and the onions rings(2) were to hard. The sirloin was cooked well done and the lobster was to tough to eat. We asked for that plate to be replace with the fried platter, which actually came out piping hot, better than mine. Dessert was brownie with ice cream and a LOAD of whipped cream, which was almost the best thing about this birthday dinner besides the cesar salad. For the price it def could of been better. May come back and try the oysters only.

We had reservations via Open Table and it took a little bit to get seated but it wasn't too long of a wait.
This place was delicious!!! The fried shrimp were huge and juicy, and most importantly the breading was so light yet the shrimp were crispy. Some places the breading is super thick and takes away from the taste. My first time trying grilled oysters and I loved them!! My friends had the raw oysters and enjoyed those as well. Our server was great - very pleasant with conversation and his service was excellent. And he was properly masked! 
Only improvement would to have a bigger table to fit all of our food. =) We will definitely return here next time we're in Nola!

I was told about Drago's from a friend who recently visited New Orleans. It is located in the Hilton hotel. We went on a Saturday night and was a little worried because they don't take reservations. However, we didn't have a wait time and were seated right away. 

I ordered the gumbo, charbroiled oysters, and baked market fish. The highlight would have to be the oysters. They were pretty cheap and absolutely delicious. They were so flavorful and you just have to try them. The gumbo was also pretty good and tasted much better than the gumbo I ordered on bourbon street. The fish was good but not worth the price. Stop by and try the oysters. 

We also ordered drinks but they were nothing spectacular.

Sorry. The raw oyster are excellent. The charbroiled oysters are over breaded. The main dishes are disguised with too much hot sauce. The drinks are weak. Our waiter was excellent but he could not make up for the misses in the menus. I would not go here again.

Quick seating, great service and the chargrilled oysters are fantastic. As a main entree I had the seafood pasta which was good. Plenty of seafood in it. My daughter had the shrimp and grits which she wasn't crazy about but it was decent, my husband had the catfish platter which was really good. Overall would return, especially for those oysters. Oh and you've gotta make sure you have your vaccine card in hand to be seated.

Daaaaang, my mom hyped this place up for a reason! She has been to NOLA many times, and this was my 1st visit. She made sure I tried the best oysters in the city, and I was honestly not feeling it. I'm not big into seafood, BUT.... these blew me away! The charbroil on them is freakin' delicious with the butter and bread to clean it all up with. Our friends got the crawfish mac n cheese and let me try some, which was also out of this world! Can't wait to go back here again someday! If you haven't tried charbroiled oysters, just do it! You won't be disappointed.  Also, their bread pudding is to die for. Super moist like how it should be and not all dried out.

We vacationed in NOLA for a week.. Came here for dinner. Had reservations and waited 15 minutes which wasn't horrible given dinner rush hours. After having chargrilled oysters at other nearby restaurants I feel they are all the same as other places here, all good and tasty. But the star were the fried shrimp and fish platter. The shrimp was so good! Lightly breaded, huge and Juicy and lots of flavor. The raw oysters were really fresh and sweet. Our waiter was very attentive and kind. Would definitely come back for the fried shrimp!
Delicious food and excellent service! Ate from the small plates menu and all hit the mark. The charbroiled oysters melt in your mouth! Followed by the crawfish mac and cheese and gator tacos!

Relatives and our hotel recommended Drago's. When we walked up we realized it was the headquarters (The Hilton) for Ole Miss. We ate in a dining room surrounded by Rebels. The fried shrimp platter was delicious. My husband said the shrimp and grits had 'some heat' which he loved. It appears Baylor Bears and Ole Miss Rebels both enjoy great seafood. Almost as good as the Zuider Zee and the 2nd Edition use to be in Fort Worth! But, I have it from a good source they purchased a fair amount of seafood from New Orleans. My sister wanted us to try the char-broiled oysters. She said they are wonderful. When my family would make trips to New Orleans to visit the Bilich oyster family, everyone would eat their weight in oysters, but me. So I'm going to have to trust her about Drago's oysters being the best anywhere. No reservations needed. Service was outstanding.
The picture says it all.... So good & tasteful!!! Service was good & had about an hour wait...but you could check in and leave and they texted when they were ready which was convenient

Very Yummy! The Oysters were really good and the staff was really nice as well. My husband and I are definitely enjoying the new orleans experience. There was even a local jazz player nearby after leaving that topped off a wonderful evening.
We were wearing masks but they wouldn't let us in because we didn't have vaccine card. Ridiculous!

Delicious charbroiled oysters! On the ground floor of the Hilton. The wait was 45 minutes but we grabbed a spot in the bar where an abbreviated menu is offered. The MOST important dish - the OYSTERS- is available here. Friendly, prompt service from Angel. Absolutely delicious! 
DON'T FORGET YOUR COVID VAXX CARD OR YOU CAN'T EAT DINNER HERE.

Definitely a no-go... With all the high reviews, we were excited to try this spot. Never again... The famous charbroiled oysters taste like nothing but Parmesan. The spinach dip was bland and I can't explain the disappointment with the gumbo. Luckily I ordered the gator bites because they were edible. We sat waiting on our order so long that we even heard another customer telling the waiters that we hadn't received our food. This was an overpriced waste of time. We went to Neyow's the following night. If we return to NOLA I'll skip this spot and head to Neyow's because they did not disappoint.

Hotel restaurants usually are not impressive... but this restaurant had good reviews for their chargrilled oysters so we were giving it the benefit of the doubt. Well, they blew that! When we first walked in, we noticed no appealing atmosphere... just a normal run of the meal hotel restaurant vibe. No background music, no stylish decor, and the staff were non engaging. Such a boring place. 
Chargrilled Oysters... great! Bread not good! Entrees came out before salads, sadly. Seafood pasta was just so so and the soup... very bland. 
By far, the biggest disappointment and waste of money of this whole trip. Surely, there are better places for chargrilled oysters where everything is good. If you go... go for the oysters and get the heck out of there.

Drago's is consistently producing quality charbroiled oysters. 

There's a lot on the menu, but I always come for the charbroiled oysters here when I come to New Orleans. 

The service is great.

Note: If you make a reservation on your phone, saves you from a long wait.

DO IT. Chargrilled oysters. Herb-Garlic butter amazingness. We never had oysters before and these claim to be the, "single best bite of food in town" well they lived up to their word. If you're on the fence, DO IT!

had here was absolutely delicious. The serving size for the oysters are for one person if you order a dozen. As for the service, sat at the bar and the service was super fast and friendly. visit was a Saturday night and it was quite busy but they were able to serve right from the bar.
You wouldn't normally seek this place out because it's in a hotel but charred oysters and gumbo are excellent and the bar tenders make really nice cocktails.
The food here was ok. I had better walking down the streets and going into random places. The oysters were good but the best,, I wouldn't say that!

8th or 9th or 10th trip to NOLA and i finally got my ass over to Dragos. Here's the deal, its in a hotel, but dont let that fool you...the set up is great, and the food is even better. What i really loved, was the service. everyone was beyond friendly, they paid attention to me, and they were quick. I sat right at the bar and watched what i came here to try get made. its a real science here, the grilling and the pouring of the secret butter and garlic sauce. I grabbed myself 6 of the oysters, and i was in love. i loved them so much, i convinced the guy next to me to get them. they were greasy, garlicy, and loaded with cheese.

in true fat pig form, i grabbed an order of gator bites too. i highly suggest these if you wanna be adventurous and try something else besides the oysters. they were outstanding. probably one of the best gator bites i had. they were fresh, fried perfectly, and i liked that the batter didnt over power the gator itself. i didnt even need the sauce it came with. 

although i love dragos oysters, i think theyre the 2nd best in town, which sucks since they are known to create these amazing lil suckers. i highly suggest coming here, especially since its huge, no lines, and great service. try for yourself and let me know!
First time I had oyster & these were good. The lobster was good as well highly recommend.
Really good oysters, pleasant service in a hotel lobby atmosphere.

business.name: Restaurant R'evolution
business.categories: Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Cajun/Creole, Restaurants, Seafood, Southern, Hotels & Travel

reviews.text: Enjoyed a really nice birthday dinner with friends. A well kept secret, Restaurant R'evolution a great gem in the heart of the quarter half a block off of Bourbon connected via courtyard to The Royal Sonesta. While waiting for our table, I enjoyed a cocktail called "Sunnyside" at the bar. Delicious. Makeup of a lemon drop and French 75 with a sorbet "egg" to add a bit of sweetness. Once led to our table, our servers J and Isaac took very good care of us. Every dish from appetizer to dessert was delicious and well executed. Appetizers: Blue Crab Beignets, Short Rib Boudin, Bread basket of fresh rolls and cornbread with accompanying butter and cane sugar butter. Entrees: Fire Roasted Short Ribs, Matagorda Bay Red Fish with Caviar Butter. Dessert: S'mores Bread Pudding Creme Brûlée and Bananas Foster. I couldnt give 5 stars due to the hostess who we all found rude and unprofessional when interacting with us upon arrival and while asking questions regarding our seating. We were told that the entire party had to be present before we could be seated which was perfectly fine but her delivery and demeanor left much to be desired. Our reservation was for 5:15. The restaurant opened at 5:00 since it was a Sunday evening. I'm not sure if she was having a rough day or if it was her general demeanor but it put a bad taste in our mouths. Luckily excellent staff as Jeralyn (hope I'm spelling that right) and Isaac were as phenomenal as they are. They more than made up for our initial welcome. Also, the seating could use an update. Though comfortable, the mid century styled seating had some wear on the seat's "leather" for the arm rests and actual seats. Other than that, great food and drinks. I'd dine here again.

We walked in and sat by the bar. It is first come first serve for the bar area, and we were lucky there were empty seats at around 8:30pm. We had death by gumbo, crab beignet, and pork belly, all were great! The gumbo I had at other places tends to be overly salty, but this one is just right.

I'll begin with the positives, first thank you for allowing us to have our birthday cake there, store it, cut it and deliver it to us. The signature spare ribs and lobster, crab anyways, and the bread service were highlights and delicious. The asparagus and mashed potatoes were also winners. The french fries were a bit on the southside. My party had two people that ordered the Delmonico steak they ordered at medium well, both of them came out undercooked. We were told by our waiter that they would be able to get those heated to temperature rather quickly which happened. Unfortunately, the steaks came out completely chard on both sides. The charring of the stakes was visible to everyone at the table so it was really disappointing that the chef, and the waiter did not have that conversation in the back before they brought it out. However, since the other people at the table with us we're already done eating their entrées they ate some of the steaks. The waiter was a little chatty BUT the assistant that worked the table with him was delightful. "Chatty" in the sense that it took a really long time to get things accomplished with us and as we waited patiently for him to recognize we needed him. I probably wouldn't return to this location though the food I personally had was good the experience as a whole wasn't what I had hoped it would be. Also the dessert options were not very appealing, just a side note.

We start out being introduced to Da'Shawn and Tina with quite a bit of energy and a great view of the kitchen. Then, Da'Shawn hands us the cocktail menus and a separate wine menu that's on an in-house iPad with searchable features by country, region, price, or any other filtering you might need. We decide on the Saintsation and the Lower Garden and they're good enough to order more throughout the meal. Spread out over the next three hours, we get the free house cornbread to start, one serving more crispy and another cooked to perfection and both served with a choice of olive oil, sea salted butter, or sweet butter with cane syrup. Try a little of each topping with the bread because they each provide a little something different. Then, we started with the Turtle Soup with Deviled Eggs and the Blue Crab Beignets. The beignets have been a return try because they converted a non-seafood me to like crab cakes and a whole world of food. The turtle soup was different from anything we've had and meshed well with the deviled egg, but we were split on whether this was worth an order again or just an interesting bite. The main meal came when Da'Shawn told us we could have half-portions of the pastas, so we ordered a half of the Duck Confit Ravioli and the Lobster Gnudi. Both were mouth-watering, with a standout in the filling for the Duck Ravioli, but the best were our meat entrees. We got the 8-oz Center Filet with truffle butter and foie gras and the special, a 16-day Ages Rack of Lamb with a red-wine reduction and a lobster tail on top. The steak stands on its own, but is even better with the truffle butter and the lamb was delicious. After a full meal, our dessert stomachs were satiated with Espresso Martinis each and a Bananas Foster Affogato Trifle. The trifle was infused with banana flavor and the martinis are dessert in a drink. We closed with the chefs compliments of their Raspberry Sugar Cookie, House-Made Pralines, and a Cinnamon-Cream Cookie. A one-of-a-kind meal with amazing service throughout.

This review is for the bar area only. Some friends and I popped in after brunching earlier in the day and needing some sustenance (along with more cocktails). The bar was very busy and we were lucky enough to snag a table when a party was leaving just as we were entering. Our server was friendly and came over right away. We ordered several charcuterie type items and cocktails, which took a while but still within a reasonable time, considering how busy it was. A big pricey for the portions given, and, as is often the case, not enough crackers/bread. But overall a nice experience in the FQ and a lovely atmosphere. Drinks were excellent!

This was one of the best meals that I've had in New Orleans.  The death by Gumbo is incredible with a tiny delicately stuffed quail and soup poured over it.  The blue crab beignets are delicious and came as a starter of four generous potions.  The blue grits are also amazing - I tried to find blue grits in the supermarket  with no success.  The red gulf shrimp was yummy too.  My husband had the pork belly which was very tasty with a crunchy rind and melt in your mouth flesh.  Please do make your way here!  Wonderful staff too!

Awesome experience.  I just arrived at the Royal Sonesta & it was too late to make a reservation at R'evolution.  So I took my chances for happy hour at the bar.  It was wide open at 4:45, though 15 minutes later started filling.  Vax cards were checked, which is fine with me.
Service was excellent at the bar! I decided on steak tartare, an Old Fashioned, sparkling water to start. The tartare was very different from any I've had in the US or Europe. It was served with potato chips and was some of the tastiest I have had!
Then I decided to order the pate. The presentation was fantastic and served with more than an ample amount of warm bread and "toppings."  It was so much, I could not finish it!
I was never rushed and the service was as friendly as it was flawless!  So please I could finally dine here after staying at the RS in October & November, but on days R'evolution isn't open.

I chose Restaurant R'evolution to celebrate my recent private nuptials with a few family and friends. I loved the private-clubby feel of the entrance and that the bar area is separate from the rest of the restaurant. They seated us right away and showed us to a wonderful table near the glass partition separating the bar area. The waiters were very attentive and even brought a selection of reading glasses for someone who forgot theirs at home. (Someone is me :) My contacts are for distance so I can't read near objects when I wear them.) They even provide an ottoman so ladies don't need to worry about where to place their clutch or handbag. On top of the service and the ambiance, the food and drinks were delicious! Our table shared the wonderful charcuterie board and we each loved our entrees. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a lovely evening out.

This always happens: we over order. Our eyes are bigger than our stomachs. This never happens: the waiter adjusts your order to half-order shared plates so you can still sample the menu without walking out so full you can't walk! That type of service is worth five stars alone. But the food is equally stellar. Death by Gumbo? Wow. Gem salad? It sparkled. Caeser Salad? Bring it on. And the Red Snapper and Mushroom Pasta? Oh my gosh. Thank you Restaurant Revolution for a wonderful evening.

Happy Hour: 4:30p - 6:30pm
Cocktails & wines are all $7 during HH
Beers are $5
Bites range from $4-$11
