My group and I came here for Happy Hour, and mostly just came for a midday drink. But while when we got seated we decided to get a few bites to share just to try. We ordered the Gruyere Gougeres ($6), the cajun-fried P&Js Oysters ($8), the Crab Beignets ($8), and the Bourbon-cured Bone Marrow ($11).  The bone marrow was good, the crab beignets were decent, but the cajun-fried oysters were just okay; we felt that it tasted too much of just oil. 

Right when they open it was still quiet enough to hold a conversation but right around 6pm or so people started to roll in for their dinner reservations and the place quickly got semi-busy

Everything about our visit was superb! Hostess was pleasant, friendly and quickly seated us, server and his help staff were prompt, read our cues and on point. Our celebration was our 15th anniversary and they made it special for us. Our first trip to NOLA and special occasion were made memorable by this restaurant. An off note, but we have always had to wait on valet no matter where it is but our vehicle came out in less than 2 min, amazed all around. Would l to dine here again!

The food and bartenders were excellent. We didn't have reservation so got to sit at the bar. Drinks were delicious but description was 'fresh blackberries and raspberries' it was tasty but little bit false advertising
I know we didn't pay 650$ for drinks but even with 150$ I would not expect to see those buckets right in front of us with mixing frozen juice which supposed to be'fre'
It kind of ruined the mood of 'fancy restaurant '
Lovely warm ambiance, outstanding servics, and absolutely amazing food! Food was rich and flavourful, with graceful presentation.

We sat and ate at the bar since we didn't make reservations. Our bartender was great. Friendly, made fabulous drinks! I believe I had the Saintsation cocktail. It was delicious and I stuck with it for the meal. 
The food was mostly good. A couple of things were misses.. we didn't care for the 2 desserts we tried. Their turtle soup was delicious though! Also the Crab Bengiets were delicious!

Tina and Da Shaun made our first and only night in New Orleans so special. Their attention to detail made our night super special. Probably the best food I've ever tasted and we are coming from NYC!  Excellent restaurant with wonderful staff!

Went for birthday dinner and although we had reservations has to wait in bar for about half an hour which was ok bc bar is nice and folks were friendly. After being seated waited almost 20 minutes for someone to take drink orders. Shantelle (sp?) said she was working w ? And took our drink order. After about 20 more minutes returned w drinks and turned and left. We had to catch her to order Apps. Husband had to ask about specials- there were none. We ordered the Crab beignets and Short Rib Boudin. Noone came to fill water glasses or ask for additional cocktail order or anything.  Despite another server making a big to-do at table for 8 next to us. Now mind you I was wearing a birthday sash and glasses.   Finally after getting apps delivered an hour into service by kitchen staff (they were ok bar food wise) and noone returning for dinner order I left. Husband stayed and cashed us out.  He said the guy carrying on w other table introduced himself as our server and asked for dinner order. No apology given.   Definitely NOT a 5 star restaurant.
This place has some of the best high end food around New Orleans. I highly recommend making reservations in advance.

The experience here was fantastic. Great service and phenomenal food.  The wine and liquor selections are outstanding .  The Saison salad was delicious and I could have licked the plate to get the last of the champagne vinaigrette. The pasta was light and tender in the Brick Oven Mushroom & Black Truffle Tagliatelle. The Filet was cooked to perfection, nice little char on the outside and a wonderful wine reduction. now for the desert... we had 2 and they were both off the charts. Petite Chocolate Gâteau and Louisiana Citrus Doberge. all said an done, it's pricey but worth every cent. by the way, if you're a Cab fan, the Donati Family, R'evolution Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon was very good .

I've eaten at Restaurant R'evolution 3 times and each time found the food, service, and overall experience to be stellar.  This review will highlight the food from my most recent trip to NOLA in October of 2021.

Meal 1

I started with the Yellowfin Tuna Crudo w/Alligator Pear, Red Onion, Ginger, Radish, Shaved Apple
For those who know me or have read other reviews, I'm a sucker for crudo and this did not disappoint. The stand out here was actually the completeness of the dish. The fish was velvety in texture, fresh and delicately delicious. The pear, red onion, ginger, radish, and shaved apple did not over power but instead offered a wonderful contrast in texture and flavors that resulted in complete harmony on the palate. 

My husband started with dry-aged steak tartare w/cured egg yolk, pickled shallot, black garlic mustard, and house made fingerling chips.
He raved about this dish...and I say for good reason.  I did have a taste and found it to be a powerhouse of a starter.  How raw beef can be so darn tender is a mystery. The mustard brought zing along with the pickled shallot while the egg yolk contributed to the creaminess of the creation. The crunch of the house made chips countered what could have been a redundant texture but saved the day to make this a complex and satisfying starter.

Next for both of us:  Death by Gumbo
I'd had this dish on a previous visit to Restaurant R'evolution and it is why I returned. I have much love for this dish. The gumbo is intense.....and it is certainly not traditional.  The presentation is interesting as well.  A covered bowl is placed before me....then the cover is lifted to reveal a single quail that has been deboned and stuffed with yummy things....(rice, sausage, etc.).  Then the strained "gumbo" liquid is poured from a small little pitcher over the quail, coating it with pure intensified flavor. Gah. So good. That quail has a crispy skin and the meat is tender and delicious.  The fillings bring the comforting flavor of dirty rice and sausage expertly combined to make one composed exquisite bite. I seriously wanted to lick the bowl.

Entree - we split something that was not on the menu (sorry) but I'll do my best to describe the dish. I want to mention, though, how much we appreciate the care the chef took in making sure we both had a perfectly composed dish.  We each had a bit of all components:  seared scallops, foie gras, duck confit ravioli, and micro greens in a delicate broth.  Outstanding.  It was balanced in flavors and textures.  I am pretty certain had we each ordered it we would not have been able to finish but divided between us it was the perfect amount for tasting. The dish was exciting, interesting, and entertaining....food peeps, you'll get that.  Sorry if that sounds like food-snobbery. Shake it off.

Dessert, which is a priority of mine, was next on my agenda.
1. Louisana citrus doberge w/Meyer Lemon Curd, Creole Cream Cheese Ice Cream, Honeycomb
There is that doberge cake again!  (Referencing another review) The stand out for this dessert was the meyer lemon curd because it brought moisture and pucker to what could have been a cake a smidge on the dry side....the cream cheese ice cream was my husband's fave and the honeycomb was a lovely addition. 
2. Burnt honey ice cream.  My husband ordered this and it was ME who fell in love with it. The salt on top made me want more and more.  I loved the sweet/seemingly caramel flavor of the cream, too.....and just when you think you've had enough, the salt kicks in and you crave another nibble. They know what they are doing.

At the conclusion of this meal, my husband pulled out his phone and cancelled the reservations he made at another place for the next night and reserved a table for us at Restaurant R'evolution again.  Soooo if you are interested in knowing what we had for meal deux, I'm happy to send it your way. It was charcuterie night!  I'll add the picture as a tease.....

Recommend getting the redfish! My sister who's not keen on fish loves it! The skin was perfectly crispy and the vegetables are great too!

The lobster was good, but we are not fans for the gnudi.

The chargrilled oysters are great!! Recommend this a lot for appetizers. The seafood gumbo is ok, but they're kind enough to split it for you!!

Get the chocolate gateau for dessert!!! It's so worth it best one I've tried so far even though I'm not a huge fan of chocolate mousse

The private room was amazing with the absolute best service from Rory and Travis! The food was outstanding and dessert was even better! The ice cream is to die for! Thanks so much for the best experience!

RR has quickly become my favorite classy Nola celebratory restaurant! The service was impeccable, Kevin the Captain and our server Catie was fantastic!!!! Everything we ordered was delicious, I'll definitely be coming back for more!

The best service I've had at a restaurant ever! Made our trip. The 2 gentlemen that were servicing the middle room the night of 9/25 - they deserve a raise. Seafood gumbo was amazing, the redfish was phenomenal and I tried the steak which was out of this world. The chess pie also completely wowed us. This is what we expect from fine dining. Nailed it.

Fantastic service and food. As soon as our wine or water was close to being low the waiter (forget his name) jumped to fill our glasses. 

Gumbo with the stuffed quail was out of this world. 10/10. Can't go wrong with a good steak either. Finished it up with the corn bread pie. Loved everything about this.
AMAZING experience! Professional people with amazing service. Yes it's pricy and it should be! Their work and food is a combination of art, science and passion

business.name: Santa Barbara Shellfish Company
business.categories: Live/Raw Food, Restaurants, Seafood, Beer Bar, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Bars, Food, Nightlife

reviews.text: On our way back home from Big Sur we stopped by this place for a late lunch.  We had the kumamoto oysters, uni shooter, clam chowder, lobster and scallop & shrimp linguini.  Everything tasted good and fresh! We went there on a weekday close to 3PM so there was no line, but I can understand how this place gets busy on peak hours and weekends!  They serve fresh quality seafood!

Location is unique. Worth it. 

Food was good. With it. 

our server was Emma. EXCELLENT!!! Ask for her by name!!!

The location is perfect. One cannot argue with a beachfront view. 
Service was fast.
Taste and cost do not match. 
I ordered a two pound dungeoness crab for 85.90 , no tax and tip. Fine, I was by the beach front. Ok, I get it. Now, let us taste it: Crab was over boiled. No special or secret sauce to make it more chichi to justify the cost . Just 2 onion rings , a wedge of lemon , lime and about 5-10ml of lemon butter. How basic can you get?
Please get a little bit creative.
So I looked at the lobster roll, the bread was not hot which is how it was supposed to be to complement the cold lobster. Now,  this gets more disappointing, the lobster meat looked mashed or ground and dry . It tasted like imitation crab and it tasted like it has been refrigerated for 3-5 days. There are No lumps or chunks. This is $32.95. How can you do this to the lobster roll? I wish they could have focused on the lobster roll rather than add the coleslaw and onion ring to it.I could order a separate coleslaw and onion ring if I wanted them. I could have a tuna sub and pass it as a lobster roll in this place. 
Now, I asked for sea urchin. This is the saddest part. They ran out.
I ordered coffee. Make that 2 please. I can call it a day.

I think I paid more for the real estate than the food.
Location, location, location. 
I think my hubby should stop following the food blogger.
I would rather follow the yelp reviewers.

Tried to come here one night around 8 and they told me they were closed, yet the hours say they're open till 9. This was on a Thursday night. So a few days later we stop by for lunch and got the calamari sandwich, onion rings, oysters and lobster roll. 
The oysters and onion rings were the only things that were good. Lobster, was tasty, but bread was dry and a little hard. Calamari sandwich was ok, but nothing special. I have a place I go to in San Jose that has a calamari sandwich 10x better than theirs. This was my first impression of this place and I was very unimpressed unfortunately. I'm not a food snob, but the items we orders were nothing special. If I ever go back, I would probably just order the clam chowder.

Fresh seafood!! It's been a while I haven't had the best seafood when I first came here in the states from philippines, however this place just amazed my palate! The rock crab was amazing! The prices wouldn't matter anymore once you dig in.  Would definitely come back! Worth the 3hrs drive from my place.

This place has delicious fried calamari, bay point oysters, and clam chowder. I'm sure their live uni is also bomb, but the say we visited, there was no fresh catch. The service is really up to par, polite lads, and the wait wasn't too bad for an NYE weekend. I can't wait to go back here.

Amazingly uninspired and tasteless cuisine.  Basic and flavorless for the most part but it doesn't prevent them from indulging in financial rape.... Must be the SB Pier setting and tourist opportunities. We tried the calamari sandwich (ok), garlic oysters (say what? And why?).... The accompanying onion rings were devoid of taste and drilling with grease. Seagulls seem to like the place though....

We are tourists in Santa Barbara, and I think this spot is the perfect place to end the day here, especially if you like sea food.  

I got the lobster roll, which was my very first one and it was delicious. It was sweet and buttery, and packed with lobster.  The side was coleslaw and onion rings, and the coleslaw was great.

My wife got the clam chowder bread bowl. She liked it as well. Creamy and pairs very well with the bread.

The third dish we got was fried oysters and it was better than I expected. Usually I don't tend to like fried oysters but this one tasted fresh and delicious.  

Overall we paid about $75 without tip. Definitely worth it. The view itself at the end of the day is priceless.

I never leave a Yelp review but I'm going to leave one here. We ordered the Dungeness Crab and asked them to leave the guts in, which we expected to be sweet, we're COMPLETELY bitter. Thinking it was the hand sanitizer we had just put on our hands, I went to wash it. came back and it was still very bitter. We then tried to the meat and it was also bitter! If we would've known that bitterness means that the crab had spoiled. 2 hours later after we ate, I felt very nauseous, dizzy, bloated, and ended up vomiting. Basically, it wasn't until my friend told me that bitter meat was spoiled. 

However the uni was really tasty and fresh. 

We heard good things from this place, and if it wasn't for the crab, I would have such a good experience. But because of that I'm traumatized.

I love to come to the Shellfish Company for lunch on a cold stormy day in winter and eat oysters . The location cant be beat, the very edge of the continent looking out to sea or back at the mountains. Live uni, crab, and lobster in tanks inside, a loud fun environment inside with a bar to sit at and watch the cook preparing the fish. I enjoy the clam chowder, quite filling and creamy, and the oysters are fresh , as is all the shellfish. Im not crazy about the way they put lemon and lime on something silky and sweet like uni and always ask for it without. Arrive early
for a good seat!

We drove down the pier and got a nice parking spot right in front of the restaurant. The first 90 minutes are free to park at the pier. We showed up a few minutes before they opened and there was a small line formed. When they opened, they let everyone just sit anywhere we wanted. It was cold the day we went and opted to enjoy the view and seafood from sitting indoors.

The clam chowder and uni shooter were really good. I would come back again for that. Kind of disappointed the lobster and that scallop uni lime dish didn't taste as good as expected. Husband had the oyster shooter and said the marinara taste takes over so you don't even taste much of the oyster. 

By the time we were finishing eating, it was a full house and about 3 parties waiting outside. Service was quick and staff is very attentive.
There wasn't anything bad per say, but the oysters were just lacking in volume for the price we paid. The uni was fresh and tasty though!

Absolutely amazing. We had to wait about 10 min for outdoor seating but it was so worth it! Dog-friendly patio is also a major plus. 

Highly recommend!

I don't give out 1 star reviews often, and this is only for one item for takeout, but the Uni was insanely expensive and not good at all. All I could taste was seawater. They didn't clean it at all. They just literally threw it in a box, it was so lazily done.
Great views great food beautiful setting. A bit rustic but don't let that fool you.  This isn't a tourist diner.  It's a Michelin star waiting to happen.

The lobster bisque that we had at this restaurant was SOOOO GOOD. I would love this soup every time that it's cold outside. The soup was seasoned really well with a nice portion and lumps of crab or lobster in it (I can't remember which one). Our servers was super nice and efficient. 

The only downside is that they don't have heat in the restaurant so it was really cold while we ate and had to leave our coats on inside because the front doors were open.

We were about 4th in line but the wait was only about 15 minutes. Very friendly staff! My boyfriend and I were seated in front of the kitchen. We were able to see how quick and efficient the cooks were. Our food came out very quickly. So delicious! I was actually shocked out at good the food was. Also, for seafood, this place gives a lot of high quality food for an affordable price! Tip these people well! They deserve it!

There's a parking lot in front of the restaurant. The first 90 minutes is free and it was way more than enough time for us to finish the food as well as hanging out and enjoying the view for a bit before leaving. There were alot of people waiting but staff was working hard to make sure everyone was seated promptly. 

We ordered some shrimp and scallops pasta, lobster rolls, freshwater oysters (as it tastes sweeter than other kind of oysters), and the beer. The waitress who took our orders was able to memorize everything that she didn't have to write anything down. It was also very nice of her to come and check in on us many times to make sure we got everything we ordered and that the food was okay. 

The lobster rolls were delicious. Lobsters were fresh, firm and sweet. Pasta tasted a little salty but I think it was because of amount of cheese that we put in. Oysters were my favorite. The juice from it was like so cold and pure. It was almost like you're drinking fresh water from the ocean. Loved everything about this place and would come back whenever we get a chance.
Fresh Santa Barbara Uni, so fresh the spines are still making circles. Delicious. A bit overpriced and definitely be prepared for a wait, but worth a stop if you're in the area.

This place is right at the end of the Stern Wharf, parking is ample, and first 90 minutes is free. There is always a line of people waiting in front of this Popular restaurant either by the to-go window or dine-in line, so you know this place is good! Come early before lunch time during the weekend or after lunch to avoid the crowds. 

The first time I was here, I ordered the clam chowder and dozen blue point oyster. Oysters are very fresh, their clam chowder is Ok. Second time, I brought a friend and we order the Uni, more dozen oyster, and clam linguini. Flavor is wonderful, seafood is super fresh, great location/atmosphere in good weather. Highly recommended!

First time here. We wanted to check it out the last time we were in SB but the wait was long and our time was limited. This time there wasn't much of a wait because of the weather. The food was great! Our server was attentive and accommodating. It had just rained and she put together a few tables and moved over some umbrellas to keep out the rain as much as possible (we sat in their patio). The crab bisque was really good but we enjoyed the shrimp cocktail and baked clams the most. If you don't want to wait for a table inside, there is a take out window to the left of the main entrance so you can get your order and sit in one of the few tables on the wharf. If you're in the area stop by for a bite. My only issue was that they didn't take to go orders over the phone but they must have their reasons.

Awesome place for seafood! So good and service is great for how busy they can get at the end of Stearns Wharf. Fabulous view as well! Love this place and we keep coming back as locals for multiple decades. Happy New Year!

My gf and I planned a trip to Santa Barbara after driving for 40 minutes and we were very underwhelmed. Maybe I'm biased but I've lived on the east coast and had lobster rolls at a much better price and they were far more tastier. Also had the crab cakes and we weren't moved by those either. However, the onion rings and fries were delicious. The service was also friendly and timely.

Grabbed them for takeout on a rainy day when we didn't want to wait in the long queue for a table! Unfortunately they didn't have any uni on that day due to the weather. 

Please note that there is ample parking on the wharf itself. We did not realize this and parked on the main street... quite a walk in the rain. Oops.

Ordered the following:
* Laguna Bay oysters on the half shell (MP was $25): Overpriced for such a simple oyster special but that's okay. Loved the oysters, the mignonette was tasty even without the shallot pieces.
* Cioppino: Thought this one was very reasonably priced - I think it was around $22? SO said it was the best cioppino he'd ever tried. I would have swapped out the bread bowl for one with a little more flavor on its own.
* Lobster roll (MP was $32): SO had a bit of sticker shock. Good lobster roll, appreciated the sense of seasoning and the bread taste. Comes with coleslaw and some onion rings.

Their packaging is handled very well to minimize dripping and prevent sogginess. Cioppino came out in two bowls, bread bowl was in a separate box, even the coleslaw had its own separate container. I'd give this place 3.5 stars but have to round up for Yelp purposes.

My friends and I have been traveling long miles away from where we came from, and this place made it worth our success. We all enjoyed the sweet-smells of our food, and it all tasted like heaven, when we bit into it. We all left happy with full stomachs, all destined to maybe visit this place again. I totally recommend it to many people, this place is worth the wait. 5-star rating from me.

business.name: Buddakan
business.categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Chinese

reviews.text:
Dumplings (chicken soup and pork) were both 
 tasty as was the kobe beef fried rice. I definitely think the food, however, tastes similar to all other Chinese restaurants but it was good and came out quickly. 

I didn't love the seating as our party of two was sat very closely to other couples which is always awkward hearing another tables conversations but I did enjoy being able to take in the unique design of the restaurant from my seat. 

Our waiter was nice, but definitely a tad pushy at times and seemed to want us to keep ordering more food likely to up the check which I didn't love. We were full after the dumplings and rice and did not need any entrees after that but felt pressured to order more. We did end up getting dessert which was some sort of coffee ice cream with hazelnut and chocolate. It was delicious but a very small portion. 

Overall, this place is a nice date night spot but I don't know if it's all it's cracked up to be.

I think Buddakan might be my love language. I went there with my cousins, mom, sister and aunt during covid. We were not able to sit at the same table but we made the best of it. We sat 4 to a table and it was still a vibe. The food was definitely something to write home about. I got the crab fried rice and lamb. I also had lobster egg rolls and that is the definition of love . It's so good that I have no problem ordering take out for lunch shoot even dinner time!

I visited with a party of 5 during the holidays and we ordered about 10 different dishes and shared them all family-style as recommended. Some of our favorites were Szechuan pork dumplings (we ended up ordering more because they were so good) and the crispy calamari salad. Be mindful the dinner portion of the salad is much bigger than you'd imagine. The entrees like crab fried rice, ribs, pecking ducks, and the whole fish were pretty good but not mind blowing. I also wish the tables/seats were a little more spread out. The table we had felt tad a bit small and more appropriate for a party of 4.

Can't speak for the in-dining experience, but take-out was superb! From the ease of ordering over the phone to the customer service at pickup, to the delicious baos, short ribs, bass, etc - we loved everything about Buddakan! Can't wait to go back!

Great restaurant!

I went with the live of my life to celebrate out anniversary, and Buddakan made our night even more special. 

To start, katherine, the waitress was very helpful. She answered all of our questions about food and even suggested some meals and desserts. She took a picture of us at the very end and did a little something for our anniversary (Free drinks and Candle). 


Food:

Dim Sum Sampler. All of them were yummy!! The green one was my least favorite. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it, but the other ones were delicious.

Lobster meal (can't remember the name) had curry in it and was incredible. 

My partner's meal in the picture was good too. 

I also recommend the desert we had. The jam was super tasty. You should probably try the other desserts in the menu as they sounded so good. 

My favorite thing about the restaurant too, was the vibe/ambiance. It's definitely a good spot for a date or a romantic vibe. 

I would definitely recommend.

This place was near perfection. I've been wanting to come here forever and finally came. We we're originally seated way too close to other people and it was a bit cramped but when I let the hostess know they immediately sat us a bit further apart which was very appreciated. The waiter made some solid recommendations on drinks. The Szechuan sour was one of the best bourbon drinks I've had. Tea smoked ribs were fall off the bone and tied for most incredible meat of the night with the medium char grilled aged steak. It was massive. We did the double but could have done a single. Wish it came with potatoes or something, the straws are artsy and good but not an ample side for the steak. We got the Korean beef fried rice and it was amazing. The kimchi was fantastic. Wish the egg had more yolk. The Buddhas Temple was the perfect ending.

TLDR: Overpriced average food and snooty staff that will ignore you if they don't think your party is spending enough (or maybe just if you're less than 30).

We were a party of 6 celebrating my friend's engagement. We all ordered a drink, appetizers, and a couple of us shared multiple appetizers or entrees. The waiter (bald older man) kept trying to push the $60 per person tasting menu on us- which, while it seems amazing, isn't what we were looking for on our medical school student budgets- we wanted nice food, but not quite that pricy.

After we ordered the waiter was clearly irritated we hadn't ordered more and proceeded to ignore our table the remainder of the night. He went and took drink orders and refilled the water at the two large party tables beside us (twice) but ignored us  completely and never refilled our water after we put our order in (probably at least an hour). The previous hour while we'd had drinks and waited for our friend this had not been the case. We would have liked to have order more drinks, but after being ignored for that long decided not to and to just get the check because we were tired of the staff looking down their noses at us. 

In addition to that, the food was far from original in my opinion, and nothing to justify the price point. Sure some of the appetizers were unique, and the duck was delicious, but I don't think they were any better than what I've had at any other Philly dim sum restaurant or Asian fusion restaurants (and was considerably more expensive). I'd save your money and go elsewhere for dim sum, and there are any number of nicer restaurants at this price point that actually care to cater to and be nice to their customers regardless of how much they spend. Won't be back even when I do have more to spend.

Steven Star deserves 7 stars for this joint. I've honestly never been so impressed with vibe, food, service, and experience as I was with Buddakan. While they have been around for many years this was my first experience. We snagged a reservation for 7:45 on a Saturday and we're seated after a small wait, but had a great time at the bar. 

Once we say down, we decided to split all the food. Table of 6 and was told this was a no brainer. Normally not a fan of sharing, but it's the way to go here. 

What we snagged:
-Asian Caesar Salad (WOW. Flavor was amazing)
-Crab Fried Rice 
-General Tso Dumplings (DOPE) 
-Tuna Pizza (Best tuna pizza I've had...ever)
-Wok Cashew Chicken 
-Tea Smoked Spare Ribs (Fall off the bone good)
-Edamame Dumplings 
-Char Grilled Aged Beef (Best dish of the night)
-Shrimp Bao Buns (2nd best dish...close to number 1) 
-Wasabi Mashed 

Honestly, I wish I went here years before. Service was quick, and the experience was over the top. Very pleased with Steven and I'm thankful for his Star effort here. LOL

Outstanding food!! Everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. Isaiah did an excellent job providing us service, very attentive. The restaurant was full, very busy and still everything we ordered came out in timely fashion. My pictures also describe my dishes.

The ambiance is absolutely beautiful! My friend and I ordered lobster spring rolls, lobster fried rice and steak w/ mashed potatoes. The service was quick and the food was delicious. I will definitely return.
It's ok . The cocktail was pretty overly sweet and watered down . The food was like an expensive of Chang's. Super annoying waiter

We came here for our anniversary. Food was good, but as with many Steven Starr restaurants, I found the decor a little gimmicky. My favorite dish  was the calamari salad and edamame dumplings. Service was also good.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB
When I arrived at Buddakan, at 325 Chestnut Street,  The thirteenth Starr Restaurant in my series, I quickly found a seat at the bar where I met my server, Pete. I asked Pete if he could recommend a specialty cocktail to start off with. I told him I had a preference for vodka. Pete made me a Vesper Martini. I wouldn't normally order a Martini, but since it came highly recommended I decided to give it a try ! I looked on the menu for a description, but it was not there..."Oh no" Pete said, "That is MY specialty cocktail"  I later did some research on the drink and found the drink was invented and named by Ian Fleming in the 1953 James Bond novel Casino Royale and made with Vodka, Gin and Kina Lillet. It was very smooth...For starters I ordered, Lobster Egg Rolls, shrimp, Thai basil, chili sauce. again I asked Pete to recommend a wine for my Lobster Egg Rolls... A Chenin Blanc from coastal South Africa was what Pete suggested. . . It was a  bit dry and a worked VERY well with my appetizer ! The two Lobster Egg Rolls were stuffed with an ample amount of lobster and the sauce accompanying them was just as perfect as the wine ! For my entrée (I regret I lost the picture) I ordered, Sweet & Crispy Jumbo Shrimp, citrus-radish salad, candied walnuts. The several large shrimp were beautifully presented down the center of on an oblong plate like the egg rolls with a candied walnut and hot red pepper slice on each side !  I cut all the ingredients in half and had shrimp, pepper and walnut in each bite ! WOW !!! Pete's' wine recommendation for this course was a Sauvignon blanc from Sileni Estates. It was a bit sweeter than the Chenin Blanc and  AGAIN was perfect with my food !!! Kudos to Pete for his vast knowledge and passion for both the menu and the wines...I highly recommend Buddakan, and will be back to explore some more !     https://buddakan.com/?

The atmosphere in here was 10/10 such a great girls night, date night or fun night with friends spot! They have a solid variety on their menu and my absolute favorite were the bao buns! We also enjoyed a delicious lemon chicken and kimchi fried rice which was so flavorful! It's best to order for the table and share - it's more fun that way! Our service was great and we'd certainly be back!

Cool vibe in this place! Asian fusion was a nice change! The server recommended  the preset sharing option from the menu so our group of 8 could experience several things off the menu and it was great! The lobster rice is amazing -- all food and drinks were great!

I had a spectacular dinner tonight at Buddakan. To start, my waiter, Anthony, was a delight. So friendly and personable (even behind a mask). I'm so glad I was seated in his section.

The food was phenomenal. I started with the edamame dumplings, which were so smooth and creamy. They were a little one note for me, but they were still good. The General Tso's dumplings however, were an absolute religious experience. They came out piping hot and I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but the filling is savory with a sweet and tangy broth. I would've liked a proper soup dumpling spoon, but I did fine just putting the whole thing in my mouth. My entree was the char grilled beef, which I actually picked after multiple reviews on here. It was so good. The beef was tender and flavorful, and the shoestring potatoes had a spicy sauce on them that all really blended together well. I didn't eat much of the greens, because they had raw red onion in them. I would've liked to have seen this mentioned on the menu, but it's my own fault for not asking.

For dessert I had the Buddha's Temple. It was fine. It was probably the low point of the meal for me. If you're a big chocolate fan, you'll probably like it more than I did, but it felt like something you can get anywhere. I also had two drinks: the Mindfulness cocktail and the passion fruit lemonade mocktail. I preferred the lemonade, but it might be too sweet for some.

The restaurant is beautiful, though I will caution that it's quite loud. I was there at 5:45 on a Sunday and the music was pumping, which of course, causes everyone to speak loudly. The Buddha in the center is a fun focal point. I also had a fun conversation with one of the managers who told me that all the dumplings are made by hand daily by a woman they call Mama Han(?) who has been with them for 24 years. She estimated that she makes 1,000 dumplings every day. In all: I'd definitely return and if you're going: get the General Tso's Soup dumplings!!

Loves the ambience but it was so loud ,, as the tables started to clear it quite you couldn't even hear the waiter. The food was fresh. Unique entrees to choose from . The Shanghai Lobster was awesome

Dinner with co-workers on a weekday.  The service from start to finish was excellent. The server did a great job describing the day's specials. I chose the chef's creation for the day which included beef medallions mixed with vegetables. The appetizers and "Zen-grilla" were amazing. Everything on the menu looks delish.  Can't wait to return for another dining outing. Simply amazing!

The bartenders here were awesome. My dining pal had an allergy that would honestly annoy most people enough to ignore it and let her spend the rest of the night on the John. I'm comfortable saying this because I love her unconditionally but seriously- what doesn't contain eggs? The bartenders busted out a binder and went above and beyond looking up ingredients and didn't even roll their eyes once. They accommodated her and we're very thorough. The cocktails were awesome. The sea bass was cooked perfectly. Service staff should be tipped handsomely and also paid more than 2.83 hourly. Diners should also be willing to pay more money for food to accommodate the wage hike for this kind of superior service. Well done folks! Thanks for a great night!

Great restaurant but honestly would prob not go here again. I prefer Sampan, Nobu or Nara ya. I literally have no complaints. This is a good restaurant. Just not good for me. Ambience is amazing. Drinks are actually super good.  The service is AMAZING and the food comes out quick and doesn't taste like it was rushed.  Great for large dining parties.

Everything was delicious! By far the best Buddakan location is old city- the crab fried rice is a must along with the spare ribs.

Drinks are delicious, atmosphere is amazing, and service is good. All around, this place is a solid restaurant that I would definitely recommended. Prices are fair because the food is that delicious!

Where do I begin?! 


The ambiance is romantic, chill, and peaceful. The decor is beautiful and makes you feel so good. The lighting is dim but not too dim that you cannot see your food. 

The service was impeccable. I am sad that I did not get the waiter's name but he worked today on the 2nd floor, young man-he was personable, polite, attentive, and well informed. Also the hostess was very welcoming and has positive energy. 

The food was A M A Z I N G! We ordered the spicy shrimp and lobster egg rolls as starters and whoa was it ever so good. I enjoyed every bite. 

Our entrees were Shrimp Lo Mein, Lobster Fried Rice, and Peking Duck and again another hit. 

We also had the donuts for dessert with a side of ice cream. These donuts were ridiculously delicious; I would say dangerously delicious- possibly addictive. 

Long story short Buddakan is a MUST try! I suggest you make a reservation in advance because it is pretty popular. 

It's nice for a dinner date or a small birthday celebration.

Dinner for five on 8/21/21. Overall we really enjoyed the experience. I've eaten here before as well as outposts in NYC, Las Vegas, and Atlantic City. I believe the last two are closed. The food has been consistently good. Think of it as a more refined version of PF Chang's. 

We ordered a lot of food and our leftovers were handed out to homeless folks on the walk back to the hotel. 

For appetizers we had the dim sum platter, spicy shrimp Bao buns, spare ribs, and tuna tartare spring rolls. All were good, but the Bao buns were a home run. For the main course we had the crab fried rice, wasabi filet, wasabi mashed potatoes, sea bass, and the char grilled beef. I'm a huge fan of the wasabi encrusted filet, but honestly thought the char grilled beef was better. All in all, we were happy with the appetizers and entrees. 

For dessert, we had the Buddha's temple and the Creme brûlée. Both were hits. 

All in all, a good meal. The service was super fast, impressive given how busy they were. Will be back in a few years.
We went to Buddakan for my birthday and it did not disappoint. The ambiance is great for a special occasion. Definitely make sure to get the dim sum sampler and beignets!

My roommate and I brought our bfs to the city for a date night. As a last minute decision, we booked a 10 PM reservation for Friday night. 
We got there and got seated right away! I was surprised at how packed it was for 10 pm. Definitely a great night life atmosphere! 
Our waiter was very nice and made sure we had everything we needed.
My boyfriend and I got the dim sum sampler. You need to try it!! We couldn't decide which appetizer to get so decided to do a taste test and they were DELICIOUS! 
The 4 of us got a pitcher to split (I forget the drink name) which was very tasty! However, expensive and only filled us up each with about 1 1/2 glasses.
For entrees I got the pad thai. Holy crap- amazing!!!! It was so good and well worth the price.
My boyfriend, who is an avid steak lover, decided to get the char grilled aged beef. When I tell you he was blown away by this!! He literally talked about it for a week afterwards that's how much he loved it.
Although this place is pricey, it's a beautiful place for a night out.
5 stars for a pretty atmosphere, nice staff, and delicious food!!

business.name: Osteria
business.categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian, Bars, Wine Bars

reviews.text:
came here for restaurant week and was so glad i did! they let you choose any two appetizers, two pastas, and one main for the table, and there's also a dessert at the end. they were super accommodating with my allergy situation and gave me alternatives which i was really lucky about how well they handled it. the interiors are also so pretty. my only complaint is that for a tuesday night their service was very slow. i stood at the host stand for 10 mins before they came to address us and we waited another ten minutes for them to prepare us a table. the restaurant was already quite empty and i saw about 7 waitresses in addition to the host so i don't really understand why this happened.

in terms of food, i really recommend the candele-- best dish of the night. i would say the pork milanese was cooked very well and would be a top recommendation of mine. the francobolli ravioli, charred octopus, and yellowtail crudo were all delicious as well. 

the apple crumble gelato was delicious and fluffy-- highly recommend!

definitely try to get a seat in the outdoor area- it's so pretty!

We had been searching for some good Italian food when visiting Philly, and we found it!! If you want homemade pizza and pasta, this is your spot. We had trouble finding a reservation and were able to find one here for the day before, so it may be easier to get a reservation here compared to other iconic Italian spots but that doesn't mean the food isn't as good by any means.
The garden room is SO beautiful I would highly recommend coming here for a brunch or dinner to celebrate something. 

Heres what we had:

Aperol Spritz and Red Wine- I wasn't a huge fan of this spritz sadly, it was super sweet, but the food made up for it! My boyfriend had red wine and that was really tasty.

Broccolini Caesar to start- this was amazing, I love adding in some veggies to a carb-filled meal

Chicken Liver Rigatoni- do NOT let the chicken liver scare you. This was some of the best pasta I had had in a while, the flavors were amazing!! I am also a huge rigatoni fan so that helped too :)

Proscuito Arugula Pizza- I thought that this was amazing. My boyfriend wasn't as big a fan as me because he doesn't love too many greens on his pizza but I LOVE lots of arugula on my pizza so it was perfect for me!! 

Homemade Gelato- This was AMAZING. So fluffy and flavorful, huge fan!! Our food took a long time to come out (we barely noticed) so our waitress surprised us with this gelato on the house. 

I definitely recommend Osteria!!

I came here for restaurant week (4 courses for $40) and it was amazing. I did not prepare for all the food I was about to eat. You and your guest(s) choose 2 appetizers, 2 pastas, and an entree + chefs dessert. They serve everything family style so the portions were very generous! Every course we ordered was mouth-watering, presentation was nice, and service was attentive. This was a delicious restaurant week and really gives guests the opportunity to explore what the menu has to offer!

Yes, yes, yes! Come here for happy hour or dinner and you will not be disappointed at all! The ambiance and decor is on point, staff extremely professional and attentive, and the food is mind blowing.

A very intimate and romantic setting. I highly recommend dining here.

I came here for restaurant week with 2 other people. $40/person and we were presented with 7 courses to share. Every single dish was incredible! 

We ordered the Charred broccolini Caesar, grilled octopus, Rigatoni, Candele, Chicken al mattone, and budino. Winners were the charred broccolini Caesar and both pasta dishes.

I cannot wait to come back here and try more pasta + pizza! 10/10

Came here on Tuesday for happy hour with my friend. Their happy hour is from 4-6 but we only got to enjoy an hour of it since we got there at 5. They had a decent menu and more importantly, decent prices for happy hour. They have a cute interior with dim lighting for dinner vibes and their outdoor patio is so adorable especially when it's lit up. 

I originally ordered their cocktail of the day, pineapple daiquiri but it was too sweet for me and didn't taste like it had alcohol. I told the waitress and she was kind enough to let me get another drink - red wine, $5! The wine was great and I regret not asking for the name lol FYI, the same glass of red wine is $13 outside happy hour - that's almost 3 glasses! 

We ordered some food as well - also included in their happy hour. We ordered the broccolini and margarita pizza. The broccolini was good but the margarita pizza was great! It had the perfect amount of sauce and their crust was crisp to perfection. They also provided complimentary bread and oil - and bread is amazing as always, especially free bread lol 

Happy hour was located at the bar and the nearby tables - but I don't think they did a good job of spacing tables apart. I felt they were really close to each other and it was pretty crowded for that area given the times we're in. They did comply with the new vaccine mandate and requested to see a copy of my vaccine card (I had a picture on my phone) and also verified it with my Id.
Excellent service. Great food. Cool atmosphere. Wood fire pizzas. Wood fire grill. Pastas from scratch

This is one of my favorite spots around for amazing food and a wonderful experience. The restaurant has a great layout including kitchen view, garden area, and outdoor seating. The menu includes an assortment of northern Italian specialties. We ordered multiple plates from the appetizer, pasta, and protein sections. Everything was superb and the random timing of the arrival of dishes makes it very relax and authentic. Sean, the manager was very nice and checked in with us during the meal. I highly recommend you give Osteria a try. You won't be disappointed.

A dark ambience kind of Italian restaurant. I think I would have enjoyed our experience better if we were not smushed to the wall where the next table was less than one feet away from us.

The food and drinks themselves were great. We ordered two cocktails: 1) Milano coretto and 2) gin cocktail and we liked the gin one a lot. The Milano corretto smells like espresso but once you taste it, it was quite bitter.

For dishes we ordered the squash, the bucatini and the rigatoni as highly recommended by our server. All three were hits. I don't think I could chose quite a favorite although the rigatoni had an aftertaste (probably from the chicken liver) that I think could throw some people off. I think in that case, go for the bucatini.

Our server was very friendly and was quite attentive throughout the whole time. I would definitely go again.

Osteria has one of my favorite happy hours in Fairmount and honestly the city. My favorite is the chicken liver pasta and all of their cocktails I've had have been amazing. The service is also really great and the servers are all incredibly nice and knowledgeable.

Was really looking for a great experience, Osteria did not deliver. I think this place is fine for pizza or a small plate and a glass of wine, but otherwise it's a pass for me.  Lots of small plates for sharing and some had very good flavor.  Anolini, Prosciutto  plate and Mushroom ravioli were all good.  Grilled Broccolini caesar was just cold, chewy broccolini with some cheese... like chewing on shoelaces.  The worst was the prawn entree...horrible and sent back.  Dry, mushy, fishy, awful.  Ordered something different, 20 min later it arrived.  Then they offered to comp dessert which was the right thing to do, and another 20 min as I am trying to leave, that arrived.  Server was apogetic but honestly the food and associated price will probably keep me from returning.

I came here for my birthday tonight and had an absolutely awful experience. I made a reservation for 6:45 and was not seated until 7:10 leaving my party of 8 standing in the doorway for almost 30 minutes without even being acknowledged. After we finally got seated our orders were not taken for another 30 minutes. Our drink orders were put in and we were served our drinks. 10 minutes later the server came over and said he forgot to ask for our ids, someone in my party left their purse at home and therefore did not have their id on them. The server took the drink away after it was already partially gone. By the time our food finally came out most dishes were cold and the "family style" portions looked like a kids meal. I am very disappointed in my experience tonight and will not be coming back.

I had been to this establishment several times over the past two years and was always satisfied with the service as well as the quality of the menu. Unfortunately my recent visit yielded a completely different experience. To start the staff appeared to worn and bedraggled. The seating was haphazard with take it or leave it approach. The pasta had way too much parmesan that smothered the taste and made all the pasta taste the same.
Worst of all was our waiter who clearly was not having a good night and decided to abandon us after we finished the main course. This was topped off by the "bouncer" that acted like he worked for the restaurant. Unfortunately for our table the bouncer stopped to ask how our experience was without introducing himself or engaging in any way. We had to assume he played some roll at the restaurant?  He did not like the candid input received and retuned shortly thereafter with the check. My kind of guy! This is a place to be avoided that treats customers so poorly and hires staff that have no manors or communication skills. Osteria - food is questionable, service is poor and head staffing needs some lessons in basic manors.

Disaster. The service was absurd. Our table was served one drink (the waiter was m.i.a), the food came out all at once, the shrimp were mealy, the 4 dishes of pasta tasted the same. The waiter showed up once (John). AND The new manager (Mike) was the most unprofessional representative of a restaurant I have ever met. The most upsetting part-Both Mike and John were discriminatory towards someone at our table(being dealt with). SO SAD. This restaurant has seriously gone down hill. Don't go.

You never expect to be discriminated against at a fine dining establishment, but Osteria checked that box tonight. The GM (Mike) insisted that our handicapped friend was intoxicated (instead of, you know, handicapped) and effectively asked our table of 6 to leave. No explanation was otherwise given, and we were halfway through an otherwise pleasant dinner. Bad management since the sale. Very sad for what was a good restaurant, but no more. Tonight was a new low for restaurants everywhere.

The food was good but the service was terrible.  It took at least 20 minutes for our server to take our drink order.  Entrees came spread out 15 minutes apart.  This was our first time dining there and definitely our last.  We are understanding of staffing shortages but Osteria needs to limit their reservation.

I really wish I didn't have to give this review, but I did not have a 5-star experience tonight. This was my 3rd visit to Osteria during happy hour. I usually order the cacio de Pepe, broccolini and whatever pizza is on the special. Today I while visiting with two family members, we ordered drinks, 2 cacio de pepe, the apple/endive salad and 1 broccolini. The wine and drinks were great, but the food tasted like a pound of salt was added to every dish. The food  tasted nothing like my two previous visits. We could not finish the pasta or broccolini due to the amount of salt. We did let our server know, but no accommodations were made. 
I'm pretty disappointed since I was beginning to consider Osteria a go-to happy hour spot. I may return again, but I won't be ordering the cacio de Pepe or broccolini again.

This was a last minute reservation for my wife and I on a Friday night. We moved to Fairmount a year ago and have been trying various restaurants as the pandemic restriction permitted. This one was within biking distance of us so we rode over. What an excellent choice! Everything was completely on point. The service, the food, the atmosphere...all exactly as we all hope for every time we click "confirm reservation". Here's a weird mention...the bread pre-meal was dangerously delicious. My wife had to pull it away from me otherwise I wouldn't have eaten anything else. 

I won't belabor this review beyond..."its good, go" because honestly, it feels like I'm gushing now but...well I am.

As a side note, they must be treating their staff well as there were definitely enough of everyone to and all staff seemed pretty relaxed and cheerful.

Came here Friday October 15 for a 7pm reservation.  Seated promptly, by friendly staff.   Was told that there was no substitutions per the chef, and we had to order all at once, we could not order in courses.  We serve also told that the food would come up whenever it was ready, not necessarily at the same time.  This lead to a dish never arriving, we had it removed from the bill. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, but disappeared for extended periods of time, I can only assume overburdened with too many tables, not a lack of skill. The food was good, not "OMG this is awesome" . The service and food at a restaurant that has an average $60-75 per person  cost needs to be better.  I would go back for the perfect Old Fashion the bartenders made.
Very good service. Food was good. Fun atmosphere. Great apps. Entrees mediocre. Would go back.

Osteria was a mostly great experience, I'd certainly recommend to others and go again myself. The menu is designed for every dish to be shared with the table, and they recommend placing your entire order at once and enjoy receiving dishes as they're prepared. We personally were hoping for a bit more of an introduction to the menu, seeing as how it's largely in Italian some additional guidance and recommendations would have been helpful. The bread service was fresh focaccia and was amazing, definitely got us excited about everything else coming our way. I was most excited about the Francobolli Ravioli, which was a little disappointing; they weren't nearly as filled as I was expecting, and could have used a good bit more goat cheese to balance out the sweetness of the corn. The Salumi Misti was fantastic, along with the Flank Steak. The baked ricotta was nice and lemony, though one in my party thought a bit too much that it almost tasted artificial. The ricotta came with more focaccia, this time grilled and still as delicious. We were far too full for desserts but all the gelatos sounded fantastic.

My wife and I dined here and were blown away. Our server John was awesome! Very friendly and made us feel at home immediately. He gave a great intro to the menu and all the food/drinks were on time and tasted great! We will be back. Thanks John!

Came for happy hour, had a great experience! Service was great, food was good, and drinks were great as well! Happy hour is served only at the bar and in these couch/armchair setups (that basically each seat 2) that I think were called the "lounge" area. We sat at the couches and had a great time.

Had the daily cocktail which was vodka-based, and enjoyed it. 
Chicken Liver Rigatoni - Quite salty. (and I normally like salty foods, but this was too much) Flavor was good but I had to drink a lot of water to get through it.
White pizza - Never had white pizza before but it was great! Would recommend. 
Scamorza alla piastra - mozzarella +honey on sourdough. This was pretty incredible... especially the honey. 
The free bread was also amazing!! Would definitely recommend the happy hour experience :)

fire happy hour. $5-6 wines/cocktails and nice amounts of pasta for 8$? good seasonal pizza too (squash white pizza for us). it's only offered in the lounge, which is really just like 2 ikea strandmon chairs in the back, or the bar so you do need to navigate eating from a table thats at like knee level.

food actually tastes good, and you're getting a good amount of it. prices are definitely affordable. highly rec for happy hour.

ALSO they start you off with a bunch of free foccacia which is great if you come starving.

I am very sad to say I did not have the best experience here...I went with a friend for dinner on a Friday and to start this all off the restaurant is stunning. I was blown away by how beautiful it was and was so excited to try it. Overall the Restaurant is overpriced for the quality that they give you for example we started off with drinks and I got the Lazzi and when the drink came out it was not even half of the glass full it was about 1/4 of the glass full it was supposed to be frozen but it was almost mushy because most of the ice was melted when it got to me and for $13 it was definitely not worth it. Next we got the Margherita pizza the bottom was completely burnt and black I didn't even finish one slice since the burnt part overwhelmed the full taste and my friend had two slices and we didn't take the rest home. Finally I got the Bucatini Pasta because I asked our waiter for a recommendation and my friends got the same and the pasta was raw and hard and I thought it was just a mistake on just my dish but my friend had the same experience and ultimately we ended up not even eating half of ours. To ultimately pay over $50 each and not even eat half of the things that we were given is really disappointing and although the service was nice and the restaurant itself is beautiful I don't believe that I will be returning.

I'd like to share my experience this evening, which was deeply disappointing. We came to Osteria to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary and we're disappointed by the horrible service. I made our reservation 1.5 weeks ago. I confirmed it on the phone and reminded the individual I spoke with of our anniversary. Upon entering the restaurant there was no greeting, no happy anniversary, which I didn't think anything of until we we're led to our table outside. This table seemed like in afterthought. It was outside right by the entrance gate, not in the greenhouse or in the true outdoor dining area. It was loud and smelled like diesel exhaust from all the cars going by. The view was of Broad Street.
I asked Grace, the host who led us to our table, to take our photo because it was out anniversary. She begrudgingly agreed, took a few awful photos that she put no effort into, and didn't even have the politeness to say happy anniversary or enjoy your meal. We then requested to sit in the green room, with all the other happy, comfortably seated diners but instead, were led inside. We ordered four pastas, the baked ricotta, a cocktail, and a glass of prosecco. The prosecco and cocktail took 20+ minutes to arrive. I didn't drank one sip and it was room temperature. I did not take another. I voiced my concerns to TJ that this was our anniversary and I was expecting a different experience and he was unapologetic. In fact, rather than use this as an opportunity to improve our experience, he did the opposite. TJ did not check on us once during our meal. He did not bring clean plates or silverware. Another server took pity on us and brought us clean plates for our pastas. The pastas were not timed properly. They all arrived within 5 minutes. While the fazzoletti and the ravioli were delicious, good food is only fully enjoyed by good ambiance and service. Grace and TJ need further instruction and training on customer service.
1) Grace was unfriendly, unwelcoming, and sat us at a horrible table that was very noisy due to sitting in front of traffic. Not the romantic setting for our anniversary we had hoped for.
2) We asked to be seated in the green room, where there were empty tables, and were denied
3) Our server, TJ, did not check on us ONCE during our entire meal. He picked up a plate and when we called to him he did hear or pretended not to hear. We had to ask multiple times for clean plates for dinner after our antipasti.
4) When I communicated that we were disappointed with the seating and the experience to TJ, he did nothing to improve it... nor did he apologize.
5) It took 20+ minutes to receive our drinks - my prosecco was room temperature.
6) We were there for a special occasion, not once was it acknowledged. There was a mind-blowing lack of customer service.
7) The four pastas were timed so that they all arrived within a few minutes- they didn't even fit on the table.

The food was good, but the service was despicable.  I wish we had gone to WM Mulherins instead.  Better food and better service.

business.name: Kayne Prime
business.categories: Restaurants, Steakhouses

reviews.text: We were absolutely blown away by our time at Kayne Prime. The food was amazing, drinks were great and service was awesome! Highly recommend taking time to enjoy a meal here. We will definitely be back!

Best food of my life. Best meal of my life. Have never and will never have a meal this good. The bacon, the kale, the filet, the salmon, the broccoli, the potato gratin, and COMPLIMENTARY SEA SALT-GHEE BREAD that was sent from heaven? You can't top it. I will have my engagement dinner here, rehearsal dinner here, bring every person I know here, crave when I'm pregnant, and I will have them host my farewell dinner one day. I love it. Service was spectacular. Vibes were on point. Lighting was sexy. I will not eat for a week because nothing will taste like the meal I had tonight. This food is what life is about.

We went for dinner last night at Kayne Prime.  I was looking forward to a fine dining steak house.  The vibe was nice, beautiful restaurant with a great view of the downtown Nashville skyline from the bar.  We ordered a drink before getting seated, titos/soda water.  When the bill came it was $11.  Totally reasonable for a cocktail.   After we gave our card, the bill came back to add tip & signature & it was $13.67.  I was shocked that $2.67 added on for taxes, not tip.  My husband verified with the manager that the 25% tax rate was in fact correct.  She said yes it was.  I was surprised that it was so high but no problem,  paid it.  

Our server was very friendly.  We ordered a nice dinner, 2 appetizers (wedge salad & cotton candy bacon).  Both were really good.  We ordered 3 entrees (one 10oz filet cooked medium-plus, one 6 Oz wagyu filet cooked medium rare & one scallops) along with 4 side dishes (creme brulee corn, potato agnolti, roasted broccoli & Mac n cheese).  When the entrees & sides arrived the sides were HOT as expected, the entrees were not even warm.  The medium plus steak was cooked medium rare, the scallops were gritty, cool & tasted rather fishy according to my husband. The creme brulee corn was exactly how I imagined it, too sweet for my liking but the others in my party liked it ok.  The potato agnolti was AMAZING, mac n cheese & broccolini were good as well.  The steak toppings were additional costs so we ordered a trio for $10 (chimichurri, truffle butter & truffle bernaiase).  The steaks were so NOT hot that the truffle butter never melted on the steaks.  The chimichurri sauce was delicious. 

The manager that came & spoke to my husband in the bar explained about the taxes & was super friendly.  Even said sorry about the confusion, I will send an appetizer to your table on me.  In a fine dining establishment,  I wouldn't think that I would have to "remind" management of their comment so waited to see if the bill reflected her offer, it didn't.   But I'm not one to complain or bicker about $20 but it was just the principal. My overall experience was one that I wouldn't return to this place but it is beautiful & a nice romantic place to try.
Ill never get sick of this place! Excellence service as always. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Love Kayne Prime! Steaks are always great and the service is phenomenal. Someday I'm going to try the bone marrow appetizer. It looks rich and creamy!

Was looking to come here to celebrate my boyfriend's job offer on short notice, but couldn't get last minute reservations. We showed up around when they opened & got seated at the bar. I was a little hesitant to drop so much here while not even having a table, but our experience at the bar was simply amazing -- not loud & partyish at all & the view was great. I also really appreciated that our bartender properly set our places, so it really was like a full dinner experience. 

We ordered the 10 oz wagyu filet, macaroni grantine, Brussels sprouts, & brûléed corn, plus each got a glass of Malbec. The wine was chilled perfectly (many places don't properly chill reds!). A little after we ordered, the kitchen brought out complimentary amuse-bouche of compressed honeydew & prosciutto for us, so again it felt like we were getting the same dinner experience as those in the dining room. The kitchen perfectly timed all the food to come at the same time, and brought us their complimentary popovers as well. 

I really cannot emphasize enough how perfect the food was here. The wagyu was perfectly cooked & tender, the Brussels sprouts had truffle oil, the mac was perfectly creamy & crunchy. I was blown away by the flavors & textures of the corn -- it's jalapeño creamed corn with a brûléed top, so the sweetness perfectly offsets the spice & the cream goes well with the sharp sugar topping. Their popovers are also incredible. 

We even shared a steak & it was still quite expensive, but on the other hand we could only finish about half of each side & took the rest home. I highly recommend Kayne Prime for a special occasion as they made us feel special even when we couldn't get a table in the dining room. I'll be back!

My wife and I had Friday night reservations in early December. We sat at the bar before dinner to have some cocktails. Kyle was awesome and got us started off right. Dinner was EXCELLENT. The bone marrow appetizer was mind blowing. I could've just kept ordering it. The potatoes aligot appetizer was all I hoped it would be as well. Our server was great, the meal was top notch, and we visited the bar one more time for hand crafted excellence and some recommendations before we headed into the Gulch for more libations. If I find myself in Nashville again, I will be paying another visit.
Service was not impressive. The presentation did not live up to expectation. The food was ok. I do not recommend.

Here it is. The best meal Star to Finish I have ever had. Never thought I could say it. Been blessed to travel the globe. Nashville!  Unbelievable!  Shiitake pepper appetizer, Wagyu fillet to Banana bread and Mascarpone ice cream. Staff was incredible!  What an unbelievable experience!

I celebrated my 40th Birthday at Kanye Prime. Traveling in from KY and my guest from Florida I started the planning process in early September and after reviewing several reviews selected Kanye Prime as the venue of choice for a formal dinner party of 10. I contacted the restaurant and received an almost immediate response back from the event manager (Kelly) who was FANTASTIC to work with. We went through private room options, menus, and ultimately I secured a reservation with the venue. During the months that led up to my reservation, Kelly and I kept in constant touch and I felt reassured my bday dinner would be perfect and it was! Thank you Kanye Prime for a first class and Amazing experience. Oh... the food was FANTASTIC! Yes you all want to know about the food! Everything including dessert was phenomenal!

One of the beat steakhouses I have ever been to.  The starters were phenomenal, highly recommend the bacon with Cotton Candy and the lobster with popcorn.  The flavors and contrasting tastes made them both a crowd favorite.  Grant our server was amazing and very attentive.  There was a mishap wirh one of the steaks, but Heather the manager was quick to respond and rectified the situation very generously.  I will definitely go back next time I am in Nashbille and highly recommend for not only he food, but the staff and armosphere alao.

Very good meal, but loses a star because the food didn't live up to the price. Appealing but loud dining room. Sides were very good (root vegetables). Steak was good, but not what you'd hope for given the price. Enjoyed the meal but probably won't return.
We had a wonderful dinner celebrating our anniversary. The staff went out of their way to make our evening very enjoyable.

My favorite steak house in the world!  Our party of four entered the dramatic foyer and were promptly escorted to our reserved table.  The Waygu steaks were perfectly mediumly rare, prepared sous vide.  The salmon was also perfect and served with caviar garnish.  Service was warm and professional -- and delivered via a team.  This is a locally owned restaurant and far exceeded any chain in which we've dined around the country.  Highest recommendation.
Impeccable service by Liam and Thomas. The food is perfection.  It's a beautiful space and away from the touristy noise.

Came here for a birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. Food was cooked perfectly! Tons of flavor and tenderness. Drink selection was fantastic and everything on the menu was excellent. Highly recommended

Pretty pricey experience but the steaks were awesome and the service was good and attentive.  14oz NY Strip quite possibly the best I've ever had (and I eat at a lot of great prime chop houses).   My wife had the fillet and it was top notch.  The popovers are a treat.   Again, a bit pricey but if you love good steak you won't be disappointed there.

Well located with valet parking. Greeted and seated on time for our  reservation of a six top. FYI, gratuities are added for tables of 7+. Large footprint with extensive available seating. Several sub bars are available with adjacent meeting areas. Two rehearsal dinners and a 20+ bachelor dinner were all running concurrently. They are somehow well staffed during these trying times. With the separate areas the noise level was comfortable.
Zoe greeted us , got waters, asked for special occasions and maintained our table through our meal. Mathew our waiter took our drink orders and checked on food allergies
We shared the popcorn buttered lobster, cheese plate and bone marrow canoes, all very tasty.
We had a cross section of the menu steaks which are extensive. Both Wagu and prime, the strip steak progression and filets. They hit the temp on 6/7. My Wagu ribeye was way over. The manager expedited a new one literally within minutes and waited while I checked the new one. Great manager!  
The sides are all shareable. We shared the mushrooms, crepe brûlée corn and potatoes. Classic popovers we're delicious
The wine list is varied both in selection and price. It's not an encyclopedia like most steak houses.
We shared crime brûlée and cc cookies/milk.
High price point but matching high quality service and products.

Highly recommend 

Slainte

Enjoyed visit to Kayne Prime on a business dinner.  I think their unique items are lobster popcorn and bacon with cotton candy as appetizers.  But, I enjoyed most their sea food tower.  Wonderful large prawns are on the tower.  Only addition they could use is side of melted butter for lobster.  For sides we had the kale salad, iceberg salad, tater tots, au gratin potatoes, and mixed veg. The kale salad, au gratin potatoes and tater tots were wonderful!! I ordered the 6oz Filet Mignon done medium.  It was good, but a little more on the medium well side.  The ambiance was great and the restaurant is much larger than it seems from the outside with multiple rooms. Valet parking is available too.

We came to Kayne Prime for the first time back in June and it was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. The service was great throughout the meal and everyone was very friendly and helpful. We started out with a cocktail and bourbon to pair with the lobster popcorn, which was so indulgent and absolutely delicious. The staff noticed how hungry we were and they brought out popovers early for us. They were so buttery and fluffy and we could eat them everyday (but you really shouldn't!). We both got bone-in ribeyes for our entree along with a variety of delicious set of sauces (bone marrow, horseradish, and blue cheese). The steaks were cooked perfectly and were one of the best steaks we've ever had. We finished our meal with an espresso martini and sambuca, both of which were delicious, and the key lime pie, which was almost as good as the steaks. 

This is such a wonderful restaurant and it's now our go-to for any important event. Make sure you get your reservation way ahead of time though as it can be backed up as much as a month. Enjoy your meal here!

This place was amazing.  From the maple cotton candy bacon to the filet, everything was delicious.  The steak was possibly the best steak I've ever eaten.   I will absolutely be back next time I'm in Nashville.

I was disappointed. I was under the impression it was a high-end steakhouse. Nothing was over-the-top, the food was good, the atmosphere was OK, the service was OK. I guess I thought it was going to be more like Jeff Ruby's.  The only thing we really enjoyed was the tuna appetizer. There are better places in Nashville.

This is my favorite go-to spot for an all around incredible meal in Nashville! Kayne Prime is an upscale steak house worth every penny. It's a fairly large restaurant but feels intimate with soft lighting and dark, cozy interiors. I almost always start with the tuna appetizer b/c it's so unique and delicious. It's presented as a brick of sushi rice topped with sushi grade tuna and jalapeños, then spritzed table side with a smoky soy sauce made in house. The Caesar salad is also great with a yummy Worcestershire sauce made in house. I usually have the 6oz prime filet and it literally melts in your mouth. Best steak ever! In the past, I always ordered the Potato Aligot b/c they are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had and couldn't eat at Kayne Prime without ordering these. One night they sent out the Potato Gratin by mistake. I've never been a big fan of potatoes at gratin but these are out of this world. I have ordered them every time since and they've taken the place of the potato Aligot. The banana bread is one of their classic desserts and never disappoints. The service is as good as the food which is hard to find these days. I can't say enough about this place. It's a wonderful way to treat yourself.

In town visiting from California. Had a late reservation for 9:30pm with my Mom. We were seated quickly and greeted by Patrick our server. Overall this place was great. Atmosphere was clean and crisp. The service was good, the drinks were strong and the food was amazing. I only deducted 1 star since we waited a little while for the food to come out. However, Patrick did pack it us up some amazing chocolate chip cookies to make up for it! If you're in town definitely check this place out. I recommend the popcorn lobster, wagyu filet mignon and the cream corn brûlée. Enjoy!

We took out of town family here for a nice meal. I liked everything the server was great ambiance was very nice and food was decent. Just kinda eh. The cotton Candy bacon appetizer was just squares of fat with cotton Candy on it. I was kinda grossed out. We got almost every side on the menu the brûlée creamed corn was so good everything else was ok. My old fashioned drinks were good but such a small drink for the price. Like, very small. Steak was eh. Very burnt on the outside and just eh. Expected more since the bill was over $500 but it was a nice night. We probably won't go back, too many other places to explore in Nashville.

business.name: Front Street Cafe
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Cafes, American (New), Cocktail Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegan, Bars, Nightlife, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Beer Gardens

reviews.text: While the food is generally pretty decent, the service is absolutely horrible at the bar. Awful. How insulting coming from a service background, and being treated the way we were today.
Very cute restaurant! Tasty food options at a good price. They have great brunch and lunch options. A fun spot to visit in Fishtown.

Everything we had here was so freaking good!! I ordered the eggs Benedict and you would never know that the hollandaise is vegan!! The ambience was great and our server was super nice! This place had been on my list for so long and I wish I had gone sooner
Great food and even better service. Forget the rest and come to Front Street for the best.

Oh the drinks start you off just right. If you get there around 1130a you will have both breakfast and lunch options available. Servers are COVID compliant, and they have a whole outdoor area. Setting up for a party! Parking is tight and it's right under the El. I had the chicken sandwich topped with bacon and the fries were perfect. I ate everyone else's fries too! I was starving. My cuz got the frittata and she loved it. Her first time having one. She said it was light and fluffy. Chicken tenders also consumed by our party. Big, juicy and crispy. Then there is the chicken breakfast skillet (?) well seasoned and definitely something you made as a kid when bits of this and that were in the fridge. I would return again

This was one of our favorite brunches in the city and we've been to far too many to count. The ambiance is absolute fire. It's industrial while still being cozy. It keeps with the NL vibe of classy but laid back. 

The food was phenomenal and unique without being weird. I had mushroom bacon as a side dish for example. It was delicious, tasted nothing like bacon, but had a great fun flavor. We had a pumpkin whole grain hot cake which was incredible and my husband had a twist on a Benedict. 

Everything top to bottom was delicious and we will absolutely return soon.

Great brunch spot!  Made a reservation online one Sunday morning, arrived early and they were able to accommodate my party.  Service was prompt and the food was good.  Must try item:  Maple & Cracked Pepper Mushroom Bacon. You will not be disappointed.

It must be quite an experience for me to write a review. Front st cafe has the honor to be my first review. Unfortunately it is negative. No issues with food, I've experienced about half the menu from my dine-ins and everything was great. My issue comes from staffing. Bar staff is great and waiters are wonderful, it's the host staff and manager that have awful demeanors. We had a group of six come in and order takeout and the hostess (Allie/Ally) attending was giving remarks and side eyes as we sat at a table to wait. She had then sat a table where we were and told us to wait outside. (Keep in mind this is November and the temperature is 50-60 f with wind chill). We got our food and contacted the manager for an explanation as to why the hostess was so callous.
