The manager (Tim) notified us that we could have waited in the room upstairs for our food which was not told to us by any staff. Throughout the call Tim was disinterested and even chuckling at our concerns and said there was nothing he could do besides talk to the hosting staff. That is great, however I doubt a disinterested manager could change an unprofessional hostess. Regardless, the food is superb but the staff could use further training on professionalism.

Great ambiance snd menu. Will definitely come back

On arrival you can park on the street but half s block down there is a parking lot that you can pay $5 for 3 hours (as of 2021). Totally worth it to not stress about your car.

Restaurant has a relaxed and hip decor. Has some seats on sidewalk. We sat out back. It was a large are under a tent. Really quite lush. I was totally surprised!! We had advanced reservations on a Friday for lunch and it was busy but seats still available.

When sat we were told they automatically add 20% tip and there is a 90 minute max. Since it wasn't busy at 2pm and we were drinking steadily they didn't seem to care about the max time. If it was busy I'm sure they would do they could seat more guests.

Menu has lots of great healthy options and plenty that aren't. Breakfast served until 3 pm too! I had the berry salad with chicken and shared chicken strips with my friends. Another friend had a burger that she devoured. The other person had a salad, Caesar with a poached egg. She finished her plate.

The chicken strips were definitely shareable. Probably 5 -6 giant strips. Came with 3 delicious dipping sauces. I loved the mustard. My salad was huge!! I couldn't finish it. The protein cooked well. One note that it was really covered in dressing. Perhaps ask for it on the side and add it yourself. 

Beverage list was good too!

I went to Front Street Cafe last night with my family. They require face masks, no problem, but the kitchen staff are without face masks or beard covers. I know because they sat us in the booth right in front of the kitchen. The food was just okay (not worth the money we spent) and the service was below average which is disappointing considering they add 20% gratuity to the bill for in house dining. At least if you are adding gratuity make sure your kitchen is implementing the same safety protocols you hold your customers to and the servers are providing average service.

My go-to spot! Delicious food with great vibes. I had the pleasure of sitting down with the owner, Andrew Petruzelli for an interview. Check it out below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vwb6B8ned2k&t=8s

Was super excited to come here because of so many celiac friendly options. I rarely get to eat any fried food and I was told they had a dedicated fryer. I even double checked with our waitress when I arrived and told her of my celiac. I had the fried cauliflower app, the chicken sticks and the Mac n cheese and a couple of the draft ciders. All I know is that I've been super sick since that dinner and I don't think it's as gluten free as they say it is, either that or someone in the kitchen slipped up. I took home leftovers and ate them two days later and immediately after eating the chicken i was sick again. Celiac folks beware- eat here at your own risk. I was sick all night after the dinner ( thought maybe I had too many ciders) but after eating leftovers two days later and immediately having a reaction I'm gonna say it's the food. I leave three stars because the other four people in the party loved their food and we loved the outdoor  patio and the bartender was really sweet. Also - $10.50 for a 12oz can of Aurochs Hazy IPA??  That's celiac tax and completely awful. I don't like places that tax the hell out of you for being gluten free.

Average to above average food. Fries are good, burger undercooked but still good. Average to below average service. Bartender was slow and incompetent. That seems to be the standard in fishtown and no libs places. It's cool to be slow and bad at your job I guess.

In celebrating my friend and my 20 year friendiversary, we made reservations for a late Sunday brunch.  Since Front Street Cafe was a good half way meeting point. Our reservations were for 3:30pm but we quickly found out that the brunch menu was no longer being served at that time, and the kitchen closed at 4pm.  Wishful thinking on our part I guess.  We were told as we seated that there was also an automatic 20% gratuity and a 90 minute sitting time limit.  Which is fine, and understood due to the times we're in.

Although it was a misty day, we decided to eat in their tent covered outside area.  We ordered drinks from the vast beer menu.  And ordered sandwiches since those were the only options at the time.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich which was really good and the fries were thick and also good.  All in all a great time and the food was pretty good although I look forward to trying their actual brunch menu.
They refuse to fix their Apple Pay machine! Really can't call and have replaced hahaha

Went on a super cute cousin date and it was worth it. One of the best things about this place is that its outdoor seating has the best ambiance but we went on a slightly rainy/overcast day so we stayed indoors which nonetheless did not diminish our experience!

We went last Thursday for late lunch and were treated exceptionally well by our server. He was very attentive but patient with us (even though it took us quite some time to make up our minds and place our other!).

I went with the All-Natural Chicken Sandwich no pickles, add avocado, and a side of fries. Would've have gotten a perfect 10/10 if not for just two small things: the fries being too salty and the cook forgetting to remove the pickles. Still 8/10 is pretty solid! My sandwich was juicy, fulfilling, and surprisingly delicious given that it was not a the typical big deep fried super breaded chicken breast style. Adding the avocado did cost a bit much ($3.50 extra) but it was worth it, that touch of avocado was *chefs kiss*. The fries were made almost too perfection but they were a bit too generous with the salt.

My cousin got the Griddled Cheese with a side of Fries and she was very much satisfied with zero complaints. I did take a bite of her sandwich and I almost wish that I would have went with that option. It was a bit too cheesy for me but the jalapeno-tomato jam was to die for. The slight sweetness complimented the cheese so well so if you are looking for a not so basic grilled cheese I wholeheartedly recommend this! Her fries were also a bit on the salty side too but not even one was left on our plates.

We did not get any drinks besides water so I cannot make any comments/suggestions on any..(water was good but that's hard to mess up)

Overall, FSC had exceptional service, superb ambiance, and conventional dishes with delicious original twists! I wish I could give this place a 4.5 but if we are rounding up then 5 it is.

On a autumn Sunday afternoon, met up with a few friends and had brunch at Front Street Cafe's outdoor area. It's a cute atmosphere and the food was good.

Ordered their sunrise mimosa (that had a dash of tequila); pretty decent. Also, tried their huevos rancheros (requested for my eggs to be scrambled) that was tasty. I never had quinoa in this dish before but it was interesting. The portion size is a bit on the smaller side and wish it had more tortilla.

Our server was nice and accommodating. Would definitely come back.
Called ahead to see if they were open and they said they were. Drove twenty minutes to get there only to be told they were closing in 30 and wouldn't take our order. Not cool.

Horrible customer service.  Hostess treated ua like it was to expensive for us.  Asked if we had a reservation.   there were approcrimately four table in whole resturaunt with guests.   informed us there is a 20% tip added to the bill.  for a group of 2. Then mentioned there was a 90 min sit limit.  I had just gotten off working night shift.  Guest i had wuth me was a vistor and i inly had one more day till she goes home.  Ordered a couple drinks but ended up walking out do to attitude of hostess and server.   Wont be going back

Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time! We went for brunch this weekend and it got pretty busy shortly after. They only allow you to stay for 90 minutes and they tell you this up front, a slow eater WOULD NOT APPRECIATE THAT. Their smoothies and desserts are AMAZINGGGG. Vegan entrees are a hit or miss. The vegan scrapple was flavorful but soggy. Thankfully there are PLENTY OF VEGAN OPTIONS!
Amazing veg, vegan, gf and healthy options. Our serve was also so sweet . I recommend coming for lunch!

The Huevos Rancheros was actually excellent. But the place was a little grimy for a breakfast joint. The server we had was excellent (very attentive) but the hostess could have been friendlier. I'm all about good service. The mushroom scrapple was a good try but it's bad. Not worth it. They have vegan options but not sure they taste good. They add a mandatory 20% gratuity to the check and then ask for more tip when you sign for your card. It's def not a mandatory 20% type place, but hey, it's their rules. I also hope the tip goes to the servers and not the restaurant. This isn't a place I would recommend as a must try but it's not a bad back up.

Price - 7-20 bucks 

Atmosphere: very homey and southern feel! There was no wait and they required mask upon entry.

The service was great and the waiter was nice and attentive.

Food was great! I highly recommend the bacon ans cheese omelet! 

Don't forget to get a cappuccino and add the vanilla chocolate shot ! It was the best coffee ever!

Cute cafe with great coffee and tea!!! The vanilla chocolate latte was like dessert. The masala chai tea was a spice of heaven! The applewood bacon breakfast sandwich was good enough but nothing super special. The service was nice.
The downtown swanky Ness of this café was really nice I enjoyed the out of town service and the hospitality was nice for East Coast Pennsylvania

business.name: Barbuzzo
business.categories: Mediterranean, Restaurants, Pizza, Italian

reviews.text:
I had the pan roasted gnocchi

- Minuscule portion
- High price vs portion
+ Delicious, creamy gnocchi

This is a picture of my take out order. Great food, horrible portions
Man.. i love this place. Their pizza.... their gnocchi.... their drinks must try. One of my favorites. There is nothing negative to say about this place. Im obsessed.

*HIGHLY RECOMMEND*

Barbuzzo is one of my favorite restaurants in Philly. I love the ambiance and the decor of the place. They have this cute little bookshelf corner table that is quite cozy. The food is amazing as well. I have been here a few times and every time, it's always been great. Their menu is decently sized with lots of options at a very good value for the amount that you get. Definitely get their caciocavallo stuffed meatballs, which are two large meatballs stuffed with gooey cheese and tossed in tomato sauce and bread on the side. Also their salted caramel budino is to die for. Their pizzas are pretty good too. Overall very great place for casual or intimate meals 

*VERDICT*
Definitely always saying yes to going here.
A little overpriced in my opinion, but the food is great. I really enjoyed the cocktails as well.

I hesitate before writing, as I don't enjoy writing mediocre reviews of a restaurant I loved.   Before I write about dinner, I will say that we enjoyed an absolutely perfect shrimp sandwich at lunchtime on the day we arrived.    We were really looking forward to dinner at the end of our stay.


We first dined here about 05 years ago and were over the moon with the food, ambiance and service.   We were so looking forward to our final meal of a great 4-day stay at the Philadelphia.   And I have to admit we were disappointed. Our server was excellent--friendly and knowledgeable about the wine we ordered.   However, he had to find a lighter to allow us to read the menus.   We ordered simply but so simply that I can't remember what I ate--tasted OK but was not memorable.  Mostly our dinner was overshadowed by the fact that we had to wait far too long for my husband's venison which, when it came, was sadly overcooked.   This time, it was the food that disappointed. Sorry Barbuzzo.   I hope this was an off night for you. We probably won't eat there again--too afraid of another quite expensive disappointment

We chose Pan Seared Gnocchi & Caciocavallo Stuffed Meatballs  for Friday Evening and on arrival were full of excitement, looking forward to great food and wine in a lovely relaxed setting.   There were 7 of us dining. We selected from the menu at the same time and the dishes arrived at different times, so some of us had almost finished eating by the time others were served.            

Drinks did not arrive at the same time either which was disappointing, and the food was below expectation.   As a result, the overall dining experience was pretty average.

*Delicious Food & Great Service!* 
I was dining alone and was greeted very quickly, sat immediately (I chose the table outside).

I asked for a virgin cocktail from the bar and they brought me a wonderful not too sweet great drink! Pasta was delicious. I wanted to get the braised pork dish but it was no longer on the menu. 

Totally recommended!

The service is super poor! We went there on a normal Tuesday night and they refused to service without any notification on yelp or google map. We wanted to look at the menu and they refused to give us. We were asked out when there were literally only us in the place. Poor organization. Poor service. Won't go there agaaaaaain!

Was expecting a lot when ordering because the reviews made it look so good. Would say the Budino is definitely worth the hype. You know it's good when the bottom layer is a crunch coffee-cookie hybrid. Extremely delicious and custard-y. Lovely dessert! I would also get the Tiramisu next time around. 

The ricotta toast was ok! Yummy, though too salty. I would recommend asking for less salt or not mixing the toppings right away. The dish was definitely creamy though.

Possibly my favorite pizza anywhere:  world class margherita with a perfect leopard-spotted char, super fresh subtly sweet sauce, and the best bufala I ever had.

Very creative & delicious salads.
I always enjoy their wine offerings.
Excellent desserts.
Friendly service.

Can't go wrong at this place! Consistently great service and food. I have tried everything on their starter menu, fantastic. They have the most amazing grilled octopus entree. It is a must for octopus lovers.  I'm obsessed with their French Farmer drink...killer!

Not sure what makes this place "Mediterranean style" other than that it's mostly Italian food. Some of the dishes like the pizza and the gnocchi were on the salty side and my drink was VERY strong and filled to the brim. The dessert menu was cute but nothing special and the tiramisu was very chiffon cake heavy and had less of an espresso taste. Probably will skip on the dessert next time but I would come back for the food!

Stumbled upon Barbuzzo after the original bar that we were supposed to go to was super crowded. The hostess was so nice and even though we were indecisive about staying she did encourage us to stay while recommending other spots as well. Because of her honesty and the diversity of the menu we decided to stay. And I am soooo happy to report that we are glad that we did.

Barbuzzo is a small and intimate spot with several tables on the right hand side and a bar in front of the kitchen and pizza oven--yes a legit real oven! The restaurant was crowded, but we managed to find a four top table in the middle of the restaurant. One part was a bench that I sat at and the other two chairs that my mom and friend sat at. It was a very tight squeeze, but once we got seated it was not bad. 

I could not decide what I wanted! Everything on their menu sounded amazing especially their pizzas. I went with their bronzino because all of the ingredients sounded delicious--especially the pesto and fennel! And wow, this dish, wow, full of flavor, super light, and so yummy! I wanted to keep eating and eating and you will too! The dish is just enough for one without feeling too overwhelming. The filet is seasoned well and is grilled to perfection.

My mom's meatballs did not disappoint either as the mozarella was baked right in the ball and was amazing as well. The meatballs came in a lightly sweet and savory red sauce. This was the same sauce that was on my friends Margherita pizza that she added sausage to. Wow, again so delicious! Worth the wait as the pizzas take longer to cook and come out compared to other entrees. We all dug into the pizza when it did come out, and yes, so good!

Our waitress was nice and gave us some great recommendations. She was attentive as she could be with the restaurant being very full and the space being very small.

Only negative was that it was very cold inside. You definitely needed to dress in layers or continue to wear your coat--my mom did! Hopefully they can put in some space heaters or something to help with this? The warmth from my drink helped a little bit, but we were definitely very cold most of the time.

Definitely worth a visit when you are in Philadelphia!

I have wanted to eat here for years but never made it happen, then Covid. We had matinee tickets to Philadanco for Sunday 12.12.2021. I decided to skip our tradition of going to Tria pre-show and get a brunch reservation at Barbuzzo. I was feeling concerned I might be disappointed with brunch being our first experience. That was a silly concern. Our experience was perfection. Service and cocktails were on point. We started with the Papas Fritas and mixed olives. We also had French Farmers and a Negroni. We ordered the uovo pizza and the shakshuka. My shakshuka was a spicy surprise. It came with the greens on top so when you tucked in you unearthed all the hot, tangy sauce and egg. I loved it so much more than I thought I would. Their shakshuka is chickpeas, garlic greens, baked eggs, butternut squash, roasted fennel, tomato, spicy yogurt, feta, and grilled country bread to sop it up with. Delicious. The uovo smelled intoxicating and my SO raved about it. I don't eat pork so I couldn't take it out for a spin. We sat at the bar after brunch for one more drink to burn through some time before the show. I tried the basil lemonade and did not enjoy. The drink was pretty tart. I could have dealt with that had it any kind of interesting flavor. It did not.

Seriously amazing food!!!!!

Seated right away as we had a reservation.  It was a Saturday night and I wouldn't recommend going without one...we were seated near the host stand and people arriving at 630 without one were told an hour wait.  

Started w sangria which was tasty.  The steak tartare was on point, although I ate it off the grilled bread because I am not used to it being on toast and didn't want to fill up on bread.  

Now for the super star. The tufoli.  

The homemade pasta was to die for.  The pork ragu. The garlic.  The broccoli rabe.  The parmesan.  The portion was a good size for me.  I prefer quality over quantity any day of the week.  I was full but didn't leave stuffed which is how I prefer to leave a meal.  

Service was good. It's not a large place and you could hear other conversations even without trying to eavesdrop, not a downfall just something to note (especially for the couple next to us who were bickering).  

I say go.  And get the pasta.

Have only done take out from Barbuzzo before, but would definitely recommend the whipped ricotta for an appetizer and caramel budino as the dessert. For an entree- you can't go wrong with any of the pizzas. You can't go wrong!

SO GOOD. One of my favorite restaurants in philly so far. The appetizers, mains, and desserts were all amazing.

Appetizers:
1. Charcuterie board - delicious and highly recommend to share with a group; not as big of a fan of the bread that came with it
2. Whipped ricotta - the ricotta and bread were both so good (the bread was soft but toasted so crunch in all the right parts!!)

Uovo pizza is a YES.

Desserts - by then I was too full, but my friend definitely had foodgasm with the tiramisu. I preferred the caramel dessert, but would recommend both!

Manager Kaitlyn, server Rebecca, and especially James went out of their way to serve our party of 7. On the fly they set up an outside table... James valiantly going through 4 different heaters to find a working one (there was already a working one on the other side). Even though we were out of the way every time I needed something Rebecca was already there though I know she had tables inside. They were pleasant and fun. I haven't missed eating out since COVID. This experience reminded me how fun dining out can be. 

Myself and my partner are vegan. At first glance the menu didn't look so friendly, but a quick chat with Rebecca gave us great options and the food (especially the pizza without cheese) was wonderful. 

I really can't recommend this place enough. We have a fun dinner story for years to come.
LOVE this place, it's one of my favorite spots in Philadelphia. You can't go wrong with any fish dish, the meatballs, or really anything here!

This was a cute, charming little Italian restaurant. The restaurant was small, so there was limited seating. My husband and I didn't make reservations, but were lucky enough to find a seat at the bar right away when they opened at 5pm. It is important to note, that even though we got there right when they opened, it was already booming, so if you don't have a reservation, be prepared to wait. The bartenders were great! They were both very friendly and attentive. We got our food and drinks in a timely manner. Looking at the menu, everything sounded very good. Before we ordered, we saw many entrees come out and they were on the smaller size. Since we were hungry, we each ordered a brick-oven pizza. I ordered the simple margherita while my husband ordered the salsiccia. We were both pleased with our choices. The pizza dough was soft and chewy. The sauce was full of flavor and robust. I absolutely loved it. I ate about half which was a LOT of pizza. We had a fridge in our hotel so I was all set for the next morning. We were very full, so we didn't get dessert after eating. I did end up getting the coffee though. It was so good, full bodied and strong. It was a great way to finish the night. Another plus, if you go to the bathroom, you will find cards for the local souvenir shops. They had quality gifts. Also, we had some strong suggestions for places to visit in the area from our bartenders who were super helpful. This is definitely a must try when you are visiting Philly.

My hopes were so high and unfortunately everything just kind of came up short. We showed up early for our reservation and were able to be seated (yay!) but that was the high point. It was a cold night and, for whatever reason, they don't have the front door blocked off, so every time the door opened the first few tables caught a stiff breeze. I ended up keeping my coat on the entire time. Our server seemed distracted/disinterested - hard to tell with the mask on (though I appreciate the mask!). I had two questions about the menu and either he didn't know or didn't care and that was disappointing. No specials. Portions were OK. Our food came out very quickly, so much that it seemed rushed and it was just OK. Overall overwhelming and would have rather spent my money somewhere else.

Mediterranean food is my jam, therefore Barbuzzo is my jam. Everytime I come here I try something new and am NEVER disappointed. Things that stuck out to me were the octopus, meatballs, arancini, and their tonnarelli

Did a pickup order and saw that this place is a cute and dimly lit date spot with drinks!

Anyways, the portions didn't look large but it's definitely filling. The Uovo pizza was pretty darn good. The brussel sprouts surprised me with a bit of bitterness that added to the taste. It was creamy, had bacon, and was friggin good. Nice charred crust, yum.

The dessert was also bomb and it was rich according to my partner but I thought it was soft and light. Mind you I did have a glass of milk on hand.
The budino for dessert is absolutely delicious, love this spot, great inside bar, can't go wrong with their menu

No heat inside. Had my winter coat on the whole meal. The music playing was some top 40 playlist trash. Only one toilet and a ten minute line for it. Me and my dining companion have, combined, 48 years of working in all aspects of food service from bussing and serving to working the line and managing. We are aware that it is supply chain and labor shortage era "you get what you get" right now but this place is just taking advantage and being arrogant about it. Server (Rebecca) told us it was 'family style, so order more than you usually would" (I thought family style meant bigger portions to share, but here it means regular portions just brought out in no planned order?) We ordered a salad, an app and two entrees. She flatly told us we needed to order more food. So we added on a pizza. We both got cocktails and when my friend finished his (a Manhattan-type cocktail) she said "do you want another?" and he said yes, she said 'great, we don't have that one anymore but I'll bring you a ____" and dashed away. (It was hard to get her attention the whole meal and she didn't listen to let alone answer questions.) She brought back a whiskey on the rocks drink that was nothing like what he had agreed to re-order. Whatever. We asked if we could look at the beer list again and she hovered over us for an order (suddenly has a free second) so we just picked two. If there was possible tab-growing she hovered, if we had any additional concerns she completely ignored us. We were still grazing on our entrees and apps  - Nothing special, just carbs and cheese stuff that can be made at home very easily.  Then the (burnt black) pizza came out. This was entirely too much food and I felt mislead by this awful server. we ordered more beers and now had two drinks in front of us and a pizza, and I was still eating one of my entrees when the server zipped by and took it away ignoring me saying "I wasn't done!" We are catching up, taking our time because it was only 7:30 pm on a weeknight, the place wasn't packed, but we wanted to enjoy ourselves and had plenty of food and drink to keep working on in front of us. She came over with dessert menus. We said probably not and she frowned. "We need a minute" I said, meaning, to enjoy our company and eat slow and finish our drinks and get off our damn backs. She appeared a second later with the bill :"I'm just gonna drop this so you guys aren't waiting on me!" WE AREN'T WAITING ON YOU. YOU ARE WAITING ON US. IT IS OUR NIGHT OFF FROM SERVING PEOPLE.  WHO DROPS A CHECK WHEN PEOPLE HAVE ENTREES AND FULL DRINKS IN FRONT OF THEM??? The most time she spent explaining anything to us was when she brought out the to-go container (also, didn't ask for it, she just, I guess, had places to be, or was just cold because it was FREEZING in there) she explained how to open it like we were idiots before my friend joked "oh, I know these containers, don't worry" 
tl/dr: do you like burnt, overpriced food, rude, misleading servers, bad top 40 music, drinks you didn't order, long bathroom lines and eating with your coat on? Never again

business.name: OBON Sushi Bar Ramen
business.categories: Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Japanese, Ramen, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars

reviews.text: Food was tasty but eat it there. I went through Grub hub for delivery. Big mistake. 2 1/2 hours for delivery when food arrived it  was cool to the touch. So much for hot ramen. No utensils or napkins came with food. Like I said food was exactly as specified and tasty, but delivery was bad.

1st time here. Service was excellent. Staff is very friendly! I had the Obon Ramen...spicy miso base with pork belly and enoki mushrooms, maguro sashimi & Uni nigiri. Everything was excellent. But I was disappointed that they only have Maguro tuna. I prefer Otorro. The bartender suggested a black tea old fashioned made with their house made milk tea syrup. Best night cap!

Really enjoyed all of the food here. Specifically though the Cod was perfection, cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. We also tried the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, that was tasty and the rice squares had a great crisp with a pillowy middle . 

Their menu has a great variety of options, from Sushi to Ramen and some nice entree dishes. The drink menu was good too, although I'm not a cocktail connoisseur so it was a bit out of my element. What I did order tasted like straight Gin with a hint of Sake  so if that's your thing then brilliant! 

Ambiance is great, very cozy and calming. Service was good, very friendly, and the food came out at a decent rate. Definitely recommend giving it a try, I'll be back, I can't stop thinking about that Cod...

I was in Tucson for a few days on business, and I wasn't sure what the culinary scene was like. Thank goodness for OBON! It's located in a busyDowntown  neighborhood, so I had to park a few blocks away. Meters were expired by then. Since I was just one person, I was seated immediately. Spoiler alert... I loved this place so much I came here on BOTH my nights in town.

Customer service is one of my favorite parts about OBON. It's strange to say, but everyone is so sweet and thoughtful. Not to mention they remembered me the second time. Each visit I ordered a carafe of hot sake, which is my favorite thing to get at Japanese restaurants.

First I tried the Tonkotsu Ramen, which has pork belly, pork shoulder, egg, bamboo shoots, and red chili oil. Super simple, tasty, and filling. It was just what I needed after a late night flight. The Tataki Maki roll I had the next night was unique. I've never had chimichurri atop sushi before! It was accompanied by shrimp tempura, cucumber, crab mix, seared tuna, tomato, and basil.

Love that OBON is both family-friendly and hip at the same time. I'd love to try more things on the menu, or just get ramen again because it was so good. I didn't know what to expect from Tucson in terms of food and drink, but OBON left such a good impression on me. It'll give me something to look forward to if I'm ever in Tucon for work again!

This place? Chef's kiss for literally everything I consumed. I'm not super into sushi or even traditional ramen for that matter, but I love curry and steamed bun sandwiches. OBON delivered. Our service was on the slower side, but I really didn't mind because the actual courses come put at very appropriate times, so that you don't feel rushed. We comfortably spent about 2 hours here last week. The Bird Bun had a crispy, spicy piece of chicken perfectly balanced by a pickle and kewpie. It was so delightful and just the right size to start a meal with. It paired nicely with this alcoholic Chai drink I ordered (can't remember the name of the drink to save my life), but, the little apple chip for the garnish made me feel like I was a kid, sneakily dipping a snack into an adult's drink. It was a fun touch. And the curry, oh my god, the curry. Now, don't confuse an Indian or Thai curry with Japanese curry because it is very different, but so perfectly warming and salty on a cold night. Can't wait to make another trip here in the near future.

Recently went to Obon on a rainy night. The atmosphere was wonderful and the Ramen doubly so. I asked the server what aas the spiciest ramen they had and they replied the Obon. I ordered their titular Obon ramen which was served with a soft boiled egg, delicious pork, and a flavorful broth.

The server came back to check on the spice level of my dish and when I mentioned I prefer spicier she recommended a spice bomb. Let me tell you that habanero, apple, and other amazing-ness puree is where it is at! It really elevated the ramen and allowed me to make it as spicy as I wanted. I will definitely be back.
Very long waiting and food is super slow. Very disappointed as our first meal in Tucson! Won't recommend it.
Simply delicious! Love their sushi. Drinks are on the stronger side but you MUST try the watermelon sake, fresh, light and taste so good.

I visited this restaurant with a co-worker and I enjoyed the outside atmosphere as well as the food. I had the spring rolls and the veggie rolls, and my co-worker had some type of crispy chicken, which was delicious. If I'm ever back in Tucson I will visit i again.
Great experience at Obon. Delicious food and cocktails. Highly recommend the Pork Bun and Obon Edamame. Nice place for a date.
Beautiful night downtown. Love love love the Miso Cod with Eggplant. And the Red Miso Ramen.

So disappointed after our last visit here. We used eat here often and recently decided to make a special trip to eat here again. Unfortunately, the place seems like its struggling. New menu is not great, service while friendly was pretty bad and the food was terrible (sushi was fishy and the seaweed in the roles was very chewy), drinks were served in strange glassware that was frankly hard to handle. Hope the place can turn things back around, not sure we'll be making another trip to find out though.

The food was outstanding. Great service. Nice menu and patio.  I never had Ramen before.  I cant wait to eat it again.  My husband's sushi was so fresh! The shoshito peppers were scrumptious. I will be returning soon.

My experience was pretty, meh. I arrived first in my small party and was sat promptly. I waiting by myself for 5 minutes as the rest of the party showed up and it was another 10 minutes after that the server finally showed up for the first time. Everyone but me ordered sake and I got green tea. It was about 30 minutes from when I first sat down to when I got my green tea. The sake came way before. The tea was good. I wish he would have mentioned it was a whole pot, I would have split it with my friend but she got her own. 
I got the spring rolls and Jackfruit steam bun to try, both were subpar. The bun was refrigerator cold. I thought it was supposed to be steamed? The spiciness was a nice touch. The spring rolls were deep fried and they were handed to me as "Egg rolls." I thought they'd be fresh and not deep fried, I should have asked. I tried a bite of one, nothing amazing. Just your standard egg roll. The miso is not vegan, I was disappointed I couldn't try it (zero mention of that on the menu). I'm thankful our waiter seemed to know what was and wasn't vegan. Our server was friendly and accommodating.
Too expensive, sashimi way too thick, tempura seemed to only be on end pieces, drinks were weak, better off going to Fuku on university

The Sushi was really good.   We had the ceviche which was a little spicy but so good.   We wish we had the ceviche after the sushi because our mouths were burning a bit.   We also had the Obon ramen which was very tasty too.  The noodles were amazing. Busy place but the service was ok.   If we lived here we would definitely come back often.

The food was fabulous. In particular,  the jackfruit steam buns were incredible. Shockingly, though, more than half of the staff were unmasked, creating an incredibly unsafe environment. We opted for takeout because of it.. They'd get 5 stars if not for their total disregard for public health.

Before this weekend I would've gave this place 5 stars. I understand places being super busy, especially during the weekend. But after my boyfriend and I drove across town to come eat here and went through the trouble of finding downtown parking, we got turned away at the door. We love this place and we're so excited to come eat here and so we asked how long the wait would be, not caring if it was super long. And the guy at the door told us too long and that he wouldn't seat us at all. 
I love the food here but every time I've came the staff seems to be ruder.

OBON has been a regular dinner spot for us recently. However, on our latest visit we were disappointed to learn of the recent menu change. I understand the need to adjust prices and menu selections with the times, but I was disappointed that several of our favorite drinks and dishes are no longer offered.

A bit on the pricey side, but not bad for a contemporary take on Japanese food in the downtown area. 
 
 Ambiance - Lots of space on the inside and outside. Cozy interior. 
 
 Service - They were pretty packed the couple of times I've gone, but were always very efficient and friendly. 
 
 Food - Ramen was alright, some of the sushi rolls were fairly solid and light which was a nice take, their korean animal fries were a stand-out and definitely worth trying! Decent drinks.
 
Overall, a little pricey (that's what you get for being downtown I guess) for okay food. There's definitely better Japanese places in Tucson.

The service was not good very slow I assume because of mismanagement or short staffed. The pork buns where too fatty and over sauced. The ramen was way too salty that I couldn't finish the broth which to me is part of the experience of enjoyment of a good Tonkotsu Ramen. 
One and done.

Went here for the first time earlier this week and I already want to go back. The sushi is great and the shoyu ramen is tasty. I recommend going during the happy hour because the appetizers are a bit pricey. But if you plan on only eating a main meal anytime is great.

This place was SO good for every reason!! First of all, Audra was our server and she was SO fun, helpful and good at her job! She was knowledgeable about the menu and made FANTASTIC recommendations and had such great energy every time she stopped back to check on us. Then, the cocktails and food started coming out and everything was as delicious as the last. The genius cocktail with mezcal and coconut was SO good and SO unique. Our Yuzu yellowtail was as perfect tasting as it looked - such a bright flavor profile. Then we shared the OBON ramen - yum! It was spicy, which I really like, but just a warning to those who might not (of course Audra shared that before we ordered so we knew what to expect)! And then the Tataki Maki roll was equally wonderful. I almost wanted to order another roll because of how good everything was, but I was just too full. Man, what a perfect date night with tasty food & drink and our new friend Audra who even gave me good tips for the airport that I was headed to the next morning. Huge kudos!!

My husband and I went here for our anniversary. We had several people recommend this place to us & it did not disappoint! We sat on the patio. Enjoyed a bottle of sparkling rosè & some yummy sushi! We will definitely be back soon!
Delicious food and a lovely ambiance. The waiters and also great. I got the Korean fried chicken and the kimchi animal fries. The chicken was delicious, but the kimchi fries were far too salty.

business.name: Süp
business.categories: Soup, American (New), Salad, Restaurants, Sandwiches

reviews.text: One of my all-time favorite Nevada places to eat. I WISH there was one out in Spanish Springs. Best service ALWAYS! Consistent delicious food. Often busy. The meal options for gluten-free are awesome! Sitting outside in summer is great. The little mini cookies they give with the meals are YUMMY! And the white balsamic vinaigrette on the side green salad is amazing!  It is very small so be prepared to pick up and go if you come when it is SUPer busy... Did you like that pun?

Stopped in for lunch with my daughter while in town.  As a Keto participant, I ordered a Steak salad, and a bowl of Broccoli cheese soup.  The soup was excellent, the Steak part of the salad was not.  Cold Beef was more like it.  Nonetheless, it was all tasty.  My daughters soup and grilled cheese was also good.  Will gladly return when in the area.

I came to sup on New Year's Eve before catching a flight out of town, I have the chicken tortilla soup which was OK, my friend and kids had sandwiches nothing to write home about just a run of the mill sandwich.

Kitchen: The soup I got was an adventurous choice (a west African recipe), and it was delicious. They have standard American fare as well, so the menu is a nice balance for everyone. Many gluten-free options. 
Front: Wonderful, quiet, caring service. The checkout was swift and the person at the register was polite. Someone who seemed like the manager or owner personally handed me my soup, which was thoughtfully bagged and even a small piece of masking tape on the lid to keep the soup from steaming or leaking out of the two small holes manufactured in the lid. The bag was stapled with care and easy to carry.
It is clear to me that the employees care about what they do and care about the people they serve. My visit was brief and my order small, and yet the experience was magical.
Yes! This place is awesome. Wonderful food, fun atmosphere, fresh ingredients and great service.

After a fun afternoon of ice skating, we came with some friends for dinner.  Although parking is tough (as is most of Midtown) we were able to find a table easily.  The staff was super nice and friendly and they had a great selection of soups to choose from!  I stuck with a classic (grilled cheese and tomato bisque) and I was not disappointed.  The meals also came with a nice salad and a small oatmeal cookie. Friends had the club sandwich, the chowder and the turkey pesto and everyone loved their meals.  Portions were large and everything was flavorful.  What a great little place - I will absolutely come back and warm up again.
Great service. Fast food, a good snack for if you are in midtown. Soup is good, always get a sandwich with it. A must try.

this place is okay... if you like food with little flavor that doesnt cater to people with food aversions, this place is for you. the only thing worth buying is the chicken tortilla soup, because it actually has flavor. skip this hipster place and go somewhere where they serve real soups.
Great prices, filling portions, friendly staff, chill vibe and amazing taste! 10/10 recommend. Would Süp again.

I tried Sup for the first time today.  Although, I ordered a sandwich and missed the point. It was a delicious sandwich. I wanted soup but didn't think I could finish both. I decided if I liked the sandwich I would come back to try their soup. Looks like I'll be back because the sandwich was pretty great. They have been open a long time (since 2007) and I have been told by several people to try it but I've just never gone. I am happy I did today.

The menu consists of salads, soups and sandwiches and is just the right size. There are enough options for every diet to choose from and then there are daily soups which are on a rotation. The options listed online for today (Thursday) did not match was being sold in person. My brother had the pozole which is one of his and my favorite dishes. He seemed to enjoy it. I wish I tried it because it looked pretty tasty. 

I decided to try the grilled cheese sandwich. It's a very basic sandwich and anyone can make one, or can they? I want a nice crunchy bite when I am eating a freshly grilled cheesy sando. My sandwich today gave me that satisfaction. The bread was toasted just right and the cheese was gooey. I don't know if they put both cheeses in my sandwich. I could only see and taste the sharp cheddar, visually I could not see the white cheddar. I make sandwiches like this often and can always see the white and yellow cheddar melding together when I pull it apart. I did not see this on my sandwich today. This did not effect my enjoyment in any way. I also added prosciutto for $2.50 upcharge. They put in a good amount of it so it was worth the added cost. The sandwich came with a side salad which had mixed greens and cranberry with a dressing I think is balsamic vinaigrette. That cut the fat of the cheese sandwich nicely. 

The space is small and cozy. There are seats outside but it's fall and cold and I'm a baby so we sat inside. The staff was friendly. They were very busy but we didn't have to wait long and the tables were bussed almost as quickly as people were leaving. I enjoyed my visit with my brother while eating some good comfort food. 

I would recommend Sup for lunch or dinner and I will be back to try their actual soup.

Delicious, amazing, filling, and happy!  Really, this is one of those joints where you just feel better after being there.  Order at the counter and take a number to a seat.  They offer both indoor and outdoor seating, no social distancing, but the staff is wearing masks.  All of the seating is PACKED. Like constant turnover of tables!  This is not a slow indulgent meal, this is eating and go.  But boy oh boy what good eats.  I had the traditional grilled cheese and tomato with a salad, and even got a cookie!  yum!  I'm a sucker for a cookie.

My three companions all ordered different combinations of super/salad/sandwiches, and everyone was delighted with their choice.  everyone closed their eyes with delight enjoying that first bite!  I can't wait to return and try some of the other options.  I did grab one of the delicious cream cheese brownies for a late afternoon snack.  It was just the sugar bump i needed to get through a long day at the office.

I am 50 years old and this is THE ABSOLUTE BEST SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED!! Food was absolutely delicious, service from front counter to table was SUPERB. Prices are only slightly above, but completely worth it. Really really nice dining experience.

Very clean food. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients and the food is very filling! I got the Turkey pesto sandwich and it was filled with fresh veggies, Turkey and pesto! The chicken tortilla soup is one of my favorites here! Solid spot for a quick clean and quality lunch!

Can't say enough good things about this place. Everything is so fresh and delicious. I had the turkey pesto with broccoli cheddar. The sandwich comes with a side salad with the most amazing dressing and yummy bites of Gorgonzola. The sandwich was fresh and tasty, the soup was hot and perfect. We also got the west African peanut stew which was a delight to the senses, and a coconut Thai chicken soup that was very good. All the employees are so nice and friendly and make me want to keep coming. Also I came on a wine tasting night so I received a free little glass of wine which was a fun surprise.

I really want to love this place! It's cute, great service, and the tomato bisque soup was lovely. I ordered a crab & shrimp salad and that was unfortunate. There was plenty of lettuce, four shrimp, half a hard boiled egg, and a couple small slices of avocado. Maybe a couple tablespoons of crab meat. It was pretty much a big bowl of lettuce. Definitely regret ordering the salad.

Nice place . Good food . The employees who was working on the register ( young gentleman with curly black hair) was super friendly. He was awesome. He was just talking to each customer and welcoming them with a smiling eyes ( with mask on ) . Keep it up man . Every single place need a front person like you .

Excellent food. Excellent service. Beautiful outdoor and indoor seating. Will definitely come back again!!! Around $13 a meal that is more than enough food with a small cookie that goes along with it for a sweet treat at the end. Definitely my go to place now in Reno!

Süp is super good. I always get the steak salad and when they have it the ajiaco soup which is to die for. The staff is by far the friendliest! The only thing I hate it the location, parking, and prices. I understand that's probably where they get the most profits but I only wish they had a little house somewhere else that's not a cluster every time you go there. Thanks Süp for everything that you do!

First visit to Sup since covid. The food is fresh and delicious. A lot of food for 1299. I enjoyed the turkey pesto half sandwich, a cup of broccoli cheese soup, cookie and a drink. They also gave us a complimentary salad. The service was quick, the price is good; the only problem with this restaurant is parking.

SO GOOD. I've been going here for a couple of years and I love this place. Everything is pretty good but I do have my favorites. 
 The tomato bisque & the chicken tortilla is soo good. 
And the grilled cheese is to die for. 
The artichoke dip is not my thing, but my friends all love it. 
And the cookies are mini bites of heaven!!!

I went here today and Terrance who works there is so nice helpful and he gave me an extra cookie! 

10/10 must try.

I've eaten here twice in the last week. Because it's completely on a different side of town from me, I forget how much I love them but try to eat here periodically when it's soup weather. My take out earlier this week was great but eating in person is better even though as regulars know, seating can be difficult especially during the lunch rush so be patient, it's well worth it. 

My order consisted of the minestrone and grilled cheese (both times hehe) and both times it was great. The grilled cheese was well toasted with the right ooey gooey cheese you'd expect. The minestrone was packed with the best ingredients and was deliciously warm. My daughter had the clam chowder and half of a club, and she pretty much finished the whole thing without me having to nag her (that's a sign of how much she enjoyed it), she even ate her side salad. 

And the service, everyone is always so polite and helpful. Our plates accidentally were missing the standard cookie and when I mentioned it to one of the servers, he brought us a cookie (and a couple extra) right away. 

Highly recommend this place, have been coming by for years and they never disappoint. My only request is this: open a Sparks location, please!!

How have I never tried this place before. I always drive by and wonder why it's always busy. Well now I know and I'm so glad I tried this spot. This place is amazing! 

I arrived right before the lunch rush at 11:30am and I'm so glad I did because the line was out the door to the sidewalk. If you can avoid the lunch rush, I would highly recommend it. 

Their menu consists of salads, sandwiches, and soups. This is a great spot for those with dietary restrictions, there is something for Vegans, Vegetarians, and Gluten free folks. The menu highlights which menu items are good for those with dietary restrictions. This was very helpful for me since I don't eat gluten. They also have great combo options so you can get a sandwich, salad, and/or soup in one meal. 

The spot: 
This is a cute restaurant located in Midtown. It has some indoor seating and a great outdoor patio with plenty of seating. They also have outdoor heaters too. If you call in an order for pickup, they have a curbside pickup parking lot available in the back of the restaurant. It's only accessible from Saint Lawrence Ave. 

The food: 
OMG, I'm obsessed with the Strawberry Salad! Mixed greens, topped with balsamic strawberries, gorgonzola cheese, sliced almonds, and white balsamic vinaigrette. I never knew I loved white balsamic vinaigrette until I tried this one. It pairs with this salad so nicely. I love pepperoncinis on my salad so I added it to give the salad some extra crunch and tangy flavor. I also added their grilled chicken, because why not. It was perfect! This salad with strawberries is only seasonal, so when they don't have strawberries they switch to dried cranberries. This salad is so good, I've only ordered the large size. Trust me, it's that good and worth it. 

I tried a cup of Loaded Baked Potato soup! Topped with cheddar cheese and crunchy bacon. It was to die for! I love that they have so many different flavors of soup available every day. They also have a rotating soup menu that is only available certain days of the week, all of their soups are listed on their website. Be sure to try some of their amazing soups. 

My mom tried The Club sandwich. She loved the rosemary chicken breast and the garlic mustard aioli. The cheddar bread was fresh and soft. A really great Club sandwich! She made it a combo and got the cranberry salad and a cup of chicken tortilla soup. Everything was amazing! 

Each meal comes with a house baked cookie. They're oatmeal chocolate chip and are NOT gluten free. I hear they're pretty tasty! 

The drinks:
They have a fridge loaded with sodas, juices, water, and beer. They also have a soda machine and a water station available too. 

I'm already thinking about my next visit! Looking forward to trying more menu items. Definitely try this spot if you haven't already. It's an excellent lunch spot!

This is my favorite place in Reno for lunch.  They're always consistent with the quality of the food.  The house salad is outstanding.   Customer service is always a good experience.  Definitely try the Steak Baguette or the veggie sandwich.

I had a bad take out experience at SUP several weeks ago ( new employee just a bad day) however the manager was amazing and assured me she would make it up to me. Well back in town this week and stopped in again for lunch. The manager had written my name down and happily took great care of us on this visit! The food was excellent and I was so impressed with the service. Thank you for keeping you word and being a wonderful host!

I went here for a quick lunch today.  I had the strawberry salad with chicken. It was delicious. I had the half salad and that was pretty large for a lunch portion. The staff was very friendly. Great vibe. My favorite part was the little oatmeal chocolate chip cookie.

business.name: Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurant - Indianapolis
business.categories: American (New), Venues & Event Spaces, Seafood, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Nightlife, Wine Bars, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Wine Tasting Room, Food, Gluten-Free, Arts & Entertainment, Wineries, American (Traditional)

reviews.text: Not only does Cooper's Hawk provide wine tasting and great food, you can also purchase fun wine glasses and their selection of wine bottles. I have a membership card that allows a free wine tasting (usually $10 per person) for two people and two free bottles of wine for about $40 a month. Their food is extremely tasty as well. I've gotten their Asian Porkbelly Tostados which I highly recommend. I usually always get the Dana's Parmesan Crusted Chicken which is delicious. This is a great place to go for date night, night out with the girls or to celebrate.

I love this place!!! I'm a wine club member and I get 2 tastings and 2 bottles of wine each month! My cousins, sisters and I decided to do our monthly get together here this month. We started with a tasting. There were 8 of us and Jonathan took amazing care of us( He always does and Christian as well). We do the sweet tastings. He allowed us to swap out any that we didn't want to try. Make sure to tip these guys well when doing your tasting they do such a great job. Our tasting ended just in time to make our 4pm reservation. We were seated at big table that accommodated all of us nicely. Four f us are club members and we had plenty of bottles for our lunch. We started with 2 orders of the egg rolls to split. It comes with cilantro ranch as one of the dipping sauces and they are so amazing. We devoted them as soon as they were dropped at the table. Our first selection of wine was the blood orange sangria. It's a sparkling wine, very delicious. We needed 3 bottles of this. My entree was the surf and turf. Steak medallions, medium, topped with Parmesan garlic, drunken shrimp(shrimp wrapped in bacon on top of guacamole) mashed potatoes and a vegetable medley that was cooked to perfection!!! With dinner we got two bottles of sparkling moscato and a bottle of almond chocolate vin noir( I think that's the name of it). We had an amazing time and our server, Lydia, was great with our big group. If I could give this place 10 out of 5 stars I would!! The staff is amazing and the food and atmosphere are always great. They also do have music playing in the background and when our party wasn't having great conversation we could hear some great music.

This was my first time at Cooper's hawk and it was fantastic. We originally went for the pretzel turtle bread pudding (it looks incredible) however we gorged ourselves before we reached dessert and did not get to try it. The drunken shrimp immediately caught our eye and we were not disappointed with the results. The tequila lime butter was the perfect pair to the savory bacon wrapped shrimp. We followed it with a crispy salmon filet and filet mignon. We also chose the maters flight curated by the in-house sommelier. Our server Ryan was fantastic and funny. He even brought our birthday truffles for my friend's belated birthday celebration. The space itself is huge and also hosts a large wine tasting room in the front where they were hosting a round of tastings when we first walked in. I would definitely suggest this place for a date night or girls night out.

I was in town for business. This restaurant was recommended by a lady in Cheesecake Factory I met at the bar. The food was  large portions . The food was served hot and flavorful. The service was great ! The atmosphere was delightful. I sampled two wines. The chocolate cake was OMG! Sooo good!

I've been a wine member here since 2014! the food is great and the wine is even better 
perfect for a birthday, engagement party, girls night out, boys night out etc 
Food is amazing, they have different chef recommendations every month as well

We always do a wine tasting once a month as wine of the month members. Christian was by far my favorite server. Took SUCH great care of us even on NYE with a full bar and line to the door! I'm so impressed by his demeanor and knowledge of the product he is representing as well as working a 12-hour shift on a holiday. 10/10 stars!
Highly recommend a trip to Cooper's Hawk on 96th in Indy. Christian was our Host at the wine bar and so knowledgeable. Thank you for a great experience.

Had to wait when I had a reservation.  The staff was hit or miss the lady who sat us was so kind and nice, the waiter was very knowledgeable the food was amazing.   That where it ended.   The dessert was ok at best.  I love that they give wine samples and the wine is very good.   The staff at the gift shop was snotty and not nice. My husband spent $23 a piece to get us a nice wine galss set and we got a bottle of wine I enjoyed.  Seems like all they care about is if your a member.   The whole gift shop experience was horrible.   Ruined the last part of our ch experience.

Hi! Still 5 stars for Coop's... just here to add some more photos from a recent visit! Of everything I've tried here so far, I'd say the trio of medallions have probably been my favorite. Perfectly cooked steaks and the mashed potatoes are delish!

I visited cooper's hawk for the first time with a friend of mine and had a fabulous experience! We went to catch up and of course, drink wine. First off, walking into the restaurant, the staff was friendly and we were seated within 5 minutes (had a prior reservation). The ONLY reason I am giving it 4 stars is due to where we were sitting. The front of the restaurant is beautiful - lots of booths, on point lighting. Some seats are even near the kitchen which is fun to watch them cook (in my opinion). However, we were seated in the way way back. It honestly reminded me of a MCL cafeteria. That back room needs to be used for last resort seating or parties. For the amount of money you're spending, atmosphere is important. Moving on! 

We ordered a wine flight. All wines were incredible. The cooper's hawk white was my favorite by a landslide. Would recommend 100%. We ordered the drunken shrimp was impeccable. The bacon was so crispy and their guacamole that comes with it, is to die for. For our main course, I ordered the tortilla soup and a wedge salad with ranch. Soup was a 6/10. I prefer brothy-er soup and this one is more thick based. The wedge salad was 10/10 and their ranch is awesome. 

Only photo I got was my wine flight because I was too hungry to remember to take pictures. LOL. Our waitress was also fabulous and super attentive.

Would definitely go back but just request a booth next time!

I visited here this week with a group of 9 people. We got seated once half our group showed up. Reservations are highly recommended. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable. To start we shared a bunch of appetizers. The over the boarder egg rolls were very good and unique. The meatballs were also tasty and enjoyed. The bruschetta was also good. The people I was with also liked the tuna app. 

I enjoyed a cup of the bisque. This was good but I don't know if I would order it again. 

For my entree I had the filet. I asked for medium and it was a bit overdone but still good. I got asparagus instead of broccoli. 
For desert the Reese's cookie was excellent too. 
The cranberry spritz was also good but strong. 

Would come back here for a special occasion.

My out of town friends were visiting and we decided to try this place out. I've seen Coopers Hawk almost everywhere in Chicago, but never been. So it was a first for all of us! First, the service was great! Our server was very sweet and attentive. He made sure we were enjoying our time here. We ordered the Barrel Reserve for our wine and we liked it. The appetizers were awesome! Especially the Crispy Brussels Sprouts. We loved the pretzel bread and the Roasted Vegetable and Goat Cheese flatbread. I might host my wedding lunch here and will likely add the Brussel Sprouts to our event! For the main, I had the Potato Crusted Scallops and my fiancée had the Red Wine Braised Short Ribs. We liked the scallops but weren't super fans of the short ribs. But we look forward to trying other items on their menu.

I chose here for my birthday dinner. I had heard great things. We ordered the egg rolls for an appetizer. These are incredible. They come with 3 good sauces for dipping. My entree was the bbq chicken salad. It was chopped and I really enjoyed it. There was plenty to take leftovers home. The free bread is pretzel bread and the best complimentary bread I've ever tasted.  Our service was average but I really enjoyed the food. I'm already planning to return.

Great food, one of our favorite restaurants. However, if you order carry out be sure to check your bag before you leave! We got home to find two of our items we'd paid for were missing. It was a bummer but the food we did get was very good.

This was a great meal, a great evening with friends, and some of the best food and service I've ever had.  We came out with friends after a charity fundraiser to celebrate time with our friends.

We chose CH, and I'm so glad we did.  There were ten of us, so it wasn't a small table to serve.  The food was delicious, and best of all for me, there were several great options for my beautiful wife who has Celiacs and multiple food allergies.

Kendra G was our server, and she was phenomenal!  She took care of all our food needs and added that extra touch of connection and personality to the meal that everyone was talking about.

We later found out it was only her second week!!!  I would have never guessed she was that new at CH.  I want to thank the team at Cooper's Hawk for the great meal, Kendra G for the great service.   We will be back!

Management if you read this, please share our heartfelt appreciation to Kendra and your kitchen team.  The meal couldn't have been better.

I love Cooper's Hawk more and more each time I go! I don't go for the wine though, I go for the food! On this most recent visit, I had a steak and Bleu cheese salad that hit the spot. I was having a craving for a wedge and this was even better!  On a visit prior, I remember having their chicken tortilla soup with a salad and was also very happy with that meal. My aunt had the salmon during this visit and we both cleaned our plates so....

Highly recommend Cooper Hawk and am looking forward to visiting the new location in Avon.

Had a Christmas get together with my nursing friends and the staff from Cooper's Hawk located on 96th street was phenomenal! Thank you for accommodating our large group.  The servers were very professional, the people at the front that checked us in were super frienfly, the wine was amazing and the food was delicious.  Will definitely come back. I did not catch their names but i highly recommend this place. 
Ruth Boberg

We had another venue cancel on us last minute for a party of15. This location opened up their back room for us and rocked the house on service, taste and presentation. Our guests were wowed by the food and spirits. Tyson was a fantastic server and kept everybody happy. A great evening!
Really really great ambiance, I ordered the filet medallions and barrel reserve red and it was amazing. Super friendly staff to boot, and I left knowing a little more about wine than when I came in.

What a great dinner! I had never been here before, but my boyfriend brought me for a night out, and one of the best things is they have a really good gluten free menu. He ordered the filet mignon, and I ordered the crusted Parmesan chicken. Both came with mashed potatoes which were amazing! Mine also came with green beans and little tomatoes and they were very flavorful (I don't typically like cooked tomatoes). We decided on the Coopers Hawk white wine, but I would probably go with something slightly sweeter if we go back (I'm not a huge wine person to begin with lol). Our server was a little distracted and not very attentive which is probably the only reason I didn't make it a 5 star review (especially since I told him it was my first time at the restaurant).

So if you have to eat gluten free then you will be in heaven! THEY GIVE YOU BREAD AND BUTTER! Yes you read that right .. gluten free bread and butter to start off! 

For our appetizer we chose the bacon wrapped shrimp. We weren't too sure about it because bacon/shrimp/guacamole/lime sauce. Weird combination right? But it was so good the bacon was crispy and the sauces set it off. 

For my entree I had the parmesan crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables. It was delicious as well! My husband (non-gf eater) had a pasta that he said was delicious and very filling as well. 

Overall, we will definitely be back! It's a great place for date night and they have a lot of wine options! :)

I gave been coming to Cooper's Hawk for forever. consistent quality, awesome flavors. Its super cool atmosphere and friendly staff. Everything is full of flavor and the portion sizes are HUGE. Love it. Recommend to everyone!

Great for date night! Service is always top tier and the prices are very reasonable for this upscale restaurant. I ordered the filet medallions and broccoli and wasabi mashed potatoes. Everything was cooked to perfection. Great restaurant ro celebrate an occasion as well.eggrolls are delicious shareable appetizers as well!

Easily 5 stars for Cooper's Hawk. I love this place and have loved all of the food I've tried. One of my favorite parts is the wine tasting at the front of the restaurant. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you haven't been yet; and if you have, go again! Ya can't go wrong at Cooper's Hawk.

Xoxo,

Is this thing on?

My fiancé and I came here for date night for the first time. Our server Jay was amazing and the food was delicious! We both got surf n turf and I chose Ahi tuna with my meal. The bubbles wine flight was fantastic. Definitely a new go to for us.

business.name: Mother's Restaurant
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Southern, Specialty Food, Soul Food, Food, Ethnic Food, American (New), Caterers, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches

reviews.text: Great experience. Staff is excellent. Restaurant is very busy but the skilled staff is efficient and they make it an enjoyable place for a meal. Line is out the door but it moves quickly.  You order at the counter and then seat yourself. There's plenty of seating. We love that Management takes Covid precautions Serious so make sure to be prepared. Food is heart warming home cooking. I had red beans and rice with a side of cheese grits. Portions are plenty and food is 110% belly satisfying.

We walked in just before closing and still received great customer service. We came for the fried chicken and were advised it
would be a 30 min wait. I will always wait for a freshly cooked meal. I paired a leg and thigh with cheese grits and potato salad. The sides were good, but the chicken was delicious. We walked the food back to the hotel which was a couple blocks away, didn't eat immediately, and the chicken was STILL crispy and juicy. The lemonade was also refreshing. We will definitely stop by a few more times.

If you want a breakfast full of eggs, buttermilk biscuits, and cheesy grits; you've come to the right place! They offer a full menu pretty much all day so you can sleep in and still have breakfast late- I love that! 

Not fancy, but comfy, and the wait staff was so fast. You pay and get your ticket and then show it to them, they'll have your food at the table in two shakes of a lamb's tail. Bring tip money for the table servers- I had to call upon them on several instances for a few, um, "mimosa emergencies ". Bottoms up!

I come here every trip to New Orleans sometimes I eat here twice.  If it is lunch, it the Ferdi, if it is breakfast, it's an shrimp étouffée omelette.  Trust me, don't be talked into substituting shrimp creole for shrimp étouffée; it's no contest.

Mother's is a New Orleans staple open since the 1930's. It has been featured on several t.v. food shows and has countless reviews. On any given day  there is a line out the door waiting to get in. Not to worry though this place runs like a top and the line tends to move quickly. 

While everything at Mother's is great there is one main reason to visit and that's for the FAMOUS FERDI SPECIAL. This is a ham, roastbeef and New Orleans debris on french bread. Both ham and roastbeef are made on premises in Mother's own butcher shop.

Mother's is sure not to disappoint!

If you're visiting New Orleans, you HAVE to stop here.. No Exceptions... Right off of Poydras, this soul food kingdom has food that will warm every bone in your body. Though the line may be long, and the inside a bit cramped, but it is all worth it. 

So many decisions, but I finally decided on the fried chicken, red beans and rice, and potato salad (please allow 30 minutes for the fried chicken). That 30 minutes was worth the wait for the best fried chicken I've ever had. 

Also at my table was some jambalaya, cabbage, and green beans, and I will be having that in the near future. You truly can't go wrong with a decision at Mothers

Tourist trap that I wasn't inebriated enough to enjoy. This place has all of the hallmarks of a classic, homestyle restaurant, but the food was bad and overpriced. I order a large shrimp creole and received a small bowl full of watery sauce with no shrimp and mediocre rice. My brother ordered fried catfish and fries. The catfish was okay, but not very well seasoned and the fries were limp and soggy. After a 45 minute wait and $40 later, I left sad and hungry. I would have had a better experience at say, Popeyes. Best thing I ordered was the red cream soda. Sorry Mother's!

This was the nasty food I ever had. I ordered the shrimp creole, fries, red beans and rice. They just put it all on one plate than threw my fries on top. This is not how you serve a customer. I am sorry this is not New Orleans food or taste! I am only giving two stars because of Terrell he was amazing waiter it was 8 of us and we kept asking for stuff he never complain and always kept smiling. So thank him for your two stars because the food would get 0 stars!
No seasoning on the food. Blah. Very New York style taste. So disappointing. Never again

Great breakfast place! Everything was served hot and in plentiful portions! Prices were reasonable too. Pancakes look "heavy" but are super light and delicious! The biscuits too!  Service is down home friendly. It was only a block from our hotel so it was easy to walk to. Make sure you have proof of vaccination or negative COVID test for entry (as all NO restaurants are requiring). I can't comment on the lunch/dinner food since we only had breakfast there every morning of our trip except the first day. Glad we stumbled upon this gem. Rustic but clean and frequented by locals and tourists. I'd highly recommend!

This place may not look like much, but definitely glad we followed our friends suggestion for awesome food.  

The service was top notch!!  Chad went out of his way for us, and was very patient as we worked through the very extensive menu with our tired and indecisive kiddos.  

The mimosas were great, the kids were happy with their fried chicken, and the wife & I were delighted with our catfish, beans and rice, gumbo, and the Jambalaya was off the hook!    My only wish was that the food was hot/spicy.   Flavor was amazing and I adjusted it to my taste with the Louisiana hot sauce readily available.

Came here with my family because of all the hype it gets, and we love southern food. I shouldve known it was suspicious when we got in line and it was all white people and no black people. We're white as well, but we know how to cook southern food, but it was just odd that there werent any black people in line for a restaurant. 

They had signs up saying to have your COVID card ready but the guy didnt even look at ours. Once we got inside the ordering process was hectic, confusing, and very inefficient. The line to order inside is right next to where all the side dishes are and one panel was open so anyone in line could breathe all over the food which was very unappetizing.

We sat down at a table and our food was super bland, no flavor, and didnt even finish most of our food. Best thing was the blueberry sauce for the biscuits, but thats about it. 

This place may have been good when it first opened up, but now that its popular i think they mustve gotten lazy and cheap with the way the food is prepared. 


Paid $30 for parking near the restaurant, $45 for out food, and would never come back here again.
Great food. Great service and friendly staff. Step up, order your food, sit down and soon after the deliciousness arrives. This is a must if in NOLA.
My picky kids loved their Po Boys. I had the gumbo. Great waiter. We're glad we could hit this iconic restaurant

We were looking for authentic NOLA and got it when we found Mother's.  Huge portions of delicious food, quick and friendly service even though the line seemed long.  We will definitely return when in the area again!

Mother's appears to be popular with tourists and locals alike. My wife and I shared a plate of fried oysters and fried shrimp. The fried seafood was outstanding! The red beans and rice and potato salad were also fine. You order at the counter and pay at the end of the line and a waiter or waitress will bring your food to your table. This place advertises that they have the world's best baked ham so I'll have to come back next time I'm in town to try that.

We came to New Orleans for Christmas.  Love this city.  Decided to try someplace new. Mother's was about 2 blocks from our hotel and was recommended by someone.  We went for breakfast.  I ordered cheese eggs and cheese grits. Hubby ordered the same with a side of sausage.  The eggs were OK. The grits weren't that good. Tasted strange. Not sure what they added but they  tasted of flour. We decided to give them another try for their fried chicken, red beans and rice and green beans.  The chicken was kinda tasteless.  The veggies weren't good at all. The reason for 3 stars? The people that work there were the best. So nice and helpful.  Great conversations.  And the bloody mary was delicious.

I stopped by before leave NoLa. You have to order your food and then if you want to stay there then you can but you have to fine a seat yourself when one opens up. The ham is the thing that people talk about the most. It is pretty good. The bread pudding was good but very sweet.

Classic NOLA eatery.  Breakfast served all day! This place is well established and fast moving.  You have to stand in line to order your food.  Just know exactly what you want. Once you place your order, Graf any seat you see. A server will come over and pick up your receipt, and bring back your order to your table when it's ready. 
The menu is extensive.  Lots of traditional options to choose from. 
It was a little overwhelming at first since I needed to get a feel of how this place worked.  
I ordered the Mae's Omelet with grits ans wheat toast 
Glad I came.  I totally recommend it.

Good: Breakfast was excellent
Bad: Expensive, confusing ordering process
Overall: It is an experience that is worth the time. 

I stayed at a hotel across the street and decided to try it for breakfast one morning.  When I walked in, I was immediately asked for proof of vaccination.  This appears to be a state mandate.  I am not bothered by this, but you should know it is required before arriving. 

I was directed to a counter after I was handed a menu.  I ordered a breakfast plate and a diet coke.  I then went to a table where I handed my ticket to someone running the food out.  When I needed a refill I walked to the counter, but eventually someone arrived and offered to get a refill for me. Half of the time I got my own refill, the other half it was obtained for me.  

The food really was amazing, but the staff are a bit put off at answering questions. I don't know if this is a part of the experience or a result of the holiday, but it was a bit shocking at how grumpy basically everyone appeared to be.  

I returned the next morning and ordered the same thing.  The same waitress obtained my receipt and brought my food.  She said something about tipping at the table.  I was not provided the option to tip at the counter, so apparently tipping is expected and you should bring cash if you plan to offer a tip.  It wasn't clear to me that tipping was expected or warranted given the overall lack of service, but I don't mind.  I just wish there was some explanation provided prior to sitting down at the table. 

I thought the food was excellent and certainly made up for the attitude of the staff. If you go, just make sure you carry some money for tipping and ensure you have your vaccine card handy.

I was in NOLA for the first time two weeks ago and of all the food I ate, this place was easily the most memorable. No frills but food and service was on point. Split a combination plate with my friend and absolutely everything was delicious, especially the etouffee. Bread pudding was TO DIE FOR.. Couldn't recommend this place more.

The service was the only thing to write home about. The food we ordered was all mediocre. Beef was tough and bread was soggy. Spend your time and money elsewhere unless you want to step into another tourist trap.

This place was discussed at a local tour I was on and decided to give it a shot. Overall, it's a small quick stop "deli" like vibe with a selection of what would be considered NOLA cuisine. However, I wasn't blown away by the grilled shrimp poboy. It's a simple cold baguette with mayo, coleslaw, pickles, and grilled shrimp. There isn't much seasoning or intense flavor. If you're seeking a basic and simple shrimp poboy, and a pretty light one at that (I got hungry less than 2 hours later) this is a good snack, but not much of a NOLA classic meal.
