The staff is friendly and they do check vaccination status so I totally appreciated that! And the service is very swift so definitely a great stop on the go.
Good but not good enough to justify the long line and wait. Red beans and rice were delicious though.

I visit Mother's every time I visit New Orleans. Their Ferdi special is delicious, and their Bloody Marys are always so good. The waitresses are always so sweet and personal. They're very attentive as well. You may have to wait in line, but it's definitely worth the wait. I highly recommend!

business.name: El Vez
business.categories: Lounges, Bars, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch, Mexican, Restaurants

reviews.text: I had saved a bunch of restaurants to review later, and it took me forever to remember where this one was from/what I had ordered, which is a testament to how mediocre their food was. It was very busy so the only way to get a table in a reasonable amount of time was to sit at the bar, which was fine. I ordered the shrimp tacos ($15). There wasn't much in the tacos; it was literally just shrimp, a slice of avocado, and a sprinkling of cheese. I expected at least some pico de gallo. Maybe I should've read the menu more closely, but I don't know why this is even a menu option in the first place. The tortillas were cold, tasted awful, and the texture was weird/not soft; they ruined the tacos, not that there was much substance left to ruin. I would've sent them back had I not been so hungry. My friend ordered Nacho Mamma as her meal, which was good and the only reason why this is a 2- instead of a 1-star rating.

Very good food, great server, too crowded during Covid. The squash/pumpkin guacamole, smoky salsa, tuna tostadas, and taco sampler (lamb and pork were best) were great. The shrimp enchiladas were a bit fishy but the green sauce was yummy. Although they checked our Covid vaccine card and ID we felt it was too packed. Should remove some seating during Covid.

I just don't get it. 

I just don't get why this place has the level of popularity that it has. The food is alright. The drinks are fine. The dining room is big and loud. The service is competent but not special. The pricing is mid. I would never recommend El Vez to anyone, but whenever someone suggests going, I shrug my shoulders and say "that's fine," because it's just fine.

The food is great here! The chips and salsas are great and they give you plenty. The only thing I can say about this place is their restrooms are a disgrace! For a popular restaurant in the city you'd think they would have the money to update it. It's only one co-Ed bathroom that's super dirty which turns the whole place off in my opinion. Just keep this in mind when visiting.
El Vez is a great place to grab drinks with a large group of friends. I wouldn't recommend going there just for the food. The chicken talks were a bit salty and not very complex.

Ordered takeout bc I haven't patronized a center city restaurant in a while and figured they need the business on a snow day. Do not play yourself. Everything was mid or worse.
I could taste the frying oil on the shrimp. The mole tasted only of straight Kraft brand BBQ. The guac was bland- if there was cilantro or onion in, I could not tell. And the rice and beans were a mushy, school lunch mess. Even the pickled onions were bland.
Always a pleasure. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Food is consistent. Drink menu is wonderful also.

Despite the long wait, I actually loved the food here. The Tito Santana & the taco tasting platter was two of my favorite parts of the meal. I got the chance to try 4 different kinds of tacos. The Mahi mahi tacos was my favorite.
Anchovy fan rejoice! This chicken caesar salad is amazing! The perfect salad. Their adobo chicken is always stellar and pairs fantastically with this tastiness!

If I just forget about the fact that this place is a little overpriced (mostly the drinks), everything else is fine. 

I love the atmosphere: fun but mature, moody and dark but a little whimsical, casual but also sexy...a great place to just chill with coworkers after work or go on a date. Staff is friendly, sometimes even funny and they make great suggestions (sometimes even off menu suggestions). I've had great experiences at the bar and sitting at a booth. 
The place always seems to be packed... definitely popular - it's difficult to get reservations on the weekend but during the week is a little better. 

Start with the guacamole, it doesn't disappoint (especially if you're trying to decide between the guac and salsa). Sip on any one of their margaritas, they are all lovely (last time I personally was loving the pink Cadillac). As far as the food, it's fine. Portion size is decent. I don't think it's the best or worst I've had when it comes to mexican but when I come here, it's absolutely for the drinks, vibes and easily accessible center city location, not so much the food.

We didn't have a good experience at this place. We sat outside and the table was all crooked. Difficult to place our glasses so we asked to be moved to a different table. Service was slow. Drinks took way past the normal time (we were actually eating out appetizer before drinks got to the table). The quesadilla was not good - flavorless (actually bad flavor TBH). We had to leave. I don't think I will come back.

On the SE corner of S 13th Street and Samson, a few short blocks from City Hall and the Marriott Downtown Philadelphia. Main entrance at that corner. 

Sat at the circular bar in the middle of restaurant on a Saturday afternoon in early December 2021. Treated well by young bartender whose name, sorry to say, I cannot recall. Place was reasonably busy with nearly all tables filled with diners and most of the bar seats occupied. Nevertheless, the food arrived quickly after I ordered. This ain't TexMex--thank goodness. Fresh, tasty, reasonably priced. 

My meal was terrific. Ate too much. Did not get to sample the drinks at the bar owing to an afternoon and evening of work ahead. So you're on your own in that department. 

Otherwise, you can't go wrong here as near as I can tell. Try it.

My favorite nachos in the city! The  margaritas are always good except this time it was a little bit watered down which I did not love. Tacos are pretty good and we got the elote which I did not really love too much

Out of all the Mexican restaurants in Philly, El Vez is truly average. The food wasn't amazing, but definitely not bad. It was everything you expect Mexican food to be, and nothing more nor less. 

Honestly, they rave about their guac but it is pretty underwhelming and definitely not a large quantity. We ended up having leftover chips that we used with the complimentary salsa since they gave us so little guac. They have fun flavors, but I'd rather just stick to other Mexican places. 

The tacos were okay. Not a lot of food inside each of them and you are definitely paying the price. I did like the plantains, which were cooked well and the sauces really worked. 

I would avoid their drinks which looked really pricey. I think most people got the margs, but we were happy to pass. 

Overall, I'd probably skip the prices and go somewhere else next time.

Great service and great location but honestly tho... I am not sure what the hype is all about. Food is fine but nothing special about them. 
If you are in the city and would like to enjoy the vibe, El Vez wouldn't be a bad choice. I just wouldn't recommend to go here based on the food
One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. Hard to get reservations last minute, so book ahead. They have huge fajitas for 2, great homemade margaritas, and delicious tacos and nachos!

Two words... PINK CADILLACS! 

Best margaritas + chips, salsa + guacamole around. This is enough to make a girl happy

First time back at El Vez since the pandemic and I was pleased to see the "mask required" sign right at eye level on the front door; however, once inside, the tables are definitely not socially distanced. We were seated in a corner booth and the nearest table was right up against us--one of our diners was touching chairs with a diner at the nearest table, and that was after we'd moved the booth table closer into the nook.

That said, the service was swift and friendly, the guacamole continues to be stellar--our table shared both "The Original" (tomato, onion, jalapeño, cilantro, lime) and the Tito Santana guacamole (mango, red bell peppers, jicama, habanero & serrano chiles), which had a nice heat to it, balanced by the sweetness of the mango and red bell peppers and cooled by the jicama--and the Macho Nachos (queso mixto, black beans, salsa ranchera, sour cream, pickled red onion, jalapeño, and chorizo) was as tasty as ever. Others in my group enjoyed the Mexican Chopped Salad (romaine, watercress, pepitas, tomatoes, chayote, corn, black beans, queso fresco, crispy tortillas, lemon-avocado dressing or cumin-lime vinaigrette) and a variety of tacos.

Looking forward to warmer weather to return to Philadelphia so we can enjoy El Vez al fresco!

I enjoyed myself when I went for dinner! The chicken nachos were really good! I really like them a lot! There was enough to fill me up! I also got the grilled lobster tostadas and it hit the spot! The guava mojitos were amazing! I had two and it was delicious! Definitely would come again! It was busy for a Thursday night! Service was great!

I had to downgrade to 4 stars post Covid. The food just don't as good. The nachos mamma is as good as ever, still 5 stars. But the other options have gone a bit downhill. The sauce for the churros used to be worthy of licking the bowl clean, now I'm positive it's Hershey chocolate syrup. Empanadas were blah, the queso fundido wasn't cheesy enough which should be impossible to say. Drinks were still phenomenal and the nachos were great. Perfect place for drinks and apps but I don't know for a whole dinner.

Good place to check out once or if you just don't want to think about it and need a good place to go. 
The Basil guac is definitely great, but this isn't where you're going to find those hard to come by flavors that remind you of being in Mexico. The food here is consistent but when sitting around the table of 6 I was waiting for "omg this is so great! Amazing good" but it was more like "this is good" :). I hope this helps. If you aren't picky, go here! If you're lazy, go here! If you're looking for the best Mexican food in the city, there are other amazing spots to try :)

I still love it here, but the prices have gotten INSANE. $16 for guacamole?? Jesus! The food is still delicious though...I'll probably spring for overpriced guacamole if I dine in person (it's better than takeout), because this is the wild life I live lmao.
Great food, great location. Highly recommend. Expect a long wait but it's worth it. I recommend the chicken enchiladas

El Vez lived up to the hype! The wait could get lengthy if you don't make a reservation ahead of time but it was worth it! 
The food was amazing and it came out piping hot! Our steak was cooked perfectly but the chicken was kinda dry. The music and overall vibe of the restaurant was good as well.

I first dined here back 2012 when I was visiting the city and absolutely loved the food, decor, drinks and service. It was one of those places that just left a mark and remained memorable in my mind because the food was outstanding. 
Fast forward 2021 and I been living in PHL a year. To this day, this establishment has maintained itself as a dining destination for Mexican food that I will recommend to any friend, family member or tourist visiting. Hands down, the food is fresh, consistently good, presented well and the servers are really friendly. Today we had Jelly as our server and she was awesome! I come back because I'm never disappointed, and I always have enjoyed my meal here, even when I ordered take out last year when the city shut down for the second time. Drinks are fantastic as well. God for the food, stay for the ambiance, El Vez is worth the visit! Thanks guys and keep up the great work!

business.name: Kona Grill - Tampa
business.categories: Sushi Bars, American (New), Asian Fusion, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Great date night. Even better service. 
Drinks 10/10
Appetizers 10/10
Food 10/10
Our server, Kelli: 11/10

We were seated fairly quickly despiste changing our mind about where to sit. We reserved for inside but it was nice enough to sit outdoors and they accommodated that for us. The service was a bit slow but they seemed to be overwhelmed with the Buc fans. Hubby got a beer and warm sake for his drink and I ordered the Sunday morning cocktail which was pretty good. For appetizers, we ordered the jalapeño yellowtail sashimi and calamari. No complaints about the sashimi but the calamari was so salty that we couldn't eat it. Then for our entree, my hubby got the surf and turf - crunchy spicy tuna roll with the NY strip, potatoes and green beans. The tuna roll was salted way too much so he couldn't eat it, and his steak was over cooked. I got the sunset roll and it was delicious. We ordered more drinks (same ones from the start) and I couldn't drink mine. It was made completely different than the first time. We got the brownie dessert and that was divine. We won't be back unfortunately.

Firstly, I never leave negative reviews for a restaurant.  I understand things happen but this was off the charts.  To begin with yesterday evening we (table of 2) ordered fries with kg sauce and waited an hour for them.  The server assured us they would be right out and offered us bread while we wait.  Bread never came and our server left the restaurant.  Meanwhile multiple tables who sat after us and had bigger parties were finishing up their meals and paying while getting constant service.  I felt like I was being treated as a 2nd class citizen.  Even other servers were asking us why the food never came.  We got a second server who apologized and said something weird is going on tonight.  Food still came out cold after waiting so long.  Steak came out raw, my fiancé couldn't eat it and they brought the wrong side when we never even changed the side it comes with originally.  Wrong food, cold food, 1.5 hour wait for said food.  By this point we were so exhausted from this experience we just paid our bill and left.  I was excited to come here per my Fiancé's recommendation but I was sadly left EXTREMELY disappointed.  I have no option but to leave this review based on how I was treated yesterday evening 1/2/22.

So disappointed with the food and cleanliness of the place, the restaurant is going downhill.
I order the Kona loco, they replaced the ingredients over a month ago, but they haven't done it on the menu.
What a disappointment and I'm stuck with the gift cards.

The menu selection is limited and it took over an 1 1/2 hours to get the food.  The mojito was the worse that i have ever had. 

The waitress was good and did the best she could but the kitchen took forever and the food was not good. 

Will never good there again.

Sadly tried to celebrate my birthday here with a party of 10 with reservations made a day prior for 9pm. Although 10 guest had arrived the host refused to sit us until all 13 of us were there. We waited 30-45 minutes for our drinks, were never offered water. Once the appetizers start coming we ask for chopsticks and are told they ran out, later on the end up finding them. Somehow 2 guest never got their food, and as if watching everyone else eat while they waited hungrily without an explanation wasn't bad enough. The kitchen closed, 2 guest never ate, the curly haired server still tried to charge them for the food they never received. The manager then came out and only made matters worse by essentially calling us liars when we told them 2 of our guest never got their food. He went to the kitchen to confirm the food was never brought out and never even bothered coming back out to  explain or apologize. Those of us that actually got to eat got decent tasting food, nothing special. The service overall left the worse impression on us all.

Had a res for 2 on Christmas Day. Checked in online, showed up 20 min early and was told there were 10 parties still in front of me. I get it, you're busy and understaffed or whatever but then just stay closed. Plenty of restaurants were closed on Christmas, don't open if you can't provide the quality of service Patrons are expecting you to provide.

We decided to make Christmas Eve reservations at Kona grill because we had no reason not softer having a great experience back in August. However, this experience was bad, so bad that we've decided not to come back again. First, the menu selection was very limited, only leaving high-priced options on the menu and only one option for kids...Turkey and mashed potatoes, which, isn't this mostly an Asian fusion-type cuisine restaurant? Second, the food took a very long time to come out and when it did, my plate was almost room temp. I notified the waiter, he took my plate, and came back with the same plate 10 minutes later. They literally reheated my food and gave me the same piece of salmon, inky this time, more cooked so to heat it up. I told the waiter and he didn't care and offered no explanation or recourse. I would expect this from AppleBees but not a higher-priced restaurant like Kona grull. Lastly, the waiter was innatentive and left our glasses empty and didn't bring the condiments we asked for. Such a bad experience and vow to never let them waste my money again. Very disappointed, especially for a special occasion.

Unfortunately this place disappointed in every way possible.  From the disjointed check-in to the 40 min wait for our drinks to the attitudes from the manager/wait staff to the mediocre food - this place is a utter disaster.  Save your time and money and go somewhere else.  I've never experienced such a disaster in my life.  Shame on you Kona Grille - you're a mess.

Dined at Kona grill as a part of a birthday celebration. To say the least I was not impressed. Reservations were made in advance and upon arrival our party was told it would be a few minutes. After 30 minutes of waiting we were told there was not a table ready and the kitchen was backed up. We were informed if we were sat it would take around an hour to get our food, we asked to speak to the manager and informed him that reservations should be held at a priority over sitting walk In's as smaller parties had been seen being sat. We were then informed the table would be ready shortly. Another 30 minutes passed. Another complaint was stated to manager and host staff and we were finally sat within a few additional minutes. When we were led to the table it was obvious there were not enough chairs for each person, the waiter told us there was nothing they could do as the other tables and chairs were needed for other parties. We had to ask another table to use their chairs and crammed into the table space. Accommodations are not an option here. In addition to the wait and lack of chairs It  took around 10 minutes for waters and they were out of most appetizers, the food itself was mediocre and the food came out in various times. Overall bad experience and would not recommend.

Okay place.

Great server.

Ambiance music did not match genre of cuisine. (Not a bad thing, just one of my preferences)

Tasty food

Ribeye Meatballs $19.00
5 choice ribeye meatballs with shallot & shiitake, macadamia nuts, chili glaze, creamy peppercorn sauce, whipped potatoes

Coconut Shrimp $17.00
toasted macadamia nuts, mango, cucumber, hibiscus nectar, cream cheese, soy paper

Allergens shellfish

Pad Thai Noodles $24.00
chicken, rice noodles, egg, bean sprouts, peanuts, cilantro, pad thai sauce

Sub Shrimp (Shellfish) $2.00
Add Shrimp (Shellfish) $3.00

Would have given a four had it not been for the aesthetics of the lobby.
Service was wonderful and food was great! Highly recommend the avocado egg rolls and the carrot cake!

RAW FOOD ALERT. i got a takeout order on 12/14/2021 with raw uncooked pad Thai noodles. I called the restaurant to see what could be done and STEPHANIE decided to argue with me. 

I want to speak to a manager but STEPHANIE transferred me to a blank phone that kept ringing. So here i am with my review. 

worst 30$ SHRIMP PAD THAI OF MY LIFE. Please see attached. 

I paid for both shrimp and chicken and received 2 pieces of chicken. 

Resulting in me having to reorder dinner from somewhere else. 

I'm a regular customer there so i know what i am ordering. This was not that. This was the most disgusting thing ever. RAW NOODLES!?!?!? How would you let that leave your kitchen?!

STAFF DIDNT HAVE ANY CONCERN OR OFFER ANY SYMPATHY JUST TRANSFERRED ME TO A BLANK PHONE. NOTHING HAS BEEN DONE ABOUT MY FOOD. BESIDES IT GETTING THROWN TF AWAY.

I wouldn't even be mad if it was cooked or if they offered to remake it. But here i am hungry looking at raw food ):

We couldn't find parking. That was the first problem,  but I guess it screams this place must be good if we can't get a parking spot. Right?! We walked into the restaurant for our scheduled reservation we had for weeks... only to be told by the host... it's going to be a very long time until we get our table. People are still eating and he can't just tell people who are spending money to leave, like I'm not going to spend money too??? 

We kindly asked how long should we be waiting. He was very hesitant to give us the waiting time, thus we gave up and left. Very nasty host. Don't know how the food would be but the service was not there at all. Attitude right when you walk in the door.  Don't need to throw money away at bad service.

We visited this place for the first time with a guest of ours from out of town. We arrived early for our reservation and told that our table wasn't ready yet and that they were waiting for others to get up. They had at least 6 empty tables that could accommodate our party. Instead they made us wait for another table to get up because the tables that were empty were for "larger" parties than ours. We finally got seated almost 20 minutes late and that is where it really got bad. We ordered drinks and two appetizers. About 15 minutes later we were told that one of our appetizers was no longer available as they had ran out so we ordered a different one. 15 minutes later our drinks came and then our replacement appetizer. We ordered our dinner and then waited an hour and a half to get our meals. We never received our second appetizer and were actually told that our waiter asked three times and the kitchen "ignored" him. Our food came and was wrong, cold and not complete. Then we never received the final part of our order. Do not go here and if you do, don't expect any kind of good service. Horrible experience.
Not only was Matt the best server in the place, he was a snappy dresser and smelled fantastic. The food was awesome too! Definitely will be back, and we'll always go with Matt's recommendations!

I'm trying to decide what was better...the food or the service. Ray was great and made some stellar recommendations. I was in a rush so could only stop in for appetizers but I opted for the ribeye meatballs & Calamari. Truly an unbeatable combo, I highly recommend the ribeye meatballs. For just an appetizer it was delicious and surprisingly filling. I'll definitely be back.
Erin our server was great! Sushi was good, watermelon margarita was very strong! Was a good time!

I sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice and attentive. I had a margarita and it was delicious and not crazy priced. I had sliders to eat, be careful because the secret sauce was on the spicy side. 
The manager stopped by and was really great. She made sure everything was meeting the standard. 
10 out of 10 recommend checking this place out!
This place was bumping on a Friday night! But we made a last minute reservation and they were able to get us in. The sushi is amazing! Will be returning :)
Fantastic food and service. I had the Kentucky mule to drink and it was perfect. Manager Haley was amazing and very helpful and friendly. Love this place!!
Food drinks and desert are mediocre and expensive. It's not worth it. I do not recommend this place.

The Ribeye meatballs are delicious. However, their drinks were horrible. Returned one and got another and still was horrible. Dinner was subpar. Service wasn't very good either. Will not come back. A bit disappointed.

Visited with a group of friends for happy hour and dinner. Enjoyed our drinks and food for the most part - some inconsistencies with how drinks were prepared and dishes were presented. The majority of the servers in both the bar and dining room were friendly and prompt. Our main server/waiter was pleasant, but smelled terribly. So much so that I found myself holding my breath and my eyes watered when he tended to us. Now, I'm several decades away from teenage/college days, but it was painfully obvious that our waiter had been partaking in marijuana on his breaks. He also displayed some peculiar behavior throughout the evening which led us to question him. It was terribly awkward and uncomfortable as at one point he ducked under our table (we suspect it was at this point that he helped himself to a large sum of cash that didn't belong to him). What the heck?! Who does that?! Such a shame that a lovely evening could turn ugly because of one employee's poor behavior. Very surprised that a restaurant would allow that. Disappointing.

Two stars because the food was good, and the happy hour pricing had some great deals.

The main issue was our waiter.  I'm not sure of his name, but when he walked up to our table, he had a Pig Pen-like cloud of marijuana smoke emanating from him.  He can make his own poor choices, but greeting a table smelling of ANY smoke is just a terrible first impression.  There's no way management didn't know - it was that overpowering. This happened throughout our visit.

The second problem we had with him is that we are 99% sure he stole money.  My friend had forgotten her wallet, so her BF dropped cash off, which she put in her jeans pocket. I know she had the money at the table, because she paid me back cash for appetizers.  And she never rose from the table again until she got up to pay for her meal.   

But - at one point in our meal, our waiter weirdly dropped to the ground below her chair - I thought he was picking something up, but we were in the middle of the conversation, so we didn't question anything.  

Time to pay the bill, and my friend's money has fallen from her pocket. Clearly that's what the waiter picked it up, because where our table was situated, no one else passed by it.  We talked to management, who could do nothing.  We talked to the waiter, who of course denied it, "I was picking up a pen".  But his response was so phony - no outrage at being accused, no offer to help look - its very apparent that he scored the cash.  One can only hope Karma pays him back, but meanwhile my friend was out money.

business.name: Café Amelie
business.categories: Southern, American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants

reviews.text:
We just loved this place! Professional service and amaizing food. 
There was approximately 35min wait for the brunch, but totally worth it. Outdoor seating is breathtaking.
For New Orleans and the French quarter this place is very acceptable. Very competent waitstaff and some great menu items that will make you step up your home cooking game

Great service. We were very lucky to be seated quickly without a reservation at this place on NYE weekend, and for such an amazing ambiance. 
Our waitress was super accommodating for my friends' dietary needs. 
Their shrimp and grits were spectacular.
I would not get the steamed string beans as it had a weird smell and zero seasoning.
We also got some pieces of bread that didn't come with any condiments, olive oil, or butter. And it was not free.
Besides that and getting hit by a mosquito, the ambiance, service and main dishes were great!

We were in NOLA over Christmas and ate here for Christmas Eve brunch.  Food and drinks were delicious. Patio dining and service was great.  I'm glad we made reservations in addition to providing proof of COVID vaccination, which is mandatory in NOLA.

This place is so cute! Great vibe, great service. We were there for brunch. The food was good but not great. The shrimp & grits was our favorite dish and the bananas foster waffle was the least favorite, which was unfortunate because it sounded so good!

Beautiful Scenery & location. We we're able to walk around the French quarter after eating their delicious cuisine. We order drinks that were amazing, had great presentation, & got us a bit tipsy (drink with caution). 
We ordered the gumbo which was a great portion for one individual & still have leftovers. We shared the shrimp & grits because we were skeptical, but they were good. Could've used less butter on the grits, otherwise the shrimp complimented the seasoning of the grits. 

Customer service report: Wonderful service from our waitress Brittany (I believe). She let us know ahead of time what they were out of and she gave her honest opinion on certain meals on the menu. As a tourist I let her know my kind of taste and she let me know how they prepare certain meals. 

Follow my IG: kyziahselah_

Café Amelie is a true gem of New Orleans. If you want the New Orleans French Quarter courtyard experience, then this is the spot for you. Make sure you check the weather for the ultimate satisfaction outside. We sat outside, and it was a beautiful experience with plenty of light. We weren't hot, staff was very attentive, and it was perfect for catching up with an old friend. 

Ahi tuna was DELICIOUS. I couldn't get over the flavors of the tuna and the rice. The salmon and asparagus was delicious as well. Drinks weren't too strong, but also weren't underwhelming. Ask the wait staff what their favorites are - it did not disappoint! 

I will 100% be back.

The most magical place New Orleans has to offer!! Absolutely loved our experience here from the drinks to the meal to dessert! If you are looking for romance or a cute spot to grab drinks with the girls then definitely check this spot out! We will definitely be back next time we are in town!

New Orleans was a little slower and less available quality restaurants the week prior to Christmas.  This was our first visit to Cafe Amelie but not our last.  Our sweet waitresses, Brittany, was very knowledgeable of the dishes as well cordial and very timely with responding to our party of 4.  The salads were fresh and loaded with fruit and nuts with light dressings, the gumbo appetizer shouldn't be missed.  Our 4 different entrees (pork tenderloin, shrimp & grits, gumbo and Cuban sandwich) all surpassed our expectations.  Give this quaint restaurant off Orleans in the French Quarter a try - you will be pleased.

Ah, well, nothing lasts forever: in this case, it's Café Amelie's status as a sleeper without much presence in the lists of Famous Noo-Or-Leens Restaurants.  If Yelp! is any indication, Café Amelie has arrived. 

Fortunately Café Amelie has survived this ascension without any degradation in atmosphere, service, or food.   It's still possible to walk in, still possible to sit in a lovely patio that is one of the finest examples of "outdoor seating" you will find, pandemic or not, and they still serve local dishes that are delicious and competently prepared.    

The bar offers a range of creative house cocktails alongside some of the standards.  Get your meal off to a proper start with one of these.

The menu is not particularly distinctive or New Orleans in nature.  Don't come here if you're looking to sample various standard-bearers in our local fare; go elsewhere for that.   What stands out is that every entree I've had here has been delicious, and the options are healthier.  Consider coming here between your Antoine's Baked Alaska and Galatoire's Crab Sardou for a plate of Brussel sprouts.  (That doesn't sound all that good, but it is).
All our food was good but the Shrimp and grits were stellar. Beautiful courtyard too.

We came here to celebrate my cousin's bachelorette and I can't get over how gorgeous this place is. However, the food I had was average. I was eyeing on the veggie burger but felt that I always get that in every place, so I chose the Amelie pasta omitting roasted chicken. The sauce was absolutely delicious but everything else was okay, it didn't really wow me as I had highly hoped for it. My cousin got the veggie plate and the spinach/artichoke dip. I don't remember what everyone else got. She did not like the veggie plate until I told her to try my sauce onto hers - she said it was decent and asked the waiter to bring a small cup of the sauce for her pasta. We all love the dip and it was so good that I think I devoured before everyone else had their third bites, no regrets heh. Yea, I wish I had ordered the veggie burger instead so, hopefully I'll get that and love it when I come back again.

This was an amazing experience. The garden is absolutely beautiful. Our waiter let us know in advance that there will be a wait time for the food. We appreciated that. Had no problem waiting the 1.5 hours it could have taken. It only took less than a half an hour. The short ribs was delicious (a little in the salty side but we like salt)and the Amelia pasta is out of this world. Although I don't like bell peppers somehow it just made the dish that much more enjoyable. The drinks are fantastic and the one with Rosemary was a hit, recommended by the waiter. We didn't have enough room for dessert which is our only regret. Fantastic date night.
Very nice atmosphere and enjoyable food. Service was good. Excellent crumble! The courtyard is delightful but extremely cold on the day we were there.

Food is alright. Our server was very nice but there was a lot of confusion going around with the staff. Servers brought drinks and food to our table about 2-3 times that we didn't order. My biggest complain is with the hostess. I believe her name was Idae/Iday? Purple hair girl. She was extremely rude and it was obvious she didn't want to be there. She was constantly away from the front performing other tasks, would see us waiting, but had no sense of urgency to seat us. Finally she came up and told us there was no outdoor seating but we could go inside to since the bar had space. We walked to the bar and there were no spaces. One of the waiters inside even said that the hostess "does this all the time. She should just open her eyes and realize there are no spaces here." We walked back out to the front and she just says "okay you'll need to wait then." She had an attitude speaking to us for much of the time we had to interact with her before we were seated.

Beautiful restaurant for a romantic dinner. We didn't have reservations, but they took us immediately at about 6pm. After that, I think the wait gets longer. The outside courtyard looks beautiful at night - tucked away doesn't feel like you are on a busy street at all. We had the spinach  artichoke dip, which was creamy and tasty. And the Amelie pasta without chicken - it had lots of flavor!  Highly recommend this restaurant, but make reservations if you can!
Loved the courtyard; the food was great! The place is busy, but the waitress was so sweet and didn't seem rushed. Thanks for a great dinner!

There is a reason why the ratings here are so high, can't beat the beautiful atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. Our server Jason was super friendly and helpful. We loved the roasted chicken, Amelie salad, and blackened catfish sandwich. Perfection!
We had small plates... the Brussels, the poutine and the spinach and artichoke. All of them were amazing and so delicious!!!

The service was delightful. The food was even better! Took my staff to dinner here tonight and when I made reservations for the courtyard decided to bring my senior bulldog along for a special night out. They made Gracie feel like the VIP that she is! Everything was wonderful and everyone loved their meal, including my vegan employee. Gracie strongly recommends the Short Ribs..... Thank you Cafe Amelie for a perfect evening out!
Great ambiance! Great service! I sat at the bar, as I didn't have a reservation & I was solo. Had 2 small plates, Brussels Sprouts & the Chili Shrimp! A perfect lunch & delish!

I selected this place for brunch with the girls: three locals and two avid 504 fans. Only two of us had been here before. 
The atmosphere/ambiance will never disappoint. The service, meh. But, it's brunch, is anyone really in a rush. 
Our appetizers and starters were on point. The entrees are where you lost four out of five of us. Three of us ordered the short rib Johnny cake dish. Another ordered the vegan pasta dish, since she does not eat flesh. Her order was botched; she was handed a chicken pasta dish. The three of us with the Johnny cake dishes could not chainsaw thru the alleged Johnny cake and the poutine was so dry looking and stringy, I decided not to attempt it. 
It did take us a very long time to get our food and it was hardly lukewarm when we received our tortured offerings. 
No manager could be produced. The vegan dish was revised. Two others went for a second choice. I decided to quit while I was ahead. 
We were still charged for the replacement meals despite holding us hostage for an eternity. 
One person did have a hot, nice meal. Hint: order the egg collard dish if you want to eat and get on with your day in the quarter. 
Not sure if Covid is to blame. But, if this is what to expect, I better fricken learn to cook.

As of this writing, Cafe Amelie has more than 2,700 reviews and is sporting a 4.5 rating, which I can attest, is much deserved. 

A lovely garden patio is the place to be seated (inside is also quite nice, but nothing like a beautiful afternoon outdoors) and the wait staff are quite attentive but not over bearing. 

After nearly a week's worth of New Orleans cajun/creole food, the French leanings combined with a southern spirit are a joyful and delectable change. We kicked things off with the Pepper Glazed Shrimp, served on a bed of greens, which had six good sized elements and just the perfect start. For entrees we dove into the Lamb Sloppy Joe sandwich, served on warm Naan bread along with a side salad that had a Greek Tzatziki dressing and the Short Rib & Johnny Cake, that was absolutely wonderful. Meat falling off the bone accompanied by a corn and jalapeno 'cake' (e.g. Cornbread) with a unique apple and tomato salsa. There was a light drizzle of honey, that absolutely skyrocketed this dish.
 
Although we didn't get a chance to return, on my next trip dinner here is absolutely on the agenda

Le sigh

A total and complete disappointment to end our trip with. I have visited New Orleans 4 or 5x and have wanted to come here with the right company. The romantic setting felt perfect to bring my fiancé to. It was a Friday morning and the place was an absolute zoo. We were sat inside since it was a little chilly and the table next to us was a bachelorette party so it was so loud we couldn't hear ourselves think. I had to flag down a waiter and ask to be moved outside near a heater. We were moved but very far from a heater so we were cold the whole time. 

We ordered the chicken and waffles as well as the short rib and there were elements we liked and didn't like in both dishes. The chicken was okay but dry, waffles were great. Short rib was excellent and tender but under seasoned and the corn bread that came with it was awful and barely edible. It tasted overcooked.

There really was no redeeming quality about our meal besides the fact that it was a beautiful setting.

Stopped in originally to eat at the bar, but I wasn't comfortable so I decided to order to go instead. The bartender was nice but took a little longer than I expected to run my card. Look, it's a beautiful restaurant, and I'm sure the service is pretty nice (what I saw of the waitresses, the bartender, and the hostess they were competent professionals). But the food isn't worth the price. I ordered the Amelie Pasta and the tomatoes and bell pepper taste like they're just this side of turning bad. Plus I don't think they were actually cooked before the were thrown in the pasta. The penne, spinach, and the chicken were okay, but the cheese on top didn't melt in the slightest. The cream sauce was so so. All in all, not really worth the 32 bucks (yes I'm including tax and gratuity). It's a beautiful restaurant, and the staff were nice, I just wish the food tasted as good as Cafe Amelie looks.

business.name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks
business.categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Southern, Steakhouses, American (Traditional)

reviews.text:
Restaurant week was upon us, so I decided to dine here since I hadn't been for some time. I was looking forward. Well, I was disappointed.  

Lia was our hostess, and she was nice and welcoming; she even came by and checked on us while we were having dinner. We thought that was nice. 

I decided to meet my guest early for happy hour. Morgan was our drink mixer. Morgan was nice, helpful, and engaging.  I will come back for happy hour. Drinks: tito's cherry mule and the prosecco sangria. Both drinks were light and refreshing. 

Atmosphere: low lighting and moderate noise. 

Marissa(spelling wrong, I believe) was our  server. She was okay. She didn't check on us. We felt abandoned. 

Restaurant week picks:

1- steamed muscles. Very little broth, tinder, and a little flavor. It left me wanting me flavor. 

2- C.A.B (certified Angus beef) top sirloin: I asked for it to be cooked medium well; however, it wasn't cooked that way. The food came out warm. Oh no!  I asked for a side of their Brussel sprouts; they were supposed to have other toppings but came out plain; I sent them back, and the second time they came out right and were delicious!!!! However, it wasn't cooked that way. Out food came out warm. Oh no!   I asked for a side of their Brussel sprouts; they were supposed to have other toppings but came out plain; I sent them back,  and the second time they came out right and were delicious!!!!

3- My guest chose the bourbon glazed salmon: they said it was overcooked, so it was dry. A chef knows you should not overcook salmon. Maybe the cook was working that night. 

4-D Desert, we all chose the heath bar brownie; however, what came out tasted very much like ginger bread. Awful! We let the server know and asked for the chef; however, the chef never came out, and our server never said anything; instead, she took my dessert off the bill. I didn't ask for that; I wanted the brownie! While we were waiting for the chef who never came, we noticed others around us had what looked like brownies on their plates. Maybe they ran out. 

Overall, our dinner was disappointing. The best thing was the bread and Brussel sprouts for me.

No bread offered.  Waiter Forgot to put in our appetizers before our main arrived and so we decided to cancel the order.  Had to remind the waiter of simple things we asked for but never came as well. Food was mediocre at best.  Was early and had reservations but still had a wait.  When we were seated, it was crammed in with other guests.

Cleanliness was an issue...
Service was not great especially the hostess station, they could've been nicer
Food was sub par buts that's a preference 
The didn't offer masks, they asks us to walk to a Walgreens to buy a pack

For this place to be "fine dining" highly disappointed. Nothing stood out, food was bland and needed a lot of seasoning. The only thing good about the place is the food was cooked well but had no taste. 

Do not recommend, do not go and I won't be going back. For the manager who comments the same thing. Try reading the reviews and making changes. Stop replying by saying the same thing over and over again.

The atmosphere was great.  Service was unreasonably SLOWWWWWWW!    It was empty and we still waited an unacceptable amount of time for food. Here's the biggest thing..... They served Instant mashed potatoes.  Are you serious.  Got water and bag mix terrible instant mashed potatoes.   Unacceptable!!   I'll never go back again.  I do not recommend this place.

My visit was perfectly fine. Not bad or great. It filled a need. Easy to get in, close to the Marriott. 

Our server did a great job. I sensed the restaurant is still feeling the effects of the pandemic as whole rooms or sections of rooms were empty. Other places downtown seem more crowded. 

McCormick and Schmicks is a safe bet, well located and a fine place to eat.

Absolutely terrible and condescending treatment by the hostess and manager. For people in the service industry, I expected more. Came in for an event for black attorneys in the area and I was denied entrance because the dress code had recently changed to 'business casual' and my attire was unsuitable. My coworkers and I pointed out the other patrons in athletic clothes seated in the dining area. The hostess was extremely rude and dismissive. Disappointed in the treatment I received and will be following up.
Unbelievably rude customer service.  I felt like dying when I left.  Please- a warning to others: DON'T GO

I don't know where to begin!  The service at this restaurant is horrendous.  We waited 30 minutes to get beverages.  Our water glasses were rarely filled.  The food took an hour or more  to arrive.  Our waitress never cleared the table.  One person in our party got up to help clear the table of a few dishes.  We had to use cell phone flashlights to read the menu since the bulbs above us were out and it was dark.  Thank goodness the lights at City Hall in Philadelphia which were bright and shining through the windows, it was a big help.  Sam the hostess was terrible and non accommodating.  Our party leader's spouse fell ill and she was running late. She called Sam to inform him and when we arrived, all he could say is that the table was given away.  All he could offer was seating in the bar. Sam could have been more helpful.  The manager was worse.  We asked for two extra chairs to accommodate the party, and she appeared inconvenienced to give chairs for her diners.  The bathroom needed attention.   We paid almost $700 for the meal for the party.  M&S's owner should be ashamed to give people such poor service!  Beware of this place, go elsewhere!

Honestly, the worst service I ever experienced at an upscale restaurant. Half an hour to get drinks, hour before the food came out. The food was just okay, but the service ruined any kind of joy I would have got out of the food. I don't know what the reason for the bad service was, I was wondering why we should have such bad service in such a empty restaurant. I would avoid this place. 

There are much better restaurants food wise, and the service you receive here is so terrible that any kind of dining experience you are expecting is ruined. And after the horrible service, they had the nerve to want to offer us their points club or whatever. With service like that, I would not try to ruin the reputation of the company by offering me to join their club when they can't even get service right. Dreadful is the only word I can think of for the service I received at this restaurant.

I don't want to say it was because of our ethnicity because they seemed to treat other patrons that didn't look like us a bit better. I know it's a shame to have to think that way, but it just felt like we weren't welcomed here.

I came to this location to celebrate my daughters 12th birthday and it was not a great location nor was it a great restaurant. Parking was horrible. Reservations were made on Open Table and right after the host called with a very nasty tone to let me know that it was a dress code I made sure that the young ladies were in appropriate dress. Because my daughter choose this restaurant I went along with the reservation even though I wanted to reserve the right to choose another restaurant. No parking and on October 23rd, 2021 the streets of Philly were busy no parking. So long story short I finally come into the establishment dressed head to toe the hostess said mama you have to take your hat off. I was taken by far as she proceeded to tell me im doing my job. I toke the hat off because the night was about me it was about my daughter. I asked the waitress what is the rational for no hats she said people who wears hats we are trying to prevent them type of people because they walkout on the bill at times. I felt like that was discriminatory on there part and I proceed and put my hat back on. Now it's about time to order. Everyone ordered food and the birthday girl ordered the Ribeye medium well with mash for her to get a bloody steak with running blood was disgusting. She didn't like the taste the waiter never offered my daughter another option. The first thing she said is that the manager would not take the ribeye off the bill and would charge for another option. My daughter really didn't feel special it was one thing after another. It was not a great experience on my daughters 12th birthday. From the host stand to the service was not what I was expecting since I have visited other McCormick establishments. I would never go again and wish I could do a stop payment on the charge. It was like they were forcing me to take a steak that my daughter didn't eat. He stomach started hurting after trying the bloody mash potatoes.

If I could give zero I would. We were not allowed in as my two kids had holes in their pants. They said their dress code policy doesn't allow for that. The dress code says 'casual', Not business casual, doesn't not specify what you can't wear. Yet the person at the front rambles off things 'not allowed'. As I look over at another customer... he is in athletic shoes and basketball shorts. They say sorry. I ask for a manager. I ask why he got to get in but my girls can't? She say he must have snuck in? Like what? How is there a double standard? Like really? And the attitude of the people working the front? My god, I hope you were just having a bad day and you talk nicer to people normally. The general manager, I can't imagine how she has a job. Talk about nasty and arrogant. Jennifer Bucci needs some education on customer service. Who hands someone a business card and says 'make sure you spell my name right'. Are you for real? I will never step foot in your restaurant and will make it a point to ensure everyone I know hears about they way we were treated. Unbelievable.

On Wednesday, Oct. 6, 2021at 4:30 P.M. My wife and I entered M&S on Broad St. I was immediately charged by a manager and told to reverse my sweat shirt, or no service. At first, I believed that he manager thought the shirt displayed swear words, ect. It does not. It is a shirt that bears the name of a high school in Philadelphia. She then tried to explain that M&S dress code was business casual. I maintained that reversing the sweat shirt would not be business casual. I would look like an idiot. My wife and I left. We were well treated at another establishment.

I came here for restaurant week and the food was just okay.  The adults in my party ordered the $25, 3 course option. The food was good but my chicken was very small and not cooked as described on the menu. When I say small I mean maybe 3oz and I got grilled chicken vs. pan roasted as the menu described.  We did order an extra appetizer of the bacon wrapped shrimp. The portion was small and the shrimp a bit over cooked. Desserts were all good and the best part of the meal.

I also don't want to harp too much on service because in Covid days it is hard to find workers but service is slow.

Would I come back probably not. NJ is really stepping up their food game and no need to pay for parking.  Try it for yourself if in the area but I would not make a special trip.

Dined here last night with my boyfriend for restaurant week. I ordered the clam chowder, crab and shrimp stuffed salmon and vanilla bean creme brûlée. The menu said the chowder was award winning, but I thought it was just okay. My salmon was absolutely delicious and I loved all the flavors that went into it. The vanilla bean was also pretty good. My bf ordered the crispy coconut shrimp, parmesan crusted flounder and peanut butter pie. His shrimp was awful. I'm sorry but it was over cooked and shriveled up. Did not taste like shrimp, no hints of coconut and we both agreed that if we were blind folded we would not have been able to guess what we were eating. It sadly just tasted burned. His flounder and peanut butter pie were both outstanding 10/10. Out of everything we ordered, I'd recommend the flounder, salmon, and peanut butter pie! 

Service was also just okay. Our waiter was very friendly, but we had to wait a very long time for water, to order drinks, and to order food. This sounds like a minor complaint, but they forgot to give us our basket of bread. Tables all around us were getting bread and refills of it, but not us so we had to ask for some. Very minor, but a bit off and annoying that we had to ask for it. 

Beautiful establishment in a great location. Our experience was not the best last night, but that doesn't mean I wouldn't come back again. Maybe it was just a one time experience. I would return and reorder the flounder, pie and maybe some steak next time!

The general manager was very rude and nasty to start with! But the food was horrific under seasoned. It was so baddd, it's sad because my party and I was looking forward to eating here so disappointed!! Had to ask for water! Had to ask for rolls!! Don't waste your time!

I went here with very high hopes. I was sadly let down. We had oysters to start the meal. They weren't fresh and when we mentioned the issue the waitress didn't care. We then had the crab and shrimp salmon with mash potatoes and green beans. The salmon wasn't fresh either and the mash potatoes tasted like they were made from a box. I eat out quite frequently and I am very disappointed with the service and food here. Save your money and go to a different restaurant.

The food was horrible. It was cold and bland. I couldn't eat it. After a few bites, I gave up. I also ordered a drink, a Manhattan. They made the drink incorrectly. The waitress brought the manager over and when I told him about the issue he said he would look into it and come back. He came back a few minutes later and said the general manager said it was nothing they could do. I asked could I speak to the general manager, he said no. He said the general manager said we need to leave now because they need the table. I said you're kicking us out, he said yes, we want the table. Because I said my food was cold and drink was made wrong, I had to leave. This was my first time here and will be my last. I see why it only gets about 2 stars.

don't dine 4here
 I came here
 to enjoy happy hour big mistake 
the bartender claim I didn't fit the dress code I'm a man with business casual attire just not a collar shirt like she pointed out 
I had on polo ralph lauren shirt with Chino pants manager had the final word say give me anything I want beside I was sitting in bar area no dress code on their website or on door of the restaurant 
the cocktail server was just as nasty she took my order and never came back I had air pods on listening to music on my ipod yet she purposely talk loud 4 me to hear to another customer how I'm arrogant because I ask manager about the dress code BS that's why she got no tip 

gave her cash and took 4 ever to get change
never coming here again better REAL FINE dining restaurants to eat or drink at

We were seated and told to access the menu by the QR code on our table, which we did. My friend ordered the Perfect Patron margarita. He said it tasted like a dirty martini and margarita mixed. We place our order ordering oysters Rockefeller, he got a cup of their "award-winning" clam chowder and I ordered the hearts of palm caesar salad. For his entree, he ordered the twin lobster tails and I ordered the scallop pasta dish. First their server came back and said that they don't have any oysters Rockefeller so we ordered a shrimp cocktail. Then she came back and told him they don't have the twin lobster tails so he ordered a fillet. Eventually she came back and told me they don't have my dish because it was on a menu that is supposed to start September 18. I ordered the shrimp Pomodoro, but asked if they could just make it al olio. My friend said that the award-winning Clam chowder must be on next weeks menu, the one he got was pretty bad. My pasta was warm at best and did not taste at all of garlic. It had chopped up red peppers on top for some reason. It was a pretty bad experience, the food was absolutely awful.

We went into this restaurant to celebrate a birthday.

This was one of the worse experiences we ever had! Service is terrible.

The waiter come around we ordered drinks and we were unable to order drinks again until dinner was over. 

When dessert was served all the dirty dishes were still on the table. I asked the server to please clean the table. She ignored my request and placed the cake on the edge of the table with all the dirty dishes still on the middle. No forks were provided to eat the cake she took off, snd we had to go through all the napkins to find the extra forks to be able to eat the dessert. Shameful!!!!!

I asked for the check and to my surprise a gratuity of 20% was added. I crossed over the amount and wrote 10% and crossed over the total and signed the new amount. I felt that they did not deserve the 20%. 

They had the audacity to change the amount to 20%. This is illegal . The restaurant does not have the right to change the amount of gratuity that I want to give according to the service that was provided. Shame !!!!!

Host was rude, didn't even say hi. Just immediately told me I was not allowed in due to their "dress code".  This was at 3:45pm on a Wednesday. I was wearing a sweater and jeans. The host told me men required a collar shirt. A nice cashmere sweater and jeans is not up to their dress code of business casual? That is ok, I went to Ocean Prime and spent 225.00 there.

Really?
I was just told by the "manager" that because I don't have a "collared shirt" that couldn't be served.
I come to this place atleast twice a week with friends.
We always make sure that the waiter's are tipped well!!
I've never had an issue.
But today I can't dine-in because I don't have a collared shirt on IN 90 DEGREE WEATHER!
When the rest of the WORLD is trying to stay healthy (wearing a mask)with all of what's going on??
Someone needs to revisit this policy!
It's going to hurt your waiter's .

I come there mainly because of the bar staff!
They're alway friendly and service orientation!
And their business is being hurt by this shallow policy.
A collared shirt?!
There are a ton of great restaurants in Philadelphia that don't have such a policy.

Get it together!!
Kevin H
Horrible service, mediocre food, expensive and not worth it at all!

Horrible staff. Brittney physically locked us out of the restaurant for our reservation after making us walk to Walgreens to buy masks (the new mask mandate was NOT mentioned in the reservation). She said they had no extras, and we replied  "ok! brb." $1 masks vs. $100+ we would spend on dinner and a generous tip. We bought masks only to return to a locked door and staff shrugging their shoulders. Is this how you do business? Keep the food.

business.name: Clear Sky Cafe
business.categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Tapas/Small Plates, Seafood, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New)

reviews.text: I heard good things about this place from a lot of people around the area. Although, The first time we came here we could not get to see it was just too busy. We came out on Monday around 1030. I was surprised that it was not as good as they said it was. I looked at a lot of the ratings were five stars and I that was not my experience. The Atmosphere is ok nothing special the food is good . Service was good Waitress was extremely friendly.  The prices are high $$$ but a wide selection on the menu. I was surprised at all the eggs Benedict selections there were. It is a  good location my meal the potatoes were dry and the toast cold. The breakfast burrito was  small for the price , the mimosa was 12.00 that's high prince for what you get. Food presentation was ok. Not like the photos . This is a good place to go for breakfast I gave it a three because I feel like there was nothing extra special about it. Nothing really stood out.

On vacation, driving by, decided to try.  Was surprised by small place with such a variety of a sort of gourmet foods.  I had Shrimp and scallops with cauliflower cream type sauce and greens. Li mean large shrimp.  Hubby had Lobster rolls and fries which he seemed to devour.  You should all try one or both.  You will not regret.  Thanks for reading!!!!
The food here is excellent. I had the pork belly ramen which was seasoned to perfection and well balanced.
Love the 2 locations of Clearsky. The one on Clearwater Beach is the best. The other great location is in Dunedin. Both have excellent service, atmosphere and food.

On New Years Eve day,y gf and I went to Clearsky for lunch.  They have a nice outdoor dining area on a closed off street.  The oysters were delicious but everything else we had was oddly off.  The grilled octopus was a bit mushy and didn't taste fresh.  The seafood piccata came with a creamy white cheesy sauce instead of red.  I don't think it's supposed to be like that.  Food quality was mediocre at best.  The service was very very slow.  It took 30 minutes before our orders were even taken and the restaurant was maybe 30% full.  Plenty of servers around so I'm not sure what was up with the slow service.  I don't think we'll be back to this restaurant.

Our waiter was great! He was extremely funny and helpful. There was an issue with our Coconut Hogfish and he resolved it with no issue! The food was amazing as well! Definitely would recommend especially their churro cheesecake dessert.
Horrible service here. had to ask another worker for my check. Waiter maybe came to the table twice to check on us. Did not ask how food tasted. Only plus is the food was decent.
Place was great! The ahi tuna nachos are a must. Only thing I saw wrong was their was left over lip stick on my cup when she brought me my water and I cleaned it off.

I've only gotten through the appetizer and I HAD to hop on Yelp to review. The handmade Cinnamon roll French toast just changed my world. I felt my soul melt. HOLY MOLY. This place absolutely lived up to its name in an instant as top 100 brunch places in the US. FREAKING INCREDIBLE.

Location Clearwater.  Upscale dinner style with in or outdoors sitting.   The menu is very good as they offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The service is outstanding must say if your ever there ask for Stephane she was very good and attentive.  I recommend this place and will return my next trip to Clearwater.
I had the veggie skillet, without the egg and feta (a vegan alternative). Food was great. Sarah made our eating experience here more enjoyable.
Great food. Good service. Short wait for table for 2.  However, not very Covid friendly (staff not wearing masks, tables very close together)
A delicious breakfast spot right on the beach. A creative menu and a Bloody Mary bar make this place one to check out.  Just a fantastic place!

I'm always excited when I see a short rib. It's very hard to find one but this was just okay. For as umami as it looks, it wasn't very flavorful so that was disappointing. The gnocchi was good and that almost redeemed the dish. 

It's a pretty busy restaurant, we sat outside. It's cute outside and it's nice people watching. It's right on the strip heading towards the beach so be mindful if you're not okay with crowds or traffic.

Had the brussel sprouts and beet salad to start with. Shared the meatloaf sliders and lobster Mac between two of us. Large portions, service was ok, restaurant was cozy and the dishes were tasty. I would recommend it!

We have always had a great meal and service at Clear Sky, but last night, as Omicron is surging, we were stunned to find the place packed, literally wall-to-wall, with people. Not a seat to be had anywhere, nor was anyone, including the entire staff, wearing a mask. No effort was made to separate people, to shut off every other table or seat at the bar. It was actually terrifying. I can't support a business that has so little regard for its staff and patrons. There are too many other outstanding places to eat in this area. For example, last night we went next door to Roxy's, which is equally good, and had an excellent meal and no maskless crowds. We have also eaten there many times and highly recommend the place.

We loved this place! It's a nice walk around that area if you don't have to drive. We didn't have a reservation, but the food gets served so quickly so I think the table turnaround would be quick here if we had to wait. We didn't and were seated right away.

The breakfast menu was massive with literally anything you could dream of.

I ordered the Mexican skillet. Everything in the dish was cooked nicely. It contained SO much chorizo and I LOVED the ranchero sauce that came on the side. Overall it was a good dish, not the best thing I've ever had but good enough to come back! 

The food came out seriously so quick and the waitress was attentive!

Beautiful Done....
Love the Outlook And Curbside pick up.No Lol..Easygoing Professional Staff.

Fun place to go if you are in Clearwater! They had live music and a fun atmosphere. The waiter was very kind and funny! The food was great. They had a large menu with lots of variety. We went for dinner and started with the pretzel bites. They came with Nutella which was a fun option. I got the falafel pita with fries. I also really enjoyed the meal. The drinks were delicious. Overall would recommend!!

Great dining experience! Was able to get a table immediately. Our server was very nice and funny. The food here was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the thai peanut pasta - such rich flavors. The alcoholic beverages are very tasty too. Would dine here again in a heartbeat!

Really enjoyed this dining experience. We went for dinner around 6:15 pm and we were able to be seated immediately for a table of 3 inside. Our waiter was so friendly and welcoming!! The menu had a wide variety of things to choose from and they all sounded delicious! It was hard to make a decision. Outside they had music playing which was very fun and inside they had fun holiday decorations. I got the Thai peanut pasta and I loved it. I thought it was a very unique dish and it was ~$14. The appetizer and drink were also very good. I would go back here again!

The music and service is really what gives this place the 4 stars.  The food wasn't anything to special but also wasn't bad. They have a great bar and ton of options, so if you're looking for a place by the beach this isn't a bad option.

The best part was the outdoor seating with a musician, who I wish I could remember her name was amazing played guitar, violin and sang!

The servers were quick and on top of their tables, it's always a huge bonus when you have great service, makes a really basic burger seem kind of fancy.

Atmosphere is a bit loud and casual
Service great
Food ok
Prices a little more than I'd like to spend on that level of food, but any restaurant with a menu that large tends to have those same issues.

The gouda cheese grits were 5 stars, but the crab Benedict was 3. So we're averaging a 4 star review. The amount of hollandaise given was so sad. I asked for an additional side because there was just nothing on the plate. It was busy when we came in, but service was good and timely.
This was such a fun brunch experience. Because the food is so good, there is quite a wait in the morning, but worth it!
Great place for brunch!  Unusual offerings and tasty comfort food can be found here!  On Sunday morning you'll find a fun Bloody Mary bar!  Cool place and perfect for the family vacationers!

business.name: Catelli Duo - Voorhees
business.categories: Bars, Restaurants, Italian, Wine Bars, Cocktail Bars, Nightlife

reviews.text: Update- I believe this restaurant has now closed permanently. It never reopened after the March 2020 lockdown.
Service great happy hour is amazing the happy hour food menu is fresh and tasty !!! Must try is the cucumber martini !!!
Fair. Food was okay. Service was nice but not particularly attentive. Bar service was slow and soda was flat.
The food was mediocre but the service was amazing. I at the cheese steak egg rolls and rib eye steak. Nothing to brag about.

Everything was wonderful from the start. Seated quickly. Bread quickly on table.  Attended to by probably the best waiter I've ever had in my life ( Mike ) , food came quickly and perfect timing ( appetizer, main ), Mike super attentive. And the food was phenomenal. Calamari. Lobster bisque. Ahi tuna putanesca. Vegetable amore. Everything outstanding. Someone please give Mike a raise.

I have been coming here since it's opening . Over the years the menu has seen its changes. Overall they always seem to find a good balance. I am finally getting  around to leaving a review lol. Last evening we were seated right away. Our waiter was quick to greet us. He did a great job explaining the chefs specials " which we ordered". Started with the duo  calamari, and the seafood platter. Food came out quick. The seafood platter was fresh and tasty. The calamari was cooked just right. The main course didn't disappoint. It was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Great dining experience as usual. I always recommend Catelli Duo to friends and family.

We came to Catelli today for their Santa brunch and my birthday. Upon our arrival they informed us that they were out of highchairs for a children's event! We then waited 15-20 minutes without being greeted so we flagged another wait staff down and helped our selves to the buffet. Our waitress still hadn't come to the table to greet us, so one of the hostess' came over and took our drink order. Our waitress finally came to greet us, bringing our drinks, then never saw her again. Once our waitress finally came to the table for our drink order we were already done eating. We then continued to sit around and wait for the waitress to ask for the bill, which never happened so I went to the bar tender who happened to also be an owner. We were then charged for our 2 year old despite 3 and under being free. We had a bad experience here 4 years ago and are sorry we gave Catelli another chance! There are much better quality restaurants and service elsewhere in this area, do not waste your time or money here.

I attended a bridal shower here today and was very dissatisfied with the food and service.  We let the restaurant know ahead of time that I needed a vegan option due to a dairy allergy.  Since my daughter is breastfeeding her infant who also has a dairy allergy she requested the same.  The server told us she would be serving us a "veggie amora".  Service was very slow and when the food came it contained a large portion of risotto that was clearly cooked with butter and cream.  When I brought this to the servers attention she admonished me loudly enough for the next table to hear and said the chef would never have approved it if it were not vegan and that it was probably just the chicken broth (!). Nonetheless neither of us trusted the food since even the potatoes tasted like they had been cooked with butter.  So we did not eat.  When I brought this to the attention of a second server she went to check with the chef and came back with the first server to apologize and tell us the food was definitely not vegan.  They offered to bring us something else but by that time everyone was finished their meal.  My daughter had to stop at wegmans for a meal on the way home.  I would suggest you stay away if you have any dietary concerns because they are clearly not up to the task.

Let me start by saying the food deserves 5 stars, but the service we had tonight was awful. We came here for my mom's birthday and none of us had been here before. Our server, Evan, greeted us as soon as we sat down and seemed to be nice. The bread did not come out until about 45 seconds before our meals. Our waters were never refilled when 2/3 were empty before our meals came. The bread basket sat empty on the table throughout the whole meal until the paper caught on fire by the candle on the table. Even then, no employee came over we had to extinguish the fire using the one water that was not empty. Our server finally returned afterwards and never apologized for the fire, never sent a manager over, and STILL did not refill waters. I've worked as a server for several years and I would never let a table leave without a manager coming over after all of that. I don't know that I would return given the poor service and the lack of managerial presence in the front of house.

This was always our favorite spot. In the last year I'm not Sure what happened. Food has improved. They put menu items back that were once removed. However with the weather changing we decided to sit outside so we could watch the games. Out of four (4) TVs they are down to one working tv. One has been broke for a year!!!!!!  With football here, baseball playoffs soon to come and hockey season approaching, definitely not going back for one tv. Get them fixed!  

It's good thing they still have Scotty!

Great food! I ordered the Seafood Vodka pasta which came with shrimp and crab in a blush sauce. I ordered my son the chicken fingers and fries which were very good and had the bread pudding. The donut for the bread pudding was a lil dry and very sweet. However, I would try the dessert one more time before I completely write it off. Everyone I came here with enjoyed their food and drinks and our waiter was great! I think his name was Steve?...he did a awesome job and would definitely come back here
Excellent service and menu! Enjoyed celebrating my mother's 50th here. Stunning locations!

Went for H H. Food was mediocre. Prices reduced but so were portions.  Most places reduce prices but portions stay the same. Past couple visits for meals have been so so. Will be giving this place a rest for a while.

I came here for a spur of the moment happy hour on a Thursday night. It's been down pouring every day the past few weeks (ugh!) so needless to say the bar area was not crowded.  It was just my fiance and I, we sat ourselves at a high top at the instruction of the hostess who quickly brought over menus in case we wanted other food too. 

I got their cucumber martini-I am a little bit of a wimp when it comes to martinis, but this one was really good. Refreshing, and definitely could still taste the vodka, but it was nice to sip on. They have a pretty decent happy hour food menu.  We split the cheese board, which came with two cheese, pieces of crostini, grapes, dried cranberries, and honey, an order of the chicken parm spring rolls, and their calamari.  We really enjoyed all of their apps! 

The reason for the 3 stars is because we also ordered their chicken francaise meal-and it was just meh.  The sauce was really good, but the chicken was more than slightly rubbery.  It is normally served with mashed potatoes and green beans, but we opted for roasted potatoes instead.  Some were good, and others were extremely under cooked. 

They had a live band playing outside that seemed like a lot of fun.  We will definitely be back for happy hour, but I'm not too sure about the dinner part.
Catellis is always a good time!! Great food, great drinks, great entertainment! Service is always prompt. Love sitting on patio outside this time of year.

We came here for dinner and the food was very good. The different portion sizes were excellent and the main courses were good but next time we will try the pizza. The mixed drinks were very strong so be ready to drink a strong drink. Try the Pear salad we split and was excellent. I would come back  again.

Other than the price I was pretty satisfied by this place. It is very similar to Brio quality wise which isn't a bad thing. It has the typical chain-like consistency which isn't always bad but definitely not unique. The mussels were fresh which isn't as common as you would think so that was cool. Their fried eggplant with mozzarella and marinara was my appetizer and was great. I had the beet salad for dinner which was really good, good portion. Other than location and price for quality I have no complaints and wouldn't decline if it was brought up as a place to go get a light dinner.

Not sure how this place is still in business.  Horrible service, food isn't good, they don't let you sit in the outside section anymore.  Drinks on the menu not tasty either.  Really not much going on here.
Back in town. I sat at the bar, had the calamari much better than the chicken parmesan. Service was ok but it was busy

This place is ok. We used to enjoy their create your own pasta menu item but they recently removed it so most likely we won't be returning as often. Their short rib stuffed long hots are really good! Their tiramisu was definitely off. Not worth it.

The outside bar is nice. Alyse is a great bartender and took really good care of us. We ordered off the starter menu, eggplant and vegetable board. Big portions and very tasty. We will definitely be back soon.
Roger is the best waiter; he is very enthusiastic & attentive...Food was fabulous! We will be back!

I came in from Southern CA however I am orinally from NY. Rode around in an uber that was lost so by the time I got there it was late I was exhausted and hungry. Wasn't sure if I could get served. The waiter Rodger was very accommodating and professional. Although the chicken parm was a little overcooked by NY standards it was better than I've had in a long while. Waiter/service was very good.

Loved this place ! Food was delicious. I got the osteria wings and Caesar salad for happy hour . The appletini was yummy and they also surprised me with a taste testing of their cheesesteak egg roll ! It was amazing . I sat at the bar outside . The bartender was a sweetie pie . I definitely will be coming back . And for those that dine alone .. this is a great place to visit especially for happy hour ! I came on a Thursday .

Had a really great brunch there. They were nice enough to give us a private room and take care of our group of 20.  The service was just amazing and the amount of food was perfect. Would highly recommend this place and for large group gatherings, they were so accommodating.

business.name: Salt + Smoke
business.categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Barbeque, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Nightlife

reviews.text:
3.5/5 

This was our first time ordering and unfortunately we weren't blown away like the other reviews said we would be. 

I got the besties 2: chicken and pork with Mac n cheese 

Hubs got the pulled pork sandwich with beans. 

We both agreed the best part of the meal was the bbq sauces! That bestie sauce 

I don't regret trying this while in town, but we preferred pappy's.

We came in late on Sunday evening January 2nd. We were politely greeted and seated right away. The service through the whole meal was exceptional!
the food we both ordered was brought to us in the right amount of time and everything we had was just great!
