we took some pie with us for later in the evening, bought a few bottles of BBQ sauce and will definitely make it a point to stop here when passing through!
i've have experienced the best service ever for my hubby and i will promise to give great reviews and i promise to compliment chef. keep up the good work

Travel for work. Was told by the locals to check it out. BBQ is amazing, loves the white cheddar macaroni, fairly priced for quantity and quality. Loved the theme and vibe of the restaurant. FullY stocked bar. Would highly recommend. 


Jaime is a wonderful server!

Trashed ribs were amazing!  Had to get an extra order to go!   Food came out hot and had the perfect spices.  Didn't need any sauce on the brisket.   Service was quick and never let our glass get empty.   Sat outside in a warm December day.   Very nice atmosphere and area!

I forgot to take a picture of my plate when it first came out because the smell of the food was so amazing. You're looking at a half eaten brisket sandwich and half of the white cheddar mac. The brisket was delicious. On one half I used the "My Sweet Bestie" sauce which was a sweet sauce and Scrumdiddlyumptious, and on the other side I used the "Hotangy" which was the hotter and more spicy sauce, also very good. The Mac was very rich with cracker crumbs on top. AMAZING! I'm not even joking when I say the food came out in 10 minutes. I whispered "there's no way" to my girlfriend because I didn't believe how fast it was. #cleanyourplate

The beet brisket that I personally have eaten. 
The white bbq sauce unique and tasty. Ribs were gone by the time we arrived. Cook/serving staff was, sweet, kind and helpful. 
Would give many more than 5 stars. 
A St. Louis landmark, for sure.
Amazing!! We had the brisket sandwich and bacon burger. There bbq sauce is so good and make sure you pick the white cheddar Mac and cheese as a side (you won't be disappointed).

I am a foodie, and I always look for a good food experience. This place totally met my expectations. . I stopped there on Sunday, on my way to Nashville, it wasn't very busy by time i arrived. Either the place itself, food and a drink I had was great. I had a plate of brisket, ribs, pulled pork along with fries and their top Mac and cheese. Recommend!
Wait times were very high with many tables open which points to a staff shortage. Overall the meat was good and the beer was good. I would recommend the burnt ends toasted raviolis.

AMAZING FOOD! We were only passing through the area and I looked up the top spots for BBQ. So glad we stopped by! -great customer service too. -If I ever make it back to St Louis, it's a definite stop!! 

I recommend the smoked brisket and the kale chicken salad with apricots and goat cheese. OMG (and yes, we were fat kids and tried the white cheddar mac, which had Ritz crackers on it... what?!!)
Longtime fans of Pappys smokehouse we were really pleased to have this delicious experience! What's not to love!?!

Went for the turkey and the brisket for Thanksgiving.  The turkey was delicious like the prior year. So much flavor and so moist.  The brisket, WOW!  Definitely recommend.  It was so tender, so much flavor.  Their pies were from a local bakery.   Highly recommend the brisket and the turkey.

Food is good but pricey 
And i wish they made the popovers without bacon 
Like i said i will eat here a lot it's just too much and i have to pay for 2 people

First time coming and absolutely delicious ribs and wings appetizers. I could eat a whole dinner with just those, the sauce was perfect!
My ribs and brisket were perfectly smoked and delicious. The fries were amazing, and the chili could be eaten as a meal. 
We will definitely be coming back.

Place is always busy.  Tangy  sauce.  Brisket sandwich is tender.  Pulled pork as well.  Ribs melt in your mouth.  Great sweet potato fries.  Big portions.  If you're worried  about cholesterol... don't come here.  Otherwise - eat up!

I really enjoyed the brisket and the deviled eggs that I had. Salt and Smoke has a great assortment of beers too. The service that we had was very good. We got there very late in the evening close to closing time. Portions were great, really enough for two people. The brisket was tasty and not fatty. The deviled eggs are something I always get at salt and smoke because it's good and it's not something you find anywhere else.

Salt +Smoke was Amazing! If you are visiting St. Louis, MO it's definitely a great restaurant to visit!! Great eats! 
The food was flavorful and portion size was great. The brisket and pull pork were a win. The Mac and cheese was recommended and did not disappoint. The cheddar and bacon bread accompanied each meal and was very good. Salt +smoke bbq sauces were great on the meat. I would highly recommend. Parking was limited but the food was definitely a winner. Everything tasted fresh and service was great.

A must come if you are in St. Louis. I've only been to this location, but there's usually a wait during meal times because the restaurant is small and popular. 

The service was fast and the staff was very kind and knowledgeable. It is easy to order online as well. I've eaten here four times and never had any major issues with the food (except once the popover was overcooked... was very dark brown/black). I have gotten the bestie combo (brisket) twice. The meat is SO well cooked! Recommended the white cheddar cracker mac. Good vibes in the restaurant - the perfect setting for friends and family.

We were really craving some BBQ so we stopped in here. TLDR: We were a party of 9 and we walked right in on a Saturday around 1:30pm and were able to be seated right away. But the entire party has to be there before you got seated.

The food was fine/good, but the service is what pushed me over to give it a 4 stars. Our server was really great and everything came out super fast. The combo plate is probably the best return - because you get to try the different types of meat. I would recommend the chicken skin - so good, but so bad for you, but so good.

Vegetarians can eat here! I had the Pimento Cheese Toasted Ravioli and the Kale salad. The ravioli was delicious with a bit of (flavorful not hot) spice. And the salad was so fresh and full of different elements that really tied it together well. Also got the Ranchwater and would recommend that. I'm sure the meat was good too. ;)
It was pretty good! I had the pulled pork and bacon beans, and corn soup  the fries were bomb!

I really liked this place! I'm on a pretty restrictive diet for allergy purposes so there was a lot on the menu i couldnt eat unfortunately. But fortunately I could eat the trashed wings and they were so good!

The waiter explained to me how they're cooked, I think it involved being fried twice? They were crispy outside and tender inside. I had the option of choosing sweet sauce or hot sauce and I chose the hot. I really liked their hot sauce! Great flavor and some kick, but not so spicy that I couldnt enjoy the food. However, my dining companion tried a wing and to him the sauce was way too hot so... Just be aware! To me, it was hotter than Sriracha but not by much.

This place is also great for large groups. We dropped by on a Thursday afternoon with no reservation and they were able to seat our group of 11 immediately.

Once again... Thank you yelp! This was truly the best barbecue in Missouri! The macaroni and cheese was the best we have ever had! The pulled pork was delicious, the drunken ribs were fantastic!  Great service! Nice atmosphere, we're only here for four days, but we are definitely going back to salt and smoke!

Omgggggg such good mac n cheese!!!!  WHITE CHEDDAR CRACKER MAC  - DO IT!

I also enjoyed bites of my bf's brisket sandwich

business.name: Lucky Dill Deli
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Food, American (New), Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch, Delis

reviews.text: My food was good and the service was good. I was enjoying my day and my time there. Then I got the bill. A 16 oz aluminum bottle of Bud Light was $6.50. That is SO MUCH higher then other bars in the area for the same thing. I am in Palm Harbor, Fl - not Yankee stadium. Everything was good, I just think the bottle beer was over priced.

Doesn't look like much when you drive by but it's unbelievable inside. It's worth checking out. They do charge a $2 sharing fee. You'll need to ask for mayonnaise or mustard if you want that on your sandwich.

I ordered a half sandwich of corned beef with delicious bow tie pasta salad. The sandwich was huge even for a half. The only thing I didn't like is that the bread is so thick, it was hard to enjoy. Not the typical New York bread that I'm used to. Our waitress was Rachel and she was very kind,  sweet and efficient. I would have given five stars if the restaurant was cleaner. I sat outside and over a half a dozen tables were filthy with dishes and cups still on them. I don't know why they were not cleaned as soon as people got up. The bathrooms were very dirty and there was puddles everywhere.
Basically I felt like I was back in NY with the filth. 
The food is really good so I give four stars

A couple of weeks ago my wife and I had lunch at the deli.   While there we saw the magnificent carrot cake at the bakery.  I ordered one for Christmas dinner.  I paid $85 for the cake and gave the lady a $15 tip to make sure it was ready and just as beautiful as the one in the case.  The picture is what I opened in front of my 23 guests on Christmas day.  I contacted the lucky dill for a reaction and - CRICKETS- apparently they just didn't care.  My opinion - Publix has a better tasting cake and Lucky Dill didn't care about my disappointment.

It was really hard not to give a 2 but I really didn't want to rate them so low-they have so much potential! Perhaps they've just gotten so busy they don't have time to try to guarantee quality anymore? 
It is a decent sandwich-but the greasy bread and lack of flavor in the coleslaw (both on the sandwich and on the side) in NO WAY warrants paying $18 for one. 
The bakery next door is cute, and I hope they improve-being from the Northeast we take our deli food quality to heart, and I wasn't getting the warm and fuzzies here...

Tasty sandwiches, nice staff, and the food came out fast! The fries were warm and crisp with the perfect amount of salt. We got the hillbilly Philly and the Tom from Buffalo and both were super tasty!

Still a good place to eat despite what some folks complain about in here. Has the service suffered a tad, sure name something that hasn't in the pandemic. The Rubin is still great a little smaller then it used to be in MY OPINION but there huge still. Great atmosphere the dinner options other then sandwiches are good too. If you like a NY style deli this as good as it is in the area.

My wife and I went to the Thanksgiving dinner yesterday. Don't know what happened...hopefully it was the augment crew. It was terrible. Although we were seated within 5 minutes of the reservation, we sat at the table for an hour before we were served the main course.  And we were starving...server was pompous and arrogant.  After all, what were we going to do? Get up and walk out? Several tables around us were served before us even though we were seated 15 minutes before them.  When the food arrived we got mashed potatoes and gravy, sweet potato (I was confused, 2 potatoes.) Two slices of turkey, and stuffing. Turkey and stuffing were cold.  Stuffing was from a box, as were the potatoes.  Too much bouillon in the stuffing (extremely salty). Anything we needed we had to ask for. Several times. For such a plain dinner why the struggle? For $39.50 per person?? We are not giving up on lucky dill... but we won't make the Thanksgiving mistake again. (PS: we observed the servers at the other tables,  and concluded that many of my grievances would not be voiced if they had served us.)

Normally we really enjoy this local joint for lunch but today we decided to drop in for breakfast and pick it up to-go in the bakery. The bakery associate seemed very annoyed to be working the day after Thanksgiving and even complained to her coworker at the tip amount left (yes, in front of us). The service, high cost, and the 25 minute wait for toasted bagels with smear solidified that we won't be returning for breakfast-- try any other place.

Best. Sandwich. Place. EVER! I can't even call it a sandwich shop anymore...they have added so much to this menu over the years, it's outrageous. No item I've gotten has been nothing less than delicious. Their bakery is to die for!

TIPS:

1) it is ALWAYS busy. You may get lucky on a weekday around 230 in the middle day between lunch rush and dinner time. 

2) don't get a takeout order. Even though I highly recommend Lucky Dill, I recommend going into the establishment. I have yet to get a takeout order that's 100% accurate. Reason for 1-less star :(
Great Sandwich!  Good Folks that own it ! suggest stopping at bakery after eating and brining home some treats!

My wife and I came for breakfast here, because we used to frequent prior to COVID. 
TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT! Don't waste your money. 
The menus offered a FEW lame options compared to what they used to have. The French toast was burnt. The poached eggs were sitting in water when brought to the table. 
The restaurant was empty and we used to have to wait to get in. Now we know why. The place has completely gone down hill with lousy food and no menu options.
The restaurant needs a good cleaning.  Overall appearance is disshufled, and lack the quality they used to provide. Food ok.

We ordered curbside pick-up . The food was still warm and packed well. My husband had the Cuban Reuben and I had the French dip - both were generous sandwiches and very tasty . We also had a slice of the German chocolate cake and it was awful. I mean had a quarter piece of the huge slice and threw the rest out awful. Dry cake with cloyingly sweet ,too thick frosting . The sandwiches were good but to have to throw out an $8 slice of cake that was inedible from a bakery was pretty irritating!

The atmosphere was cool, the service was slow, the food was plentiful. The portion size was huge but the food was not seasoned at all. The best part of the experience was the delicious bakery/desserts.

I love everything about Lucky Dill-variety to choose from, themed restaurant and a bakery right there with a million things!  The only drawback is it is hit & miss with the servers-some are fantastic some are average and then there's the guy we had a couple of weeks ago-pretty darn bad!  It was not busy, but he was soooo slow, never asked if we wanted more to drink, didn't check on us once our entrees arrived, he just caused us a poor experience that night but again I love the place

I was in Palm Harbor yesterday and decided to stop by Lucky Dill Deli. They have been on my list for quite a while, but I am rarely up that way. I had heard great things about their monster sandwiches, so I had to try one.

I walked in and grabbed a seat at the bar. The bartender was great throughout my visit. The menu was extensive, but I had my eye on the monster reuben sandwich. It had over 1 pound of corned beef on a single sandwich.  The bartender doubted I could finish it, but I was ready to prove him wrong. I put the order in and started with some latkes. 

The latkes came out and they looked great. They were served with sour cream, apple sauce, and sliced apples. They had great flavor and texture. The sandwich came out shortly after and it was a monster. I sized it up and realized the only thing it was missing was enough Russian dressing. The bartender grabbed me a few more sides of dressing and I went to town on that thing. The flavor was spot on. It was incredibly meaty. I am not going to lie, it was a struggle to finish it, but I did. The last few bites had me on the struggle bus, but I prevailed. 

Overall, I loved my first visit to the Lucky Dill Deli. The food and service were great.  The menu is extensive and I will definitely be back soon to try out some other menu items that caught my eye. I dont think I will be doing another monster reuben, but they had so many other great looking sandwiches that it would be hard to go wrong.

Typically is pretty good. Had an incident where we made a reservation at 1145 and when we got there they told us that they could seat us until 12 due to lunch menu being switch out. Which is fine, typically, but there was literally a lobby room full of people waiting to be seated jammed back like sardines while there are a ton of empty seats in the restaurant. Maybe training the staff to better handle that situation might be good.

Can I say wow  
I'm sorry to say my boyfriend and I have an addiction... 
The sandwiches are AMAZING. You will need a to go box . I've even tried some random foods such as the Ruben rolls and French onion crock. 
Service is great and their bakery is ADDICTING. We have spent $50 on their desserts!!
This is our new spot. Pure comfort food!!!

This place is a little pricey but the portions make up for it. You definitely get what you pay for. I love the half sandwich option. 

The restaurant is giant and you could almost get lost trying to navigate to the bathroom. 

Service is always prompt and friendly.

Always consistent, boneless Buffalo wings this time and they were perfect...
Service is always great, thank you, Brent, Heidi and Alexis...

It had been a really long time since I'd been, maybe 4 years.  Went on Sunday afternoon around 3 pm and it was busy so eat at the bar.  No longer is there breakfast all day but limit the breakfast choices to 4 items.  Went with the cobb salad and was not as promised.  It had iceberg and no romaine.  Also, weirdly it had slices of pickles which as no listed on the menu.  Also there is corn which is also very strange though it is on the menu with that included.  The buffalo ranch was good but no one brought out salad dressing with the salad so had to get that after.  The service was ok as the bartender's were busy with making drinks.  My partners omelet was good but the toast was cold and not buttered.  Also fine but since it was cold and maybe not toasted it wouldn't spread.  The desserts looked great but didn't go for it.  That line for them was insane.  It may be a while until I go back again.  Not bad but not great, though the salad was huge.  I wanted to try the whitefish salad but getting a bagel sandwich seemed really pricey at $15.

I truly enjoy this place, it has a great variety and look at those cakes!  In full transparency, I will say certain items may be a little hit or miss. Or I guess to be fair sometimes it's just better than others especially on the healthier items. For instance ... I love the conundrum, but on occasion it's more of a salad on bread and the grouper gets lost.  The Al Panino was excellent as were the onion rings.  I have never had onion rings here before; but they are truly some of the best I have had! Now most people who come in here don't go for super healthy items, and in that regard there ginormous sandwiches usually make everybody very happy!  I have had the turkey Reuben here and have yet to finish the whole thing (and I can eat).. luckily it warms up great as a snack later.  One of these days I will try one of those 10 to 12 inch tall cakes, when my sugar coma is over I'll let you all know how worth it it was :)

My family and I really enjoy the food from lucky dill but the customer service has always been subpar, regardless we continue to go, but not anymore after the way I was accused of lying about extra shrimp that was left out of my order which we paid for. In short once my husband came home with the order I noticed that my salad had its normal side of shrimp it always comes in a white cup, but there was no extra shrimp in the cup and there was no shrimp on the salad or an extra cup anywhere. This is not the first time we've paid for something and not received it and I just let it go, but at this point i was just annoyed because of how often it happens. I called and Holly answered, I made her aware what happened and she stated that it shouldn't  be a issue to refund the $4 back to my card. She put me on hold so she could speak to the manager Karen. She then came back to the phone and said, "I don't know how to say this but my manager said that she knows the extra shrimp is in there and she won't refund you." I then naturally got upset and said you're joking right? And then I asked to speak with Karen and then was put on hold for about 2 minutes. Holly came back to the phone and said it's really busy tonight and my manager said to take your number and she'll call you back, I then stated is that really going happen at which Holly said I'm sorry I don't know what to say I can only go from what she's saying and the expo also said they made the extra side of shrimp. I said never mind don't have her call and advised i would be leaving a review on google and that it is ridiculous that I'm being treated like a thief and liar, I then asked for the GMs name. It's evident that Karen doesn't know the first thing about being a manager. She should've gotten on the phone, period. She shouldn't have left it up to Holly who doesn't make enough money to deal with stuff like this, and she shouldn't have conveyed to Holly to tell me I'm a liar and thief. Holly was very nice and I'm sorry that she was made the go between because Karen is not a good manager. It's not about the $4 it's about the way I was treated. Thanks.

First I would Like to say is, My hamburger was not done right, the employees where rude we sat outside there outside waiter was rude, the outside bartender was siting around doing nothing would not assist the other waiter as they were swapped, being my first i will never go back . i write for a newspaper i got them . the one in palm harbor  ... they suck

business.name: Hirosaki
business.categories: Restaurants, Sushi Bars, Japanese

reviews.text: If you want a cool dining experience, you need to try this restaurant. I enjoyed my experience from the minute I walked in. You can dine at a table or chose to have your meal cooked in front of you by talented chefs. I always enjoy their filets. Their "House Ginger" dressing is so yummy. The place is clean and entertaining for the entire family!

I was surprised not to see higher reviews. We did not have hibachi,  so maybe that is a different experience,  but our group went for sushi and had a wonderful experience!

The server was friendly, attentive and accurate. We asked to have our sushi plated separately and everything came out correct including our bills. 

It was a Friday night and they were pretty busy,  but the food came out surprisingly fast! Our order was accurate which doesn't sound like a big deal,  but for sushi it can be. 

Everything was hot and tasted fresh and delicious! And as sushi goes,  it was reasonably priced and good serving sizes. Specialty rolls ranges from $12-$15 which is on the lower side of standard for sushi in this city. 

Our waitress was outstanding! She was friendly,  engaged us,  but not too much,  made sure we had everything we needed,  checked on us throughout the meal,  etc. 

I would go back and recommend this place if you're in the area.
Love this place. Yea bathrooms are kinda gross but the food is amazing!!! One of my wife and I's favorite go to spots!!

This restaurant has been my go to place for sushi and hibachi on the west side...that changed today. Our waitress was very rude and seemed very preoccupied with other tables. Giving the benefit of the doubt as my group had 6 people and there were other groups there larger than mine that she had to assist. Her rudeness was also noted by someone that joined our table. We ordered an appetizer that didn't come out until our food was prepared. By then it wasn't much of an appetizer. Someone at our table(not with our party) found a long hair in her soup. The gentleman cooking our food miscalculated portion sizes and everyone received varying amounts of rice and veggies. Those that had the same thing missed out on portions(for me it was scallops) my mother ordered the steak and shrimp and he had given all of the shrimp away and had to request more be sent out in order to make hers. Finally when it came time to pay, the waitress through my card on the table and said "Decline". I explained that was impossible and asked to run the card again. She told me "No I ran it 4 times". I asked if she could again and this time she ran the card while I looked on. The credit card reader said "Chip Malfunction" yet she insisted my card declined. Someone who I assume was a leader came over to help. She too saw the message and said the same thing about my card declining. I replied that it says chip malfunction and not decline and that I've not had issues with my card all day. To which she replied "we run lots of cards everyday". I think she sensed my frustration and went to another terminal to try my card. And like magic, it worked. I have never been more embarrassed at a business. The amount of disappointment with the service and food have made me not want to return. No pictures because honestly there was nothing photo worthy.

Food is great!  Time to clean the bathrooms and do some maintenance. The place is just dirty. We love the sushi and hibachi with outstanding service. Please clean the windows and replace the rotted wood.
Had dinner here a few times and I've never been disappointed. I love that they have half price sushi night.

It is hard to find great sushi. Look no further. Not only does this place cook on a tabletop in front of you, you can also sit sushi bar front. It is the closest to good Cali sushi that I can find!  Thanks for great service, great food, and a great night! We will be back!

Always a hit when we go here for dinner. This, in my opinion, is the best hibachi in the city that we have been too. The staff is always friendly and the chefs make the experience fun and enjoyable. The food is very good, as well as the sushi, that Is 1/2 price on Tuesday's and Wednesday's.

Was in the mood for a Japanese steakhouse, and visited this spot for the first time ever - which is amazing, considering I remember when it appeared! It was later in the evening so things were quieter and we had our own table/grill. I had the plum wine, which if you like sweet wine, was very nice. I had steak and scallop and my boyfriend had steak, and a couple shrimp were thrown in as well. We were served what I'm guessing is the clear soup, and the salad had a creamy ginger sauce. The entrée preparation was entertaining, and the chef even fired up the onion volcano a second time so I could take a video, haha. Food was great - I don't typically love fried rice, but when it's fresh off the grill it's amazing, and Hirosaki did not disappoint. Price feels a little high, but I think is typical for a Japanese steakhouse. Overall nice experience, will have to come back again soon!

I have never had any issues with their food (always get to go, both hibachi & sushi).  Always hot and/or stored correctly for the temperature.  Their half priced sushi rolls on Tuesday and Wednesday are the best deal in Avon! The reason it's lacking an extra star is because the front of house always seems so discombobulated and not very attentive.

After waiting for 45 minutes after being quoted 20 minutes every single party that arrived at the restaurant ahead and after us was seated. When confronting the hostess about the situation she was dishonest in saying that we had been called and didn't respond. That wasn't possible as we were seated directly next to the hostess stand. We were not offered and solution, lied to and the manager didn't get involved although he was standing there talking on his cell phone. After many happy visits they won't be getting our business again

Tuesday and Wednesday is half off sushi. That's it. That's the review. Just kidding lol. If I'm in the Avon area I definitely stop in for the sushi it's delish (and cheap). Our server was a little persistent in taking our order and after a long day of work we were kind of in the mood to relax and take it easy. Everything went well our food came out good, we ate and left. I've only been for the sushi and Haven't experienced the cooking at the hibachi table. When we left around 7pm it had gotten quite busy. If you want some inexpensive su
Love the half price sushi, however when a server brings me the wrong plate of sushi (my roll plus another one) don't make me pay for what I didn't order.  Service was not great today

The food was good but we ordered drinks and the blue Hawaiian was terrible and made in a martini glass.  It was way too strong.  I took maybe 2 drinks and when I sent it back the lady was very rude and said that I had drank half of the drink.  Untrue, I could not get more than 2 drinks down because it was so terrible.  Because of her poor customer service skills I will never visit this establishment again.  Besides, there are better hibachis.

Do you like sushi? Lots of flavor and tons of options? Great prices? Then Hirosaki is the place for you. Working on this side of town a couple years ago made this place my go-to every Tuesday and Wednesday for lunch and get this... half price sushi?! Yes please! Cherry Blossom, Mango Tango, Las Vegas, so many fantastic options. I always make sure to plan my West side trips around Tuesday and Wednesday just to take advantage of it, and even if I have to drive an extra 20 minutes out of my way. Now if only there was some way to keep sushi fresh for days. Elon Musk should quit screwing around with the Hyper Loop and solve that conundrum!

Wednesday Half off!!! Woot! These rolls were actually rolled the size you get normally in California or Hawaii. Nearly all places I've been out here in Indiana were stingy on their roll sizes. I just thought it was a thing out here... Nope, this place respects the sushi roll portion ratios. 

Taste: 9/10 very good tasting rolls. So far so good, we are coming back. 100%

I went to Hirosaki for a nice hibachi lunch. We went with two friends and my wife and daughter. My son stayed home so I placed a to go order. The lunch prices are still available on Saturday which is nice. One common thing I have noticed is that it is a place where dinner will be a bit more expensive vs lunch so I am glad the lunch menu was available.

The service was great very attentive both from our waitress and the cook. They do have a good sushi, shashimi menu on top of the hibachi menu. My friend did order the lunch sushi combo which is nice as you can pick the rolls you want from a lot of choices. The hibachi menu has the standard array of choices and includes soup but to add the salad is just a few dollars.

The cook was entertaining and did a good job making all the meals and I ordered the scallops. I thought they tasted great. The vegetables here thought are better in quantity than I have gotten at other places. The fried rice was great and tasted less oily. Overall a good lunch experience. Just remember you will need longer time to eat here for hibachi. They do have a nice bar area and regular tables if you just want sushi or retreating chicken lunch boxes.
Amazing food! Definitely get more than your suppose to eating at the grill! Very filling! Will go again!!

I was trying to o take the kids to experience what I did at another place similar but the experience was t really the same, the night started and immediately we were told they've been busy all day and only have 3 cooks(which at the time didn't seem bad considering there weren't many people in the place) there were 3 hibachi tables including us with guest the other 2 were just finishing up as we sat down. I went to koto in Carmel the night before and told the guy I wanted the kids to see the hype lol, he said well we'll have to step it up. The chef here didn't really do much as far as entertainment he hide the egg in his pocket but that was it. The servings were small as well compared to what I had the night before at another establishment similar, the chef seemed exhausted to be honest with you, even my kids said when we left "he seemed tired mom" ‍ food was pretty decent. They do have a beautiful entry into the restaurant they have a love pond and beautiful artwork.

If you aren't ordering half price sushi from here than what have you been doing Tuesday or Wednesday nights? Service is always incredible! Sushi is freshly made within minutes of ordering! Lots of the sushi options use spicy mayo so make note of that. The bar is huge with a large selection of beer, wine, and liquor. Edamame, miso soup, and crab salad is also super good!! Stop by and grab apps and sushi! Or order half price sushi to go and eat at home with your own bottle of wine!

Very spacious compared to some of the other hibachi which makes it little less hectic, we've been twice now an been shuttled right in, asked politely if we minded waiting a few minutes while they waited to see if any last minute arrivals, the waitresses (one was in training on this visit) was still fast an polite, the trainee even made a point to ask us to bear with her she was still learning m, an apologized ahead of time if she was slow or mid wrote something, ordered sushi an a appetizer came out fast an fresh tasting, an of course the entrees well we all know they taste the same everywhere, entertainment was lil lackluster we was sitting with a older couple an they didn't really seemed to entranced so the guy gave us the medium, an we even came at a busy time ..overall was a great time give it a try I really can't see this being a bad choice

I was craving Japanese food and decided to give them a try on Doordash.  The sushi was satisfactory, but what really turned me off was that their chicken katsu (cutlet) wasn't breaded in panko like it traditionally is and tasted bland as a result.  Their miso soup also had an off taste to it and had noodles in it, which I found odd.  I gave them three stars because they didn't miss anything on my order and the yakisoba turned out okay.  I wouldn't eat here again.

Note: I lived in Hawaii for 18 years and Japan for 10 years so I probably have very high standards when it comes to Japanese cuisine.

I take my hat off and say thank you to Hirosaki, due to the fact that this was the place where I was introduced and fell in love with sushi. Up until I was approximately 20 or maybe 21, I had never tasted sushi. My best friend took me here and it was a far beyond superb first experience. Initially, my first thoughts on what sounded ideal to me was something along the lines of hibachi shrimp and steak with fried rice. But, with a little poking and prodding and encouragement from my buddy, I decided to give in and broaden my horizons by trying some authentic Japanese sushi. Right off the bat, the waitresses, hostesses, and hibachi chefs are very engaging and enthusiastic. Nothing in particular struck me to where I would declare or label this place filthy or unkept. Cleanliness seems to be something they could put on a resume as a qualification. From placing a drink or meal order up until you receive your food, the timing is pretty decent and along the lines of ideal. Long enough so you can catch up and talk with your date, friend, or family members, but quick enough to where you don't get anxious because your stomach is growling from hunger. Oh yeah, miso soup and a small salad are included with your meal. 

What I got that first time is pretty typical to what I get every time I go there now: 1 shrimp sushi roll, 1 scallop sushi roll, 1 spicy chicken roll, and a miso soup. I love seafood so I didn't think or assume that I would not take too kindly to this new delicacy. I loved every single bite I had that night. What I really appreciate and what stands out to me about the spicy chicken roll, is that it would make a very good introductory sushi roll to possibly a preteen or young adult who wants to get into sushi. Then, I'd say branch out and give the shrimp or crab roll a chance afterwards.

I have always loved this place and I can't see myself not continuing to go in the near future!

This place seems kinda weird from the outside, but it's so so yummy! When you enter in, you tell the waitress if you'd like to go to the bar, the hibachi, or just the regular restaurant. I highly recommend the hibachi! The way it works is you sit (usually with strangers) around a huge stove top, choose what you want, and a chef comes out and prepares the food for you right there! Usually the chefs show-boat a little to make it fun & its a great way to meet and chat with new people! Plus the food. Is. Phenomenal. Omg, the fried rice here is the best I have ever had in my life -- SO SO YUMMY! The only downfall is they do try to have an almost full table before they prepare the food, so sometimes you're seated, but have to wait 5-10 minutes for others to be seated at the same table. TOTALLY worth it though! Highly, highly recommend if you're in the area looking for something new to try, or just looking for good food!
Our first visit takeout and we were pleased with everything. Had the beef ramen, beef and chicken satay and chili wonton. Flavors were great.

business.name: Yardley Inn Restaurant & Bar
business.categories: Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, American (New)

reviews.text:
What a lovely reward for such a hectic holiday weekend! A relaxing brunch! The service is top-notch and the food is so delicious and creative. I love my squash soup and the quiche is absolutely divine. I got the English breakfast tea on the side my quiche came with a salad and a little chopped fruit selection. And the staff is very very attentive and efficient and kind and friendly!
It was such a beautiful day that I enjoyed from the inside looking out. The view of the Delaware river is just the cherry on top of a beautiful cake. I love this place and can't wait to come back.

We come here when we visit my in-laws. The restaurant never disappoints. It has a cozy pub setting overlooking the Delaware River, although it can feel cramped when it's a full house. We always get whatever fish dish they have on the menu - how could you not? Definitely worth trying if you are in the area.

Great location especially if you get the window seat to the river. Staff is professional and friendly. The decor is very warming and inviting, especially during the holiday season. A great beverage selection as well!

We pass this Inn on the way to my parents frequently and decided to try it out for lunch.
My husband had the Caesar Salad and I tried the Hummus. Both were very good. Atmosphere was very nice. The weather was still nice out and they do have outdoor dining, but we decided to go inside. It was quite busy at 2PM in the afternoon during the week. Only seating available was near the bar at a table. Staff was friendly and service was excellent.

We've lived in the area for 18 years and have eaten here numerous times over the years. But will never go again! We've only eaten outside since Covid. The Inn has tent seating. Tonight (11-12-21) we had a 6:30 reservation in the tent. Second time in the last month we've eaten in it. We both ordered the Yardley Inn burger which we've had often. During the second to last bite of my husband's, he bit into a grape shaped item. Impossible to chew or cut. When he brought it to our waitress's attention she asked if he'd like another burger. Really?  He is obviously finished with this one. How could he eat another? She then said, " I'll tell him?"  Who is she referring to?  It was not taken off our bill. My husband will never complain. I would have. In addition, when we arrived home he told me about the large mouse in the tent ( he said it was not a field mouse). The reason he waited is because I'm terrified of them and likely would have screamed and not eaten!  Disgusting meal.

We just happened to be in the area, and decided to eat dinner here. We are so happy we did. They were able to accommodate us with a table for my family and I without a reservation on a busy Saturday night in just under ten minutes. The hostess was a sweetheart and upon entering was amazed at the interior of the place. As soon as you sit down, it feels cozy and warm; like home. It was beautiful on the inside and the staff was super friendly and understanding! Our food was delicious and I highly recommend the pork chop. I highly recommend this establishment and the next time we are in the area again will come back.

I would consider myself a semi-regular at this restaurant and I always enjoy the food and service.  I will continue to dine here but I will not order the Chicken and Waffles- they are so far below the high standard of this restaurant. Waffle is dense and chewy and no flavor. Maybe the worst waffle I have ever had. The fried chicken is just 3 little chicken tenders nothing special to say the least.  If I were the Chef I would take this item off the menu it's just doesn't meet the standard of the other food.

Yikes...Saturday night dinner for 4.  Not good tonight.  Very disappointing.  Service started out fine then slipped off to "where did she get to?"   But that wasn't even an issue really.  Our food was not memorable and felt reheated and old.  For example, hubby's burger was way over cooked, same with fries, plus fries were cold.  He was very disappointed.  Calamari was over fried and a very small portion.  In fact that was more disgraceful than anything.  My lemon chicken was nothing special.  I actually make a better and more tender chicken than what was served.  I hardly ever get chicken out but lemon chicken sounded so good.  It was oddly smothered in green olives.  The best choice was the salad with chicken.  I raved about the crab bisque and they didn't have any crab.  Sigh...no crab bisque.  My martini was very good.  Our friends ordered the $19 speciality drink and it was just fair. Our friends had not been to Yardley Inn for years as they had written it off their list a few years back. They wanted to revisit and see if it improved from their last time...sadly they won't be back.  I picked the restaurant...darn.
Disappointed. First time here, sat at the bar. It's obvious the regulars get better service.

Super parents to dinner tonight for restaurant week and food was awesome. Drinks were great and the sea bass was delicious. My mom had the chicken which she said was amazing and my dad had the Ruben which he said it was also great. And I must say that the Yardley inn has the hottest waitress I've ever seen in my life. So if you're reading this girl with chest tattoo you are gorgeous LOL

Wow.... Just wow! 
This restaurant is everything I had wished for. Great cocktails , food and service. I recommend the cucumber martini and hardly burger.

I used to like to go to this place but lately, their answer is " we can seat you for dinner at 4pm or 9:30". So haven't been there for quite sometime - and the upside is that it has encouraged us to try many other new places - so, maybe we won't be back - who knows?

It's been quite a while since we've been back to the Yardley Inn and tonight it absolutely was a grand slam home run.  Exactly the way in an evening out should be, especially when you're spending good money. 

My wife and I dined out with another couple this evening we came in early so we can have some enjoyable time before they got crowded and just relax which we did.

Our server was very helpful very respectful overall the food was incredible beautiful plate  presentations, and we all left Happy and fulfilled in our bellies.

My wife and I start off by sharing the Springberry salad which was arugula mix greens with goat cheese spiced almonds white honey balsamic dressing it was absolutely delicious.  

For my entrée I had the Farro island salmon which was served with roasted baby carrots, sautéed spinach, cherry tomatoes, and a passionfruit butter sauce; it was fabulous.  The husband of the second couple had the same and was equally as pleased.

My wife had to handmade Ricotta  Cavatelli- Beef and pork Bolognese and it actually was really tasty.  

It's refreshing to know that we have Yardley and in our backyard and we're looking for that exceptional meal with exceptional service and a fun night out.

Giving 2 stars because the food is decent but service is horrible. I live in NYC and know good restaurants and service. Went for dinner with my sister as this is supposed to be the best restaurant in town. First we asked if we could sit outside which was available but were NOT told there is no outdoor lighting once it got dark so when we finally got our entrees we had to prop our phone flashlights up to see what we were eating. That was the strangest thing. We then waited a half hour for our first drinks then another half hour for our apps and once they were dropped the waitress never came back to check on us. The entrees came and once again no one came to see if we were enjoying or needed anything. We wanted to order another drink which we finally flagged down a bus boy who came out with a random candle he found in the bottom of a closet only it was after we had finished our meals. We said we would like another drink if he could let the waitress know. After about another 25 mins I can see inside our drinks just sitting on the bar. Beyond frustrated I go inside to inform an employee who I believe was a manager in plain clothes we would like to cancel our drinks and get out of here to please bring the check. She apologized and said she would take the drinks off the check. Now instead of bringing the drinks that were sitting there to us while we wait for the check etc she continued to let us sit outside and wait for her to figure out the check and talk to our server. After waiting another 15 mins she then comes out and says I'm so so sorry I took $20 off the bill. Way to go above and beyond for what was supposed to be a lovely dinner turned to shit!! Will not be returning to this restaurant.

So good.  Beautiful setting. Delicious food.

The staff is making the post Covid adjustment.
There are doing a good job. As customers we just need to be a little patient and it's all good.

A historic and charming restaurant set next to the Delaware River.  This Pennsylvania restaurant is worth the trip to if looking for a change of pace and scenery.

The craft beer list is impressive with an hearty offering carefully selected by the head barkeeper.

Appetizers are kind of limited by choice but they offer a 2-3 choice tower that samples some of each.  The Wings are phenomenal here!

The Cod was a great and the oysters cleaned so well not a grain of sand!  This is a definite go to on our list and it should be for yours as well.

Love the food and the staff, always a pleasure going to eat here! I like that they kept the outdoor tent up even though covid restrictions are being lifted, it's nice to be outside on these summer nights

We came here to celebrate our 39th Wedding Anniversary and could not have been happier with the ambiance, service and the food. Although, we had never been here before we were treated as if we were royalty. The couple who joined us this evening had made the recommendation. An idyllic setting on the bank of the Delaware we had a beautiful view of the river and their vegetable garden. As soon as we were seated the Yardley Inn provided us with a complimentary glass of champagne.  The seafood risotto was as light as a feather and perfectly seasoned. All of the wait staff who interacted with us were excellent! Just a lovely restaurant and we look forward to returning!

First of all, This is my first time giving out a review. I give reviews based on the time and quality of the food.I went with my brother and his friend. Whom we were  all  black. I didn't wanna go but it was for my Brother's birthday and when I got there I felt uncomfortable tbh.The waitress who took our order was nice as well as some waitresses who passed by to check with our table. We got there at 5:07pm and by 5:10pm our order was taken. We waited for an hour and some minutes which was 6:15 pm but our food wasn't at the table while some guests who came after us had already gotten their food and finished it. I got angry and told my brother that by 6:20 pm I'll be out. Then I saw a woman come to our table( I think that was the manager) and told us that we should wait for a some minutes for which our food will be ready. My brother told her about the long hours we've been seated for and suggested that we should leave but she told us that she was gonna package our  and also added some dessert to make it up. Also I have been to many restaurants( not fast foods, tea restaurants)and order more food than what I got here but I got it in less than 30 minutes and am very sure on that.  I don't know who was responsible for the delay of our food but what pissed me off was some people came in early, got their food and finished but we still didn't get ours. I don't know if we were served differently based on our skin color. I know not all White restaurants are like this.
Came here today for a Father's Day brunch. Excellent service, food and drinks. A bit pricey but it's to be expected of the area. Will come back again .

Visited Yardley Inn on a dinner date with my wife after work on a pleasant Thursday afternoon. We sat under the tent out back. It's a nice space. You can see the Delaware River, and although your sandwiches between River Road and the parking lot, there is still plenty of green canopy on a nice spring day. 

We ordered margaritas. They were too strong for my wife and had to hand it off to me. Had a shrimp cocktail for appetizer. The shrimp tasted fresh and was nicely prepared with a side of jicama, avocado, and balsamic. At a cost of $4/shrimp it wasn't amazing enough to get again though. 

She got the filet, with potatoes a gratin and spinach. Steak was tender and cooked the way she asked. Potatoes were flavorful and crisp, spinach was good as well. 

I had goat cheese and herb ravioli. Waitress told me the pasta is made in house and I don't doubt her. The pasta and sauce was really good and fresh. The filling kinda tasted like the herb infused chèvre you can purchase at the supermarket. It was still really good though. 

For dessert wifey got the flamboirsue (sp?). I got the oatmeal chocolate chip cookies. Can't go wrong with processed sugar, but it was nothing to write home about. 

Service was good. A little on the spendy aside, especially $4 a shrimp. I find that a little unnecessary. Four stars!

THE BEST NACHOS I've ever had! They use a lemony cream chz sauce that it out of this world. I am a nacho connoisseur btw lol.  The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The menu is great as well, I had a seafood dish and all the seafood was very fresh. We live close by so my husband has lunch from here all the time and we highly recommend The Yardley Inn.

Has a great brunch with my hubby here while celebrating our Anniversary. Our waiter Napoleon was outstanding. Friendly, outgoing and totally on point. Food came out fast and was delicious and nice size portions for the cost. I had the steak and eggs and the steak was cooked to absolute perfection, well seasoned and juicy. The star of the meal was the espresso martini, which was the best I ever had. I will definitely be back.

Gave them a second try and this time steered away from entrees. We opted for appetizers and bar items (cheesesteak, burger) and had much tastier food than last time. The drinks, as always, were good. If I go back again, I will continue to avoid the entrees.

GF's bday dinner , server was excellent. Drinks are strong and the dining area is very cozy . I had the salmon dish which was fantastic . My GF enjoyed her filet, only complaint was the side of scalloped potatoes.... She really didn't like them and they were overpowering , heavy cheese flavor. I tried them also and had to agree. A baked or mashed option would've been preferable. Desert was delicious , we had the creme brulee . All in all though it was a pleasant experience and she enjoyed the night .

business.name: Luciano's
business.categories: Restaurants, Italian

reviews.text:
I have gone to Luciano's for my birthday two years in a row (both years that I have been local to Boise). Although I love absolutely every single thing I've had off the menu, the real shining star is their baked Brie. It comes in crispy flaky dough-y bread with garlic, green apple, and bread. It may have been the greatest thing I have ever eaten. 
In terms of ambiance, the place is pretty small and it has a hole in the wall type feel which to me, makes it feel cozy and often indicates the food will be amazing (I was correct).

We had just finished an escape room at Escape This Live Boise and were looking for a restaurant nearby. Siri suggested this, and we love Italian, so we went for it. As others have said, it doesn't look like much from the outside, but the number of cars in the parking lot (a lot of them) made us think it must be worth a shot. Once inside, we were immediately greeted by a host. It only took about 15 minutes to get our party in, but it was a weeknight, and I get the distinct impression that you should call ahead if you want to be seated on the weekend! Excellent pasta! My son ordered the Gabriel, which was outstanding. I'll go with that one next time, but none of us were disappointed with our orders, from Alfredo to meatloaf and a really good salad. We'll be back!!

Staff was very professional and helpful.  I think the secret to this place is to get there before the nightly dinner rush.  The place filled up in about 15 minutes after we got there.   When we left there were masked people stacked in the small waiting area and people were in line out the door.  

They supply plenty of food for the price.  The bread is delicious.  We started with stuffed mushrooms which are very filling because of all the melted cheese.   I had the veal parmesan and it was very good, large portion.  The missus had the lasagna but wasn't overly impressed with the sauce.  It took the ride home with us for the next day.  

A solid place serving 50's style Italian-American dishes.  Not upscale, but far from being the worst Italian in the TV.  At least they cooked the food correctly, unlike Gino's in Meridian.  Havng eaten at some very special Italian  places in NYC, Long Island and San Francisco, this was far from great.

The parking lot is a joke.  Maybe someone should actually redo it.
Delicious! Whatever you order you'll be super pleased! My fav is seafood pasta. Their crab fettuccine was my fav but it's no longer on the menu.

Delicious! My husband and I were both impressed by not only the food but also the staff. They were extremely busy but still polite and friendly and accommodating. I definitely recommend going on the early side and calling ahead one hour to put your name in. We did this; if we hadn't, the wait was 1.5-2 hours. 

The restaurant is small, so it's somewhat noisy but also intimate at the same time. Our server was so nice and attentive and kept telling us when our food would be out. I got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and it was splendid! My husband got something on the menu called "Gabriel" and added sausage. He loved his, and we rarely both love a date night spot! The bread is delicious as well. We got dessert to-go, which I doubt will disappoint.

This place is great for a date night or to take friends and family in town who love Italian.

Great time every visit. Most recent visit we were seated at 8pm (when they seat the last tables). We had to wait for a while for anyone to check in on us and ask us about drinks and appetizers. Finally we were all able to order but unfortunately had a 45 min- 1 hour for our food. Once it finally came out, one of the entrees was missing so someone had to wait even longer. We were also there for a birthday and they told us we would be getting cake, but didn't. It was all quite unfortunate, until the manager told us we would each get 50% off our meals for the lousy service. I've only been here twice and the other time it was a completely different experience. Food was still fantastic, and I will be returning.

Delicious food, great menu! The staff is attentive and well-versed in their menus and were very friendly. They have a great wine list, with great Italian wines. Their complimentary bread is so good. And their desserts- yummy! Luciano's is small, but they have a great waitlist system set up, and they stage their seating well so you get the proper attention and they maintain high quality food and service. Highly recommend!

Good service and food. I got the Penne Pasta with Chicken and it was delicious. They definitely do not skimp on portions either! The wine selection was also really good, got the Malbec and it was great!

I WOULD CHOOSE ZERO STARS IF I COULD. I made a reservation for my family for 6 pm for a hopefully lovely Italian dinner. We checked in for our reservation and they made us wait 45 minutes to be seated, we had fast appetizers and drinks as well as ordering our main meals but it took an hour and 45 minutes before we gave up and left because it was taking so long for our meals to arrive. We left without a meal and the eagerness for a good night.

Great food & great service every time we go! Sometimes the seafood fettuccine has broken chunks of shell from the shellfish they cook in it, but still my favorite dish though. The bread and oil vinegar is delicious. Unfortunately they do not allow reservations at such a small yet busy restaurant. Also tried to go there a little while back and they were closed due to staffing shortage. I understand that but their hours on Google did not reflect that and stated that they were open. Driving there only to get let down by a paper sign taped to the door. That's why the four stars

Our family had dinner here for the first time. It was a great experience.  The service was awesome,  even though they were short staffed. (Who isn't these days?)  And the food was delicious and very plentiful. We will definitely be going back again!

Luciano's is right next to the railroad tracks so I was a little skeptical going there, but after eating there twice with other friends, everyone loved what they ordered.  Both times I went, the place was packed.  The food delicious, and I would definitely go again.   I had their salmon dinner twice.  Fresh breads.

Can't say I'm going to agree with ANYONE that thinks this is the best Italian food in town. I'd say is middle of the road. I had the lasagna and a salad, my wife had a Chicken Dish. 
The red sauce was fairly bland and not very zestful. One day I'll find a place that uses real cheese and not the fake stuff. But it was not tonight. 
There's a few other places I town I've tried and are better, flavor wise. I do t have to go back here ...

This was my second time ordering from here (take out both times). I ordered the lasagna and rosemary chicken fromaggio, house salad, Caesar salad 

Lasagna- average, more cheese than meat. There was so much cheese you could not really taste anything else in it. It was minimally seasoned. It was also luke warm.

Rosemary Chicken Fromaggio- too much overly salty bacon on top, no actual rosemary. Again, heavy heavy cheese and yes I am aware this is meant to be cheesy. But the bacon and salt were so over whelming I couldn't taste anything else.

Caesar salad- legit Caesar dressing. 

House salad- not too bad, lettuce was fresh. The blue cheese dressing is more like a blue cheese vinaigrette.

Bread- just pass on the bread and make fresh toast when you get home.

Take out experience- I arrived 15 minutes prior to my pick up time expecting to waite a bit. I had to waite an additional 20 minutes past the waite time. I get it was busy, it is what it is, but just annoying. 

Overall, I can see how if you grew up coming here or are against going downtown, it's a great place; nostalgia, particular flavors etc. But for better quality or a more traditional style with elevated ingredients and flavor profiles either cook at home or go to Alavita or Asiago's down town.

Luciano's is always amazing the service is by far the best in town ,they also have the best Calamari in town due to it being smaller and not as rough , penne Luciano is to die for as-well as their tiramisu cake . Definitely going back .

Well the only reason I gave you only 3 stars is not because of the food served.. as always your homemade recipes are always delishish..
The reason for only 3 stars was ALL because of the waitress.  We can in at 11:30 for and early birthday lunch and this person only had 2 to 3 tables.   She was absolutely was the worst server I have seen.. I don't know her name but she had 2 nose loops and tattoos not that I have a problem with that but I'm not sure she actually introduced herself.  She was slow to respond from start to finish..and would disappear for 15-20 minutes at a time. As we were walking away from the restaurant we found her out back talking and smoking with another worker.   Looked like the owner or manager wasn't there to see her doing that.
We will be back but I'm definitely going to ask who our server would be so we don't get her again... she needs to be working somewhere like Applebees where you would expect terrible service.

The atmosphere & cleanliness alone deserves one star. Waiting area is tiny, the ambiance is dark, dingy, outdated; and on top of it all the bathroom is musty with no seat covers and an overflowing trash can. Not to mention that the food does NOT seem appetizing when it's coming out of a kitchen that looks like the floors haven't been scrubbed in months. Makes you question what Gordon Ramsay might say if he walked in. Sorry, Boise fam, this restaurant aint it.

Absolutely love this restaurant! 
Can't say it enough! 
Best Italian food with amazing drinks, they do also offer gluten free options, which I love because I'm allergic to white flours/wheat/Gluten, so it makes it super easy for me to order the food I like and not have to go without. 
The servers are amazing as well, very prompt and just all around please people. 
My Father takes my boyfriend and I there as often as we can. Our favorite dinner spot!
Excellent Italian food in generous portions! Wonderful service too! I like that you can call ahead to get put on a waitlist since reservations aren't taken. I'm looking forward to my next visit!

A few thing about Luciano's...

1. You can not make a reservation on a Saturday night. 
2.  You can be added to the waitlist if you call in. 
3. Expect to wait longer than your quoted wait time. 
4. Once seated you will be given the approximate time it will take to prepare your entree. 
5. The mozzarella, mushrooms, and Caesar's are all worth ordering and come out fairly quickly. 
6. The pasta is worth the wait. We ordered the 4 cheese and the seafood Alfredo. Both were divine. 
7. Your server knows the wait is long, so they make sure you have enough to drink and bread should you need something to avoid hangry.

Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had. There bruschetta is sooo good and there Minestrone is delicious. Our food was made to perfection. Cassandra our waitress was attentive,polite, and very sweet. I had such a great experience here! There cooks really know what there doing back there. This place is truly authentic and the food is flawless. Probably my top restaurant in the Boise area. Gracie Luciano's!

Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the general experience. The service was slow, seemed like 1 waitress for all the tables during the afternoon on a Sunday. 

I ordered The Gabriel, which was a large portion, probably could serve 2 people! However, it was extremely salty, and I couldn't finish it. It came with a slice of garlic bread, which not very flavorful, but I used it as a neutralizer for the salty pasta.

My favorite part of the meal was the toasty and crispy complimentary bread and balsamic dipping sauce served in the beginning.

This place is worth it! I ordered the pasta Athena with a side Cesar salad and wow. As a restaurant worker myself, I appreciated the friendly caring service as well as the perfectly made pasta. I will absolutely be coming back to try more items on the menu.

When I had this restaurant recommended to me as the best Italian ever, I was excited but nervous Luciano's wouldn't live up to the hype. Believe me it did!!! The service was great! I came with a party of 7 people at dinner rush, and our food didn't take long. The crab/artichoke dip and calamari were great, but the pasta dishes are the reason for my 5 stars. 

Everyone in my party had huge pasta portion (except for the chicken marsala, but it was still a good sized portion). I will have leftovers for multiple meals. I will definitely return!!

We love this place! Food is fantastic, great value for the buck. They have lunch special. If you come for dinner, make sure you make reservations. It was Cassandra who helped us last time we were there. She took a great care of us. I would recommend this place.

business.name: Cask Social Kitchen
business.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Southern, American (New)

reviews.text: Loved the atmosphere here! It's in a nice location to people watch and the DJ is great. He plays a variety of music, which livens up the atmosphere. Very yummy drinks and very yummy chicken and waffles . The food service is fast and the staff members are really nice.

Finally made my way to Cask today. Brunch was pretty good! I had the deep fried french toast with a side of bacon and potatoes. The french toast definitely grew on me, but I definitely enjoyed it. I like how Cask gives you a pitcher for bottomless mimosas because we only saw our server every so often. Definitely would recommend for a Saturday or Sunday brunch. Definitely will be back.
Omg My brother recommended this place to me and my sister to try while we are out here visiting food is delicious and let's not Forget about the live Dj perfect music perfect vibes I love it here
Not the best place, but not the worst.  Really oily food, not much flavor. Could be must better with a fresher menu.

Worst experience ever!!!!!!!! Discrimination because we had kids and sat us outside even though they where not busy and we had a reservation. Tried to sit out party of 8 at a table for 6 people. We never saw our server took 27 minutes to get a drink. From the time we sat down to 2 hours later we finally got our dinner. The manager isn't really a manager as he was just as bad as the  serving staff if not worse. The food was mediocre the deviled eggs could have been used as bouncy balls. All of our food was warm at best. Overall not a place I would recommend to anyone. Worst dinning experience in a really long time. When I spoke to the manager he could have cared less about my concerns and could not walk away from me fast enough.

Atmosphere was great! However, their mimosas are straight orange juice. We were told they pre make them and they can't add anymore champagne. I got the French toast and it was hard as a rock drenched in sugar syrup. The crab dip was a great appetizer but everyone else's entrees were average. 

Don't recommend. Plenty of other brunch spots in Tampa to try out.

Dreadful.  Had been wanting to try Cask for a few years.  Music was way too loud.  Booths - vinyl.  Was like a diner!  Buffalo cauliflower was bland - so I had to as for a side of Buffalo sauce.  Asked twice for share plates - no luck.  Service was slow   

Drinks.... My old fashioned was ok.  My wife's Grey Goose cosmo was terrible.  Watery - it was obviously a pre-made mixer to which they added a splash of vodka.  $13.   

We opted not to do entrees based on apps and drinks.  

What a letdown.

I made a reservation at 2 pm for a friend and I that came from out of town. I brought my dog as well so I arrived a little early at 1:15pm and checked in. They said closer to 1:30 they could seat us. So we checked in again at 1:30 and they said a little longer. We waited and waited and they ended up not seating us until 2:30 and sat many people ahead of us that got there after we did. It felt like they were purposefully skipping over us. Particularly this one hostess who had short black hair was very rude and acted like she did not want to seat us even though we had made a reservation. This was on 11/28 a Sunday so I understand they are busy but I've never had to wait so long for a table.
Vibe, food and service. Love that you can sit and vibe with family and friends and not feel rushed to leave.
I love cask! I always work on weekends so I definitely appreciate the Friday brunch. The steak and eggs were so yum and my boyfriend loved the biscuits and gravy

CASK SOCIAL!! Alright so the day is sunday, i walked into Cask to be informed that i had to make a reservation in order to get a table. No biggie, bar it is. Grabbed a stool and orderd bottomless mimosas and a breakfast bowl. Then i seen a waiter walk past with a chicken and waffle plate and I regretted my choice i made...buuuut next up, Pretty young staff as im young my self so phone happy and dont pay much attention to you unless you yell for their attention. But got my food to notice how small the dam break bowl was. A bowl or a plate? More like a little plate of potatoes, bacon,eggs and tomatoes. In my opinion, don't order that if your like me and like big portions of food. Im still hungry as i type this but hey bottomless mimosas right! So as this second pitcher comes out ill keep drinking to see how tipsy i get when i walk out.....sooooo would i come back? Yup! But as i said dont order the breakfast bowl.

Great brunch atmosphere..delicious food and the music was on point. Do not expect a quiet meal here, lol. I had shrimp & grits (wish there was more than 5 shrimp) and my husband had eggs, sausage (huge pieces), new potatoes and an English muffin. He said his meal was full of flavor. He wanted to get the unlimited mimosas but the pitchers are premade with OJ only according to the waiter. He wanted pineapple juice. :-(  All that said I'd definitely go back!!!

What an awesome experience for just googling a place to eat. Food was fabulous,  service was phenomenal, and atmosphere was great. Krystal our server had so many good recommendations,  and she was awesome. We definitely will return again when we are in town. This place will not disappoint you.

Cute brunch spot right off Howard in south tampa. Great location and close to other bars and restaurants. Me and my friend came to brunch and I'm giving this review 3 stars because they cap you on bottomless mimosas during brunch and food was just okay. A long time ago when I came here they didn't have a limit so we were upset when we got there and got kicked out for being there for too long. Bottomless mimosas are $20 a person but again it's not bottomless. They bring you a pitcher of mimosas which was nice so you didn't have to wait for refills but they limited us to one pitcher each and they put a limit on how long we could be there.  That is so annoying! I live in Spring Hill and when I make the drive down to tampa to brunch with friends, we like to sit and chill at one place, catch up and we will drink and eat all day. The longer you allow us to stay, the more money we will spend, I get having to get people in and out but it just sucks when your rushed.  The pretzel was fantastic and the candied bacon was meh. Prices were decent too, probably one of the cheaper spots in the area. They also had a DJ during brunch which was nice and food was decent but honestly, probably going to find a new brunch spot for the future.

Looking for a place to eat some great brunch!! Cask is the place to go. The vibe is super chill and it's just an amazing time to be with people and socialize. Great Drinks,Great Food,Great Vibe!!
Deep South Tacos!!
Deviled Eggs!!
Candid Bacon!!
Nice spot good eats - great service .. I recommend this spot I wend on the weekend w a friend made a reservation parking lot was full (only downside)

Was in the area and decided to come here, and what a wonderful choice. We just missed the brunch which is till 4 btw! I got the Black Bubbles cocktail and my gf got the Cask Cosmo. Both pretty good and recommended by our server. The black bubbles was definitely a lot sweeter than the Cask Cosmo so if you're looking for sweeter i'd choose that one. Then for our late lunch i got the nashville chicken sandwich (without nashville) the chicken was seasoned so well. My gf got the chicken n waffles and it was delicious. The waffles were so soft, the sweet sauces on top, and the chicken also seasoned so well. Definitely coming back to try other options on the menu because we were indeed torn. Still very happy with our choices.

I hate to say that as a resident foodie it has taken me this long to try Cask Social, but OH BOY was it worth the wait. Situated in SoHo parking was a challenge but we managed to score free parking across the street. It was mid-morning on Saturday and I wasn't sure we'd even get in without a reservation. The hostess was very accommodating and we were sat immediately. Our waitress was super nice with the perfect amount of attentiveness. I had the chicken and waffles and my daughter had the omelette we were both in love! That orange maple syrup is to die for. It may have taken forever for me to try this gem, but won't take me long to return!

The bar is first come first serve, plenty of room at 11 when the opened on a Sunday. We sat down immediately upon arrival! All 3 bartenders checked on us while we waiting. Food was on point! The candied bacon is to die for! The $5 Bloody Mary is hard to beat. Good vibes, good people and good music!!

First time for brunch at this restaurant! My first impression is that it's too small for how loud it was. There's no real ambience to the place, just kinda people packed in and oh my was it HOT.. my friend and I were super uncomfortable with how humid it was inside. 

I'm going to get straight to the point. If you like shrimp and grits. This is your place. I would give this place 5 stars alone for how delicious this dish was. Like - I can't even. It was amazing. Lol. It completely made the humid and bad drinks and annoyingly loud environment to be immediately ok and worth it the more I bit into this this creamy, savory, amazing delicious dish. 

Whatever you do, don't  get the red sangria pitcher. Ours literally tasted like watered down NyQuil. It was not good at all. Our server did a great job checking on us and asking us how we liked everything, we both said we liked our sangria before we even tasted it and then realized we in fact did not like our sangria lol but it was too late and we are too shy to complain ha.

Overall, I will order that shrimp and grits to go from now on.
This place was pretty cool & I'll for sure go back . Also heard it was a BOB sooo of course I was looking to support ! Was able to catch happy hour ! The food was good !

Had the best little date night tonight with amazing service. Ben was fun and attentive! Everyone else seemed very happy to be there and it was a nice experience overall. The Carrot Cake French Toast was to die for!

You can make reservations on Opentable. The parking is a nightmare. There are maybe about 10 spots at the restaurant itself. I drove around the block for about 15min looking for any availability street parking and only came across a paid lot that was $10 flat rate. I asked for patio seating on the open table app but they sat me inside spin arrival. You definitely want to make reservations, there was quite a line for brunch! Server was friendly and attentive. They have $20 bottomless mimosas but also have options for bloody Mary's and aperol spritz as well. They have some of the best Buffalo cauliflower that I've ever had. Very nicely breaded served with celery and blue cheese. I tried the new menu item-Spanish frittata. Loved the guac and fresh pico on top. The hash brown base was perfect. A large portion so come hungry!

It's brunch time. We parked across the street in public parking.  You need the app "parking by app"
It's Sunday,  it only allowed us to purchase 4 hrs at $10 and change. The bartender came over, his attitude felt like he had a bad night. "Like I'm here to take your order, what do you want" However, the table of ladies behind us got a smile from him.  Our food was delivered with a smile. The chicken and waffles were delicious and tasty. My chicken and biscuits uneventful maybe their "Jameson breakfast  shot" (Jameson, butterscotch liquor,  oj,bacon) would help wash it down.

Food is nothing to write home about but not terrible but if you're charging $20 for mimosas don't give me nothing but OJ. Our table had to buy separate bottles of champagne because the "bottomless mimosas" was literally just orange juice. Not worth the trip out and won't be coming back with all the better options that are a mile away. If you want bottomless go somewhere else.

business.name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
business.categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Bars, Steakhouses, Wine Bars, Seafood, Nightlife

reviews.text: This is worst restaurant I've ever been to. The service was awful. Waited 10 minutes at our table without any service. After receiving my salad I sat there for 15 minutes with no dressing. It took 50 minutes after ordering for our steaks to come out. Absolutely awful experience I will never go back nor recommend this place to anyone.

It was our first time here. We reserved a table for our anniversary. However, our server did not seem to know that we were celebrating our anniversary. The food was ok. Lobster was very salty and salad was soggy (not flavorful). Service was even worse. We spent one and half hours just waiting for service and waiting for food. I waited for about 20 minutes for my salad and it was very disappointing. Our server seemed to spend more time at certain tables. The food was may be a 4 star, but the service was 2 star. It was a very frustrating and disappointing experience for our anniversary.

Appalling. They had nothing! No options for vegetarians (no pasta for instance). One of our guests wanted a steak and they ran out. Just shameful. If you call yourself a restaurant please have food! Disgraceful. Wait time was long. Very poor service. Would never ever go back.

Have been going to Ruth's my entire life.  Have visited Ruth's in multiple states and countries.   Yesterday had reservations before the Saints game and to my surprise we were turned away because a pre teen had a Saints jersey on.  We were told we could sit at the bar if it was available (which it was not).  What confused me is the bar seats were 3 feet away from the dining room.  In a city that steaks or king we left our hometown favorite to go to a better steak house that appreciates customers.  Now what to do with all these gift certificates for a former favorite restaurant.   But you can wear shorts and gym clothing in dining room if this is the type of place you want to visit.

Ruth's Chris Tampa is nosediving. That is all. Dirty shirts, slang language, 100 chairs stacked right by my table. Drank drink and left.

Bone appetite.

The service was nice and friendly, my waiter had been working here for 25 years and knew what he was doing, good waiter.  Of course they try and sell the bottled water to bump the check up and appetizers and the rest. Our steaks were just fine and the Fries are not on the menu, but be sure to ask for them, they are good.  Out hostess who sat us was pleasant and at one point the manager too came by and said hello, all great people and the food was good too.
