HOWEVER---- this place is old, our seats in the booth were shedding whatever what was covering them, all the booths are real old and they look it.  This location has been open for 25 years and looks like it has been 100 years with little or no repairs. Makes one think that if they cut corners in the public spaces what must the kitchen look like?  Scary, right?
BUT....the people were great and the food was good, but I would take a pass as to ever coming back to this RUTH CHRIS due to the lack of care and maintenance the place reflects....it is nasty

This was my second time going to a Ruth Chris and I can say they were both pretty consistent. The service was good and so was the food. I can't say it's my favorite steakhouse but they're steaks are worth what you pay for them. My only criticism would be the lobster Mac n cheese. I know most steakhouses offer this dish and everyone has their on flare on it but both of the times I've had it from here I was not impressed. Without the Lobster , the Mac n cheese doesn't hold any flavor at all. But overall a good date night option with a nice ambiance.

Our waiter never greeted us. Just came to the table, poured water and left without saying anything. Then came back several minutes later and asked, "Do you want something to drink, or just water?" I don't know why he couldn't just ask us, "What would you like to drink?" like they do in almost every other nice restaurant. My wife ordered for us (Porterhouse for two) while I was away in the restroom, he verbally confirmed our order with her, then when I returned, he asked me if that was what I wanted. Why he didn't believe my wife is beyond me. The bread, to my taste, was stale and dry. My bloody Mary, which I ordered myself and asked to be extra spicy, was served very bland, with a bottle of Tabasco sauce. The Tabasco sauce only marginally helped--the drink had no flavor. The mashed potatoes were also bland.

I appreciate steak served on hot plates-- and I heard other waiters tell their tables that the plates were hot when placed on the table. Our waiter did not tell us this. Good thing neither of us touched the plates--when I put a piece of cooked steak on my plate it sizzled. That's how hot the plate was--and we weren't told. I don't completely understand why the plates were served greasy, I've seen other restaurants serve hot plates that were clean, but honestly, it wasn't the worst of the night.

The wine and steak were quite good. The other waiters helping our waiter were very nice. Our waiter got super friendly at the end of the meal, and I have to think he was looking for a nice tip. I felt the bare minimum on a couple hundred dollar bill I could leave was 15%--mostly because the other waiters deserved something if the tip is split, so that's what I did. Mediocre bread, potatoes and drink I could have almost handled--it was all because of our waiter's service that I tipped this low.

I shared a good portion of this feedback with the restaurant via the service I booked the reservation through, by the way, and gave them the waiter's name, and the day I was there, which I'm witholding here. That was several days ago. No response.

Ruth's Chris never disappoints. The food is amazing and the customer service is even better. I haven't had a bad item on the menu yet. It's fine dining, but more affordable than similar dining options.

I was running around with my son and granddaughter, and we planned to grab some food on the way home.  After a wrong turn and some conversation about good steaks we made a last minute reservation.   I was worried we would be out of place (not really dressed up), but the staff treated us like gold.  I adore the folks who work at this Ruth's Chris and I will be sure to make this a planned outing everything I am in Tampa.

The last time, 2 yrs ago, we decided to wait a while as it wasn't that great. We decided to go on 9/22/21 and had the best meal we've had at RC. From the service and food, it was awesome. Just make sure you ask for the wine list as the menu had a few expensive wines on it but the wine menu has a lot more and some less expensive. Also look at the prix fixe menu as it's all inclusive and the filet/shrimp was great. We will be back soon.

Ruth's Chris Steak house offers patrons a fine dining experience like no other.  My wife and I decided to enjoy a premium steak before attending a comedy show in Ybor City recently.  We both have been to multiple steakhouses in the Tampa area and chose Ruth's Chris for this experience.  If you call and they are completely booked up from a reservation perspective, they do offer open seating in the bar area.  They can accommodate seats at bar, high tables away from the bar, and booths, as well.  We wanted the calamari as an appetizer, but, unfortunately, they didn't have it this night.  We decided on the sizzling crab cakes.  Not only were they delicious, but they were literally sizzling when the waiter brought them to our table.  My wife ordered off of the Ruth's classics menu which is a three course meal featuring the Chef's favorite recipes.  It comes with a starter, entrée and a side, and dessert.  Also, note that, if the entree or side you desire is not on the classics menu, you are allowed to substitute at an additional cost.  My wife ordered the 16oz ribeye with a lobster tail and a side of sweet potato casserole whereas I ordered the same steak with a loaded baked potato.  The food was absolutely fantastic.  The steak melted in my mouth like butter and it should be illegal how good the sweet potato casserole tastes.  I am convinced it is actually a dessert masquerading as a side.  It is dangerously good.  The service was fantastic, also.  If you visit, be sure to ask for Savannah and Jacob.  They did an awesome job.  There are many steakhouses to choose from in the bay area, but, if you are seeking a fine-dining experience, Ruth's Chris Steak House offers a high-quality meal with exceptional customer service.  You will NOT be disappointed.

The good - Savannah at the Bar, and Desiree at the table were marvellous servers.  All the steaks were perfect and the crab cakes were heavenly.  The drinks that were high balsa were a fat pour and well garnished.

The Meh - got a Mai Tai at the bar that was pretty much kool-aid and rum.  The lobster Mac and cheese, soupy noodles and dry lobster, although there was lots of it.  The bread was stale and tasteless.  The Oscar topping, the asparagus was nice but barely any hollindaisse sauce, which is kinda the whole point.

It was good, but given the prices I expect damn near perfection.  They feel now like a high end chain that we "feel" all fancy to go to, but they've lost their edge.

went to ruths chris for the first time to celebrate my husbands birthday. there were 7 of us. our reservation was for 06.16.21 @ 7:30. we were all there at 7:25.

the hostess that greeted is was professional, but less than warm. we were sat immediately, though. great! 

it was fairly busy. lots of hustle and bustle. after a long wait, a server assistant came to water the table. the family were chit-chatting and discussing what scrumptious offerings we were all going to order. it took a lot of time. we never saw our server. we were patient.  

more discussion to fill the time while we were looking around to find our server. nadda. finally, the SA came back and asked if we would like to have bread. quickly, we all exclaimed "yes!" as we were still unable to order anything. he was expeditious in bringing plenty of bread and butter to the table. 

still waiting on our waiter... which i suppose that made us the waiter!? 

finally, sean comes by to start service. great! not so much... we asked to see the kids menu as we were dining with our toddler nephew.  so much time passed before he came back with the menu. im sure they dont have a lot of children come in, but wow... he must have had to type up, edit and print a new one for all the time it took. 

at this point we were all ready to order. everything. from drinks to apps to entrees and sides. sean was professional, but seemed flustered. maybe he had too many tables? he started with the ladies drink orders and made it to my husband and i. we both ordered the house old fashioned. he then proceeded to get the next drink order. my husband, very hungry, had to ask if we could also order appetizers. sean, of course, and quickly took down the app orders. 

more time passes. the apps come out surprisingly fast, but no cocktails on the table ...

about half-way through the apps, we are served our drinks. my mother-in-law has had an empty glass of unsweetened tea. no sign of sean.  i will say, the knobb creak old fashioned is simply perfect, though!

we had been finished with our apps for quite a while. like, to the point were the sauces on the plates were starting to get weird. no table maintenance, clearing of dishes. nothing. was unappetizing. 

sean eventually remembers we were his table and gets back to us for our entree orders. he gave suggestions and was attentive, at last. yay! everyone orders. he noted we needed new drinks as the large cube in my glass was nearly gone. waiting, waiting, waiting... wheres out drinks!? they finally come... could have ordered much more if anything came out timely. 

still no table maintenance. old, gross dishes just sitting there festering. right before the entrees were delivered, we finally got old dishes and flatware cleared. thank goodness. i was tired of looking at them for the past hour. 

now sean has hit his stride. only 1.5 hours into service. not bad! glad he came around.  

food was unequivocally fantastic! my fillet and sides were exactly what i expected. perfectly cooked and very tasty.  perhaps, the best steak ive ever had. thats saying a lot. and thats why i am giving 4 stars. the food and cocktails saved the dinner. 

in the end, sean ended up being a decent server. we all enjoyed ourselves and would come back.

We had a 5pm reservation but arrived early so they said we had to wait.  There wasn't hardly anyone there so we decided to eat in the bar area.  It was less stuffy and ended up costing us $58 less for the same meals minus a couple ounces on our steaks.  It ended up being perfect.
It's my first time here and the food was excellent. The steak was perfect. I would surely recommend this place.

First ever experience at a Ruth's Chris did not disappoint.  The food was stellar, our server lacked personality but that's ok.  We were paying for the food after all.  Their petite filet had me savoring each and every bite!

For happy hour it is definitely a good experience. We were here at 5 pm and the place still empty. By 6 pm, it is pack with people. The happy hour is at the bar area. 

I got the steak sandwich. This sandwich is worth the value. It is slice filet with fries. The steak was well cook to the temperature that was order. The quality of the steak is high. We also got the spicy shrimp. This dish is big shrimp fried in butterfly style. It is delicious. We have the seared ahi tuna last. The outward was seared. The tuna is dark red color. The number of pieces also enough. 

Overall experience is good. Service is good in good restaurants. Food come out quick without much waiting. We enjoy our time here.

Honestly I hate giving bad reviews, however I am really trying to figure out the great reputation this restaurant has? My experience has to be terrible for me to leave a bad review... and here I am. THE SERVICE IS ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. We waited about 45 mins for drinks.... another 30 for appetizers and when I checked it had been 2 1/2 hours since We had sit down and we still didn't have our entrees. Everyone there is very relaxed to the point they barely check in on you (our maybe it was just us?)... now the food.. I have one word... BLAND. The entire menu is BLAND... I didn't even know what to order. Decided to go with a filet and a baked potato..I honestly could've made it at home with a lot more flavor. I also had a sangria and it was super bitter. Not impressed at all unfortunately, I had really high hopes for this restaurant.

I was brought here for my birthday and it was so underwhelming. We were sat in a room with cackling girls doing shots and being loud...would've much rather had a nice quit booth...
Our server would just come to the table and stare at us, literally not say a word just stare, it was so awkward. 
My boyfriend ordered a glass of wine when we ordered our meal, and he didn't receive his wine until after our entrees.
The mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were so bland...steaks AMAZING, but everything else very mediocre.
Our server almost lit my hair on fire trying to light my birthday candle over and over after I blew it out for some reason lol...this was just a mess haha, I have a sense of humor about it and I'm not going to list our servers name because I'm not here to get someone in trouble...but maaaaannnnn this could've been so much better. For a $250 bill I would expect a little better service/atmosphere. Oh...please see the photo, they even spelled my name comically incorrect, despite my boyfriend spelling it out for them.

After receiving a comment back from management at Ruth's Chris I happened to notice they wish to hear about everyone else's experience more via email...except for this one. Judging by the experience and the response I can't imagine they care much about customer service.

I took my wife to Ruth's Chris on 04/11/2021.  We were greeted and promptly seated in a room by ourselves which was very nice.  We had a great server, can't remember his name, but I have no complaints about him.  We started out with Lobster Bisque.  It was ok, tasted kind of canned in a way, there wasn't much flavor.  We both agreed.  The complimentary bread was decent, along with the provided butter. Now, the steak, an 11 oz filet, which came out sizzling looked appetizing, but it honestly wasn't anything special, it tasted like a generic steak, I was not impressed after all the praise this place gets.  My wife's filet was also over cooked, though she quickly got a replacement.  The sides we ordered were Creamed Spinach and Au Gratin Potatoes. Both were very very bland and had no flavor.  I was disappointed to say the least after hearing raves about how good it was.  Finally, my wife had the cheesecake dessert that came with her dinner and while the presentation was beautiful, she said it tasted like it came out of a freezer section in the supermarket and was just thawed out.  So overall, I wasn't too impressed, maybe I went on a bad night ?  Berns has spoiled me to expect consistent greatness ! I don't know if I'll come back.  Service is excellent! But you go a restaurant for the food, and this was not something that would make me run out and tell my friends to try!

Another couple as well as my husband and myself started trying to visit a nice steakhouse each month for date night. Ruth Chris was one of our most recent destinations and it did not disappoint.

The other couple and my husband ordered alcohol drinks to start. Being pregnant, I asked for some sort of mock tail to still feel festive. The bartender did a great job giving me a fun drink similar to a Mojito but a virgin version. 

As far as food, I ordered a combo that provided me with a steak, a side, and a dessert. The steak was so tender and juicy! All Of the sides that our table ordered were delicious and the cheesecake did not disappoint! I cannot wait to go back!

The food was excellent the steaks came our really good nicely seasoned and cooked just right. The lobster Mac and cheese I personally didn't think it was worth $20 we probably could have skipped that honestly I was not a fan.  We also had lobster bisque and that was pretty tasteful and lastly crème brûlée how fantastic the desert was!  and our serve was  very friendly and super nice. If you plan on coming here it is a little pricey but worth it. This would be a good celebration spot,anniversary they do have a dress code policy for the atmosphere just be mindful of that when you go

5 stars bc from the moment we walked in to the minute we left, everyone was amazing and the food was out of this world. We were celebrating our 7 year anniversary and they had the table set up with rose petals and everyone we walked by literally told us "congratulations!" The recommendations from our waiter was ON POINT! The even had an anniversary dessert for us at the end! Will definitely come back!!

Honestly we went here the first time and the food was amazing but the service sucked. I'm not sure if it's because we were the youngest looking people there and were being stereotyped or what. However we just went this past weekend for valentines weekend and it was again amazing food and our server was also great this time around I can't remember his name but he was from Venezuela.  Anyway this is surely one of my favorite places to go in Tampa, the filet with the blue cheese and lobster tails is superb!

business.name: The Melting Pot - Nashville
business.categories: Fondue, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Restaurants

reviews.text: I'm a Nashville native and used to go to The Melting Pot for special occasions. I returned with my husband and 4 friends over the weekend. Putting aside the dated atmosphere, the meal was horrible. We had a bug on our veggie and bread plate for the cheese fondue. We had a hair on two different dishes, both raw meat for the entrees. The waitress was very new and turned on an entree oil mix prematurely (as the raw meat took awhile to deliver) and it boiled and popped up from the pot, almost burning us. We dipped our meats in it, and it burnt the meats. We begged a nearby waitress for help and she at first insisted it was our fault. The manager then showed, and when we informed him of the issues, did not seem well trained in customer service. (He did later give us all a discount on our bill. I asked him for it.) I dislike writing negative reviews and do not frequently do so, but it was not a pleasant dining experience and it was not cheap. Overall, the cheese fondue and dessert fondue were tasty, but we would not return.

We truly enjoyed this experience. However, whenever I go back I will skip the entree section altogether. We enjoyed the Lobster and shrimp most, but all the others on the bigger meal for two were just ok. Alpine was great for a cheese course and I'd like to try the cheddar and loaded potato next. The dark chocolate flaming turtle was SPECTACULAR.

Four of us had an amazing and entertaining dining experience. The Alpine cheese was my favorite, but definitely not to be overshadowed by the turtle chocolate. The main course was phenomenal as well. Every bite was delicious. All of this, coupled by wonderful service and good social distancing practices you can't get anything better!!

Great experience! First time at a melting pot for both of us. Staff at the host stand was very friendly, and provided us a mask when we forgot to bring one. The waitress was super helpful. She was great at explaining everything and giving us tips. We were celebrating, so he arranged for the table to be decorated with champagne, strawberries, roses and candles. They even provided a framed photo of us. The restaurant offers a great package to celebrate special occasions! Management was very attentive and friendly. We had a great experience and would recommend!
It's simply the best date night location and they're super sweet. The customer service is remarkable and you get plenty of food.

Hands down experience such a great experience, specially this generation when two young person at a table both are using their phone , this experience give a chance to converse in so many ways...., the food was so good # steak lovers Yummy , the land and sea Yummy. I took my fiancé there for her birthday she blown away with the rose and rose petal on the table the whole experience was WOW.
Friendly staff , I have to mention my wonderful waiter SEBASTIAN for his patience to over the menu with us cause it was 1st time for the both of us , and i left my card somewhere I couldn't find it he kept it calm. 
If you in NASHVILLE that's a MUST

I have been here many times. Either for special occasions or girls' night out chocolate fondue goodness. This is more of an event than just a meal. It's a wonderful date restaurant, you have something to do, while getting relaxed and engaging in conversation. There are endless delicious options. The ambiance is sublime, the staff are friendly, knowledgeable and very willing to assist with any questions.

We were dining in on 8.10.20 and had the best experience. Kumudie was our waitress and was fantastic from start to finish. She was very knowledgeable and kind to us. The entire staff was extremely kind as well. Great service all around. My date asked for a specific type of drink that wasn't on the menu but the manager went above and beyond to create the drink. We left In a food coma and will absolutely return. Thank you for a wonderful night. It was the best we have experienced in a while.

We always have an incredible experience every time we're here. We normally only come for special occasions (birthdays, anniversary), and each time the staff has made them memorable. The dark dulce de leche chocolate fondue is a-ma-zing!

Let me start by saying: I am biased towards The Melting Pot. It is one of my favorite restaurants since I first visited in Scottsdale, AZ in the 2000s. My enjoyment of this play never gets old. With all that said, our experience here at the Nashville MP with my husband for our 2yr Anniversary celebration was hands down the BEST Melting Pot dinner to date! While our food was very tasty and fresh and near perfect as always, our server, Heather, made the entire meal!!! Y'all give her a raise!!!!

We decided on the Full 4 Course Experience for 2 with Wisconsin cheddar cheese, MP house salads, the Classic entree (shrimp, herb crusted chicken, teriyaki steak, and sirloin) with Mojo broth, and flaming turtle chocolate! Our tummies are SO happy :) All the food was fresh and flavorful, and perfectly spaced so we could enjoy each course. Their signature dipping sauces always complement the meat, seafood, and vegetables perfectly. I think my 2 favorites are green goddess and the Gorgonzola.

Oh, and the Watermelon Cooler? It is THE PERFECT non-alcoholic summer drink. Refreshing, light, and just the right amount of cucumber and watermelon flavor.

If you have been on the fence about trying out the Melting Pot, or haven't been to the Nashville location, I highly recommend you make your reservation today! 

Thank you again, Heather! You rock!

Arrived at 7 for a birthday dinner reservation. Was immediately seated. Didn't take our drink order until about 7:20. We also ordered our apps, salads, and entrees at this time. My friends did not received their appetizer until 8:00. They mentioned this to a manger and he apologized/promised to get the food out more quickly. Our entrees did not come until sometime around 8:45. I would've ordered a fondue dessert but he did not come back until after 9, which my parking had expired at the lot. My friends did not leave until almost 10. THREE hours to eat is absolutely ridiculous for it to be as slow as it was. I had two beers and the steak entree, which totaled over $50 and I still left hungry. Gratuity was automatic which was frustrating,  because it was some of the slowest service I've ever received. I won't be back to this location ever again.

Most worthless $99 plus tax i have ever spent. The food is nothing but trash   i go to all the good restaurant all over the places and the food quality here isnt even close to be called nice dine in. I dont mind paying $200-$300 for my meal as long as it tastes good. But its not worth $99 plus tax.

When you first walk in from 2nd street into the first set of doors and head down stairs, is pretty minimalistic which is pretty pleasing. Once you get into the second door, the mood is pretty romantic and the staff that greets you is pleasant and makes it easy to check in. It was our first time there and we already had high expectations when we were being sat to our table. We had to wait a little bit to get our waiter over but when he came over, and asked if it was our first time, he gave us a brief explanation on how it works. The price is pretty high but after asking question on how it all works, you do get a four course meal. After figuring it all out and ordering, our waiter, left us to go prepare our first dish. We had to wait a while to get our first dish, the cheese, but we expected a little wait to get it all prepared. The first dish we chose was the loaded potato cheese, ingredients pretty simple, the waiter, who was a bit more talkative then he should have been prepared it for us. This is where the two star rating starts. A few moments later our salads where brought out  and we ordered cocktails to go with our entré. My water and my companions were getting close to empty and we waited a solid 25 min just for someone to bring us the starting cooking sauté to boil our food in. Given, though they are usually very busy, this was a day they were close to being dead, maybe 4 or 5 other tables and 1 large table at the end. When we finally got our sauté the man acted like he was in a rush and quickly hit the mechanism that ended up splattering some of the sauté all over the table and then turned the heat on high and left. We then waited another 25 minutes for our entree to come out, just for it to come out wrong, then to correct it, it took another 15 minutes. After we finally got our meat to boil we only got one meat done before our cooker turned off and wouldn't turn back on. Our waiter was no where to be seen to grab his attention so we had to mess with the heating and power button ourselves to get it to turn back on. It was another 15-20 minutes messing with it before we got it to turn back on to cook the rest of our food. By this time, our waters were empty, we finally saw the waiter for him to give us our cocktails we asked for to go with our entree, and a refill on water. My companion at this point was so stressed out he didn't really enjoy any of the food. With your entree you get "on the house veggies" to go with your entree but when we first used our "on the house veggies" and tried to get more the waiter was no where to be seen. I finally caught him at a different table and had to lift our white empty veggie bowl up just to get his attention. Our desert was amazing, the chocolate, but honestly it was the only thing we actually enjoyed. When we finally got done and received our ticket, our waiter came and swiped our card and watched and stared at us to see how much we would tip him. He put the tipping rate at 30% which he did not deserve, he honestly didn't deserve the 20% we gave him. The manager had come to our table and asked if our food was good and I do admit at the time he came over and asked us, we were already pretty fed up and just didn't want to deal with getting the already allusive waiter  to treat us any more poorly. I am sad to say I don't think we will be making any further trips to the melting pot. It was overpriced for the way we were treated

Came here for a date night on a Saturday. Wasn't too busy being a weekend. I really am glad they gave Valet parking, the gentleman are really nice, and it's only 15$ and I drop my car right at the front of the resturaunt and pick it up right there too. Saves time and money and they are really quick and reliable. 
Overall dining experience was great. The hostess was nice, we sat for about 5 mins before being sat. We came about 15 mins earlier than the reservation.  
Our waiter was very very accommodating. He acknowledged my Yelp offer for 1 free artisan dipper when you check into the location. Even though he has never seen it he made sure he talked to the manager and they took it off on the bill. So that was really great! He was polite and quick given he had A LOT of tables to take care of. He explained everything for us to make sure we got the best dining experience. We did the Alpine cheese dip (my favorite), 2 Caesar salads, 1 classic entree, and the s'mores dessert fondue. The bill came out to be 51$ !!! Talk about saving money, usually for two people it's 100$++ ... but I have been here before and know how much food it could be and I got smart when ordering. We decided to share an entree because the cheese fondue plus the salad is already filling before the dinner comes out. And we had plenty room for the dessert. 

I believe our waiters name was Silver? He was absolutely great! We had such a great experience. 

Also, a tip is to try not to order any drinks, it helps with the bill later on. Granted there cocktails are amazing! But if you wanna save money either drink before or after. Going there for the fondue experience is the best.
I love The Melting Pot! It's so awesome! We always have a great waiter. The food is always so good and so are the drinks here.

Literally love all the melting pots that we've been too but this visit was just not good. We got there as a walk in because my husband is active duty and I'm in school full time. We decided we desperately needed a date night. Anyways, we had a waiter approach our table (he was friendly the entire time). He told us we were going to have two waiters for the night. We decided to get the bigger night out. After our cheese some lady brought our mojo for our main entree. We had 4 other tables around us that had constant attention from the other waiter and we just sat there. Where we happened to be sitting was next to a vent so the steam form the mojo kept blowing onto me and my husband. After about 40 min my husband turned it off and that's when our entree came. Again the waiters were super friendly I'm not sure if there was a lapse in communication? Since we had two for some reason? I ordered the yin and yang drink and 
When it came it was just milk. I know it is normally a thicker type of milkshake but this time they literally made it with milk. I was a tad disappointed. For how much money we spend coming there is was not up to the standard of what it normally is :/. Again, the wait staff is super friendly. I'm not sure if there was just a lapse in table management. As for the 10 dollar drink tbat was just milk... couldn't believe that. The table across from us got there about an hour after us and was already on their dessert by the time we left. They also had the 4 course option. (Just to show how long we sat waiting for our dinner).

Ejah was our server and she amazing and anticipated our needs. I can't say enough good things about her as she has a warm and inviting personality. The food as always is great quality and this is a place for an experience and to have great conversations. Only one caveat the managers were very smoothing and interrupted our conversations multiple times. (and not just one but multiple managers)

A cool spot, especially for fondue lovers. A little pricey but offers a great deal of options both for dipping and the actual fondue. Our waitress was very polite and knowledgeable. Menu can be confusing but she explained it to us and we got the gist. The overall experience is generally 90 minutes to 2 hours, but we were in a bit of a rush and the staff kindly accommodated us. The food itself was very good, not great, but pretty good.

Mandy was our server. 

My friends and I went out for a birthday dinner. Mandys service was 100% and we had an amazing time. 

Would come back and request Mandy again.

This is a VERY (far too) pricey meal.  The Melting NOT.

Our family of 4 chose mid-range options for a 3-course meal and paid $280!!!!!!    Oh my goodness!   You pay for the experience.  The ingredients aren't particularly special, unique or high-quality.  The atmosphere is dark and banal.   The service is mediocre/decent.  And the tastes are nothing to write home about.  You pay exorbitant prices so that you can cook at your table.   The menu is even a bit misleading, so there's a bit of sticker shock.   Did I mentioned it costs us $280 for dinner!??

If you must go, tell them it's your first time (even if it isn't), so you get a bit better service.  Think about ordering 3 servings for 4 people, especially since they will bring you extra dipping portions.  Ignore the suggested 25% tip (since it really isn't merited).

We stopped in to grab a snack and ended up having dinner.  The burners added to the bar are a great addition! Usually my husband and I cannot eat at the same time when we visit, but now we can! Orlando did a great job.  He was friendly and attentive.  Mike was friendly and helpful while busy perfecting drinks behind the bar. Never disappointed with the food!

My husband first brought me here for my birthday about 7 years ago. Since then it's become a tradition and we come at least once a year. This year we made a reservation at a different restaurant and still ended up here because we love it so much! We've tried it all and it's all been good! We love the romantic and private atmosphere that you don't get at many restaurants. The service is always top notch! We'll be back again, and again, I have no doubt!

Oh my goodness what a wonderful evening! This was my first visit ever to The Melting Pot, and I know for sure it won't be the last. Decided to eat at TMP to celebrate my birthday this weekend, and it was an excellent choice. Michelle was our server, and she was a wonderful tour guide on this evening's culinary journey. We ordered two 4-course meals so we could try many different options. The bacon and jalapeno cheddar was scrumptious as was the garlic and herb. Salads followed, and the house peppercorn ranch was tasty. We had an assortment of beef, chicken, pork, seafood, and duck, and our favorite sauces were the sweet and sour and the curry. Dessert followed with s'mores and turtle chocolate to coat the dessert pieces. I had the wine flight to complement dinner, and The Monterey Pinot Noir is one of the most flavorful wines I've had. It went well with every meat between the two entrees (I even ordered an extra glass it was so good!). The Tipsy Turtle cocktail was also terrific. 

If you're looking for a wonderful evening of good food and tasty memories, I recommend a visit to The Melting Pot.

Originally from Kansas City, but visiting Nashville for the weekend, and we had to try The Melting Pot! As first timers, Shell made sure to give us the whole rundown of the menu. She also provided us with great recommendations. Everything was AMAZING. The manager stopped by and checked on us. We ran into a small issue with a gift card, but management took care of us and made sure we left as happy customers!! Extremely happy with this experience and will be returning!
Amazing per usual!!! We had the wisconsin (but vegan) and the classic alpine cheeses, and then the s'mores and flaming turtle chocolate fondues. Great service (shout out John) and super fast!

business.name: KitzMo Sushi
business.categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Japanese, Sushi Bars

reviews.text:
Fine sushi place. They have some great appetizers for all you can eat sushi.

Sushi quality is alright. They do serve their sushi with big portions of rice, but their rolls are unique and good.

6/10

I've been coming here for years now and I had never a bad experience until today I came in and a waiters  named Danielle was extremely rude she has horrible customer skills we sat for 20 min before she even checked on us and when we'd ask for something she didn't bother to bring anything food quality was great but unfortunately the servers are by far the worst I've ever seen

I have been here a few times, but haven't been in awhile. Tonight I came in with my husband after waiting over 45 minutes to get into Tokyo, and I must say I don't remember it being this amazing!! The service was great, the rolls were perfect and I'm a stickler for a quail egg shooter and this one definitely aced the test. Finished it off with some strawberry mochi that was completely freezer burnt like most places! Will most definitely be coming back here way more!

Well, after years of my coworkers telling me to try this place next time I go to Reno for work, I had to finally try it. Why the hesitation? Hmm sushi in Reno, NV didn't sound appetizing.

Glad I tried this place! The staff are all helpful and friendly. Establishment is clean and the prices are very reasonable. The host Francesca was patient in explaining how the menu works.

Ok Eric, what about the food? So I tried the:

-Dragon Maki Roll= tempura shrimp, avacado, unagi (little small but decent)
-Dragon Ball Roll= tempura shrimp, unagi, avocado, spicy crab, tabiko (lots of toppings!)
-Seared Salmon Nigiri (amazing seared flavor)
-Tobiko Unagi Nigiri (delicious!)
-miso soup (could be more flavorful)
-fried gyoza (too fried, but seems homemade w/ chunks of filling, not mushy like prefrozen)
-quail egg shooter (sauce too sweet)
-green tea ice cream (think this is the best green tea ice cream I've had)
-pineapple ice cream (wish I could take a tub of this home)

Geeze Eric, how much did that cost?? Only $27.95! Because it's all you can eat! Made to order, not buffet style.  Sushi chef Carlos was fast and helpful, his service was fantastic! 

Highlights? The salmon Nigiri and the Dragon Ball Roll are scrumptious. Everything had a generous amount of ingredients (Dragon Maki Roll could use a little more unagi). 

Why does this place have so many mixed reviews? Seems like the majority of good reviews are sit-in and the majority of bad reviews are delivery or take out. This restaurant does seem busy with take out and delivery apps.  If you don't eat your sushi here quick enough, the rice does get kinda "chewier" which I can see why some negative reviews said the rice is bland with no rice vinegar. 

Moral of the story: for the best experience, dine in at Kitzmo! 5 stars for the quality for the price
The worst sushi that we have ever tried... We tried the Teriyaki combo and it was expensive for the portion of chicken and with no flavor.  Dont have complaint about the place/ service

I ordered from here on Uber eats and I am so surprised that Uber said that this place is a top 3 for sushi in the city. I was extremely underwhelmed and disappointed. It's not good. The rice taste like nothing at all and rolls with sauce on top have so much it is almost inedible. 

Sushi 7 is where i usually go and it is truly leaps and bounds better than this. Each roll at Kitzmo tastes so similar and I'm really just so disappointed. 

It's not bad it's just not good and for how much sushi costs in town I would not want to pay such a high price for mediocrity.

It was okay. The staff was great. Smiling, masked. Really nice people. The bathroom was horrible. They should update it, but at least hire a cleaner if they won't clean it daily.  Had some not so great bites. I'd rather have less but fresh and good. Ginger tasted moldy.  If they make a couple changes things could be much better.

I hate to leave negative reviews, but I really did not enjoy this sushi restaurant. Two stars for service, because our waitress was sweet, helpful and tentative. I went for all you can lunch and she let us know if we wanted to try one or two dinner rolls they could do that, which was so nice! She told us her favorite rolls and we tried a few. We ordered 5 or 6 different rolls and they all tasted almost the same, they were chewier/soggier than most sushi and not tons of flavor. I wanted to like it but I was just unimpressed by the appetizers, rolls and desserts. The restaurant itself is small, but cute and service, again was great! The one thing we did enjoy were the mussels.

The service was just ok. 
The sushi: Flavor 4/10, Uniqueness 7/10, Presentation 5/10
The quality and quantity: 5/10
The prices were normal for the area.
The good part was there was no wait for a table or seats at the bar. 

Sushi dinner for 2 is a $100 affair, with drinks, tips, and food. This didn't feel special in any way.

My friend suggested we come here for sushi, bad choice. I think they really rate a 2 1/2 star at best.
For the price of a AYCE place, the quality of the fish was lacking not to mention the very very very limited selection of fish.
The grade of the fish was what I was disappointed with, the fish was dry and lacked flavour. I only ordered hamachi, maguro, unagi, mackerel, surf clam, a rainbow roll, miso soup, baked mussels and a salad.
The fish was cut pretty thin compared to the amount of rice, the unagi was pieces and pretty thin.
Here's the kicker, they had no green tea ice cream or any ice cream for that matter, really???, I settled for green tea and mango mochi, I know I have better mochi at home.
All and all they really need to get a better grade of fish and a wider variety of fish in general, and I almost forgot, they didn't have spam, wow, and lower their price to match their quality.
I certainly will not patronize this place again if they don't get their act together.
I hope the owners will take note.

We were disappointed because we read some reviews that this place was in the top 10 Sushi places in Reno.  Not yet...but you have this potential.
First off, no pleasant greetings walking in.  We are used to a friendly sushi bar greeting patrons as they step in. ( I have seen this problem in every sushi bar we have gone to since moving here...why is that?)

The place felt "sad" and a bit drab.
We did not see any happy faces on the waiters or the sushi staff.
No smiles or laughter, no greetings...not once for the hour we were there.  We sat at a tiny table. The setting was plainly low budget. 
We thought, give it a chance, try the food, we could be pleasantly surprised.
We ordered our favorite sushi, salmon hand skin rolls.  Not too bad!  A little bit greasy freshly made,  fresh tasting and not chewy. Best we have had in Reno so far (after 4 places listed in top 10)
We ordered a couple of cut rolls, all fresh tasting, but fish lacking flavor. No ginger or wasabi was offered and the tea was so bitter and strong for green tea. Not looking too good.
The second cut roll was very bland. The fish on top was mostly farmed, light in color and 
Low on flavor. The only fish that had good flavor was the yellowtail! Nice and fresh. The other ingredients otherwise had a wonderful fresh flavor!! Very nice!
We asked for some Ponzu sauce.  (Need some flavor here)
And after a long wait and again asking...."It" was served.  They may have tried to look up how to make it, we got vinegar soy sauce with an emphasis on the vinegar!  
They had a nice presentation, well made sushi, cut great, but in no way have they ever made this sauce or maybe any other sauce to compliment sushi.
We were sad to see this, as they had tried hard to have a fresh taste, they accomplished this extremely well!!  
You can tell they served mostly Farmed fish. I am sure with "all you can eat", they had no choice price wise.  They are doing their best, I can see that. 
So, compliments on the yellowtail, flavor was fantastic!! (I grew up ocean fishing)
This place is redeemable, yes it is next to a massage parlor but many gems have flourished in odd areas.
Bring in a proper sushi Master,
Learn your sauces, change from all you can eat to high quality sushi, your chefs have most the skills already, bring back the friendly greetings, a Japanese master sushi chef who can teach you sauces, help you train you chefs. With some great publicity as you begin your venture and intermittently on how you are progressing....I see a place to frequent and enjoy dining in.
You are a diamond in the rough.  
It would be a shame to see your vision disappear.  You food is  fresh tasting, and a nice presentation...find your way, you could be that Business who brings back the joy of eating amazing fresh sushi with happy regular customers who become friends as well as patrons. We sincerely hope to see you prosper and grow your business into a wonderful dining experience.
Overpriced tiny rolls with no flavor! They don't even use the sushi rice with rice vinegar; they use plain rice. Yuck! A waste of money and stomach space. I'm pissed!
Great place to do all you can eat. Really friendly service and the owner was really nice. He took our photo at the end. The best thing we had was the silver and blue.

I will come here every weekend. Best sushi of all time.

My gf doesn't like sushi, she does now

I came back here again, and the food is just as good. I tried the spicy vegetarian roll and it was great! 
The one thing that was wrong was the service. There were two servers on staff, and it seemed like they were a little over loaded. Things took a long time. One of the servers messed up our order. Our bill took a while to come and when it did, it was wrong. We came at about 4:30 and the restaurant was a little busy. I think the staff was just a little overwhelmed.

Ordered from Uber Eats. Delivery was disappointing. I asked for teriyaki sauce (that is included on one of the rolls) on the side. Didn't get it. I was given a mere two small packets of soy sauce (not enough for one let alone two people). Rolls were just okay. Based on this experience, it's unlikely I'll visit the restaurant or order in the future. There are plenty of other options. This order felt like a throwaway to this establishment. Too bad.

This sushi place is our go to for vegetarian sushi. It can be hard to find flavorful and diverse options for vegetarian sushi, but this place really gets it done. 
We got the Futomaki, Tempura Vegetable, "V V" roll, and the Avocado Nigiri. All delicious! We finished our meal with the Stuffed Inari, and it was perfect. It is sweet enough to feel like dessert, and small enough to not stuff you. 

Overall this place is great for vegetarian diners looking for good sushi!

*warning* if you do not like lemon, you will not like the "V V" roll.

We used to really love coming in. The food and atmosphere was amazing. But it seems like every time we come in, its become increasingly worse. This time, we ordered a bento box for our daughter, and AYCE for my husband and I. Only got the items on the front of our form, nothing on the back. Made out another form and after waiting 20 minutes and watching the only other people in the restaurant (a couple at the bar) getting roll after roll; we said something to our waitress. All she could say was I'm really sorry and the only thing I can do is tell the owner because he (the cook) doesn't speak any English. So we ended up paying $90 for one bento box, 2 appetizers, 2 nigiri, and 4 rolls.

Actually was pretty good sushi for all you can eat. We didn't like a few of the rolls and the waitress going to charge us extra for not eating the rolls we didn't like. But after some chatting she changed her mind. Over all good service. And honestly how does anyone know if rolls will be liked or not....

While on a recent trip to Reno,we stopped by for an all you can eat lunch.  Got to say that some of the order was spot-on while some was seriously lacking. The staff was the best and we enjoyed the atmosphere but some of the other patrons were noisey and a bit annoying.
Food was good but the portions were VERY small for their sushi rolls.  Got 6 rolls for 4 people and left hungry. Very disappointing!! Smallest rolls I've ever seen

Good food, but possibly my worst restaraunt experience ever.

I ordered AYCE, I'll break it down course by course.

Drinks- You get one drink the entire time, the servers may need a map to find tables that aren't at the bar? Not sure. Over an hour to get a drink refill which required hounding down a server.

Appetizers- These actually came out on time, the mussels are actually very good as well as the gyoza and vegetables

Sushi- I primarily eat rolls and ordered 8. Of those 8 I received 6, of those 6 one was not what I ordered, and two were missing ingredients. The three I wanted and got complete were actually very good. 

For nigiri over half of my nigiri order simply never arrived on both the first and second order sheets. Some fish was also weirdly warm?

Time between finishing first set and receiving second order sheet was 25 minutes. Time between second order sheet being filled out and taken was 15 minutes. Time between second order sheet being taken and receiving food was 30 more minutes. Heavily considered just leaving at numerous points along this timeline, doubt the servers would even notice!

Dessert- Pretty sure the mochi is the my mochi brand you find at the super market, actually not a bad idea as it at least arrived in a timely manner and as described.

I want to like this place, however paying to not receive half the stuff I order, not get any server attention, and have some of the things I do receive be simply wrong is dissapointing.

I have come here several times and every time the fish has been warm and gross.  The rice is overcooked and then smushed into sushi shapes so that each bite feels like a brick in your stomach.  The fish quality is bad and doesn't even taste like fish, just warm weirdly sweet mush. The waiters are inattentive and I went nearly 40 minutes without getting a water refill or getting a new paper for the all you can eat. The restaurant was never even close to full when I was there and for some reason there was still horrible service.  Half of our all you can eat order was consistently left off and they just forgot about it. Sometimes they brought us the wrong food entirely.  While I was there, the table immediately adjacent told the server the food was bad, didn't eat most of their food they ordered, and left. They made the right call.
This place is awesome super fresh fish great service today I give this place a #1 A+++ rating like Arnold says I'll be back

Been here before a few times and it was fine. Sat our party of 6 down for a birthday dinner, ready to have some AYCE fun!!!. We had two order forms where we ordered various hand rolls and long rolls. Maybe 12 rolls total.

We wound up getting rolls that we did not order and they never delivered the hand rolls at all.

Asked one of our servers "What roll is that?" and she replied "I don't know" and walked away.

There were maybe 2 long rolls left to eat so we asked one of our servers for another order form for the rest of the group, she replied:

"You have to eat what you have left on the table before you get another order form" She was an older lady with glasses.

Got another order form finally (half of the table didn't have any food for quite some time- while the other half of the table finished their's)

Maybe they didn't want to provide good service because they automatically tack on %18 gratuity for parties of 6 or more,

Won't be back

business.name: White Dog Cafe - Haverford
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Event Planning & Services, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Vegetarian, American (New), Venues & Event Spaces, Gluten-Free, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text: I have used this restaurant for several Holiday meals.  This thanksgiving was not what I expected.   The turkey was extremely dry and the stuffing was over saturated with liquid.   I did take the tray back and asked them to call but two weeks later nobody has followed up.

After visiting this location a few times with mixed experience, tonight's dinner was a big disappointment. The early evening dining rooms were lightly attended, with ample front of the house staff. 
Our server was competent, but rarely visited our table. Our wines and appetizers were prompt and delicious. And then, crickets. 20 mins. 30 mins. 45 mins. No server, no entrees. 
Diners all around our table (whom arrived after us) were served their entrees before ours. We waited. And waited. Our server didn't stop by to give us an update. Finally I flagged down the server, explained our disappointment, and asked for the check for the appetizers and wine. And waited. 
The manager arrived with what can only be described as a condescending apology, and offered us a gift card. A gift card to a restaurant offering poor service and long waits for mediocre food? No thanks.

The minute you walk in the door there were three hostesses. None of them had a smile on their faces. Not at all welcoming. I ordered the Kennett Square mushroom soup, it was puréed with tons of garlic in it. Terrible flavor I had to send it back. It was also cold.The waitress put it in front of me and had to come back with a spoon. My steak was OK. It had a lot of a sweet sauce to it which was good. But I asked for some bread and I had to purchase it. A $54 steak and not a piece of bread on the table. I was there three different times wanting to give it another chance. But I'll never go back and would never recommend it to anyone.

Tried this restaurant 3 times. Good food. Unfortunately 3 hostesses are not friendly nor do they seem to know what they are doing. Servers are not educated on their menu as they need to ask the kitchen questions. Also our server wasn't aware there were specials again in the kitchen to ask. Asked for bread. Not available unless you purchase. $54 steak and no bread. Something is wrong here. Manager/owner needs to be made aware of the staff's shortcomings. I will not be returning. Very disappointed

The manager , a tall guy with beard , redhead . I think his name is : Bryan 
He's so mean , impolite and unprofessional ! Yelled at me because I asked him how long it will take for my food to be ready ! Will ever go back there !!

I've come  to like the bar and the bartenders. When it comes to finer dining in the more formal side, not so much. The level of service drops precipituosly, and other elements including the menu do not make it any better. Food offering feels stale and the overall ambiance stalled. I came here when the place first openend and everything is pretty much the same. Some  much needed evolution, upgrades and refresh would have been expected by now.

We are fairly regular customers here- often eating at the bar- but last night we made a reservation, asked for a quieter table as we hosted an older couple- ( late 70's) 
Unfortunately we had a table at the front of the house. 
That would have been okay had the food and service not been equally disappointing. It's our neighborhood place and we would like to be proud of it. We like to meet friends for dinner over the weekends and it would be nice if we could confidently present what we have in our hood. It is going to be difficult going forward as we do not want to overpromise and underdeliver to our friends.

Went to White Dog Cafe on a Wednesday night for a triple date. The ambience was fantastic - loved the setup inside and all the decors; pretty eclectic and definitely dog-focused. Our waiter was super attentive and patient with our orders. He also never failed to refill waters, which is something that waiters/waitresses tend to forget. And let me tell you about the food - THEY WERE DELICIOUS! We got some house-made foccacia and beet salad for appetizers. Everything was gone after 15 minutes! A few of us got the spicy lamb bolognese, which was superb. I got the roasted chicken with yogurt sauce. Chicken was perfectly cooked - super moist and very crispy skin. All the accompaniments went really well with the chicken too. Another person from my party got the salmon and it was also delicious. Overall, it was a very good experience and we will definitely come back. Definitely worth the higher price!

The ambiance here is fantastic. Really old school classy inside, pics of dogs everywhere, lovely all around. Food is well put together, menu isn't your typical city brunch menu, might lack a little depth but it speaks quality over quantity. Would recommend. 

Bloody Mary didn't wow me but sangria was solid

Came here to celebrate our 17th wedding anniversary the other night. We've been here a few other times over the years and have always enjoyed it, so we figured we go again for this special occasion. Has made a reservation but waited a little while for a table to be available, not a big deal. We're both vegetarian/vegan ans we always appreciate that they have a whole vegetarian menu that we can order from. We ordered a hummus platter and two tofu entrees along with some drinks. Drinks were great, tofu dishes were pretty good. I love tofu, so it's fine, but it wasn't especially flavorful. But our hummus platter was no where to be seen. By the time we got to mention this to our server we were nearly done with our meals. He was awesome and apologized and said he'd get that right out for us. 10 minutes later it still hadn't arrived and even he was completely surprised and disappointed. He said he'd comp is dessert and take hummus off of bill. But we were still hungry, so he ran inside and grabbed a hummus platter for us and comped us another round of drinks. He handled everything great and was as professional and polite as can be, but obviously something was off with service that night. We'll certainly be back sometime, but I expect a bit more from a "higher end" restaurant such as this.

3 stars for atmosphere and good food, 0 for service. I understand restaurants are having a hard time with help, but we sat at the bar for brunch and I guess I should have known it would be bad when the BARTENDER didn't even give us a drink menu. Ordered a cocktail which took so long I thought he forgot about it. Then he did forget to put in part of our order. The runners gave us our food, and we were more than half way finished when he even bothered to ask if we were ok and only then were we able to tell him part of the order was missing. Keep in mind that he was eating his own meal at the bar during this time!! He finally brought the forgotten side with no apologies when we literally had one bite of our entrees left and still charged us for it. We have both worked in the Industry and often give a pass but this was just kind of unacceptable. 

In hindsight, should have talked to the manager but I think we were in shock at how terrible he was and just wanted out. Won't sit at the bar if we come back.

Grace and Hospitality 
My husband and I are new here and decided to go for a walk, when I started to feel lightheaded. My husband saw the White Dog cafe & thought we could go in for a quick snack and get out of the heat, not realizing this was a sit down place. I would have turned around, since we were really not dressed for it, but the hostesses and waitresses were so gracious and friendly and welcoming. This is true hospitality. We are quick to point out discrimination, I wanted to share a good experience. I was also impressed that they had a separate vegetarian/vegan menu. I recommend the mint chip martini  & Creme brûlée - was amazing! Will be back, this time with a reservation.

Found this place while visiting nearby college. So glad we did. Good beer selection. The cheese board was really good. The roast half chicken was cooked to perfection and the sides that accompanied were delicious. The pasta special with crab, corn and tomato was very tasty and a good size portion. The service was also good. Would definitely return.

White Dog is a favorite -- came here for a special birthday brunch and our server, Dan, was extremely caring and helpful throughout our meal! The food is always 10/10. The crab dip is a must, and you cannot go wrong with any cocktails! I had a watermelon aperol bellini and it was outstanding. Need to come back for dinner or happy hour :)

We made plans to go brunch on Father's Day. This would be for a table of 4. I was assured there would be outside seating when I called. However the day before I drove by and was sad to see the outside seating was removed. I wish I was alerted about this as I could
Have made different plans. We ended up with pastries at home. It was fine but we had looked forward to brunch. We won't be back soon to white dog as we are not yet comfortable eating inside.

The food was delicious and the service was great. We ordered the Verlasso Salmon which was fine. It was Pretty simple, fresh salmon, not heavily seasoned, and the Green Meadow Double Cheddar Burger on the brioche bun with the Truffle Parmesan Fries, was delicious! The restaurant has an upscale vibe, as to be expected on the mainline.

Food is comparable to other locations. Front desk is racial. For all the seats that were emptied - we were sent to the one that's half feet from the other table, no divider, cramppy - while white folks who came later than we do were sent to the table with 4 seats. That had applied to the other couple who entered the restaurant afterward. There it went for the "socially distanced indoor seating. 
Very irritated by the social bias and won't be coming to this location anymore. 

Ordered a half chicken and found it cold inside. Not cooked through. 

By the way we had made the reservation two weeks ago. Unless there was a better reason or I could not explain why we have received a different treatment except of our ethnicity.

Funky, eclectic place. Lots of unique dog art pieces scattered about in an overlaying bohemian farm style thing. It's an interesting but calm vibe. Drinks were good, got the Dolby mule and gf got the Lucky Lady both good. The salmon was very good and so was the spicy lamb bolognese. A bit pricey, nothing blew me away but it was solid. It's like a "hidden gem" by choice kinda vibe but all in all worth it for a date night when you want something a bit fancy.

Do not order 'To Go' food from here. I placed my order for a group of people and received confirmation the order was received. When I went to pick it up they told me their To Go order system was down and they never received my order. All they offered to do was place my order again and have me wait in store for it to be made. No compensation, not even a glass of wine to help the inconvenience of making you wait. White Dog treats you as if they're doing you a favor verses being appreciative of your patronage. Plenty of other great restaurants on the mainline.

It was a very special occasion. The first time that my husband went out side to a restaurant since his stroke in December. We got to our table and waited and waited and waited. Finally I asked where our server was. It must've been about 10 minutes. A server came and said he was filling in for that table. Wow he was terrific, the restaurant did nothing for us to make up for our long wait. Also, in the reservations I said there was a birthday. They did not mention it at all when we arrived and I didn't wanna embarrass the party by saying it right to the server. All in all, although the food was very good I was so disappointed in the experience and I had hoped that my husband's first outing would be memorable.

Straight to the point. Over priced items with subtle flavor. The ambiance was subpar, I felt like I was sitting in a circus tent. Not fun. Our waitress was not attentive. Forgot the coffee, check and my to-go order. Overall, I would have paid less than half the price at Corner Bakery with similar service.
Baily was the best server ever. Beyond that, she was extremely personable and hilarious. Service and staff on point . Thanks, Bay. **nickname cause she made us that comfortable**
Burger was greasy and very soggy, fries were overcooked and tiny portion. I know we are in a pandemic but there is no excuse for the quality of the food, way overpriced very disappointed!

Satisfying eats @ white dog ! We dined outside which was generously spaced out in their tent and the heaters inside it kept us warm. We started with the crab dip which was definitely on the heavier side but if that is what you're looking for it's very tasty. Then we got the verlasso salmon (with Brussels instead of broccoli) and the burrata salad with salmon. The salmon was crispy and cooked throughout nicely. I cannot recommend the Brussels more. They serve it as a side. In my opinion if you're going to white dog you must get the Brussel sprouts! Service was a tad slow and decor outside was lacking but nothing else to complain about.

This is a really cute spot especially if you are a dog lover. They have really charming shabby chic decor with a lot of dog paintings all around and unique, eclectic light fixtures. The food and drinks were delicious. I highly recommend the yellowfin tuna tartare. It was flavorful and very refreshing. The Brussels sprouts was tasty. I had the burger medium with a fried egg added. It was seasoned well and perfectly cooked. Not dry at all. The service was  exceptional. I would definitely come back here to dine again. Great spot for groups or a date.

business.name: Deanie’s Seafood
business.categories: Restaurants, Specialty Food, Seafood, Food, Seafood Markets, Cajun/Creole, American (Traditional), Caterers, Event Planning & Services

reviews.text: Manager on duty was distasteful and Rude rude rude. Restaurant was dirty and the crab au gratin must have been rotten because it kept me with the trots the entire day later.  Service and friendliness towards patrons should be key to your business since there's competition so close and so much better right around the corner.

Went because the place we were going had an 1.5 he wait but Deanie's did not disappoint. Waiter was outstanding. Took our order w/o writing anything down and did not make a mistake. Our party was 10 folks! I had the combo platter of shrimp and catfish. It was plenty to eat and tasty. I would definitely go back.

Who doesn't like a good hole in the wall restaurant?! Even though this place is a bit bigger than your typical hole in the wall it definitely has the feel of one .  

The seafood and shrimp platter was wonderful ..classic fried platter meal.. nothing fancy but nothing is left to be desired ..portion size of the oysters and shrimp were more than fair .

The stuffed flounder was surprisingly bigger than expected so be sure to save space for it if ordering ..it was pretty good and flavorful.

My favorite was the seafood gumbo ..very satisfying . 

Was not a fan of the stuffed portion of the artichoke , it basically tasted like salty bread crumbs . 

Overall great experience and enjoyed trying  a restaurant outside of the French quarter .

My hubby took me on a little date night while we were in the area. This place was just as amazing as the other one we went to in Downtown New Orleans in 2014. So much good food!! The little boiled potatoes they bring you when you first down help you gave the teensy wait while you're food is being prepared. Our waiter was a young guy and he was very much on the ball. We never wanted for anything before he was there with a refill or to bring our check. I tried the mule (can't remember the name of it but it was delish!! It said it was family made? But it came in a can. I loved it but it would've been tasty over ice too.

We have been coming to Deanie's for as long as I can remember. As a kid, I remember my mom warning us not to fill up on the boiled red potatoes and butter while we waited for our salads, onion rings and blackened redfish.Now when we go back to visit friends with my family, I give my own kids the same warning.

Seafood, seafood, seafood.

Love the speckled trout, the blackened redfish or fresh catch of the days. Our friends love the seafood platters stacked high with shrimp, oysters, crab and crawfish. 

The fried artichoke hearts with Romano and pecorino cheeses are perfect to dip in marinara sauce. The colossal onion rings are so addictive. If your meals comes with a salad get the artichoke heart or fig dressing. Add the carrot soufflé as your side and take a pint of spicy potato salad to go. 

Not eating in? The seafood market is quick for a takeout order. Ordered speckled trout grilled on our last visit and the order was hot and ready in 15 minutes. The lemon meringue pie is worth the splurge, so good. Thanks also for the extra bag of red potatoes.

I have been going to Deanies on and off for the past decade or so. It remains one of my favorite places around New Orleans. The trick is that you have to know what to order, and it appears that many of the more negative reviews on here are from people who ordered the wrong thing. (random dips, non-seafood items, etc.)

Here's a tip: stick to the seafood. The gumbo is excellent and the fried shrimp are strong. Get those two things and you will be happy. When crawfish season rolls around, I'll be back to try it. 

The one thing they need to fix, however, is the lighting in the dining room. Someone ordered the wrong bulbs and put in those bluish-white LEDs that are very cold and harsh. A switch to a more natural lighting color would go a long way in improving the atmosphere.

The food was ok, not great. We ordered a variety of items, Artichoke appetizer, combo fried shrimp, oysters, fish, pork chops, dirty rice and a variety of beers. 
The beer selection is extremely limited and not very good at all. 
Our server was great and that's why I gave 3 stars!

I don't know what happened to Deanies. I used to love coming here and ruined many diets just to have that delicious seafood platter and satsuma daiquiri. But now, the seafood has NO SEASONING!! I was just here over the summer and now I'm back and I don't ever want to come back after this. The bartender was so unfriendly and looked at me crazy every time I spoke, but entertained her regulars graciously. I ordered a pina colada daiquiri blended with soft serve and got a cup of ice cream placed in front me. My entire appetite was off after having ice cream before my meal. There was hardly any liquor in it. I am hurt that Deanie's went downhill like it did. 

*I forgot to add how mushy the jambalaya was. It tasted like it was made from the box. Many Louisiana residents are amazing cooks and if it's one thing someone from Louisiana knows, it's a good jambalaya. Deanie's jambalaya is straight garbage.

This place was recomended to us by a friend, but i was not very impressed. They quoted us a 30 minute wait, but it took almost an hour. The restarsunt itself was super cold, which was weird. The food was good, and our server was grrat, but everything took forever.
The bbq shrimp and voodoo drink are to die for! Our waitress gave great recommendations and made us feel so welcome. We will definitely be back!

I can't believe that I am changing my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars, but I believe that I have no choice.  The question for reflection becomes, what happened to the seasoning?

I recently returned to my hometown for a visit.  As always, I had to get some Deanie's Seafood.  Yet, when I bit into my platter, the only thing that tasted the same were the crawfish balls.  

Deanie's please correct the seasoning.  Bland taste is not what I remember about your restaurant, growing up in New Orleans.  I was praying that this was an off day, but then I read other reviews and they had the same experience.
Great place for some great seafood.  COVID-19 precautions are being exercised which is great. Food is amazing as always. Highly recommend if in search of some great seafood....
Tasteless food, no seasonings, and bland... I do not recommend...Seafood gumbo, no crab, no okra, 2 shrimp...

Went to the Deanie's today for lunch with my 82 year old mother, we asked for seating for 4 because my 2 other family members were coming, they would not seat us, told us we can't hold up a table for 4 they have to be present,the place was empty, we wanted to order Appetizers and have a few drinks,they told us go sit at the bar,by the way my mother is blind, so I just walked out, terrible customer service, we went to Landries instead, and asked for a table for 4, we got seated right away, I will never go to buck town Denny's on Lake Avenue ever again

The last time we visited this restaurant my daughter had a bug in her drink. It looked like a fruit fly. The waiter said he didn't see it but he replaced the drink. The 2nd drink still had the bug in it because he only dumped the beverage, he did not give us a new cup. This time he saw the bug and replaced the drink and cup for the 3rd time. Our waiter did not offer us any of the complimentary potatoes although all the other tables had theirs. I had to ask for our potatoes. The food took a long time to arrive at our table.  The waiter had my husband's order wrong! Finally we get to eat and the food is mediocre at best. I used to like eating at this restaurant but this time we had poor service and a overall bad experience.

70.00 for tasteless food! You all stop seasoning your food for a few rating from people that probably isn't use to good seasoned food or people with High Blood pressure. I'VE been coming to this location for over 20 years and this is the first time I would not recommend anyone to go there!    I think someone need to taste the food and then ask yourself us this really what I want to serve to people!? Answer should be NO! YOU want food to as least have a taste, Salt is necessary,  even on CHOPPED THEY SAY IT ALL THE TIME.  
PLEASE CHEF COOK AS THOUGH YOU WOULD COOK FOR YOUR FAMILY. PLEASE ADD THE SEASONING AND SALT BACK INTO YOUR FRIED SEAFOOD. ITS ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY. I GAVE it 2 stars because you still get the good quantity of food.

This is very terrible food 0/10 this seafood restaurant serves no crab and the crab they have is soft crab very small and very hard to find meat. They catfish had no seasoning it was not decent at all.If your looking for good seafood in New Orleans DO NOT COME HERE, they also automatically including 20% service charge if you have a big table or if you have a separate checks. This place has nothing about it that is attractive 0/10.

The one in the West End is superior to the one in the French Quarter.
I find the sea food very good, generous portions, good service.
This spot was pretty good but some of the food was a little bland. Portion sizes were great!

Th the bartender Gabrielle I believe was her name! Terrible customer service , & it's a shame @ how good how good her cocktails are & her customer service is terrible! She shouldn't be behind the bar & dk how to work under pressure when dealing with guest! You never know who have been in the service industry so treating ppl like that is underlining disrespectful! She don't need to be the face of you'll bar , Bc she doesn't hold that title. She's rude & mean! I'll never ask her to service me ever! She don't do well with black guest , & we wanted to tip her for her drinks cause they were so good!!!!!! But her nasty attitude costed her , her tip & returning customers!!!!!!!!!!!!!
So the seafood platter was really good!! And we were able to split it amongst 4 people. I would've liked tho if they gave me my gumbo before my meal/platter

This DIP is horrible and the customer service is even worst. We were not satisfied what so ever! So when we asked the manager to correct it he stated NO and that's our policy. No problem! We said we would like to cancel our order. He said NO if it's been already placed. Luckily it wasn't and we paid our tab and left! I never experienced such horrible customer service from a manager at that! Never will I recommend this spot...not even to my dog that I don't even have!!! Caution as you decide to eat here!!!!!!

Heard of this place for years... was disappointed. We had the boiled shrimp. They were out of crab that I really wanted. The shrimp tasted good, but most were difficult to peel. Corn tasted okay, but wasn't that great. Service was excellent and staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean.
The appetizers were great.  The fried seafood needed more seasoning.  If you like bland fried seafood then you will like it.
Dining experience can be highly influenced by poor service despite the taste and quality of the food   Poor service due to lack of courtesy and common sense makes it worse

business.name: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill
business.categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Desserts, Steakhouses, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Food, Wine Bars, Nightlife

reviews.text: We were seated on time for our reservation. The wait staff when present was pretty good, I would say very accommodating due to the food allergies of my girls.  My steak and shrimp came out tepid. My wife had salmon that was over done and her mashed potatoes were cold. I was disappointed with the kitchen service. This used to be my go to place to celebrate a special occasion but I think the reputation of firebirds is on the decline. We will be finding a new place to celebrate.

I placed a to go order online and decided to go in and sit at the bar to have a happy hour cocktail while I waited on my order. I was greeted promptly by Neiman. He had a very pleasant disposition and explained a few things on the menu. I ended up ordering the lemon drop martini which was tasty. My order was ready right at the time that was stated. I ordered the kids meal wings for my daughter which included two sides.  She chose mashed potatoes and vegetables w/ a side of ranch. Food was warm when we arrived home. This was just the right amount of food for her. We will be back.

Went here for dinner when a different restaurant was closed. The Caesar salad was good, but the chicken I ordered was very dry and the vegetables were over steamed and flavorless. My partners steak was tuff and tasted like actual shoe leather. Was very disappointed for the price of the meal.

This was our 2nd time eating there. Both times the service was good. Our waitress was very nice for both visits. The food the first time was okay, not worth the price though. Decided to try again. My husband's larger steak and appetizers were fine. This time I had to send back 1/2 my $30 (medium cooked) steak after numerous bites being difficult or impossible to chew because of silver throughout and the center being solid blood red and completely odd in texture. It was more like what you would expect at a buffet. The waitress was polite and offered to remake it, but time didn't allow for us so I asked for grilled shrimp. It came out quickly but they were very small. I was still being charged full price for the steak. I had to request that some be deducted. They removed one of the appetizers for $10 and didn't charge 7.25 for the shrimp. This was better than nothing. I can't justify going again.
Outstanding food with booths that make it easy to talk with family and friends. Our grandchildren ordered from the children's menu and the portions were good size and high quality.

This was my first time dinning at this establishment and I can honestly say that I was very pleased with everything. My waitress was for sweet, She checked on us several times. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the other guest at my table and including the birthday girl had to send their drinks back because it wasn't made right, it was some type of margarita, they said it tasted like only lime juice and no liquor.

Waited for over an hour and half for a to-go order. Was nice to staff and treated them with utmost respect, wish I could say they did the same in return. Terrible management. Firebirds used to be a great restaurant but has rapidly gone downhill in recent times. Eventually had to leave without any of the food we had paid around $150 for. Money is just money, but the opportunity cost of not being able to go to another restaurant before they closed, due to waiting our night away, was the real damage. For those wondering about the food, it's no longer worth the price or worth putting up with the poor service. We were hopeful that they would get things turned around but were disappointed for the last time.

We brought our family of seven to enjoy a celebration of our daughters graduation from nursing school. We were shocked to find out they do not seat parties of seven together.
