They could but choose not to.  If you have a party of six you're OK and they will seat you together. They offered us two separate tables separated by probably 5 feet but who would like to have a family dinner separated by an aisle. So I checked Firebird's website and did not find anything on the front page that says they do not seat a party of seven or more together. 

Granted, it is there a restaurant and they can do with it as they please but I will not be back. I not would I recommend an establishment with this type of customer service to anyone. Fortunately, when we left we can across a lovely Italian restaurant right across the street which was happy to seat us all together. I am glad we found this wonderful gem to replace Firewoods and their poor customer service.

I've eaten at other firebirds and enjoy the chain and the dining experience. 

However, whether it's the staffing shortage or just how this location is run, the staff were distracted and scattershot in their customer service approach 

10 minute wait past my reservation for a table, despite a number of tables being open. 

Waitress forgot my appetizer and while the steak was cooked to order, the cut of beef was decidedly sub par. 

Sadly, I was warned that the location was not the best, but because of my positive experiences in the past, I didn't want to believe it.
The food was amazing! Very crowded, so make sure you make reservations. Service was a little slow but that was to be expected due the crowd. Servers were nice too

We have been to this location several times over the years. We have had lunch, dinner & even a few big events. We had a family dinner planned, tried an earlier time slot to avoid the rush - which we did as there was ample parking when we arrived - only to be told they will not seat a party over 6. We had 7 people and the restaurant was rather empty. We have been seated there with more than 6 in the past. The hostess was rather rude. This "policy" is not listed anywhere on their website or reservation apps. We had to regroup in the parking lot and went somewhere else. Customer service is extinct, and we will not be returning nor recommending this restaurant anymore. It is very disappointing.

Service was okay, steak okay (overcooked) then when requested to remake it came back rare (undercooked) and only seared on each side. We each ordered steak; I had the filet and they had ribeye. They just couldn't get the steaks right this night. Both of our steaks were sent back twice. We saw several going back to kitchen from other tables. Manager was rude and not concerned; only took one off the bill and we only got to enjoy our drinks and the appetizer. I am giving this place 3 stars only because I've been here before and would have given 4 stars then and 2 stars for this visit as the drinks and appetizer were good and I have hope that it will improve. I think it was just an off night as I've been here before.

So, actually, this place is great. My sister and I came for dinner. The server was bad. Really rude. My sister ordered salmon with mashed potatoes. The waitress asked what salad dressing she wanted. My sister and I were unaware that it came with a salad...well because it doesn't. They ended up charging for the salad that they implied came with the meal. 
I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with no bun. Along with a side of veggies. The waitress did not refill out drinks. Not one time. She did not bring mustard like we asked. Short brown hair, thin, didn't get her name. But she needs training.

Good food. Nice atmosphere. I really enjoyed the Cajun rib eye (not 100% sure if this is what it is called on the menu but that's the concept). The steak was encrusted with a chili spice and a dollop of Cajun butter on top. Never had this for a steak and it was amazing!! It have it all the flavor it needed. I would def order again.

We visited the Saint Charles location today and arrived at 3:15pm. On approaching the hostess, she explained we couldn't be seated until 4:00pm because they were short of staff and only had two servers. It was my wife's birthday and I wanted to take her to her favorite restaurant, but again Firebird's had to disappoint us. This happened earlier in the summer on our anniversary and were also turned away. 

We are an older couple, so we like to eat mid-afternoon to get away from the crowds and noise. We would have been happy to have been seated and enjoy a couple cocktails while waiting, but we weren't even offered this choice. This is the last straw, we will not be returning to Firebird's again, it's obvious they don't need our business. Please don't offer any apologies or coupons for us to visit again. We will not be back!

Firebirds refused to seat my family. We were told that they will not seat any party greater than 6 people. Since there are more than 6 people in my family, we were not allowed to eat at this restaurant. I will return the favor and refuse to eat at this restaurant in the future. I understand there are COVID-19 restrictions, but to refuse a family that all live in the same household is rediculous. They have lost my business.

My wife and I chose to eat here after seeing the 4.3 star average.
Pros:Great location, great atmosphere, my filet and mashed potatoes were great.

Cons: wife"s Aged Ribeye was not good and I'm not even sure if it was actually aged. He also paid for the Chile rub that was not put on it. He would have asked for a new steak and to have the rub put on if the waitress would have come back around. I was also wanting some steak sauce but we never saw her again until we were ready for the check. 

Happy hour had decent drink specials and half priced appetizers. 

Overall for a mid to high range steakhouse it was a mediocre experience for a $100 tab.

Bellyed up to the bar. Waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged. I was asked, finally, "Drink menu or full menu ", to which I replied, full menu. Waited 5 more minutes, hoping I would at least be asked what would would you like to drink... crickets. Walked out. For an out of town traveler, bad first impression.

Visited Firebirds WFG in the Streets of St Charles last night.  We had an 8:15 reservation and arrived 15 minutes early. We had a couple of Lemon Drop martinis? at the bar and were seated promptly at 8:15.  We liked the ambiance, decor, high sealing.  It's warm and inviting.  The best thing is the service.  Each and every staff member we encountered was upbeat, smiling, and engaging.  Special kudos to out waitress (I'm sorry I can't remember your name).

The food was good but not great.  The wine list needs help . . . 
We started with the Lobster Spinach Queso.  I'm not a queso guy, but this was enjoyable.  Lots of crab and spinach. Tasty.

 My GF had a mixed green salad.  It was very nice and big too.  The Cilantro Lime vinaigrette was good without being over powering.

We both had prime rib with a baked potato.  The potatoes were a hit.  They were baked rubbed with rock salt.  The prime rib good but pedestrian.  We ordered mid-rare and got medium.  Mine had an inedible skin on one edge.  

We ordered a side of the Port Mushrooms.  They were done nicely.  Cooked perfectly in a balanced lightly rich sauce.

In all, a nice evening, experience, and meal.  We'll go back,  Another quick shout to the staff!!

Some aspects were great, but not consistent for all. The onion rings were crispy and delicious with the ranch dip. Lobster dip was ok. Spinach was in large chunks and was difficult to eat. The steak sandwich and sirloin steak meals were excellent while the California burger tasted bland and the ribeye was way under cooked. We ordered medium and it was barely medium rare. The staff at first acted like it was ordered incorrectly, but later was very apologetic for how it was done. In the end, the staff (2 different people) handled it professionally and that was appreciated. 
Both the steak sandwich and the sirloin steak were properly cooked at medium and tasted amazing with the wood fire flavor.

We were visiting from out of town and wanted a good steak to celebrate our anniversary.  Our hotel recommended this spot, so we were hopeful.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed.  The staff were all very friendly, so I have no complaints with that.  However, my center cut sirloin was dry, tough, and chewy despite being medium rare.  Not sure how that happens.  (My husband's prime rib was similar and had to be drowned in the sauces.)  The manager came over and recommended the filet instead.  In waiting for that, it was a bummer that I couldn't eat at the same time as my husband for our anniversary dinner.  The filet was juicier, but for the price, it lacked flavor.  When we were given the check, we had been only charged for the sirloin.  However, when the slip came back for me to sign, they had up charged me for the price of the filet.  I did not appreciate that switch--especially without telling us and when we couldn't even enjoy the meal together.  This was a total disappointment for the price point.

I really wanted to love this place... from the moment you walk in, it has a really great upscale atmosphere with the stone & dark wood decor inside with dim lighting. The salad, bread, draft beer choices, & dessert were all great, but the entrees (where you will spend most of your money) are just not very good. 

The draft beer choices were pretty solid - lots of craft beer options including blue moon & Sam Adams Octoberfest.

The caesar salad was pretty good. It was a pretty large salad for a side. The dressing was pretty tasty, although it could've been a bit thicker dressing. It had a mixture of large fresh  parmesan shavings & fresh grated parmesan with crispy croutons. I'd get this again. 

The bread was an individual round loaf of homemade bread. Soft on the inside & covered in the semolina flour on the outside. Very tasty & enough for 2 people. 

The entrees is where things went wrong.  I ordered the filet mignon since the menu bragged about 21 day aged meat. However my filet was so chewy, my jaw hurt trying to chew it. It was wrapped in this fatty piece of bacon that I just threw out. Every time I order steak at a good steakhouse, I never have leftovers, but here, I took home half of my small 7 oz filet mignon since it was so chewy. I was just tired of  eating it. I got the parmesan mashed potatoes with it.  These were just ok. Just tasted like standard mashed potatoes with lumps. Probably wouldn't get these again.

My husband got the striped bass for his entree. The striped bass was overcooked. The best part of the dish was the curry flavored shrimp on top. These were really tasty! The rice pilaf had a really odd flavor to it that I didn't like. I couldn't put my finger on what the flavor was- almost tasted like chipotle flavor to me. The asparagus weren't grilled or seasoned at all. 

For dessert, we got the carrot cake. This was really good! Moist carrot cake with chopped nuts served warm with cream cheese icing & salted caramel sauce to pour over it.

Their bread service is pretty good.  A 6in pillowy loaf baked fresh for us.

My wife liked the casear salad.  Shavings of block parm along with course grated parm.  The sauce was more watery than thick but evenly coated.

The bass was ok but kind of plain tasting.  A tad bit overcooked too.  The rice pilaf was also plain.  Asparagus was cooked well but not well seasoned or charred.  

My wife's filet was very chewey and undercooked.  The mashed potatoes were lumpy style but not very cheesey or flavorful.

The carrot cake is very good.  Creme cheese frosting is rich and not too sweet and plenty of large nuts and coconut throughout.  The salted caramel topping is more on the sweet side.

When we first arrived there was a mix up at the hostess desk on seating, which took a couple of minutes or so to straighten out which resulted in us waiting as well. We were sat immediately after since we had a reservation, and although that happened we waited about 10 minutes before we had to get someone's attention to ask who was our server. One of the hostess apologized and stated it was a mix up or shift change or something. They ended up comping us with a free appetizer which was nice and appreciated. While waiting for our drink order (lemon drop, it was okay a little watered down, and a watermelon something my husband ordered he said it was okay) as we sat we noticed that a couple of tables around us was served bread and we didn't get any. ‍ I did mention it was our 22 anniversary and well there was no acknowledgement of that ‍. The restaurant was busy, good ambiance a little nosey but again they were busy. We order the wood fire wings as an app, salmon with mushrooms and I added shrimp, my husband order a burger and fries. The wings were good, my salmon and salmon were good, and his burger and fries were pretty good. I believe we will give this restaurant a second try, service was kind of slow and we will see how they'll do the next time around.

Not a great experience. My family has never sent anything back but we sent two plates back here. One plate was a ribeye that was over well done when requested medium rare and a rotten baked potato. The other plate was a burger and a large piece of paper was tangled up in the burger. We also waited an hour for food. Our waitress was nice and apologetic but couldn't make up for the food experience.

business.name: China Pavilion
business.categories: Chinese, Food, Dim Sum, Desserts, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Amazing chicken and chow main!  
Service was top tier and I love the fact that the restaurant was in downtown

I love this place and have been going here since my time at UCSB. Every time our friends from college come into to town we go here. The scallion pancakes are to die for and I also love the General's chicken. It's family style so it's a great place to go with a group and order a bunch of different items. The servers are all super nice too.
Always a nice place to get Chinese food. Have tried couple of dishes it never disappoints.
great food AND great service!!this is my only Chinese food thumbs up in Santa Barbara Goleta or Montecito!!!

Food is good, but not worth the price. One dish of walnut prawns is nearly $20 when you only get 7 prawns! It's hard to pick out which dishes would be worth the price, but the fried rice and the thin noodles were good.

Dim Sum in Santa Barbara? Yes!

This style of food isn't one that I'd been familiar with until recently. I was introduced to it by a friend and was instantly awestruck. Dim Sum is a method where small plates are brought out and served back-to-back. The table orders several of them and they are served at various stages. There's really nothing quite like it. 

China Pavilion is one of only a small handful of Chinese restaurants in Santa Barbara. I feel that the food and the service are consistently great. I've never had a bad meal here. The dining room is large and will accommodate large groups well. I love their shrimp chow mein and their rangoons, but you really won't go wrong with anything on the menu. It's adjacent to a large city parking lot and is a mere block to State Street. It's a good choice for a casual dining experience or a special occasion. If you're looking to wow your friends with a local Dim Sum experience, look no further.
Before this place, we've traveled to Alhambra for good Chinese food. Now we can save the 2 hour drive and eat here. Hands down the best Chinese food in Santa Barbara.

Definitely the best Chinese restaurant in Santa Barbara, including its' dim sum. It's also very clean, which is a big bonus for me. The staff is also always friendly. Here's a tip- grab a drink here...it's strong and not too pricey. The food isn't greasy and the dim sum has many options. Definitely my go to Chinese restaurant here.

I have tried about 10 different items from here and they are all amazing. The interior is beautiful for dine in and the lighting is great. My favorite dishes  are the Hong Kong style beef and spicy Chinese basil eggplant. The service is also really quick. Great for dining in and also takeout. Highly recommend! My favorite Chinese restaurant in town.

The food here was great and the customer service was excellent. I got the chicken and shrimp chow fun, scallion pancake, and the chicken with yellow chive. The chow fun was really good and the meat to noodle ratio was good. The scallion pancake was disappointing I felt as if their was still flour dust on it and it wasn't the best I've had as it had an odd taste. The chicken with yellow chive was the star of the show as I did not know what to expect flavor wise and was happy with the dish that I finished the whole plate. I definitely recommend coming here as they were all so nice and patient!

So sad to see the young lady refuse to serve a Brown-skinned male customer outside at the door, who was requesting a drink. She told him the price but said she couldn't accept the $100 bill, all the man had. 
After pleading, a more mature superior came to the door, took the man's money and served him the drink.

My hubby and I had dinner tonight at China Pavilion.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.  We asked that our vegan dishes be prepared with minimal oil and our waitress asked if we would prefer low sodium soy sauce as well.  The food was prepared beautifully and the portions were generous.  We will definitely be eating here again the next time we come to Santa Barbara!

Super friendly boss and employees, the best Chinese food I've ever tasted in Santa Barbara!!!!!!!
If you want Chinese food with nice quality, HERE!

I really wanted to write this place a solid review because they are the one dim sum restaurant in this area. While some dishes have some good merit, some of their dishes are REALLY BAD. 

Their Shrimp Cheung Fun is VERY THICC either because the batter is too thick or they put too much batter. The flavors are there though, so if the chef can adjust the thickness, there is potential to be a great dish.

Similarly, the scallop dumpling has great potential as well, but the skin is for some reason VERY THICC once again which hurts the dish overall. 

For me, the Lotus Wrap Sticky Rice with Chicken had promising flavors, and when I added some much needed salt myself, it was a reasonable dish.

The Xiao Long Bao had no soup inside, which was disappointing, but it did have good flavor.

The Chicken Feet is very well flavored and cooked. There were no small and dangerous teeth shattering bones, which is a great plus. 

Their Siu Mai is a standard Siu Mai in terms of taste and texture. Nothing out of the ordinary, which was good!

I liked their Salted Egg Lava Bun, it had all the correct flavors and consistency, and there was actually lava!

The Bean Curd Roll was one of their strongest dishes. It had really good flavor and texture. I'm not sure why they are so tiny though because none of the ingredients are expensive.

Overall, good that they're serving dim sum in the area, but there's A LOT of areas for improvement in terms of technique.

Recently I stayed home a lot due to personal reasons. My friends frequently sent me foods ordered from local restaurants. One of the dishes was Spicy Basil Ginger Beef from China Pavilion in Santa Barbara. I was curious and eager to taste it. Unfortunately it didn't change my opinion about their foods. The following is an unpublished review I wrote before the pandemic. 

An average Chinese restaurant that offers Americanized dishes. "Authentic?" No. My family are typical Americans, who used to come here to enjoy "Chinese cuisine." But after living in Asia especially in Hong Kong and China for months, we couldn't eat the foods from this restaurant anymore. We ordered take out (Moo Goo Gai Pan, Ribeye with Szechuan Pickled Sour Mustard Green, and Ants on the Tree") after we came back. The tastes were so different from those we had in Asia, but not in a good way. We thought the experience might have been been different if we had dined in. We went a month later and ordered their Dim Sum and a dish. My wife, who understands some Chinese, observed the wait staff treated Asian and Caucasian customers differently. The verdict: We are not coming back.
The Hong Kong style fried noodles was a little salty but we finished it.   The ambiance of the place was soothing.

Great experience, friendly service, the food was all good and the tea was fantastic and only a $1! We will definitely be coming back. The cocktails looked yummy as well and were reasonably priced especially for being in Santa Barbara :) So happy to have found a new Chinese food place that is good in SB!

I'm giving CP 3 stars as the people were very nice and takeout was easy to order and pick-up.
Now... on to the food itself. Not great at all. Very disappointed in the quality. (And this is not an inexpensive place). I ordered several dishes (so we'd have leftovers the next day) and they all basically had the same flavor. A very heavy saucy overcooked flavor... there was nothing fresh about it. You couldn't even tell what ingredients you were eating. It didn't matter if it was shrimp or beef, it was just drowning in that unappealing flavor. I had to throw everything away and have a few Tums. Panda Express... which I don't necessarily recommend... is more satisfying and WAY cheaper. Really wish this place were better... will not be returning.

My wife searched Chinese food in downtown SB and found this restaurant showed on tops lists. We weren't sure if it's just another "Panda Express" but turns out this is one of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in town. I mean not the kinda of "sweat sour pork" "general tso chicken" " egg foo young" but genuine Chinese stir fry with some delicious cold appetizers.

I like this place for takeout! They even allowed me to use my axxess deal of buy one entree get one free which I appreciate and they were very kind about it- sometimes I feel awkward asking restaurants if they use axxess deals because I feel I can get some stubborn or rude responses but I appreciated how kind they are and for allowing axxess deals during these difficult times-
The lady who helped me was very thankful for being a customer which I appreciated
Food was horrible hard and dry hands down this place needs to be shut down.  Waisted 89$
My boyfriend and I really enjoy the foods there.  They serve authentic dim sum. They follow Covid protocol which is good. Definitely will come back again
Pretty authentic Chinese food.  Good to find dim sum in Santa Barbara.  They have outside dining during Civid-19, and they are pretty careful and we felt safe enough to stop by and dine there.
Food is very good, service is OK. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is due to the very expensive prices.

Very friendly staff, they serve one of the best Dim Sum I've tasted in a long time. We tried the beef fried rice, orange peeled chicken and my ultimate favorite the Basil Beef. Everything was very tasty, can't wait until I'm back in town.

business.name: The Grand Buffet
business.categories: Specialty Food, Buffets, Restaurants, Food

reviews.text: Went just recently on Sunday.   Over rated and over priced.  Had prime rib and shrimp cocktail but prime rib extremely cold and shrimp overly cooked mushy.   Cannot Believe I paid all that money to get the most delicious out of all the food the Pho - hot and tasty broth even with the Ok wontons.   Grand Buffet is no longer "Grand". Things have changed with the times.   I understand due to times the price increase but quality should still be there but no longer the case.

I am very happy to say that I'm updating my previous reviews. My husband and I came up to Reno for New Years and we're staying at GSR (our go to hotel). My husband had tickets for the buffet for New Years Eve so we went yesterday evening. My expectations were low from all our previous experiences; however, my back up plan is always the prime rib which always has been a safe delicious bet. I am extremely excited to report that this place has changed exponentially!!! And definitely for the better! Literally, there's been a complete turn around and has come up 100%. The Dungeness crab was cooked perfectly... no more over-soaked water logged crab here! The shells were strong and easy to crack and the meat firm and easy to pick out. Super delicious with the hot drawn butter and cocktail sauce. My husband enjoyed the oysters on the half shell but was disappointed that there wasn't any mignonette sauce that had been advertised. He still enjoyed them though! We also enjoyed the salt and pepper shrimp and prime rib was delicious as always. They had clam chowder and even had sourdough bread bowls... it was decent... could have been seasoned better as it was pretty bland but I threw some salt, pepper and Tabasco in it and had a few bites. Even the desserts have been upgraded... they looked beautiful and most tasted very good. My husband loved the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake and we both always get a scoop of ice cream on a cone when we leave. We took a moment to call over the general manager and let him know how much we enjoyed our meal and how it was clearly obvious that big changes had occurred definitely for the better. I took 1 star for not having the advertised mignonette sauce, the bland soup and having to wait for condiments that weren't stocked on the table such as the Tabasco as well as having to wait for mimosas when you're on a time limit. Overall... Great job everyone! You definitely got it right this time! Happy New Year!

It's so nice to have a "grand" buffet open. $39.99/adult and worth every penny.  Many different cuisines to choose from. Fresh, hot, and delicious.  Many different healthy options as well. Although I didn't try those . 

The service was friendly and kept my water glass full. 

The desserts are out of this world. Especially the crème Brûlée.

So we've been here a few times now, and decided to come yesterday (Sunday November 14, 2021) to eat their buffet like we had the previous times before! Sunday is definitely a seafood paradise sees that the price is over $40+ per person with tax, now with that said I'm expecting a phenomenal experience- first off the coffee was lukewarm, which I didn't complain to my partner because I didn't want it to change her experience- so I kept it to myself, then we go and get our first plate of 6 Carné Asada tacos, COLD MEAT- she took a bite and spit it out, then I touched the meat and put it into my mouth and spit it out- we told our waiter he went and advised the person at the taco bar, and our waiter through that food out- so we head to the Americana where it's Denver omelette, bacon, eggs Benedict etc. The Denver omelette was ice cold I'm like you gotta be kidding me?? Then I tried the Benedict it wasn't even edible and I love me a good Benedict- I spit it out, and I see my partner start to peel her cocktail shrimp- and I'm like is that the shrimp that smells back, and I look and we notice it's all slimy- no Mami's are you eating that, so here we are going for another plate, I get their sausage (spoiled) I spit that out the moment I tasted it- So we head to the Pho bar and next thing I know people are bring up shrimp, clams and crab- Well Sh*+ i guess I can't eat there either- because now it's cross contaminated tho it's only suppose to be a chicken and beef both with pork wontons... at this kpoint we decided to just leave and cut our loss. Once we arrived home we didn't eat again after the buffet as we have both been stomach sick....

It used to be very good before the virus. was there in October 2021. The food an selection was very poor, The prime rib roast was like saw dust when you chewed it. The tiny peel shrimp has no taste, The fresh fruit was not ripe. 4 of the stations were closed. For $40 this was a real waste of money. I should of known since there was no like to go in at 6pm. I would like to know why it is so poor? Called the managment but never heard back/

I know that buffets aren't always the best to begin with, but there wasn't much here that I was able to find palatable. Things were either over-salted, or oil soaked fried foods, overcooked, or unevenly cooked. 

Just a few examples: The stuffed peppers had decent flavor, but the meat inside was gummy (over processed/mixed) and too salty to finish it. The Prime Rib was dry and over cooked. The fried shrimp and sauerbraten (both fried items) were so oil soaked that while the outside was pretty crunchy still, the shrimp was almost a mushy texture inside, and the sauerbraten was the same, except the inside was almost opaque from so much oil. The sliced Turkey was a bit of a concerning color, the edges were pink and the middle was a bit of an off-putting yellow. I had a slice of cheesecake and pumpkin pie, and they were okay, but nothing to write home about.

This place was the only buffet we could find with a decent menu and reviews if you find yourself staying at GSR Hotel and Casino this place is downstairs next to all the slots and other restaurants. The line was not bad and the staff was pretty friendly but not too informative about the menu just checked you in took your money and you waited to be seated. The moment we got to our table it was clean and spacious and the waiter checked in with us and asked what we would like to drink. We walked the food areas we could choose from. We went with the tri tip and prime rib. Taste wasn't bad and the au juice helped improve the overall taste. Fruit wasn't bad and the pineapple was sweet. They had a pho area we tried and it was tasty. The Asian area had white rice fir those who have fo have rice. The desserts were good and a lot of selection. Overall it wasn't bad and it wasn't good, however everyone's taste buds are different so give it a try
Food was terrible bland not good quality this was a money grab almost $50 per person for crap food. Save your time and money and don't bother

Well went back for the rib buffet and the smoked ribs were basically the only thing worth writing about. The salad bar was horrible. Lettuce was old wilted and brown. Not a lot of toppings. The prime rib was tough as before it was very moist and tender. The mashed potatoes weren't the same and had little flavor. Mexican rice was dry. Even the cookies I had last time tasted gross this time. Not sure why the change but I would say management needs to do some looking around and taste testing. It was not very good at all this trip. Not at all impressed with the quality of food. Don't waste your money on this place.

For a very busy buffet I think this place does a great job. Their food is fresh and I love their dessert selections.  The pho bar is my favorite. Kind of expensive for what it is but that is expected of the casino buffets.  I wouldn't recommend going for the crab it is filled with tons of water.

I'm only giving this place one star because the manager was super nice. 
First let me say that I've heard so much about this place. And after living in Reno for 3 years I decided to try it. First off, way over priced. The Peppermill had a better buffet. The food options were lack luster, I prefer my crab legs meaty and warm. They were skimp and cold and when I asked for my crab legs to be warmed up the server gave me attitude. The meat was not seasoned, the pasta was dry and old. The chocolate chip cookies were BURNT. Rookie mistake if you ask me. The best thing here was the beer, that I got for free. Avoid this place, don't waste your time.

Came here for lunch and was very disappointed. Half the stations didn't have food no the ones that did the food was cheap and plain. Dirty plates and crappy food is not a good combo for a casino buffet

Absolutely diabolical!! Just arrived - 7/31/2021 - to the worst experience we've ever had! $71 + tip for 3 scrambled eggs, bacon, 2 diet cokes and a water!! Hardly any stations open and what was open had trays empty or minimum available. Only ham and turkey available on the meat station. No salad and a big queue for pho! We should've been told when paying that most of the stations were closed! Only donuts and ice cream available for dessert! GSR you have lost a loyal customer today! Disgusted!!
Edit: just spoke to a manager who ARGUED with me that when breakfast is being served nothing else is available and "it's always been like this!" That is a lie!! We've been customers for the past 6 years and have never seen anything like this! Don't waste your money! Toucan Charlie's at Atlantis is way better!! We went a couple of weeks ago and everything is available!!

Had a great experience when me and my friends went there over a weekend. Upon check-in at the buffet area, I was asked to pay for our group (5 of us).  Just as we were about to be seated, one of my friends can't join us due to headache. I think it's a hassle for them to refund the credit card payment or void the transaction so they called the manager, I think his name is Omar? The buffet manager gave us a credit meal/dinner for the extra payment we did. Thank you Omar!  So nice of you.

The food isn't great. It used to be better so I do not know what changed. And of all places, they ran out of lemonade at a buffet. Service was great but I came there for the food so for the price, it wasn't worth it to me. I gave it 3 stars because the servers are attentive.

The buffet located in GSR. For those that want to try everything, Grand Buffet offers an all you can eat option of quick-serve food with gourmet flavors. With multiple offers and styles that will ensure everyone will enjoy. There are a variety of different cuisines including asian wok with chicken chow mein, Mongolian beef, prime rib, pho, Italian, a taco bar and more.

False advertisement! I drove 2 hrs+ excited for the lobster buffet. Turns out, they handed out one ticket for each person...for just one lobster. That's it. Wasted my time and money. Also, I booked a room as well and it wasn't cheap. All of the other foods were cold and seemed like it sat out for awhile. Not worth it!

Calling it Lobster buffet with one lobster was false advertising for sure. Don't waste your on your next lobster buffet weekend. Such a waste of time and money. One ticket for one lobster. What a joke.

No.  Just no.  

The positive: The crab legs, while cold, were great. The staff was attentive.

The not so positive: The food (I'm not a desert person) was nowhere near the price point that I would expect based on the quality of the food. 

If I were to return again, which I won't, I would focus only on the crab legs and skip the rest.

We decided to go to this buffet after years of not living in Reno. In remembering our past visits we knew that locals would get a discount of 20%. When we paid for our buffet we were not given the discount even after showing our Nevada ID. Now you can eat at many amazing restaurants for $20-$30 a person in Reno and walk out pretty happy. Well at this buffet they charged $40 a person including our 11yr old son who didn't eat anything except the Mac n cheese. Shocking they would charge a kid the same rate as an adult. So for almost $200 after tip I took my family of 4 to a buffet and won't ever make that mistake again.
Visited a couple days ago,and it was delicious. I had to stop cause I would have eaten all crab legs and shrimp.

Awful!  Food was cold, and I mean everything I ate was barely lukewarm. The worst buffet I've ever eaten at. Three adults and one child was $189 plus tip. I've paid more for a good buffet in Vegas so the price didn't bother me. However, food quality was subpar and not worth $10 per person. The only decent food was the salad bar and desserts. 
The prime rib was most likely a 'select grade, and there was an ammonia smell to the crab legs. Asian food was dried out and the
Italian choices were all cold and old tasting. We arrived about 15 minutes after opening so food temperature and quality was truly unacceptable. Really gross. Will never eat there again, even for free. Our waitress was very friendly and did a great job. I'm sorry I canceled our Charlie Palmer reservation after surveying the buffet. It looked  good, but tasted bad!  Live and learn, I suppose.
Very bad & disgusting food. Ended up sick & having food poisoning. Never felt as bad as I did the past 2 days. Nothing but constant diarrhea & throwing up.

Food poisoning.
Husband and I went there last wknd for our Anniversary. Had the runs that evening and following day. Most of the food was tasteless except for the Shrimp Scampi. Went to the Taco Bar/Station and old Asian man working there that just finished taking care of the garbage can, didn't change his gloves,  then proceeded to help me with my tacos. So i just left.

Easter brunch was wonderful. The prime rib was delicious and they offer a variety of different kinds of smoked meats. Asian, Italian, mexican and a Pho station as well. Staff was attentive and professional. No rush. Deserts were good. The breakfast items were not very good but the other main dishes were worth the price.

business.name: The VIP Mexican Restaurant & Lounge
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants, Mexican, New Mexican Cuisine, Bars, Nightlife, Lounges

reviews.text:
Wow.  Absolutely RUDE "customer service". Little brunette employee insanely awful... Scowling face and ugly attitude.  
Don't go on the front door as you have to sign in at the back door... yet no sign to tell you that so you get berated for coming in as a normal person would.
Very strong margaritas. The queso is very average. Nachos were very very good. Service was also great. Overall very good place

By far the best Tex-Mex restaurant in Pinellas county. It's not even close. That being said, it's not somewhere I frequent often because it can be a bit of a hassle . Parking is limited, seating is limited, wait times are long and takeout is more trouble than it's worth . That being said, I still give it 5 stars because the food. There is a reason this place is off the charts popular. My God the food!

This is a Tex-Mex restaurant, and they don't pretend to be otherwise. You can still get traditional tacos with onion and cilantro, but if you're expecting much more you'll be disappointed. That being said they rock out the Tex-Mex dishes like no other! The wet Burrito and "mini" wet Burrito are the stars here! Make sure you come hungry because it's huge! Upset that taco Bell got rid of their Mexican pizza? No worries, VIP has you covered! Their Mexican pizza is enormous and so much better than the fast food chain! The Mexican steak dish is marinated skirt steak sauteed with onions, Jalapeno's and served with rice, beans, guac and tortillas and it is a hit! My absolute favorite thing on the menu are the Mexican rolls. Giant eggroll wrappers stuffed with meat and cheese served with a warm ranchero sauce to dip them in. So good! 

I don't give 5 stars to businesses that I don't feel deserve it. And I hardly ever give 5 stars to restaurants that are a pain to get to and enjoy, but once you wade through the logistics the experience is second to none. Just wish it was closer to me!
This was our 3rd visit to this restaurant and it never disappoints! Great food and friendly staff! Guacamole is yum, the fish tacos are my favorite and my hubby loves the wet burritos!

The desk manager at our resort recommended VIP and we are so glad we went.  It is absolutely a quirky, locals, divey kind of place but the margaritas and food are delicious. It looked like the inside was pretty loud and packed but sitting at a picnic table on the patio with a "great" view of the parking lot and dumpsters could not be beat.  My husband and I each had a margarita and we shared a shredded beef Mexican pizza.  The pizza was so loaded we actually could not finish it!  Definitely recommend VIP and will return if in the area again.  (Hint: Go in the back and wait to be seated.)

This place doesn't value customers time or money. Literally had to explain to a manager - RJ what a manager is. Pretty sad that a manager doesn't know their responsibilities!

In case you weren't listening and you probably weren't because you could care less... When a customer asks to speak to a manager and you arrive you introduce yourself. You don't come over and act like we are interrupting your day.

Also another one of your responsibilities is to turn a bad experience into a pleasant one or AT THE VERY LEAST TRY! RJ could care less and did neither! We were basically told it was our fault we had to wait an 1 for 2 burritos because we ordered them to go and not for dine in!? Absolutely ridiculous and the worst excuse I've ever heard! 4 tables sat around us, had drinks, appetizers and ate entrees and we sat and sat and sat and waiting for our dinner while missing the sunset. RJ finally came and said "Do you still want your food?" What a joke of a manager. No we sat there an hour waiting and don't want our food. No apology no care in the world. NOTHING! Then when I asked for some sort of restitution for the inconvenience he acted like he never heard the word restitution before. I honestly believe with his vocabulary, lack of being a manager and training this word went way over his brain capacity! Sadly we will NEVER eat or recommend this place to anyone again! Hope this review costs you way more than an apology would have easily fixed! You lost valued customers not that you care! 

The owners need to fire RJ ASAP

I live near the Indian Rocks location but was near TI with family. Four of us went the Friday afternoon after Thanksgiving. The place was packed. There is always a bit of attitude from the staff. And they can have attitude because the food and margaritas are THAT good. And it is OK. We always know it will take a little bit of time to be seated. So we grab a margarita from the truck outside and wait for the magic moment we hear our last name: Walsh for 4! BINGO... we're here.... right here... ooh ooh. We sat, ordered 4 more margaritas and a large beef Mexican pizza, of course with jalepeños. Wow...delicious. Then we all ordered wet burritos with different proteins: ground beef, chicken, shredded chicken... all looked and tasted amazing. We all had food to take home because the portions are ginormous. That is something I love, big portions of good quality, delicious food. If it isn't good, I don't want a lot. This place is delish! Also, for the 4 of us- it was a totally cheap date. We were all stuffed with margs, appy, and wet burrito platters. Excellent value. I will go again and again. The IRB location is just as wonderful. I just advise to have time, patience, and relax, and you will love it too.

Busy because Christmas week but staff did great trying to accommodate the rush. The trio sampler great! The mini churros tasty. Chimichanga was good, skip the house margarita and get the tropical sunrise.

Every now and then you find a diamond in the rough, a place that blows all expectations out of the water, this is it! From the outside you would never expect the VIP Lounge to be the best Mexican Food you've eaten in recent memory, but it was! We started out with guacamole, salsa and chips. The guacamole was so fresh and delicious the four of us devoured it in minutes. My two 20 year old  sons who like large portions were amazed with their dishes, hillbilly bowl and taco bowl, both raved about them for days. I ordered the wet burrito with pork, huge portions and I ate every single bite! Momma equally amazed, if on Treasure Island find this place, you'll thank me!

We enjoyed chips, salsa, chicken chimichanga and wet burrito.  The portions are huge, and super tasty!!! We dined inside, where there is bar seating, and tables along the wall.  Service was fast and friendly.
Delicious food. Great local spot. Really good vibe. Get a drink at their outside bar while you wait...totally worth it. You will not be disappointed.

The Treasure Island location was a MUST for my family for years. But things have changed. The staff and new young manager? Just seem too busy interacting with each other than interested in what the customers want or need. I've never been to an establishment where the employees including the Manager are allowed to DRINK on the clock...  The interaction with the staff is heavy. And I feel uncalled for.  Maybe they should put their personal lives aside for work and help the people that are spending money at their restaurant. Work now. Play later. Its very simple.. At least we've got the Indian rocks location, never disappointing.

Anyone who knows of or has been to the original VIP in Treasure Island knows about the great food this little hidden gem has been serving for over 3 decades. Located just north and Nextdoor to RickyT's Bar & Grill the VIP LOUNGE & RESTAURANT has been serving Tex-Mex & Authentic Mexican Fare forever it seems. They've done so well they recently expanded into Indian Rocks Beach with a second location just north of JD's Lounge.
VIP TI is small but quaint and had both indoor & outdoor seating. The wait staff has always been friendly and attentive on all our visits and they get very busy and very crowded at times.
Just last Taco Tuesday we stopped in for a few Grilled Portobello Tacos and their special Jalapeño Queso Mac-O-Cheese that they only offer on Tuesday's and it all was OMG! I WANT MORE...
They are dog friendly at the rear outside dining area as well.
Recommend you get their early or expect a wait! Of course their Margaritas make the wait worthwhile!  Their new location is great as well!
My favorite Mexican restaurant thank you Gabby, Dee, Alexa, Dee and Stephanie for making my birthday awesome

Surprisingly really yummy American style Mexican comfort food. The chimichanga was amazing and the margarita was strong, which makes it exactly my kind of place. It's a bit hectic and service could be better but overall a great spot for a good meal.

Great food. Salsa and chips were awesome. Great guacamole. Had the Mexican Steak and was awesome Wife had the Chicken Quesadilla and she loved it. Good Margaritas, but should have larger versions. Can be a long wait..and didn't like paid parking
Really great Mexican food and bar. Awesome service it had a loud fun vibe to the place definitely will be back

Very friendly, fast service with big portions of delicious food and tasty drinks. Every one in our party of four ordered something different and we all loved our food! The margaritas are made with very generous portions of alcohol. For a beach restaurant in a tourist area, the prices are cheap compared to most places, but the quality is superior. So glad a friend recommended this place. We will definitely be back!!

Visited this place again because it's always one of my MUST GO TOs while in town. Their special was the pork belly taco which I had to try. Had a good crunchy sear to the pork belly ends. You can't go wrong with the wet burrito. I got shredded beef this time which I think has been my favorite so far. Always a margarita special each day. Can't say yummm enough!

@stl.foodie
Best Mexican in town! Great food, great atmosphere, amazing margaritas. Love all the food. The Mexican pizza is fire!

My favorite Mexican food in town. We always love the Mexican pizza - but honestly everything here is delicious. And the mini churros for dessert - fantastic.

It's always busy so expect a wait. The staff is fantastic - especially Chris at the outside bar.

We have eaten here many times. It is very busy because it's good. They have inside, outside, and bar seating. The staff is great and helpful. Drinks are the best. The Mexican food is very good . You can get chips with queso , guacamole, salsa or all 3. The portions are big so you can share. Enjoy this beach gem but leave me a seat with a margarita.

Very disappointed in VIP.
$8.99 for chips and queso. And a small amount of both. Really? My bill for 2 a la carte wet burritos and chips and queso 34.98 and a freaking service charge of 2.99? For what? I walked up and ordered and came back and pickup. Second time I am sick of this shit. I am going to R Bar or Willy's.  Much better food and  price for food. VIP is sticking it to the customer big time and now losing customers.

WOW! all I can say is WOW to this restaurant. What an amazing amazing restaurant. I've been to many Mexican restaurants and this one tops it all! 
We LOVED all the food that we ordered! 
We started of with Trio dips, then specialty tacos and wet burrito. We tried the Mexican fried ice cream too. All perfect. The best part was all the staffs were soooo nice and welcoming! Will definitely be back!

Love the food, can't be beat! However, the mixologist need training. I love a heavy handed bartender as much as the next guy, but when all you taste is alcohol, too much alcohol. That's a problem. You'd be better off just pouring pre mixed margaritas!

business.name: Sheraton New Orleans Hotel
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, Hotels, Venues & Event Spaces, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Booked the club level package on their website that includes breakfast and parking. My family was put in a room on the 46th floor. With that said you would think we were on the ground floor because the street noise was so loud. My husband said it sounds like the cars were in the room lol. I'd suggest sleeping with ear plugs or bringing a white noise machine with you if you have trouble blocking out intrusive sounds.  That's the only one of two downsides to our stay. 

NOW to the positives because there are plenty!

Check-in was a breeze and the customer service from everyone at the front desk was amazing. Normally I walk away with a bit of worry but every question I may have had was answered fully. 

The package I purchased included a breakfast buffet in the club lounge however due to covid breakfast is now at the restaurant on the second floor and it just gets charged to the room then zeroed out at check-out supposedly we shall see at the end of my stay when I get the folio. I'm doing this review in real time so by the end you'll get all the nitty gritty. 

The rooms are decently spacious. CLEAN.However I feel jipped with these double beds felt like I was back in college fighting over mattress space with my husband lol. Sheraton could really benefit from having Queen beds. The beds were perfect for my two toddlers to share though. The price I'm paying for this room doesn't correlate with the bed is all I'm saying. There were plenty plugs in the room for all our charging needs! There are 4 plugs 2 on each side of the night stand. Invest in a dual charging block or bring a surge protector if you need to plug in a lot of stuff close to the bed. 

Valet was simple Jazmine went over everything I needed to know to get my car back and was very pleasant and warm. You text a number to get your car and they'll text you back when it's downstairs ready for you takes about 15 minutes. However valet was crazy at night the line to get to the front door stretched down the street.

Now these are some fancy elevators and they're fast. So instead of pressing a number inside the elevator you type in what floor you need to go to outside and then it tells you which letter elevator to go to. No more having to worry about your kid playfully pressing buttons. 

There's a Starbucks in the lobby but perks of club level I can get some for free in the club room but if you want specialty coffees and fraps the lobby is where you'll be headed. 

There's also a doggy area right outside the property it's gated and big enough for your fur babies to roam and do their business. 

Masks are required in public areas and vaccination cards or a negative PCR tests for dining areas and restaurants as we were asked to show them when we went to Coteries for dinner.

Breakfast was buffet style but you hand them your plate. These grits were phenomenal! I didn't have to add anything to them. Everything taste great and fresh. People please stop fussing.

Whew checkout was a rollercoaster but with Tequila or however you spell her name. she kept moving her name tag to where it wasn't fully visible but to be an Envoy Elite member and treated in a dismissive manner put a damper on what was a great trip. I'm not sure if the overwhelming amount of people who were there for other events got to her but she could've told me she needed a moment and I would have totally understood. I had questions about my bill but another clerk came over with an issue from a guest they were helping and they totally forgot about me. Thankfully Sarah came and asked if I needed help since I was still standing there lol but she addressed my concerns with the bill because it was$230 more than I was to be charged initially. 

All in all I would definitely come back but would book a king bed suite for more space for my family. This hotel is super close to everything as we were able to walk short blocks to every place we wanted to go.

Dated hotel in need of remodelling, but great location.

We all know that the heart of New Orleans is the French Quarter, and the Sheraton is located close enough that most bars / restaurants you want to go to are only 10 min walk away. Even better, its located next to the Sazerac house which is one of my favorite attractions.

However, as convenient as the location is, the hotel leaves much to be desired in regards to its upkeep. The lobby is spacious, but not great for sitting or even a fun bar area. Restaurants are old and dated, especially the breakfast area. The rooms look like the 80s, dark carpet, old worn furniture, and a tiny dark bathroom. Not even enough plugs - you have to hunt for them. At least the floor to ceiling windows are nice. 

The club lounge is decent though, plenty of snacks and drinks so thats definitely a plus. Service was also decent - front desk and housekeeping staff were polite, friendly, and efficient.

Stayed at the Sheraton which is situated perfectly from everything. The elevators are pretty interesting too. The rooms are very nice. We had a nice view. I loved the location. Really close to harrahs casino and Bourbon street. Lobby is big and has a nice bar in it. Also the Starbucks inside gives it a nice touch

We booked this hotel as part of a wedding block and stayed here a few weeks ago. Upon entering it gave all the good vibes - check in was easy and the concierge lady was lovely - and the lobby seemed clean and spacious. Everything went south after that though. The elevators were slow and frustrating and broke multiple times during our two nights stay. Walls were very very thin so when the elevators were working, or if anyone was making any noise in rooms nearby, you could hear the mechanics and voices crystal clear. On top of that the ice machine outside our room was broken and beeping every 3 seconds for hours our first day. We had to call multiple times to get it fixed. All in all - this stay was not peaceful and when you're on the 31 floor you expect quiet. Sadly nothing really worked out and I wanted to love it :( I don't recommend staying here - especially for the price tag that goes with it!

I am currently staying at the Sheraton Hotel on Canal.  I am changing my review from 3 stars to 2 stars.  I'm here for 4 days and 3 nights.  No one cleaned my room on yesterday.  No one cleaned my room on today.  

The parking is also very hectic.   There was one time, where it appeared that it took 5 workers, to deal with one guests lost car keys issue.  Why did I have to be impacted by that if there were enough workers to get my car, while one person could have dealt with his lost car keys issue.  

I also have to say that they need to highly invest in new remote controls for their televisions.   Trying to use their television remote had to be one of the most frustrating experiences of my stay.

The remote was slow to react to every press of the button.  There were times that I had to pray to keep myself from wanting to just throw the remote at the television.  

Even when I scanned the code to use my phone as the remote, I had the same issue.  Please fix this so that your guests can have a more pleasant stay.  It should not take almost 30 minutes to log into Netflix because the television is slow to react to the remote.  

On another note, I inquired about a refrigerator before I traveled.  I was told that my concerns would be forwarded.  I was given the impression that a refrigerator would be available.  

There was no talk about a first come first serve basis on refrigerators before I traveled.  Yet, when I called the staff like 4 times regarding a refrigerator, I was told that they would check.  

It's okay to check.  It's even okay to even not have one if they are all checked out.  Yet, the issue is that the staff NEVER followed up with me regarding whether they had a refrigerator or not.  

The staff simply ghosted me each time and never followed up.  This is downright disrespectful.  You should at least call to let your guests know whether they will be accommodated or not.  

There were also times that I called the staff, and no one picked up the phone.

phoenician and crystal at the front desk lack the ability to function at a corporate level, it's appalling that they are employed here in the first place. The level of professionalism is rudimentary at best, my recommendation would be to take your business across the street to the JW Mariot.

We ordered drinks and food and they just somehow forgot to give us both then looked at us crazy when we asked about it. They weren't that busy so I'm not sure how our order could of been lost. Don't waste your time.

We had a nice stay here at the Sheraton on Canel St.  Our room was on the 36th floor which had a great view of the city.  Our room was nice and spacious with a comfy king size bed.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby, open in the mornings.   The Sheraton is walking distance to lots of places.   CAFE beigent was a block away.  The Aquarium was also a few blocks away.  BOURBON St. is also walking distance.  There is a high-end mall down the street as well.  We had a wonderful time in New Orleans. We would definitely stay here again the next time we visit.

It was a good location. Now the bad side. You press your room floor outside of the elevator. There are not any buttons  inside the elevator,except for open/close. Unfortunately, if you don't want the creepy person in the lobby to know what floor you're on,this will make you uncomfortable. We put the  do not disturb sign on our door, only to come back with housekeeping in our room. We're aware that she didn't miss the sign, due to her knocking it off the door and putting it back on as she informed us she didn't make one of the beds because it had personal items on it. However, both beds had personal items on them before we left.  The parking area is an extremely tight, dark dungeon without elevators, and last but not least, they had roaches.  We could not switch hotels due to everyone else being sold out.

This hotel gets at least one star because the beds were comfortable. 
But that's it. 
The first night I was greeted by a newborn baby cockroach on my nightstand. The next day, one was in the shower. 

The "upgrade" given as a loyal and revered Bonvoy member was an Executive Suite with Club Access but A) to get to the club we had to go to an entirely different building and it took two elevator rides to get there. Fine.  But when we got there there were small bags of potato chips, two types of granola bars and that was it, no matter what time of day you arrived. All four days we were there the Espresso Beans were never refilled. I get that it's "Covid Tome" but have some imagination. At 5 pm, put out individually wrapped crackers, cheeses and veggies.
Small bottles of wine or something that makes me feel like a valued Bonvoy Member. 

And why is it that everywhere I went on the lobby, it smelled like Dank Weed?!?

The restaurant was a disaster. We had "coupons" for breakfast. The first day they handed us a menu with limited options, I get it. 
The second day we were shown to our table and TOLD there's the buffet, enjoy. 
I didn't want the buffet. There were no other options given. 
So I went to the buffet, which is more money than the "meal tickets" allowed for which is unexpected.
Here's what I found on the buffet: 
There were flies in the bread rack, the pancakes were, literally, cold and hard. The eggs were inedible and the sausage links were fry, overcooked and tasteless. The fruit cup was old, and was clearly from a previous meal.  And on the second day they made us get our own coffee and carry it to our table without providing saucers. 
There were no saucers to catch the coffee that splashed as I walked.  And other than someone Seating us and handing us a bill, no one ever came to our table.  I finally lost my appetite completely when I realized just how dusty and dirty the banquet seating and chair rail were. I'm pretty sure it hasn't been dusted since Louisiana was purchased.
And why, for the love of goodness are people in the portico selling weed?  I can tell you. Probably to service all the college kid's who were staying 8 to a room across the hall from us. Thank goodness we travel with ear plugs and a sound machine because we would not have been able to sleep at all otherwise. 
And finally, the bed linen. The comforter was stained with blood and looked and smelled like it hadn't been washed in months. Thank goodness I bring my own comforter and pillows. 
Completely dissatisfied and disgusted with this sloppy, unrefined waste of my time. It's almost as if they said "Hey! I know, let's just see how far below the Sheraton Standards we can go!!"  We have a long history with Sheraton and Marriott but this hotel is clearly the dregs. It's a shame really.

Do not stay here, parking deck is terrible and the management is just as bad. They threw away a bag of all of my toiletries when cleaning our room, and then after calling to try and get it back the desk was unhelpful and said our only option was to file a full report with statements that wouldn't even guarantee we would get anything back or any type of compensation. Would recommend going anywhere else if you can.

i haven't even got there yet and they can't simply tell me what the incidental / deposit is due during check-in. i've been on hold 10 minutes . the person on the phone sounds like their not even sure wait hotel they work for .. deadd lmaooo .

.. stay tuned because i'm updating this as i travel :) .

The staff members are wonderful but the up keep is not so good and the first day here they sound off the Alarm so we had to walk down 28 flights of stairs and after everyone got to the bottom they said nothing I had to go to the front desk and ask what was going on and was told it was a false alarm but they still had us out side and said nothing on top of that you have too pay to park your own car in there parking lot that they say is not there parking lot but one of the people that work there are writing tickets on vehicles I stayed 5 days and had to pay on top of the hotel stay an extra $211 and if you valet it's$15 for 2 hours and if it's over night it's $48 for each day

I stayed here in July for a convention. Starting with the check in the women at the registration desk were so helpful and friendly and really took their time. They made sure me and my friends were on the same floor and that our rooms were fairly close. At the present time there is not any room service so they gave us extra bags of towels which was very convenient and also gave us as many bottles of water and other amenities as we wanted. 

The convention rooms we used were on the fifth floor and they were very nice, the temperature was comfortable and the lighting was great. 

The location of this hotel is very convenient to many of the activities and main streets in the area. They have limited meals that can be delivered to your room and one morning I did get a breakfast sandwich and that was fine they charge a five dollar delivery fee

Room was dirty parking was complicated no toilet paper in room water damage through out pool out of service... bedding was comfortable staff was friendly but not a repeat stay...really surprised for a Marriott property.

Love it here! Really beautiful room! Spacious! Nice! Best of all, the view! 

Starbucks coffee in the room.  Furniture was nice.  Nice tv.  Overall a wonderful stay. Def would love to stay here again!

IF YOU LIKE  BUGS THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY. They have roaches. I saw 2 in the bathroom crawling on the tub and on the walls. I report the incident to the night shift manager ADOLPHO  he basically insulted me by offering me $50.00. Called corporate spoke with Bruno he was understanding took the complaint and said he was very sorry. Spoke with Katie the day shift manager the morning I was checking out she applied a credit to my room which in my opinion was not enough. She also told me that these type of things happen which is another slap in the face. I've stayed at lots of hotels I have never seen a roach in my room. Can't bring my suit case in the house It's just sitting in the garage. I've been Waiting on corporate to call me back to discuss this matter and I have not heard from anyone, no emails no phone calls no text. But yet I'm getting emails thanking me for booking with them and asking about my stay. I Guess this is how they treat BONVOY members. SMH THEE WORST!!!!!

Great location! Close to all of the French Quarter/Bourbon street action. However, it is not the cleanest hotel. The comforter inside of the duvet was noticeably yellowed/stained. The carpets also need to be shampooed. However, for the price and location, you definitely get what you pay for.

Based on lobby restaurant only. Hotel rooms are fine. I know still opening from covid but really? The gumbo is an embarrassment to NO. Wings are small and sad with hot sauce on the side (blue cheese served in a resale packet). Everything reheated in a microwave. Crappy beer options to boot. For heavens sake just serve drinks till your really ready to open.

Check in was awesome . River view . Hotel needs updating for the tech savvy people . Clean room and customer service is very good .  Main thing again is update rooms for the tech savvy , wanted a fridge and microwave too . The staff makes up for everything . Update - I am enjoying my stay and appreciate so so much the reply .  Takes time to check on guests FIVE STARS !! Again great staff
In retrospect I was too harsh in my previous review. It is a fantastic hotel/great location. I don't like the corporate policy regarding the cleaning of rooms.

I have stayed at this establishment before and it's now subpar.   For a comparable price you can book the  Westin or Marriott.  First they have no bell hop service.  Second their atm machine doesn't work.  Third housekeeping can't pass out essentials including towels, toilet paper, tissue, ect,.  Fourth they come to your room to tell you that you are too loud. This is NOLA.   Get over it.  In a nutshell: soccer moms and Karen's are welcome.  If you are looking for a a good time I recommend the Marriott or crown plaza across the street

Great location and easily accessible to all of French Quarter. Hotel pool and restaurant was  going through renovations during the time of our stay which was disappointing. Room was clean, carpets although dark definitely needed cleaning (at least in our room). View from the 28th floor was amazing. Also, do not pay to have your car parked- do it yourself!!!! Premier Parking is not affiliated with the hotel and they  were the worst to deal with regarding me trip!

If I could give zero stars, I would. Really unprofessional. Booked 2 rooms and the front desk wrote our room number wrong and took our stuff out of the room while we were out for us to come back to find our stuff missing and in the lost and found. How they could have gotten the room numbers wrong but then to remove our stuff is beyond ridiculous. Do not appreciate anyone touching our bags, especially during COVID. Would never suggest anyone to stay at this location.

The hotel is nice but concierge and housekeeping  is ridiculous.  We had to ask for towels multiple times, which they just threw on the beds and never got dirty ones. They never came to take the trash so we got bags for housekeeping cart in the hallway. Not to mention concierge was not at the desk when we would go and we had to wait while many employees stood there. Their were a pair of eyelashes( not ours) into bathroom and sticky substance on the floor, missing picture on the wall with wall hanger exposed. Valet was prompt and polite. For such a nice hotel you would think that the accommodation would match ...not so much

business.name: Noble Pie Parlor - Downtown
business.categories: Sandwiches, Vegan, Restaurants, Pizza, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text:
All kinds of good stuff to eat. It has a lot more on the menu than just pizza. Noble Pie Parlor is always among the best pizza in Reno. Has a location in downtown. The prices are pretty high but you can't get much better pizza like this. 

It also is like a sports bar. Lots of great alcoholic drinks. There's many beers, including local ones, to choose from. Beer of course is the best beverage to go with a pizza, so that's what we got. They have a big selection of crafts and local stuff on tap. I got the appropriate Sierra Nevada among several drinks we ordered. It's about $7 for a pint. This is one of the best known local breweries, because it's also a mass producer. A good thing to share are the big appetizers. They even have some that are vegan. After checking out the menu we decided on the Vegan Frachos. It's about $19 for a big plate fries and nachos that are piled with lots of stuff. There's vegan cheese and meat, along with onions and peppers among other things. It sure is expensive. This is the only bad thing about the food here. 

An update is this location seems to be closed. It's not possible to get inside. The food often was just way too expensive but I happily took lots of leftovers instead of just getting rid of these.
Our go to for pizza slices in Reno.  Right around the corner from the Worldmark, so super convenient.

I ordered a pizza (wrangler) and a pound of wings for my wife and myself. We have traveled all over the US and I must say I was blown away the pizza was hands down the best pizza I have had in 20 years the wings are top notch so do yourself a favor and order them dont forget the ranch because these flavors are like Christmas in your mouth or fireworks on the 4th. Loved it and will be eating here again.

We came here after our drinks at 10-Torr and movies at the Galaxy Theater, we enjoyed just a single slice each of their pepperoni pizza, garlic tots, and of course Sierra Nevada sour IPA!  Another awesome perk of having the yelp app was that you get $2 off a drink, which we used when checking in on yelp! It's kind of crazy since the pandemic all started noble pie there used to be a line out the door and now there was maybe four of us total eating inside the building. The bartender definitely had his mask off more than it was on, but he did have black gloves on, but also ate food with them on and then washed hands with the gloves on... interesting lol. That was the only thing that I found questionable LOL.

This is getting a 4 overall, but I'd say more like a 3.5.
WINGS WERE GREAT. Got the BBQ and they were amazing, highly recommend them. Service was good, very kind, wears masks, and quick. 
Pizza was disappointing to me, but my boyfriend loves it. We got the nobleman and I'd say it was over cooked (but my boyfriend attests that normally it's not like that). To me it was too greasy but definitely still good flavor. 
Seats are very uncomfortable but atmosphere is cute. 
Wouldn't walk here alone as a female.

I want to give a amended review to my previous review of Noble Pizza. Most specifically to Ryan who went above and beyond when it came to fulfilling his promise to me and my husband regarding our previous experience at Noble Pizza. Ryan displayed to us integrity and humility during a rough time that faces all small businesses at this time during COVID.  That in itself has given me a different outlook at Noble Pizza and I am sure we will become loyal patrons of this establishment all because Ryan stepped up and stepped out of his comfort zone and displayed the commitment this establishment has and why it makes such an impact on those who love Noble Pizza

This place is amazing. Weekend getaway from LA during Covid. Wandering around the pretty deserted downtown and came across Noble Pie. We were greeted by Chris who gave us the run down of the menu and the town really! I would say the best chicken wings I've ever had, best pizza on the west coast and the meatballs whilst not world ranked were pretty darn tasty.

All in all a wonderful experience and great service by Chris.
Slow. do not recommend ordering on a Saturday nigh. you will never eat.

This was our second time going to noble pie and the experience was horrible. We decided to take my in laws to noble pie because our last experience went well and we enjoyed the pizza, but we now regret the decision and will NEVER return.

My mother in law and I walked in to see a guy with thin blonde shoulder length hair sitting behind the bar. I told him we made a reservation and he said noble pie was no longer doing reservations. We didn't know what to do or what that meant because the website states reservations are required at both locations until mid March.

Then he said we could hang out and proceeded to do other stuff while we were still standing there. It was absolutely confusing and rude. Then I asked ok so can we just sit at this table to eat in. And he said yeah.

After my fiancé and his father walked in, the same guy kept reminding us to come to the front to order. We barely had time to look at the menu. Then he walked near us (he was behind the bar) and said "jI'll come over and take your order." That was confusing because he originally told us we were supposed to go to him to order. Then he asked us to yell our drink and food order out loud. Then he kept stopping us and then telling us to proceed with the order. It was complete chaos. We couldn't hear him and he couldn't hear us. Then he proceeded to confirm our order by yelling everything from across the restaurant. So I got up and told him "we're going to confirm it right here at the register. I can't hear you because of our masks and we need to pay."

As we were waiting for our food the server ended up leaving the establishment with his coat and a friend.  Then once we received our food (the chef was very kind and helpful), the server happened to come back into the establishment and left the door wide open.

It was less than 30 degrees, we were cold and our food was cold. The only thing he said was "sorry it's hot in here." He was highly disrespectful and unprofessional.  We spent over $55 dollars on ONE cold pizza and three drinks.  

We will NEVER return nor will we recommend this place to any colleagues, family, or friends.

Wow, where do I start. From the moment I stepped inside the vibe of this place was incredible. Staff was very friendly and attentive to taking my order. I haven't seen this is any of the reviews but I found out about this restaurant through Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dines. Guess what? Unlike some restaurants they don't have it plastered all over the place, which is great. They let the food and quality of it speak for them. I'd love to have a beer with the owner- incredible place and atmosphere.

Nothing like coming in here (downtown) after a few cocktails when you are starving and still want to get a beer late at night. I was worried about the one in Midtown not being as good but the quality of the food seemed even better!

Stopped by to grab pizza and wings before our road trip to Vegas. Walked in about 11:15 on a Sunday and saw it was empty, but saw a man on the phone taking orders. After a couple minutes he asked for our order. My husband ordered the vegetarian with light real cheese (not vegan). I got the bbq chicken. We also ordered the 6 chicken wings. 
Fifteen minutes later the wings come out and were seriously legit. Mildly-moderate hot Buffalo sauce, but smothered in raw minced garlic and green onions- hello! Delish! My breath is now horrid, but that is my dreamweaver of wings. 
My pizza was good, although a tad salty? Wish it had fresh cilantro on top, little less cheese, it was caked with cheese. Hubs said his was good, also a tad salty, but good. He didn't know it came without red sauce, there was a vegan pesto on it, which he's not a huge fan, but liked the thin crust on the bottom, twisted flaky soft crust around the edges. 
Shares a bathroom (which wasn't very clean, in fact, pretty gross) with Siegel Suites (I think it's temporary housing for down and out folks) so that was a big no for me.

This is my first time ordering from the Noble Pie and at first I loved it! I loved the variety of different toppings and the pizza tasted amazing, especially the BBQ chicken pizza. Although, our Ring of Fire had several small hairs in it  I wish we saw it before we were half way through the dish

Ok, so I like wings. The best finger food there is(sorry sushi) and have ate at and reviewed just about every place in town that is worth reviewing but every time I get caught up in a conversation about it, people bring this place up as the best. Even to the point of being dismissive of my opinion since I had not.

  I really wanted to knock this one out in 2020 but being an "essential worker" has made it hard to do anything this season, but I digress.

  I went here on a Saturday night a couple weeks back and it was lightly seated, with delivery drivers seeming to make most of their business. They have a good selection of hard spirits and beer behind the bar. Limited seating in an already somewhat cozy space.

  I ended up taking to the kitchen manager before I ordered to find out how the wings were cooked.  Mainly because I prefer a fried chicken wing to a baked one.  Its a texture thing.

  They actually par bake the chicken beforehand and finish it in the fryer.  I imagine this is because the wings themselves are very meaty. Like twice the size of a normal buffalo wing.  If you tried to deep fry something big and meaty, you tend to overcook the outside and leave the inside a little rare.

  The result is chicken that has a more roasted texture, rather than crispy fried. Think a rotisserie chicken.  Juicy and flavorful. No, It doesn't have very crispy skin but it's still very good.  It is also served fast, probably less than 7 min.  

  Then there is the toppings, which consisted of peppers, garlic and parm.  Perfectly accented th chicken without overpowering it or making me want to scrape off the detritus before I dipped it in the house made ranch. Which, by the way, is the best ranch I've had.

  So yes, Noble Pie knocks it out of the park with their wings.  Not something I will seek out when I am wanting traditional style but definitely something I will suggest to anyone wanting a nice, juicy and meaty wing.  Of which there are plenty.

We walked in and were taken care of quickly. The pizza and wings were good. I loved them! My husband is a picky eater and so he wasn't too enthused about the extra garnish of garlic on the wings but it was easily removed. The food was reasonably priced and we enjoyed the atmosphere. I enjoyed seeing some of the unique ways they re-created their spaces for COVID. We had made reservations but arrived a little earlier and were seated promptly.
