However, as it got business, I noticed people getting grumpy about making reservations and having to wait. I think it was mainly due to not wanting to sit outside. They had heaters out there but we didn't sit out there so I'm not sure how well they worked. We would definitely visit this place again when we returned to Reno in the future.

I have lived in Reno since 1997. Over the past 10 years, I have heard about Noble Pie from many people. I have heard about their chicken wings. Well, after dealing with 2020, I decided its finally time to give it a whirl! And thankfully, they have delivery! I didn't know what to try because the selection on the menu is huge! So I got a few things.

I ordered a Nobleman pizza, the meatball stromboli  (comes with a salad), a pound of wings, and my own pizza creation (caramelized onions, spinach , and feta). I sampled a little bit of everything. Everything was so delicious!!! And yes, their chicken wings are the best I have ever had. The meatballs in the stromboli are homemade! The dressing for the salad was great and the salad itself was put together with fresh ingredients! As for the pizza, its the best in town! My taste buds are very pleased with their first experience of Noble Pie Parlor!

The spicy hot wings were really good. 

We only tried 1 pizza, but not bad. I would try this Restaurant again. Service was friendly and good.
Outdoor seating wasn't that bad because they have heaters places directly over the tables. The pizza was amazing and the staff kept coming to check on us outside.

If you find yourself in downtown reno you HAVE to come here! Me and my husband got a pizza, wings(a must have), a Stromboli, and beer. Everything was delicious! The homemade dough for the pizza and Stromboli were perfect.
This is some great pizza! The salad was also tasty as well as the garlic fries. What really made our experience over the top is the great customer service that ANTHONY provided. Thank you!!!

This place is racist! Do not eat here. Unless you want to be disrespected. My sister walked in and asked the bar manager/cashier if they would be able to take a party of 10. To which he replied, yes but you will be split up into two groups of four and a group of two. We said no problem. He then said you also cannot get up to talk to one another. My sister  said okay no problem. We were just hungry. Then he tells my sister that we need to make a reservation in order for him to take us in. We all book our reservation and go in and tell him that we have made our reservation. At this point he turns around and tells us that he cannot take us in because our group would put his restaurant at full capacity. When we look around the place we notice that every person in the restaurant is of Caucasian resemblance. And we are not. So what other reason if there to turn down a family with four children down?

Worst service ever. Showed up with my group and was asked to make a reservation. I make the reservation. As soon as I'm done making it we get turned away saying they can't accommodate our reservation!!! When I was told specifically by them to make the damn reservation!!!!

Zero stars is what this review really needs!!! Had a bad meal about a year ago and decided to give it one more try. Ordered their supposed raved about Thanksgiving Calzone that the menu shows comes with a side salad. The price is already steep but the side would make up for that. Order arrived via delivery and NO salad. Then I could tell the calzone wasn't even warm. Cut into it and it was completely uncooked and raw!! Wasn't even browned like a calzone should be. Went right in the trash. Called the restaurant and didn't even get an apology just got told to call Door Dash for a refund. Will never again give this place my money. Two times is enough and they proved they are horrible. Restaurants are fighting for their lives right now during COVID and this is the kind of service and product you put out? Unacceptable!!

The wings have saved this place for me. I've eaten here a handful of times and have tried the pizza and wings. The pizza to me is bland and doughy. And for the price, just not worth it. But those wings are some of the best I've ever had. Yeah you smell like garlic for the next 48 hours but it's worth it. Today I ordered the wings and gave a calamine a try.... I have to stop falling for it! It was just as flavorless and doughy as the pizza. Not shocked. Just disappointed. I'll stick with the wings.

Wasn't even compelled to do this until the umpteenth time they had messed up my order, so at this point it needs to be addressed. Amazing food (hands down the best fries and wings in all of Reno) but do they have a new team? Because recent orders have been so wrong. The food is either burnt, wrong, or missing something. Never really had problems with my orders until this year. Please bring back the old team to train the new team or something because it's becoming annoying and making me want to not even bother with this place no matter how good the food is.

business.name: The Refinery
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants

reviews.text: While the food was good, the atmosphere left a lot to be desired. We only had the nachos from the current rotating menu, which to our disappointment was Tex Mex only, and nothing else sounded good so we stopped at that. Back to the atmosphere... imagine a small warehouse converted to look like a half-finished basement and you get the picture. The bare concrete floors and white drywalls echo every conversation making the noise level annoying, even at half capacity. What really annoyed me was that the TV behind the half-stocked bar where we were sitting was tuned to local news, which of course was hyping up the tragedies of the day, which does not make for a pleasant night out.

A few friends and I usually come to dinner after various shows at nearby Tempus Projects or Quaid gallery. I always want a place I can sit down, in AC, and be waited on. I also like a full bar and good food - ding ding ding - you guys offer all of that and more. Erika has waited on us a number of times and we lucked out last night too. She is friendly, informative, makes great recs, seems to know the menu inside and out. On one particular occasion last Fall, she handled a difficult diner who was at our table. While I lost patience early on, Erika never did and continued to do whatever was needed to make this person happy (futile). She was cool, calm and collected. True Professional!
Always friendly​ and quick to seat us. Even on​ a weekend​ without reservations.​ Erika is the BEST! Enjoying the rotating menu this summer very much!

Have been to The Refinery several, just lazy about writing a review. The food, in general, is pretty spot on and the issues I have had are more personal preference than technique.
Almost always fortunate to have Erika as my bartender or server. She's the one who looks out for the guest. Raff is awesome as well and cares about customers.
If you want a solid experience I strongly suggest it.

I was unpleasantly surprised to find that the Refinery has taken on "theme" menus as opposed to what was its very good standard fare - and this month's theme is British food. I'm not sure if they thought blood sausage was something that normal humans might find appealing, or that soggy fish and chips might be a hit here - but if so they were dead wrong. The restaurant was pretty empty for a Saturday night - now we know why. Our party of 6 ordered 3 appetizers and a variety of entrees to try to find something that was tasty, and the only thing worth trying was the pork loin. Please PLEASE do not continue to run this menu through June - seriously, it's gross.

This was not good. The food was pretty bad. The service similarly was not good. We started with the burrata which was served without bread which we had to order separately. The burrata in and of itself was ok--at least of the right texture but otherwise uninspiring. This was followed by the bucatini which honestly tasted like pasta covered in chopped canned tomatoes. We had the short rib which was flavorless and cannoli Beans tasted straight out of the can. Honestly, the bread was the best part!
Brunch was ok. Limited options to choose from on the menu. It is very large and spacious; however it seems to always be empty.

This place has a really cool vibe but personally, I wasn't impressed by their food. Service was OK, drinks were pretty good but food... mehh. I was thinking about giving it another try but there are lots of other places in Seminole Hights I'd rather go to.

I'm a little spoiled because I live within walking distance of this place. I came here for brunch with my family on a Sunday. The restaurant has a really cool vibe, it's was probably once an old garage of some sort which has been totally redone giving it a really modern-industrial vibe with lots of wood and high ceilings. We had reservations at 11 and were seated immediately in a cozy booth.

We started off with Manmosas which are pint-size mimosas (really reasonable at $8). They were very tasty. Unfortunately they were out of one of the beers that someone in my party wanted to try. We all ordered different things: French Toast Special, Daddy's Favorite, Corned Beef Hash, and the Big Freakin' Biscuit. Overall we all really enjoyed our meals. My biscuit was really good, but my side of grits was disappointing, it was pretty watery and not creamy. My boyfriend commented that the Daddy's Favorite was good, but not the best he's had. 

I will comment on the portion sizes, because I thought they were a little off. All were a little smaller- but still filling. However, the French Toast portion was massive while the Corned Beef Hash was smaller than the rest of our meals. 

Overall, I'd definitely come back from brunch. We all thought the prices were extremely reasonable (entrees are between $10-$15) and the service was attentive. I look forward to trying them for dinner.

Fantastic place for brunch.

The food here is top notch. It's a small menu because they know that every option they offer is A+++. I got the Pastrami Toast and just wow. The bread is phenomenal, they get it from a local bakehouse, the pastrami was so tender and had the fattiness level I desired (I like my meat like I like my men, totally kidding, but I'm sure my husband hates that joke so I have to keep making it), and the eggs were perfectly poached on top. 

The sweet debris was also absolutely delicious. This is a must get. Sure, it is a heart attack on a plate, but you only live once. Their biscuits are amazing on its own, but then fry it and add jam and powdered sugar?! I'm seriously running out of synonyms for delicious.

I also got to try my friend's pancakes and it was so fluffy. I would have had food envy if I wasn't busy loving my own meal.

This might not seem like a ton of food, but it is very filling. And the quality of ingredients can't be beat. 

I really appreciate how spaced out all the tables are. We had two babies in here and didn't feel crammed in at all. 

They have a neat little patio outside so you can sit inside or out.

So decided to have a date night with a few friends thinking this place would match up to Fodder and Shine. Unfortunately, my expectations were ruined
this establishment is Definitely no Fodder and Shine.

The concept of serving a more healthier meal is always a plus in my book. But if you're not skilled in seasoning or lack ambition in the kitchen then this place will not last. The tapas concept is great if the food is amazing but this place lacks the love of flavor. The Acaraje is dried in need of some sauce to dip in but unfortunately, the chef would not provide one and stuck to his guns. Thank God I'm a chef myself and created one for our table and it tasted much better. The Thai street corn lacked the Thai concept (again no flavor). The Kimchijeon we wanted to love so bad but unfortunately, this was no proper kimchi pancake. The grilled pork shoulder was okay nothing to brag about. 

Will say the dessert menu was the only thing we all seemed to enjoy. The chocolate èclair and the banana cue (mango rice pudding) that is because you can never go wrong with some kind of sweets. Unfortunately, Fodder and shine left some big shoes to fill and these small plates are not quite doing it. They say the menu changes weekly, unfortunately, it needs to happen quickly. 

Seminole Heights is a food-loving place so if this establishment wants to stay learn to cook authentic food with flavor. 

P.S. the customer is always right even if you may feel otherwise for your consumer is what keeps your doors open. ;-)

I was always a fan of The Refinery as well as Fodder and Shine before they merged together but the new Refinery is better than either of them were independently. The have an outstanding cocktail menu and the menu is a perfect mix of New American with a Southern twist. I've never had anything less than top notch service on any of my visits here as well.

We used to love this place. We would come twice a week we are total foodies and love to try different things not sure what happened here! Very sad because I love to support local businesses but this place went down hill.

Like the atmosphere but I guess my review online was deceiving prior to dining. I saw pictures of plenty of food in the plates. We went tonight and had the short rib while it tasted pretty good it's also over $30 FOR ONE PIECE OF SHORT RIB. My husband was pissed. We left after spending almost 90 on 2 meals and 1 drink and stopped for fast food on the way home. I respect good food but I think we should also have more than 3 bites to enjoy it.

This place is never packed and I always wonder why!  I love it though cause I never have to wait when I walk in. I love coming here because I know I'm going to get excellent service with a smile and a delicious cocktail. The food is southern comfort inspired and they have some vegetarian options as well. Good environment for a date, as well as small parties with its outside option as well. Sometimes they have a local grass fed beef meat store out in the parking lot where you can get incredible meats for great deals!

This place has a cool vibe.  We thought the food was good but overpriced for the quantity and quality.  We've heard lots of good things so we will give it another shot, but our first experience we were a little underwhelmed.

The service was really good, they were very on top of making sure we had everything we needed and they were extremely friendly. One server even asked us how we liked the music. The food was very good pricing and absolute delicious and the ambience is romantic and relaxing! An amazing night

This place has taken a nose dive! We used to love it. Portions were great, presentation, service. Nope. Something has gone awry at the ol refinery. The millennial manager offered nothing but defensiveness and aloofness at our obvious dismay. Beers are good and ok priced, but food way overpriced and underwhelming. Go to have a drink MAYbe? but have food at your own peril.

The fried chicken was about as dry as the service and atmosphere. Went here for my b day dinner and I mind as well have went to a hospital cafeteria. Server had zero personality, the drinks were fair and the atmosphere of the place sucks! Like somebody died. The fried chicken had no seasoning and was very dry. How about some dipping sauce?? Sad to say that I will never dine here again. Might order a house burger to go, if anything. The over all experience was regretful.

5 Stars for the Sweet Biscuit Debris and every single other thing I tried when dining here for brunch.

Man, this was a good brunch experience. Everything from the easy online reservations, to the lovely hostess helping us get situated with two infants in the group, to a really informative server, to a surprising menu. 

I'd been to the old location of The Refinery years ago, but I appreciated the open feel of the front of this relocated Refinery. We sat at a large table towards the back.

The first thing you need to do when brunching at The Refinery (for the rest of its life... which I hear won't be much longer) is order two or three orders of the Sweet Biscuit Debris before they run out. This heavenly dish is made up of fried biscuit bits in powdered sugar, served with homemade jam. They are limited supply, so that's why I urge you to do this immediately. Everyone at the table agreed that they're like a reinvented beignet that we didn't know we needed. But we did. And you do. So do it.

I also ordered the Green Curry Banana Pancakes ($12) served with a lemongrass anglaise and ancho maple syrup. These were a nice muted sweet flavor with a subtle aromatic curry flavor that added interest. Everyone at the table wanted a bite and everyone agreed that they were a great take on a typical brunch dish.

My friends ordered savory dishes, of which I tried a few, and all were worth ordering again. I am looking forward to trying out their dinner while we all still have the chance to enjoy this great spot!

*Quick note, they don't have any to-go coffee cups, so drink up while you're there!

I was so very disappointed. The largest disappointment was the service ..even though we were seated at the bar it took at least 10 minutes for the bartender to give us a menu ...after another 15 minutes I had to flag one of them down to get a cocktail. After delivering the cocktail the bartender asked if we would be eating even though affirming that we would be eating it took yet another 35 minutes for someone to return to take the order. I should add that there were only two other people at the bar and the restaurant was scantly occupied. Additionally,I found the food to be very lackluster. I don't think I would give this restaurant a second chance.

Brunch at The Refinery was worth while. The service was excellent, here is a breakdown of the items I tried.

Coffee: 4/5 - They use Kahwa coffee brewed locally out of St. Pete the cost $3. Flavor is an intense dark roast, great if you enjoy strong coffee. 

Corned Beef Hash: 3/5 - The corned beef is not from a can, but it is texturally similar to canned corned beef. The flavors were great, but a bit salty. Not served with toast, would have been a nice addition. 

Green Curry Pancake with Ancho syrup: 5/5 - Yes this dish is the most trendy/hipster sounding dish around, but it was very interesting and the pancakes were the perfect texture and density. Nothing was too sweet and the curry sauce complimented the spicy undertones of the Ancho syrup. 

Side of  pastrami: 5/5- This was the best dish sampled. Smoky homemade pastrami grilled like bacon. 

Value: 3/5 - The average cost of each dish was around $13, a bit steep for brunch. 

Next time I'll order the Pastrami sandwich.

We are walking distance to The Refinery, but this was the first visit during Sunday Brunch.  We had just finished yoga and didn't feel like changing, going home, only eating quickly.  It was moderately busy when we arrived but there 2 spots at the bar right in front of the BPL soccer game was being aired, so we were happy! My husband ordered coffee and we did take a few minutes deciding.  The brunch menu, just like their standard menu, is chock full of items you won't find elsewhere.  Looking for some eggs and bacon, we chose to order off the sides menu to create our late breakfast.  It was nice to sit at the bar...certainly not our first time and we had the same attentive service. Food was perfect and quick.  Coffee, according to my exacting husband, quite good.  A nice Sunday brunch.  We were charged one item 2 times on our bill, but it was promptly resolved.

I remember their food being excellent years ago at the old establishment, but I had a bad experience today. I'm not sure if the oil they used to cook the food was bad but everything tasted peculiar, especially the oven smashed potatoes. The normally delicious biscuits were flat and chewy.  Our food was a little cold when they brought it out. The bartender did not greet us, and just slid the menus to us. I've been there before for dinner and other bartenders ignored us and let our drinks stay empty, forgot to give silverware after the food was brought out, etc.  It seems that the bartenders only pay attention to the people they know. Ive been there 3 times hoping for improvement. I used to be a fan, but I'll never visit again.  It's too bad because I normally like to support local businesses.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.   The worst meal and awful service.  I would not even give this place one star.   To start the service was terrible!  They made us wait over 30 minutes to be seated.  We were told we had to wait for the waitress to put water on the table before we could be seated.  WHAT???   When I pointed out to the hostess it would be more accommodating and profitable if we were seated and gave our drink orders the hostess was beyond rude.  The service was very slow despite the fact that there was not a lot of customers.  Had to ask numerous times for a straw.  When the food came out it was a complete disaster.  The chicken and cornbread was tasteless and lacked flavor.  The chicken was like rubber and was void of any flavor.  The cornbread was dry and also lacked flavor.  The greens were sour.  The burger was raw in the middle and they were out of French fries.  The tofu and bean dish was disgusting.   It was as if someone opened a can of beans and poured it on top.  No flavor and inedible.  The chicken and biscuit was dry and tasteless.  A complete disaster. Will never go back.

business.name: Tortilla Press
business.categories: Mexican, Restaurants, Sandwiches, American (Traditional)

reviews.text:
The Tortilla Press is as the perfect cure from a Friday night hangover. We enter the TP with happy smiles from the waitress, the orange paint help make the environment feel warm and fun! 

The virgin margaritas are well worth it. Very tart and sweet! The honey cholulo wings were sooooooooooo good!! We also ordered tacos, so yum!! All of there food is made from scratch and has some unique twists!

The TP is more of an Ameri-Mexican rather than traditional Mexican. I felt the tacos could've been better seasoned and come out alittle faster. We also didn't receive any chips for some reason! ): 

Regardless-  food and service was great, I would love to return to the Tortilla Press!

Tortilla Press is the epitome of Tex-Mex or Americanized Mexican food.

Situated right off of Haddon Ave in the heart of Collingswood, Tortilla Press has some prime real estate which includes two separate dining areas and exterior panels that open up into the street, which creates an inviting and fun environment.

My friend and I came here to catch up with over some margs (this place is BYOB btw) We brought some tequila and ordered a pitcher of marg mix. Honestly it hit the spot if you ask me.

I ordered the Classic Burrito and didn't have too high expectations for it, given our location and the menu offerings. The Classic Burrito met my expectations, but I'm sure it tasted better with me being 1 marg deep by the time my entree came around ... regardless, if you're looking for rich, Mexican flavors, then Tortilla Press is not the spot for you. If you're looking for Tex-Mex, then Tortilla Press is the way to go.

With that said, we loved our server, Sherri! Such a ray of sunshine, honestly!

Happy eating : P
We've loved all the food we've ever ordered from them - every time! My fave is the chicken Brie mango quesadilla - insert chef's kiss and my partner's fave are the wings

I'm not sure which was better the guac, the crab and avocado quesadillas or the service from the 3 lovely ladies at tortilla press. Thank you Lindsay, Jamie, and Charlotte for making my take out experience that much better. I'll be back for In-house dining and more avocados. 
Cheers!  johanna

It's been awhile since I've have good Tex-Mex. Several coworkers and I decided to order Tortilla Press for lunch and the crab&avocado quesadilla did not disappoint. Plus everyone got what they ordered.  Can't wait to try more of their entrees and even a margarita!

I have always heard great things. It was just okay. Food was fine, but not great. Waitress very good, but food took a very long time. Make sure you use bathroom prior to your visit or wait until your next stop. This was the dirtiest bathroom I have seen in an eatery, the floor was filthy. It's small, but that's not the problem.

While there are a few restaurants in downtown Collingswood, this is the only Mexican one. The lack of competition may lead to the substandard food quality of Tortilla Press.

The facility is nice and clean with plenty of seating; while service can definitely take some time during dinner its not out of an ordinary range for a busy restaurant. 

The quality of food prevents Tortilla Press from receiving anything above 2 stars. Having been to numerous Mexican restaurants in South Jersey and having ate in Mexico numerous times, the food at Tortilla Press is underwhelming at best. It does not necessarily tase bad but also does not really taste good either.
Delicious I got the tacos with filet mignon and crab meat my s/o do tilapia tacos. no wait fast and wonderful service very reasonably prices

We hadn't been here in years, so it seemed like a good time to revisit this favorite of ours now that restaurants are again offering indoor dining, especially since I was recently overcome with a craving for old-school hard-shell corn tortillas.

We started with the Guacamole and chips, which is delicious but a bit hard to eat due to the extremely thin and crisp tortilla chips, but we were both up to the challenge given the gustatory benefits of this combination.

My wife wisely chose the half-rack of coffee-rubbed ribs, which were tender beyond belief! The meat fell off the bone with only the slightest provocation, so there was no need to use your hands! And the taste was right up there with the best either of us have ever had. 

The crispy-shell beef tacos were exactly what I needed: extremely fine-ground beef in a delicate, crispy shell with just the right amount of fresh tomato, lettuce and cheese. However the meat didn't have any extra zing that you might get at a genuine Mexican taqueria (for example El Limon in the Philadelphia area). 

The service was excellent; we had a wonderfully nice waitress who happily took nice photos of us and even the manager stopped by to introduce himself and ask us if everything was to our satisfaction. This restaurant's popularity is well deserved and we look forward to dining here again soon!

The staff were very nice and engaging. We picked up our order and noticed they also had seating for customers. Every dish we ordered had a separate container even the fajita so we had many containers amongst our party of 3. Because of all the containers, we didn't notice that my fajita didn't have the side of red rice and beans. Overall the chicken nachos were delicious. The chicken and shrimp were seasoned nicely but the steakhouse empanada was a bit dry but tasted nice with the sauce. I would recommend trying it out.

We really love tortilla press and have for years, so I'm sad to write this - we made reservations through yelp for 730pm on a Saturday night. When we arrived, they told us they closed at 7. As you can see below, they are aware of the yelp reservation issue but are doing nothing to fix it apparently? Also, I was not offered the same explanation or any type of apology or anything more than just being blown off really. I totally understand closing early or changing procedures during the pandemic. I specifically wanted to support one of our favorite spots during this time.  I would think providing accurate information so your patrons can do so would be priority.

Enjoyed a great lunch on a weekend at tortilla press! It was extremely hot- but there was atleast one tree we could sit under for SOME shade. 

I had made a reservation through yelp- but upon entering the manager expressed to me he was not using that app for reservations at that time so I am not sure what that was about. We were asked if we wanted to also sit inside- they have a room that has window floor length that are open as an option as well. 

Our waitress was friendly and prompt. We brought our own tequila and could mix it with their margarita mix for $12 a pitcher. We were happy with our $2 chips and salsa which was enough to split! I enjoyed the buffalo cauliflower tacos and rice as a side. The food was amazing! Only complaint we had was the quesadilla was not big enough for an entree.

Every time I order take out from the tortilla press it's awful! Shame on me for going back, but I keep hoping it will be better. After today I won't be back. 

When we walked into the restaurant for our order no one had a mask on. The one girl had to put hers on when she saw us come in and the man I believe is the manager didn't even bother to acknowledge us nor pull his mask over his face. I don't like the mask more than the next person, but I comply with what I'm told to do you'd think the people working in the restaurant would do the same? 

We were told there was a mix up with our order and it would have to be remade. No problem at all.. it happens. We waited outside for our order to be remade and were asked to come back in when it was ready. Still no mask on the manager lol. I made a comment that it's all good now we have fresh food. Meaning I'd rather wait for the food than the food wait for me. The server knew what I meant, but still decided to make a comment that the food was "always fresh." Sure guy. We get home and the food is horrendous! The guacamole is usually made fresh.. ours was brown. We wanted to try the Brie and mango quesadilla.. don't... couldn't get past the smell. The side veg was putrid as well. The mahi mahi tacos were a small piece of fish that didn't even fill the taco and the pulled pork tacos just looked sad. After seeing the beautiful pictures on their website of their food I thought what I was ordering would kind of resemble what was in the picture... I was so wrong. It was like watching a McDonald's commercial and then getting the burger in real life! Where is the quality control? Where is the freshness? So disappointed. Not for nothing, but an apology for the mix up on our order didnt come until after we paid... we were left with a bad taste in our mouths literally. 

Our dine-in experience has always been wonderful.. however take out is lacking. I understand things aren't as they usually are right now, but we've ordered take out before all this and it was awful. You'd think if you can't have customers dine in you'd at least want to make their take out experience worth while. The price point of the food doesn't match the quality of the food.

I've tried very hard to support my local favorites during these trying times because I very much so want to see them on the other side of the pandemic. 

My experience today however with Tortilla Press Cantina has resulted in my taking an extended break from this establishment. While I understand that Cinco de Mayo is busy for Mexican restaurants, the mismanagement of expectations today was over the top. For over half an hour, I was unable to get through the line to make an order and ultimately being hung up on once I finally did make it through. My fiance got through and we placed our order around 5pm and were told that it'd be ready for pick up between 6:30 and 6:45. He's there waiting for the order as we speak and says that not only does the line for pick up go around the block, but there are still people waiting for the 5:30 pickup window. It's about 5 after 7 now. All the while, we still don't even know if there is an actual order waiting for us. I've been trying to call to see if he's standing outside waiting in vain, but again, getting an actual human being is nonexistent. I continue to get the voicemail after the phone rings about 10 times.

I'm not angry that they're sorting out now to navigate business in an atypical setting. I'm angry that there's no communication, and they clearly bit off more than they could chew in this instance. Note for future endeavor- know your limits. Trying to go too big just cost you business. Best of luck.

I used to think the Tortilla Press was awesome. I'm not sure what changed but it went down hill from 2-3 years ago. Going into the restaurant on Friday I was feeling great, happy to visit my old favorite restaurant in Collingswood.  On my most recent visit I ordered the Carne Asada entrée.  At the time it was okay, not the best. It used to be my favorite meal at the Tortilla Press. It wasn't until I got home when the meal took full effect. I spent my entire Friday night in the bathroom. I think I was able to sleep only an hour. All night long I was taking number 2 trips, along with throwing up. I contacted the Tortilla Press's email have to warn them of the possible food poisoning on my most recent visit. I have yet to hear back from them. It's a shame I always looked forward to my Tortilla Press visits. The wait staff is always great and attentive. But because of my most recent experience I think it will be a long time before I return.

What a disappointment!
This restaurant was always special 
We had to wait for our dinner to arrive forever 
Our  grandson ordered steak tacos 
How terrible that dish was
Shredded steak and very salty
Returned the shredded steak- wAs not edible 
Kind enough and replaced with chicken tacos!
Shredded again! 
Please get the quality of food and service upgraded!
The server was never available to help!
The food was amazing. I had the classic steak burrito. She had the cauliflower taco. And the virgin margarita was awesome.

This used to be one of our favorite spots in Collingswood, but I do feel that they have gone down hill over our past couple of visits. Went there yesterday and were seated immediately with plenty of open tables which was not the case a year ago. The server though friendly, was not very attentive as we had to ask for chips, dip and a set of utensils more than once. The food which used to be a highlight; I can only describe as just ok. Three of the six meals came out barely warm and the portions are definitely smaller in size. There are just too many places in Collingswood to eat these days to settle for just so-so. I hope that the owners of the Tortilla Press see the light and step up their game and get back to the good old days and soon.
I used to work here once upon a time. They have the best guacamole I've ever had in my life. Everybody there was also very friendly. Great place!

This place has been on my radar for a long time, but frankly, parking around Collingswood can be a pain if not planned out carefully.  We just happened to stop into town for the Clover pop up market and thought we'd stroll up here for a little sum'thin sum'thin to fill up.

We shared a plate of loaded nachos (no protein) and they were good about not adding olives as requested. We found a few random carrots (WHUT) buried in there, but they had a nice tart flavor so perhaps they weren't in there by accident after all.

And the plantains - oh my!  So very good and glad we ordered them. Soft and tasty and a generous serving.

Complimentary chips and salsa had a nice kick.
terrible service food is gross they never come to fill up your water the chips are very salty and the food tastes like it was bought at walmart. waiter never comes to see if you need anything

I came here with my friends who are from Collingswood. They were pretty excited to take me here. We were immediately seated. However, it took about 15-20 minutes for a server or anyone to approach us if we wanted water. Once the waitress finally came over to us, we immediately ordered. We got the loaded nachos and I ordered the cheese enchiladas. Honestly, the food was alright, I wouldn't say it was worth a 20 minute wait. I was a tad disappointed since my friends were so excited to bring me here. I am not sure if I'll be back!

We had a great lunch today at Tortilla Press. Our server Cheri was welcoming and helpful with the menu and stayed on top of our drinks. Lisa had a full menu of vegan and Vegetarian choice included jackfruit tacos and buffalo tacos both very authentic and delicious. I cleared the plate of my Chiles Rellenos along with a small Tortilla soup. We will definitely will be back

This place let me and my friends stay after closing and we didn't even realized they closed and I think that's just so nice of them like they didn't have to keep us there but they did and I am oh so grateful :) food and dessert was amazing!!!

My friends and I go to Tortilla Press often and the food and service are always great. Most recently, we had dinner here on 7/18 and our server was very nice and our food (nachos and chicken fajitas) were excellent. We have never had a bad experience and always look forward to dining here!

business.name: Oregano's
business.categories: Sandwiches, Pizza, Restaurants, Italian

reviews.text: Very disappointed in the service I've been here for an hour and have not gotten another drink since I've finished my first one. The waitress has not even asked if our food is good if we need anything hasn't even stopped back at our table

Such a wonder lunch today. Wanted something other than heavy food. Came in for salads and wow blown away. 
We decided to also try the wings and fried zucchini. The portion sizes are super generous.

Wings were juicy, the regular "hot" version was perfect nice and spicy but not over the top.

The fried zucchini was tasty too and the ranch that comes with it is just right.

Service was efficient, attentive and courteous we went right when they opened to beat the crowds.

They took care of the customizations I requested on my salad and made it to order.
I got the "Favorite" but asked for them to omit the raisins and change the dressing to Caesar and it was great!
Hubby got the Caesar and was pleased.

I o
All we could say was WOW!  Service and food was excellent!  Pizza was so good, crust was crisp and oh so full of toppings!  Even the salads were great, fresh and vibrant.

Jasmine, thank you so much for coming in and taking over our table. You literally turned our frowns upside down. Our previous server from the bar provided really bad service. We requested a new server and jasmine came to the rescue. You are really great at your job, your energy is awesome and literally provided top tier customer service. 

Thank you jasmine!
I  Oregano's great atmosphere and awesome people... I've been to all 3 locations and never once had a bad experience with food OR staff

We we're looking for a quick lunch and came across this place, so glad we did! Excellent food, atmosphere and service! Everything from the pasta to the sausage and sauces is made in house! It's definitely a "don't miss"!

While the wait staff was wonderful, what the heck is happening in the kitchen?! We went for lunch, and the restaurant wasn't busy. We expected to eat fairly quickly but that wasn't the case. It took at least 45 minutes for our two personal pizzas to be delivered from the kitchen. When we did receive it, it was quite cold.  I'm not sure if this was an off day but I don't believe that this is a location I would visit again.

The food was amazing however the waiters at this restaurant were unprofessional! My partner had walked out for an emergency call while the waiters kept looking out and gossiping with each other. While leaving, we left a couple items and came back quickly to retrieve them and waiters refused to give items back. We talked to the manager and just told us to leave... worst experience

It's always a great time at Oreganos! Except this Irvington location is always packed. My boyfriend and I always opt in for the bar area since it's just the two of us. The guy behind the bar is always super friendly and the service is great!

We always tend to order the Alfredo after dark with comes with a piece of bread and a huge jalapeño!

Highly recommend this dish!

Man we got delivery thru doordash. It was about $95 worth of different salads and over half of them where horrible. They where missing ingredients so bad that it was laughable. My house salad had 1 and a half (yes I am not joking 1 and a half) croutons on it, with no tomatoes. One of my friends asked and paid for extra chicken and they got ZERO chicken. Two others asked for extra ranch and only got one. On top of all that if we asked for items like onions, yellow peppers, or cheese to not be on it, it was always on it. Worst experience ever!!!
Horrible seating kept bringing up the waiting time! Never had this happen before in this Oreganos. And I'm never eating here again! Makes me want to work here to do a way better job.
Surprise by the Guac dish, will order it again n again!  Very good!!  Salad pizza and wings very delicious!  See u soon!!
Waits are always long (around 45 for dinner) but when you love their food, it's worth it. Would put myself in the wait list on Yelp to make time shorter as a pro tip.

First off I suggest including on your menu that the pizzas take anywhere from 45 minutes to 90 minutes to be done. That way customers know to decide on those options right away. Or have your servers present those options with the wait times when they take drink orders. We ordered the stuffed pizza to go after our server told us it would take 90 minutes. We really wanted to try it as it looked and sounded delicious. Ordered a chicken Parmesan sandwich to eat with the rest of my party in the restaurant. Everyone's food came out and I was still waiting on my sandwich. My sister shared her salad with me because I was the only one not eating. I asked the waitress if the sandwich should come out before the pizza since that was the point of me ordering it, she said yes the sandwiches usually come out quick and your pizza should be done in about 10 minutes. She asked if I wanted her to just cancel my sandwich and remove it from the bill. I said yes since I ate off other plates in my party and everyone was already eating done. My pizza did in fact come out before my sandwich. Was still charged for the sandwich and they put it in a to go box. Told the waitress we didn't want it to please take it off the bill since the point was to eat it in the restaurant with my party. She gave me a very snooty side smile and walked away with the bill and the box. The whole meal she took a very long time to bring refills. When we asked for a refill one of the times because she forgot I guess she responded "yes, but give me a minute." And it was not a nice tone she used. This is not the first time we have received bad service here. It's close to my house which is convenient and I love the food but I think I would much rather drive the 45 minutes to the Speedway location where the service is always excellent, the portions seem bigger and the staff is nicer.

Can't believe people are giving this place 5 stars. Obviously they don't know what good Italian food is. Our entrees left a lot to be desired. I ordered the Bolo Pasta with a side Caesar salad. Both my salad and pasta came out at the same time. The lettuce was wilted, pasta was Luke warm and the sauce had a bitter taste to it. Even the bread that came with it was stale. My British wife cooks much better Italian at home. Save yourself a trip and money.

Two words: pizza cookie. 

The service is great. The food portions are GIANT! So be ready to share. But save room for the pizza cookie. It is an absolute must.

Coming in I wasn't surprised to again be treat with the lovely atmosphere of the restaurant! The man who was taking customers in was so nice and got us some water when we came back after our walk. Super proud again with Oregano outstanding service our server Nya was amazing! The presentation was beautiful as always, and the food delicious! Thank you again for this wonderful dining experience!

I was really wanting some pasta today. We went to Oreganos. We were seated quickly and our waiter was awesome. He is explained some items when I had questions. My kids were happy and busy playing with some pizza dough he had brought out for them to play with. I ordered a Diablo shrimp pasta and it was amazing. Super yummy and a huge portion. My kids all shared a pizza and everybody left really happy. Thank you for a nice first visit. We will be back!
Love it always awesome! Meatball sammie was yum and also ordered the special chicken piccata- fantastic!

Went here on a Monday, around 2pm, and the server paid no attention to our table. While the rest of the restaurant was not busy what so ever. We were there for about 5 hours or so. I would not go to this location, the one on Broadway is worth the drive. The food was not worth it at all.

One of my favorite spots! Wait can be a little long especially with limitations related to Covid so prepare for that. Food is always great and filling. Love their pizza, pastas and anything with their meatballs!!!!
Honestly I'm not interested at this point. I feel your establishment should have known better especially a manager your staff was so polite and kinda shocked the plate was not removed from my bill.
Their pasta is pretty good. We also Iike their cheese bread. It's different from Olive Garden, so yeah if your trying to decide between the two. Oregano's has more spicier flavor than Olive Garden.

I was very very disappointed and will never eat there again! We had ordered pasta dishes and calamari which was very rubbery. So we were hoping our pastas would make up for it. My dish was under cooked pastas were dry and hard my girlfriends was  not much better. So I sent mine back after 2 bites and the manager asked if I wanted another one done I replied no, he never took it off my bill!! I'll never ever go back low grade food for people who just don't know any better honestly. It says a lot about a restaurant manager or owner when you send something back and they won take it off your bill really? I'm out!

Food was tasty, HOWEVER, service was poor. They failed to put cheese tons on our antipasto salad and the waitress said they no longer come on it.  Later she came back and said the kitchen forgot and quickly remedied the situation. The mixed drink was delivered quickly, but the tap beer took around 20 minutes. We joked that they were brewing it, but she said she took the beer to another table. The  first order of appetizer wings took about 30 minutes, and had obviously been sitting under the heat laps even though the waitress said she was still waiting/checking on the order. The second order of wings was delivered long before the first. Another time she said our food was on the way and we let her know we already had everything - she then realized the order was for a different table. Furthermore, multiple times  the kitchen brought orders out and we had to tell them we didn't place that order. The waitress continually apologized, but after a while it got old because mistake were still made. At the end of our meal she finally asked if we wanted a refill on our empty water glasses. 
I let the manager know the service was sub par and she stated everyone was new. Been to Oreganos MANY times, but this is the first and last time to this one.

business.name: 360 St. Louis
business.categories: American (New), Bars, Tapas Bars, Restaurants, Lounges, Nightlife

reviews.text:
Stopped on my way across a cross country road trip.
I wanted to stop for the view however due to the weather the rooftop was closed. 

The concept is open seating and they don't take reservations. Luckily I found a table near the window.

Food was good nothing out of the ordinary. I ordered the dressed to impesto since they have a fire oven.

Nice spot with the view of the city. Definitely recommend on a day that is not raining. After 9pm it turns into a bar.

Prices are reasonable

There's no parking for this place. You have to park on one of the lots across the street.

I chose Three Sixty  specifically for its rooftop view and it did not disappoint. LOVED IT!!! Located on the top of the Hilton hotel, this swanky indoor/outdoor rooftop bar and eatery is a must visit place in downtown St. Louis. Absolutely Incredible!!!

Good food, Good drinks, and Good vibe! We had the Burrata, Chicken Wings, Brussels Sprouts, Cauliflower Tacos, General Tso's steamed buns, Beet Salad, and Housemade Kit Kat! Each dish was a 10/10 in terms of presentation and taste. 

They don't take reservations, so it's an open seating with first come first serve. We went on a Friday night and were seated after a 15-20 minute wait.

Would give it a 0 star if possible if the 40min wait doesn't kill you the 20$ drinks and asshole staff/ security who let dirty people who pay them 40$ to get in front of you and then once you get up you can't vape or smoke out on the porch literally got harassed by security and almost kicked out for vaping outside!!!! Fuck that place go spend your $$$ elsewhere
This review needs no intro. This is the premier place in downtown STL. Looking for a good time? Go here. Looking for high end service? Go here. Views are as amazing as the service.

We went here on a very busy Sat night & sat at the bar. The service at the bar was a little on the slow side, the bar tenders were slammed. 
The view from here is incredible, the Arch looks awesome from here as does the entire 360 view. It's worth coming here just for that. 
The food was good, not great but tasty enough for a spot like this. 
The prices are reasonable & not over priced as I expected it to be. 
They have a good selection of craft beers, great mixed drinks & wine. 
We had pizza which was ok, my son loved the Mac & cheese, she said the Hamburg was tasty but on the small side & the cauliflower tacos were "interesting" according to my daughter. 
I'd definitely go back just for the view again & the food!

You have to get the hotel staff to let you in the elevator if you aren't staying there. The whole place felt very trendy and designed for insta.. which I could take or leave. However the views from the balconies were truly lovely.
I had the beet salad and the salmon chips. The salad was good. The chips were.. ok. I didn't feel the flavors quite worked and ended up just eating the fish off the chips. Our group shared the butter cake and all agreed we were happy we split it as it was delicious but extremely rich. 
Overall, decent and pretty, but not very memorable.

Probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. There was a line to get up there (no big deal and expected). We get to the top and the seating is "try and seek out your own table in an overcrowded bar" which I am not a fan of because if you leave your table it is no longer yours. The drink selection was very minimal which I wasn't expecting to be the case considering any rooftop bar I've been to in the US normally has a phenomenal drink selection. The drinks we got were okay, nothing special. The waitress was very nice and attentive for how overcrowded it was. We ordered the crab dip, the white album pizza, and ooey gooey butter cake. The crab dip was okay, again nothing special.  They served it with chips which was odd for a crab dip. The white album pizza was literally the worst pizza I have ever eaten in my life. It was insanely wet and oily. No real truffle and drowning extremely cheap tasting truffle oil. It was absolutely horrendous. The butter cake was by far the best part, still pretty basic, but at least tasted good. The views were nice, but not nice enough to make up for the low quality overpriced food. Then there was  a line wrapped around half of the restaurant in order to exit so it took more time to leave than it did to get in. No option to take the stairs. I seriously hope their other food options are better than the ones we got, because that pizza was literally the worst.

Needless to say, 360 St. Louis has an amazing view of the city. The rooftop is gorgeous and so is the view! Once you get inside the hotel, it's a little difficult to figure out where you need to go, but after some wandering around we realized that when you walk into the hotel, you just need to go straight to the elevator and head right up to the top. My fiancé and I stopped by for drinks and loved the view and the ambiance but the service was just okay. Our server only checked on us once during the hour we were there and my fiancé was served the wrong drink. By the time he noticed, he had already drank most of it so we didn't say anything (I'm sure she would have corrected it if we asked). Overall, worth checking out for the view. Great spot to stop by for a drink on a weekend night.

Great atmosphere. Unfortunately I got up to use the bathroom and the waitress closed my tab and another party took my table. I hope this doesn't happen often. After checking my bill they double the price and gave me no receipt.

Wow wow wow!!
As a new St. Louis resident this has been the most impressive and impressionable restaurant/bar I have been to yet! The food is good, their house fries are to die for! If you're looking for well seasoned things this is the place! The drinks are wonderful as well! Really made with love! And don't get me started on the views. As you walk the outside patio, you'll see everything... literally everything! Beautiful views of the city accompanied with wonderful food! Great spot for date nights or just getting together with the girls!

I chose this place because of distance to my hotel and the picture of the views. It was a Friday night and two conferences in town so for sure packed. Outdoor dining was clutch, the view and people watching. There were at least 4-5 bartenders so you were covered but you have to certainly do the stare down to get attention. The first drink I ordered was a margarita (12 seeds) and he said $20. Mmkay, I'm not from here. He returns and says 'sorry it's just $13' hmm. Ok. I appreciate the honesty. I'm here on biz so explained food on card and drinks are cash. But even though I was sitting there and ordered food, each drink paid upon receipt. Maybe they have a lot of theft. Next bartender asks me what I was charged when I got a second round so maybe they charge you based on YOU. Idk. I've seen it before. 

The food-- I wouldn't return for the food. The crab salad said peppers miso sauce and crab. It was in that order. They should've called it a pepper salad topped with crab. Shrimp skewer was ok. Polenta on bottom, heavy on the red sauce. The one dessert is why they get 4 stars (and I can't do 3.5) get the cake. The ooey gooey butter cake. Soft with a crisp crunch bottom. Oh oh yes. 

The view was sweet, the people watching good. Dates and work friends. It's atop of the Hilton so keep in mind when searching.

I would return for drinks and dessert.
Great food, beautiful view, and friendly staff. I had the short ribs and my fiancé got a burger. I tried both lol. They were amazing. Definitely will be back.

One of the best rooftops I've been to.  Centrally located so you can see so much of beautiful downtown St Louis.  As soon as you walk in through the hotel lobby everyone is super friendly and extremely helpful. Came here about 1.5 hours before a Tuesday game and was enough available seating to enjoy having a drink and taking in all the views beforehand.  Didn't get to order food; however, the drinks were pretty reasonable, all things considered.  Overall, highly recommend- you won't be disappointed!

If you have never been to St Louis, 360 is a must do yo experience the city. Absolutely stunning panoramic views of St Louis. You'll see the iconic landmarks such as the Arch and the baseball stadium. Numerous spots to take great pictures.  

Grab a handcrafted drink and some tasty food and enjoy the view. You will not be disappointed. The interior is also spectacular. 

Located atop of the Hilton Hotel, 360 is very posh and elegant. It serves wonderful cocktails and food, plus it has incredible views of the city.

5 stars!!

Nice view over Busch stadium. Love it! There's a surcharge at 12am for $10 and I'm not sure what time it starts. Came to try there food but we came in a little bit too late I guess cuz they don't serve food anymore.

At the end of a whirlwind day in Saint Louis I was looking for a fun place to finish off my experience with a nightcap - 360 Saint Louis at the top of the Hilton adjacent to the Ballpark Village was just the right place. A lively crowd, attentive bartenders & serving staff, a skilled DJ spinning (and I say this with the experience of having worked as a DJ in the past), made for a fun way to end the day.

360 has large windows on the inside areas, as well as open areas from which the entire city can be viewed in the round. The lighting within the space is at a level which highlights and allows the downtown architecture to be a focal point of your experience.

A modest cover charge was in place when I visited but the views alone made it well worth the admission.
This place was really cool.  All of the 4 specialty cocktail were delicious as was the old fashioned.   The atmosphere and view were really nice.  You could dress up or dress casual for a date night.

Great views! Great drinks! And great fancy snack food. Old fashions were great! Also with great options of martinis. 
Security has to let you up to the 26th floor and we're very attentive. 
First come first serve everywhere. 
Oh and the bathroom down the stairs right behind indoor bar.

Made reservation for 11, had to sign a contract to guarantee seating.  OK, contract stated we would spend at least $60 per person minimum or be charged that amount, We would have our own server and a 22% tip would be added.  Our time frame was 6:45-8:45.  We showed up 6:40 and were seated, got our first drink at 7:15 after complaining to management.  Took 1 hour to get an Ice tea!!!!.  Dedicated server had 4 tables of 9-12 customers, so much for a dedicated server.  Service was TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE.  The food was ok and overpriced for the portions.  The view was excellent.  Argued the 22% gratuity that was added on, but was told the contract stated that, I argued that contract also stated a dedicated server which did not happen.  Will never go back and will tell others it a rip off don't go service sucks.

Excellent food and service. Fastest kitchen I have ever witnessed for full-service dining. Went on a Saturday evening during a Cardinal game and even with the crowd the service staff was attentive, on top of every detail and very knowledgeable on all menu items. The brussels sprouts were so good we ordered a second.
This place was spectacular. We only visited briefly before a Cardinals game for drinks. But the view it wonderful. The drinks were reasonably priced and delicious.
Waited 25 mins in the lobby and no one come down to let us up. There are 20+ people in the line. We gave up and left.

The view is outstanding! One side is the arch, the other is the stadium. We just ordered an assortment of small plates. All were excellent! My favorite were the fried ribs and the brussle sprouts in a chimichurri sauce. Husband had the grilled asparagus on curry hummus and salmon chips-so delicious! Even the french fries were great!  Drinks were good and the service was fast and attentive. Definitely will return to this place and try more things off the menu. This was our favorite meal from the past five weeks on a road trip across the country.

The view was amazing! Great atmosphere. However they don't moderate how many people are coming in and it was extremely over crowded! They don't seat you it's fend for yourself. We had to wait 10 minutes just for someone to greet us when we did finally get a seat at the bar. We ended up just having a drink and leaving because we couldn't get a table and didn't wanna have to stand to eat. The service sucked. The menu was limited.

On July, 26, I and two other individuals of Hispanic and Asian race entered the establishment and were immediately shocked at the atrocious environment This place has been advertised as one one in which you go to have fun. We decided to stay even though it was not at all what we expected it to be. We processed to order drink which is when they asked us for our ID. We gladly handed them over even though we thought it was funny they were id'ing us seeing as though we were clearly over 21. They pretend to check the ID's and asked my friend questions to make sure it was hers. After she answered them all correctly she had the audacity to say that her government issued ID was fake.

business.name: Barcadia
business.categories: Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment, Restaurants, Arcades, Music Venues, Sports Bars, American (Traditional), Gastropubs, Bars

reviews.text: If I could leave zero stars I would!! The manager is the most miserable person I have ever met. Avoid Barcadia. There are hundreds of bars in New Orleans, and this place is at the DEAD BOTTOM. The worst experience I have ever had in a bar EVER!

Nice spot that my boyfriend and I ducked into to avoid rain. We actually enjoyed their limited menu (wings, cheese fries, burgers) and even played the games available. It was across the street from the hotel we were staying in and we will definitely be back!

We were really excited to visit this place while we were in NOLA, as we love arcade bars. Once arriving, we were very underwhelmed by the small amount of games they had. We even looked around to make sure we weren't missing anything, thinking, 'that's it?'

   Our visit was also about a month after Hurricane Ida, and they were not serving food at the time, which was completely understandable. Without food, though, we were entertained for about 10 minutes and ended up going somewhere else down the street. 

I would love to return one day if they ever get a larger selection of games to play!
Whack and boring. No one there and the staff was rude and unhelpful. Never coming back.

Went with friends to celebrate a birthday lastnight. unfortunately the uneducated bouncer insisted my ID was fake because it was out of state, even when i had multiple other forms to prove my identity. he refused entry and broke my license in half. spoke to the woman they said was the manger and was told i could've paid him to get in. highly unprofessional and disappointing. won't be going back.

i like this place !! it's the best for anything... if u want to have a relaxed time at the bar you can, if u want to be dancing to the music u can, if u want to watch games u can if u want to play games u can. you can basically make it whatever u want it to be. the atmosphere is great and there's a huge selection of drinks. my only complaint is that in the evenings the bartenders & servers can be kind of slow, otherwise this place is a 10/10
Customer service is trash. Do not go here. My husband and I were not greeted. We were just told to be seated and no one ever came over to help so we left.

This is not a "barcade". This is a bar with 10 arcade games with 2 that aren't functional. The food is a joke. The bartender was nice. But this place is not what you're looking for. Go somewhere else.

41 minutes to cook a hotdog...

There are no words to describe how ridiculous this was. And to top it off the guy from the kitchen ARGUED over if the hotdog came with a bag of chips.  Also, am I seriously supposed to drop a quarter into these games? What kind of "barcade" does this? If you're a club, fine. Don't serve food and don't have video games. And definitely don't call yourself BARCADIA.

First time in town with family and barcadia was right outside of our hotel. Tried placing an order To-go
But app did not work. Decided to come sit and eat, sat at the table without being greeted or noticed for about 10 minutes. Went to speak to bartender and she blew us off and mentioned ordering through the QR code. We ordered and the food was very underwhelming for how expensive it was. Had to send chicken strips back. It was 4 chickenstrips for $12 no description on website and had no server to ask prior. We ate what else we ordered and was still being unattended. Had to take my tables cups up to the bar and ask for a refill, which prompted the bartender to give me an ugly look. Just a terrible first impression of barcadia and I don't think my family will be visiting again.

I had the best experience at Barcadia, the staff was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive to  he needs of myself and other guests. 
The bar itself was clean and the food our group ordered was hot and delicious!!! Can't wait to come back here.
Great service every time! New food menu is delicious!! Must try the new churro donut!!

Would love to give 0 stars. Food was overpriced and terrible. Service was worse. Arcade games took money but didn't work on several occasions (yes, we did feed them the 50 cents they were asking for). Food came out over a 35 minute period for our party of 5.

Quite possibly one of the worst restaurant experiences ever. If it weren't for the bartender's pronounced disdain there would have been no interaction at all. Five video game machines, uninteresting bar food and filthy bathrooms. Do yourself a favor and go to the crappy McDonald's on Canal Street.

Horrible!! We came in for lunch at 12:05 didn't get our food until 12:55. We watched other tables around that came in 30 minutes after us get their food but not us. 

I asked the bartender twice if she can check, but I guess she was too busy with her two friends at the bar to really care. 

I Finally saw a manager and ask her if she can check on our food which she did. 

Even before CV19 the service and food was bad. They have a I don't care attitude. Never going back!!

This is a cool bar located near Bourbon St.

They have interesting decor and fun arcade games.

I did not order anything from their liquor/cocktail selection, but I did order food and it was delicious.

I ordered a delicious burger and fries. It was so good.

Customer service was good.

I think you can only view the menu by scanning a QR code.

I'd probably return the next time I'm in the area.
This shit was sooooo weak. Waited 30 minutes for red beans & they gave me a shot Glass of rice. Literally one tbsp of fucking rice. The food is a WASTE of money.
Place was kinda dirty and rundown. Burgers were very dry and salty. Fries were ok. Arcade machines really old and eats your money. Pretty disappointed. Cool concept but definitely a letdown.
Best night club in nola, hands down.  They also have great chicken wings.  Always a fun night at Barcadia!

We arrived into New Orleans late and need have a couple cold ones and eat. Thank goodness Barcadia was open!!  Very welcoming and gals to have more customers join them. Food menu a little limited, however, our waitress recommended the wings and HOW they were awesome. They have a great smoke flavor and about 6 sauces abs ribs to choose from. We had she chipotle bbq , oh so good and the garlic Parmesan mouth watering. I will see them next tome I am back in town.

Cool small arcade bar that was serious about COVID and had good wings. The employees all had masks and enforce mask wearing. That's a rare thing in the area but I was happy to see it. They were good about how many people they had in at one time and have tables spaced out. I had the wings and I thought they were great. Probably too crispy and a little dry for most but that's how I like my wings. They do fry them in their fish batter  it seemed. Some definitely had a fish taste in the skin. But it wasn't enough to be an issue. The staff were polite and always on the floor. They also have a few arcade games. It's a good local stop on this side of New Orleans.

I don't know if this is the proper place for this, but I just feel like I need to share this story. In order to escape the snow and ice in the northern part of the state, my wife, daughter, and I made a trip for a few days to New Orleans (pulling a Cruz?). We had been in town for a couple of days and decided to try the little barcade next to our hotel for lunch.

It was just before the start of the Celtics and Pelicans game, and out on the porch, Anthony Mackie was with a couple of friends, smoking a cigar. Now, yes, I know him best as Falcon, but I was closer to his role in 'Hurt Locker' as a former combat veteran, his acting resonated with me. And I wanted to meet him.

My wife didn't believe it was him first, but after talking to the waitress, it was confirmed. I asked if it would be okay to ask him for an autograph, she said he was usually pretty chill about that, brought me a pen and ticket and wished me luck. I waited a few minutes and then approached.
He stopped me short and said he was social distancing. No autographs. I was disappointed, but I took a moment to thank him for his work and that I really enjoyed him as an actor. I returned to my table and took a seat. My daughter wasn't feeling well, so we decided to order to go and head back to the hotel to eat.

While we were waiting, Barcadia's manager came over to the table. I was worried at first that we were going to be asked to leave. Instead, he asked what we were drinking. My wife and daughter both had water -- I had a coke. He laughed and told us 'There's someone that wanted to buy our drinks!' I had a total and complete squee moment but was sad that well... no drinks. He said no worries, he'll figure out something.

We had the bourbon burger and Ceaser salad - the burger was cooked perfectly medium well. The sauce was a little heavy on the sweet, but it was off-set by the smokiness of it. The salad was fresh and crisp. We had the cheese curds as well. The were perfectly sized and the cajun seasoning was a nice touch. While the place may have been a little loud for us to think at times, the meal was wonderful. 

As we were leaving, the waitress brought us our food to go and a T-shirt for our daughter, his compliments. Mr. Mackie and the manager of Barcadia gave me one of the most positive experiences I have ever had in New Orleans.

Barcadia is decorated so festively for Mardi Gras! I tried the Mardi Gras Shrimp Po'boy, and it was awesome--it comes with fries, and the sauce on top is delicious. I also tried the Zulu cocktail and it was a great spin on a piña colada.

The decor is really fun for groups, and the staff are all wearing masks to abide by covid guidelines. There's also an area to sit outside with is nice as well!

This bar had a really fun atmosphere! A lot of photo opts that could be really fun with a group!  The drinks seemed to be a little more on the basic side, but good nonetheless! We went mid-day just for a quick drink, but seems like it could be really cool bar for game night or for groups. They had several arcade games as well.

I visited during covid but I've also spent many evenings here in my 20s and 30s

Barcadia - half bar, half restaurant, half arcade. Barcadia has really grown its menu over the past few years and I am impressed by the amount of food they do well.

From cheese curds, to red beans and rice, Barcadia knows how to serve up a good time with both food and drinks.

One of my favorite things they do is the holiday pop ups. I've been for Mardi Gras and Christmas and both scenarios are so much fun!

This is a fun place for locals but tourists are welcome!

business.name: Charcoal
business.categories: American (New), Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text:
We met friends for dinner at Charcoal, our first time there. It was a pleasant place to hang for a few hours - tables spaced nicely, good lighting, and not noisy. I did find the chairs to be quite hard and unforgiving for a long evening though.
But the food was delicious, comfort foods with a modern spin. Generous portions, hot, attractive and flavorful. I especially enjoyed the Brussel sprouts Cesar salad. Nice service too. We look forward to returning in the daytime so we can enjoy the river view.

This is one of the very few restaurants whose bread is worth paying for.  Which you will do if you want it.  We did and loved it.  Being a sourdough home baker I recognized the skill of the baker and the quality of the ingredients and care with which it was handled and baked.  Delicious and highly recommend.  High hydration dough makes light, airy interior and the crust was perfect.

Our meals were delicious and well prepared.  Hangar steak, Nashville chicken, Rye radiatore pasta and a sea shell pasta in an adult version of Mac and cheese.  All were well received and the portions were generous.  The Brussels sprouts (?) Caesar was delicious and unique, very large portion enough to share easily.

Do not miss the cinnamon sugar donuts with caramel sauce which are prepared when ordered.  Plenty for four adults to share which we did.

I would definitely go back.  Only minor suggestion is; add home made onion rings to your menu maybe as an app.  Food cost would be low and profit high, if you can manage it.

It's an easy 5. BYO so you get about a half star just for that But you don't even need it. The room is great, overlooks the River. Service is totally professional, they know the menu and have opinions. the 2 of us  had 5 apps For our meal.   house made bread with a hard crust and quality butter...amazing. Shishito peppers...simple, perfect with a great dipping sauce. They have a Brussels caesar salad that is the best salad on Earth. Scallops app was on a skewer with a bbq squash relish...insanely good. Monkfish deep fry very good.

We arrived at 2pm for lunch and it took time until we were asked about drinks. We received them fast and ordered our food.   We ended up waiting almost 45 minutes until we got our lunch.  It seems like they only cook for 1 table at a time so we waited on 2 tables before us.  During this time the waitress never came over to see if we needed anything or to explain it would be soon.   We received our food finally and ate.   My smash burger was so thin it barely had any meat and the tuna melt almost had no Tina. We never saw our waitress again and She never came over to see if the food was OK or if we needed anything.   Finally after sitting for 10 minutes after finishing she came over with the check in hand and asked if we wanted anything else.   Never even asked how it was.  Overall poor service and a bad experience.   Will never come back and if anyone has limited time, definitely not the place to go.
Charcoal is our families favorite breakfast and lunch spot in Yardley!  The food is outstanding! Lovely people work there too!

Another great find.  We were heading home one Saturday evening and wanted to find a place to go out for dinner - used yelp to find this local place and glad we did.  Food was hot and delicious and service was great.  We will definitely be back

Charcoal was delicious.  The service was top notch.  And the view is awesome.  For starters we ordered the kung pao brussel sprouts & the skewered shrimp.  Yum!!  Entrees were......
1Rigatoni
2Barbecue jerk spiced cod
3Yardley hot chicken
4Smash burger
I would recommend any of them.  We were all happy leaving with full bellies and smiles.

Great place for breakfast. BYOB for mimosas and brioche donuts. WOW !
Went for dinner had fried chicken was ok. Pickles and lettuce are sides?  Put bread on the menu as a starter, and charge five bucks?? I don't think so.
We'll be back for breakfast for sure.

Great breakfasts, lunches and dinners. Donuts to die for. Bit pricey but definitely worth it! The only problem is the stairs as the restaurant is on the second floor. There is a service elevator but someone has to hike upstairs to the hostess and ask for it to be used. Not great parking so be prepared during peak hours.

So this is my first review on here. A coworker of mine told me I had to go here for a nice dinner. So we did and usually when I'm told I have to try a place I go in with super high expectations and I get let down. Not this time. I went in fully wanting to get the hanger steak but my wife said she wanted to and I wanted to order something different so i got the duck. Now I never had duck before but I figured why not. I was not let down at all, it came with gnocchi that melted in your mouth, a pea kosho and emperor mushrooms. I am not a fan of mushrooms at all but I damn bear licked my plate clean. I would and have recommended this place to others already and can't wait to go back!

We were boating on the river and thought that would be a good place to get a takeout. We had dined there previously and my memory was that the food is good.
Not sure what happened this time as we got the dishes they recommended: Brussels sprouts appetizer and steak and fried chicken for main courses. I wouldn't say they were bad but definitely not gourmet nearly $40 dish. The ingredients were good but it lacked execution.

They never cease to amaze us. Flavor Town galore with everything. Unique dishes with local ingredients. The brothers story is cool too. This limited burger is theeeeee beat burger o have had. Top 3 all time. I mean whole mouth was satisfied. Every tase bud was hit. From the Kung Pao brussel sprouts to the homemade cinnamon donut sunday. Off the hook. Service is always great. Love this place
Best restaurant in Yardley! You have to go try the Yardley Hot Chicken! Local spot with nice views of the river, and it's BYOB.
Was at Charcoal again today for breakfast with my Mother and my Wife. Again had delicious food and great service. Nice view,great atmosphere

Everything here is made with care and attention to detail.  There is a certain sprezzatura about their dishes - everything has clearly taken great pains to create and get perfect but they present it as everyday and unpretentious.  There is no dish that you could go wrong with here, and while the menu is small it allows them to offer perfection, as well as keep you out of the paradox of choice.  One specific thing I will recommend is to get the bread.  It is a menu item and not complimentary but it is homemade and delicious.  Great view of the river and BYOB.

Came here with my mother on Friday morning. The location and view are absolutely great!
The service was good, even if our waitress was a little curt with us. 
My mother ordered a platter that came with a bagel, cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers, hard boiled eggs, and tomatoes - she loved it. 
I got the breakfast sampler, with eggs, sausage, bacon, and french toast. The sausage was delicious. I prefer crispy bacon, so I was a little disappointed by the soft gummy texture it had. The french toast was fine, but I like mine a little more custardy and this one was very dry. 
I think, though, that Charcoal makes for a really great breakfast spot and is well worth visiting. I will likely be back!

Came to this cute BYOB for brunch to celebrate Father's Day.  It's located on River Road with a great view of the Delaware. The place is average size making sure everyone spaced out enough. Appreciate they have a elevator outside to accommodate those who struggle with steps.

Our party of 6 had reservations and was seated within a few minutes with a fairly nice view of the water. We brought a couple bottles of Prosecco and ordered OJ to make Mimosa.

Our server was great and found out later he played baseball with our son.  How ironic.

Our brunch entrees: Brichoe Doughnuts, Ice Coffee, Custom Omelets, Breakfast Sampler, Avocado Toast, Blueberry Pistachio Pancakes and Chickpea Caesar Salad.

This was our first time, but it won't be our last.  Thanks for making Father's Day memorable.
Lovely place,a little pricey. They make almost everything from scratch though so it's worth it. Service could be better
