Our favorite restaurant in town!  It never disappoints. We love the ever changing, seasonal modern menu. We always get the octopus starter, whatever version is on the menu and at least one pasta. We also love that the pastas can be ordered in 2 sizes.  The dishes have even held up well for take out.  Simple, clean restaurant with beautiful views and good background music.
A solid breakfast every time. Had the blueberry pistachio packages today-heavy but delicious. Make sure you remember to BYO.

Aaaammmazzzing breakfast!!!  We started off a birthday celebration day with breakfast here.  I was a bit skeptical bc I was only here once, quite a few years ago,  and have not been back bc I had a memorable bad experience and vowed never to return.  However, I heard the breakfast was very good and it was time to give it a try.  Never say never...right?
So, having said that I made a full 180 degree turn and I had the most delicious bagel and salmon (lox) platter with avocado, capers, and cut veggies.  It was a generous portion and fresh as could be.  It was the kind of meal that you can't wait to go back for.  Hubby raved about his breakfast also.  It had everything...eggs, french toast, potatoes, pork roll, bacon...a real manly breakfast.  Our guests enjoyed the avocado toast and eggs and omelet.  We brought our bottle of champagne and our waitress provided us with OJ and glasses.  Service was efficient, friendly and right on.  Such a perfect start for our birthday girl.

Its a nice place with good breakfast food. Close to the river with nice views.The only draw back is the stairs to get up there. Being recently injured and have a hard time walking up stairs was a challenge but worth it once up the steps.

Went here sporadically for dinner before COVID and have ordered some very very tasty pickup a few times during COVID.  The spaced out table arrangements look swell and I plan to take the wife for dinner very soon.

Note it is BYOB, but that is good. (I'd rather get a 13-20$ bottle of south american wine or something before hand and save a fortune over bottle service any day).  

The food is great! The menu changes regularly (also probably a good thing).

Cute location right on River rd with river views. Good mix of people eating here, including young couples and occasionally the well behaved child.  

Would highly recommend if you are looking for a dinner spot.

Never had their brunch, but I really want to!

Charcoal is one of my favorite breakfast spots in general! I've never had a better plate of pancakes in my life. Friendly servers and good coffee is also a plus. I even tried their smash burger once and it was amazing

Excellent food with beautiful views. Live that it's a BYOB, makes it affordable and delicious. COVID precautions were good with significant distancing between tables. Had the vodka rigatoni and my friend enjoyed the soft shell crab. Do not forget to order the bread, so worth it!

business.name: Arario Midtown
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Korean, Restaurants, Gluten-Free, Tapas/Small Plates, Tapas Bars, Asian Fusion, Cocktail Bars

reviews.text:
Love this place. 

Unique Asian fusion

Full bar .. great place for drinks and appetizers.  I'm not there today so I don't have a bunch of photos, but check out all that's been posted by others.   And some I've posted on my last visit

I've eaten here a number of times and can't  wait to go again

This is not a long review, but sometimes less is just as good


 Check this place out

Asian food is all about balancing. Manage the  Sweet , sour, salty, spicy and sometimes the gloriously stinky aromatics .

They do an incredible job and make very fat cocktails and charge low prices.

Staff was fun , helpful and  happy. I was there when they all got Christmas presents from the owners,  both owners were in place cooking and bartending .

This place deserves to be celebrated, it's damn good.

Came in for a impromptu lunch with my son.  Was greeted at the door by very friendly staff and seated immediately.  Service was great and the waitress brought my son's food out very fast. He is 3 so parents know how important this is. The atmosphere is very nice and relaxing. 
 The food was excellent. Great bulgogi bowl and the accompiaments were fabulous. Excellent choice for lunch or dinner. 
TJ was very nice and made great suggestions for menu items that were surprising and very tasty.

I've been here twice both on dates. The food has never failed and the staff is wonderful. If I could give this place 6 stars I would. It is exceptional. I have tried almost every single thing on the menu and I can say every one of them was good.  Covid friendly, seating easy, reservations easy. Parking is the only downside

Arario is by far my favorite place to go when I'm craving some seriously good Korean food. Not only can you find your favorite Korean classics such as bulgogi, bibimbop and tofu stews; they also offer a variety of fusion dishes that are very impressive. I highly recommend the bulgogi pasta, kimchee fries and hot pot bibimbap. I was also pleasantly surprised that they carried my favorite brand of soju, Soon Hari here and the peach and strawberry flavors are a must try! Their chocolate lava cake is perfectly decadent and not too sweet and is topped and is the perfect dessert to end your meal. 

Arario never disappoints and I'm always looking forward to returning!

Such a hidden gem! This fusion cuisine was so delicious! I highly recommend trying the kimchi fries! My friends who I was with had never tried kimchi before and were amazed at the flavor in this appetizer. I will definitely be back to try more items on the menu.

I don't know what the hype is about this place. We chose this restaurant based on its almost 5-star review on yelp. The food was mediocre at best. Coming from SF bay area I have eaten much better Korean food which is on another scale throughout the bay area. The bulgogi (its signature dish) had a wired taste I don't like and beef is not chewy. The seafood tofu soup was so-so and didn't had the intense flavor or silky tofu texture I anticipated from a tofu soup. Some mussels in the soup also did not taste very fresh. Overall I cannot rate this restaurant over 3 star. It's ok for a meal to fill your stomach but don't expect a delicious Korean treat (at least when compared to the bay area).

We made a reservation for Christmas Eve at 4:30.  We had eaten ourselves to obolivian and finished by 5:15!  The service and food were amazing (had mandu, and traditional plates of bulgogi, pork bulgogi and Galbi).  Being Korean and Korean being my absolute favorite....I haven't yet gotten behind the "fusion" side of things but everything here was super yum!  Even the Banchan (sides) were super fresh and delicious!

I will definitely be back!  

Well done Arario!  Well done!
Some of the best food I've had in Reno yet. The kimchee fries and Brussel sprouts are insane
Defiantly 5 Star! Everything food, service and presentation is at next level. Give it a try they know what they are doing. reasonable price not expensive

Visited Reno for the weekend and found this great joint. Located on the second floor, this place had a great vibe and the service was welcoming.  They were able to fit us in for a table for 4 on a Saturday night.  My family and I tried the octopus salad (8/10), galbi beef (9/10), chicken wings (9/10) and chicken bulgogi (10/10).  The food had great flavor and was provided in a timely manner
Always good food and a refreshing change from the same generic restaurants all over town. Always great service and great food

Let me start by saying I have only made one positive review in Reno, this far. It was also an Asian fusion spot. With that said, Arario has won my heart as the winner of the two. 

RSVP is super easy thru OpenTable. They are open from 11am for those of you who don't want to hit the crowds. Our original reservation was at 8pm but we got hungry earlier and they were able to accommodate us with a table even though we were told only bar seats may be available. 

Service is fast and friendly. The other two in my group had drinks and they were happy with them. 

We basically ordered everything on the menu (or maybe 1/3) so here's the run down with any commentary needed. 

Kimchee fries 8/10
Edamame 10/10 
Beef tartare 10/10 almost ordered seconds
Chicken wings 9/10 get half & half for the sauce so you can try both
Fire cracker 6/10 (for me, personally) my friends loved it but it was way too spicy for my taste, also I'm a wuss
Grilled octopus salad 9/10 
Beef Galbi 10/10 also I had the leftovers cold and they were still amazing
Jap chae 7/10 pretty good but lacked flavor compared to the rest of the food

Only thing was the bathroom is downstairs and the keypad to unlock it was more complicated that I was sober for. But that has nothing to do with the food/service, so, still 5 stars. 

If you're in town, do it.
Atmosphere is really nice and cozy. Food is always amazing. The staff is also always very kind and catering to us.

Delicious food. The idea of a Korean fusion was very thoughtful because most of the dishes tasted very good. The bulgogi cheesesteak was top 2 along with the korean skort ribs. As for appetizers, the wings are a must. They were crunchy on the outside and extremely juicy on the inside. The service was a bit slow,  we waited about 30 mins after we finished eating to get our check. Overall very good restaurant

DELICIOUS EVERYTHING! fantastic service, cool location, and incredible food& drinks
making a reservation was easy and they were pretty much on time
The sake and shortribs were delicious! I cant wait to go back and try more!
Parking can be tough because of the location so plan ahead.
Its upstairs
In the same location as noble pie :)

My love for Arario is not unknown, but as a creature of habit I rarely deviate from my absolute favorites at one of my absolute favorite restaurants. Fortunately I actually have a lot of dishes I consider favorites here, which allows me to have diverse experiences each time, but every now and again I branch out and try something new. Part of me hopes it won't displace a current favorite and a little part of me kinda hopes it does! 

So this time I tried the Bulgogi power bowl, with spicy pork, mixed greens, delicious veggies, rice, cheese and some special sauces. I normally stick with just the spicy pork Bulgogi, which is a more "pure" or unadulterated version of the dish I ordered. 

While I enjoyed the combination of flavors and textures on the power bowl, I really just wanted the pork and banchan. Personally, I prefer to keep my Korean flavors separate and distinct, then mix and match them as I see fit. The power bowl is for someone that wants several unique flavor and texture combinations within one dish that come together. 

This time around my current faves won out. I'm not sad. There's plenty more to explore!

Seriously...WOW.  My family and I were looking for our first restaurant with Korean cuisine, celebrating my daughter's birthday.  From the moment we walked in, the hostess was pleasant and welcoming.  Our server (Marco?) was excellent and patient.  We brought our 2-year old (yes, terrible-two's are a THING) and even though we was well-behaved, our server brought out a drink for my son in a very cool cup that my son loved.  Nice touch - and it wasn't anything I asked for.  Tip to restaurant owners:  parents notice these things!  The food was sooooo perfect - hot, and it didn't take 30 minutes to receive.  The kimchi fries and the brussel sprouts were the perfect "hint" to what was to come with our entrees.  I ordered the spicy squid (perfection) and my family ordered a variety of popular dishes.  The birthday lava cake was a VERY nice touch and I just can't say enough great things about Arario.  GREAT service, prices were surprisingly NOT over-the-top and the food is honestly the best part of the experience!  Highly highly recommend!

Hamburgers are good except there are nothing very Asian about them. They taste like any hamburger that you can find in a good pub restaurant. Buns are toasted and fries are crispy. Our meals come with some very small sides like kimchi, which were pretty much the only Korean thing we ate.

Don't order the house seafood udon, which lacks flavor and was watery. It tasted like those packaged udon you'd find in grocery stores and doctored a bit with some frozen seafood. 

Friendly and fast service.

My first impression of Arario is impeccable. I've been searching for a good gluten-free restaurant that isn't Thai food for a while and Arario checks all the boxes! The decor is modern and clean, with really soft modern lantern lights. The yuzu mojito was a great cocktail- super refreshing.

We ordered and tried a little bit of everything which I highly recommend as every dish was spectacular. For appetizers Brussels sprouts, edamame and chicken wings. The edamame were flavored with garlic and Parmesan which gave it that extra kick, and the Brussels were full, juicy and delicious, the sauce was fire. Chicken wings were good too the meat fell off the bone easily and the spicy flavored ones were on point.

For mains I chose the beef bibimbap, short ribs galbi, bulgogi bowl and japchae noodles. Everyone agreed the bulgogi bowl was out of this world next level delicious. It was definitely the highlight dish and I am already craving more of it. The japchae noodles I also really enjoyed, I haven't seen a sweet potato noodle used too often and I really appreciated the delicate texture and slight sweetness of the dish- well done! I liked the short rib galbi however there was a little too much bone in the dish which made it less appealing and hard to get the meat out. The bibimbap was also really good!

My only dislike was that to get to the bathroom you have to go on a long journey outside, down the stairs and through a different entrance and enter a code I mean it was like mission impossible to find it! And if it gets too cold I don't even want to think about slipping and falling on those janky metal stairs. 

Food was incredible and I will be back to try more off the menu!
Came in for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised. Every single bite was perfect and delicious. Will definitely be back back!

I finally got to try this place for a work lunch and was totally impressed with the food. Kimchi Fries, Wings and Hot Pot Bulgogi Bowl were all delicious and gluten free! 
I'll have to go back to get pictures and try more of their offerings, but their menu is diverse and provides many options. Service was okay; the server seemed new and wasn't well versed with the menu and we waited a while to have our check processed.
Definitely will be back and highly recommend the food. I'm already craving the bulgogi!
Consistently good food, nice atmosphere.  A nice midtown spot. Only issue is needing to climb stairs.

Arario is a great place to go to if you want Asian fusion style. The atmosphere was pleasant, not loud at all (maybe because there weren't really kids and mostly adults). The food were great, everything was delicious. The staff was amazing and on point, meaning if your drink was low, they refill it and your plates were empty, they'd take away before the next course comes. I would definitely recommend this place again and go back!
I never get tired of eating here! Whether you're in the mood for Korean or Korean fusion I am always excited by their menu! The atmosphere is lovely and the appetizers are all amazing!

business.name: Blind Owl Brewery
business.categories: Beer Gardens, Restaurants, Food, Breweries, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Gastropubs, Nightlife

reviews.text:
I was a fan of the lemonade blueberry alcoholic drink!

Food was okay. Had pretzels and cheese and chicken nachos. The same cheese was used for both and I would have liked a variation. 

I'm sure just as with many establishments right now, the restaurant is understaffed. I am totally aware and understand that and try to be overly kind and patient as I know the staff is working hard with less. However any request we made or ordered was met with an annoyed look from our server. I could tell she was exhausted but there was nothing we could do or say to help turn her mood around.

If I found a dish or item I liked, I'd order it to go or get my drink directly from the bar instead.

There is something about that blueberry basil lemonade that's so good! Food has always been correct and tasty, their fries are delicious. I love being there in the summertime when you can be outside and playing the games too!

Blind Owl is located at the corner of 62nd and Binford in the Binford Plaza on the south end. This brewpub is still one of our favorite restaurants and my husband enjoys many of the 26 beers on tap (some rotating) plus the full bar. 

As you enter, the hostess stand is directly in front of you and the family side dining area is to the right with the FCFS bar area to the left. The seasonal patio, weather permitting, must be seated by the hostess. Large umbrellas protect you from the sun at most tables. Play bocce ball, cornhold or try your hand with the giant jenga game.

The menu is diverse with something for most, IMHO. The two jumbo pretzels are warm and soft served with a beer cheese dip and the Quesadillas are extremely popular. The Chipotle Wings are terrific and the Elote Soup (corn chowder) is my favorite soup. Tenderloins, Peppered BLT and the Smashburger are a few of the sandwiches my husband enjoys. The Pot Roast is tender and a generous portion with carrots potatoes, celery and onions. Their Chicken Pot Pie has a flaky puff pastry top and nice selection of veggies with a good flavor but needs a little more cornstarch for a thicker sauce.

Several Artisan Pizzas are offered which looked good but I've never ordered. The couple sitting next to us recommended the flaky Salmon and the Fish and Chips.

The servers are great, personable and even with a crowd drinks arrive quickly. Our meals were prompt and brought from the kitchen by a runner as soon as they were ready. Used dishware is removed timely and it's an atmosphere filled with laughter and fun. Give them a try sometime.

I ended up going there on Sunday Nov 21st, 2021 to watch the Indianapolis Colts game against New York Buffalo Bills. The restaurant is located in the Binford Blvd area. The restaurant wasn't crowded, there are no stairs to enter the restaurant, and I sat at the bar. Blind Owl Brewery is known for it's beer, and you can purchase the beer growler to take home. For, my lunch I had the honey Wasabi wings(10), fries no salt and a coke to drink. It was a great game, wings good, and with good company. Blind Owl Brewery has plenty of TVs to watch NFL, NBA, and even college sports. So, whenever you're wanting to watch the next Colts game, or probably a college game go to Blind Owl Brewery. I forgotten to mention that the honey Wasabi wings weren't hot at all, but a slight sweet taste to the wings.

It's nice and great space with excellent food but the waitresses working Sunday were just not good. Our waitress didn't even check on us and didn't even ask if we wanted another drink, she just gave us checks. It felt rushed and we weren't even done yet. Another was definitely having a bad day, which I get but definitely they killed our vibe. I'll probably not come back but it's not bad to try out at least once but maybe only 2 people haha.

Blind owl is quickly becoming One of our favorite go to spots when we are just east of Castleton. The service is always great, everyone is so kind and helpful, and the food has been awesome! I've recently been there twice in the same week, wants to grab appetizers and drinks and the other time to grab lunch with a coworker. Both times the service was wonderful, very attentive, and always sensitive to the fact that we were in a little bit of a time crunch. All of the food we ordered had great flavor! I think my favorite thing I've had there recently is the rose pork eggrolls, the sauce and the balance of the eggroll is awesome! I also really enjoyed their extensive beer list, and it made the trips even more fun to try the different beers. Their outdoor area is beautiful, and somewhere I enjoy sitting both during the day and in the evening.
This place is awesome. They have great beers and the food is just as good. I come here every time in in the area.  You won't be disappointed.

We arrived on a Saturday afternoon, around 2p, after the lunch rush. It was a lovely day so we wanted to sit outside, but were told, "There are no seats that are not in the sun." Understood, but there was an open table just outside the kitchen door (the table people usually try to avoid) that had obviously been occupied recently, so it wasn't a "covid spacer table". 
I asked the hostess if we could wait for that table to be cleaned and she said "Sure. If you are ok with the kitchen." 
Out of nowhere, came a woman you yelled, "I TOLD YOU no more seats outside! Don't you listen?" I can only assume this woman was her supervisor. The confrontation was right in front of us and SO unprofessional it was disturbing. 
I said, "We don't have to sit there if that is a problem" but our hostess apologetically said, "It's ok. I'll clean the table."
The lunch went well, other than the "angry employee" kept hovering around our table. She never said anything to us, let alone an apology. 
The food and the drinks were good and I would like to return to the brewery but that level of uncontrolled angry is stopping me. If this type of yelling is standard issue during non-rush hours, I sure don't want to be there when this chick is stressed.

There was a good selection of local beers which I enjoyed; however, the food was not the greatest. I don't mind if the food isn't excellent at a brewery as long as the vibe is good. The vibe was also just okay. Maybe it would be better on a friday night as opposed to a monday evening. There were plenty of food options which was surprising. My friends got the chipotle chicken and the wings and I got the buffalo chicken wrap. There was nothing special about any of the foods we got. It's okay if you're in the area, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to go here again.

Stay away!  Paper cuts would be more enjoyable than subjecting yourself to the terrible service at this over-priced mess masquerading as a brewery/eatery. Went  in on a Sunday.  Only 5 or 6 tables occupied.  Sat for 5 minutes as multiple servers walked by, ignoring us.  Finally went to host and asked to be served...she looked up from her game of Angry Birds long enough to say "Someone will probably be with you in a minute."  Seriously?  Then sat 5 more minutes with absolutely no service...not even a drink order....as two servers again walked by and ignored us.  Got up and left. Said "See ya" as I walked by the server (who this time did not even look up from who phone and said only "bye".

Typical pub food, nothing to write home about.  Got the shrimp tacos which came with chips and salsa.  The tacos each had two rather small shrimp on them which didn't have much flavor.  Not being a beer drinker I did find a really great cocktail the Lavender Pineapple Margarita...yum!

Worst service I've ever had. Came for my bday dinner and I wish I hadn't. They forgot 3 people's meals, and made ZERO effort to make it right. They brought 2 of the meals 20 min after the first meals were delivered and we told them they forgot, and somehow still managed to forget my mom's dinner. So she waited an additional 30 min for her meal, which she then took to go bc everyone was long finished by that time. Not one time did the server apologize for the inconvenience or offer to make in right. In fact he never came back to ask how we were, to offer refills or anything. And he had the nerve to charge us without comping a single thing, despite the fact that 3 people had to eat after the rest of the group had finished. We had to ask him to remove a meal from the check, which is ridiculous. It was the worst bday meal experience I have ever had and I will not return. Blind owl needs to have their servers take a training course on how to apologize when they make a mistake, instead of making it seem like we did something wrong by asking for the meals we ordered, 45 min after the fact. Straight incompetence.

Met a few friends here (8/13/21) for a small get together for our rare 90s cars and had a very good experience! Food was amazing, service was great and the overall atmosphere was nice to be around. I got the chicken tenders which were very good and the others food looked and they said it was amazing as well. Drinks were also good as well.

I've been here several times.  They have their own beer and then guest taps. They have a fairly large area with seating outside and then bocca ball pits.  I was told they have a league. They also have live music on weekends.   I ordered Avacado tacos and fries with 3 Floyd's cheer time.  I loved the beer, but how do you go wrong with a cold 3 Floyd's.  I had not tried this before so I had 2. The French fries were excellent.  The tacos were a little bland.  I ate one, then opted to just eat the fried avocado.  I would suggest soaking the slaw mix in vinegar/sugar or something.  And then do something with the sauce on top to give more flavor.  As I mentioned, been here before and enjoyed the food. The four stars reflects the previous visits.

We've been to Blind Owl a handful of time. We came on a Saturday afternoon expecting the place to be packed, overall the patio was busy but definitely not inside. We ordered the none the wiser IPA and comb sweet comb brown ale. Both were alright, nothing crazy different about them. We also ordered the hot pretzels which came with two dipping sauces; mustard and beer cheese. The sauces both made this basic pretzel a knockout. We debated between the pretzel and the nachos but after seeing how runny the beer cheese was, we wouldn't recommend the nachos as thats what comes on top. It seems like it would be a hot mess.

I will never go here again! We wanted to try something new so we made the trip to Blind Owl. From the moment we walked in, we could tell it would not be a good experience. We waited for several minutes before we were greeted and finally seated. We understand and expect there are some delays due to staffing right now but we saw plenty of people working. After we were finally seated, we watched server after server walk by, look at us, and continue. After 15 minutes of sitting there and not even greeted or bringing us water or telling us they would be with us soon,, we got up and left. As I exited, I told the front door person no one has acknowledged us or waited on us and got, "sorry" and then they went back to wiping menus I believe. It didn't seem to surprise them nor did they seem to care. I would not recommend going to this establishment.

Good food, beer cheese was AMAZING. Amazing atmosphere and great drink selection. However, service was a JOKE. Our waitress maybe had 4 tables , on a fairly busy night, and she spent more time in the back than checking on us. Our food came out wrong, but she never came back to check so we couldn't even send it back. Tried to ask one of the other waitress to grab our server, never did. Asked for the manager, and had to flag her down myself. Beer we ordered came out at least 20 mins after we ordered it. Best tip if you go eat there, just order to go and eat at home.

My boyfriend and I had a great experience here. Our server was great. She explained the beer menu in detail and we shared a flight before deciding on some pours. Overall we liked 3/4 beers that we tried. 

For dinner I had the chicken tinga tacos. Very flavorful.  They were served with a side of chips and salsa.  I really only ate the chips because the salsa tasted like ketchup to me. My boyfriend had a burger that he really enjoyed. For his side he chose the roasted potatoes. They were my favorite part of the food we tried. They were nicely seasoned. 

Great beer selection and good size food menu as well. I would recommend.

I went here with a group of 8 for dinner, we ordered the pretzel to start and I had the chicken tacos with the lavender margarita. 

The service was pretty slow but the waitress was very nice! 

Listen, I know my tacos pretty well... These chicken tacos were VERY bland and dry... I had to add extra salt for my tacos and the only flavor coming through was a weird tomato paste. Overall literally the worst chicken taco I've ever had... And I'm not even coming at it with high expectations, they just had zero taco flavor, or flavor at all. 

But my lavender margarita was pretty good, I had never heard of it before and was pleasantly surprised. It was refreshing and pairs well with the lime citrus.

Mediocre food, Ignorant staff.  Walked in and sat at the bar. There were two servers and the bartender deep in conversation at the end of the bar. So deep in fact that we were completely ignored for 3-4 minutes. Just as we were about to leave the bartender finally noticed us and came over.  Ordered burgers and beers and they were Applebee's level quality but premium priced.  Beers were ok but certainly not worth it. As we tried to simply relax and finish our drinks we had another interaction with an ignorant staff member, this time the shift manager.  Easy to say we'll never be back. There are a dozen better choices in the same area.

Food was only okay - kinda pricey for what it is. We had burgers and they're nothing to write home about. Beers were good. Weird thing.. they had open tables outside because there was a chance of rain and they didn't want to sit anyone out there. So we cashed out at the bar and said we'd finish our beers outside and then the hostess came out and told us we couldn't sit there. Even when we said we were just finishing up beers and would leave. They have bocce ball set up so you'd think they'd encourage people spending money at the bar and hanging out. I guess not? Needless to say we probably won't be back. There's plenty of other great patios.

I had been to blind owl in the past, and had thought their food and atmosphere were good, but recently I had heard that they had a new menu from a new chef that had concocted some scrumptious wings.  Well the Indy Wing Club had to check out to confirm they were the real deal...and wow were we blown away.  They have a mixture of dry rub and sauced wings to choose from.  We had heard the dry rub were phenomenal, so we decided on two dry rub flavors (chipotle & Nashville hot) and one sauced Wasabi Honey.  The Chipotle was a mild dry rub, but the spice was well coated on the wing and it had a bold flavor.  The  Nashville Hot wings were equally as delicious, but lead to some slightly watery eyes, so if hot and spicy is not your thing you might want steer clear.  The Wasabi Honey was a recommendation from our waitress and those were slightly spicy as well, but the honey balanced the Wasabi out nicely so really we think even those that don't like spice would appreciate the flavor.  Ultimately what we wanted to see is well flavored wild with a perfectly crispy wing, and blind_owl_brewery did just that.  #indywings #indywingclub #chickenwing #IWCwantwingey

I've been to Blind Owl many times over the years with friends etc. Their IPA & DIPAs are really delicious here. Love the beer garden area & inside bar. 

I recently was here Friday (6/4). The person I was with it was his first time here. We enjoyed the fun atmosphere, delicious beers & great weather. The only downside for me (and reason for 3 stars), I asked the waitress to find out if their pizza crust was dairy free ( no milk). She right away shared with me about their gluten crust. I said well is it dairy free? She said she didn't know and I told her I don't have a gluten issue, just dairy (no milk). I just want to double check before ordering a pizza. She seemed annoyed by the questioning & I asked if she'd ask the chef in the kitchen. She leaves to ask and was gone maybe 5-6min and comes back stating no clear answer if the crust is dairy free just saying "As I suspected it's likely 99% sure there is dairy in both the crusts, sorry". I made sure she was aware I wasn't talking about eggs, just milk and she continued to say she thought both crusts had milk so I shouldn't order. -These types of conversations are frustrating to someone who has to double check before ordering all the time and it's respectful of your patrons to find out an answer to their question over assuming you're right and taking a guess. It would be nice to know on the menu what is safe to order or not for people with food allergies. Or educate your wait staff on ingredients used would be super helpful!

First time to ever post a review, but felt compelled to hopefully get the current five spiced salmon with lentils dish removed from the menu! It was terrible. No flavor and so watery. I choked it down, because I've worked in the restaurant industry before, and didn't want to be rude and send back. I was so sad spending $18 on it, please think about removing it from your menu so no one else has to endure the sadness I felt!

Great little spot right outside the heart of Broad Ripple. Stopped in on a Friday night and it was super busy. I had called ahead to put my name on the waitlist so luckily we didn't have to wait too long. Their patio is absolutely gorgeous and perfect for the summer nights ahead. 

I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were good but each taco only had 2 shrimp in it. I know it's their take on street tacos so they are smaller but after two bites, I had a lot of cabbage and onions but no shrimp left. Salsa was great and the dish was very filling as it came with chips as well. We had also ordered a burger and fries and their fries were amazing! I debated on getting a side of them instead of chips and salsa and regretted it once I tried the fries! So good. Great spot for drinks and hanging out with a group of friends.

business.name: Porta
business.categories: Italian, Wine Bars, Bars, Restaurants, Pizza, Breakfast & Brunch, Nightlife

reviews.text: scam alert, this family business is a scam, do not order, they will take your money and tell you they need your funds for their production for other back other,  file a complaint with ohio general attorney and consumer affairs to shut these frauds down!!, after they get your money they tell you its on back order for 30 to 60 days meantime trying to convince you to spend more however the email they send says 3-7 days for shipping!

I wrote a scathing review of this place (a pre-covid visit) and realized today that for some reason Yelp decided my experience was not worthy and deleted it? Long story short my food and service were both terrible, but whatever. It doesn't matter now if I tell you not to get the carbonara pizza at all costs since I don't know if it's on the post-covid menu, it doesn't matter if I tell you the bartender was literally on his phone the whole time I was there and I couldn't get a drink even though it was slow, since that guy was probably fired or quit or he's dead or something - I'm just stinging at the injustice of my review removal so I'm re-reviewing for posterity. But if the carbonara pizza is still on the menu, don't do it. We deserve to live in a world where no one hurts carbonara like that.

Okay first off you need to try this place if you already haven't. We ordered their meatballs which I have to say were some of the best I've had in a long time especially the sauce it was perfection. We ordered a vegetarian pizza that was SO delicious the wood fired crust was to die for and the vodka gnocchi which was also 10/10. The cocktails are unique and are worth a try highly recommend for a date night or a dinner with friends.
Moving from NY to PA this is my absolute go to for pizza. Such fresh ingredients and the crust is perfectly chewy. If you don't like this pizza then you have no taste buds. Bravo Porta keep it up

Not good. Food is mediocre and place is poorly run. Terrible experience.


Don't know what is worse the food or the management. Awful. Awful. Awful.

They fired their entire pre COVID staff VIA INSTAGRAM POST. This place is trash. No respectable business/owner would do this. I hope it goes under. 

*i have never been employees by porta nor do I have close relationships with anyone who was*

Sat at the bar. 
Bartender was extremely rude and disrespectful which is why I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5. I would give 3 but the food was excellent. 

Food was delicious and the Place is roomy, I'll definitely go back to order anything I haven't tried on the menu. 
Everything is great! They just need to work on their service and treating customers with respect.

Sooooo good! We've only had the 14 1/2 pizza(without cheese) and it's amazing. I also love the ambiance. The White Door is my favorite cocktail and Toni, the hostess is a sweetheart! 10/10 would recommend.

I loves the cool vibe of Porta. We got the 14 1/2 pizza and it was amazing. My boyfriend got the calamari and it was eh he said. The cocktail I had was also delicous. They have a good selection of beers too. We will be back!

We came here at 11pm for drinks and dancing, so I can't speak on the quality of food or service. There was a good selection of drinks and even though it was really busy when we arrived, the bartenders were pretty attentive. The atmosphere of Porta is cool and unique, and it's an exceptionally big space considering the location in Philly. When we got there they were transitioning into their dancing phase of the night, so there were tons of big dudes in black security uniforms moving tables and being extremely aggressive about everyone moving out of the way. The DJ was great and I think did a good job of reading the crowds in terms of energy level and music to play. I'd definitely come back another weekend, and maybe even come earlier to try out the food beforehand.

The chef needs to pulll his head out.   It's a pizza place that serves pasta.  We asked to add and change something on a pizza and got a hard no.  My daughter ordered the pepperoni and was forced to take the really spicy pizza with pepperoni.  The pizza was way tooooo spicy - tone it down and offer red chili powder.   What's you deal chef.   Can't you make the basic pizza with pepperoni.   Do you feel more special since it is over spiced ?????   That all said, pizza has a great burnt crust and thin like a true Italian pizza.  Salads were good.  Little heavy in the dressing but if that's what the chef wants - guess what - that's what we got. 

Fire the chef.  Realize you got a good crust and solid greens.  It's not hard to offer a variety on a pizza and get some flexibility on the salads.

Well, I'll start with the positive... the food isn't bad. I enjoyed the pizza.  That's where it ends. We were seated upstairs for my friends birthday and it was like a sauna. Really uncomfortable. But we let that go and we order. There were two people who ordered titos and club but my one friend specifically asked for house vodka. She specified this multiple times. We didn't have enough silverware for the table so we had to keep asking when we actually could find our server. I asked for a regular seltzer as my next drink, usually this is free of charge. I wish I would have been prompted to the fact it was $3.50 a glass. Seemed obnoxious when we get the bill.  On top of that she sneakily charged my friend for titos and not house vodka and the waitress fought with her about what she ordered. We were also told we weren't able to get separate checks or use more than 4 cards to split. The whole experience was anything but smooth and the heat was not making anything better.

When I think  of boutique pizza parlors, I have higher expectations than this place. Though pizza wasn't necessarily bad, it was just basic. $17 for a pepperoni pizza with a fancy name. I enjoyed the white pizza more, and the ricotta cheese appetizer was yummy, but needed more bread on the side! We also dined our on Valentine's Day with another couple, but we ate late around 9pm to avoid the crowds. It didn't seem busy when we were there, but our server was MIA through dinner, and when we were finishing up, the employees started dragging chairs to the corners of the room to make a dance floor. At least  pick up the chairs or wait til we're leaving for polites sake!
College kids vomiting in the corner. Underage thots all over the place. Sweaty, uncomfortable dance floor. No thanks

There are a lot of better pizza places. 

For our meal my wife selected ACORN SQUASH & 
WINTER BETTY. $10 for the squash and $17 for the pizza. Squash was worth it and the pizza was not. 

I really liked how thin the pizza was. However there was supposed to be a creamy goat cheese which I did not taste. The pizza also was not the least bit bit filling for $17.  There wasn't much on it. 

No complaints about the squash. 
No real cohesion in the look of the place. 
We also got desert which was pretty good. 

Overall I don't regret trying it but I don't plan on going again. In the world of specialty pizza there is a lot of better places to choose from.

EDIT: After writiNg my review I read some others. Looks like this place is notorious for being light on the toppings. I thought maybe my pizza was just a mistake.

Do not go here!! My friends and I went on a Saturday night and that was our mistake. We were dancing and having a good time, and I got separated from the group some how. I was standing there trying to look for my tall friend and all of a sudden the security guard says you're out and 5 guys are escorting me out! When I got outside I went up to a different group of security and a manager and said excuse me why did I just get kicked out and the manager said one second I will find out for you. The manager  comes back and says sorry it must have been a misunderstanding if you want to go back in then I will buy you a round. F that! Then, my friends phone got stolen! This place stinks.

I ordered takeout for dinner. After trying the phone at least 6 times, i finally got through after calling Brick Wall Tavern, the affiliated bat attached to the restaurant. Got through to the host and learned that they do not do takeout orders on weekend evenings. Went in to order and wait for the food. Ordered a Duck Hunt and a Snawzeech for takeout. Duck hunt 7/10 and as ordered. Snawzeech was missing the cashew ricotta which was the whole reason i ordered the pie. 4/10. No cheese to cut the pepper. Essentially 1/3 of the toppings were missing. Very disappointed. 

Ordered the Snawzeech a while back at the Jersey City location and it was great. 9/10. 

Only saving grace was the mushroom Arancini. 9/10 even as takeout.
Pretty solid brunch setup, and fairly priced. I got the crab Benedict which was fire and the perfect amount of food. Mimosa carafes also a perk, but sipped through them so quickly

The food was really good. The atmosphere was really cool and trendy. The service left something to be desired. We got there when it wasn't very busy and had a reservation since it was restaurant week. Our server  was nice but a bit aloof. I asked for an unsweetened tea. She brought the tea and left. It was sweet. I waited almost 100 minutes before she returned to the table for me to let her know and then she asked someone about it and apParenty they don't ever have a sweet and unsweet options it's just one or the other which I thought was dumb. In any case, despite no tea for me the food portions were humongous and good. We chose the kale salad and the plate with the homemade  ricotta and  mozzarella. The ricotta was to die for. SO creamy and delicious. I could have put it on everything. The salad was truly enough to feed like 6-8 people. We left most of it there and we still had plenty. The pizza was good. I got the 14 1/2. It was pretty spicy but I liked how it had bits of the homemade ricotta on it. Also humongous  to each get a pizza so quite a bit leftover there as well. To finish we had the Nutella pizza and the budino. The Nutella pizza was  ok but I thought the make up was a bit weird. I would have fathered regular pizza crust and the Nutella but the sandwiched it between thin and crispy dough. Some of it was burnt. I'd maybe come  back here but nothing I tried really was super special.

Meh and double meh. Tried the red pizza this time (meatball) and not only did it take a full 20 minutes to come out of the kitchen, it was dry and mediocre.

Not to mention, this time I noticed that the restaurant is exceedingly loud and decorated like a graffiti-covered alleyway in Rome, creating an overall atmosphere of chaos.

With restaurants like Zavino and Barbuzzo around the corner, I won't be back.
I look for the good in vegan/vegetarian options in Philly but Porto is not one of them. The food is mediocre and the atmosphere is loud and echoing. I will not return.

Huge spacious venue in the heart of Philly. Jacky was great she was attentive and extremely polite. She checked on us throughout our time to make sure everything was taken care of. The vibe is excellent, great decor and also perfect lowkey but big and open place to watch sports. Will be a regular here.

On Saturday evening, one of my dear friends drove from NJ for dinner in the city. We decided to give Porta a try as both of us were in the mood for pizza. We were greeted by a hostess who informed us of the wait time and directed us to the bar. We each ordered one of their signature cocktails- the Red Door and the White Door. The drinks were delicious and before we knew it, our table was ready. We opted to split the Formaggi cheese plate and the 14  1/2 pizza. The cheese plate had a variety of Italian cheeses, however, I would have liked more bread. The 14  1/2 pizza was an excellent recommendation by the waitress, but was a bit spicy so have your water ready! I certainly would dine at Porta again- trendy atmosphere, tasty food, and friendly service.

I've been wanting to try Porta for awhile, so I made a reservation for 730pm on a Saturday night. When we got there, they told us 15-20 minutes. It was a busy night before the holidays, so we grabbed a drink at the bar. After the time passed, the hostess looked at me like she'd never seen me before and said she'd check if they had any tables available. Isn't the point of a reservation to avoid that? We decided to just eat at the bar and the manager bought us a round for the issue. 

We started with the kale salad which was great. Also ordered the Porta Porta "pizza" and a double portion of a pasta dish. When the "pizza" came out we were sure they had our order confused. What they called a pizza, and 3 of us were expecting to have a slice or 2 of, was actually a calzone cut into about 5 very tiny squares, with no cheese or filling in the end pieces. 

Time had passed and we asked if the pasta was coming. The bartender look confused and was frantically on the register and said it went to the wrong table. Clearly, he had never put it in but was able to get us a plate in about 5-10 minutes. My first bite I pulled out a short blonde hair (and there were no blondes with us). He brought it back and got us a new one and comped it, but the meal was already ruined. Side note: the double portion is served in a huge plate but the actual serving size is that of a child's portion. 

And, as we were finishing, us and the ladies next to us were told more than once that the stools that we were on we're going to be removed soooo basically get up. It turns into more of a club at night, but I've never heard of bar stools needing to be removed and definitely not in such a rude fashion. I like to give places a second chance, but I'm not sure if Porta is worth it.

Lackluster service and average pizza.  Not somewhere I'd recommend.  You can get better "artisanal" pizza and a dozen other places in the city from a staff that would actually be pleasant to deal with

business.name: Rue 127
business.categories: Bars, American (New), Nightlife, Desserts, Restaurants, Food

reviews.text:
This is the only one star review I've ever given.

Listen to the other reviews about bad service. I came here on my birthday excited to try the fried cupcakes. First, the waiter seemed annoyed that we didn't have a reservation despite the place being empty. He then spent a few minutes on the computer seating us as we stood around awkwardly. The menu looked good, but it took us over 10 minutes to get water, and we tried to ask him for drinks but he walked away. Maybe he didn't hear us? Looking around, we realized no one else had been helped either...and there were only two other tables seated. After 10 more minutes, we left. 

Three staff were hanging out in the kitchen but didn't help anyone. The worst part was how the staff didn't seem clumsy, but genuinely rude. They seemed annoyed that were eating there. I felt bad leaving, but it was an overall uncomfortable experience- and we were never gonna be helped!

I've actually NEVER experienced service this bad! EVER!!
The service and food were outstanding. It so nice to see table clothes in a quant mid-city setting. We can't wait to get back.

Always a good meal when we go to Rue 127. As a resident of the neighborhood, I am kicking myself for not discovering this place sooner. Several visits have continued to impress - notable dishes are the incredibly creamy risotto, the seared salmon, and the fried curry fish. When I imagine a cozy neighborhood restaurant, this is the place that pops up into my mind. The menu is one of the most creative I've come across - the Asian/Indian/New Orleans fusion is really interesting.

So, this was NOT our first time at Rue but it was certainly the worst experience at Rue.   
My wife and I dined there for Valentine's day dinner.   The menu was a "fixed menu".   While the flavor of most if the items was good, the portions were embarrassing small.   A single oyster, a single ravioli, a small cup of soup, miniture portions of cheese and grilled fish was the meal... The entire ordeal took over 2 hours....
The experience was over rated!!!

Went here on Dec 29th 2017...I was a little  concerned about the service reviews, and I must say they were pretty  much on point.  While the servers were very nice, everything took too long to come to the table....Drinks, bread, appetizers. The appetizers were on the kitchen, but bread and drinks was front  of the house. The other issue was portion size...see pictures.  My wife had the duck gumbo to start, which she loved, but the temperature  was a little  on the cold side. They serve it with potato salad (no rice), which she asked for on the side, so that didn't cool the gumbo. I started with the oysters with the Thai BBQ sauce....absolutely  delicious!. Next up I ordered the Scallop Entree, while my wife opted for the pork chop, and we split the Mac and cheese. The scallops, while tasty, would have  left me hungry  had I not had the appetizer and the Mac and cheese. The plate needed something else as a filler. The pork chop on the other hand was so big it could not be finished....very.tasty as well. We skipped dessert, as nothing  appealed to us, even the fried cupcakes.

I would not go out of my way to come here the next time I'm in town. I went for my 6 year anniversary on NYE for their 5 course tasting. 

Staff really DOES make the restaurant. The staff here in my opinion was not down to earth. I also asked about the pecan pie (later mentioned****) The waitress never got back to us. 

They had a cheese listed on the menu ($75 for the 5 courses). When the main entree came, we asked about the cheese. The waitress said that some menus had a mistake on them from what they were thinking of serving the week prior. When we sat down with the full menu - we should have been told about this. It was not acknowledged. Instead, we were presented a spoon full of chopped beats. We did not agree to this.

The crab soup was very room temperature. 

Small portions are usually known for upscale restaurants. I felt that customers here were sort of taken advantage of. 

I had called two weeks ahead of time to discuss seating for our anniversary/NYE dinner. I had mentioned the pecan pie. I was told that maybe for our anniversary they would have some in the back. The gingerbread dessert was very dry. However, I did like the compliment of the dehydrated thin slice of grapefruit to enhance the gingerbread flavor. 

Dessert was just given to us immediately after our main entree. We were not asked if we wanted tea or coffee. We were looking forward to having a nice cup of joe before going out into the freezing 30 degree weather to watch the fireworks. 

I thought maybe based on the reviews, maybe we went on an off night. It seems that a lot of people feel the way we did. I really wanted to love this restaurant. When we told everyone about our reservation, they gasped. Disappointed New Yorkers!

*****Anniversary not mentioned or acknowledged.

Came for the Reveillon dinner especially the lamb shank which is one of my favorite foods. The meal was outstanding except ..... for the lamb shank which I found almost inedible.  Ah Me.... The place is long and narrow but lovely inside with outstanding art work and a stand out decoration and paint scheme. Part of the kitchen is on view behind a glass wall and it was nice to see the chef plating our dishes. There was a service problem. They seemed really understaffed. One very hard working and dedicated young woman seemed to be serving everyone. She did her best but it really slowed things down. We had a 30 minute wait for our check. She was pleasant and eager but there was just no way she could keep up. The Reveillon  menu was inventive and mostly well executed. Bread and sea salted butter hit the spot. The pear and frisée salad was great. The honey glazed quail was too sweet for my wife (who detests any form of syrup) but I thought it was perfect. I wish I had a half dozen of them instead of the lamb :-(. The pork belly was just perfection: an ideal balance of crispy and chewy and sweet and spicy, A small piece of "candied jalapeño" was just enough spice to balance the pork belly. Really good. Then the fourth course.  My wife's puppy drum with mussels in an orange bacon broth could not have been better. But the poor lamb shank, So heavily salted and dry, coated with panko and deep fried. It should have been braised and unctuous not salty hard and dry. They said it was "confit." Please don't ever do that to a lamb shank. Pecan tart was very sweet and had Bourbon ice cream. Yum. The choice was a nice cheese plate.  I may go back and try again with the regular menu and when they have more servers. Except for the lamb this place has the potential of 5 stars.

I had a date night here with my partner in crime and we left feeling less than overwhelmed.  Based on previous reviews I'm guessing we just happened to be here on a really off night. 

We had a reservation for 6:30 and were greeted warmly by the bartender when we arrived. We were asked by the hostess if we wanted to sit in the main dining room or the hall. Huh? Well, we went with the hall. We poked our heads in, and the main dining room was pretty noisy and cramped due to a couple of large parties. 

The hall wasn't bad, just crazy narrow, and weird. I mean, we sat in a hall. 

The brightest spots were definitely the great ladies who work here. Our waitress was Bree, and she was phenomenal.  She was quick to notice the "hole" in my husband's wine glass, and she replaced it immediately with a full glass. Apparently there were a couple of defective glasses because his wine was just disappearing. Seriously, it was a great cab.

We chose the bone marrow and octopus apps and were a little let down. The bone marrow was topped with pickled veggies and served with pita bread. I blame myself. I'm sure it was spelled out on the menu, but I checked the online menu at home prior to, and was set on this dish. It was described there with grilled onions and a baguette. The marrow itself was delicious, I just pined for the onions and baguette. The pita just didn't measure up to the rich flavor of the marrow.  I feel like it was an odd pairing. The octopus was ok.

For mains I had the Hanger Steak and he had the duck. Meat flavors were awesome, portions were small. My husband's duck was very chewy. My steak was only accompanied by bland black rice. I was bummed. We ordered sides of roasted cauliflower and Brussels sprouts.  They were both delicious and I would have them again.

No chocolate desserts on the menu, so Bree was sweet enough to bring us a small bowl of some seriously tasty chocolate chips to snack on. I'm telling you, she was the best! 

I had been here years ago for lunch and was impressed. This visit was less than stellar, but I'm going to try again. Maybe for lunch.

I want to reiterate - the service last night was fantastic. Cheers to Bree.
This is a nola 4 star rating. In any other city it would be higher. But the food at so many other restaurants is better. Drinks were just ok as well.

We went on a Friday night to celebrate my husband's birthday. The place is small, and we were given a table in the hall-like section which is quite small and intimate. Every part of our meal was amazingly delicious. From the yeasty roll served with salty butter to the dessert. We split a butter lettuce salad that was given great crunch with the addition of pecans. We also split the octopus appetizer which was outstanding. I had the duck breast and ordered it medium rare. It was so juicy, and the blueberry sauce made it sing. My husband had the hanger steak also medium rare. He loved the steak, but didn't think the purple sticky rice did anything for the dish. For dessert we had the chocolate flourless cake. So yummy! It is so rare for us to enjoy every single dish that comes out of a kitchen. It has been years since we ate here, but we definitely will be back again soon.  The service was pretty good, but sometimes we seemed to wait awhile before the waitress would check to see if we needed anything.

I have never written a negative review but I have to say this was very disappointing. I treated my friend to her birthday dinner and it was horrible. We arrived at the restaurant at 6:30 for our reservation and we were the only table. Ordered and were given lovely & delicious appetizer. I asked the server to wait a bit before serving main dish so we could stay and chat. Well, our fish came out burned and mushy!!!!! Should have sent them back, my bad!!!!!!

In my humble opinion this is one of the best restaurants in a city full of excellent restaurants. If you consider the price point, it is the very best restaurant in the city.

It is an intimate conversion of a small single house. It is the most consistent restaurant in the city. I have been many times and have never had a complaint about the food. The menu is small and rarely changes, but they have perfected every item. 

They have great small plates.

The space is very small with a tiny kitchen visible through a window. It very pretty with adequate table spacing.

They have a great Tuesday wine night.

The service has always been excellent. They have a tiny bar in the front. However if you make a reservation, I have never had to wait.

I recommend it to everyone. My favorite restaurant.

The place was pretty empty and the first thing the hostess/ bartender/waiter asked was if we had a reservation.  Took awhile for the 1 waitress in the restaurant to come serve us.  I got the baked chicken which was really good but the macaroni and cheese was all grease.  Waited about 10 minutes after finishing before the waitress/hostess asked if we were done.  Great potential but I think they lacked on employees while I was there.

Great food, cool space but the service was VERY slow. 30 minutes to get orders taken, long waits for drinks, etc. The staff was really nice and helpful. Probably understaffed this night. Will go back!

I was excited to find this restaurant, but boy, did it disappoint. The menu looks fabulous, the chefs are pedigreed (CIA + Commanders), good midtown locale, adorable cottage vibe. But that's where the good ends. There was one server for the entire restaurant. ONE. She poured our water early on, but never spoke to us. I finally got the attention of the hostess and asked if I could order a glass of wine. Things didn't get much better thereafter. Sadly, our favorite taste of the evening was the bread and butter. We're usually dessert eaters, but couldn't stand throwing out any more $$. When picking up my credit card, the waitress decided to clear the table at the same time, and dropped a fork on my foot. All I got was "sorry!" Perfect way to end this meal.

Good food but slow service. This was my third visit to the restaurant but the first time I had been there with a large party (9 in total). We ordered an array of different starters & snacks. The starters were better than the sides with the oysters, mussels and pate' being the bes. The fried okra and chicken skins weren't as successful. The entrees took a long time to arrive but the food was served hot in an attractive style. The duck was very tasty and the curried goat was delicious. The risotto served with the hanger steak was delicious and outshined the steak. The fish special was a tad dry and the chicken was average. I think they were short staffed due to Jazz Fest because the drink refills were slow as was the table clearing. Prior to our dessert course, the slow service was overshadowed by the pleasant staff. However the dessert course changed that. The staff was obviously overworked, due to the crowd, and the smiles faded and were replaced by snarky comments. Dessert took over 30 minutes and even the tea took ages to be served. I suggest visiting this restaurant during the week with a small group to get a true glimpse of what they have to offer.

Cute, little restaurant hidden between two bigger buildings. Rue 127 looked to be a restaurant located inside of a house. The appetizers were small but delicious. I tried the beet salad, mussels, pate, and bone marrow (get this!). I ordered the pork chop for my entree, which was another great choice. The pork chop was juicy and seared to perfection. The sweet glaze on the pork chop complimented the side dishes well. The hominy spoon bread side dish tasted like corn grits, creamy and sweet. The black eyed peas hoppin John side was surprisingly tasty as well. The restaurant was a bit humid for my liking and sitting right next to the kitchen made it a bit intense. Service was a bit slow for it being a small restaurant. Other than that, the food was great, and I would definitely come back for the pork chop and to try their desserts!

We did a family 6 top here on Saturday night.  Easy reservation to get and we mostly had a great dinner.  Few hiccups but nothing egregious (I had no idea how to spell this word.  Thank you spell check).  

Easy reservation to get for 7:30pm on Saturday.  Convenient but suspicious.  It's a quaint house converted to restaurant.  Only street parking, which was no problem.  I parked right in front.  I was the envy of nearby patio patrons...I assume.

The food was pretty darn good.  I had the duck which was phenomenal.  Perfectly cooked.  Nicely seasoned and a light char on the crust which had tons of flavor.  I get duck with some regularity.  This was the best duck I've had in town.  

Our apps were a mixed bag.  We loved the fried okra (spears not slices) and salt/vinegar fries.  I was not a fan of the fry bread.  Tasted kind of bland to me.  And the bone marrow was ok.  They went too heavy on the caramelized onion toppings.  Easily removed, so nbd.

I loved my dessert.  This bumped my experience up a notch when the dinner was starting to drag on.  It was the blueberry upside down cake.  First off, it wasn't deconstructed.  I do not care for deconstructed cake.  Dense cake with lots of blueberry and associated blueberry glaze.  It was topped with honey ice cream.  Excellent.  Totally recommend if you have a sweet tooth.

We thought our server was a dud.  She had a strange cadence.  I never knew if she was done talking or just getting started.  Our dinner was paced on the slow side.  From entree clean up to dessert drop off was waaaaaaay too long.  I almost canceled my dessert because we had all grown tired of waiting.  We also had some issues with drink refills.  That's a pet peeve.  I suffer from cenosillicaphobia.  It's a thing.    

In the end, a very solid culinary performance made up for some weak service.  We will likely repeat.

I absolutely love this place. It is a charming little restaurant with great service and amazing food. Oh and the deep fried cupcakes are one of the best desserts  I have ever had. I can't believe it has taken me this long to try this place.

I have SEVEN food allergies and this was one of the only restaurants in NOLA willing to make me a meal and I have to say, it was one of the BEST meals of my entire life.  They made sure I got to eat a real, Southern meal.  Not to mention, the shotgun house is cute af.  It was out of our way, but well worth the drive and we really, really enjoyed it.  Thank you, thank you THANK YOU!

I ate here recently and dined from the Reveillon menu (5 courses for $60 - a December special). I really enjoyed my entree - the rabbit pot pie - and would absolutely order that again, but was underwhelmed by the other dishes. However, I can't speak to their regular menu - I think they must do a better job with their standard dishes because I have heard really good things about this place. Service was poor - we were barely checked on and signaling our waitress to order more drinks was a hassle.

Fantastic in every way. They shut the restaurant for us to a private party of 35 people. They handled every detail impeccably. I will definitely be going back every time I'm in New Orleans. Joanna was a pleasure to work with to plan the party. She was accommodating to anything we needed, organized everything just the way we wanted and along with the rest of the staff...made the party a huge success. I would recommended to anyone on any day for any occasion!

My first dinner in New Orleans and I wanted to try something away from downtown. My Uber driver even had trouble finding it, but what a great venue. TINY single house tucked off the street. Had 7:30 reservations and was seated immediately at a table looking through a window into the kitchen. Best seat in the house. Very inventive cocktail list. Followed others advice and was wowed by the marrow app. Why don't more restaurants serve it? Went with the curried goat entree. Incredible depth of flavors, not spicy at all. Perfect match with a local craft brew. Only disappointment was they were out of fried cupcakes! Apparently four earlier parties had cleaned them out. Oh,well, just a reason to go back (and I definitely will).
The food was awesome!!! Fish of the day was very good I was very pleased!!! The atmosphere is great not to loud!! Clean

Not a great way to start off our New Orleans trip but the food was very very good. Not sure how the restaurant lost our reservation since we have the confirmation email after making it. Once we arrived there was some confusion about where Casitas and we got placed in this tiny shabby corner that was very difficult to be comfortable and also difficult to get in and out of. It's a nice restaurant was some charm but it's very crowded in general and not in a charming way.

business.name: Dat Dog
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, American (New), Hot Dogs, Restaurants, Comfort Food

reviews.text: Yummy yummy for the yummy they have a big menu. Good location and man I am going to miss this I wish we had one in nyc. I recommend this spot.

Delicious cheese fries w ranch dipping sauce wow
Also yummy dogs! All kinds of toppings delicious

Late nights in New Orleans? Can't find a quick spot to eat? Dat Dog is your spot! We came out for my cousins bachelor party and a number of places were closed for food especially for  a big group of patrons. I enjoyed the alligator dog. It was easy to custom make. I could not eat any bread and the staff was open to use lettuce as my bread. Friendly and great folks. We are in the times of pandemic. You will need to show a vaccination card upon arrival in Dat Dog
Thrilling to have such delicious vegan options at a hot dog stand!! Sit outside and listen to the music on Frenchman.

Heard about this spot by someone on the plane! 

After drinking, this place hits the spot!! 

So many different hot dogs to choose from. 

I settled on the crawfish dog. It was Crawfish Sausage, Crawfish Etouffee, Sour Cream, Tomatoes, &
Creole Mustard. AMAZING FLAVOR! 

My boyfriend had the Rougarou. It was Alligator Sausage, Grilled Onions, Creole Mustard, Tomatoes, Jalapenos, Barbecue Sauce, & Bacon. He said it was delicious and very spicy! I had a small bite and I enjoyed it. 

They have so many options it's so hard to decide. They also offer sausages, chicken, burgers, fish, and vegan options. There really is something for everyone and for every diet. You can also create your own dog with various different toppings to chose from. 

Side choices include fries or tots. 

Great place to stop at after drinking!

We stayed in New Orleans for a week, and this was one of the places I wanted to try since we were in the neighborhood getting tattoos. Great lunch stop with a large menu. The prices weren't bad either. This was my 1st time trying a alligator dog, and it was DELICIOUS! The cheesy tots were yummy too, and the drinks were bomb.com! I loved the strawberry lemonade vodka on a hot day. We'd definitely go here again!

Who doesn't love a hot dog? Dat Dog is a fully customizable hot dog eatery with a fun sausage selection. We tried the smoked duck sausage with chili cheese and grilled onions to keep it classic. The sausage and toppings were delicious but what sets Dat Dog on top is their bread. Imagine a soft, buttery Texas toast that warmly caresses your dog. It's a must return just to try every combination on the menu.

Surprisingly great hot dogs and sausages on a bun. I had the Chicago Dog, which was true to form. We had a Guinness special, and a Bacon Werewolf, as well. 

The service, for a place with a long line, at one of the handful of fast-food joints on Frenchmen Street, was really friendly, from Sarah, the cashier.  

The kitchen was a bit slow, but, it's a go-to for those catching a break from the music and booze binging on Frenchmen Street. Seating is up on the balcony, at some really ratty picnic tables, up front, or there are a few seats at their bar. 

The bar is a minor fail. They notify you, after you've been through the food line, that they can't let you pay for a drink at the bar. You missed it? You end up back in the long line. The investment in a POS system for the bartender?  Might be a plus. #justsaying.

Fun spot to grab a bite after listening to some live tunes next door at the spotted cat... We tried a couple different dogs and the stand out from our selections was the GUINNESS SPECIAL...we also had the CRAWFISH ETOUFFEE, THE SON OF A SAINT 'DOG, & TOTS... Honestly all were delishh...

My NOLA colleague recommended we grab a New Orleans tradition so we made our way over to Dat Dog for a lunch bite.  This location is near the Quarter and the surroundings are def street scene NOLA. 

I selected the Alligator sausage tricked up with guacamole, pico, bbq, bacon, chipotle mayo and man, it was a taste explosion! 

I grabbed a a side of loaded tots (cheese, bacon, jalapeños) to top it all off. 

We sat outside and did some serious people watching, be advised you may have to wait a while-our service was slow, not sure why since they weren't busy, but it was worth the wait.  

Dat Dog is a NOLA must, check it out.

Everything was awesome, service was kind and attentive, and they were super accommodating of my dietary restrictions!

My friend had the rougarou alligator sausage, and I built my own veganish dog with the smoked apple sage, blackberry sauce, grilled onions, sauerkraut, and chipotle mayo.

Shared the tots with crawfish sauce--amazing.
We have tried the Rougarou( Alligator) and crawfish dog. While they were both very good the Rougarou was simply amazing and delicious. Definitely recommend.

Great food, one of the only things open on a Monday past 7 around here. Reasonably priced, awesome food. Was out of chicken, fish,  and rolled burgers so missing a star; honesty think they just didn't want to make it. None of the employees were very happy or friendly. Still what they had was awesome.

Amazing hot dogs! 
I made a custom hot dog with alligator sausage and I was not disappointed.
Well cooked and seasoned and the toppings were made very well. The bun wasn't overpowering and blended well with the sausage.
I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone in the area for hot dogs.

Take some pride in the bathroom you have available for customers. Leaking toilet with a broken seat, and no top to the tank. The health department is definitely going to be notified. This is absolutely pathetic. If the kitchen resembles your bathroom in any way, you should be shut down.  Spend $200 on a new toilet and pay a professional to fix you sh*t. I will never come back here.

They are good in food. It's a typical Nola French quarter place. Very busy but worth the price. They could not pronounce my name though. But they have good sitting area. And they are open till late night. Must go in Nola.

OMG!  This is the place for you If you are to come to New Orleans!! Hands down! I'm picky about my dogs and they didn't disappoint. Liz is the bomb! If you come here One day I hope she is still here. Price (his name ) was making the dogs, and he hooked us up! It's off the beaten path but worth the walk. Get yo ass here!!

WOW. Coming from Chicago, I draw a harsh line when it comes to hot dogs. But Dat Dog was honestly super good. They had tons of vegan options and everything was 100% customizable. They had over 70 topping options which spanned from relish to guacamole. I loved my spicy chipotle dog!

I just tried to order TOGO and they told me I couldn't order food without having a vaccine card. I told them the law was you can't dine inside without the card/test but the manager then (rudely) told our group that we have to leave their establishment if we aren't vaccinated. Wow. So sad because I loved this place so much. Then in the middle of a disaster (Hurricane Ida). I had just left the Dat Dog Freret St. & they said that I could order Togo (without any cards or tests). Terrible management and very rude responses.. do better.
Ordered Son of a Saint, substituting the hot sausage with a beef one. This is so freaking good. It's a bit expensive ($8.50) but SO delicious.

Food shmacked. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being the most shmack. Dat Dog was a 10. 

Nothing beats a tasty wiener. For real some tasty meat.
Tried to go on a weekday just before sunset. It was so packed and the line was disorderly we ended up leaving.
Best hot dogs in town, bar none!  Everything about them is top-notch from the meat (or meatless, if you prefer) to the amazing buns and toppings.

Ok don't just think about eating here, get in the car now and go eat at Dat Dog! My wife had the CRAWFISH ETOUFFEE DOG, my son had the THE ROUGAROU and I had THE BLUE DAT BURGER but with cheddar cheese instead of the blue cheese. We shared an order of fries and everything was incredible! The buns were amazing! Everything was great and it was a fun atmosphere. Come give it a try and you'll be back!

The ultimate customizable hotdog joint!!! This place was so good. A little on the pricey side for what you get but it was still delicious. I got a classic Vienna frank and my dad got the brat. Our toppings were yummy. Good service. Cute atmosphere!!

business.name: Hibachi Steak House & Sushi Bar
business.categories: Steakhouses, Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Japanese

reviews.text: Amazing!! Everything was so good, the fried rice could have been better but other than that the food was great, we also had a Christmas roll and it definitely makes it on my top 10 favorite rolls!!
This came out recently and it's been my go to ever since. So worth the wait. Although they are busy, they are very friendly. I love this place!
Love love love this place. We order so many dishes and all of them were so delicious. Service is just amazing. Our server suggest me plum wine which was good. I highly recommend this place.

We had an order to go while on a mini vacation trip to Santa Barbara and boy did we get lucky with this place. The hibachi was awesome and the sushi was great. Everything tasted fresh and and cooked to order. Would come back.
This is a great sushi bar and restaurant located downtown. It's my go to for sushi. I usually get some gyoza too, which is also delicious. Good prices and service as well. Definitely recommend.

Absolutely love the food here, the customer service is the best as well! I came here the other day, and they would check up on us every 5 minutes, they make sure you get what you want! Our waiters name was Omar, he was excellent, he made me feel really comfortable and it just felt as if I've known him for so long! They don't open till 5:30 p.m. but it's worth the wait, they're seriously the only place Ill get sushi from! I got a crunchy roll, spicy edamame, and chicken stir fried rice and it was the best!

During non-COVID times this is the only place in town to get Hibachi. However, we regularly make our way here for the sushi. They have a great selection of rolls and the prices are very reasonable. I prefer the big foot roll, unless I'm feeling something simpler, in which case I'll double up in the Santa Barbara and Something's Fishy rolls - in case you're wondering, this spot used to be named Something's Fishy for many years. 

They have some outside seating and rumor is they'll be building a parklet soon. Perhaps the best thing about the place is their incredibly friendly service. Head sushi chef Hiro is a particularly fantastic guy and I have never had a poor experience here. With the outside seating, and their prime location on the best block in town for fun, it's a great spot to people watch and enjoy a meal.

Just stopped by for a last minute anniversary dinner and everything was so great and yummy! Sushi rolls are good and reasonably priced, NY steak and salmon were so great and juicy! Service was also great, our server was really attentive. Would go back!

Friday is super busy for State Street and while we were asking this place looked pretty good. We were sat pretty quickly but it took a while for our initial service. Service staff was really good and friendly after that. For dinner, I ordered the New York strip steak and shrimp hibachi with fried rice substitution combo (which came with a small salad). Although dinner was good, for the price, I was pretty disappointed with the entire meal including presentation ($30- not including tax or tip). It wasn't your typical fried rice plate (no eggs or veggies other than onion) flavored with salt and pepper), my steak had a ton of fat on it, and the shrimp wasn't flavored well enough.

Seating and service were fine. Prices were fine, but not much of a "bang for your buck". We weren't too hungry, so it wasn't a big deal, but the sushi rolls were itty bitty. They tasted great, but just wasn't the quantity we were hoping for.
It's a Covid-19 set up dining outside in the middle of State St. decent sushi at an amazing price!
Excellent food and service , what a gem of a place and special thanks to to our server Melissa and chef for a memorable occasion
