My bf and I came to Santa Barbara for the weekend to celebrate his bday. We walked around the strip looking for ideas to have for dinner. We arrived at Hibachi about 30 minutes before closing and they still welcomed us and seated us. Our servers name was Omar, His energy was great! Omar gave exceptional customer services, he kept it very professional all while making us feel like friends! His energy was bright & cheerful. Even recommended a couple of places to visit. The food was also very great. The restaurant resembles Benihanas but way more reasonable in pricing. Only payed 80 something bucks for all the food ordered. This place is a must! I definitely recommend it.

Food was good. State St is closed right at this corner so there is outdoor dining. The wait was not too bad for a Saturday night.  The steak was cooked perfectly. The food did get a little cold, but  the place was super busy and they were doing all they could under the circumstances. The server was polite, she did forget a couple things we had asked for (small things, sauces), but she also mentioned she was new. Def a great place for dinner, we would eat here again.

Food was delicious and in their defense it was cold the day we went, they had heaters that didn't really work and my food got cold before I even finish. Sushi was ok, the ambiance is great because it's outside and you can see all the people. We didn't get the dipping sauces for the dish.

I remember this place when it was Something Fishy and feel like it just changed names. The location is what it really has going for it. 

The only offer dinner options, I understand because of Covid but it is really lack luster and a little pricey for what you get. 

Service was ok. Servers were really good but the owner (?) seemed to be a little overbearing.

We hadn't been in years.  It's still wonderful.  Great service,  lovely people working there.  Our waitress and servers were all kind and attentive. The California roll is the best around,  the hibachi meals are still excellent!  The shrimp was flavorful and delicious. The chicken was marinated perfectly.  The white sauce was great,  but the brown sauce was not the typical and was just teriyaki sauce. Great time!
We ordered a $ 35 dish, the hibachi lobster shrimp and fish, and it was definitely underwhelming

Last night my partner and I were really craving sushi and of course it was a no brainier, this place has half priced sushi rolls and we've always loved going. We haven't really gone out to since this whole COVID 19 pandemic started and my girlfriend recently got surgery and last night she was finally up for going out to get some food so it was supposed to be a nice dinner date. Upon arriving I could tell they were on the busier side of most places around. There was a table right in front of the restaurant but we requested something by the heaters since it was starting to get a bit cold. The only table available by a heater seated 6. We confirmed it wouldn't be a problem since it was just my partner and I. We were reassured it would be no problem. So we sat down and looked up the online menu and started to decide what we would order. We then noticed a few people on staff kept walking around looking at us. It happened a few times. We started to feel weird thinking it was because there was just two of us sitting at this 6 people table. Turns out we were right. There was a group of 3 that they wanted to seat but options were limited. We got asked if it would be a problem if we moved, we agreed as long as it was near a heater and they said they had a table clearing up near one. Then a few minutes later the same guy came and said it wasn't a problem we could stay where we were. We asked if they were sure, we didn't have a problem moving but were once again reassured it was fine. We then noticed the group of 3 must work there or be friend of the staff because they were quickly brought a table out from inside and their drink order was taken. By this time it had been 30 or so minutes and the only time we were approached was to be asked to move. We waited a few more minutes and no one came. We noticed the groups of 3 was already ordering and we hadn't even had water brought out. We flagged down a waiter and expressed our frustration. He said he would be back and after another 5 minutes we decided to get up and leave. Worst experience ever.
Delicious sushi and friendly staff. My favorite sushi spot in Santa Barbara. Always go-to and good sushi. The host is always nice.

We ordered two rolls from Hibachi -BSC roll and a crunchy roll and it took over an hour to get the rolls. Mind you this was to go so it's understandable if it takes longer but an HOUR?! Finally I told the front host that it's been an hour and she said it was ready. Mind you I've been standing right next to her (why didn't she tell me?) we opened the foam boxes and the food was cold! Don't recommend- you're better off going to Ralphs and grabbing sushi there.

Hibachi Steak House and Sushi Bar is located in 502 State Street in Santa Barbara.

Let me start off by saying that although the service is not super fast, the waitress made sure that we had everything that we needed, from drinks to side dishes, as we waited comfortably at our table. Once our cook arrived, he was professional and prepared our meal right before our eyes, much to our delight. He also named and explained the usage for each sauce, which was a nice gesture on his part.

Hibachi is an experience that cannot soon be forgotten. I'll definitely be visiting this establishment again in the near future.

My son and I really enjoyed our dinner here! My son compared it to BeniHana but said this place was better and I agree! The price is perfect it not too pricey. My son got the New York steak dinner plate and I got the New you're steak with salmon and the portions were perfect! We also had sushi rolls for our appetizer and those tasted very fresh! I'm very pleased with this spot!  I highly recommend

We are new to Santa Barbara and wanted to try the local sushi on State street. We actually attempted to call before walking 25 minutes to this location to which they didn't answer their phones on the two attempts of calling. 

This was for my wife's and best friend's birthday; and we had a party of ten. When we arrived, they told us they would have to seat us at two tables of five, possibly separated, and that there would be a 15 minute wait. After waiting well past 20 minutes, a seated customer they over served alcohol to vomited on the floor under her table. After 5 minutes of scrambling their workers to address that mess, they walked up to us and tell us they won't be able to seat us Because, "It will overwhelm their servers."

We were ready to indulge, pay good money for drinks and food, they made us excessively wait and turned our business down. Absolutely haphazard of the staff and a terrible experience for us.

I can't comment on the steak or the service, because I only rolls during the Covid 19 panic. The gentleman who took my order was very kind for the brief interaction we had. Given the look of the place, the large amount of workers inside, and the grub hub drivers waiting outside to grab the orders I felt confident the rolls would be good. I didn't bother Yelping. Lesson learned. I ordered the two special rolls for the day, The crunchy roll and the orange fire roll. One was $12 and the other was 14. The ingredients sounded like a good combination, although they touted the Fire roll as being really hot, which is a bonus for my tastes. I brought the rolls home and they were fairly sized so the portion was adequate, but once my family and I actually ate them, disappointment reared it's ugly face. The quality of the ingredients was severely lacking. The crunch roll seemed like they used stale crumbs, the rice was almost doughy, and left your mouth coated with a dry doughy feeling which took from the other ingredients that should have saved the meal. The same issue with the rice went for the fire roll, only it was even more disappointing as it had salmon in the center and a beautiful slice of tuna on top. But looks can be deceiving, the sushi was actually not very fresh and it couldn't save the day, rather it only added to the sad meal. I'm not an avid sushi eater, but I've had it at least a hundred times in my life, and this was easily the worst I've ever had from an actual sushi restaurant (buffets and grocery stores don't count). If you're in the mood for rolls, keep rolling for your own sake.

business.name: Sabor
business.categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Mediterranean, Italian, Iberian, Spanish, Portuguese

reviews.text: For the price point tell you the truth I'd rather go next door to Spaghetti Factory we had the octopus which was amazing I must say the chef knows what he's doing by far but the service was not the best and we felt a little out of place the way we were treated will be back I'm not sure will I recommend it especially not to my clients

Ordered a large dinner with many items for takeout. The hot food was very hot and cold still cold when I got home. 3 boars, lobster bisque, Caesar w/anchovies, seared scallops, mushroom risotto, cheesecake. It was all amazing. Cooked just right, not under our overcooked. Solid, subtle and complex flavours was a treat to eat. Some in room dining currently. I have been here a few times over the years and never disappoints.

Went for the Valentine's Day set menu .. our very first time and I'm dying to go back already .. absolutely everything was delicious starting with the lobster bisque soup amazing .. the main meals lobster risotto and my steak dinner were outstanding .. desert also perfection mmmm 5 stars from us

Did takeout, have to phone it in and pickup yourself which I don't mind but wow! I have missed going there after work, but the takeout was just as good as in-restaurant dining. We will order again shortly, thanks for keeping the experience exceptional!

While the food here is amazing, we didn't have the best service while we were here this past weekend for Downtown Dining Week. My partner ordered a virgin Caesar and was given a regular Caesar with vodka. When we questioned the waiter he guaranteed the drink was a virgin. However, after raising concern a second time he brought a new drink which was the correct order. His attitude throughout the whole ideal was enough to make us not want to return.

I'm so glad we checked this place out! I have followed them on Instagram for a while now. 

The outside seems on the smaller side of things but when you walk in it's dark, romantic, and spacious.

We ended up doing the family meal with the three starters of peri-peri prawns, scallops, and mussels. They were amazing. The prawns were by far my favourite. We also ordered extra of the breads which were phenomenal. 

For dinner we had the lobster risotto with halibut and salmon. Which was unbelievable. 

This is one of our new fav places. Can't wait to go back.

This is just a gem in downtown Edmonton.
Portuguese cuisine at its finest.
The service was outstanding, our dishes were beyond explainable. I had their Bacalhau, which was really good. The perfect food for the cold Edmonton winter.

We came here for a date night before the quarantine and it must have been coincidence but we were seated at the most romantic little table in the restaurant (in my opinion - next to the piano). The food was fantastic and the service was good as always. When we return I'll be certain to ask to be seated again next to the piano and hope that we get what felt like a private show. Otherwise, it's also quite nice to see someone walking around playing music by the tables. The ambiance was on point! 
The food is always delicious!

We went here recently for my daughters birthday. I made reservations for a birthday, the food was alright, I made a bad choice I think because everybody else's looked good. The waiters were all men aged 50-65 who were very kind and professional. Love the atmosphere. Just one issue, they brought my daughter cheesecake she didn't even want because we had a baked cake at home for present time and they put it on the bill. Everybody at the table told me to dispute it but I didn't want to be a 'Karen' in a posh restaurant so I just paid it. Don't worry, I know it was the servers fault and I still tipped him out 20% on a large bill. Anyways, I'd try it again, I want to try their scallops.

My boyfriend had his birthday dinner in the private room and from beginning to end it was fabulous. Our server was so accommodating, patient, and understood everyone's needs. The food was amazing, such big portions and so flavourful. I've been here on many occasions and have never been let down. Highly recommend!

Our first time at Sabor, decided to come here for a romantic valentines lunch on Feb 14. We had a reservation, and we were contacted day of that we wouldn't have the best seating because they'd be setting up for Valentines dinner. Since we had nothing to compare it to, this seemed fine with us. 

I have to say the ambience was slightly ruined due to all the running around going on during our lunch. Tables were being hauled, chairs dragged, things dropped as they were moving stuff into what looked like a private room of the restaurant. This was all distracting and took away from the experience. I would suggest a restaurant do this outside of business hours if there's really that much set up they have to do, that it disrupts customers. A little is okay; but this was too much. 

The service was good. The hostess seemed a little grumpy but she was helpful anyways. (Came back and wiped our table between the mussels and the main entrees). Our waitress was very very nice. She was attentive but didn't bother us too often. 

The food was very flavourful. The boyfriend and I both opted for items off the daily features. We got mussels to start as well. The food came out quickly; we didn't have to wait long at all. 

I've heard very good things about Sabor and while we hoped this would be a romantic lunch, it seemed like people who cane for dinner would be the ones who got the nice ambience I've read and heard about... so that was a little bit disappointing. Maybe another time.

First tip - if you ever travel to Edmonton on Sunday/Monday, many restaurants in the downtown core are closed Sunday (some even Monday!).  

Thankfully, Sabor was not closed and we had had a good experience one year ago when we last visited.  

Was it as good as last time?  No... it wasn't "bad" - just nothing different... so, if given a choice, the decision would be to try someplace else different.  

What is good about Sabor?  Good ambiance.  Good service.  Good food and wine list.  Everything good - nothing great or outstanding.  Nothing to rave about.  

Will it warrant a return visit?  Probably - just because other establishments aren't open.

Excellent! From the service to the food, everything was as it should be; excellence in dining. 

I'm Portuguese borne but raised and educated in Canada. However, I was raised with traditional foods and can say without a doubt the menu has little in the way of traditional Portuguese dishes. It is more of a modern Iberian fusion of Portuguese and Spanish, with some other influences. Still great food. 

I highly recommend Sabor for the seafood dishes which give you a little taste of Iberian culinary art. Cheers!

This is an amazing Portuguese seafood restaurant.  I come here when on business and have yet to be disappointed, with their selection of wines, apps and mains.    A reso always helps as this place can get really busy - esp before any sporting event.  

Their tapas area is a different menu than their dining area, but both have been great food wise - just depends on what kind of food you want to order.  My faves are the seafood dishes.

Visited Sabor twice, top notch freshness of seafood. The scallops and squid stir fry dish was impressive, such a shame that now it's no longer on the menu:( Steak and lobster were perfect prepared. Servers are helpful with picking wine, will go back again doubtless.

We got married this past weekend and Sabor was our choice for the dinner following our ceremony. There was 14 of us booked into a beautiful private room. The wall designs were unique and everyone loved the atmosphere.

While the food was wonderful, our waiter Troy was outstanding. He was very attentive and knowledgeable. He made sure everyone always had a drink and let me know when the wine ran low but without ever being intrusive. I just want to commend how great a job he did.

We chose to use the price fixed menu for our group that had a number of appetizers brought family style, personally my favourite from this was the bacon wrapped dates but all the appetizers were delicious.

The entrees include sablefish, beef tenderloin, or roasted lamb rack. I got the lamb rack which was very tender and tasty but other guests loved the sablefish and beef as well.

My wife and all our guests talked into the next day how great the restaurant was and now we can't wait to go back. I'll likely have to go there for out first anniversary.

Best seafood dishes!!! Friendly service. Love the piano player on weekends. Classy but casual.

I enjoy sabor divino. Dined here by myself, with a significant other, as a large group and every time service is fantastic.

Service is quite exceptional. Paced perfectly but not rushed with the privacy to hold a good conversation without being rudely interupted.

I prefer the fish dishes as they are seasoned perfectly and are so fresh. The accompaniments are always perfect and have so much flavour. Its definitly farm to table like quality. The steak is great too but I find with large groups the steak is kinda inconsistent. some pieces drastically overcooked and some rare. But when ordered  individually they are always perfect. 

I love how the desserts come in taster sizes too. I find the meals are large but I could never finish an entire dessert so the taster size is just right. I especially fancy the passionfruit cheesecake or the creme brulee. Both are outstanding.

If you want to try this place out without breaking the bank...lunch specials are awesome.  My fave is the Lobster risotto with black cod!!! Most specials are $21 and come with a choice of soup or salad. The specials change daily and are posted on their website. It sells out quick so best to get there before 1230.

I had the pleasure of sharing a meal with family and friends at Sabor for the first time the other evening.  It was a birthday celebration and because of the number of us we were seated in a private room and had a set menu where we chose an entree  and the appetizers and desert were chosen for us.  The serves was impeccable,  I believe are server's name was Jose.   He was attentive, unobtrusive and friendly.  The serves was fast and all that was suppose to be hot did indeed arrive at the table hot.  The appetizers that came with the set menu were delicious and not a word was spoken at the table while everyone dug in and enjoyed the piri piri prawns, scallops, ricotta and chive filled piquillo peppers, manchego filled bacon wrapped dates and Mista salad ( tomatoes, mix greens cucumber and a light vinaigrette). The buns served were also a big hit with the group.  For the main coarse we had a choice of either a double boned rack of lamb , beef tenderloin served with roasted potatoes and a variety of other roasted vegetables or Alaskan sable fish on a bed of lobster risotto. The presentation was beautiful and sparked a high level of desire to dig in.   I knew that everyone was enjoying the meal when the table goes from a lot of chatter to dead silence while everyone proceeds to discover what is on their plate.  I had the sable fish because at times I will try something I would not have at home.   I loved the fish, it was smooth as silk with a lovely after taste. The risotto was too salty for me or maybe risotto is just not a dish for me. I serve lamb to my family often so they are use to the flavor.  Those that had the lamb enjoyed the meal although found it a little well done to what they are use to.  Those who had the beef tenderloin were completely happy with their meal.  Since this menu catered to an adult palate, it was kind of Sabor to offer a pasta dish to their young patrons.  My granddaughters, who I might add are extremely picky eaters, gobbled up their pasta (which consisted of broad pasta with either an Alfredo or marinara sauce) until they could eat no more.  All the portions were a generous size and left just enough room for desert.  Speaking of desert, in my opinion is never complete unless involves  chocolate and Sabor did not disappoint with their chocolate  cayenne mousse and a slice of house cheese cake with port cherries. Very decadent, a coffee and liqueur would have gone nicely with this desert.   I did not have any wine since I was driving but the wine list offered something for everyone and those that had the Malbec loved it.  Entrees run between $28 and $48, appetizers or tapas run between $6 and $22 .  Wine by the glass is between $16 and $21 for the 9 oz.  Didn't notice the 6 oz prices, why would I.  A bottle of wine will run anywhere between $40 and $400.  All in all we had a lovely experience at Sabor's. The ambiance is warm and the atmosphere is calming.  It is a great place for a family dinner as much as a great place for an intimate dinner for two or to catch up over dinner with friends.  
 I am looking forward to returning to try the seafood paella.  I would give Sabor a solid 4 1/2 star rating but Yelp will only allow whole numbers. Thank you Jose for your attentive serves and the little extras you  provided us. (taking photos of the group for us was very kind of you))
I've had several lunches here. Their lunch menu is usually quite nice: well priced for the quality and quantity.
My new favorite restaurant in Edmonton. Sometimes I go on both nights that I'm there. Service is also professional and friendly. Excellent paella. Great wines.

Amazing seafood for the north of Alberta! I've gone to many seafood restaurants in Calgary and this was such an amazing experience. Fantastic quality and portion sizes for a great price.

I would consider this finer dining and service was slow - if you are an impatient person this may be bothersome but we were out for an experience and were not bothered by it. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

We started with the mussels and scallops to share as a table - the scallops melted in your mouth; and the broth of the mussels we couldn't get enough of.  For a main I had lobster risotto; so flavourful and rich. Others with me had catch of the day and seafood risotto and all enjoyed their dishes. 


Would recommend and would love to come try another dish!

The kitchen really understands fish, and octopus in particular. I had the octopus mussel salad, and t was bang on. Great flavours, textures, colours.  Delicious.

It was not very busy today, all that road construction can't be helping, but the food I saw coming out of the kitchen tells me I need to go back, often...

Lots of beautiful fish on the menu to try out. Such a cool space and street too. 

Oh, and terrific friendly service too.

We were in the party room, with about 20 people. The young waitress was excellent in doing her job, and everything went well. I ordered the lamb racks and just one of the racks was so tough and I coud not dig my teeth into it. The rest of the racks are better, but generally they have more brown on it than I think they should have. I told the waitress and she said she would let the chef know. This is a $75 full meal, I would and should expect better than this.

The restaurant is really nice, the concept and  the design amazing however the food  for that price U expect something better, If u ever try a real paella with saffron and more than just mussels you will understand what I'm talking about, the drinks were very good.

This.Place.Is.Amazing. I was honestly blown away by their food it has easily become my favourite place to eat in the city! The food is consistent - fresh, delicious and so full of flavor. I had the family style dinner both times I was there so I got to try quite a few options. Their "3-Course" dinner is easily a "4-Course". For the first course you start with a plate of raw oysters, grilled jumbo prawns and a mussel/clam medley in this amazing cream sauce. The second course is 2 types of fish with the lobster risotto (heaven!) which is seasoned to perfection. Then for dessert you get a dessert trio to share which consists of a type of cheesecake, chocolate mousse and tiramisu or crème brulee.

The restaurant is in a large open space but it still feels so cozy and intimate. The prices are a bit higher than the regular places that you might go to but for the quality and the amount of food that you get, it makes it definitely worth it. I will definitely be going back!

business.name: Capitol Grille
business.categories: Hotels & Travel, Hotels, Nightlife, Lounges, Mexican, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, American (New), Bars

reviews.text: This will be our last trip to the CG unless we hear that things improve. Service was ok. The cream I poured in my first cup of coffee was clotted. Yuck. Got that replaced quickly. Food? Well, see the photo below of the bananas garnishing my plate of unremarkable pancakes.  They arrived looking this unappealing. Why would that be on any plate?! Just gross.

Nashville has the best events during Christmas and one in particular is the Christmas Tea inside the Hermitage Hotel at the Capitol Grille. 
Things you need to know: 

1. Make reservations (this is a busy venue and walk-ins have difficulty finding spaces)

2. They have complimentary valet parking for this event. Bring your ticket to the check in desk and they can stamp it for you when you arrive. 

3. The tea is located in the mezzanine area of the hotel which is flooded with natural light and flanked by an enormous Christmas tree for Insta worthy pics. (A couple was filming when we were there.)

4. For $75 per person (and an automatic tip added at the end), see this as a once-a-year splurge with a few of your friends and start a new Nashville tradition.

I had a reservation booked at the Hermitage for tea... this reservation was made 1 month in advance (on October 21, in fact). I received an email notification of the cancellation and then a voicemail stating that my reservation would be cancelled, as there was some sort of glitch in OpenTable and they had overbooked. Unfortunately, they didn't realize this until 48 hours before our reservation.

When I called to ask if there was any ability to get in for the weekend (as we had folks flying in for birthday celebrations), I was told there would be no accommodation or attempt to help, as they were booked through the end of the year. I will not, in future, ever book a reservation here... I didn't even get the chance to sit down before experiencing terrible customer service. Cancelling 36-48 hours before the reservation and then notifying the customer is not the way to win folks over.

The servers were amazing but I can't say the same for the food at this location. We ordered medium rare steaks and when it came out it was cool, had no flavor and super thin. It looked like what I'd envision if you boiled a steak then threw it in a microwave but left it on the counter for hours bc you were sad you were going to have to eat it. 
They replaced it with lobster risotto but the rice was over cooked and was hard & crunchy

Could have been an off night bc normally Capital Grille's food is incredible.
LOVE this place! Delicious food, special and reasonably priced. Gorgeous venue and great service.

It's hard to even give this place one star but I give it only for ambiance & the waiter. Note, the pictures are misleading! You don't sit in the darkened elegant dinning room but in a sunroom type area or on a landing of the staircase. But it's nice. 
For over $100.00 each, one would think the food would be plentiful, Hot & delicious but it was FAR from it. We wish we would have gotten up & left when we saw the menu,  so that's on us. The waiter explained it away as a result of "kitchen renovations". We had the meat & cheese starter & should have asked for the bill when it came out. Really rolling my eyes here!  It was hardly impressive and VERY overpriced.  It was literally meat & cheese & wafers. Not even olives, pickles or other pickled veggies. Moving on to the main course (& again, we should have excused ourselves & just found somewhere else to dine)... My fillet was cooked well but lacked taste & HEAT. The Mac n cheese was definitely left over from a few days ago, nothing to write home about; certainly not since it was $12 & was hardly as purported ..." shareable". The Brussel sprouts were also tasteless, uncooked & had little to no seasoning. Certainly nothing creative to their recipe or preparation. My husband went for the flounder but it was just ok & not worth $30+.  There were no garnishments on the plates & from watching as the food came out, seemed like it was cooked a block away & brought in under cover. Oh, and NO bread! Find yourself another Nashville establishment with which to dine until these guys complete their " renovations " which needs to include the  chef & sous-chef.

What a major disappointment. The kitchen is under renovation/construction so the menu is extremely limited. Your food has to be carried across the lobby to your table. My wife's entree was lukewarm. Will not be back.

Three of us celebrating a birthday. Ordered two filets (medium and medium well) and flounder. Sides of mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. Both steaks came well done no pink at all. Flounder was lacking flavor. Sides were warm (not hot) and mediocre. Very disappointed.

Extremely poor service with food not arriving for all people at the same time. One waited almost 20 minutes and another received her food when everyone was already finished. The restaurant tried to offer to help, but nothing really picked up on service. Food was not that great either. It's definitely not what one would expect from a 5 Star Hotel. There are many other restaurants for less cost with better service and food. Don't recommend.

Went for breakfast, had the French toast which was covered with berries and was delicious. Presentation was excellent. Had French pressed coffee too. Menu was limited, compared to what was online. I suppose because of COVID, I was hoping for something more savory and have a sweet treat for the table. Because the main restaurant was under construction we ate in another area and couldn't see the famous men's bathroom. It was okay, not great, but okay.

As a food critic, I was very excited to dine hear on Christmas Day, unfortunately the same morning as the bombing just four blocks away. However, the quality of service and the quality of the menu was incredible. The interior immediately intrigued me, however, the important thing to me is would the food be as good is the quality of service, Etc. It was absolutely incredible. I had the Pan Seared Scallops, the Prime Rib, and the Cinnamon Roll Dessert. Flawless. Thank you for the incredible dining experience.

Way way overpriced. 
Miles was the saving grace for this visit. Service was slow but I think that's just the laid back vibe of the bar space? He was very sweet and accommodating. He gets 5 stars.
Otherwise, whole vibe is cold, dated and unwelcoming not in a historic, charming way. Drinks were good. But nothing special. Especially for the price. 
Food was mediocre at best. 
Had the beet salad that was dusted with maybe a quarter ounce at most of goat cheese. Underdressed, underwhelming. It's my favorite salad and my friend and I didn't even bother to finish. 
Fried green tomatoes. Where are the tomatoes? Giant scoop of pimento cheese and a tiny little sliver of overcooked green tomatoes. Very one note. 
Scallops were undercooked and WAY too expensive. 
Lasagna was all beschamelle (spelling?) sauce and no contents. 

My friend and I both left with major stomach aches and had to end the night early. 

Don't name your restaurant after a five star restaurant chain.
Good food from a limited menu in a dining room that begs for a decor overhaul. Too expensive for what you get, although the service is excellent and the people are friendly.
Great food.  Great service.  We had our anniversary dinner here.  Can't say enough good things  about our meal and service.  We will be back!

Well the steak ( filet ) was amazing. But! You now have the option of a 5oz for $39 or 10 oz for $67! Pitiful, what the hell! I either have 3oz less than I desire or 2 oz more than I want. Is it so difficult to provide a 8 0Z steak, pretty much the standard. No music piped into the bar, so vibeless. It is incredibly how so many businesses blame COVID on everything. Wine list is beyond weak. You can enjoy a $10 glass of red wine or a $17, $33 per glass. Get your game up at this price point!!! It will be awhile before we come back.
I came here for a light lunch.  I had the arugula salad with burrata cheese and beets.   A really good lighter lunch meal.

It's a petty that this place isn't on the wow side, don't get me wrong, it's good but I wouldn't say it's worth the penny they charge. I've been here a few times now and this time just sealed it for me. The food is just not solid. I can't even remember well but it was steak and we had the duck that day too. The service has always been just ok. 
It's nice to come and say you did, if you're all about that.

We started at the bar which had an old school vibe. Service was attentive but not overbearing. We then went to the dining room. The bread was awesome. The black -eyed pea fritters were grainy and without flavor. Shrimp and grits were flavorful. The lamb chops ($40) were overcooked without much flavor. Dinner service was professional and attentive. I like the  feel of the restaurant, but the lights could be dimmed to create more of an atmosphere. I have to say for what we got, it was overpriced. It was a nice, but not great evening.

We started at the bar which had an old school vibe. Service was attentive but not overbearing. We then went to the dining room. The bread was awesome. The black -eyed pea fritters were grainy and without flavor. Shrimp and grits were flavorful. The lamb chops ($40) were overcooked without much flavor. Dinner service was professional and attentive. I like the  feel of the restaurant, but the lights could be dimmed to create more of an atmosphere. I have to say for what we got, it was overpriced. It was a nice, but not great evening.

Birthday lunch - had a taste for the now $15 club sandwich which was absolutely wonderful the last/first time I ordered it. This time it was just ok. Fries were also just ok. Service was good. Greeter at the desk was very nice and welcoming.

From initial drinks to appetizers, everything was amazing.  We had the oysters which were great, caesar salad was awesome, and soup was delicious.  I ordered the "recommended" 12 oz dry-aged ribeye steak which the restaurant was "known for" and was truly disappointed.  I ordered the steak medium rare Pittsburgh style and they simply pan-seared a 1 inch piece of steak (I could have done this myself. I've had better steaks at chain restaurants and charging $60 for this "amazing" steak is simply deceiving.  

If you go to this restaurant, stick to the appetizers and skip the steaks.

I enjoyed my meal at the Capital Grill. I had a NY steak.  It was cooked to perfection.  The meat was excellent quality. The service was flawless.  I would recommend this restaurant as well as the hotel.  The Hermitage wow. Not rushed.  Just good food.

Not impressed. I'm from Long Island and the Capitol Grille where I'm from is fantastic. I had the summer lasagne which was goat cheese sauce and 8 slices of zucchini with a sprig of parsley. Oh PAlease and my husband had the Tuesday special that was lukewarm at best. It would have been nice if the waiter wasn't wearing cologne and came back to the table once during our meal.

Love the capital grill went to lunch with my wife today. Service was nonexistent. My meal was cold and the staff didn't check to see if every thing was alright.my wife's vegetarian lasagna had no pasta so it was 7 pieces of squash with sauce very disappointed will never go back

Upon arrival to Capitol Grille we were a bit confused thinking it was the franchise. However we were pleasantly surprised as our waiter explained the history of the restaurant. As the staff bustled around like anger honey bees changing all table linens with each turnover, I couldn't help but notice the Matre'd had a bulge in his pants the size of an eggplant.  His pants were tighter than my father's wallet at a school fundraiser. His jacket looked like something found in the kids section of a department store and I'm sure the entire look was very European but I couldn't get past the battle of the bulge. Need less to say this kept us entertained the entire evening.. The salads come from
Their own farm and we're fresh and delish. My steak was cooked perfectly but the star of the dinner was the dessert beigne with blueberry compote and lemon buttercream ice cream was amazing.

business.name: Bourbon Street Distillery
business.categories: Nightlife, American (Traditional), Food, Bars, Restaurants, Beer, Wine & Spirits

reviews.text:
Just stopped in town for keys to friends apartment. This joint was literally right across the street. So we decided to stop for brunch/lunch.

There was some pretty cool decorations in the joint. We ate upstairs and just about had the place to ourselves. As always the first item is usually a beer and this spot was no exception. 

Got a new phone after this visit so I am not sure what I actually had. But I'm sure it was good.
Great place!!! Beer and bottle and can selection will satisfy All!!!! Music selection hits all genres perfectly. Bartender is fantastic. Can't wait to come back and try tasty looking food menu.

We love this place!  Unbelievable food - salmon, catfish, po-boys, tenderloins, crawfish etouffee - and a great atmosphere.  Definitely worth checking out whether you are local or in town for business or fun.  You will not be disappointed.
Had a great burger and fries for lunch. It was a quick in and out. I could tell that if you don't get in early you may have to wait awhile. Sat at the bar. I think its a local place.
Kind of a funky little place with good sandwiches and great portions. Decore is a little tired that you need. Good place to watch a baseball game.
Nice atmosphere overall. Staff appears friendly, and patrons seem to enjoy the place.

Stopped here a few years ago after the mini marathon and really enjoyed our food (we had just ran 13 miles) so after a canal bike ride on a Saturday afternoon we headed back!  The place was pretty empty but it was the middle of the afternoon on a Saturday. The bartender/waitress was very unwelcoming-- didn't even speak to us and acted annoyed we were there.  That being said, our pulled pork sandwich and Reuben were both large portions and very good. Salty fries but that's a good thing in my book!  Looked like a variety of drink specials throughout the week.  We usually eat on Mass Ave when downtown and will continue to but this was pretty good even if the service was amazing.

My husband and I went here twice during our visit to Indianapolis. We parked nearby so we started and ended our day here with a drink. It looked neat from the outside because they have ample outside seating. Both visits were just "meh."  The downstairs bathroom was disgusting which kinda matched the bar as a whole, cluttered and dirty. We only had a drink because I can only imagine how the kitchen looked. Both bartenders we encountered were less than pleasant. The day bartender was slightly better but we didn't feel welcome at all. Even still we came back later that night since we were parked right outside.  That experience was even worse.  The night bartender was sitting down at the bar and acted super annoyed that we came in.  It wasn't late so it's not as if she was trying to close.  Overall,  we won't be back on our next visit to Indy. There are too many cool bars in the area to waste our time and money here. We will definitely find somewhere else better to park next time!
Unique place.  We only have had lunch there since we brought kids with us so we sat outside.  The chips is made fresh and the po boys are really good.  Very Cajun!
Stopped here on our way from Ohio to Kansas and we were blown away! The po boy sandwiches are amazing! The mac n cheese was delicious! Really neat location in the middle of downtown!

The food is decent and the drinks are cheap! Both times I've been here, the service was decent too! So no complaints! It's ordinary bar food, so don't expect any meatless options, but I would only suggest coming here for the drinks anyways - with food on the side.

Mondays: $1 beer
Tuesdays: $3 Corona & Dos Equis, and $4 Margarita

Was really excited to try this place. However i was extremely disappointed...started off that our server didnt get pur drinks out too us for about 20 minutes. Then we ordered our food and when they brought it out they first brought out only two meals (there were 8 of us) then the rest of us had to wait about 15 mins until our food came. Our fish and chips came out without any chips or our sides. One of the people in our party still didnt have their food at this point...they told us their printer was down but thats all the apology we got. We are not picky people but a restaurant should be held up to certain standards. They were not on it tonight. Maybe you will have a better experience.

Good food and drinks. Generous portions. Close to the canal to walk and build up an appetite. Great cocktails -Sezerac is especially good. 
Reasonably priced. I would advise sitting outside since it has kinda an odor inside. 
I would definitely recommend going back.
Derek took care of us tonight. He kept the kitchen open late and made great food recommendations. I'd highly recommend the calamari and triple grilled cheese. Class act...we will be back!

I love Bourbon Street because it's a step up from a dive bar... you don't have to be dressed up to be there and the food and drinks are affordable.  What gives it the step up is their food!  For being a no-frills bar, their menu is pretty diverse and their food is great!  For $20, you can easily have dinner and a couple beers (check their specials!).  Their upstairs patio is really nice in this beautiful weather.  A quick walk from the IUPUI campus, this spot is always a favorite after a long day of classes!

Why do servers in Indianapolis hate their lives so much these days?!? This bit*h of a server came out to the patio and said "what do you want?" And I asked for a beer menu and she said "I don't know where they are", so I was like..... "Uhhhhh I guess I'll get a water then???" And she just walked back inside and never came back out with our waters so we just left. Why would you work there if you can't put a fuc*ing smile on your face and do your go*dam* job?!?! Rant over

I went here last froday with a friend after a day at the zoo. Super friendly service, cold beer and good drink specials. I had the blackened catfish po boy. Really good! Very salty, but that's the blackening seasonings. The bread was very good, which is the heart of a po boy. My friend ordered the patty melt which looked good & was cooked to order. The stairs are shady. My friend is going through chemo and is having balance issues. It's a good thing they had two handrails.

Went 5pm on Saturday. Food was great, service was even better. Liked the second floor balcony. Over all if you like northern style Cajun it's a must stop. 

Had a burger rare and it was done right, and wings were pretty good. 

Beer selection was good, but not on tap.

Definitely sit outside!  I ordered the blackened catfish with a side of mac and cheese. The catfish had a nice spice to it and was the perfect portion. Everyone in my party was satisfied with their food, the portions for the pork chops and fish and chips were HUGE!!! Awesome beer selection. Definitely satisfied.
Food very good. Here for lunch and not busy. Cooks very friendly. Bartender warmed up but could have shown better customer service from the beginning. Felt like we were an imposition on her time.

I was in no way impressed with the Bourbon Street Distillery... perhaps because I am from New Orleans and get to experience the real Bourbon Street whenever I feel like it. The real Bourbon Street is much, much better... 

A friend and I stopped in when we were in Indianapolis for business. We were staying at the Courtyard Marriott across the street and liked the idea of a short walk to grab dinner and drinks. 

I had the BBQ ribs special with red beans and rice... I went with the ribs after the bartender went on and on about how good the pit master was and how delicious his ribs were. I really didn't enjoy them... they were way too tough and had what tasted like a cheap, store bought BBQ sauce slathered all over them. 

The red beans and rice, which is a staple in New Orleans, were terrible. They reminded me of a canned red beans and rice I used to buy when I was in college... and that's not good. The problem with the dish is hard to describe, but they tasted nothing like typical Louisiana red beans and rice. I really didn't enjoy any of my meal and I had to explain to my co-worker, who is not from New Orleans, that the food at this place is in no way representative of the awesome food we have down in New Orleans.  

Aside from the food, the place really isn't particularly appealing in it's other aspects either. I noticed that it wasn't particularly clean (now THAT'S something that is similar to Bourbon St.), and the beer selection was not good. We couldn't get out of there fast enough... 

BOTTOM LINE: In no way representative of Bourbon St. or anything else New Orleans. Unless you have no other option, I'd look for another place to go.
The food was amazing. It tasted like legit Cajun food. The restaurant itself was dirty and smelled like piss.
This is a great place to eat! The atmosphere is kitchy and the waitstaff very friendly. The food is wonderful! I highly recommend you give this place a try.

Its a dive bar with great food.

Best tenderloin sandwich in Indy!

This place was a home away from home a few years back when I was in Indy for work.    This was a great place to visit for dinner and a couple drinks to unwind.   So much of the food is great, but my favorite and go-to, was the Cajun Chicken Pasta.    Not the healthiest dish, but definite comfort food.    Looking forward to another drive over from Chicago soon!

business.name: Cross Culture Restaurant
business.categories: Indian, Restaurants

reviews.text: Never heard of this place before, probably because of the name it doesn't stick out as an Indian restaurant, but decided to take a chance since it's hard to find really good Indian spots in south Jersey and a lot of places seem to phone it in. The space has these huge comfy booths and there were only a couple other tables taken up. I think the best compliment I can give is that after our meal I kept  wondering "why isn't this place more crowded??" Even the mango lassi was the best one I've ever had in my life. We tried a bunch of different grilled tandoori meats, the tikka masala, paneer and another app that I can't remember the name- all of which were excellent, but even small things like the rice, naan and side sauces were absolutely stellar. Would highly recommend and if you go don't sleep on the lassi!
Prompt service. The food was delicious. Very reasonably priced. Not too crowded on a Thursday night. Would definitely recommend.
One of our favorite restaurants in Haddonfield. Everything we've ordered has been great - never a disappointment.

Love the atmosphere inside, the service is great, the food tops it all. When we pick up our takeout it is always ready on time. I've tried many of the Indian restaurants in the haddonfield and collingswood area this is by far my favorite!!

When we walked in, the aroma isn't great.  That's the reason I give one star less.  Everything else is really nice.  The curved, round table booths are superb for giving the privacy.  

Felt strange when the waiter just walks in free hand and takes your order.  
We ordered, 
- Malai Kofta, spice level 2, 
- Panner Tikka, spice level, 4
- Bhendi Masala, spice level 7
Butter Naans and Garlic Naans. 

I was so sure he is going to mess up, but all came exactly as we ordered. 

Food was super delicious. 

Waiters were courteous and polite.  Masked up. 
But gave a feeling that we are talking to robots.  Human touch was missing.  Sure they don't ruin the evening but didn't help either.  They were sticking to their routine and doing a perfect job.  I shouldn't complain.  But it would be "really" nice if they can give a smile and ask "How are you" rather than politely asking "Are your ready with the order sir" as the first sentence/conversation.  

Ambience is good. Food is great.  Service is good. 

Don't miss.  I will sure go again.

Very good experience, great service, BYOB is welcome!   The lamb vindaloo at spice 7 level is just fine,  the chicken tikka masala at 7 was a bit mild, however still tasty.  Garlic naan was excellent, still thinking how good those were!    as out of town visitors we welcomed this excellent meal, and as Indian's we know these guys know how to cook!

I went down from JC to visit my best friend and for dinner, we went out to this restaurant by accident haha but it was a delicious accident! the food was delicious and I loved how they asked from 1-10, how spicy did we want each dish. everything was delicious. we ordered chicken tikka masala, the okra dish, lamb tikka masala, and others with rice  I would love to go back again. the chicken was cooked a little too well done is my only negative feedback, otherwise service was thoughtful and nice
Solid food. Have tried the tandoori chicken, tandoori shrimp, paneer tikka masala and naan. I will definitely come here again.

Update to my previous review is very simple: Still really great local Indian, in fact, I think this my new favorite place for Indian. They have really great Naan with nuts that other rivals don't seem to have. I like the signature dishes and it was in my house in a flash through Grub Hub.

This is a great Indian restaurant in the heart of Haddonfield NJ. The food and service were both excellent and I would definitely go back again for my Indian cravings. They can make it as spicy as you want from a scale of 1-10.  Of you want it hotter please ask them for Indian hot. Everything was homemade and fresh. From the different flavors of naan bread to the mixed tandoori grill. The lamb vindloo had great spices very flavorful and the meat was very tender. Each dish is accompanied y basmati rice which is made to order. We tried the chicken tikka masala and the chicken curry. The nasal had a sweeter taste to it and the curry was more flavorful. For dessert we had gulam jamun which is a fried dough ball in sweet syrup and that came out fresh and hot. Highly recommends his Indian place and we will definitely be back again.

What can I say other than this place is amazing! Everything we ordered was made with love and very nice. Even the naan was lovely.

Obviously, a ton of vegetarian options and many vegan options. I will be coming back!
Delicious food to-go during the pandemic!  My favorite is the Saag Paneer- I couldn't even try to make it better myself!

I have had continuously disappointing service here. I've been a customer for over 6 years and i haven't had a good experience here in awhile. They struggle to stay true to their hours. I can't find consistent information about them. Whether I'm dining in or taking out I never feel like my satisfaction as a customer is a priority however, despite all of that, they have the best Indian food I've ever had. I continue to fight through the pain of going here, against my better judgement, because I simply cannot find a place that even comes close to comparing.

Very good Indian food at a decent price. My sister and I got 2 teas, the chiefs meat platter and an app. For $58 including tip and was full the rest of the day! The service was great and they provided outdoor seating. I will be coming back to Cross Culture!

Due to the unseasonably warm weather we dined her at the outside tables. We loved everything we had! The highlights were the samosas (though we got 3 large ones we ate them all), the mixed grill (the seafood was perfectly cooked), and the vegetable biryani (fragrant and delicious). The service was excellent as well; our waiter was very attentive and polite. This will be our new go to for Indian food from now on!

This is a very pretty restaurant for a date night. My husband and I went to dinner here with another couple and we enjoyed the food and ambiance.  I was surprised how efficient the only waiter that was on duty was. He was a one man show. We started with shrimp over eggplant and veggie samosas, they were both were good. I hate eggplant but this was fried right . Our entrees were good and flavored just right. My husband had the sampler platter and the goat curry was in it was amazing. I thought the prices and portion size were a bit off but hey its Haddonfield.  I would go back if it was for a special occasion because of the ambiance, but for a regular Indian food craving I would go to another place.

Went for Saturday evening dinner. Sat outside. Ordered tandoori mixed meat/seafood grill. Menu said it comes with grilled mixed vegetables. But there were only a little sautéed greens and red onions. Dish was good and flavorful, but I wish there were also grilled vegetables. I ordered the garlic Naan and the paneer kulcha Naan (Naan stuffed with cheese and seasonings). Both were good. My friend ordered chicken Tikka Masala, came with rice. Good, but a little different taste than other places where I've had this Dish.  Will return.
All your favorite Indian dishes are on the menu. Great variety to choose from including vegetarian, chicken, shrimp and lamb. I like to try a different appetizer with every visit!
Amazing food and excellent service. Hands down my new favorite for Indian food. Will order from them on a very regular basis going forward.
Always delicious! On the pricey side, but the portions are generous and everything from naan to biryani is homemade and really tasty.

The food was amazing, we all got different dishes and everyone loved everything. The only reason I would take one star off is that the outdoor seating, the only thing available during this covid situation, could use some work. It would be infinitely better if they added some umbrellas to provide shade

I hate to leave a bad review, but in this case I feel it necessary.  I've almost never had Indian food I didn't like, but the dishes in this order ranged from mediocre to truly awful, to actually missing from the order. And I'd meant to try this place for a long time.  How disappointing.

I ordered delivery on Father's Day, after seeing it was being offered at no extra charge.  The food arrived warm and on time. 

 I had originally had the Papadam in my online cart. Then I saw they were included in the vegetarian mixed appetizer, so I added that and deleted the separate order of Papadam. The food arrived, I opened the bag.  No Papadam.  That was a bad start.  Oh, well, at least I have Samosas.  Those lacked seasoning, were heavily breaded, and extremely greasy.  Truly just short of being inedible.

The main dishes were just so so.  No real heat to the Chicken Vindaloo.  The fish curry was not at all as described on the menu, in a thin sauce and tasting a tiny bit fishy.  The best I can say is that the rice was fine and plentiful.  The mint and tamarind chutneys that came with the appetizer were good.
Love this place. Have ordered here a few times during the pandemic. The food is hot and prompt, the flavor and value are terrific. Highly recommend their split pea soup and Masala dishes.
The food and service are both top notch.  I've gone there on lunch hour and live the variety.  Chris Vtrainers Personal Training Studios

We have eaten in and gotten delivery from this local restaurant in Haddonfield. Both experiences have been excellent. The food is delicious. The delivery has always been on time. We were able to get contact free delivery during the pandemic which was much appreciated. I like that you are able to indicate spice level in your order. I highly recommend Cross Culture!

business.name: Guppy's Good Times
business.categories: Bars, Nightlife, American (New), Local Flavor, Tacos, Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Mexican

reviews.text: Friends moved nearby recently so we met them at Guppy's for dinner and drinks. First time being there and was impressed. High tables inside in addition to the bar stools, several TVs behind the bar. Plenty of beers on tap, probably around 15; standard yuengling, etc. and also some local beers. They also had a house cocktail list and a separate seasonal cocktail list. Two of the seasonal drink specials were with screwball pb whiskey; one with screwball and peppermint schnapps in hot chocolate and another was with screwball and either baileys or kahlúa and something else I think. Both of them were delicious. As a table we ordered plenty; French onion soups, Buffalo chicken egg rolls, bison burger sliders, and more. Every dish that hit the table was great; the food was hot and tasted fresh not frozen. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive without being a bother. Given the fact that my friends now live within walking distance, we'll definitely be back. Definitely recommend Guppy's!

Came here for the Eagles vs Cowboys game. The atmosphere was very lively, definitely a go to spot for sports events. 

I had the chicken sandwich here, it does NOT disappoint. It's definitely up there when it comes to the best tasting chicken sandwiches in the Philly/Philly suburb region. I definitely recommend it, especially if it's your first time here.
We had great sushi take out tonight! The avocado  on the sushi was so fresh. We normally eat there, but found the takeout just as great!
I LOVE JOHN - He was so attentive and sweet! We had a lot of friends asking for different drinks and he was ontop of it! Can't wait to come back and ask for John!

A regular spot for me. I love coming for lunch and happy hour. Can't go wrong with the chicken sandwich or the Kathy Romano wrap. If they have sushi - get it! It's surprisingly delish. Great beer list and cocktails. Service can be slow when it's busy, but that's okay when you're just hanging out. Recommend!

This place is great! We got edamame and Gup's chowder for appetizers and they were really good. For our meals we got the Kathy Romano wrap (with sweet potato fries on the side) and the taco salad with chicken. The wrap was phenomenal and the salad was huge. The prices were fair and the service was great. I 100% recommend this for lunch or dinner!
Best burgers!  The quality of the beef and the special sauce really make these burgers exceptional!  Great fries and onion rings too!

love the sushi and you can't go wrong with any of the food, drinks are also great. John is the man and the girls are all super friendly, great neighborhood spot for a fun atmosphere and good time any time of day.

My favorite bar in conshy!  My friends & I have been coming here for years, the servers are always friendly and attentive!! John the bartender always makes it a point to come say hello and make sure we're taken care of! Guppys is the perfect place to grab a drink for happy hour or start your night on the weekends! BOGO sushi is a must & the rest of the menu is amazing as well!

Don't leave your receipt on the table. They will change your total price in their system and upcharge. Was just there for lunch ($60) and they charged my card $80. Unfriendly employees and mediocre food.

Happened to hear about this place on a local radio station and looked up their menu and couldn't wait to give it a try. We decided to go with some friends, so there were 8 of us (4 adults and 4 kids) and we did make reservations ahead of time. Initially we were told we couldn't make a reservation for 8 as they didn't have any tables that could accommodate that size but when I called back a few days later, they took our reservation for 8 without question. We went with one of their private rooms and the table was really meant more for 6 but we squeezed 8 around it. It was nice being in our own private room and each room is uniquely decorated. Even though it's a private room, it's not quiet. Overall, it's pretty noisy in there. Their was a TV in the room (no sound) but music was blaring throughout the place. It did make it a little tough to have a conversation. Food was really good and fresh and portion sizes large! We started with the guacamole and mozzarella wedges which was all quickly devoured. For my entree, I went with the hearty Thai chicken salad and had plenty for leftovers the next day! My wife had the shrimp and fish tacos which she said was some of the best she has had and they were able to accommodate her gluten-free allergy by swapping out the tortillas for corn. My son loved his Wowee Burger. We wanted to try their desserts, but we were so full that we had to take a pass on this visit. Service was very good throughout. The biggest issue here is parking. They don't have a dedicated lot so it's parallel parking in the street, but we struggled to find an open spot and wound up parking 4-5 blocks away. There is a church across the street from them that said church parking only but our waitress said we could have parked there as well. We will definitely be back!

Love that they're doing sushi more than one day a week. Their BOGO sushi roll Thursdays is a great deal. I'm happy these guys pulled through the difficult times of the pandemic. Looking forward to many more meals here.
Lots of outdoor seating and super friendly staff! We got cauliflower tacos and the wowee burger and both were delicious. Great place for a casual hangout
Love guppy's more every time I come! I didn't catch his name but the server with the tattoos was super accommodating! Thanks for everything.
3 stars because food was great but the bartender with the tattoos had the energy of an ear plug. Rude and unpleasant. The type of guy that'll take you to bed and not text you back again.

Finally got a chance to get to Conshohocken and check this place out. Was not disappointed. My wife and I both had the FAMOUS jeweler Joe's chicken sandwich  THE BEST CHICKEN SANDWICH we ever had. The coleslaw and chopped pickles made it for me.

Went here with my family and had a very rude server. We all ordered an alcoholic beverage and then ordered an appetizer for the table. We were told that every single one of us has to order an entreé in order to have any alcoholic beverages. I live in PA and this is not the law. When I asked the server why this was a rule, he basically ignored me and just walked away. Needless to say we left and will not be coming back.

Amigo Dan and I stopped here on our day of 5000 cheesesteaks. We order two drinks and a cheesesteak to split. We were told that we needed to get 2 food items. I asked what is the cheapest thing on the menu. The waiter responded, 'wings are on special.' I looked on the menu and right next to the wings was Guacamole. I ordered the Guacamole. The waiter left. The waiter returned.  He said Guacamole doesn't count. I said fine we'll take the wings. The waiter left. The waiter returned.  He said the wings didn't count. We left.  Ironically I took my sign selfie next to a painting on their wall that said, 'Whatever the ?, Love is the answer.'  Middle of the afternoon.  One person there eating.
I went here pre covid and I wouldn't return. Rude tattoo guy should learn to at least smile if he's working customer service.

Great food! Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend the Mexican Street Corn. It was amazing. Quick service and friendly staff. The owner came out to make sure we enjoyed our meal. So glad we found this place!

The worst place ever. Don't go there. Their staff is so rude, the manager John himself is a racist a******. This restaurant and it's staff is the perfect example of what's happening now a days. So if you don't want to be treated like a p**** of s*** , save yourself a trip. I am also going to report the incident to authorities.

The best burgers around! You can't beat the Monday burger special and the burgers most definitely do not disappoint. They also have a make it "skinny" option which is no bun and a side salad instead of fries which is a nice feature! This place has become one of my favorite spots for burgers! Also they make a great Bloody Mary! Staff is so friendly and overall just a fun atmosphere to eat and drink.

Food was good, but the bartender with the tattoos was, by far, the most unfriendly asshole I've ever had as a server. Does he not realize that he works for tips? I'm surprised that he still has a job here with his attitude, he must be related to the owner. Never said hi, never asked what we wanted to drink, never once asked if we needed refills, never asked how the food was, nothing! He sucks! Guppy's should get rid of him and find someone with a more positive, friendly vibe. If I owned a business, I certainly wouldn't want someone like this jerk representing it!

Favorite spot anytime we visit Conshy! They have a great selection of beers on tap and food! The Tuesday sushi special, BOGO is incredible! The orange crunch roll, the spicy tuna and phat Asian are my favorites! They also have a private area where you can host a party. Can't wait until we are in the area again to go back!

I've been getting lunch at this place on and off for about a year now. I've had a sampling of their burgers and their sushi. The food is pretty decent. However, the service is typically terrible. You'll be waiting a long time for your food or for anyone to even acknowledge you. Servers are consistently unfriendly and once you have your food after the usual excessive wait time, they rarely check in on you if at all. I hadn't gone in months because I usually regret it afterwards, but I figured I'd give this place another try for lunch. Well, nothing has changed. The wait time for a burger was close to 30 minutes and to top it off there was human hair actually cooked into the burger. Unfortunately I had already eaten about 95 percent of this thing before I pulled a 1.5 inch brown hair out of my mouth. I didn't complain about because I hate doing things like that, but I did mention it to the server when I asked for the check. The response was a quick "sorry about that" and my one drink off my tab; still paid for the hairburger. I'm totally done with this place. It's just inexcusable. Go here if you want to be treated like garbage.

business.name: Thanal Indian Tavern
business.categories: Asian Fusion, Restaurants, Indian

reviews.text: Truly delicious! Our go to Indian in Philly. Really great flavors and a bit more creativity on the menu than I normally see. Highly recommend
Fish preparation wasn't great, but all the other preparation was better than average. An OK place of yiu are looking for Indian restaurant in Philly

Order anything on the menu. You 100% wont regret it at all. The food is so amazing here and the spice level is great. I think it's difficult to find good Indian food in the city and this place is definitely on my list of favorites.

The Chicken Tikka Masala and Mushroom Mutter Masala were so creamy and packed with flavor from all the spices. Tikka Masala usually has some sweetness to it, though this one was just right in terms of not being overbearing. The Mushroom Mutter Masala though -- not only does the mushroom have a good meaty bite to it, there's a nice kick to it.

Gotta get the Gobi Manchurian as an app. These cauliflowers seem to be battered, then fried, and tossed-in-delicious-sauce-and-mixins *takes deep breath* get these.

I didn't enjoy the crab naan too much though it did have a subtle crab flavor and I could see some shreds of actual meat. I may opt for the cheese naan next time (heard that one is bomb).

The service was a bit scattered or not timed correctly. Wasn't too big of a deal because of how delicious everything was, but by the time I finished with the app, I was full! It's cool though because they have containers for you and just know I stuffed all the leftover rice into the container like a champ.

Exceptional food, however service was subpar. Waitress last Saturday was disappointing. Not friendly and seemed annoyed with us. Left me with a bad taste in my mouth. Even a smile would do. Or speaking a word.

We ordered takeout. The crab stuffed naan was just ok. It was cold and somewhat rubbery when we got home. The curry, however, was delicious. The portion sizes were a little smaller than what I'm used to for that price point though.
Walked in around 9pm and the waiter said I can't serve you we are closed and the time on yelp says they close at 10pm... didn't even offer take out!!  Very rude bad service....

Great food and good service for a packed place on a Friday! My boyfriend and I came for dinner without a reservation and they were able to seat us by the door pretty quickly. Next time I'll definitely call ahead for a reservation because they had to turn some people away who came in after us without one. Food can be spicy if you are spice sensitive. Great naan and masala dishes. Owner was super nice too!
Really bad bland Indian food. Probably the worst I've ever had. Service was also terrible. Not cheap either feel like I threw away $100 bucks

Delicious Indian food. Everything was very tasty and seemed to be authentic (I can't personally confirm this but my friend from India who was with me said it was authentic!). Naan was great, as was the paneer, the goat curry, and a spicy chicken dish that we had. 

Only downside is that the service was slow, but very friendly waitstaff. Will be coming back very soon!

I love Thanal!  Been coming here ever since they opened!  The food is always delicious and they are the nicest people!  Love the Jazz band outside they have when it's warm.  Hoping the buffet can make a comeback once the pandemic settles down.  That was my favorite,

One of the best tap beer selections I've seen at an Indian restaurant and the food was stellar! We had the spread below and nothing was underwhelming, quite the opposite actually. Along with the great food and beverages, the service was on point!  

Crispy Cauliflower
Onion Pakora
Tikka Masala
Vegetable Korma
Naan & Roti
Utterly disappointed! It was literally the most bland biryani I've ever had and it also gave me food poisoning! Avoid this place like the plague.

I made it back for dinner and even as I write, I can't wait for the next opportunity to eat here. 

My friend T. loves Indian food as much as I do. While we both enjoy cuisines that do not radically alter themselves in order to appeal to timid tastebuds, neither one of us shuns Sukhi's frozen samosas or Trader Joe's version of butter chicken or their garlic naan. We also both have no hesitation to shop for and make more complicated Indian dishes from scratch at home. This is to say that we are an easy, but also well educated, pair of diners.

We made an early dinner reservation, arrived hungry and were seated immediately. We started our repast with Indian Railway Peppers, deep fried wax chiles and Gobi Manchurian, cauliflower florests in a spicy, tangy Indochinese style sauce. Hari, the manager, seated us and served our appetizer, commenting that we seemed to like 'the spicy stuff.' Yes and perfectly spicy both dishes were! T. and I were practically thumb wrestling to see who got the last bites of each dish. 

To go with our entrees, we chose garlic naan, Thanal bullet naan-another spicy item with chili-and peshwari walnut naan. The latter was something I'd never seen or tried before (it's made with coconut, sultanas and walnuts)  but will now make a point to eat whenever it's available and possibly try my hand at in my own kitchen.

The mains were tandoori pomfret, which is a whole fish with curry leaves (T. swooned over those) and kashmir chiles. The fish was tender and moist and we picked it clean like starving animals. Chicken chettinand was our second entree. I first had a baby eggplant version of this at Amma and was hooked. Thanal makes this with meltingly perfect boneless chicken cooked in an onion-tomato gravy flavored with chettinand masala and fresh curry leaves. While our rice was ample, we did not want to miss a drop of the juices and gravy from either dish so we ordered additional plain naan to aid in our gluttony and left absolutely nothing on any bowl or plate. The naans we tried, by the way, are all utterly superb and I could, if I was utterly shameless, order one of each and make a meal of just that, a chutney or two and a few gin and tonics. The thought of the crab naan has me salivating...

Hari and other servers checked in with us often, joked and chatted pleasantly and kept our water glasses full. Dessert was offered; as much as T. and I love rasmali, which is on the menu, due to our earlier grand feasting, we had to decline. 

T. chided me for keeping Thanal Tavern to myself for so long and then promptly ordered a lamb biryani to go for her next night's dinner. Yes, it's all THAT good and yes, don't put off visiting-come taste for yourself.

Had reservations here for a weekend evening for outdoor seating. Tables were comfortably spaced out. I ordered the butter chicken which was flavorful. My friends ordered the chicken korma and hanal special goat curry. I had a bite of each and enjoyed it. The Hanal special goat curry seemed like a bigger portion for a few dollars more than the other dishes. Got both the truffle and garlic naan, both were good. Truffle on anything is always a plus but it is a few bucks more. 

Food took a little long to come out but it was busy. 
Since the restaurant is in 20th street which is a main road, there were many loud cars and rescue vehicles driving by so don't expect a quiet dining experience outdoors. 

Street parking. Some spots are free parking in the evening (check the signs!) 

The staff was very nice and patient.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I was in philadelphia for a weekend trip to catch up with friends and we decided to go here. My friend said she always walked past here and it always smelled good. She was not wrong. 

Price - Reasonable - $16 for veggie dishes, $18 for chicken, $20 for goat and $22 for seafood. 

Service - The waitresses were super nice and very helpful. My friend was torn between two dishes and the waitress was able to describe each dishes and how they differ to help my friend make a des

Food - We got Mango Lassi, Chicken Korma, Butter Chicken, Hanal Special Goat Curry, Garlic Naan and Olive and Truffle Oil Naan. All the meat dishes was really good, flavorful and tender. There was slight kick to the korma with certain bites that caught me by surprised, but wasn't terribly spicy. My favorite was the Hanal special goat curry. It had the most flavor but not overwhelming. It's only $2 more than the chicken but I felt like you got 1.5x more - worth it! 

The naans were crispy and not flimsy. It still held it shape the next day. They cut it into 4 triangle pieces per order. The truffle naan was so good! I couldn't really taste the garlic on the garlic naan. 

The mango lassi had a little ginger flavor to it. Not sure how I felt about it. It's different than other mango lassi I had. I don't know if I would order it again.

Absolute outstanding. Had chicken tikka masala for entree (really good, on par with Ekta's which I think is really good). Person I was with had chicken tandoori; just a bit bland without the additions although cooked really nice-when adding the chutney, it was amazing though. Gobi Manchurian was pretty nice for an appetizer. Haven't tried the rest of the menu yet. Service good enough, if just a bit slow at times (though to be fair it was pretty busy).

Decent selection of beer too.

The foods delicious and the service as very quick. Our waitress was great and she provided.some great recommendations. 

For southern Indian food, it wasn't very spicy - but not bland either. We would've preferred spicier dishes. The naan was amazing and very fluffy. Also, the portion sizes are huge! Keep that in mind in while ordering

This place had been in my Yelp wishlist since the last few years as I had found the place while searching for Kerala Porotta serving places near me ( 3.5 hours near(far) from my place in Connecticut). I had even seen raving reviews about the dish specifically
They have such good reviews barring a few recent reviews, I don't know if something changed recently, the overall experience was very disappointing.
We did have a reservation, yet were seated after waiting for 10 minutes. They are clearly short staffed and a single employee was handling all the guests seating arrangements.
We were seated outside (as they did not have enough indoor seating space and it felt congested inside). It was a hot summer evening and to add to the already non pleasant experience, we were seated right next to the people playing guitar and xylophone. It was too loud (I can see many reviewers mentioning the same). It took forever for the food to arrive and once arrived, the food tasted pretty bad. The eggplant koora (vegan) tasted just like how I make onion tomato gravy when I cook on lazy days (bland).  Kerala porotta seemed like it is from a frozen paratta packet. We couldn't finish any of the dishes and they did not bother to ask why was there so much food left.
The only thing we got here more than what we expected was the amount in the check. For such average food and service, we got a huge bill. I will never be back to the place!

Absolutely amazing. Came here after spending a day in Philly (I'm from North Jersey) and we were looking for local Indian food. So happy I came across this place. It is by far the best Indian food I've ever had. Everything is delicious. Servers are extremely friendly. The Tikka Masala tacos are to die for. Highly recommend. The only knock I have on this place is that it's 2 hours away from me. If you're looking for high quality Indian food this is a must have.

Came here because my dinner partner never had Indian food, I had to take care of that. We were seated quickly since it was pretty dead, the owner came out to greet us and was a awesome guy. Real genuine and personable I love hospitality he's shown. The food was all great, we got a few different naan for her to try, butter chicken, onion pakora and chicken Briyani. Can't go wrong with butter chicken and naan bread. My friend could eat the broth and naan alone. The Briyani was well seasoned, great texture on the rice not soggy. Oinion pakora was better than onion blooms or rings. All the naan bread we had were great.

Vindaloo lamb - incredible flavor, tender meat, spice level was just perfect. Spicy, but not overwhelming. 

Garlic naan - very fresh and tasty. I received two pieces that were a little on the smaller side. Flavor was great 

Vegetable samosa (2) - very good flavor, spice level was excellent when dipped in the vindaloo sauce. Only complaint is that there was a little too much crust. So I just peeled it off.
