I really want to give this place a 5. I really do. The American-Indian fusion was great. They had such unique dishes including crab naan (what?), and the chicken tikka masala is a must. It was so creamy and buttery - you couldn't go wrong with it. My only issue is that they the food came out 30 minutes after I was expecting it. They told me it would take 30 minutes, but it took another 30 minutes on top of that. They did seem busy, granted, but an hour is just a little too long. I would love to come back here, especially because its a gem in an area that has a paucity of indian food - but you really need to plan ahead if you want to eat here. Otherwise the curries were really good and flavorful, but they could use a little bit more protein in my opinion.
They kept customer wait for 55 min for a takeout order while kept saying 20 min. 2 more min. 5 more min.   When they could have told us more than that. Will not come back.

The food was delicious! The space was quite dark and loud -- the latter being mostly attributed to a 13 year old's birthday party. I appreciated that they sat our party of 5 less than an hour before closing without all of us being present at once. Sadly they were not serving dosa which is why we chose this restaurant over others. Still... many vegan/vegetarian options and friendly service.

business.name: The Crossing
business.categories: French, Restaurants, American (New), Italian

reviews.text: We came here on NYE. Our service was great the waitress was a doll and I had no issues with that. The food is underwhelming and I think over priced. My tenderloin was small and lacked flavor: the pasta course was slimy and the broth was too strong. Salad was good. The crème brûlée which I would've loved to order was ruined by adding ginger. I got blackberry sorbet. Meh. For the cost of the food I would think they could update the interior, it is dated with diff light fixtures and no consistent design or ambience. Same as it was 15 years ago. The other restaurant they own is Acero and that is one of my favorite places. They are very nice here but I'm not rushing back.

We love this cozy little place. You always have lots of choice as far food from meats to seafood to vegetarian. They also offer a prixfix menu ! I have bounced all over the menu and have never been disappointed! I love any of the fish  specials, and the foie gras appetizer is a favorite. The servers know what they are doing and do it well. You can trust their judgment. So order a very well made cocktail sit back and relax, your in good hands!
This restaurant has never disappoints. I've been here many times it's always perfect are waiter was Sunny and he knocked it out of the park with his service. Can't wait to go back again

My husband and mother being picky and very needy, however, without any hesitation, the restaurant was super accommodating. Of course, the food and drinks were great , but sometimes the service is what makes it 5 star restaurant. Thank you!
Fantastic! Went for lunch! My 65 yo brother said it was the Best Caesar salad he had  ever had. Service was great my salmon was wonderful, and my sister-in-law loved her salad!
Celebrated our 10 year anniversary here.  Best food (Chef's Grand Tasting).  Best service by Ben. Comfortable. Very clean.  I definitely recommend it!

In true French fashion, The Crossing values the meal experience. Servers are demure yet passionate, and they treat each guest with respect. It seemed stuffy at first, but as we interacted with staff, they interacted too, in concerted and theatric respect and passion for the cuisine. Staff works together well, from server to bartender to server helpers (bussers?). The quarters are small and cozy, in swanky Clayton.

We had great luck, as they had Kobe Wagyu 2oz portions on the appetizer menu. This dish was incredible. We are still dreaming about it. We also received a complementary cheese based soufflé to dip crispy bread pieces, as well as bread and butter. They knew it was my spouse's birthday and had a happy birthday card waiting for him at the table. We were treated well throughout. 

We chose to do the tasting menu. Every single dish was delicious. Dessert was the least impressive though still quite tasty and beautifully plated. We had four cocktails off the menu and also ordered two dirty martinis. We had hand-stuffed blue cheese olives in our martinis, which always earns major brownie points from us. 

A great restaurant for a celebratory, upscale meal.

Great restaurant. I had a wonderful night with my wife for our anniversary. The food was at awesome at reasonable price, and the service was super friendly. Definitely will be back to this place again.

Outstanding.  

Food: Delicious. Quality. Some of the best food in the city.  
Atmosphere: Cozy and classy. Dress up.
Value: Pretty great. It's expensive but it's worth it.
Service: Exceptional.

Every aspect of the dinner was perfect. We both had the tasting menu and chose the upcharge for the Dover sole special.  Totally worth it. Each course was delicious and the presentation was true art. The service was impeccable.

Came here with a friend on a Thursday night. We opt for the tasting menu with wine pairing. 

First course tuna tartare was nice and flavorful. Second course pan seared foie gras, texture was great. It melts in your mouth. Portion was super small for a $9 up charge. It was a little too heavy with the extra oil drizzled on top. 

Main course was halibut. I do like the flavor and the nice crust of the halibut, but it was over cooked unfortunately. 

Service was five stars , our server was nice and attentive. The wine pairing was on point.

My colleagues and I enjoyed a lovely dinning experience at The Crossing while doing business in St. Louis. The restaurant is a bit unassuming from the outside, but the food and service was exceptional. 

Our party of four all opted for the Premium Tasting Menu - 3 courses with wine pairings for each course and followed by dessert. 

Our waitress was wonderful, genuine and knowledgeable of the menu, specials and wine pairings. Everybody at our table enjoyed her personality, humor and professionalism. She made us feel very welcomed and never rushed. 

I enjoyed the potato/leek soup (vichyssoise), followed by tagliolini pasta with mushrooms, and the halibut as the main entree. All were very good, but the halibut was prepared perfectly. Definitely my favorite of all the courses. 

The wine pairings selected by the waitress were well chosen for the courses. I can't say I loved each wine, but they did have a nice balance with the food. 

The presentation of each of our courses were  beautiful set and creative. Your eyes knew it was good before you ever tasted it! Bravo to the chef! 

I'd recommend this restaurant for a nice evening out with a friend or date. If you appreciate a full dining experience, look no further than this charming place.

This restaurant honestly lives up to the reputation of greatness. 

Before I talk about the details, I highly recommend dressing in business casual to make the experience better. 94% of the people are dressed this way. It's a nice feeling. 

We visited for my wife's birthday on a Monday. Highly recommend calling in a reservation ahead of time. The place was full soon after 7 pm. The staff is perfect and exactly what you want when fine dining. We never felt neglected and always had fresh silverware for each course.

I think the premium tasting menu choices are the way to go. $58 per person for a top-tier, quality 4 course meal isn't badly priced. The selection is pretty diverse without choosing the few items that actually add extra to the bill. 

I'll let my pictures do most of the talking about the food but I want to mention we ordered a second plate of foie gras because it was that good. The portions were great. Large enough to enjoy the favors but not too big that interferes with the next course. We left completely full and without take home. 

It was a very Happy Birthday for my wife!
Always a top 3 restaurant in Saint Louis. Haven't been in a while but as usual it never disappoints. Luke was are waiter and he did a excellent job.

One of the very best places in STL for ambiance and food. Every dish was gorgeous and so delicious. The serving staff was so knowledgeable and friendly as well as professional. Always such a pleasure dining in this cozy gem.

This is truly one of the best dining establishments in St. Louis. The tasting menu is a must do! I love trying a variety of food items when I go out and the tasting menu offers four courses. The service is also second to none as the team works together wonderfully to keep drinks filled, cutlery needed current, and  to clear plates. The best part is the dining is so relaxed, I have eaten here multiple times and never once felt rushed plus the time between courses gives time to process a dish before moving onto the next. I definitely recommend the crab cakes!

I was there about three days ago, I found multiple hairs in my food and saw countless employees without masks on. They made me and my partner feel uncomfortable the entire time. It makes me wonder what other health regulations are not being followed. Maybe next time I'll stay home and let my 3 year old cook for me.

I wish I could post a zero star for this restaurant. The service and quality of food is  laughable, it looked like a 2 yr old made my plate. The smell was horrid, I was glad the mask  mandate is still in place but that did little to mask the smell of this run down restaurant I will never be going back. It's a slum of a restaurant and all they did was put lipstick on it to make it look good...

My wife and I travel quite a bit and we brought our four adult children here to St. Louis with us while staying at the Ritz Carlton around the street to visit SLU university where the youngest girls will be attending. This restaurant came highly recommended by our friends who live in the Saint Louis area. I must say that the food was outstanding; from the beet salad, to the tomato soup to the homemade pastas. 

Where the whole evening left a slightly sour taste in my mouth was the service. The waiter started out strong with a great wine choice and very attentive but faded after the entrees were served. At this point there was only one other table who he was more attentive to for some other reason. In addition the bus boy needed some training on removing dirty dishes; I would imagine that our dishes sat on our table after we were done eating for approximately 20 minutes. Therefore, no time or asking of dessert, coffee or after drinks that we were eager to have. 

Too bad that great food lacked great service in the end. Such a miss!!!!!!
Back open with 50 per cent capacity. Really good food and excellent service. Pricey but worth it. Still a little noisy

Everyone knows how great dinner is here

However on the lunch menu has the best burger and fries you can get with white linen tablecloths and napkins in the area. 

For those none "school day" well made cocktails enhance the experience. 

Perfect service not matter when you dine.

The Crossing has been on my list for some time, I was really glad to see that it lived up to my high expectations!

The waitstaff was very respectful of public health and everyone wore a mask (there's a lot of places that don't follow this rule). Our server knew the menu inside and out and gave us great recommendations. She was a lot of fun!

I started with the beet salad. The presentation was beautiful. All of the flavors went together perfectly.

My entree was the Spanish Octopus appetizer. This was the best octopus I've ever had. The texture was not chewy and had a nice crisp outside. I loved the sauce and peas that paired so perfectly.

For dessert I had the peach cobbler. They say it's meant to share.. but it was too good to let that happen!

I'll definitely be back! Highly recommend.
Always top notch.  The best pastas I have ever had along with Acero the sister restaurant.  Had my last meal there with 2 crispy chinos from rockwell brewing and it was heaven.

The service was fantastic. We sat at the thoughtful outdoor setup for those who wanted to take extra coronavirus precautions. The cocktails were great and so was the warm bread and butter. However, almost every component of our orders - the octopus, halibut, duck confit - were way oversalted. The flavors were completely unbalanced and I was unable to get through my entire main course. We finished off with the fried strawberry pie, which tasted good except for the overly sweet cream. Given how quickly the food came out, I wondered whether quality was being sacrificed. Overall, the menu was underwhelming and not worth the price unfortunately.

Very delicious, very upscale, and very quaint menu. A small menu is always exciting because usually the dining experience is very precise, and that's exactly what happened.
Delicious lobster bisque, tasty Dover Sole, and the lamb chops were divine.
Entrees are about $40-50 per person, so the tasting menu is worth considering as it's always nice to experience the chef's imagination, palate, and creativity on a plate.
Even the spread they give with the table bread is very tasty- bleu cheese with onions and garlic I believe- very satisfying, and very rich.

business.name: Tokyo Japanese Steak House
business.categories: Sushi Bars, Steakhouses, Restaurants, Japanese

reviews.text: My favorite restaurant. I've had every chef on the hibachi side and all of them cook really well. Great place for celebrating anything special. They even celebrated my 3 year anniversary and surprised us when they came out. I didn't even know they were going to. All the waiters and waitresses are very attentive and friendly as well, and always checking on you. Saturdays are busy so i recommend going on a weekday. Other than that great food and environment all around.
Love this place. I always order sushi and everything is always fresh and yummy!  The staff is also very friendly and I love the overall environment!

We have never had a bad experience. Everything is always good from appetizers,sushi or hibachi, Love love the salmon and scallops dinner! We always sit on the dining side and get excellent service. We have one other place in Smyrna we go. If we want American we go to HF and if we want sushi, hibachi we go to Tokyo. Oh and we live in Murfreesboro but well worth the drive.
Always good food and great staff.  The Hibachi Chefs are great!  Fillet is really good.  Good appetizers and good assortment of sushi available if you like it.
Really wonderful sushi! Service left quite a bit to be desired... took a long time to get our check and even longer to get water refills.

Pass. Food is mediocre and bland. When you order hibachi at regular table instead of at the grill it comes out "watery" on the plate. I still can't explain why that is. The food is nothing impressive. I don't need to try it again.
Best and freshest sushi in Middle Tennessee hands down. If you have the opportunity to sit at the sushi bar, DO IT-the chefs are awesome and the service is superb!
The best Hibachi on planet earth. Period. We're absolute fans and have (like many I'm sure) been to countless similar restaurants over the years. This is our absolute favorite, hands down.

The set up (once inside) is pretty awkward and not really, "ahhh this place is nice " I'm guessing because of COVID, however the food is excellent. We did the hibachi grill. The staff was pleasant and accurate with our orders. We were a party of 8 and everything went off without any negative issues. If you d drink, they do not skimp on the alcohol. I'm not real drinker, I ordered a Mai Thai (because I thought it would be on the sweet side), it was very pretty, however it had too much rum in it for me. I would absolutely recommend Tokyo Japanese Steakhouse!!!
I have been going to Tokyo Steak house for years and it is my very favorite place to go eat. They go above and beyond to satisfy your needs and are always friendly with the best service.
We were denied service and we called before we made the drive , we came 5 mins before the last seating . I will not be back and of course the manager didn't care

Excellent sushi! Staff was a little busy but didn't have to wait longer than the estimated wait time to be sat and food was delivered efficiently! Sushi was so yummy and can't wait to go back to try more!

We have frequented this place for the past two years and it NEVER disappoints! Always spic and span and the hospitality is unmatched anywhere near Smyrna. If you have never experienced the warm pineapple saki it's a holiday for the taste buds. Sometimes I just order take out for the soup and salad but I love just being able to grab and go if we don't have time for the hibachi. It's a solid high 5 from The Placek's

We dined there last evening with a couple of friends.  We sat at a Teppan table that served six persons.  The service was perfect, the food was very good and the portions were large.  You won't leave there hungry.

This place doesn't care about the health of the customer. They send out rare steak instead of making sure the meat is well done like you asked. Simply asked for a refund even with the picture evidence and receipt showing I asked for well done. The manager was rude as well. Did not care to even talk to the customer to resolve the issue. If I could give no stars I would in a heartbeat. 5 thumbs down

All hibachi is not created equal.  While the dinner "show" may be the sand tricks, the cooking quality is better than most other hibachis I've been to that typically over cook.  What I really love is their liberal use of garlic!  Recommend substituting miso in place of the clear soup, yum yum ginger dressing on your salad & a big scoop of chili paste with your meal.

Restaurant was clean and staff was very friendly.   Did the hibachi and our chef did an outstanding job of entertaining the table.     

Food was excellent and huge portions given.
Great service and great experience!!! Our chef Glenn was fabulous and made our birthday celebration with our aunt memorable
We had reservations for 11. They did a great job. The food was fresh and correctly prepared . They were entertaining. No complaints. I would go there again.

Been here twice and both times the food has been pretty good. Not much in the line of hibachi entertainment. It's pretty basic without any excitement. But that's ok the food is good as well as the service. 
 As I write this I would recommend the restaurant if you are in the area.

You get sooo much food and it's good. They sometimes charge to charge but 2 adults and 2 kids (14 and 12) we could technically split 2 meals and still have leftovers. We do 3 because 1 kid eats the salad and soup the other only eats the rice and chicken so no reason to get more salad and soup. They space you out now it's COVID which is nice.

Drove an hour to come here. Luckily we made reservations. My mom wanted Hibachi for her birthday. It was 9 of us AND everyone loved there food. The drive was well worth it!!!! I recommend doing a reservation so that you don't have to wait long. The cook was very entertaining, we loved him and our waitress. We all can't wait to go back!

Sadly, I was very disappointed Tuesday evening when I had dinner at Tokyo's. I requested my filet medium rare and it arrived well done with salmon which was 1/8 of an inch thick and just slathered in sweet sauce. I requested that the filet be redone in a polite manner. They made it WORSE - they just warmed it up, brought me the same plate back. However, the rest of the plate was now ice cold.....
Our two waiters wore gators but it does not protect patrons nor themselves when they do not cover their noses with it! I requested they do so and they just gave me a blank stare. 
I truly used to love this place but I was truly disappointed with sticky bench to sit on and water spots on silverware on top of it all.
I don't think I will be coming back again.

Great place to eat, friendly staff! Everything is delicious.
This is my go to for all my Japanese food

My family enjoyed the atmosphere, service, and food at Tokyo. My little ones weren't quite ready for the Hibachi table, so we opted for regular seating. Our server was so friendly and made our experience great. My husband and I can't wait to return for Hibachi!

business.name: Cafe Blue Moose
business.categories: American (New), French, Restaurants

reviews.text: Fabulous restaurant. One of the best in new hope but unfortunately tonight was their last night. Another incredible dinner and I will miss coming here very much. Solar and his Blue moose family have always been friendly, accommodating and so happy to serve. Skylar is a genius in the kitchen. Good luck in your next endeavor.

This is the best food in New Hope/Lambertville. Every meal is fantastic, as is the service. It's the only place I'll order salad. Food first, every time. I'm beyond sad that Cafe Blue Moose is closing. Eating out is always tough for me as I have a dairy allergy, but I know to ask or face the consequences. Blue Moose has always explained what's in their food when asked, and has gratefully substituted when able. I will miss the atmosphere, the ambience, and mostly the beautifully crafted and delicious food.

Impressive operation front to back. Food is outstanding. If you have to wait for a table, do it. The wait is worthwhile.

I had brunch on a busy hot Saturday afternoon. The table shared a Dutch-baby with blue berries and lemon curd. YUM. I had the Tom-lette with amazing potato latkes (these are your typical latkes), coffee cake muffin and applesauce. It was unique, perfectly balanced and memorable.

This place is amazing! There was a line outside before it even opened! I originally was not sure what to order (I am a picky eater) and ended up ordering a modified grilled cheese and it was amazing! I also had a vanilla latte which was delicious! I hope I can come back soon. Really nice interior and very modern!

PHENOMENAL FOOD BUT KEEP READING........staff is incredibly rude!! I am not a sensitive person who normally writes reviews like this. However, throughout our meal the waitress blatantly flirted with my boyfriend. To a point where she would not even speak to me or look me in the eyes. She would only speak to him. When she did address me it was in a condescending tone as if i were a child. I can put up with a lot but going out for a nice meal with your SO only to have it interrupted by someone being incredibly disrespectful is just not okay. In addition she told me my card was declined in a rude way and it was only declined because she treated the card as credit and not debit. (Yes i had money in my account) As my boyfriend then used his card the SAME exact one that i have and it miraculously worked. My family and I are regular goers of this restaurant, but now I will be hesitant to go in worries of having a unsatisfactory dining experience. You're a pretty sh#%$y person with zero respect if you blatantly flirt with someone's significant other while they are sitting right there....

love this place! the atmosphere, staff and food are all amazing! great breakfast options with a wide variety to match any craving you have! you can really tell the hard work that has gone into this establishment by the quality of the food and the personable staff. Never ordered something i wasn't happy with.

One of the best places I've been to in New Hope. The food is simple but very rich and flavorful. This restaurant is not cheap but, you get what you pay for here. The atmosphere can be a little stuffy as the restaurant is just a converted home however the staff are friendly and accommodating. Try the Honey Fried Chicken.

Super cute breakfast/brunch place not directly on Main Street. It gets pretty crowded we came early and we were lucky enough to snag the last table. Got the Dutch baby pancake and the asparagus scrambler (special). Both were yummy and the ambiance was really welcoming and sweet. We loved this breakfast!

I am so impressed with this place. The owner and chef is a very young man with huge passion and talent for the culinary arts. I've never had a bad meal here. The cuisine is French inspired. The salmon and creme brulee are amazing. 

This place is very small however so definitely call and make a reservation!

Food was fine. Nothing to write home to mom about. Had a weird time here. I have a minor allergy to tree nuts and this place is making me feel like crap about it. Allergy is pretty managed, not severe or life threatening and I am A-okay when I just avoid eating nuts. Places that cook etc. in the same space are fine for me and I worked at an ice cream shop serving up nuts for 5+ years. I do not warn everywhere I go that I have an allergy because if a dish features nuts that's nearly always called out because it's a pretty known allergen and my life isn't at risk. When I do end up eating nuts, I become extremely uncomfortable but I'm not going to dive into my symptoms ha but I'll say that walnuts are the worst. 

The ~pastry of the day~ was a zucchini muffin which was cool because you don't see those very often. My friend gave me a small bite and when put it down I saw a walnut baked in and knew I was about to have a time. Was traveling that day and was saved when my friend had a spare claritin. I was pretty disappointed that there was no mention that this was a zucchini nut muffin because I could have just not taken a bite. We told our waiter who gave an apology because what else was he going to say? The manager noticed our table's distress and reaction to this lack of remorse and came over to address the situation which from what I got from it, was that it was on me for not mentioning my nut allergy at the onset of the meal. That was MADDENING! Sure, I can ask and let everyone know, but how about the server ask if anyone has an allergy too? Or better yet, label the item on the menu (not the special menu which was where this was) as containing such. Putting a disclaimer at the bottom of the main menu that 1. doesn't mention nuts only shellfish and gluten and 2. just requests the customer speak up doesn't cover any kind of base. You can't guarantee someone reads and you also aren't stating everything! We were appalled that there was no accountability from the restaurant and that not listing that muffin as containing nuts was the bigger issue for me over not having a conversation, which is something I don't typically have to do because allergens are stated. 

I'm upset too because the business owner replied to another review on my friend's experience here and called my eating at a restaurant and not saying "I can't eat nuts" as "reckless and disrespectful" and that I need to take responsibility for myself. What good does it do to say that to a paying customer? Where is the remorse? If you weren't going to print the allergen on the menu, at least let the team know that day that there are nuts in the baked good. I'm sorry I didn't come in with my allergy on my sleeve that day but I'm even more sorry that an establishment had the reaction that they did over someone else's discomfort. It's one thing to not state that this dish has nuts but it turned into a completely other issue when the reaction from the business was to shift the fault onto the customer. I have never felt so uncomfortable speaking up for myself and I can't believe a restaurant has let that happen.

NOTE: Original review was 1 star as my friend suffered an allergic reaction and we were treated fairly rudely after the fact. Wait staff and owner were dismissive of our concerns and recommendations to change the label to "zucchini nut muffin" and instead blamed us for not knowing the muffin contained nuts. Had to acknowledge this multiple times before the owner was able to understand where we were coming from and offer an apology. 

The food was quite delicious and the coffee I got didn't taste watered down, which is often a problem with the iced coffee at restaurants.  I ordered the Zippity Omelet which was well stuffed (maybe a little bit too much cheese) with fresh ingredients.

The latkes and fresh applesauce were the stars of the meal. The applesauce had a wonderful, rich texture and paired well with the latkes. 

I also really enjoyed the aforementioned zuchini NUT muffin as I am not allergic to walnuts.  

My review would be lower due to the problems we had with the manager and owner but I did find the food to be fresh and delicious. The chef wasn't our problem here, hence the 4 star review.

Came here the other day with family and friends for a quick bite after shopping all day. We had a great time and were really happy to find this spot! We chose this restaurant based on the abundantly positive reviews and were inspired by the story behind the eatery. As young adults, it was really cool to find a spot managed by, staffed by, and created by people just like us. 

The food was rather good. I wish I had photos to share, but my friend and I split the egg sandwich and grilled cheese. I was blown away by the homemade apple sauce, too. I actually hate apple sauce, and I definitely surprised myself by eating the whole side of the stuff. 

The reason I can't give this restaurant a full 5 stars has to do with a food allergy incident we experienced. One of my friends has an allergy to tree nuts. Certainly not life threatening, but enough to cause discomfort. She will typically mention her allergy when eating out, but on this day she forgot. I think because we were exhausted and hungry, we were just excited for good food and jumped the gun on ordering right away. 

My friend wanted to try a bite of my sister's zucchini muffin and was surprised to find nuts were baked into the muffin. She had a slight reaction from the ingestion and used an antihistamine to counter the reaction. Knowing we had made a mistake in not mentioning the allergen or reading the menu carefully, we took a second look at the menu and realized the daily printed menu had no mention of nuts in the muffin, and the brunch menu had mention of shellfish and gluten allergens, but no mention of tree nuts. We understand restaurants are not required to list food allergens on their menus, but seeing the mention of other food allergens without any mention of tree nuts made us feel that we should mention something to the staff. The specials menu is printed regularly and we felt it might be wise to add mention of tree nuts in the event that this situation occurred again. 

Our waiter acknowledged that it was a good idea to write something on the menu, but didn't follow up with anything actionable (like saying he brought it to management or that anything ultimately would/wouldn't be done). Upon receiving the check, we decided to leave a comment on the "How Was Your Experience?" card. We felt this was the appropriate space to leave a suggestion on representation of food allergens. 

A manager noticed us discussing what to write and came by to ask about our experience. We told her about how much we enjoyed the food but how we wished something had been written about food allergens. Instead of agreeing, apologizing, or giving us an actionable response, the manager told us that it was our responsibility to disclose food allergies before ordering. Again, we understand that it falls in the responsibility of the person allergic to certain foods to disclose their allergies, but we were only trying to recommend a second line of action that would help the restaurant prevent any issues in the future. The manager was rather dismissive and did not suggest that anything would change in the future. 

I would just like to be clear to close out this review: we had a very positive dining experience between the delicious food and friendly waitstaff. However, we could not help but feel disregarded by the employees when bringing up a valid concern and suggestion. It is logical to expect someone with a food allergy to say something. But for the occasions when the food allergy isn't so severe, and the restaurant is already taking the time to represent OTHER food allergens, it is fair to make a suggestion about adding "tree nuts" to the list of allergens, especially when they're a main ingredient in a dish that doesn't always include tree nuts. We accept responsibility on our behalf, but we wish someone from management or the staff would do the same. 

I've attached photos of the brunch menu and daily menu.

Had lunch in this quaint restaurant. The service was  disappointing. We ordered muffins with our lunch -zucchini.  We were told nothing about the muffins having nuts throughout. Unfortunately, one of our party members has an allergy to nuts. After getting the muffins, we mentioned the allergy to our waiter who was dismissive. We were concerned another patron may also have exposure to the nuts so we mentioned it to the manager who came to the table to ask about our lunch experience. We explained our concern and she said there were only nuts used for garnish and that it was a last minute addition and that next time we should mention the allergy ahead of time. There were nuts throughout the full muffin. Additionally, I was upset that we were brushed off and chastised as being responsible for the situation (rather than appreciating our input for future patrons). Very upsetting experience. There are so many wonderful restaurants in New Hope. I suggest trying a different one.

UPDATE 2:Owner sent a message apologizing for how he acted & for the situation.I appreciated his ability to swallow his pride & admit to his wrongdoings.When you run a business I'm sure it's hard to hear negative comments however, I also believe that to run a restaurant you need to have some pretty thick skin. You're going to hear things you don't like & things that make you incredibly frustrated- not every review is going to be positive. The best thing to do is to listen to your customers and make sure their needs are met. Thank you for taking the time to apologize and respond to us all individually.
UPDATE: Owner responded to my review with hostility & victim blaming. "It is printed on the menu for that very reason" THATS THE ISSUE !! THE FACT THAT NUTS WERE IN THE MUFFIN WAS NOT PRINTED ON THE MENU. WE HAVE PHOTOS OF THE MENU. This is NOT how you run a business. Your staff should be asking about food allergies. As a business owner, YOU should be taking every precaution necessary. If you had a nut brownie on the menu, you'd say "brownie with nuts" if you had banana NUT bread you'd mention nuts, why is this any different? Why can't you just admit that you did not mention the fact that there were nuts on the muffin? We were very kind given the entire situation & the response we received from the waiter, manager & now the owner have been both disrespectful & honestly very concerning. This place does not care about their patrons and would rather ARGUE with paying customers & be dismissive and rude than accept the fact and admit to the fact that they are in the wrong. I've attached two photos- one of the muffin listing (never mentioning nuts) & one of the menu where it too, does not mention anything about nut allergies. Skylar, you're not as intelligent as you think you are. & this is not how you treat people never-mind customers. 
I would have given it a 4 if the situation that I'm about to explain hadn't had happened. 
The food was fantastic. 
However, our waiter lacked social skills & when we had our issue that we ran into he did not show any signs of remorse.

The issue; 

When we all ordered our food we were informed it came with our choice of bread or a pastry - the pastry of the day was a zucchini muffin- harmless, sounds yummy etc. very excited. 
When our food arrived we all ate it and were enjoying ourselves when my sisters girlfriend noticed her mouth began to tingle. After looking at the muffin, she realized they had nuts in them- she has a nut allergy. 
Now, this allergy isn't severe enough to kill her instantly - but it is severe enough to the point where if I hadn't had allergy medicine, she would have had to go to the hospital. 
Our issue came with the fact that after this happened, we looked at the menus on the table and realizEd that neither our waiter nor the menu specified that the muffins contained nuts. we decided to inform our waiter, who- like I mentioned before- had 0 remorse. He didn't even apologize. We didn't tell him in a rude manner either- we simply said hey just for the next table that comes in, make sure you mention that there are nuts so this doesn't happen to someone with an even more severe allergy. He said "sure sure ok" and walked away. 
We then were approached by the owner (or manager, couldn't tell) who I believe overheard us discussing it. When we explained the situation she said to us "well, did you mention to the waiter that you had a food allergy?" Right then and there I knew this place wasn't a professional spot. 
I have worked at numerous restaurants throughout my life and every time we were told to mention nuts and shell fish AND to ASK our table if there were any allergies we should be aware of- even if they didn't order anything that would seem like it contained anything in it. JUST IN CASE. 
Also what the hell kind of a business tries to justify their own mistake like that? Why not just own up to it and say "you know what, you're right- that should be listed on the menu and I will note that change and make sure all of our staff checks with our future tables before we serve them." That would have been a simple, easy, effective solution. Instead she put the blame on US - the CUSTOMER!!! 
I live in NYC so maybe there people are a little better at being courteous and doing the right thing to please their customers and ensure a return, but this woman did not do that. No "I'll take $10 off the bill" no "I'll take that item off of your bill as an apology" not even a regular apology!!!!!! 
Completely unprofessional and rude. We stayed very calm and kind throughout the entire ordeal, but the experience we dealt with is not how I'd expect any restaurant to treat their customers. Will not be returning, am upset we gave them any sort of business, and the owner, manager, whatever she was- needs to be re-taught customer service because clearly she doesn't understand how to run a business properly.

Food is excellent, portions on the small side though. They had a spot in the Marketplace on the main drag (Main St?) that had the most AMAZING sandwiches!!! I always had The Ezra. We would drive an hour just to come have that sandwich. Sadly they no longer have that spot at the market and do not make the sandwiches at the restaurant. I hope that changes...(hint hint!!)

If you haven't been to the Blue Moose, run don't walk!

This place is fantastic, it holds a special place in my heart because every time they aren't just on point, they are remarkable. 

Atmosphere: this place is cozy and tasteful, the decor and feeling is done just right to make you feel at home with your dinner party. 

Food: the main point and so well done! I constantly dream of my next time at Blue Moose when ever I'm in the New Hope area. The food is always fresh with the main dish and sides perfectly complimenting each other. It can be a basic mashed potatoes or vegetable dish and still freaking deliciously incomparable to anything in the area. I wish, oh please do this, they opened a location in Princeton, NJ. 

If you haven't been here, get here now!

Blue moose cafe is my go to brunch place when I'm home. I've been multiple times and love to bring new people because it's suits all types of diets (from vegan to meat eating) and the staff is very accommodating.  Food portions are  all for a good price. My favorites are the omelets with the homemade pastry of the day. I was a little disappointed they took my favorite vegan wrap off the menu but have a new vegan burger which sounds pretty good. I went with the skylar egg Sammy but asked for two eggs over easy which they were more than willing to do. My cousin got the applesauce Dutch babies which he loved. You also can't go wrong with any of the iced teas and coffees. No reservations but the wait usually isn't too bad and you can walk around new hope while waiting for a text your table is ready. I suggest in a big party dropping someone off to get a name in while the others try and park.

I loved my dinner here! The decor is really fun and unique. The beet and goat cheese brûlée was beautifully executed and delicious. I loved the presentation on the wooden board. My shrimp and scallop jambalaya was good, but the scallops were slightly overcooked. The  upside down pear cake was to die for--I am still thinking about it. I have never had a great meal in New Hope before--this was the best so far. I'd love to try the brunch menu next time.

So far this has been the best restaurant that I have been in New Hope and on my favorite 10 list globally. 

I was very lucky to get seated right away without a reservation as it turns out that usually you have to book 2 weeks in advance.

The quality of the food is superb and at a very reasonable price with a great hosting crew.

The chef deserves a standing ovation!
From the outside it looks like a quirky hole in the wall. Inside it's an airy fun and artsy place with great food and service!

From start to finish, our experience was amazing. The server was very friendly and service was great. The eggs Benedict with the ladkes and homemade apple sauce were the best! Unfortunately, they were closed the next two days we were there or we definitely would have been back! Highly recommend!

We have been dining at Cafe Blue Moose almost since it opened years ago and, it keeps getting better with age.  We went last night had had the new spring menu.  Husband had the pork shank and I had the short rib -- both entrees tender and immensely flavorful.  We both had the sweet potato soup and it was a bowl serving -- rich with wonderful ginger flavoring.  One minor miss were the mushrooms that accompanied the short rib but that was quickly rectified with another serving that were more well done and tender.

Over the years, the seating has expanded so there are more options for aesthetically pleasing sections.  Somehow, the price points for the two course and three course menu have remained a great value without compromising on the quality, selection and creativity.
Great food made from scratch and friendly service for brunch the homemade coffees pastries and different breakfast offerings were delicious.

On a beautiful autumn morning we decided to get up early Sunday and try this cafe that we had heard so much about. The cornflake crusted French toast was totally amazing and worth the 20 minute ride for my wife's almond croissant French toast was worth going back to try. The apple scone was scrumptious and the service was happy
Very nice brunch, good service, original fair. It added to the pleasant experience that is New Hope

business.name: Nook A Paleo Influenced Diner
business.categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Specialty Food, Food, Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Nightlife, American (New), Cocktail Bars

reviews.text:
I am from out of town and I usually dislike leaving reviews for places I have only visited once. However, I am writing so that maybe management can use this as feedback - the visit itself would yield a 3 star rating but again, I am not an ass, so I have only taken one away. 

I just had my lunch there today, Friday, at 11:30 am. 
The place was not at all packed. 

We were greeted a little coldly and offered a shot of olive oil - I mean it's a bit awkward (even for a true Italian like me) because EVO isn't exactly the sweetest of tastes but hey I took one. And thank you - it was complimentary I later found out. 

I ordered the ketogenic lasagna and I have to admit the dish completely fell short of any expectations:
1. No texture at all. It was a soggy mush of zucchini, eggplant, and sweet potatoes. If you don't overlook the eggplant, it turns out quite delicious (I have made this before)
2. Salt. Salt everywhere. Overpowering salt. With garlic. 
3. Further drenched in tomato sauce that honestly tasted like Boyardee. 
4. SURPRISE! I found an unidentified foil-like piece of paper in my food. Is the stuff premade and then heated up? Could be! 
 
I didn't say anything about the foreign object because at least it wasn't a hair; I continued eating because the place was too silent for me to say anything to the waitress without anyone hearing. 

I received the check without even being offered dessert, as soon as my lasagna dish arrived. 

Price was ok - I only paid 15 bucks for the meal. 

But yeah uhm no..

My husband and I loved Nook! Every thing was delicious. It was so nice to eat in a restaurant where I didn't have to worry about gluten. We had an appetizer of guacamole, thick sliced bacon chips, and paleo pizza crust chips. Then we shared a Primal wood fire pizza, YUM! Lunch was finished with a slice of chocolate ganache cake with raspberry sauce. It was heavenly! Its been so long since I have been able to order dessert after being diagnosed with celiac disease. We will definitely be eating here again.

We tried out Nook for the first time on Saturday and really enjoyed it. We went in a little after 7 and were sat right away and enjoyed the ambiance. We shared the Brussels sprout appetizer which was delicious. My husband isn't a huge fan of the brussels, but even he liked it. My husband had the chicken and waffles while I had the chicken tenders. We both really wanted to try some gluten-free "breaded" chicken. The chicken was moist and had a crunchy outside. I wish it had a little more flavor along with the sweet potato fries, but otherwise everything tasted good. I liked their in house ketchup as well. The waffle had a nice texture and fluffiness for a gluten free dish also. It's hard to find restaurants with enough options for those who can't do gluten or dairy, so we will definitely be back.
I enjoyed the curry chicken. The portion size is plentiful and cauliflower rice is interesting

Delicious foods that fit my Keto(ish) lifestyle! 
***Ask for Ben H, he's the BEST

Was very excited to see that Nook was open for Mother's Day Brunch. It was my second time dining here and they didn't disappoint. We had the latest reservation of the day so they were out of some of the special items BUT that was okay because they had what I came for; Keto Breakfast and Brussels sprouts.

The biscuits and gravy (Keto breakfast) was extremely tasty. I loved the buttery flavor of the biscuits. The gravy wasn't the traditional heavy thick white gravy associated with B&G which was fine; didn't miss it due to the flavorful sausage. Eggs were cooked perfectly; slightly runny yolk that helped thicken the sauce/gravy.

The Brussels sprouts were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The added bacon and shishito peppers added the right amount of salt and heat to balance some of the fattiness.

Honorable mentions: 
* Bacon chips with guacamole - guacamole was fresh and had lots of lime..loved the zing. Would've liked the bacon to be a little saltier but that's a personal preference 

* Sweet potato wedges - samples this; like the Brussels they had a lovely crisp exterior. The flesh was tender and creamy. Could've gone without the sauces, again a personal preference

*Primal pizza - my mother had this behemoth of a pizza; it's definitely shareable. She enjoyed the pizza and thought the crust had the right amount of chew. She kosher on this for two days, was still tasty by day 3!

Overall Nook Paleo has made it to my favorites list. The food is fantastic and meets my dietary needs. Another huge bonus is the service is A+mazing. We go to restaurants for the food but will keep coming back when the service is great!!

I love everything about this place and can't wait to return. The atmosphere is casual. It is clean and modern. We were greeted promptly on a Friday afternoon and asked if we preferred a booth or table. We sat in a very comfortable booth and service was immediate. We ordered the Brussel Sprouts to share while we waited on our main selections of lasagna and the angry shrimp taco. Everything was absolutely amazing and fresh. The flavors were delightfully paired. The waitress was very attentive and I really couldn't have asked for a more perfect experience. I love what this place is doing, I hope they are hugely successful!

Trishna, the new bartender, made a killer cucumber cooler, even though it's not on the menu.  The staff here was super friendly and they were so helpful in explaining the paleo concept.  I had the Salmon with goat cheese and pistachio. Loved it. Perfect healthy portion.  The primal pizza was delicious and you have the option to have it gluten free.  We will definitely come back next time we're in town.

Great food and cocktails! The smalls plates (bacon chips with guacamole and the brussel sprouts) were very tasty. Had the lasagna and angry shrimp with cauliflower rice. Both very good. The rice had a bit more than a hint of coconut flavor, which some people might not prefer.  We also had to try the desserts: chocolate avocado mousse and a piece of carrot cake. Yumm. Overall a fantastic experience, and we will for sure be going back!

This is a great restaurant especially if you are following a special diet. If you need gluten free. They have it. Need paleo? They have it. Need vegan? They have it. And their beverages are unique. I ordered a kombucha mule and it was amazing. I will definitely definitely be back. And back again.

This is a great restaurant especially if you are following a special diet. If you need gluten free. They have it. Need paleo? They have it. Need vegan? They have it. And their beverages are unique. I ordered a kombucha mule and it was amazing. I will definitely definitely be back!

Interesting business model catering to the diet trend folks. Rather average / below average food, especially considering the price. Our medium-sized group agreed. Pretty surprised at all the high reviews. 

It did feel "healthy," but I'm not convinced it was actually healthy; there's way better out there. It was fine for staying in a hotel nearby but I won't go back. Probably cool if you're on a strict diet and not enjoying food. But like most everyone else said, bland food with salt and pepper on the table like they expect you to season it yourself. 

Bacon / pizza crust chips and guac was visually basic. Bacon was good, hard to mess that up. Brussel sprouts were the most complex dish of the night but ligtimately sugary. Friend's pizzas had "unappetizing" crusts. Chicken curry was fine at best, cauliflower rice was less than good, and veggies were soaked in oil with no salt. 

Place was more or less empty on Friday night. Almost gave three stars because they're at least trying. Nice to have a different type of restaurant in Indy. Interior lighting was neat. This place would've been ok if it was half the price. I feel bad saying it, but gimmicky restaurant.

I heard good things about the paleo diner. I'm on a strict diet and was looking towards the paleo chicken and waffles, which did not disappoint! The chicken breading was crispy, a crunch in every bite and tender chicken inside. The waffle had a nice, consistent texture to it where I could almost forget it was paleo. The 100% maple syrup paired with it quite nicely. It wasn't too sweet, but it enhanced the overall flavor of the dish. The other person with me ordered a paleo vegetable and mozzarella pizza. The toppings looked fresh, and the pizza was thin crust. Unfortunately, the edges and bottom of the crust were blackened. They were gracious to exclude the pizza from the bill and make another pizza with a traditional crust. The second pizza was not burnt, and tasted wonderfully. The server and manager said that it is typical for the paleo crust to have black edges. I can understand as the edges of a thin crust are the thinnest part of the pizza, but the bottom was unacceptable to eat and enjoy of the first pizza. Nut flours are more fragile to cook with than traditional flours such as wheat. My guess is that the wood stove is too hot for the fragility of nut flour in comparison to a paleo pizza being cooked in a conventional oven. If you go to the diner and would like a pizza, I'd suggest the traditional non-paleo crust. Or better yet, try the chicken and waffles. It was delicious.

Service was subpar and the food was unacceptable. We are very open-minded diners and we were more than dissatisfied and disappointed.  We will NOT be back and we will definitely share our experience. We gave 1 star because the bacon chips and guacamole was good.

My kid and I were looking for a good spot on a recent trip to Indy. She's a gluten intolerant pescatarian, and I'm an avid carnivore, so that's sometimes a challenge. 
We were perusing the menu outside when the hostess stepped out and warmly invited us in. Service was friendly and professional, our questions were answered with enthusiasm instead of condescension. I felt perfectly comfortable in my jeans and sneakers, but it would be a good place to throw on the velvet jacket for, too. 
I found the menu to be well organized and informative without being precious. 
My kid (a 13 year old with fairly sophisticated palate) got the tuna poke, and I got the burger. 
OMG the food was so good!! The house made ketchup was a real treat, and my burger was cooked exactly as I asked. My kid was in raptures over the tuna poke. Man, I need to up my cooking game. 
The restaurant itself is sleek and natural-industrial, without being self conscious. 
I feel like this restaurant's intentions are earnest and admirable, serving a nice variety of dishes that really speak to an often overlooked niche, while also being just plain GOOD. The prices were very competitive for a downtown eatery featuring fresh, original fare. 
I'd definitely go there again. My kid wants to come back for their birthday.

Traveling for work, it's always difficult to stick to a strict diet. This restaurant makes it possible. 

The idea of this place is outstanding. It provides an option for people on specific diets, or just those looking to keep it healthy, the ability to leave their own kitchen.

I was on my last week of whole 30 when I stumbled upon this place. I then proceeded to come back 3 days in a row! There is an entire section of the menu devoted to whole 30 meals! 

Whole 30 isn't your thing? Don't worry, they have a paleo section too.

Another unique thing about this place was they provided a shot of olive oil before your meal. It was strange.. but I enjoyed it. 

If you're trying to stick to a specific diet, or just looking for a healthier night out, give this place a try.
Great service.  Great food.  Was wonderful for my wheat allergy.  Great for people on the keto diet.  I love how there are so many gluten free options.

Nook is a really neat place with cool vibes and a killer menu. I highly suggest the wood fire pizzas, they are big enough to share and are scrumptious. Some of the items are pretty overpriced, but easily shareable. They run a really good lunch special as well. They carry kombucha and have some neat cocktails. Definitely a spot to check out.

Love this place! I took my boyfriend here last night since I (try to) eat paleo and he does not. He was apprehensive at first, but was happy to find plenty of items on the menu that he was excited to try that weren't Keto, whole 30 etc. He ordered the bbq chicken pizza and I got the paleo chicken and waffles. We liked both a lot, but the chicken and waffles were amazing. They were some of the best chicken and waffles I've ever had, and I can't believe they're considered paleo! My boyfriend loved them too and kept asking for more bites. It's so nice to be able to have access to a restaurant where you don't have to worry about modifying an order or eating something boring because you are on a specific diet. I can't wait to come back to Nook soon!

This place was absolutely amazing! The food was so good and healthy! I'm a huge health nut and
This place made me want to eat everything on the menu and not feel guilty about it:) highly recommend their Brussel sprouts for an appetizer (Not pictured)! The atmosphere of this place was so cute and the service was great! Highly recommend for a cute date night or
Family lunch or dinner!  

We ordered the curry chicken and cauliflower rice, chicken and waffles, fresh salmon with root vegetables and cauliflower rice, and a build your own pizza on paleo crust! 

The kombucha mule was one of the best cocktails I've had in awhile. Healthy and delicious! 

So healthy and so good! Check it out!

First time visit for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. Tried a pizza with a paleo influenced crust that was pretty tasty and a salmon taco and found it to be very tasty as well. Good wholesome food. The menu helps customers with the different types of popular diets. Quality ingredients. Really nice space, well worth a visit.

Wow what an awesome restaurant. Decided to check this place out during Devour. 

Despite this place being Paleo influenced, it shouldn't put anyone off the menu is clever and very open to anyone who has an open mind. 

The devour menu was a great sample of what this place has to offer and super reasonable for two people. We ordered two different starters, bacon chips with guacamole and the Brussels sprouts - which were amazing. 

Entrees wife had lasagna and I had cauliflower chicken both very very good. 

Server was great and cocktails were tasty too, maybe just a little overpriced but that would be my only critic of this place. 

Take a chance on something a little different and don't let the paleo title put you off.

Amazing food, flavor, and service in a really cute, nice setting.
Very at home type feel, very friendly and inviting. Loved it.
Great heathy food choices, extremely flavorful.

We shared some guacamole and bacon chips, absolutely delicious and filling- I managed to clean the whole plate after my wife tapped out a quarter way through.
I also got the primal pizza with paleo crust, and no pineapple (I'm on Keto) which was oh so good and tasty, but oh so very filling. I could not finish, nor should I have. My wife got the Nook burger with gluten free bun with a side of sweet potato wedges delicious! The avocado chocolate mousse was very cocoa rich, almost too rich. But it was very tasty non the less. 

Overall I will definitely be back. The great Paleo, Keto, healthy choices should be the norm not the exception. A BIG thank you to the Nook for offering such delicious healthy food.

Any restaurant that offers me a complementary olive oil shot right away after sitting down is a winner in my book. Nook has great options for those who are diet conscious. The staff is extremely knowledgeable about all the ingredients of each item on the menu, even though our server was on the newer side she was able to quickly reference what was in each sauce and menu item by looking in a binder. They were open and knowledgeable about my dietary needs being as that I was on the whole 30 when I visited. I will say their whole 30 options are not great they only had a Powerbowl and a short rib option, But I of course appreciate that there were whole 30 options. The space is cozy and inviting and I was actually surprised and how big the restaurant actually was.The kombucha cocktail sounded amazing as well so I will definitely have to be back to try those.

In town for a conference, finishing up a Whole30 and found THE place for great eats and a restaurant that "gets it". Menu makes finding GF, Vegan, Whole30 selections a breeze. I'd go back even if I weren't following a "plan"--it's that delish!

Friendly staff and warm environment made for a great evening. Curious? Just go!

Came here for Whole30. 

I'm currently about halfway and the bf and I have been trying to find somewhere to eat out at least once a week without having to completely alter a dish. And NOOK gave us that. They have four menu items that are approved and compliant by whole30 standard which was great. 

We started with the tuna poke. Which was fine. This was probably the most lackluster part of the evening to be honest. I would hesitate to call it poke and just call it tuna and pineapple lettuce wraps? Something less fancy than poke for sure. It was flavorful but very overpriced at $12. 

The meals we got were tasty. I do wish I would have gotten the sweet potato mash with the short rib rather than the cauliflower rice. It just has a better combo for the flavor. The seared tuna was ok - although ours was a bit cold. 

But they had kombucha, they had excellent service and kind managers to specifically talk to us about whole30 and it's great to have a restaurant of this caliber focused on helping this who are attempting to better themselves by eating healthy. 

Good location downtown, nice ambiance. All around good experience.

business.name: K'Far Cafe
business.categories: Bakeries, American (Traditional), Mediterranean, Food, Restaurants, Cafes

reviews.text:
Hate to say it but I don't understand what all of the hype is about! Was expecting long lines and crowds but ended up getting a table in the back room in the apartment complex lobby. Tried to order online with the QR code but it kept giving me an error that items in my cart were no longer available, but not specifying which items, so I ended up waiting in line to order anyway. 

No one in my group liked the grilled cheese Jerusalem bagel. One compared it to frozen Ellio's pizza- and they weren't wrong- yikes. The avocado kubaneh toast was good, but nothing special beyond your average avocado toast. The pistachio sticky bun was by far the stand out item, but definitely doesn't compare to the pastries at Suraya. I don't drink coffee but others in the group strongly disliked theirs. My Bloody Mary was horrible, one of the worst I've had. 

The items were delivered to the table sporadically with huge gaps of time in between. For example, we ordered 2 sticky buns and one came out right away and the other came out after we finished everything and were packing up to leave. 

Overall, a big ol' disappointment.

Food: Jerusalem bagel was quite soft and far leas chewy compared to the standard bagel. It was fragrant with the toasted sesames, but definitely not worth $5 per piece. Cheese spread was just okay as the smoked salmon flavor was not very prominent and all you taste is the chive and creaminess.

Pistachio sticky bun ($4 each) was overly sweet for my taste buds. The chocolate rugelach ($18 a dozen) was loaded with dark chocolate and was my favorite out of the three. 

Price: quite pricey for what you get. 4 bagels with 2 spread was $27 ( $20 for bagels, $3.50 for 1/2 pt spread). Additionally they charge an automatic service fee of 10.8% on all orders.

Overall, it's a cute spot to visit if you're in the area and need a little afternoon pick me up, but not a must try.
Super duper long wait but sooo worth it! The pastries are sooooo good if wait on the line again for it.

There's a reason this place has so many great reviews: it's great. I've been here a few times now and never disappointed. Today I got the pistachio roll and my goodness, so tasty! I wish I could figure out what the syrup they use is, it's mindblowingly good. I just googled it between writing that sentence and pressing 'Post' and one reviewer thinks it might be a hint of rosewater, I agree. I thought maybe rose water as I was eating it but truly who knows. SO GOOD!

In the past, I've also had the borekas (solid) and a variety of coffees. Their coffee is, well, it's coffee. The Yemenite Latte was very yummy, not an every day coffee but a great once in a while drink. Next up is the chocolate babka, and luckily I know I'll be back so it's only a matter of time.

Food: everything was fresh and light. Nothing too heavy or overly sweet. Flavors were delicate. Would go back for their bagel. 

Service: friendly staff and service. Was able to get seated in 20 min for two without a reservation on the weekend. All the ordering and payments are done online. Love the efficiency 

Ambiance: music is really loud and seating space is a bit crowded, but they also have a separate seating section behind the main bar/ kitchen. 

Have heard much hype about it, but not sure if it's worth the hype..? Maybe I'll have to try more of their pastries for a fuller review. Overall, no complaints!

K'Far is the perfect streamlined and delicious brunch or breakfast find in Philly!

I stopped in on a local's recommendation to snag a snack and was hard pressed to not order everything. I tried the pistachio sticky bun which will blow your mind and the roasted mushroom marscapone toast. There were so many other items on the menu I didn't have room to try. There was a unique taste and vibe to everything available.

Ordering online or via smart code is easy and the service is friendly and prompt also. 

This is a must-try!

This place is definitely one of my favorites food-wise. Everything here is delicious. Only giving one less star because it seems, weekend or weekday, if you order ahead it takes even more time than normal ordering. Scheduling twenty minutes ahead for pickup can have you waiting at least 15 minutes on top of the scheduled time. Today I sadly waited 35 minutes past my scheduled time (so 55 minutes total to make) for just a bagel and pastry...

Don't come here after 2 PM on a Sunday because there's almost nothing left on the savory menu. We came to get a late brunch but we're only able to order a Jerusalem egg and cheese bagel as a savory entree. No regrets, as it was delicious.Pumpkin roll, pistachio sticky bun and potato baraka were also delicious pastries to accompany or savory food. What was most amazing about this meal was their drinks. We tried the chai latte in the Yemenite latte.The spices were fresh and they were not overpoweringly sweet. You could really taste the aromatics of each spice and it was a joy to savor them.

My favorite place for Israeli inspired snacks. I love all their pastries. Including their new in season pumpkin spiced latte bun. Just kidding but I know there's pumpkin in here and it's great. Love their fluffy egg and cheese sammiches on their Jerusalem bagels. The Yemenite latte reminds me of the lattes I had in Jerusalem after picking out all my favorite spices in the bazaars. 
All the babkas and Cookies and pastries omg! So good you can't go wrong with whatever you pick. And they got lunch stuffs too but I come here for the breakfast goodies

We stopped here for breakfast on our way out of town and this might've been my favorite cafe I've ever been to. I started with the Yemenite Latte which is made with spices; the flavors were very interesting and they worked very well but it's definitely not a daily-drinker if you're craving coffee. We then split the smoked salmon Jerusalem bagel which was superb. The salmon was fresh, delicious, and generously piled on. The outside of the bagel was crispy and the inside was soft, just like a bagel should be. The real star was the Boreka, my favorite pastry I've ever had. The pastry part was flaky and covered in Zaatar seasoning. The inside was cream cheese and olives which seemed a little bit interesting but the salty olives worked so well with the cream cheese and buttery pastry. Next time I'll need to get a box of them to go!

I know I'm not the target market for an Isreali cafe like K'far, but I have always read good things about it and figured I'd give it a try. I placed a lunch order for pick-up. It was crowded inside when I got there so I glad I was just picking up. I went out of my comfort zone and ordered a Smoked Salmon Jerusalem Bagel and two Pistachio Sticky Buns. The sandwich was on a really tasty bagel but the smoked salmon was just OK. It's not something I would go back for in this city full of great sandwich options. I was really looking forward to the sticky bun. It was good, but slightly disappointing. It seemed a bit overcooked as the outer layer was a bit harder than I would have liked. But pistachios on a sticky bun actually make for a good combination. Unfortunately, I cannot agree with all the 5 star reviews for K'Far.

K'far is so much more than a coffee shop, and one of the best places in the country for Israeli and Middle Eastern baked goods, and for pastry in general. We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon for a snack and the place was absolutely packed, with a line out the door. However, K'far is absolutely worth the wait. Although they unfortunately sell out of some of their more coveted items, like Yemenite lattes, fast, we were glad to order a couple of their sachlav lattes, a traditional sweet and creamy coffee alternative popular in Israel and rarely found in the States. For snacks, we had the flaky cream cheese and olive bourekas, and the incredible pistachio sticky bun, which was hands-down the best pastry I have ever had- sticky and sweet, but leaps and bounds beyond a boring cinnamon roll in flavor and texture. We also took one of their famous Jerusalem bagels to go, which was perfectly chewy and just like those you get in the Old City. K'far is the only spot to go to for coffee and bakery in Philly.

Loved loved my experience here! This place was packed with people inside and outside, but my friend and I were lucky to find a table rather quickly. It's hard to choose my favorite here because everything I tried was delicious but if I have to pick one, the Smoked Salmon Jerusalem was the best smoked salmon sandwich I've tried so far. The special cream with the freshness of the salmon was like a salmon lover's dream come true - it got better with each bite! The Jerusalem egg/cheese bagel was delicious as well. Lastly, the pastries were absolutely amazing - if I lived in Philly, I would be coming here every day to try all the pastries. Most highly recommend!

Get anything. Seriously. Get anything. The best thing about this place is it is just as good quality as any of michael solomonov's places (zahauv, laser wolf). The quality doesn't stop cause it is a breakfast place or cheaper side. You will love everything about it. The decor, the food. The experience.

Get there early. It fills up. Quickly. I was there at 9:30 and by the time we left it was packed. Honestly it won't matter the time after the experience.

Sweet and savory Israeli-style pastries, make sure to order online to avoid the long wait! You can't go wrong with their Jerusalem Bagels (I love the crisp texture of the bagel bread). 

The pistachio buns are a must (they are quite big and can definitely be shared! Sometime online they are sold out, but when you to pick up, you can ask if they have any pistachio buns in store and they should have some!)

Highly recommend the mushroom kubaneh for those who love mushrooms and savory treats!
Everything I have had from here is delightful., and the process for ordering and picking up take-out is a breeze. Highly recommend - definitely worth the hype

Good food but other oddities make it a less than enjoyable experience
Ambiance: Bistrot style dining but usually with a wait amongst a crowd outside. Definitely felt rushed the whole time from check-in to the moment we were ushered out. ordering is done by an app - complete with paying. The problem with this is you can't ask questions about menu items, nor can you ask for substitutions or modifications. And you have to spend 10 mins entering in all your credit card info before the order is sent in. Very frustrating and not congenial to chatting with friends.
Service: hit and miss. Nice enough staff but rushed and not able to help with modifications to orders. Once your meal is finished you're encouraged to leave quickly.
Food: A very limited menu, but what we had was good enough. Everything baked fresh in house. We went for brunch and shared a very large lox and cream cheese bagel. It was okay but nothing special. the hot chocolate was nice though - creamy viennese style without overpowering on the chocolate.
Price: So-so.
I doubt I would go back to dine in house. Perhaps order take-out (along with many others waiting for pick-up).

Adorable, unique and delicious! I just spent time in Europe and this reminds me so much of the cute little cafes there. The food is beautiful here. They do a great job with ambiance. The only bummer is they don't take reservations so it can be a bit hectic in the cold weather waiting for a table. I had the Jerusalem bagel with egg and cheese. Quite filling. I need to come back for all the things!

I was in Philly for two days and ending up going here both days for breakfast because it was so good. The Yemenite Latte is the best latte I've ever had. It's espresso flavored milk steeped in cardamom, cinnamon, and ginger. The flavors are incredible. I had it hot both times, but I bet it's great iced in the summer as well. I had never had a Jerusalem bagel before. It tastes like a bagel and looks like a thin and oblong bagel, but has less fluffy insides. The capers in the cream cheese and the pickled onion made the smoked salmon Jerusalem bagel extra tasty. I hate it when a bagel place either is stingy with cream cheese or puts an entire block of cream cheese on one bagel. This was the perfect amount of cream cheese. The smoked salmon was melt in your mouth delicious. Pastry wise, everything I saw looked great, but I only tried the chocolate babka (fabulous) and the pistachio sticky bun (my favorite, like baklava in sticky bun form). The staff was really friendly and remembered me when I returned the second day and thanked me for coming back! There is indoor seating at tables and a high top bar, as well as outdoor seating. I ate inside, but the outdoor area looked very neat and nice. The vibe in the space is great, they were playing good music as a reasonable background volume, and the decor is modern and beautiful. I can't wait to go back to Philly so I can come here again. If I lived in Rittenhouse, this is the kind of place where I'd go on the daily.
Delicious and charming, but don't make this choice if you're in a rush. Perfect place to sit and relax.

If I could give 0 stars I would. The service here is terrible. I ordered takeout in person and they lost my order. I was warned that the food would take 30 minutes and I was fine with waiting. After 45 minutes and seeing other people I waited with outside getting their food I asked someone about the update on my order and they said that it should be up any minute. I waited another 20 minutes and decided to check if my bag was on the counter and it wasn't. I notified the person who LIED to me that my order would be up any minute where my bag was and he looked so lost and knew he lied to me. I was already running late to my appointment so I decided to get a refund because I could not wait any longer. No apologies or explanation about what happened to my order. 

Also can we talk about the 10.8% "Service Charge" they place on every order? I would be fine with this if it was the tip but it's not because they still ask for tip when you pay in person. There's no transparency what this service charge is. What a complete scam.

I came in hoping to order their pastry but it was sold out. So I ordered two lattes instead to not come empty handed. Got in the car and took a sip of the latte, how disappointing, it was watered down!  If their lattes tasted this bad, I don't know if I really want to try their pastry now. Definitely the worst cafe I tasted a latte.

I popped in for an afternoon drink and snack. They have the best Bloody Mary ever! The savory cheese and olive pastry I had blew me away as well! If I wasn't leaving town in a few hours, I'd be back again and again.

I expected more, quite honestly.  The rugelach were not as fresh as I expected.  Maybe I made a mistake by ordering the dozen (are they prepared the night before), but shouldn't I be rewarded for doing so, instead of the opposite.  The pistachio cinnamon role was so small, I had to laugh.  The babka was flat.  Why does everyone rave about this place -- or was i misinformed?  The borekas were pretty good, but nothing to write home about.  The chocolate chip cookie was a pleasant surprise, as was the linzer cookie.  I'm hoping this was a bad day, or a bad hour, and that if I come earlier or later, I'll hit the fresh sweet spot....

Really good, really filling meal. We ordered ahead on a Sunday - luckily they had not run out year - and were excited to try the legendary Jerusalem bagels that sell so fast. Our order was still pretty warm, really tasty, well-seasoned with good spices, etc. I found the pick-up process to be rather chaotic - wish there was an easier way to get our food without dancing around the swirl of customers and waiters / servers.

business.name: Don Pablo's
business.categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Restaurants, Tex-Mex, Mexican, Nightlife

reviews.text: EXTREMELY SLOOOW DINING EXPERIENCE.... Not the server's but the kitchen and for what reason I have no idea as there was only 6 tables seated here for lunch!!! UDATE 2 weeks later the place is CLOSED!  R.I.P. Don Pablo's!!!
It's been about a year since I ate here. Service was slow but very nice. I think she was spread too thin. Shrimp tacos use to be more tasty. Steak fajita was just okay.

I am still mourning my favorite local mexican restaurant closing so I have been trying different mexican restaurants to fill the void. I came in around 7pm on a saturday night and luckily did not have to wait. There was plenty of seating and also seating in the bar area. 

Within seconds of sitting down, our waitress brought over chips/salsa. Each day of the week there are different drink specials- since it was saturday, it was frozen margaritas. We both got a frozen margarita and they were pretty good. 

We also ordered queso dip- which was pretty good. I may have eaten a little too much because by the time our fajitas arrived, I was already feeling a little full. Overall, the food was good and the service was quick enough. The decor/atmosphere of this place was cool- I really loved the lighting. 

I'm not sure if this is my new favorite mexican restaurant, but it is not a bad choice! They had some good happy hour deals- so hopefully I will be back to try that.

I'm really disappointed to give a restaurant that I've enjoyed in the past such a poor rating, but so be it. Went well-after dinner rush on a Tuesday night with two others. Waited over an hour for our meal, with our server assuring us several times that it was "on its way out." Finally after our server disappeared for 15 minutes, we waved down another server to ask for the manager. 

Out huffs a woman with no introduction or greeting, who in my opinion has no business working with the public. When we said we hadn't been served our meal for over an hour, she just went on about how she's "doing her best." She seemed annoyed and dismissive. She claimed they were down a cook, which would be understandable. But I said that as a manager, she should be on the dining room floor explaining the situation to guests--many of whom, by the looks of it, were also not getting food any time soon. She said to give her a minute and left. Another ten minutes later the food came out, with no follow-up or apology from her. 

Food was not on-par with how it is usually, but at that point we were hungry enough to not care. Never have I been so close on walking out of a restaurant. I won't be returning for a long while, if at all.
