My favorite Mexican in the area. They even have delicious spoonbread!! I love the way they season their steak. And the tortilla chips are made there I believe. They are always fresh and slightly warm. So so so good. I usually get chicken and steak fajitas. I also think they are reasonable on the alcohol volume in a mixed drink with corresponding price.

The service was awesome and the food looked great. I found out today that I am not a fan of corn tortillas shells, I had the Don's chicken enchiladas, the chicken was filled with flavor however the shell had a weird after taste to me. I ended up just eating the chicken with my rice and refritos

Disappointed. I loved Don Pablo's, but after my last visit I will not be returning. My food came out wrong. Multiple things missing from what was advertised on the menu. The manager made it seem like I just didn't like the food when the food just fell short in many ways. It was just a bad meal. No accountability for the food being poor. I've worked in the restaurant industry for half a decade. The customer service displayed by the manager was off-putting. No one likes when a manager can't take responsibility for their kitchen. I worked under a boss like that for 2 years. It's embarrassing and hurts the business. 

I hope Don Pablo's can turn it around somehow.

The waiter is very polite. Yet, if you take a look around, you can see the dust all around the place. I think it just needs a little cleaning up. Also the food was a bit weird and usually I like Mexican but for some reason something was off about the meals.

I would not even give one star because the food and service was so bad. I went here one week ago on a Wednesday for dinner at 7pm. Service was horrible. Plates were dirty. Our server said the food would take a while. It did. When the food came it was the worse Mexican food I have ever had. Taco bell seems gourmet in comparison to what was on my plate. soggy bad tasting burrito just thrown on the plate messy. Soggy tacos. hard, cold, dry fries. beans looked like regurgitation. I complained to the server who agreed with me that the food is bad there and he is looking for a new job. Since everyone complains about the food. He apologized that although we didn't eat the food we still have to pay. which I did. but I will NOT be back to Don Pablos Nixon Drive. You lost a customer.

I wouldn't say I'm a regular but I have been here a few times this year.  However, after tonight's experience it will be the last!!!!!  I think 2 hours to wait on 3 dinners plus an appetizer is ridiculous.... the entire restaurant emptied out and we were still waiting on our 3 dinners. Our waiter was awful. To take 20 minutes to get refills on our water is EXCESSIVE. He disappeared for most of the night.  When the manager stopped by we told her what was going on.  She  hollered at him in the kitchen. We could see it.  Very unprofessional in my opinion.  Plus no apologies to us ..  could've taken care of our bill.  Given us something off considering my blood pressure was through the roof from the whole experience. But she disappeared too. Never to be seen again.  Sorry Don Pablo's I'll be going elsewhere from now on.   Moe's would've been a better choice tonight
Yummy foods at reasonable price and good drinks. Great place to get together. The drinks are fantastic!

With all the new Mexican competition, this place slips down on my list.  Had to remind the waiter to take our menus after we ordered. Should have been my sign. Never asked to refill the chip basket while our dip sampler sat on the table. Came for taco Tuesday and literally waited 30 minutes for a second round. The waiter claimed another server took his order.

Pico de gallo tasted like bad tomato's very disappointing. We changed our minds on having dinner and instead we got empanadas appetizer that arrived 40 min later. My daughter and me did not eat any I paid for the bill and we left to another restaurant. I don't recommend this place at all!!!

Chips, salsa, and margaritas are never a bad combination. However, my son ordered a corn dog and we've been sitting here for an hour waiting for our meal. At least bring the corn dog out for the kid...come on. We also ordered the item listed as the special for the night. We usually order the special because it's prepared and ready to go, coming out relatively quickly. This place is also half empty, what is taking so long?? Are you growing the corn? Raising the "insert animal here" required for the meat of the corn dog? Do you need to grow the tree required to make the stick that shoves into the end? Carnivals pump that ish out in like 5 minutes. Update, just got a notice that my order is "coming right out". I guess they waiting 55 minutes before starting to cook it. Maybe they assumed my wife, 3 1/2 year old, and I just wanted some extra bonding time at the dirty booth we are sitting in. Shoutout to my son for lasting a solid 45 minutes before turning into a restless animal and spilling his water all over the table. #champ #notyourfault

Welp. I have to provide an update because I had such a terrible experience last night. My husband and I ordered the sambaritas that I mentioned in my original review and they came out in red Solo cups with no cocktail shakers on the side. I asked where the regular glassware was and the waitress said that the bar was really busy so everyone was getting Solo cups. I looked around and my eye detector test determined that was a lie. 

I took a sip of the drink and noticed that it was NOT a sambarita. There was tons of sweet-n-sour mix which is not part of the recipe. I told the waitress about that issue as well. She looked confused and asked if I wanted to speak to the manager. I said yes. The manager strolled over about 10 minutes later and just stood by the table looking at us. No introduction, no "I heard there was an issue with your drinks", just a smug face. Oooookk, I thought. So I began my long explanation. She told me that her "ace bartenders" were working and that they made the drink correctly. I asked her if she was back there when they made it. I told her that the drink tastes nothing like it normally does. She said sambaritas have Patrón and Patrón is very expensive. (Gee thanks for the lesson. Never knew that. -__- ) She said she will have to charge us for a shot. After going back and forth, she begrudgingly offered to make new drinks, but I said I didn't want another one if it was going to taste exactly like the one I had AND be delivered in a red Solo cup. 

I was just appalled by her lack of professionalism. Horrible manager. She should have apologized about the mistake instead of arguing that her bartenders didn't do anything wrong. She should've offered to bring out new drinks in the beginning and should've ensured they were made correctly. And they should have been free, in my opinion, especially for a regular like me.

To add insult to injury, the $5 nacho special was extremely dry with barely any queso or other toppings. I asked if we could get more queso since there was barely any on them and was told that we'd have to be charged for it. The taco shells were jumbo Old El Paso shells from Walmart, not the regular white corn shells that are freshly made. I don't know what happened during this visit, but it was a complete FAIL.

e restaurant was really nice! Amazing Mexican decor. Unfortunately, the food wasnt the best. I was craving tamales and had called numerous restaurants. Don Pablo's was the closest one. The taste did not deliver. The tamales was def not authentic. It tasted like smoked pork smothered with sauce wrapped inside a quick corn meal recipe. We also ordered the steak fajitas; it was semi ok. The comp chips was super stale, as well. But what can you really expect from a chain resto. 
The only nice experience we had was the ambiance and the waiter. He was friendly, helpful, and courteous.  I believe his name was Gregory.  He even changed the channel for us so we can watch the game.
This place is really worn down. The food is never cooked properly, either burned or lacks flavor. This place used to be good, however Taco Bell tastes better now.
I usually love this place but how do you leave the sticker on the drink fruit!!!???!??? Not cool. Wash your fruit.

Call me basic, but I really like this place! Obviously it's not authentic Mexican fare, but it's tasty, affordable Tex-Mex. Taco Tuesdays (all-you-can-eat tacos for $9.99) are everything here. Your choice of shredded chicken or beef, crispy or soft tacos and two sides. The complimentary chips and salsa are delicious. The chips are fresh - thin and crispy. (sometimes, you'll even get a warm batch #winning) Their original queso is a favorite - delicious with the chips, but even better on top of the tacos. The service is good -friendly, helpful staff. If you'd like a drink, try the sambarita!! The strawberry-flavored one is heavenly, but my sister and husband have gotten the mango one and thought it was delicious too. Can't go wrong with either. 

Just good, messy, yummy, traditional, affordable (Tex)Mexican food. Nothing fancy or uniquely alternative about it, just good food. I can't ask for more.

Every time I have gone here, I've had such a positive experience. The bartenders are awesome (Sarah & Marcel) and I get great service from the servers as well. (Victoria is the best!)
I always come here for the chipotle pork tacos which are awesome! Try the corn bread too as your side! You won't be disappointed ! Complimentary tortillas and salsa!!

First time coming here. The establishment is very nice looking inside and out. Pretty clean from what I can tell. Came with a bunch of coworkers (12+ folks). I ordered the taco salad & it was nothing real fabulous. Portions are decent for the price, but seems to lack a bit of flavor.

   Drinks are great and the wait staff is pretty friendly.  Aside from lack of flavor on the food; they take FOR-EV-ER on bringing you your check!

Pack a sleeping bag

I have been to Don Pablo's five or six times and just only noticed I have never left a review. We were over in the Moorestown Mall area on a Saturday night in January and hoped with all the new restaurants we could get a table quickly for two. On all of our previous visits, Don Pablo's was pretty crowded. There was no exception this time but it was only a 15-minute wait for a table.

There are some great small, independent Mexican restaurants in the South Jersey area, but some very good Tex-Mex food can be found at Don Pablo's. I feel Don Pablo's is one of the better chain or box restaurants. The food is all very reasonably priced and they make their tortillas in house. The classics for us Gringos such as Tacos, Burritos, Enchiladas, Fajitas have all been very good. Our server Abigail was great and our food came out quickly and hot. Don Pablo's has a good selection of beer (Mexican & Domestic) and drink specials. They also have daily drink and food specials.

The dining room can get a little loud due to the high ceilings, amount of customers and solid surfaces but it is a festive place so that is all good. There is also a lot of over the top Tex-Mex kitsch but again that enhances the fiesta vibe.

Tip - The cornbread is more like a cornbread pudding. It is moist, sweet and crack like. I will order this for dessert on my next visit. It was awesome.

4 Yelp stars!

This place has been here forever! Some people comment on the food being okay but honestly I think it's pretty good! There's an option to sit at the bar or in the regular dining area. There are deals on most days of the week for certain dishes. I came for taco Tuesday which is $7.99 all you can eat tacos- the choices are beef or chicken and soft or hard shell. 

They have a good sized menu with lots of options and opportunities to customize. They were pretty empty honestly- which surprised me because when I came here more frequently about 6 years ago, there were always lots of people there on taco Tuesday nights! 

But nonetheless we were seated immediately and our waitress was fine. She forgot to bring us some stuff we asked for but eventually brought it so it was ok. The food came out very fast and we enjoyed our experience. 

I got two beef tacos and a chicken taco- the beef had more of a kick to them if you're into that. They give you free chips and salsa when you sit down. The chips were warm and perfectly salted.

I used to come here all the time, but I stopped coming once I discovered another nearby Mexican place that I preferred. We came on a Thursday evening, because Don Pablo's sent me an email that they loaded up my Habaneros card with free cantina nachos (plus every Thursday this month they were having an endless enchiladas promotion!)

They have limited bar seating, some tables and booths by the bar, plus plenty of restaurant table seating and booths along the wall. The place is more brightly lit than it used to be, but not bright by any means. Limited beer selections, fairly certain there's no craft beer.

We were seated right away and were brought our complementary chips and salsa. The chips are light on salt, and the salsa tastes like tomatoes (I added hot sauce which made it taste awesome!) as they have 3 different hot sauce selections on each table. The cantina nachos came with fresh cheese, queso, tomato pieces, refried beans, and jalapeños (plus lettuce and sour cream, which we asked them to leave out) and they were really tasty!

I ordered the endless enchiladas but could only enjoy two plates as the nachos were pretty filling. I went with the cheese ones which were pretty good- they actually had a good amount of cheese. The tortillas themselves were a little firm for my taste, or maybe a bit dry, not sure why.

Our service was actually pretty slow, but our meals came exactly as ordered. Overall, decent experience but if we came back I think we'd just split the nachos.

My wife and I went on Wednesday, which happened to be $9.99 fajita night. After gently asking that the table be wiped off (it was filthy),  I ordered the vegetable fajitas and my wife ordered the steak fajitas. My food was horrible. The black beans had no flavor and were chewy and old. However, the worst past were the vegetables themselves. My "garden veggies" were a mound (like 95% of the plate) of onions, four slices of peppers and four pieces of zucchini that were mush from being so overcooked. I ate less than 1/2 of it. I would have told the server but she only came back to leave of check on the edge of the table. Truly there was nothing enjoyable about the meal. 

Turns out veggie fajitas aren't included in the special and cost $2 more than steak fajitas. 

So, yeah, we won't be heading back there anytime soon. I suggest you don't either!

business.name: Sycamore
business.categories: French, Southern, Comfort Food, International, Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text: What a great find! My husband and I were visiting Philly and found such great Yelp reviews about Sycamore we decided to trek out to the burbs and try it.  We were not disappointed!  We did the prix fixe on a Wednesday night and for $35 per person we were amazed at how much food we got!  Each course provided different dishes for each of us, doubling what we could try.  The sticky toffee cake and the cheese course with house cured olives and strawberry preserves were phenomenal.  I can still remember the flavors of that dinner almost two months later!  Sycamore doesn't have a liquor license but they do let you bring your own wine or booze without a corkage fee.  They have great cocktail mixers so you can have your own creative drinks while you're waiting for your mouth watering meal to begin!

I was so excited to celebrate our anniversary at Sycamore based on all the rave reviews but I wish I had read a little further. Apparently the chef and/or ownership changed and since then the most recent reviews have been lackluster with mine being no exception.

Pros: 
-BYOB
-Not crowded on a Friday night
-Delicious, unique oil and spice blend for the bread
-Drunken raisins! Amped up an otherwise mediocre cheese plate
-Perfectly cooked steak
-Delicious mixers for your alcohol (try the Lansdowner)
-Apparently (according to my boyfriend) the country fried chicken was some of the best he's ever had even when living in the South
-Was offered a free dessert due to being out of my choice of appetizer (see below for more about that)

Cons:
-No amuse bouche (my fault for expecting it - apparently the new chef has done away with this)
-Out of all beverages except soda and water (no iced tea or lemonade? really?)
-They were out of every salad. Literally. Because of this I wasn't able to have a lite appetizer and instead chose the sausage and pasta (only because of the Yelp deal for a free appetizer at check-in... otherwise I would have skipped it altogether)
-Said sausage and pasta was under-seasoned and under-salted
-The broccoli rabe that came with my steak was bitter beyond belief (hey, alliteration!). I couldn't eat it.
-We felt the server was a bit snooty
-The decor - dark and bland with a peeling floor

I can now see why it wasn't crowded on a Friday. I realize I had high expectations for this place from the get-go, but the fact they were out of EVERYTHING, the dull decor and the so-so service left me disappointed that we chose Sycamore for our anniversary celebration. I do feel like this establishment has potential to become something much greater (perhaps as great as it was before?) but who knows how long it will take for them to get there.

My partner and I were finally able to come in for a meal at Sycamore BYO and we were so happy we did.  We decided upon the Wednesday tasting menu and were blown away by the quality and innovative dishes that were served to us including fresh salads, a crispy southern fried chicken breast with cheddar creamed potatoes, a tender pork chop with sauteed red cabbage, a rich and creamy soup, and hands down the best crab cake either of us had ever had before. This was all followed with a cheese plate, flour-less chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream and homemade salted caramel sauce, and hazelnut frangelico tiramisu with raspberry sauce.  We can not wait to experience Chef Gossette's magic again.

Wow, I wondered why the meal last night was not up to all the other times we;ve been there. Now I see the place was sold back in August and the food is not the same.
The squash soup was rich and had good flavors, but was very heavy. The house was good, fresh ingrediants, and a nice dressing, no problem there.
The buttermilk fried chicken was very good, but I was just not in a mood to eat a ton of mashed potato's with gravy. The chicken breast was small, but not greasy, and would have liked it better without all the potato's. It also came with a biscuit that was warm and buttery. The veal chop for $39 was terrible. First it came out undercooked. It was taken away and brought back again, but still not cooked the way it was ordered. The worst part was it was tough and chewy and not at all tender. It came with a heavy pomegranite sauce that covered up the taste of the meat.
The kitchen with the previous owner seemed to have the food show thru more than using heavy sauces.
At the end, they are using an Ipad to complete the checkout, which I think is a great idea. They swipe the card right there and email you the receipt. My only problem is, unlike other restaurants that use this method, the only tip option was 20% versus places that give you options.
Like I said, been here many times and loved the food, but last night was not good.
Little touches like amuse bouche are gone as are the little chocolates at the end of the meal. For a bill at a BYO that came in over a hundred dollars the food has to get a lot better.

Last night was our second time at Sycamore, and unfortunately it was a far less pleasant experience than our first visit almost a year ago.  

The restaurant was eerily empty for a Friday, and it definitely appeared to be an "off" night from the start. There was no amuse bouche offered, unlike during our previous visit, and I was annoyed by the lack of a single vegetarian entree option, as well as the kitchen's lack of creativity/accommodation in putting something together for me.  Other BYOB's that I've been to either have an option on the menu, or the chef puts something veggie together based on the ingredients they have on hand.

I settled on the spring mix salad, which was fine, and the mushroom toast appetizer as my main course, which was not fine.  The toast was over-baked to the point that I could barely get a knife through it, the mushrooms were burnt, and the entire dish had so much salt on it that I was crunching on salt grains, and no amount of water could quench my salt-induced thirst. I only got through about 1/4 of the dish before I gave up. (If I hadn't been so hungry, I wouldn't have made it as far as I did!)

I should also mention that it took an incredibly long time for our main courses --mushroom toast app and buttermilk fried chicken-- to come out.

My husband enjoyed the buttermilk fried chicken, although he found the gravy and the sides to be too salty and the mashed potatoes to have an uneven consistency.

We had been looking forward to coffee and dessert, but we decided to call it quits after a not so stellar experience with dinner.  

We were initially excited to have a restaurant like Sycamore in the area, but after last night's experience, I don't think we'll be going back. Sycamore's sister restaurant, NoBL, closed recently, and Sycamore is likely heading in that direction if they don't significantly step up their game.

My favorite restaurant is 3 hours away, I have been here for three years and have had a hard time finding that "spot", my husband and I dined here on Wednesday night and hard the grand prixe (only offered wednesdays and sundays) was $35 a person, a 5 course meal and it was blind.  For every course we each received separate dishes, loved this as it enables us to share and really sample the menu.  Neither one was served something we didn't love!!  We have so many other restaurants we are trying in the near future and we will be very surprised if Sycamore is topped.  The only reason we did not do five stars is because of the chairs and seating, but when you are served this kind of food you won't care if you are eating on the floor!!
So delicious! Farm to table is my favorite type of restaurant. Gets you to try new and locally sourced foods great!!!!

I was a huge fan of this place when Chef Sam was at the helm. I haven't gone since he left so the new chef could get it together. Even with the time given, this place has lost its shine. The food was okay, but nothing I couldn't get from any other place in Delaware County (which isn't saying much, considering the dearth of non-chain restaurants). Standard issue salads, salmon served on underwhelming rice, overcooked steak, boring desserts. Bleh. Sycamore is destined to go the way of NoBL--because mediocre food is not going to draw anyone to Lansdowne when there are so many better restaurants in Philly proper.

I had a great experience here the other night.I went for my birthday after plans with someone else fell through.On the way I stopped at the Wine and Spirits shop on West Chester Pike Havertown and picked up a nice bottle of red.the restaurant was dimly lit but in a relaxing way with a lot of natural light still coming in at 6:30 p.m.it's a small place probably better to go on the earlier side because it fills up quickly. There is a minimal staff but they are more than able to serve a full room.The two young men that waited on me we're both casual but formally trained. The food was great and the chef was creative. They have one of those new-fangled sign on an iPad and swipe your credit card yourself kind of things with an option to  have the receipt emailed to you later. Overall an excellent and very pleasant experience

Fantastic little hideaway in suburban Lansdowne.

Finally got over to try this place given that it's only about 10min from us, and the idea of fine dining fare in a suburban clime was tempting indeed. It did not disappoint. 

Small and intimate, with wide rustic tables and fantastic lighting, Sycamore served up flavorful new American fare with a touch of French influence. 

My favorite, the fact that BYO here is made fun. It's foreign to me to have to bring your own liquor and since I love mixed girly drinks, the idea is not only foreign but unappealing often times to cart in my own drink. Sycamore mixes frou frou drinks for you, without the liquor in a shaker, then delivers the shaker to your table, you just add the splash (or cup) of liquor, shake it up and pour. I got something with pear nectar and added peach vodka (all I could find on our way out of the house, another downside of BYO, having to remember to pack your liquor!) and it was really amazing.

Bonus of the BYO is that when the bill came, it was only $100 for a serious 5 star dining experience. The service was amazing, the food rivaled fare in SF, we were in love. Can't wait to return, often.
From the appetizers to the entrees to the excellent service, this place is great! So glad to find this neighborhood gem!

Maybe it's because Chef Jacobson is no longer here, but I didn't get all of the Sycamore hype. (We probably showed up 3 weeks too late...) 

We made the trek out to Sycamore for a double date. Someone in our party heard that Sycamore was totally "orgasmic" and we had to come try it. The 4 of us ended up in the large communal table in the back room. The seating arrangements were comfortable enough, so we all shared a little bit of everything and ate family-style. The server was cool with this and so he brought out a few small plates for us, which was definitely appreciated. 

So what did we have?

- Seared Foie Gras - I remember enjoying this. 
- Cheese Charcuterie Plate - I'm not really a cheese person, but they did not have the cheese that our party really wanted. ("Ran out.")
- Scallops - Overcooked and were a little rubbery.
- Venison Chops - Okay, but still quite gamey. 
- Seared Tuna - Over-seared. It was more of a fully-cooked tuna.
- Halibut - Decent.
- Maple Creme Brûlée - This was not even a Creme Brulee... it was more like melted ice cream. 
- Sticky Toffee Pudding - Can't complain. 

Do you want to know what REALLY turned me off at Sycamore? While we were still working through our entrees, a server came by and starting spraying down the table next to us. Now, I understand that they need to clean off the tables after a party leaves, but she was full on spraying it with an insane amount of cleanser while we were still on our ENTREES. It got to the point that all we could smell was the ammonia. What does that tell me? She was probably trying to give us a sign to hurry up and eat so they could close up and get out. So much for a fine dining experience.
The food is out of this world would have been 5 stars if it wasn't for the slightly slow service!!! Sticky toffee pudding dessert was awesome!!!!

The menu here is inventive and trendy.  The service was a little flighty but friendly.  I recommend the chef's tasting menu if you enjoy variety.  It's a BYOB but they have a great cocktail list.  They provide the mixer and you add your own liquor.  It was a little pricey but worth the visit.  Lansdowne is a great little location -- just west of University City if you're coming from the city.

Those of you who stay culinarily current will not be caught off guard at the voguish Sycamore, but they might be left with a distinctly bipolar impression of the trendy spot. 

The decor flows smoothly and provides a consistent palette in tune with the establishment's name, but it looks as if it were done by your handyman neighbor on his weekends with a few beers in him. Oh, and that same handyman made the seats, which creaked and groaned and swayed more than a skyscraper's 100th floor. In this amateur critic's opinion, an upscale dining experience is undermined  by feeling the furniture will fall apart at any moment. 

Far and away, the best part of Sycamore is the food. Portions were adequate (even generous considering the voguish nature of the dishes), well-executed, and delicious. For my first course, I ordered the 'Mushrooms on Toast', which impressed me with its earthy and rich tastes and a light, yet satisfying quality. My main course, the not-always-available pork chop, was a delight. Juicy and flavorful in ways pork seldom is, the filling portion was worthy of building a meal around. Rounding out the meal was my choice of a deconstructed lemon pie. I admit, I was skeptical at first. How could a plate of whipped cream and scant smears of reduction be satisfying? I was so happy to be proven wrong, so much so that I may have to re-evaluate how I see desert entirely. 

In the end it's not the cuisine which smears Sycamore, but its menu and its service. It's a BYO, going so far as to offer cocktails sans liquor (with the idea that you bring your own presumably tiny bottles). Although an interesting concept on paper, in practice it seems out of place with the trendy, full-service experience they otherwise propose. The service, while adequate when the room was less crowded, rapidly deteriorated as the night went on and the place filled up. Signs of understaffing and inexperienced staffing (many of them looked in high school or just out) hurt our group's experience to the point where several items were taken off our bill in apology. 

Sycamore is not for everyone. It's menu is cuisine couture prepared by a knowing hand; it's front of house staffed by by last year's local high school graduates. But if you watch the Food Network religiously and DVR every episode of Iron Chef, then this is one establishment you must try for yourself.

I went to this restaurant with my adult daughter and brother from Buffalo,N.Y. For lunch today and had a wonderful lunch. We all had something different and it was all great, can't wait to visit again. Service and food were all wonderful.

I've been back twice since Chef Sam's departure. During each visit, we saw glimmers of the place we were drawn to over the last two years, but the food and the front of the house just weren't the same. Sycamore is still a solid BYO choice, especially here in Delco.

I have been thinking for a while about what I would write about my visit 2 weeks ago to Sycamore. There were many, many high points, but also some not so much. 

The location of this place is a little odd. But after reading so many great reviews, I decided to give it a go. I was treating my husband to a make-up birthday dinner, and we drove a long distance to get here, coming all the way from Northeast Philadelphia. It was most certainly worth the trip. We decided to throw caution to the wind and go with the $29 prix fixe. My husband was worried about it because he doesn't like salmon (clearly because he is crazy), but I was pleased when I asked the server to exclude any salmon selections and he did not seem to mind at all.

Not to get too much into specifics, because it's a varied menu anyway, but everything we had was very unique, inspired and seriously magnificent. There were several courses- amuse, bread, salad, mezze, entree, cheese and dessert. The portion sizes were much larger than I had anticipated as well. Quite impressive for only $29! Seriously, if I were judging Sycamore on food alone, I would be giving 5 stars without hesitation.

Alas, there were a few misses. Sycamore prepares a few different cocktail mixers to accompany whatever spirits you've decided to bring. We tried two different shakers, Indian Ocean and Moscow Mule. I feel like these were conceptually very good, just executed poorly. Both had waaaaaay too much citrus. We couldn't even finish the second shaker because we were both starting to experience terrible heartburn. But like I said, I think this is a small error in execution that could be easily adjusted. 

Then there was the service. I won't say that the service was at all poor, just a little...off. The servers (both male) were both dressed khaki pants and non-matching sweaters, so it really just looked like street clothes to me. I can kind of get what they are going for with this, but then the bus-girl was wearing all black. I feel like there really needs to be some kind of cohesiveness with the uniforms. It's a small detail I know, but I certainly noticed it. Also, at one point we asked to see the menu again to look over the mixers, and the server completely forgot to come back and check on us to see if we wanted to order any of the drinks we had been looking at.

At the end of the day, Sycamore is a lovely restaurant that really hope does well. I will certainly be returning again, and I hope that they will have tied up some of these loose ends by the time I do.

I used to love this place. Something happened and now it's not worth the money anymore.
 
We ordered à la carte. The 3 appetizers were good, ingredients were fresh, my cabbage soup was a little average. 
Then we got 2 risotto and the broiled ribs.
A risotto for $25 needs to make me scream of enthusiasm, instead it was boring and overcooked. Same thing with the ribs ($28). Any diner would have cooked them the same way. 
Desserts were good. Waiters are as strange as always, but we knew that already. 

PLEASE FIX WHATEVER IS GOING ON WITH YOUR KITCHEN!!! I WANT TO LOVE THIS RESTAURANT AGAIN!!!

I read all the good reviews of sycamore so I was expecting something exceptional. I was disappointed with the finesse of the food. It was good but not great. A fine neighborhood restaurant but not worth it going out of the way for. The service was friendly but very amateur except for the manager who was very good.

I created a Yelp account just for this. We dined here recently and got the chefs tasting menu. One dish after the other was totally disappointing. I've made better salad, soup, risotto, salmon, and steak myself at home. Service was excruciatingly slow and the waitress unfriendly. I was still starving at the end of the meal.

Oh yeah, and the dessert- "lemon cake". What arrived was two teeny 1 inch lemon tarts (...not cake), tasting as if they were straight off a jumbo tray purchased at Costco. Disgraceful.

Upon leaving,  I had these thoughts: 1) I can't believe my spouse and I paid nearly $150 for this.  2) I can't believe this meal took over 3 freaking hours. 3) Does anyone else want to stop for a burger?

In the end no burgers were had, but I did inhale a donut when I got home. It was the best thing I ate all night. Enough said.

As an out of towner, I rely on you, Yelp users to direct me & my party of 7 other people to an awesome meal. Yelp, you have severely let us down.

After returning from our dining experience, I am stunned that some Yelp users could describe the same food I just ate as "divine" "breathtaking" & "perfect". Our server greeted the table about 10 minutes after we arrived, not introducing herself or asking if we'd like to start with an appetizer or something to drink, not with an Amuse Bouche as many Yelpers have recounted in their reviews, but with a simple "do you know what you want", verbatim. After asking several questions, most of my party got the tasting menu.

The salad was forgetful & uninspired, followed by a squash soup that was not properly seasoned... each course took around 20-30 minutes to arrive at our table. This would be acceptable for entrees, but not starters. Our server completely skipped the Mushroom Risotto course, and after she served us our 4oz salmon (topped with warm, barely cooked bell pepper & olive??) we realized this, and she brought the box-mix rice & cream of mushroom soup dish out... of course this caused a delay in the "Wagyu" skirt steak which arrived medium well at best... it was accompanied by 3 small brussels sprouts. The combined price for my wife's & my meal (with auto gratuity) was $140. We thoroughly mocked everything about the restaurant on the way home, from the barely warm risotto to the ill-conceived napkin & cocktail shaker concept in which you shake every drink, including carbonated ones. Idiocy. My understanding upon reading older posts is that the chef who earned their incredible (inexplicable?) 4.5 star rating has since left leaving a shambles of what apparently used to be a decent place to eat. This is no longer the case.

I feel sort of bad leaving a review such as this after all of the intense hype and love fellow Yelpers before me have doled out... It's not that my meal wasn't good; it most assuredly was. My deductions came from odd portion ratios and flighty service. But let's not get ahead of ourselves, this place deserves its due accolades first. 

We started with the farmer's plate which was very tasty. We opted to have the chef choose our three cheeses and three meats. For the mains, I choose the scallops with vanilla bean risotto and my bf had the spare ribs with mash. They were good, but nothing that would bring me back to the Lansdowne area again for it. My scallops were cooked perfectly. They were on a California king sized mattress of "vanilla bean" risotto. There was SO much of it... And had I not known the starch was to have vanilla in it, I would have simply assumed it was creamy risotto. BF's meat was alright, but I though it a touch bland. He ate it without any complaints. 

We decided to for-go dessert, which NEVER happens. Everything coming out of the kitchen looked super tiny and nothing on their menu sounded particularly scrumptious. 

As I had mentioned before, the service was a little...off. I'm not entirely sure how to fully explain it. Our waitress was lovely, but it seemed that everyone had some involvement with our meal. At one point, this random man came up to our table and asked my boyfriend how he was enjoying his meal. He completely blew me off and I didn't see him give any of the other tables any attention either.... I'm still not sure if he was apart of the staff or just thought my bf looked dapper in he blue button down. 

Nothing about this place was "bad"... And perhaps if I lived in the immediate vicinity, I would give Sycamore another go... But I don't believe we'll be venturing there again.

This is a review for first-time diners of the Sycamore (obviously tonight there were many repeat customers who where there but we were not among that group): We've been looking at coming to the Sycamore for a long time now; the reviews seem to be consistent and it was a birthday event so we wanted to try something new.  We liked the fresh, local concept of the place, the sample menu online was intriguing and so we reserved a table for this evening.  Upon arrival, we were escorted quickly to a tiny table near the windows (nice for an urban dining experience but felt a bit cramped ultimately), but overall the it was a bit noisy once the restaurant filled to capacity (i.e. if you bring older people with hearing issues this could be a problem).  For a first course I ordered the chopped wedge salad - it was whelming... not overwhelming, not underwhelming... just whelming.  My dinner companion ordered the carrot and ginger soup, which was good, but was even better with some fresh, ground pepper, salt and the fried shallots I shared from the top of my salad.  For an entree I ordered the rabbit, which came by itself with a puree underneath - a starch or a vegetable would have been nice for a $23.00 entree!!  My dinner partner ordered the salmon which was well cooked, but the butternut squash puree was overly sweet, and required some fresh ground pepper, which the staff had to go in search for (there was no salt or pepper on our table), and then the staff asked to take it from our table when it was needed (I think maybe they should make sure they have more than just one on hand for the restaurant).  All in all, dinner was... whelming.  The place is nice, but 
I'm not sure what will draw us back there with so many other options to experience.  Maybe it's worth a one-shot if you haven't been there... as long as they aren't out of the short ribs or the steak (as they were tonight - a Friday night at 7:30) - then you should see if you disagree with our review. Overall, I think that the next time we want something similar, we have other options we would look towards first.

I have to be honest, maybe it was all the hype, and the great reviews, and my long wait to get there, but I was not blown away at all. Everything was good, but every item seemed to have one to many ingredients, and not in a good way. I feel like if they just try to go 1 step too far with almost every dish we tried. It is definitely worth trying, maybe we just ordered all of the wrong stuff (mostly recommendations from our server). Additionally, we had a server who was waaaay over attentive, in a "please give us at least 1 minute uninterrupted to eat" kind of way. I feel like we spent more time listening to him then being able to converse amongst ourselves. All in all, it was a good meal, just not great. We might try again, bc I really wanted to love this place, and I know everyone can have an off night.

business.name: PROVIDER
business.categories: Bakeries, Bars, Nightlife, Coffee & Tea, Food

reviews.text:
Completely changed menu and only have 1 vegan breakfast sandwich after having a completely vegan menu. Really unfortunate since I used to love coming here.

Also, they don't offer gluten free bread for the sandwiches anymore and they used to have Native Bread for them. They have a gluten free bagel but I was told I couldn't get it for a sandwich. Only with a smear. Makes no sense.

Great coffee but won't plan to eat here anymore.

This was a spot that I wanted to check out because I saw some pictures on Instagram. Provider is located in the same building as Tinker Coffee! There's a private parking lot and I was able to find a spot. 

The coffee shop is not that big but they have adequate seating. I was able to find seating at the bar. I went on a Saturday afternoon so I'm not sure how busy it usually is or what their peak hours are. I was facing the cute "Nice Weather" neon sign. The coffee shop has nice natural lighting. 

I ordered a hot Miel latte (which is seasonal). All of the lattes are $7 (which is on the pricier side in my opinion). 

I enjoyed my latte but it was on the sweeter side. It was also garnished with something - I'm not really sure what.... I'm moderately allergic to nuts and it seemed like maybe my latte might have been garnished with some kind of nut? 

I ended up not finishing the latte because it was a lot (oz wise) and a little too sweet for me. 

Overall, I would definitely come back and try something else! I enjoyed the vibes and ambiance.

I really enjoyed going to Provider. It's a nice looking place and I love anywhere I can find Tinker Coffee. I got the breakfast sandwich and that was great as well. 

Be careful parking. This place is so busy it fills up fast and some spots are reserved for the tech company only in this space and employees told me they will tow your car. 

My only gripe is they are TOO popular sometimes (or maybe I just have bad luck! Trying to find parking can be tricky and once I walked in and 20 ppl were standing in line so I nope'd out of there. 

Overall I like it and hope to actually sit and drink coffee and hang out there. It could easily be 5-star territory except my gripes.
Cute little place with plenty of parking. Nice place to get away and work. I had an americano, which was pretty good. Not the best I've ever had, but good nonetheless.

Oh oh! Indiana never surprises with casual and happening coffee shops. Provider coffee is located in the same building as Tinker Coffee. Beautiful outdoor setup for warmer weather days and similar menu as Coat check coffee located in Indiana downtown. The chocolate brownie paired with the house drip coffee was bomb! The pistachio latte had a wonderful, vibrant combo of pistachio and lemon which was heaven with every sip.
Good place to work or just casually hang out with friends, ample parking space and quite close to downtown but not within to face any parking challenges. Will definitely be back!

I used to really LOVE provider but recently their drinks are upcharged and have been suboptimal. They serve tinker coffee which used to be more affordable. Still a great atmosphere which is the reason for the 3 stars but you can get better coffee at other places in the city.
Provider is a great place to catch up with friends or colleagues. They have wonderful lattes that are unique to them. Typically I drink black coffee, but I love their golden milk latte! It's a winner

This coffee shop is a great spot during the summer! There is a ton of outdoor seating on the patio. However, during the winter or any cold/rainy/snowy day it can be tough to find a spot inside. But... that's because the place is usually packed because the coffee and food is so good! I love their golden milk and their specialty lattes are delicious. They make a mean breakfast sandwich and are usually pretty quick.

This unique little coffee shop is a hidden gem in the Old Northside neighborhood! Check it out - each of their lattes taste like it's crafted just for you (which it is!). Not to mention that they offer this space for weddings/cocktail hours when it's closed on Saturdays. It is such a fun place to chill out and has a natural vibe where it's very relaxed. Try their golden milk latte if you like Chai tea!
Friendly service, great avocado toast, and coffee. We sat outside on a nice covered and clean patio. If I lived in the area this would definitely be a place I'd go regularly.

This is one of my very favorite coffee shops in indy! Every single latte they make is out of this world and not too sweet--very well balanced! Plus when they're serving food options, whether it's lentil soup or a croissant, they perfect everything they serve! The baristas also make a point to remember your name. Great outdoor and indoor seating vibes. It might come off as a bit bougey initially but the baristas are usually very helpful when you have a question. Great vibez!

I love touring coffee shops and trying their specialty lattes, so I opted for the iced ginger latte here... it wasn't a bad cup of coffee, but it was definitely not worth $7 (+tax!). I can usually get something similar in Indy for $5-6, tops. My husband said the same thing about the $4 Flat White. 

I don't know that I'll come back, just because the prices were so high, but the location and decor were nice enough. You can tell it's owned by the same people who own Coat Check Coffee because several of the drinks (like the flavored lattes) are exactly the same, but the setup and decor here is different. Very hipster-stylish vibes with hanging plants and a painted mural wall.

Honestly my favorite thing was the tables! They were deep enough to set up a laptop and a notebook in front of you, so you could set up a pretty great work station.

Provider is my go to coffee shop, and it's not just because I live within walking distance! Their speciality lattes may not be everyone's taste, but if you're looking for something unique they definitely have it. Their patio is unmatched in this area, and their location just off the Monon is super convenient. You will pay a higher price than most other shops in the area, but it's because they've gone to a no-tipping model in order to pay their employees more, which I really love. It's the best coffee with the best atmosphere, I can't recommend it enough

Provider is one of my favorite spots in Indy. Their coffee is fantastic and they always have interesting lattes. They always have vegan options for food as well. The vibe here is my favorite, from their outdoor patio to all the plants inside. Conveniently located off the Monon.
Coffee is good of course but bummed that there was  no sugar free syrups and no nonfat milk.

Best coffee shop in Indy. We have been exploring all things coffee in Indy and Provider is by far our favorite. The atmosphere is great and the coffee makes it even better.  I always get the ginger latte with oat milk. It's amazing.

Provider is my favorite coffee shop in Indy! The specialty lattes are expertly flavored with a variety of fresh spiced syrups. I have tried each one and love them! The chocolate is unlike a normal mocha in that it is light and not overly sweet. My go to is the pistachio latte as it has a slight spicy tang with a warm nutty flavor! I highly recommend trying this shop, it's also next to the monon trial!

I've been wanting to try Provider for awhile now and I'm glad I did! We arrived shortly after opening on a Saturday morning and they were already very busy. Our order was quickly taken and not long after that we received our drinks and then our food. I highly recommend their iced pistachio latte as it isn't overly sweet and has a wonderful and satisfying flavor. I noticed while waiting on our drinks that the syrup is weighed out on a scale. This is awesome because that means a consistent taste no matter who is making your drink! We also got their avocado toast which was a work of art. Very filling and comes with two slices.  We soon realized a slice each would have been enough to fill us up but we had already purchased their sausage breakfast to split. This was also very yummy with its fluffy egg and jalapeño jelly! Overall Provider is a stunning local coffee spot that has a wonderful selection of unique drinks and food. I'll have to come back to try their long drinks!

The space : This place is a somewhat hidden gem! The indoor and outdoor space are a coffee shop dream perfect for pulling out your laptop or just enjoying a good beverage. 

The drinks: The matcha tea is about $8 which is a bit pricey...but it's delicious so definitely worth an occasional treat. I'd also recommend the horchata or the horchata latte...to die for! 

The food: I've only tried the avocado toast (maybe 5 times) and it is delicious (and I'm not just saying that because I'm a millennial lol). The other food items also sound good and are on my list to try. Yum!

Absolutely delicious. I had the signature latte, iced, ginger. Freaking delicious! Tad bit expensive but I'd go again, and again, and again. Also the customers seem super courteous. No one was talking to loudly.  And it's dog friendly!

The best coffee place to ever exist. I spend an insane amount of money here. Almost $30 a day when I do go. I will go in the morning and get a Butterscotch latte (heavenly) with a vegan donut or breakfast sandwich. Then I will study in their space with the most comfy seating, best music, and immaculate vibes and start to crave their lunch to-go options. I hate buffalo and the chickpea buffalo salad is still a 10/10. The kale salad is one of the freshest salads I have ever had. And then the love of my life the Cauliflower Veggie Wrap is my go-to. I am obsessed with this place obviously.
Our favorite local coffee shop, the people here are so kind and they know what they are doing! the Ginger and butterscotch lattes are our go-to orders. You don't want to miss this spot!

Quick morning review... 
$8 for a matcha tea is pretty high. They go from $4-5 just about everywhere else in the city. Service wasn't bad. They had my drink made quickly. Beautiful interior.
Great outdoor setup! I'd really like to come back later in the day for drinks and hopefully add another star.

I used to really enjoy going to Provider because their vegan options were amazing, but they've since gone hill. Everything is prepared now, and the two vegan option they have left is avocado toast (which is not good) and a English muffin sandwich with some frozen justegg and beyond sausage patty. Not really worth 9 dollars compared to the old sandwich they had. I really enjoyed their mostly vegan menu. Everyone I've talked to, including omnivores, aren't happy with the change either. Their pistachio latte is excellent though!

The golden milk is my absolute favorite but today I had the Matcha Latte and the blueberry muffin which is delicious!! My daughter loves the over-sized chocolate croissant. I love the industrial feel of this coffee shop. They have outdoor patios seating since there are still COVID restrictions.

business.name: Chop Steakhouse & Bar
business.categories: Food, Steakhouses, Lounges, Seafood, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

reviews.text: Ordered through Skip. Had the prime rib and chicken wings. I had requested medium rare on my prime rib but it was medium well. Was really delicious otherwise and I would definitely recommend it. Was super tender and flavourful. The wings on the other hand were a disappointment. They were really dry and didn't taste very fresh. Wanted to order the smoked ribeye that everyone seems to be raving about but they were sold out. Meal wasn't cheap by any means but was to be expected at a place like that. Just wish the food was prepared with a bit more care.

I hope I'm reviewing the correct location. We went to the one close to West Edmonton Mall.

Expensive, as to be expected, but honestly not THAT expensive considering it's a steakhouse. I'm pretty sure we spent $110 including the tip for two people, granted we didn't drink. My husband got the filet minion and I got the baby back ribs. The food alone was PHENOMENAL and the service was fantastic too. Tara, our waitress did a really good job. They also took my unusual anaphylaxis case seriously. Would definitely recommend!!
Best Bar Service Ever !!!!  The Best Old Fashion in Edmonton!!! Rhonda best Bartender !!!!!

For Valentine's Day this year, my partner and I decided to order takeout- getting into the pandemic spirit, right? Chop had a 3 course meal for 2 deal on their website so we took the plunge to try it out.

For my entree, I had the miso glazed salmon and OMG... it was phenomenal. It was perfectly cooked and the miso glaze was although subtle, it seemed to work perfectly with the salmon. Chop truly is one beast of a steakhouse. My partner had the ribeye and requested it to be cooked rare. Chop delivered and the steak turned out to be a perfect rare.

My favourite way to end a meal is with a good dessert. The chocolate torte is probably my favourite- rich and decadent. Just how chocolate tortes should be. Having worked in a bakery, trust me when I say the chocolate torte is good.

All in all, Chop is probably one of the better steakhouse chains in Edmonton. I would probably rank them alongside The Keg (which I love equally).
Really great food highly recommend eating at Chop!!

We went for lunch and it was great! First off the beef dip was actually prime rib on a bun, looked so good. My hot chicken sandwich was also great. Though to be honest not to hot. The service was great, quick and attentive. However the parking was awful, I mean you could park in other lots and walk but who wants to do that. It looked like they did have private rooms if you wanted to rent one out for an xmas party. But it is a steak house so bring $$$

We just went to Chop and had the Greatest Experience!
Food & drinks were on point and the entire staff was beyond exceptional!!! Go to the lounge and have Sky as your server.... absolutely a superb experience!!!

I prefer this place over The Keg now, as I just find the steaks so much better here. 

Took my dad for his birthday and he enjoyed his steak and lobster, as well my mom liked her ribs and even had enough to take home.  My steak was made perfectly, as I like some pink in it.  There was a bit of a mix up on the orders, but kudos to management for coming over to fix things, which he didn't need to, as I still enjoyed my meal.  Our server, Kendal was awesome too and one reason why I love coming here, great and attentive service!  Sorry Keg but I'm now a Chop convert!

To start off on a positive, the place was a nice little spot that was at a convenient location. However , my fiancé and I had stopped in for a couple drinks and an appetizer last weekend and were excited to try something new . The place was a little busy , and as we went into the lounge area to find a place to sit we noticed that the two person table they had by the window was sticky and was not cleaned off. The drink or sauce on the table also was left long enough on the table for it to dry. 
This table was in front of a window and the bar had been over looking it , there had been maybe two people sitting there and the bartender behind the barI'm sure had time to look over and check to make sure tables were cleaned after people left . 
The service was ok we had two waitresses that served us , as we ordered our food came quick although i ordered a salad and my fiancé ordered pulled chicken tacos. Some of my lettuce was brown but I ate around it. I noticed as I opened the napkin my utensils were wrapped in had crumbs inside (not very clean either). The croutons were flavourful and the chicken tacos were good. The quality of the two appetizers and cleanliness of our table we got didn't really seem to be worth what we paid.

Conveniently located very close to my hotel, but a real pain to drive into the lot. You actually need to go through Denny's to find it. Veggie tempura was very tasty, my sirloin and prawns were excellent. Craft beers were very good but pricey as expected. Perfect place to go on someone else's dime.

Very loud music in the lounge at 1:00pm in the afternoon.  Not sure why they do  that. Atmosphere is upscale.  Booths and the chairs were nicely padded too.  A couple of small TVs in the lounge. Staff are friendly.  Big windows in the lounge but view is of the parking lot.  The Black Smith Black Ale is very good if you are into dark beers. They gave me a glass with my beer but it was warm so I drank out of the bottle.  Hint.  The food is excellent.  The halibut burger was perfect and spicy.  The house salad was full of vegetables.  Steaks were made to order and juicy.  Lunch menu has reasonable prices.  I would return.

Now that the Keg near my house has shut down, I needed to find another good steak place. I tried this place out and was hella impressed. I found the staff were quite willing to do whatever needs be to keep the customers happy. I saw this happening at my table and others so it seems to be consistent.

The food here is tasty and the drinks (albeit I only tried the virgin cocktails) were artistic. I would highly recommend the rib eye
house-smoked with alder, apple & hickory, a cut I would never normally eat. But the way they treat it, I am salivating just thinking about it. It is a MUST.

There is a chocolate dessert that I fell in love with. Fallen Chocolate Soufflé Cake. I had to have two. 

Pro-tip: the bathrooms (at least the ladies) have two doors out going to different places....so make sure you keep track of which one you came in.

This happens to be one of my favourite places to have a steak.  I have been here several times and the service has always been great. Servers and bartenders are funny and are great at their jobs.  Food has always been so good.  I usually order the sirloin and get a cream brûlée for dessert.  And let me tell you every time they have delivered on taste.  Tonight the bartender was kind and funny and provided exceptional service.  Chop has one of my favourite wines from Tin Horn Creek their Cab Franc. Now you can only get it buy they bottle but it is worth every penny ($47 worth).  This place is just enjoyable. Great atmosphere and service.  This is what keeps me coming back.
Awesome steaks. Price  good. Beef is very tasty.  I will be back. My once year trip. Our waitress in bar was very helpful. I had the rib eye smoke. The beer was local on tap and very tastey.

To start off on a positive, the place was a nice little spot that was at a convenient location. However , my fiancé and I had stopped in for a couple drinks and an appetizer last weekend and were excited to try something new . The place was a little busy , and as we went into the lounge area to find a place to sit we noticed that the two person table they had by the window was sticky and was not cleaned off. The drink or sauce on the table also was left long enough on the table for it to dry. 
This table was in front of a window and the bar had been over looking it , there had been maybe two people sitting there and the bartender behind the bar I'm sure had time to look over and check to make sure tables were cleaned after people left . 
The service was ok we had two waitresses that served us , as we ordered our food came quick although i ordered a salad and my fiancé ordered pulled chicken tacos. Some of my lettuce was brown but I ate around it. I noticed as I opened the napkin my utensils were wrapped in had crumbs inside (not very clean either). The croutons were flavourful and the chicken tacos were good. The quality of the two appetizers and cleanliness of our table we got didn't really seem to be worth what we paid.

Two words, Prime Rib.
Oh man, I'm not always a fan of prime rib but I've never had one this good before. The meat is tender and flavourful, every bite in fact. Served with creamy mash, topped with green onions and in house made horseradish. I also tried the maple bourbon haddock which was dreamy. It's a bit spicy, a little bit sweet and it packs a punch... but not as much as the spicy prawns. They were so good my tongue was nipping with the garlic. 
The decor is classy and upmarket but not so that you don't feel uncomfortable wearing jeans or casual attire. The lounge/bar area is trendy and the dining area is well laid out, with well decorated booths. There are some quirky things to spot too, like the top hat lampshades and you can't miss bull outside (with the big balls) it's a talking point with the staff. Speaking of which, all staff were chatty and knew lots about the restaurant, including recent renos, menu tips and they were mega attentive along with it. Fantastic first visit to Chop.
Amanda was an absolute treat!full service and taken care of. She made great recommendations and the food was fantastic.

Giving a 5* rating at a resto is a toughie, especially at chain steakhouse in Edmonton, the land of chain streakhouses, but this particular Chop deserves it.  And you can see from my other reviews that I haven't always been such a big fan of Chop in the past, so you know I'm being genuine in my love for this Chop.
Every meal I've had here has been spectacular.  My steaks are perfection.  My sides are delish.  My appies are to die for.  And the selection of beer and wine and complimentary.
This is beautiful restaurant.  All cozy and classy and atmospheric.
The staff are second to none and make you feel welcome and at ease.  There is no pretense here.
Parking and access are super easy, it's right in the heart of West Ed and being attached to the Sandman hotel makes access a breeze.

Well done on this location Chop.

Solid steakhouse. The meat tasted of high quality. I had the filet which was seasoned perfectly and very tender. Our server, Rachel, was excellent. She checked in a lot (but not too much) even though she was also in charge of the whole bar. 

I wish they had more vegetable offerings (maybe a kale or Brussels sprouts side) but I'm spoiled by California produce. 

New Zealand Pinot noir isn't very interesting, but I should have known that.

I have died and gone to steak heaven.  Happy hour menu is the stuff of dreams.  I enjoyed the steak bites floating on golden mustard sauce with horseradish cream.  Teamed up with red red house wine. I can't get that song off my mind . Neil diamond red red wine make you feel so fine......thank you chop restaurant

I have died and gone to steak heaven.  Happy hour menu is the stuff of dreams.  I enjoyed the steak bites floating on golden mustard sauce with horseradish cream.  Teamed up with red red house wine. I can't get that song off my mind . Neil diamond red red wine make you feel so fine......thank you chop restaurant

The steak bites are just phenomenal. I ordered the hunter chicken and it swims in rich creamy mushroom sauce that is very delicious. The mashed potatoes were also really good. I had a gin tonic. This was a lovely dinner and my waiter was just fantastic.

Been to "Chop" before.  This particular one, is not as clean and classy as others.
Ordered Top Sirloin (medium), it came almost well done.

Dinner last night. Food was good - not great. Was expecting more with previous reviews. Service was great! Wait staff were attentive and friendly. Also,  they do allow you to bring a bottle in with a corkage fee.

food was extremely good, but it is a service issue again, it seems that here in Alberta at least, service isn't taken too serious, and they really do not care about the customer. every part of service is just slow...... I keep coming back cause food is great service still and as always needs work

business.name: Mayfield Dinner Theatre
business.categories: Restaurants, Canadian (New), Cabaret, Performing Arts, Arts & Entertainment, Dinner Theater, Buffets

reviews.text: I was recently here for a work Christmas party and it was a fantastic experience. Located Just inside the Mayfield Inn. The food is all buffet style. They have many different options as far as meat, salads, sides and desserts! My favorite was the Pierogi bar and the Oreo cheesecake. You get to enjoy your meal and a few drinks before the show. Also a good tip that someone showed me is to get your dessert just before the show starts then you can enjoy it while you're watching! The seating is teared so you can get a good view from almost anywhere in the theater. This was my first time here and I would definitely recommend it to friends and family for a great night out. The play I went to was all about Canadian history and music, poking a little fun at the things we do as Canadians for it's 150th anniversary. All the actors had incredible singing voices and the skits were quite funny! I would love to come back and see another show here soon.

Experience: 4.5
Food: 3.5

I have fond childhood memories of attending the Mayfield for family holiday brunches when it was called "Stage West" and seeing greats like Frank Bonner (Herb Tarlek on WKRP) and Jamie Farr (Klinger on MASH) doing hilarious farces after stuffing my face with roast beef and shrimp. Decades later, things haven't changed much, though the buffet feels a tad more generic now and the talent hails from closer to home.

The food is nice, if a little bland - the luxury highlights, as always, are the prime rib and the mounds of poached shrimp. The cocktail sauce is too ketchupy, but there is horseradish sauce by the prime rib to make amends. The hot sides were a bit of a disappointment because they're too cold - the mashed potatoes were barely lukewarm. Fill up on mains because the desserts are a huge disappointment. Nothing decadent here, just dry or foamy or spongey or slimy bites or squares or blobs of blah. Are they catering to the reduced calories crew? Looks somewhat cheap and tastes industrially prepared. There are neverending plates of cookies, but these are the same boring things you'll find by the "Kirkland" barrel-full at any conference or office meeting. For the ticket price, the Mayfield should really up their game in desserts and food temperature.

The musical show was terrific, and the coffee was great, too.

Really great time had at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre. I went for the Elton John and Tom Jones performance. Every time I go, I starve myself as I know the food will be amazing and this time was no exception. Every type of meet, salad bars, veggies, potatoes and tons of desserts. The food is always the same unless you go to a breakfast show! They serve the food from 6-8 for the evening show. I like going at six so I can eat slow and have breaks between courses! The show was awesome; the musicians are very talented. I took off a star as the tables are very close together. I had to turn my chair to see the stage but I couldn't turn it all the way so my neck was bent for most of the night. In the end, it was a great evening. I would totally recommend going!

Just recently saw Forever Plaid.  Although I wasn't super impressed with this particular show; it was still very enjoyable. Most of the shows that I have seen are very high caliber proformances. The buffet is amazing, with fresh, tasty food.  And so many lovely desserts.... it is hard to try it all.  Servers are professional and quick. Definitely will come here again.

We come for the shows but stay for the well-appointed buffet.

The first thing one sees upon entering are the publicity head-shots from all the years gone by. There are a lot of familiar faces, so please take the time to find your favorites.

The table seating is pretty good; it's hard to have a bad view of the stage.

The buffet is laid out with two mirrored offerings with a carvery in the center. There's something for everyone, from keto to sweet tooth, fish, meat, vegetables, pasta, desserts. I've had several chats with the chef de cuisine and have walked away each time pleased with his competence and enthusiasm.

The shows are very off-Broadway, but that lends a homey touch to the goings-on. I'm looking forward to our next visit to the Mayfield Dinner Theatre.

I went here this holiday break to watch "Back to the 80s Part 2: The Adventure Continues" this is based on the 80s cult classic film Bill and Ted's excelent adventure. I went on a Sunday and had the brunch and show. I had a blast at this show and the costumes, acting and singing were amazing. I thought the food that was provided at the venu was delicious and the service that I received was great. So far this is the third time that I have been to the Mayfield Dinner theatre and I have not been disatisified. The server that was assigned to my table to serve us was funny, polite and attentive. The seat I got was super close to the stage for a decent price. Although the tickets are generally expensive, the entertainment and the service that you get makes it well worth it. The choice of food at the buffet was also very good. I believe they had food options to meet the needs of everyone. I also really liked the venue because it is nice. I will definitely be coming back here this year to check out other shows and enjoy food and excellent music. If you're a fan of Ted and Bills Excellent Adventure, I recommend you check this show out... you won't be disappointed!

This was not my first or second time at this Dinner Theatre. I have come here a bunch over the years and I can safely say it is getting better and better. That says alot because it was a class act to begin with.

I have the other dinner theatres in the city to compare it to and this one definitely is a step above the rest. The food is excellent and I always eat too much. They don't cut corners here and the chefs definitely take pride in their work. I will admit this time the Gravlox was too salty and coming from a salt fanatic that is pretty bad. But other than that the dessert section was the only thing that could use some love. I found them to be a little boring.

The theatre aspect was incredible. I had seen 80's number 1 and this was the continuation....it FAR exceeded my expectations. I found myself singing to most of the songs, and I don't sing. I was just so excited I couldn't help myself. Sorry to my neighbors.

I will be returning in the future and find this a great way to spend a special occasion.

Celebrated our wedding anniversary and hubby took me here as a surprise.

Food was ok wine very expensive the play was great.  Our seating unfortunately was shared with another wonderful couple but it was a special celebration and I would have preferred not sharing.  The Staff were unwilling to change our table.

The shows are always very well done. Food is just okay. The wife likes salads and says that they are mediocre, not the freshest or tastiest. Most of the other dishes they have are pretty decent. All in all a pretty decent night out.

I am writing this review for the performance, "The Simon and Garfunkel Story" that I went to see today.

For those who enjoy the music of Simon and Garfunkel, I SINCERELY recommend you going to this production at the Mayfield.  I went today and it was excellent.  The music was exceptional and the singers portraying them made you forget it wasn't Simon and Garfunkel :-)

I don't make this kind of comment often and didn't know where to post it so you all could read it.  However, if you can go to see it at the Mayfield, it is WELL worth it.  It is like having Simon and Garfunkel holding a concert all these years later for us :-)

There was so much food. Like SO MUCH FOOD. It was pretty alright. Didn't stay for the show because...well...too much food. Maybe next time. And then maybe I'll know to pace myself. 

The service was bar none though. Any request was greeted with a smile & plates were cleared away quickly. If I could break it down I would give just the servers on their own like 20 stars. They were fantastic.

Come for the food, stay for the performance. Be sure to keep a player snacks before the buffet closes to snack in during the show. Staff is extremely friendly and efficient. The food is pretty good. The desert is awesome. But don't take my word for it. Come try it for yourself.

Only been here once. The show was amazing and very entertaining. The food is typical hotel catering. They could do much better. Although it came out hot I think it was either kept in a warmer for too long or microwaved. You only get 3 choices. Fish, chicken or meat. Go for the fish or chicken. The steaks looked like crap. Typical potatoes and veg side. Nothing special. You're paying for an amazing show, served with a TV dinner. Lol. But then again I wasn't really here for an amazing meal and I received warning from people I was going with about the food. So not inedible but nothing special either. Don't get your hopes up for a great meal. But be prepared for a great show.

Lovely spot for family entertainment.  I would definitely take my Mom (66 yrs old) and grandparents here...   The food is just alright, you're mostly there for the show!  The waiters are fun and attentive!

I came out to the Mayfield Dinner Theatre with some friends for the opening night of HAIR. This was my first time at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre, and it did not disappoint!! 

The buffet was delicious and some of my friends had wonderful tips (ie treat plate for the show). I can't remember the last time I ate that much food, but it was soooooo worth it! The prime rib, yorkshire pudding and entire dessert table were easily my favorites.

I really enjoyed the show. I've only ever been to Jubilations before, so this was a different experience for me. I loved how there was a band on stage so everything was live instead of singing to music playing in the background. They also had a great stage set up and lots of room to walk around between the tables, it didn't feel too cramped at all.

I can not wait for my next visit!!

Lights camera, buffet??!! 

Mayfield dinner theatre is ALWAYS a good time! 

Was recently here for their production of HAIR! pretty risqué choice for some of the grey hairs that were there but I loved it! It had sexual innuendos, jokes about drugs and hippie love! And the cast was phenomenal Islam their roles! Really well done! 

BUT THATS JUST THE SHOW! 

The wonderful staff of the Mayfield dinner always always take such careful care? Of you that you feel like Queen of the world! 

The seating is surprisingly intimate so you do get to spend time with the friends you've come with too! 

Then there's the food! So delicious! For buffet style serving, the food never ever disappoints. 

Siskel and Ebert would totally give this place 2 thumbs up, but we'll have to settle for 5 stars!

Edmonton, you sure are the home of many amazing attractions and the Mayfield is one of them! The Mayfield is nestled in Edmonton's West side and treats its guests to an all you can eat buffet followed by live theatre. I was lucky to get to check out the show Hair and it was quite the production!

Live vocals and a entire band on stage completed the retro vibe of Hair. The lighting and costumes transported you right back to a time where peace and love ran free. I could not believe the talent of each of the cast members. They all really brought it on opening night and brought the house down. It was a world class production and I was so happy to get to see it!

Now if your tummy is rumbling you may be wondering about the food. The all you can eat buffet is in a huge room at the back of the theatre. Your first stop is going to be at this delicious buffet after you have been seated and met one of the great wait staff. You eat all of your meal before your show in about a 2 hour time frame, so make sure to pace yourself! There is something for everyone and the menu changes with the production but they always have a cut of beef, chicken, fish and their amazing desserts. I definitely did not leave that establishment hungry.  I had a bruschetta chicken, prime rib, Yorkshire pudding along with salads and desserts. I think you can check the menu online before hand if you are curious.

It was a fantastic night out. This would be perfect for a nice date night, girls night or just a treat yourself evening. Thank you Mayfield for hosting a great night!

I had never been to Mayfield Dinner Theater but I had once been to the dinner theater in WEM. Based on that experience I didn't think dinner theater was my thing. 

I was lucky enough to get tickets to the latest and greatest shows opening night performance of Hair. As it turns out I was wrong. I love dinner theater.

Mayfield dinner theater definately offers a great night on the town. Their tables are set just far enough apart. And the chairs are phenomenal. We got there right at 6 and didn't leave till after 10. Not once did I become uncomfortable in my chair.

Enough about that the chairs. The food is were Mayfield really shines. It's buffet style eating but I love buffet. Getting to choose exactly what you want and how much you want. The prime rib was impeccable and the desserts. Oh the desserts. It's unfortunate my stomach isn't as big as my eyes.

As for the show well let me tell you it was Broadway worthy. Although probably on a bit of a smaller scale. The actors and actresses really poured their hearts and souls in their amazing performance. The band was spot on with great sound quality throughout the venue.  The set was simple but eye catching. 

Truly I can not wait to find another opportunity to go back and catch another show because believe it or not my friend told me that their other shows are usually even better then Hair!

Mayfield Dinner Theatre brings fabulous broadway shows right to good ol' Edmonton! With about 5 different productions throughout the year, there seems to be something for everyone. I've had the pleasure of enjoying Cabaret, Back to the 80's, and Hair, all in the past year. All great shows with very talented cast. 

The chef at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre ALWAYS makes an amazing buffet. First of all, who doesn't like a buffet. And second, who doesn't like a buffet that is actually delicious, quality food?! There seems to always be prime rib and yorkshire pudding, which is a staple for any buffet. All the dishes are really exceptional. Full of flavour, but not too rich where you'll feel sick. Well, I mean, you'll feel sick because it's a buffet, but the full kind of sick, not the "I just ate a tub of butter" kind of sick. Know what I mean? Ya you do.
