The best part of the buffet... in my humble opinion... is the DESSERT!!! Every. Single. Time. I am blown away. Sour cherry panna cotta, bread puddings, crumbles, mousses, cheesecakes. Good grief.  Pro tip - arrive at 6pm to start eating, then around 7:30pm, before the buffet closes at 7:45pm, grab yourself a plate of whatever you might want to snack on during the show. 

For the price, you can't beat the Mayfield. Follow them on social media because they always have "friends and family" discounts which I've seen as low as $69 per person! For amazing food and hours of entertainment. It cannot be beat! Even at regular price, you will not be disappointed.

The Mayfield dinner theater is a very good date night however it also can have some drawbacks. First off the good stuff. 

The buffet is amazing. There is always a full spread of absolutely fantastic that you will be wanting to go back for more. If your on a diet it's going to be very hard not to go back for seconds or thirds. 

The performance itself was good but not fantastic. The performers do involve the crowd and put on a good show however compared to some New York Broadway shows its just not as good. 

Lastly the seats that we had were very uncomfortable. We had a booth seat in the back. From that position there is no back rest for you to turn and watch the show easily. Half way through the performance I wanted to just stand in the Isle to give my back a rest.

If your going out make sure you don't get a booth seat but get a chair instead.

I had a girl's night out at Mayfield Dinner theatre last night and I was absolutely blown away!  That place has everything!

My girlfriends and I arrived at 6pm when the doors opened and there was a line, but the staff were absolutely organized and had us seated within minutes.  Our server was at our table in a flash to grab our drink orders and offer instructions for those who had never been to the theatre before and also to point out washrooms, etc.  I thought this was a really nice touch (go Sylvia)!

The buffet came next and my heart (and stomach) was filled with joy!  There were so many delicious options (prime rib, seafood, salads, cheeses, cold cuts). Everything looked amazing.  I was also impressed that everything was clearly marked.  I have a severe shellfish allergy and I did not worry at all because the shellfish was all grouped on a separate buffet table and was very clearly labeled.

Our night was topped off with a fabulous cast in Hair.  I was absolutely blown away by the casts' acting and singing talents.  The show flew by because I was singing along and swaying in my seat.  We were seated in one of the booths at the back of the theatre and we had a fantastic view and could hear everything perfectly.

I will definitely be back for another fantastic night out!

Wow! Great times were had with my friends at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre. I haven't been here in over 10 years and I am glad I came back to enjoy an evening of musical theater. 

I am not a big buffet lover because the quality of food often lacks but this buffet was most delicious! There was so much variety to choose from. You had your salad bar with your greens and noodle based salads, your cold cuts of meats and cheeses, bread, a mix of meat and seafood to choose from such as pork tenderloin, chicken, prime rib, basa, and a shrimp szechuan dish, and your carbs such as Mediterranean Pasta, potatoes and such. Oh! and the Yorkshire Pudding! Can't forget that one since it is probably the best I have had! And when you were finished sampling all of that, you have this amazing spread of desserts such as panna cotta, rice pudding, cheesecake, cookies, torte, raspberry mouse cake and the most delicious mouth watering apple crumble with strawberries. I had a food baby to say the least once I was all done.

The service was excellent. The staff were very attentive and I felt that we were well taken care of.

Hair is the show that is playing until the middle of June that is set in the late 60's during the Vietnam war. We were there for opening night. Although I really wasn't a fan of the play, the production of it was great. The actors are very talented, the choreography was awesome and the singing was wonderful. I guess I was expecting to hear more of those classic tunes from that era that we all know so well that speak to love, peace, drugs and rockin roll. But we still had fun groving in our seats. Again, as I said before, the cast did an awesome job.

Well done!

Came out to the Mayfield Dinner Theatre last night for the opener of #HAIR - and WOW!

From start to finish, it was my FAVOURITE night at the Mayfield Yet!

From Chef Willie White & Sous Chef Andre's amazing spread and hospitality to the show itself, I could t have asked for a better date night!

Where in town can you experience a 5 star buffet with prime rib, a massive variety of seafood, and a dessert bar to die for coupled with Canada's best dinner theatre?  The Mayfield Dinner Theatre of course!  

The set, the music, the cast of Hair was phenomenal!  The Broadway musical came alive last night and I am sooooo glad to have had the pleasure to see it! The cast interacted with the audience throughout the show in are ally unique way.  

And let's not forget the fabulous waitstaff who are there before you even know you need them!

If you haven't been in awhile or are yet to experience the Mayfield Dinner Theatre, now is time!  Call and book your seats today before HAIR blows away!

Wow, man! This show was out of this world! Just stopped in for another great show at Mayfield Dinner Theatre, Hair, and was blown away again. 

Walking in the staff at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre is so professional, and processes everyone quickly into the hall. Doors open at 6, and there is already a line up to get in! Why? THE FOOD! Oh man, the food. But they get you in fast and on your way to the buffet. When you hear buffet, it's usually met with skeptical looks and visions of stagnant food, but the food at the Mayfield Dinner Theatre is AMAZING! Hot and fresh, because the team moves so fast to keep up with the appetites of the guests! You have two hours to fill your belly with an assortment of meat, veg, salads, seafood and more! The team they have there is simply outstanding. The only thing better than the perfectly cooked beef is the desserts. Oh man, the desserts. This time my fave was the pumpkin cheesecake. So yes. 

Then the show. Hair was breathtaking. Such a powerful show, and the fearless cast performing it did the story justice. Some of the lead voices gave me goosebumps while they sang. The use of the stage by the huge cast and band was so impressive. It gave such a close and intimate feeling to the group. We're so lucky to have this quality of productions available to our community. I hope to go back again some time during the run of the show! 

Peace.
Had such an awesome night this time around at the mayfield dinner theater. Entirely new cast and they can SANG! There is awesome harmonies and everyone is uber talented. The Hair show is a must see.

business.name: Bliss
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants

reviews.text: Great brunch! Food was delicious. My group had two French omelets and "the monte." The latter was the winner with house cured pork belly on top of French toast! Good service too.

Will let you decide on my one star: 
Last Saturday ( Sunday before Valentine's Day) 
- seated without a drink menu( not a big deal)
-waitress didn't ask for drinks just asked if we were ready to order our meals ( not too bad)
- I ask what bourbons they have she comes back and say they don't have brandy 
-after 30 min ( I know this cause I was watching my watch and the guy seated next to me said you still haven't gotten your drink?) I then tell her bourbon and she brings back a clear glass which she insists is bulleit rye, it's gin.
-I go to the bar and get my drink (bad)
-we had to ask for the bread, that happened to be cold 
-dinner comes tells my date the cod she ordered was salmon 
- then we have to wait for utensils 
Outside the service, the food was on par with a meal you would find flying internationally

My friend and I stopped in for lunch during a shopping trip. Service was fast and friendly. The food was great. Relaxed atmosphere where you can hear each other speak. Seemed family friendly as well. Will definitely go back next time I spend a day in Center City.
for some strange reason bliss is listed as closed and it is not!!! bliss is open, i dined here last night and had a good time!!

We went here for a pleasant dinner before attending a show at the Kimmel Center.  I had heard great things about the restaurant, so we were looking forward to the evening.  Bottom line, this was a mixed experience and so at best the overall rating is 3 stars.  First, when we entered the restaurant - no one was at the desk.  We waited and finally I got the attention of the bartender who had someone from the back come out to seat us and confirm our reservation.  So I immediately sense there is something off.  Now, you should know that the food did not drop their star rating.  It is really how they got a 3.  The Pappardelle pasta was delicious as was the calamari and the Filet Mignon.  The Bluecoat martinis were done perfectly and we had good pours of wine.  So why do I give it only 3 stars?  It was our server.  He seemed as if he were "performing" a theatrical piece of his own design with grand gestures and a poorly written script -- rather than serving.  Every interaction came with some attempt at wit and charm, but it seemed strained and contrived.  The "young man" and the "petite young lady" lines might have worked a few decades ago on us, but they were a bit off putting now!  Yet, it wasn't just the old trite lines; it was the lack of attention.  I can never understand when a server is at another nearby table and never looks in your direction - to save them a trip, to see if you need anything, etc.  This server had that down to a science - he never looked at us unless we waved in his direction.  So when I saw the calamari come out of the kitchen; I also saw it sit, and sit, and sit on the counter.  Our server was nowhere to be found.  Finally; another server swooped it up and delivered it to our table.  When we pointed out it was cold - this new server - quite professionally said he would have them make a new batch and also made some rather generous adjustments to our bill.  The food was quite good.  The second server was attentive and professional, but alas our original server returned to close out the meal.  The message to management - if I wanted "dinner theatre" I would have gone somewhere else that night.  Also, one of the reasons I chose this restaurant was because it offered a discount on the expensive center city parking.  Never once did anyone ask us "where did we park," or "are you seeing a show" - anytime we are in NYC to see a show, they always ask us this - usually the server does it.  Well I guess our server was too busy being his own show to ask about us and we forgot to mention it.  We called the next day and brought this to the attention of the person on the phone - not sure they got that either.

5/5 on the food! I had the filet mignon with a side of asparagus (they are surprisingly spicy, but delicious).

That was where the positive ends, the service was just awful at a 1/5. Had a waitress named Kristen, who just didn't seem to be all there. Her demeanor did not match the atmosphere of the restaurant. She was cold, impersonal, didn't know the menu or the drinks and ruined an otherwise delicious meal. I'd return, but I would make sure to request NOT to be in her section.

Bliss has delicious food! I've dined here many times and the service is usually very good minus one time. When I called for a reservation I asked not to have that particular server take care of us. I was assured it would never happen again and that person was replaced after other complaints. We had a lovely dinner, received wonderful service, and even complimentary drinks. One bad apple shouldn't spoil the bunch or a good restaurants reputation.

We ate here last night for our anniversary dinner and were so excited to try a new (to us) place! Long story short, we were underwhelmed.

If you don't feel like reading the novel that is to come, here's the short: Food: 4/5 stars, Service -1/5 stars, ambiance, 3/5

When he made reservations he told them we were coming for our anniversary. Usually places do something for you to celebrate with you, like seat you at a more private or romantic table or at least a verbal mention. No acknowledgement. No big deal, we don't need a standing ovation, it's just that most places realize that you do it up big for a special event that you took the time to mention, and that they're lucky you chose them. The hostess was sweet and sat us right away, didn't ask to take our coats. 
We were seated by the window facing the street, which would have been nice except that these are usually doors that are open for open air seating. They were sealed closed with a clear tape, but there was a literal wind blowing the menu insert and my hair around. It's December, I'm in a cocktail dress. You put us next to a windy freezing door in an otherwise empty restaurant? After about 5 minutes no one had come over (there was only 1 other table in the place) so my boyfriend tracked down the hostess and asked her to move us. She did right away and the new table was great (and at a comfortable temperature), So now we're back on track!
We wait for awhile and finally an older blonde woman comes over and stands awkwardly far away from our table and says, "get you a drink?" Once we realized she was speaking to us, we asked for a drink menu. "don't you have one?" well, no, or we wouldn't have asked you. She returned, dropped it off and left us to decide. When she came back, I ordered a glass of wine and she asked me to repeat myself twice. You have 5-6 wines on the menu, how is this so difficult? So after more confusion and repeating, she leaves to get our glasses of wine. She brings them and tells us the special. I'm going to assume she meant chicken cacciatore soup but what she said was chicken skatatory soup. We pass on that, and I ask to have the salmon dish, without salmon, but with a different protein (that is listed as the same price). You would have thought I asked her to solve a difficult math problem. She made a big deal of it and finally agreed to ask the kitchen. She walked 10 feet away and asked and the guy in the kitchen said, "yeah, no problem" and was not at all phased, did not seem upset. She comes back and tells us we're ok, then leaves us to our wine. A bus boy brings us some bread in a cloth covered basket and it looks delicious! I pick it up to try it and it is ice cold. So why the basket? To keep it cold? Super disappointed. 
Food comes in a timely manner and is delicious. If there was a critique at all it would be that the scallops were a touch overdone, but were still very enjoyable. Ok, starting to forget about the negative stuff, back to enjoying our anniversary!
She comes and asks if we want dessert. I remember that on the dessert menu were also dessert drinks and I ask her for a dessert menu. She looks up at the ceiling and starts rattling off desserts. I tell her that I don't want dessert, but I do want a dessert drink, which was listed on the dessert menu. This is of course an enormous inconvenience. We get the menu and I order a boozy coffee with no whipped cream. Guess how she delivered it to me? Yep, a mountain of whipped cream. When I point out that I asked for none, she corrected me and told me that I asked FOR whipped cream. I assured her that I did not, and pointed out that the only reason I asked for NONE was because the menu lists that it comes with and I don't like whipped cream. So again, this is a huge ordeal as she huffs 6 feet over to the bar to have another one made. I'd like to point out that we were her ONLY table. The table that was there when we were seated was gone and another younger blonde waitress was tending to a table of 2, the only other table in the place. At no point was she even remotely friendly. At no point did she smile. This may have been the worst service I've ever had, and if not, it comes close. So, if you're looking for a special place to celebrate a special event, think twice about this place. We'd go back again if she wasn't there.

Friday the 13th didn't hinder another great meal at bliss!! My only issue was two fellow patrons and their appalling behavior! The way he and his wife treated their poor waitress is disgraceful! The couple with them looked mortified! You two should be ashamed of yourselves!
Love this place! Great food and atmosphere! If you headed to a show, this is the place to go!!
Had the perfect night. Loved the food, and the staff was incredibly friendly and excited about their food. One of my best dinners in philly so far.

Food was excellent.  Service was even better. Kevin and Becky were great. I had the cod and my partner had the scallops. Both were fantastic. We split the chocolate torte and blood orange sorbet for desert. Delicious.
Food was great. I had the scallops . He had the cod. We shared ahi app and chic tort dessert. Best part was our wait staff Kevin & Becky who made the meal as fun as it was delicious

I had a grilled cheese with apple slice inside. It was absolutely amazing.  I was skeptical when ordering but after biting in my taste buds were very pleased. It paired perfectly with the pumpkin soup which was truly amazing. The waitress was kind and knowledgeable of the menu and helpful with suggestions.

I'v been to Bliss many times over the years. Every time, I was absolutely delighted with the delicious food that was prepared and presented with tremendous imagination. This past Thursday, I had the Bliss Burger. Outstanding. I went back Saturday and had another. I am no so-called Foody", but I know great food that is interesting, tasty, wholesome and plentiful and that is presented creatively when I see and taste it. The prices are very reasonable.
When you go and if it is a nice day, sit outside and enjoy the sights of center city.

Just ate here and was shocked with the portions and prices. Was unable to finish my meal, the chicken sandwich was delicious and tried the crab cake sandwich and that was great as well. 
The service was great, was immediately seated and served. 
Definitely recommending this place. Ambience was relaxing. Probably not a good place for kids though but great for couples and groups. Thanks Bliss for an excellent lunch!!!

I went there for a business meeting. The meal I ordered wasn't too complex but I am so impressed with what they did with it. Everything was delicious! The manager was also very welcoming and accommodating. The restaurant service was excellent all around. I will certainly return.

We went for dinner before the ballet tonight. We had 6pm reservations for three people before a 7:30 show. At 7:10, we still didn't have our meals. When they arrived,  we scarfed them down in record time and ran.

They comped our two drinks,  but we still paid $150 for a terrible experience.

We have been here many times before, but I doubt we will be back.

ps - tell the chef when he speaks bad about customers from the kitchen, we can hear him.

I am all about zany.  If quirky and unusual can be used to describe my experience, then it's pretty much a guarantee that I'm gonna give that something five stars....5 million thumbs up.....43 snaps in a circle.

Something in planet weird aligned to make everything occur how it should have during my evening at Bliss.  In particular, the universe decided to give me Kevin as my waiter.  Im pretty sure his name was Kevin.  Boisterous, sarcastic, flirty, a little touch feely, a lot giving of hard-timey....but at the same time, really really seems to love and know his chef's food.  He also seemed to know a lot about the town and the places we should go based on what he could gather about our personalities.  I wish I could have hired him on as a personal person to ensure I had a good time wherever the world decides to take me in the future.

I'm a vegetarian....and while Bliss doesn't really have a lot on the menu that caters to vegetarians, the one dish that they do offer WAS EFFING AMAZEBALLS!!!!  It was  a pasta dish just wam bam thank you ma'am chalk full of flavor.  holy crap.  I could have horked down more than just the appetizer size portion I ordered.  I needed to slap somebody to express how good that was.

The 28$ for 3 courses menu with Yelp check in, caught my eye. However, it was unmemorable night. This is not based solely on food, it's based on the whole experience. 

1/ I was not a fan of the dull atmosphere.
2/  I was not impressed with the food.
3/  The waiter was professional, friendly and informative. 
4/  They did not honor the offer. 



Two Yelps
Excellent dinner. I had a sweet potato soup and the lamb loin. The latter was so juicy and tender it melted in my mouth. And the rice with feta sauce was delicious.

As you walk in there is a specified entrance with a hostess and place to hang your coat - I appreciate this because I hate walking in to restaurants and awkwardly standing among guests who are seated at tables. As you walk in the lighting is quite dim and the vibe is very relaxed. I went on a Friday at 7 PM and the crowd is definitely older - this is likely due to the proximity of the restaurant to the theater/concert halls. I wouldn't consider this a particularly "trendy" place but the service was excellent, the food was delicious. 
I was seated immediately even though my dining partner hadn't arrived yet. The brought me my drink and bread as I waited and didn't make me feel bad at all for taking up a table when the other person I was waiting for was stuck in traffic and 20 minutes late. We had the tuna roll app which was delicious. For the main course I had the scallops - when I asked to have a different side besides the one offered on the menu, the waitress immediately offered to prepare the dish anyway I preferred which I really appreciated. The scallops were excellently prepared and the mashed potatoes had a pool of melting butter on top - delicious!
After dinner we were heading to a show and it was so nice that this place was so close that in the winter it was a very quick walk to the theater.
I highly recommend for people looking for a place to dine before seeing a concert or show.

My boyfriend and I went to Bliss for a Valentine's Day dinner, at the suggestion of a friend. They had roses for guests. And we were seated quickly. Our waitress was Rebekah and she was awesome; so attentive and friendly. We arrived a bit early for the 4-course prix fixe menu; but they allowed us to order from it anyway. The amuse-bouche, oyster with cilantro, was absolutely delicious and had us craving seconds and thirds. The lobster soup second course left an unpleasant after taste; so they allowed us to order the beet salad (boyfriend) and Hudson Valley foie gras (me) instead. Both were awesome. For the third course, we had the 28-day aged ribeye for two, medium rare. It was cooked perfectly was and so tender. And then we topped it off with the cheescake and strawberry consommé. We've already made plans to return and try items on the regular menu.

Before I even get to the food I have to start by telling you about the service. Our waitress was very attentive and accommodating especially when we told her that we were celebrating a birthday.  She said she had the perfect idea to help us out, but I don't think she or anyone else thought that her fellow waiter would be serenading our table with a Portuguese version of "Happy Birthday". That's what he gets for being late to his own birthday dinner.

Now for the food, I started with the crunchy ahi tuna roll appetizer.  Normally you wouldn't think that a non-Japanese restaurant would be the place for sushi, but I was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed it.  I also took advantage of a special soup that was available that night. It was a sausage and bean puree that I found to be delicious, especially as a compliment to the cold tuna roll.

For my main course I couldn't pass up the beef tenderloin (even though the scallops were calling my name).  The meat was very juicy and tender and not very fatty at all.  It was served over mashed potatoes which were also delicious.

For dessert I chose the warm apple tart with vanilla gelato.  It was good, nothing spectacular, but the Portuguese birthday celebration definitely helped. I noticed that many of the other options included gelato as well.

Also worth mentioning is the parking lot right next door. Be sure to have them validate your parking ticket so you get the 50% discount before you head home.

Let me start with this-ask for Kevin to sing in Portuguese if it's anyone's birthday!

This little gem is in the heart of Philly's theaters and conveniently located directly next to a parking garage. Ask the restaurant for a coupon if they have any left. 

Our server, Rebecca (from Kentucky) was a gem. So friendly and attentive. The Manfriend and I started with a round of ginger mojitos which was a solid pick. The birthday boy and his little lady selected a bottle off of their rather extensive wine list. Glug glug. 

I started with their special bean and sausage soup that was topped with cheese. Delish. My dish was followed by their tomato and fresh mozz flatbread. Also delish. Are you seeing a pattern? 

And FINALLY a beautiful bunch of scallops was placed in front of me and I died and went to heaven. I mean these bad boys were cooked perfectly and not a speck of sand to be munched on. There were four but I could have eaten 10. So yummy. 

Like the true fat kids we are, everyone ordered dessert. They have a great selection of sorbets and gelatos. So naturally, I got ginger gelato and creme brûlée. 

The end. Happy dining. We highly recommend this place!

business.name: Siam Elephant
business.categories: Restaurants, Thai

reviews.text:
This place is incredible!

So clean!  Fresh food, wonderful choices.

So coming back there!

Beautiful located, a choice of sitting inside or outside.  THANK YOU!

I think fusion-style Thai food.
I found something in the food and they changed immediately. But not too sorry and not offer anything. I wanted to refund but just eat.
Anyway, every food is fine.

Well Date of Visit : December 19, 2021 and searching for an open Restaurant in Santa Barbara after 8:00pm is kind of difficult !! So what I noticed is lots of restaurants close fairly early and driving up and down the street plus walking in asking if restaurants are opened !! And most close early !! So Finally found this Thai Restaurant opened past 8:30pm and I walk in and was seated right away and it was really slow because it was 43 degrees outside and freezing so I guess no one wants to be outside eating !! Well for us we were fairly hungry and needed some food in our stomach !! As a foodie I always enjoy trying new restaurants and eating at new places !! So I Decided on ordering the Pan Thai Noodles and I have to say it is one of the more popular dishes here !! Cooked well and flavorful !! Next I got some appetizers which were the delicious Spring Rolls which they cut in pieces for you to dip into there delicious Peanut Sauce which comes on the side !! Those spring rolls were yummy !! Last I got the Red meat Wonton Soup which hit the spot !! Tasted pretty dang good !! I also noticed the decor was decorated with a lot of elephants around and I guess it's the symbol for this Restaurant !! But I do suggest you give it a try and enjoy the delicious Thai food they serve here !! One more thing the parking was not bad but you have to park on the side street and the first 90 Minutes are Free !! Well my overall experience was good and I definitely recommend this Restaurant to everyone to try  !! And if I happen to be in Santa Barbara again I might have to stop in once again !!
Had the lunch special pad thai with thai ice tea was delicious and well worth the price.

The panang curry was a little different from what I'm used to but it was actually really tasty, which is a lot to say for Thai food the SB County area! Nothing super special about the pad see ew but still better than most places in Santa Barbara. Service was great too, they were on point with filling up my partner's water cup haha. Would definitely come back!

This is a little gem down by the beach. We were all very happy with everything from the service to the food!  Our servers was very attentive and friendly. We had pad Thai, spicy noodles, chicken fried rice, chicken chow mein, fresh rolls and the rib appetizer. We will definitely be going back!

Best Thai food in the entire region. Reasonable prices, excellent food, dedicated, kind staff and wonderful, passionate hands-on owners. Food is so good! I recommend the Imperial Won Ton soup, the Asparagus Avocado salad and their scallops prepared any which way - always delicious. Their Duck Curry is also phenomenal. When you're in Carp and tired of Mexican food or pizza, check out Siam Elephant, you will not be disappointed!

Very good Thai food, love the milk tea!
The environment is good, both outside and indoor seating.

Wonderful!  We wanted Thai for a change and in little Carpintería this place delivered.  Their dinner combo was great - lots of entree choices that are bundled with Tom Ka soup (yuuuummm), some appetizers, and rice.  Prices very reasonable and a cute outdoor patio. Service was gracious and prompt.  Thumbs up!

We were going to camp at Carpinteria Beach and wanted a warm meal before we went in. I'm so glad we stopped here because this place was fantastic! It's a small place but the service and food were excellent! The hosts were very welcoming and checked on us multiple times to make sure we were doing well. We ordered the Chicken Panang Curry and Poh Tak Soup with sides of rice. The Curry was spicy and delicious! The best we have tried so far, and the Poh Tak Soup had a sweet flavor with a little bit of spice. Make sure you stop here! You won't regret it!

I love this restaurant and the staff that work there.
I am wondering if the cook had a bad day last Thursday night (10/7/21). Overcooked vegetables and too much bottled sauce. Sometimes the food is really delicious and sometimes not at all. I want manager to know that the customers may come and eat there (because Carpinterians don't have a huge number of places to dine) but the food quality can be hit or miss. This bottled sauce is not typically used in Thai cooking. It tastes like teriyaki sauce.

This place is decent given that there are not too many choices. We ordered the following dishes:

 Pad Thai with Pork- Coming from the Bay Area, I'm used to Pqd thai standard with shrimp. The had decent portion and noodle consistency was good. The sauce was a bit greasy and on the sweeter side.

Pumpkin curry with beef- didn't really taste the curry and only got one piece of pumpkin with the curry. Got decent amount of beef with the curry though.

Fresh vegetable with chicken- my favorite dish as it was not too greasy and was light. Mix of broccoli, baby corn, Shanghai bok choy, mushroom, cabbage, and carrot stir fried with fresh garlic.
Food gave us both diahrea 15 minutes after eating. Yellow curry tofu and spicy noodles tofu. We shared and something was bad in the food. This was our first and last time dining there

Great little restaurant with comfortable charming outdoor patio.  The food is delicious with generous portions.  There are combo choices for both lunch and dinner.  The service is friendly and very efficient.  Great meal before or after the beach. All servers wore masks appropriately.

Yes! You want to eat here. Look no further. Fantastic food and very accommodating service. The coconut soup with shrimp was so fragrant and flavorful. The honey ribs were fall off the bone tender and the pad Thai didn't disappoint with its classic earthy flavors.

Was greeted at the door ..Sat us down .. The Service was impeccable.. The Food was absolutely the best and received it in timely manner .. If your in Carp and want a great dining experience Siam Elephant is it ...I will be back
The best Thai food around. One of our favorites whenever we are in Carpinteria. The service is excellent too!
Was told it would be 50 minutes to pickup my order been waiting outside for 45 minutes and still no to go order. This better be the best Thai food ever. Must only be one chef for 75 people

We were driving through town after leaving SB and stumbled upon this treasure. The food was absolutely delicious! I fell in love with the Tom Kha soup that came with the combination meal. I even told Bel our waitress, that I would come back to town just for the that soup! Don't hesitate, try this place out as soon as you can!

Been going for years! I especially like the combo plates because they include soup and an entree as well as two or three appetizers. Their Tom Kha Kai is the best in town and their Thai tea is very good. The service is always with a smile and because we have gone for so many years they know us and take good care of us. The only downside is that the prices have gone up pretty significantly in the past few years. I guess that's the cost to the customer of a restaurant becoming as popular as this one.
So glad we stumbled in here. The food was awesome. We had Spicy Fried Noodles, Pad See Ieu, and fried cream cheese wontons. So tasty and so fast. Everyone was really kind. And the place is gorgeous.

We ordered a good amount of food because 1.) we were extremely hungry and 2.) we wanted enough to take home and eat the next day.

The waitress starts questioning the amounts of food we ordered and then starts schooling me on the menu like I have never been there before.

Who was she?  Why is she questioning our order?  Why is she assuming I don't know the menu?  Is she questioning the people AROUND US, TOO?

Now I have speculation as to why she was questioning us...we did look a little "differently" from the packed house of customers, but I'm going to give her the benefit of doubt of being ignorant.

Fix that chick quickly.  Get her off the floor.  Teach her never to assume and to STOP QUESTIONING THE CUSTOMER ABOUT WHAT HE OR SHE WANTS.

I spend way too much money here for that.  I'll add one star because the food is always good...even after her disrespect.

It was alright. Pad Thai had an interesting BBQ taste, pad see ew was VERY salty, servers were impersonal and seemed annoyed that we had our dog and a large group in the outdoor patio. Tom kha was very different than what myself and my friend had experienced as tom kha, not sure we were into it... the spring rolls were very fresh though, food came out fast, and the fresh coconut was lovely. The Panang curry was beautifully plated, but it wasn't the best curry we have had. It's not something I would go out of the way for, but it was good enough to try again if I were in town and in the mood for Thai.
Best Thai food I've had. Very flavorful and filling.  Prices are great and great costumer service! If you are in the area this is a must stop!

Our first time here and a great experience. It was probably the best Tom Kha Kai soup we've ever had. Friendly service, generous portions, excellent all around. My husband had the cashew chicken combo and I had pad Thai. We'll make it a regular stop when we're in town.

business.name: Benny the Bum's
business.categories: American (Traditional), Restaurants, Seafood

reviews.text: I live near Benny The Bums and I frequent the place at least once a week I find the help especially Amanda to be a very good server and efficient the food is very good and the bartenders are as nice as the waitresses if you are in the area you have to try this place I give it four thumbs up

I was at Benny the Bum's last Wednesday for dinner last week with my boss (who is from out of town and I wanted to take her to a place I knew would be good!).  Well, just like my previous visits I was pleasantly surprised with the food and the service.  

The calamari appetizer was great - very sweet and tender and cooked perfectly and a nice sized portion!

She had the "Bayside" - Lobster Tail, snow crab and shrimp - steamed & with drawn buttter.  While she did say it was tasty, it was oddly served in an aluminum baking pan and everything was drowning in butter.  Not the best presentation, so maybe y'all could reconsider how this is served up?  -1 star for that.

I had the "Hungry Harry" - Jumbo shrimp, sea scallops, crab cake and broiled flounder with Cajun seasoning!  All of that plus, the sweet potato fries were fresh, well seasoned and delicious.  (Funny that they give you caramel sauce in a container for the fries though...they are naturally sweet...Maybe most Northerners don't know that?  LOL!)

The drinks and the server/waitress were awesome!  She was friendly and attentive!  

Just an FYI that the hours shown on YELP are wrong, they don't open up until 3 pm!  They used to open for lunch...I used to meet clients here at 12 pm.  Guess they changed hours due to COVID??  Not really sure.

This place was recommended but I wouldn't return. The waitress was great and attentive (at first). Drinks were yummy, could have been stronger tho. The food in the other hand was a disappointment. My salmon was raw and the crab balls were just alright.  There were flies all over and made for a pretty unappetizing experience. The bathroom needs some major work. There was giant hole in the ceiling and the toilet seemed patched together.  Just a strange time all around.

I ordered 4 crabmeat sandwiches, asked to make 2 of them spicy and 2 mild and 4 of them was spicy . When I came to pick up my order they gave me wrong one . I called them and explain situation . They told , that they don't have delivery and in order to get my food I need to came back to the bar . 
Bad customer service . Can't recommend this place to anybody .

Local restaurant that I never noticed and wouldn't give much looking from the outside. But the food is delicious and the staff were friendly. The food arrived quickly and to be quite honest it tasted far better than expected. Will most likely be returning. 

Ps. Try the caramelized salmon! Absolutely delicious!

The girl was nice I ordered the Manhattan red spicy soup she brought it to me quickly she gave me crackers and bread butter that was all good other girl there was a bunch of tattoos she was very bossy I gave the nice girl a four dollar tip for a six dollar bill the girl says to me what's this I said it's four dollars for the nice girl that left because I got a put it in the register I said go ahead So I took the soup opened it up heated it up it was those canned mixed vegetables corn peas beans no crab meat no clams nothing wouldn't go there again.

Ok so where do I start. We haven't been to Bennys in a good while so naturally I decided to pay them a visit. Seating was spaces out perfect. My wife had the calamari which she orders where ever we go so she knows real calamari vs fake calamari the portions are decent fried a little too hard but over all she liked it. I had salmon tacos which we excellent salmon cooked to perfection not dry at all along with a nice barbecue sauce. My wife who doesn't like salmon tried it it made her want to order one herself. As far as the bar set up you are allowed to sit at the bar to drink and eat I felt the bartenders could be more attentive it's a little confusing that when you sit at the bar the server comes to take your order for food vs the bartender putting the order in so it feels like your sitting for a bit until someone comes to take your order. The drinks were good I had the Long Island which was good you could actually taste the alcohol in it. Bennys is def a go too if your looking for good seafood.

The place used to be way better. I'm a loyal costumer and have been going there for years. The last few times I went I was very disappointed. When I placed a pick up order I specifically asked for no seasoning on crab legs and when I brought it home my two orders had heavy seasoning all over. I'm allergic. Everyone makes mistakes BUT what really threw me off was when I called and told them, they told me to BRING MY ORDER BACK and they'll make me a new one. Who wants food back once it's left the restaurant and I already opened the containers?! What are they going to do with it? Gross. Makes me think they re-use it? GROSS. Also they didn't apologize.

Went for happy hour and seafood of course. Discounted food and drinks during that time. 1st time there so kinda got a lil of everything LOL. Will definitely return. In a shopping plaza so no issues with parking.

Super great specials tonight!
Lobster ravioli with shrimp...yummy!
Short ribs totally tender with an amazing glaze-gravy.perfectly done broccoli and homemade mashies.  Dessert was cherry cheesecake - fabulous.
Service properly masked, quick, and really nice.

This is usually my go spot to relax. But yesterday 2/28/21at 3pm just took the cake. We ordered our food and when the waiter brought It out my sister had a dead fly on her crab legs. They replaced her food but still what the heck!! A fly!! They gave me the end stalk of broccoli, like that was cool to serve. I requested another serving, which they replaced as I began to eat my food I touched my corn and it was ice cold. Now I only had my food for a few moments so it was no way for my corn to be ice cold. My friends food was undercooked and watery....she had the crab daddy entree, her corn was cold also. I informed the waitress to please bring it to the managers attention. We got tired of complaining...we will be taking a break from this spot in Hope's that the cook that was working is better trained. My greedy girl feelings are hurt!!!!

These seafood devours come all the way from @bennythebums  this neighborhood seafood spot is a real chill establishment for all ages. This establishment strongly encourages social distancing and offers both indoor and outdoor dining. Wonz here I chose to sit at the bar (my favorite place to sit and eat) The bartenders we're really nice. This establishment has a ordering system if you want alcoholic beverages you must water from the bar, and if you want food you must track down a waitress so that she can take your order. I want to see that I ordered The spicy pick and pool shrimp, a half dozen oysters on the shell, and garlic mussels in white wine. The shrimp were absolutely delicious, The mussel broth was very scrumptious with a perfect amount of garlic. Once done with those dishes I then ordered the buffalo shrimp along with the 1lb of snow crab legs. The buffalo shrimp were good however they weren't better than the pick and pool trip. The pound of snow crab's came with Broccoli, corn, and potatoes In a special lemon garlic Cajun sauce. The crabs were steamed perfectly and the seasoning for the vegetables was absolutely amazing. This is definitely a spot that I will revisit in the near future. If you ever want to chill by some really good seafood dishes please check out @bennythebums and tell them shimmy sent you! #food #philly #philadelphia #foodies #foodstagram #foodphotography #foodblogger #cajun #crab #shrimp #garlic #butter #water #broccoli #corn #potatoes #mussels #oysters #shimmyeats

I havent been to Benny the bums in years so take with a grain of salt... It was my most favorite seafood place growing up. I always got the surf and turf. If its still as good as it was back then, than easily it is a 4/5 star.
My boyfriend and I had lobster mac & cheese. It was delicious and the service when we called was wonderful. Our food was ready within 10 minutes of when we called. This place was amazing.

This is my first and last time at Benny the Bum's. I found them on Yelp and all of the photos on Yelp was making me drool, unfortunately the actual food was beyond unappetizing. 

First and foremost, first impression means a lot. When a customer walk in, instead of a greeting, my hub was ignored. If you say the guys behind my hub were ignored also, then it is a "norm", but that wasn't the case, both of the waiters greeted the 2 guys behind my hubby. But what about my hub? He was the first person walking in and waited for someone to acknowledge him....... Btw both of those guys were white, I don't want to play the race card but this is unacceptable. Both of the waiters continue to ignore my hub, so my hub left and ask me to call. I called and the counter girl say she just brung out the food, so my hubby went back inside. Then my hub came back out, and say they said my food is not ready.... I was like ????? You told me it was ready.... My hub went back in after a 3rd attempt and finally got our food.

When we got home, one of the bag broke and my platters fell onto the ground. I know I order oysters but the least you can do is to ensure my bag doesn't break . We ordered fresh fried mozzarella, dozens of raw oysters, double lobster mac and cheese, double clam chowder, shrimp and scallop alfredo, seafood jambalaya, and bayside seafood combo. 

The clam chowder was sour, I tasted one and it had a sour taste to it, it seem like it was sitting in a pot all day. Oysters got pieces of shells in it, I'm trying to eat the oyster not with the shell too. Fried fresh mozzarella and lobster mac and cheese were lukewarm, seems like it was sitting on their counter for a while. We only saw one piece of lobster meat on 1 of our lobster mac.  Shrimp and scallops alfredo got a weird taste, especially the scallops. Shrimps tasted frozen and rough in texture, and the scallops got a nasty stench to it...... Seafood jambalaya and bayside pot were also rough in texture. 

It is not like our bill was $50, our total is around $164, is that a way to get treated at a restaurant?  Other yelpers say it is fresh seafood, but what me and hub got tonight was no where near FRESH! $164 totally wasted, never again!
No one was wearing a mask and facility didn't adhere to the 25% capacity rule recently imposed for restaurants by the governor. No social distancing enforced. The food was terrible.

I was craving crab legs during Quarantine 2020 and was looking for a place close to home. Ordered and delivered in 40 minutes. They were delicious! I asked for extra sauce so I can soak the bread in it and then inhaled it like a fatty mcbutter pants because they are so damn delicious. The rest of my family got the shrimp platter, crab alfredo, and kiddie chicken tenders. Everyone enjoyed those items. Thanks for the great seafood without traveling!

Love
Love love this eclectic restaurant
The service is fabulous and the food is unique
My husband had the shrimp and a bums salad
I had the steak and lobster
Wow it was so wonderful can't wait until I go back
The place is spotless and everyone was happy

I've been coming here for the past 10 years! It's a great place to grab a quick lunch or party it up on a Friday night! Their bartenders are exceptional and the servers always give the best service. They have DJs Thursday-Saturday! Their menu is majority seafood, I recommend their crab legs or wings!

BLECH! Have you read the health violations? They scored 46 out of 100. That's horrid. Mouse droppings... Disgusting. I ate here years ago when it was considered good. Now, just reading the slew of RECENT heath code violations, it sounds like it's now a filthy pig steye.

After driving by for the past almost two years we decided to stop in to try out this local restaurant. It was a Sunday night so not crowded and we got sat almost immediately. The waitress was quick with our drinks and after taking our orders, the food came out fast. I ordered the shrimp jambalaya. No surprises or complaints. Same with my fiancé's order. My only issue is when we were done eating our waitress disappeared for at least ten minutes after giving us our check. Have had this issue at other restaurants and it's annoying. Other than that Bennys was a descent experience.
Love this place. Lunch or dinner, I always get the crab steam pot. It never disappoints. Sometimes service is a bit slow.

The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the calamari and music were so good but I'm so disappointed with the service! This is my neighborhood bar and I used to come here often but this was my first time in a while. Came here on a Friday night around 11 PM and there was a decent crowd - at least 30-40 people. My friends and I sat at the bar and the bartender had such an attitude! Every time we spoke to her or asked a question, she seemed annoyed or that we were a burden. We asked her to put a food order in and she said we needed a waitress and quickly walked away! We obviously couldn't tell who was a waitress and where she was since we were at the bar but the finally the bartender got her. The waitress was super sweet and helped us narrow down what to order. We ordered the calamari and fried pickles. The fried pickles were okay, not the best I ever had but not horrible either. The calamari was so good!! Just a FYI, Benny's is a seafood restaurant so definitely get this if you ever go. 

The music was great - they had a DJ who was playing a ton of hits ranging from Spanish to EDM! Unfortunately the dance floor was empty though. 

Benny's also has games - we were playing Connect 4 but not sure what other games they had. 

If I'm in the neighborhood, I may come back if I don't have any other options but hopefully the service is much better next time.

First time there on a Saturday night. Horribly mismanaged, untrained staff who only seem to care about themselves. Had to pay 3 separate tabs because the bar and food service are separate. One due to a shift change at 6:00pm on a Saturday night. Bartender eating instead of tending to any duties while a bunch of other staff  congregated around point of sale in center of rest blatantly ignoring patrons.

As far as the food and drink, it was very average. Unimpressive! My partner was served an unshaken Prickly Pear Margarita, which costs $10.00 and was easily a $6 drink--way overpriced. I had the Cherry pepper hot wings which I will honestly say we're good. My partner, hiwever, got the Honey chipotle shrimp which were small and the texture was rubbery. 

Will not be back!

The worst bar I've ever experienced. Service was horrible. Felt like a burden to the place when trying to place a drink order. Bartenders walked passed my husband and me at least a dozen times without acknowledging our presence. Do not waste your time if you expect decent service.

business.name: Black Crow Coffee Old NE
business.categories: Food, Coffee & Tea

reviews.text:
While I generally don't mix politics with business in this case I'm making an exception.   

No justice, no peace?   Why not just peace?  Justice will prevail one way or another.  Maybe just karma.  But you don't need to threaten violence, even implicitly, to make a point.  Okay.  I'm done. 

Love the coffee.  Love the food.  Happy to support a family owned, local coffee shop.  Just remember to keep an open mind and promote love and peace above everything else.
Bad tippers to people who help them 25 gallons of milk for $13 bucks not even the amount of a coffee here.

Very nice coffee and a great chocolate croissant
The political views of the coffeehouse were a bit over the top.

I came in for breakfast and felt like I got a dose of the owner's left-wing politics the moment i stepped in the door with their big No Justice No Peace banner above the counter. 

I almost walked right out but figured i'd give it a try. Coffee and muffin were pricey and mediocre at best. I wonder why liberals like these folks think everyone who walks in their business wants to be exposed to their politics? I came in for breakfast not a dose of lefty politics. No Justice no peace is the rallying cry of looters and others who believe in lawlessness. 

If they had better coffee, i might hold my nose and patronize them anyways, but the combo of bad coffee, high prices and off-putting politics put me off.

I went to the St Petersburg Pier for sunrise and after sunrise I was looking for a coffee shop near me and decided to have Coffee as well as quick breakfast at Black Crow Coffee. The cafe is a good cafe with an amazing ambiance and i loved the staff as they are friendly and helped me to decide the order by answering my questions. The unique thing about the Coffee shop is that they brew their own rich and unique coffee. For the order I ordered a Medium Coffee with Leek & Parmesan Croissant and Muffin. I got my order in 5 minutes and muffin as well as croissant were heated up. The coffee was delicious and amazing. Loved their brewed coffee. Croissant and muffin was also delicious and freshly made. Loved the food as well as the ambience of the cafe.

Black Crow Coffee: 9.8/10 - St.Petersburg, FL - okay so so rad! loved the huge emphasis on social justice that i was really thankful for/they had a little receipt box where you kept tabs on how many times you visited so you could eventually get a free coffee! had a vinyl player inside with a super cool guitar as their entry sign - super vibey and overall reallyyyy solid i must say

The best coffee ever, the taste is perfectly balanced. It is almost always perfect, if not always.  The chocolate crowsant is the best, but they also have a vegan everything bagel flavored pastry that is to die for.  Their flavors are very good too, something about this place.  Great spot to relax and study or to stop at before work, or before a trip. :)
Wonderful place to drink coffee, get some studying in, or simply people watch. One of my favorite spots on that coast!
This place is an absolute vibe!! The coffee was refreshing! Would definitely be back.

Amazing coffee, freshly baked muffins (my favorite is their banana nut), and great atmosphere. The staff is always really friendly and make an effort to remember and make conversation with repeat customers. Perfect place to grab coffee and read/work/study.
this coffee shop was absolutely adorable! i loved the 90's vibe, great start to my morning

Just based on one little visit I feel compelled to immediately rate them! AMAZING quality. A simple little espresso we shared, and wow whattan incredible tasty quad shot it was!! Can't wait to return and try the jet fuel!

I've been here 3 times now! The staff is so nice and helpful! I love all of the different flavors of coffee they have! They even have vegan friendly coffee AND food options!  I love the fact that they have PASTA STRAWS!! Today I tried their caramel sutra latte and I have a really big sweet tooth and to me it wasn't that sweet. I highly recommend trying their purple haze coffee and their banana mocha coffee! I recommend this place to others.

Cute little antique rustic industrial chic hipster spot for coffee tea and specialty pastry. They have non dairy milks like oat and almond as well as gluten free pastry. They are an everybody welcome establishment and I loved that.
Coffee is amazing and the baristas are so nice!! Lots of comfortable seating and places to read/study/talk. All the plants are a plus!
Very cute place! Had a caramel frappe. Way better than Starbucks! It's a little bit hidden, but just look for the coffee sign.
The barista, Pat, was super friendly and the coffee was amazing. There was a guy playing piano there which added to the already chill ambiance. I will return for sure

Beautiful place. A terrific space for work, write, think.
Great coffee and amazing atmosphere
All of the in your face political "wokeness" doesn't "wake" anyone up. Instead it deters people from what could be an amazing coffee shop.
Great place. I am a military member and they gave me a free coffee on the house. And it was delicious.
Really love this little spot! They're super friendly and have a great selection of coffee. I got a cold brew but if you're into something a little sweeter I'd highly recommend the caramel sutra.

This coffee shop is the CUTEST!! It's so green on the inside and out, and the vibe is industrial and hipster! I LOVE that they use eco-friendly straws (hopefully cups soon too) and I'm looking forward to going back and trying another delicious drink.
Coffee is nothing special. Hostile toward law enforcement, military veterans, and men in general.

Black Crow is so delicious and the staff so wonderful, that I make a weekly trip from Sarasota on the weekends just to come here. Their coffee is the best in St. Pete, and the Parmesan and leek pastry is to die for. We usually order these two items and then go say hello to the hens across the way at the community garden before taking a stroll through the town, enjoying the beautiful old houses in the neighborhood.
Loved this place! Very unique inside, and the latte was amazing! Loved the oat milk option.

business.name: Zemam's
business.categories: Restaurants, Ethiopian

reviews.text: So good, I have been going here for years and it has been consistently perfect and amazing with great service. Highly recommend going as a large group so that you can sample as much as possible, but makes for a fun date place too!

Delicious Ethiopian food. The food is excellent. I always get the Vegetable sampler with cauliflower, yemisir wat, shiro, yetekelt wat, and of course the collard greens. All are deliciously seasoned with onions, garbanzo beans, and spices. The injera (spongey bread)  is perfect. I do ask for more than the amount it comes with, and they have always been nice enough to give me extra. 

They are finally remodeling the inside so the location on Broadway is under construction at this time. I think that they also own the place on the east side but I've yet to eat at that location. 
I'm excited to visit once the new remodeled location is open! 

The people who own it, and work there, are super friendly which to me is a major bonus.
More oily than Cafe Desta but still delicious food with so many vegan options.  Love the collards!
So much fun to eat at the restaurant. Delicious flavors. So many vegetarian options.  Love BYOB too!
Haven't visited since Covid but this place is absolutely the bomb and I miss it. The veggie platter is unbeatable.
I'm from Seattle and was missing the Ethiopian food from my favorite places back home. Zemam's was all I wanted and more! Really good injeera and the lentils are phenomenal.

One of Tucson's best restaurants. Spicy and delicious options available for both vegetarians and carnivores. I am incredibly impressed with the fact that during The Covid Plague their doors are literally locked and they only offer curbside take away.
Delicious, warming, and flavorful food. Support local businesses and family-owned restaurants!
Never had Ethiopian food until I moved to Tucson, and I LOVE Zemam's!! Spicy, healthy, delicious!!
Yo!!!' This place is the BOMB!!  I could literally eat here every day. Super pleasant staff, prompt and helpful, food is to die for!
Best Ethiopian food in town. There really isn't much else to say about it. It's delicious and we love supporting them!

This is my favorite date night spot. The prices are reasonable and overall, the staff is very friendly and attentive. I never had Ethiopian before coming here but now I crave it all the time! Everything on their menu is so flavorful, delicious and unique compared to any other place in town. Another reason I love this place is that you can bring in your own preferred adult drinks and they will happily provide the glasses and bottle opener if needed. Eating here always leaves me feeling so content and satisfied. Give Zemam's a try, you won't regret it!

We stopped going to restaurants due to Covid, and being high risk, haven't really resumed yet. And, since I'm WFH I rarely get to the Zemam's area. But I placed an order and picked up recently, and was SO pleased. 

The food was as great as ever, and the take out was really well packed. Portions felt quite generous, and everything was perfect. Love the current spice level on the spicy dishes.
We love getting the sample platters and trying different things on it. They are doing curb side pick up for the pandemic so it feels very safe!

Absolutely delicious!  I tried this place as I'm ticking off places that have been on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives as I travel for work. Only doing takeout during COVID. Very tasty, lots of spice if you're so inclined. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in town

I used to frequent here when I attended college from 2004-09 and totally miss this restaurant. The owner is amazing and when my friend and I would dine in would load up our portions since he knew we where college students. The food was always amazing as was the service.  Next time I visit Tucson I will definitely have to visit Zemam's and recount my memories with Amanuel. I loved dining here and totally recommend all the dishes they offer. 
Now I want and am craving Ethiopian food as I recall my college memories;)

Excellent food. Excellent service.  Beyond clean.  Lovely people and outstanding take out service.  I highly recommend this place.   And if you eat it, very comfortable and casual setting.  Good place to take friends.

My family has been going to Zemams for almost 14 years.   I went the first time for my 30th birthday, with my 6 month old on my lap. She is 14 and chose to go there for her 14th birthday! The food is amazing. We've tried most foods on the menu and everything is good. During quarantine we've ordered from them a few times, but order early, they sell out fast!
I can't deny the fabulous flavors of their food! I love Zemam's! I love that they do takeout and I love that soon the restaurants will be open for sit-down service! Thank you Zemam's!

This place was soooo delicious. Lived in Tucson for several years I can't believe I didn't try this until this year!!! Busy restaurant cozy atmosphere & fun trying the different foods on the platter!!! Get a meat platter & a veggie platter you won't be disappointed!!!

Eating at Zemam's is a great way to experience authentic Ethiopian food. The homey ambiance creates a very welcoming environment for diners to enjoy their food. I was also surprised to find out that Zemam's was actually fetaured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives (the TV show that Guy Fieri does for Food Network). 

Forget your forks and knives! Eating at Zemam's is a very hands on activity. We ordered one veggie sampler and one meat sampler for 3 people and we had plenty of food left over. The mincheta bish beef dish was my personal favorite. If you need more of the injera flatbread to go with your dishes, just ask! 

I will definitely be returning to try out more of Zemam's amazing dishes!

Yes! I've been coming to this place since 2001 and the food is always great. You can also bring your own wine for small fee. But seriously, great food and great experience. I highly recommend this place.

I do not live in Tucson, but I've visited Zemam's twice - with about 10 years between visits.  This place is a total gem.  It's the first place where my kids every tried Ethiopian food, and turned them into fans.  I love everything I've tried at Zemam's, in particular the Gomen Alicha, the Spinach, and the Yekik Wat.   Mmmmm - heaven!  Get a combo plate so that you can sample several dishes.  There's not much parking, but it's easy to just park on the neighboring cross-street.

What an amazing great restaurant. I love the whole vibes of this place. You enter as if it were someone's house, through a house door and screen door. The inside is small and cozy with traditional pictures and art pieces designed throughout. Parking may be a bit difficult as there's not many places to park but a couple around the restaurant.

The food is phenomenal! I suggest coming with a few friends so you can try the sampler platter with different options. The spicy boneless chicken was my favorite, it has a rich tomato-ey flavor. We also got mincheta beef which was ground beef it tasted very home-ey. The shiro tasted a bit burnt flavor and it wasn't our favorite. I definitely want to come back and try the rest of the sauces. The bread is so soft and delicious :) can't wait to come back!

Went there for lunch, and it was definitely worth a visit! Interesting mix of Ethiopian and African food, as well as presentation. Had the Mixed Meat and Veggie Sampler which come with 2 meats and a vegetable dish. Chose the #10 Spinach for the vegetable, and a #14 and #15 (Kay Watt and Lega Tibs). Would definitely get the #14 Kay Watt again hands down! First time eating using only bread to pick up your food which was a pretty cool thing to experience for a first time trier of Ethiopian food. Could have come out warmer but still good over all.

business.name: Ike's Sandwiches
business.categories: Restaurants, Vegetarian, Sandwiches, Gluten-Free, Vegan

reviews.text: I love Ike's! The different choices of bread is what makes me keep coming back. Dutch crunch all day
We go to Ike's in the bay. It's a really great sandwich shop:) it's a lot of fun to go to with all their fun options

Honestly, a sandwich has no business being this good. I found Ike's on doordash and have been OBSESSED ever since. The sandwich is so good, made correctly every single time, I can't even put into words how great it tastes. I have a 3 year old toddler who attacks me for this the moment it comes in the door, if you were thinking about getting this place, do it!

Been coming here for 4+ years and the people here are like family!!! Honestly, always a pleasure coming in and catching up with everyone here. Feel like I grew up eating Ike's - I come here that often lol! THE FOOD MAKES YOU GROW BIG AND STRONG

Management has changed a few times over the years but they have all been so kind and nice! Don't get me started about the sandwiches - they are simply the best. You can come here after a workout from the gym, middle of the day lunch break, or even if you're simply starving. The food will fill you up! Get a side of fries or Mott sticks, you can't go wrong!
OMG, had the Menage A Trois and it was amazing! I am sorry it took me so long to try these sandwiches. Fantastic, and we are ordering again today!

Ever since I can remember eating Ike's in the Bay Area, I've always had the best experiences. Now living in Reno, I love that Ike's is here. 

The team at this location is friendly and very helpful. Great service! 

The Food: 
If you love a good sandwich, this is the spot for you. They have so many great unique options available: meat lovers, vegetarian, vegan, halal, and gluten-free. Not too many sandwich spots that offer something for everyone and their dietary needs. All sandwiches are served hot with lettuce, tomato, and their dirty sauce (creamy garlic aioli - dairy free but contains egg). I always get extra because it's that good! You can add freebies to your sandwich too: red onions, banana peppers, jalapeños, mustard, and pickles. 

For gluten-free, they have a delicious option for an extra $2.00. This is my personal choice, since me and gluten are not friends. One of the better gluten-free breads I've had. 

The Menage a Trois is my favorite! How can you not love halal chicken, honey mustard, bbq sauce, real honey, pepper jack, swiss, and cheddar all on one sandwich! The Hunter Pence, We're Just Friends are all good meat sandwiches. James & The Giant Peach and The Time Traveler's Wife are the best vegan sandwiches! 

Don't forget to grab a bag of Zapp's Potato Chips (tasty bag of goodness from Louisiana). Side note: they sell a bag of their house made famous dutch crunch bread in bags of six for $4.99. 

Catering: If you need some sandwiches, this is a great option! 

Lastly, you will always get a sweet treat in your bag. I usually get a caramel apple sucker! 

P.S. I love Ike's sandwiches!
Mediocre food.  They know you have limited options around the university and figure you'll just deal with it.

Checked out Ike's after visiting Lake Tahoe & Reno...all I can do is apologize for not taking a picture of the sandwich's me & my husband bought. THEY WERE BOMB!!! If I could have eaten the bag...I would have eaten that too lol..ohhh, & they even gave us 2 caramel apple suckers!!! What a treat! If u haven't checked them out...what are u waiting for?!!! We definitely have found a sandwich spot, definitely will be returning on our next trip!! Keep up the fabulous job!!!

Cute spot right off the UNR campus. 
The menu has a decent amount of variety, I love the creative sandwich names! The service was good, even when very busy they were friendly and  efficient. I got the Hermione, a vegetarian sandwich with the orange glaze on their house bread. The house bread is so good!! Soft, crunchy on the outside, definitely baked fresh. I got a veggie sandwich since I wasn't super hungry, but ended up eating the whole sandwich, since it was so delicious. The portions are very big, this could definitely be split if you're not super hungry! They also have a good assortment of drinks - cans, regular fountain sodas, and I saw some organic fresh iced teas and lemonade. They have a few spots to sit inside and outside, or you can take your sandwich over to Ranch San Rafael park nearby. A great sandwich spot in Reno! Also, one of the few that are open on Sunday's!
Great experience. We got take out and it was fast, employees were friendly, and sandwiches were better than most in town. Will return when we are in south Reno.

The vegan options are great if you can get them to make it for you.  The staff acts very privileged and snotty.  I ordered online and still did not get my order until 26 minutes later because "others were standing in line."  I ordered a Vegan sandwich and the girl rolled her eyes and handed me a turkey and mayo.  I did not realize until I got home since I was trying to socially distance even though no one else there was and most of the staff did not wear a mask properly.

Ordered from grubhub, sandwiches' bread was soggy when they arrived, perhaps for delivery put sauce on side. I had a bite of my husband's sandwich before mine and wished I'd ordered what he had. And for the life of me I can't remember the name of any of the sandwiches we had. Most likely won't order for delivery again. Might be much better if ordered dining in.

I appreciate the response. I had the King Koopa and the bread was so soggy from the sauce it was ineatible. Personal taste, if I ever got this sandwich delivered again I would request sauce on the side. I would also not have the mozzarella sticks on it as they were cold when the sandwich was received and soggy. My husband had the Matt Kain and he stated the same as far as having the sauce on the side. His bread was not as soggy and I found his much more appetizing than mine. Hope addition to the review assists with your delivery orders.
My coworker got us lunch from here today. I got the Matt Cain on gluten free bread.  First, their GF bread actually tastes like bread.  The sandwich was great and would definitely return.

So disappointed. The food is delicious but not worth the money, especially when they are okay with charging you for items they don't carry! The entire point of downloading a restaurant app rather than going through a third party app ( like DoorDash) is to avoid issues like an order fee ( 2$ to use your app for a pickup order is stupid when you are trying to encourage customers to spend as little time in the store as possible). 3rd party apps also rarely know when stuff is out of stock, but you certainly should. And if an order was messed up through DoorDash, they would at least refund me. But , when I spent $10 on drinks that you no longer carried, the employ behind the counter looked at me as if it was not her problem to solve. That is stealing, in my opinion, and no way to run your business.

Don't bother if you're vegan. My boyfriend and I placed an order for two sandwiches, one vegan and one not. The cashier confirmed that, but they were not labeled and not discernible when we got home. Very frustrated that I wasn't able to eat my dinner at the risk of getting sick. I expected better for a restaurant that literally advertises vegan food.

Parking is hard to find but available. The facility is very clean. The service is very good. The menu is exciting with interesting combinations. The bread is fresh as all ingredients. The meat and  sauce was very salty and the requested add on veggies were skimpy. The flavors did not blend well.  The portion was small for the price, thus no value.
Awesome vegan sandwiches. Staff seems very knowledgeable of vegan options. The sandwiches around. Highly recommend.

My family and I love Ike's! The sandwiches are excellent and we've always had great service. We did quit going for awhile because of an experience my husband had with something in his sandwich that shouldn't be there but we decided to give them another try recently and have already been back twice since. Good service and fun, delicious sandwiches!

The staff were welcoming when we entered.  They allow indoor dining which was good as we were just traveling through the area. The inside of the restruant had a few tables well spaced apart. 

Our sandwiches were good.

Ike's near UNR is a hopping spot! I've never tried it so we've finally discovered the delicious bread, condiments and veggie fried chicken. You can enter from Sierra or Virginia but parking is a bit tight. If you can park elsewhere and walk, that's great. The location is close to Rancho San Rafael park, UNR, the stadium and housing so it's really convenient! The Dutch bread is cool but they have sourdough, wheat and other options. As the menu billed the sandwich as vegan fried chicken , we expected crunch and a lot of it. We got a few medallions in each sandwich with a lot of condiments and veggies. Although that's healthy, the cost of each sandwich warrants a bit more vegan chicken maybe? Also, it wasn't really fried at all. So, it was good and we expected great. Hoping to be pleasantly surprised next time. Try Ike's for sandwiches!

I love that Reno has Ike's! I work in Santa Rosa every summer and have been enjoying these massive sandwiches for years. Theses are just as good as the locations in California! The sandwiches are the size and weight of a small baby, so don't let the price scare you away. They are fresh and always made to order. The Dutch crunch bread is classic and is probably the only bread that can support such a hefty load. My favorite part about these (besides the killer combinations and vegetarian options) are the fact that even with their size they don't fall apart while eating. It remains a sandwich through every last bite. Definitely need to eat here when your craving a sandwich!
I mean, it's an institution. If you haven't been here, you haven't eaten a bay area sandwich.

I DoorDashed this order so i can't really speak for the customer service or the restaurant/vibe. I ordered the "Going Home for Thanksgiving" and added cream cheese. The sandwich traveled well and the sandwich was beautiful. The flavors on this sandwich were amazing. I have definitely been missing out. I really love Thanksgiving sandwiches. I get them wherever they're offered. Even though it was missing the dressing it was still really good the sauces are pretty yummy also. I'd love if they added some dressing to the Thanksgiving sando. The Dutch crunch bread is a force all on its own. My sandwich was $9.99 + $1.50 to add the cream cheese. $12 for a sandwich with no alternate sandwich sizes seems a bit pricey to me. I did enjoy my sandwich, but the prices(in my opinion) are a bit offsetting.

What?! The BEST sandwiches by far! These sandwiches are the wake up call you didn't know you needed for your taste buds. You can't go wrong with whatever you choose. So, pick and go with your gut. You won't be sorry.

My family is obsessed with these sandwiches.  We have been eating here for over a year now, at times it's once a week for 4+/- months.  Their sandwich selection is vast, every option delicious, unique pairings, the perfect size.  As a veggitarian myself, the selection and variation for the non-meat eaters is greatly appreciated.  And my meat eating partner has a few favorites that he craves too.  Even my picky 10yo daughter has two options she jumps between.  The location sucks for parking, but is my only downside.  Inside the joint is decorated with old lunchboxes, SO CUTE!  They are always clean, organized, friendly, and never gotten an order wrong.  I can't say enough about thier food, service, and all around awesome experience.  Every time consistently.

business.name: Tuk Tuk Thai Street Food
business.categories: Restaurants, Thai

reviews.text: They make an excellent panang curry, but why is there an extra charge for rice with an entree? Service is extremely slow, so if you're in a rush go elsewhere.
The food here is amazing! Some of the best Thai I've had in Tucson. The holy basil chicken is excellent. The food comes out hot and quick!

BEST THAI RESTAURANT IN TUCSON!! 

I absolutely love Thai food, especially Thai curry, so I always have a habit of ordering curry at most Thai restaurants. However, Tuk Tuk Thai is has impressed me so much that I am willing to go outside my comfort zone and order items aside from curry, and I haven't been disappointed yet! My most recent trip was this past weekend, and I decided to try their Pad Char Pla, which is Thai catfish battered and fried with aromatic seasoning and mixed with vegetables. It tasted even better than it smelled, and it smelled amazing! The texture of the fish was PERFECT, super crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside, and the sauce it was cooked in was super flavorful. I have to compliment this place for having great tasting meals as well as generous portion sizes - I have a habit of trying to eat everything on my plate but I'm pretty sure I always have to get a to go box every time I have come here. In the past I have also tried their chicken wings and coco pumpkin fries - both of which are absolutely delicious; their fried options are definitely always a treat and are cooked perfectly. And of course all the curry options I have tried have also been delightful - pumpkin, green, khao soi, and panang - all a great mix of sweet and spicy with distinct flavor profiles. 

I also love when a restaurant has unique beverage options - so far my favorite drink here is their fresh strawberry lemonade. Do not be fooled, this is not your average bottled pink lemonade. The strawberry flavor is very prominent and refreshing, and it also seems to have a hint of carbonation in it, and I love carbonated drinks so I adore this drink - it is a perfect mix of sweet and tart and it really hits the spot when it's hot outside. I have tried their Thai iced coffee which is strong and very good; I think it would be a favorite for most coffee lovers, but not for people who like their coffee with lots of sugar and cream to hide the bitterness, bc theirs is quite strong. I have also tried the Thai iced tea, and while I do like it, I will have to warn people who are expecting the bright orange and white mixed drink that is often seen at other Thai places; Tuk Tuk Thai's Thai tea is much less sweet and more subtle than the ones at other Thai restaurants. 

Overall I love this place and have come back many times, and as always I just wish I didn't live so far away from it! My only gripe is that getting rice for most meals does cost extra (I believe it's around $2). Do I pay for it every time? Yes! I just wish I didn't have to since most other similar restaurants offer rice as a complimentary side dish.
