But that really is my only issue, and it's a small one; I still think this place is worth coming back to again and again because their menu is diverse and everything I've had so far is super tasty, especially compared to other Thai restaurants in Tucson. I hope everyone will get a chance to check it out!

I've been here twice. First time was dine in and their food was good. The second time I ordered take-out and unfortunately the food quality and taste was not so great. When I called and ordered I was told my food will be ready in 20 mins. 20 mins later I went to pick up my food but the wait time to pick up and pay for my food was another 10 min. The restaurant was busy and short staff so my food just sat there until someone came to hand me my food and pay. Maybe dining in is a better option for this location.

The worst Pad Thai I've ever eaten in about 35 years dining on Thai cuisine. For $15, it was a glob of way overcooked, stuck together vermicelli noodles, not the normal flat noodles used in Thai stir fry dishes. Speaking of which, it wasn't stir fried but just boiled noodles. Second, no flavor- like maybe they completely forgot the tamarind sauce? Third, no one in the restaurant was wearing a mask-- no staff or customers- and there's a county mask mandate indoors right now. I took mine to go, but still really nuts for a restaurant to do this.

How they got 4 stars is beyond me. Maybe they ran out of ingredients and the cook is new?

So we came here because they had amazing reviews so we decided to try this place expecting high quality and authentic Thai food since everyone was raving about this place in all the reviews. 

Let me just start by saying I specialize in eating south East Asian cuisine. I ordered the Larb, wok stir fired pork belly with Chinese broccoli, calamari and Thai iced tea. 

Calamari and larb came out first. The calamari was very plain, thin and sauce was sweet. It was edible. The larb was extremely sweet!! I never had sweet larb before in my life. Larb is suppose to be sour , spicy , and have lime in it but the flavor was just sweet!!! 

Our server forgot about our pork belly entree we waited 15 mins and had to remind him that we ordered that dish as well. He never came to check up on us to ask how everything was or anything. 

The only good thing I can say about this meal was the Thai tea .

Overall not authentic Thai food at all in my opinion and I've been eating Thai food for 30 years now .. not sure what everyone is raving about but this Thai food is not Thai food. Everything is extremely sweet and unpleasant.

Very odd to say the least. We ordered food got an appetizer, larb dish, and another dish. Our first 2 dishes came pretty much at the same time and we were completely finished eating before our last dish even came out. Our server didn't check on us once and I was in need of multiple things, he was intentionally avoiding our table and it wasn't busy at all. We had to ask for help from someone else because our server was everywhere except by us! The food is like 1/5 also, the pork belly and broccoli dish was literally all broccoli with a tiny bit of pork belly we didn't eat it cause it came out extremely late. The larb was a sweet sweet larb that was stir fried nothing like what I was used to and had an odd stench to it. I would pass on this place if I were thinking on eating here. The Thai tea was great tho.

Update: my stomach has been turning and in knots since I ate here. Haven't been able to stomach anything since then.

Another update: it's been a full 24hrs since we've eaten here and still haven't been able to stomach anything and I'm pretty sure we both are experiencing food poisoning symptoms. Avoid this place at all costs.

Placed an order for take out and was told it'd be ready in 30 min. We arrived at the restaurant 30 min later only to wait another 45 min for our food. We ordered 3 things of curry and they only gave us one tiny bowl of rice to go with them so we asked for 2 additional sides. At first they said they would need 4 dollars for each additional side of rice. We said that was ridiculous and that we wouldn't pay that kind of money for rice that should already be included in the meal. They did eventually let us have the rice w/o charge but they said that was only because of the holiday and in the future we would have to pay. When we got home we came to find they forgot one of our curry dishes so we had to drive back to get it. When we finally did get everything platted nobody wanted to finish their meal. The shrimp was not fresh and the curry sauce was runny/tasteless. Would not recommend this place. The food/service is bad.

If I'm being honest it was just kind of a weird dining experience.  Was seating for a large group just fine but ordering food was extremely difficult and we kept having to chase down the waiter because we waited for 30+ min to order without then showing up.  We had to do the same thing when we were wanting the check at the end.  Meanwhile our water cups never got refilled and some of our food orders got mixed up.  The food was delicious (besides the chicken wings which had no flavoring besides the dipping sauce which had a strong balsamic-like flavor that wasn't very appealing).  

The Thai chicken basil dish I ordered as my mai course was delicious which flavorful chicken with a good mix of basil and vegetables.  

Overall, next time Id just order take out and spare the hassle of chasing the waiter down so I could more easily enjoy the good food!

Well the food was very good it was also very expensive. You think of Thai St., Food as something that might be not be expensive, something you would buy on the streets of Thailand. You would not expect that to be expensive. I had a coconut curry vegetable dish. It was delicious. But it was also $18.95 plus tax I ended up paying $21 and some change for a bowl of vegetables and cononut curry sauce. It's just too much. It's a nice restaurant but it's going to price itself out of business

First, because of COVID, we did take out. Some of the best Thai food we've had since coming to Tucson. The Hoy Joh were really delicious. The larb might use a bit more dressing and green onions, but was well beyond average. The pad thai was also satisfying. We have to return and try other items. However, I do wish the staff were wearing masks.

If I could give 4.5 I would... we were driving through Tucson on our way to Phoenix and hubby wanted to try this place. We were a little early (it's hard to time that 11am arrival from El Paso perfectly!) and were the first customers. The decor was bright and cheerful, everything was very clean and all staff was masked. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and number 62 - pad kee mao with beef. Hubby usually likes pad thai, but I convinced him to try something new. The calamari came out at the same time as the main, but oh well. The servings of meat in the calamari were impressive with a very light batter. Hubby found it chewy, but I preferred it to the smaller pieces of calamari with heavy batter you usually find. The main was not as exciting as I had hoped, but after stirring up some of the veggies from the bottom and adding the leftover sour sauce from the calamari it was much more flavorful. My main complaint was that towards the end of the meal some oil either hit the griddle or the deep fryer was working overtime as the smell of burning oil filled the restaurant. Otherwise, very tasty, we may have to stop again so he can try that pad thai.

I shared two shrimp spring rolls, some chicken on skewers and a pot of soup with a couple of friends. The place was full of people but service was fast. We all enjoyed all three dishes. Prices were reasonable; the bill came to $14 apiece including tax and tip.

I've been to the N Campbell location several times. The first time I didn't like my food because the vegetables were way too hard. The next 2 times I liked my food OK. However, one of the times they brought something different than what I ordered. They corrected it when I told them. The food seems pricey for the amount received. With all that said, I continue to return because I like good Thai food! When they get it right, it's good!

Best Thai food in town - specifically for vegetarians. Before they opened we were so sad that the Thai was so terrible we tried pretty much every place we could find including Senae Thai bistro, Karuna's, Bai Thong, and Bangkok cafe which were all disappointments. 

I've told everyone I know about this place.

They are so popular they opened a second location within a year. 

Our go to meals are Khao Soi (vegetarian), Papaya salad, and Pad Thai. The drunken noodle is ok which is unfortunate as it is my favorite Thai dish. Despite that you can't go wrong here.

Tonight I popped In after a couple months Away. 8pm. Closes at 9pm. Service was a whirlwind, but not terrible. Staff is always pleasant. Tom Kha Gai was more like gravy tonight & less soupy. Not thrilled. The pad Thai noodle was super clumpy. Overcooked. Think things were subpar so close to
Closing. Note to self: do not come here with an hour before closing!

It was nice dinner. Specially Tam Yum soup was awesome. Waitress was super nice too! 
We will come back again for sure.
Food is okay, portions feel like not worth the price. I ordered Togo and the total came out surprisingly high and the price is not adding up to it even counting tax. Menu prices are outdated.

This is my first time eating Thai in Tucson and I will say it did not disappoint at all! The curry and the apps were on point. I truly enjoyed how the Thai tea had free refills. Friendly service as well. I'll come back for sure.

We haven't been here for a while.  We got take out for crab fried rice, basil minced chicken, and Thai beef salad.  Intense and authentic flavors.  I can vouch for their authenticity since I lived in Bangkok for three years.  We also tried some grilled pork.  They used the same seasoning for the dried pork jerky they have in Thailand.  I'm leaving one star on the table because I think the cooking staff can do better by offering seafood salad, pomelo salad, crab omelet and other Thai treats.  Will continue to come here for those cravings.

Tom yum Gai didn't taste like anything I've every had or my wife had had in all of Thailand.  Vegetable pad Thai was super dry and vegetables not cooked.  I asked 3 times to have the wings extra crispy over the phone,  they were soggy and almost undercooked.  Mango sticky rice was under cooked and almost half of the rice was crunchy.  Would not recommend.  I wish it was better cause its the closest to us.  I hope they do better in the future.  But I won't be returning to find out.

One of the best Thai I've ever had, and I've been all over! We ordered the Pumpkin Curry, Som Tum Thai, and Pad Kee Mao and we absolutely loved every single dish. The spice level was perfect, everything was fresh, and the service was amazing. The owner stopped by and talked to us and told us about his locations in Oregon which are next on our list. Truly some of the most authentic and delicious Thai food I have ever had!

This is the second time I've been here, and there will be many more.  The service is good, the food is delicious, and the pricing comparable.  I had curried duck, while my partner had shrimp pad thai.  We shared chicken wings.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  I had to pay extra for rice (which does not come automatically with curry dishes), which I thought was strange, but it was worth it!.

$3.90 for a bowl of rice when most of not all other restaurants include your first bowl of rice with a curry dish. A little ridiculous.
Other than that, interior is cute, food flavor is fine, kind of expensive aside from the rice. We got red curry, pad Thai, and Chinese broccoli. Red curry was good but not spicy at all or milky which was a little strange. Pad Thai was good, also not spicy, but that ended up being good for my daughter. Chinese broccoli was strange. It was sour and I'm used to it being sautéed in a garlic sauce. I was not a fan. 
Also, there's cilantro in yhe dishes. It's kinda hard to see since there's also basil, but I could definitely taste it. My fellow cilantro haters, beware. 
I'm too mad about the rice to give this place more than 1 star. 
Bring your own rice.

I've been wanting to try this place and was stoked to find a sidekick to join me. We ordered the pad prik pow chicken and the char pad pla. Both were really tasty. Fresh and crispy = perfect for the fish. 
We didn't ask for a spice level and they didn't offer. So we did ask for chili after getting the dishes as they weren't spicy. The iced tea was tasty as well! 
Service was attentive and friendly. 
We will definitely be back.

business.name: Hearthside
business.categories: Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text: I tried to set up a reservation and you require a credit card?  Go eff yourselves and your pretentious bullscheisse.  You're in effing Collingswood.

Love this BYO! The staff and food was terrific. The Wagyu Carpaccio and Mussels were out of this world. 
Ashley the manager was really a pleasure and made our dining experience a pleasurable one. 
Can't wait to go back.
Deliciously curated and designed down to every detail. Sausage pasta was a bit salty. Prepare to dig a little deep into your pockets, but it's worth it for the occasional romantic fancy date night.

The food is excellent, the atmosphere is excellent and anyone who says otherwise is a fool. The agnolotti is definitely my favorite pasta dish of all time. Treat yourself, bring some nice wine and keep going back. The jewel of Collingswood.
The food was as good as advertised. Some of the additional touches you might look for in terms of great service were a bit lacking.

I'm conflicted about Hearthside. On one hand, if I judge it as a "local restaurant in suburban New Jersey," which it is, I'm impressed by the service and the flavor of some dishes. On the other hand, if I judge it as a "higher-end, award-winning restaurant," which it also is, I'm disappointed, if not angry. 

My experience is best summed up by going through my dishes one-by-one...

1. Wagyu Beef Carpaccio: this was surprisingly tasty and fresh. I have no complaints, it exceeded expectations!  

2. Scallop Special: the flavor was good, but it didn't take long for the butter/oil the scallops sat in to harden into sickly clumps. Also, the portion was small small small small small, which is something I don't generally complain about because I really do believe quality is more important than quantity, but I hate that the restaurant tried to hide how half the container didn't have scallops by covering the empty side with bread.

3. Tortellini Special: now THIS dish ruffled my feathers. Five tortellini is standard at any modern/higher-end restaurant, but these tortellini were pathetic. And I don't say that mean-spiritedly, they were just cold mouthfuls of dough with barely a drop (check out the pictures; no Italian grandmother would approve!) of filling.

4. Orecchiette: great flavors, but again, the portion was small small small small small. Quality was definitely better than quantity here, but the quantity was honestly jarring. 

So I'm a "meh." There are definitely more expensive places in Philly with small portions too, but I've truly never been shocked by how small portions are at a restaurant except for at Hearthside.

A
Amazing as always! Service was excellent and food was incredible! Can't wait for the summer menu!

We showed up here on a Friday night at 6o'clock and somehow got a reservation as a walk in. We sit outside in the food was absolutely phenomenal. Everything we had was great and the staff was really really friendly. Couldn't say enough good things about this place it's worth all the hype! So glad that this wonderful restaurant has come to our neighborhood.

We had a rehearsal dinner for the the wedding couple and parents and it did not disappoint.  We ordered a "chefs table".  The food was delicious, beautifully presented, plentiful and flowed like water.  Staff was friendly, conversant and efficient. A perfect beginning to our wedding weekend. Many thanks to all.

Finally checked out Hearthside in the neighborhood with the husband and no regrets!! Loved our waiter so much who was so friendly and down to earth and was seated outside with heat lamps that kept us warm throughout. We had the beef carpaccio, mussels, pasta dish, and pork chop and can't wait to eat it all over again. My favorite was definitely the beef carpaccio and mussels- so flavorful and light to start out our meal.

I've read so many good things about this place, so naturally I made date night reservations for my husband and I.

Booking a reservation over Resy was a pain. Reservations are only available up to 2 weeks in advance, and Hearthside is a very popular spot. You definitely need to book as soon as possible once reservations open for a new day. If not, the only time slot left is the 9pm one. You can also press your luck with first come first serve, even though I would not recommend it.

Parking was super easy. There is a metered parking lot within a block if you don't want to park on the street. There were plenty of available spots when we were there, but I'm not sure if it will stay that way during the summer months as the weather gets better.

Inside the restaurant, there were huge plastic dividers separating diners, and I also like how the restaurant provides little envelopes for diners to store their masks in, in addition to the already available hand sanitizer on each table. Very nice touch!

For food, my husband and I shared 4 small plates and 2 medium plates (pasta dishes), and it was plenty for the both of us. The wagyu beef carpaccio had thai basil, crispy shallots, jalapeno in it, and honestly tasted like a broth-less Pho. It was a little silly. The Hamachi ceviche was a lil too sour for our preference. The Gulf Prawns and the Lamb lollipops were definitely the better small plates we had. The two pasta dishes we had were delicious as well. The desserts were ok. Overall, I would give the food a 4/5.

What was exceptional was the service. Our server, Patrick was truly THE best server we've ever had. He made us feel so comfortable and took great care of us. We give service a 6/5. If anything, he's the reason we will keep coming back to Hearthside.
Great food, great service, all around fantastic experience. Fresh takes on traditional dishes in a great environment. Cannot go wrong with any occasion here.

Amazing. I haven't ventured out to Collingswood before, but this is an incredible place to go for a nice dinner. It's BYOB so be sure to bring your own to really round out the meal. First, the service was incredible. Our waiter was attentive, would literally bend over backwards for us, and an incredible host. The off-menu prawns were delicious, tender, and complemented well with the sauce. The coffee-encrusted pork was delicious, and charred to perfection, and had a wood-fired, really hearty feel to it. This place is also really hard to get reservations at, but their outside patio is first come first serve - so there is some hope of eating here if you just walk by.

This restaurant has become my new favorite place to go. The outside area is beautiful with string lights and cozy seating. The location is wonderful, close to two parking lots and street parking. It fits perfectly in Collingswood main st. No reservations, but didn't wait long. The food was outstanding. We had mussels to start. The coconut curry sauce was extremely flavorful. We also had risotto and the Bronzino. It was incredibly good, seriously I wanted to lick my plate after both dishes. The bread that came with the mussels to dip in the sauce was very good as well. Truly an amazing place! Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and was really nice. Can't wait to go back.

Thoroughly impressed with this restaurant. There is a lot of hype as you read articles in Philly Mag or reviews on Yelp, but it lives up to all the expectations.

Let's start with the service - top notch. Friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, the whole nine. They went above and beyond to offer vegetarian options for the entree.

The atmosphere is upbeat and exciting. Great music playlist, open air space, you can watch the chefs cook and prepare food pretty much from anywhere in the restaurant. The interior is lined with candles and wood finishings - super comfortable. We even felt this way during COVID, all the seating was spread out or blocked off with plexiglass. All tables came with personal hand sanitizer. 

Now the food...where to begin, where to begin. We absolutely splurged on this meal and did not regret it one bit. The menu is sophisticated, the plating is elegant, seeing it from the menu to being executed on the plate is true art.

Appetizers:
- wagyu beef carpaccio: this was my first time trying a dish like this. If I could describe the dish in one word, I would say "fresh." The beef was soft and earthy, topped with crunchy vegetables that really gave it a nice pop.

- coconut curry mussels: this is a big dish for an appetizer, could easily be an entree. The nice thing is that the coconut curry sauce is light (compared to a red/diavolo sauce) so it didn't quite fill me up. The lemongrass focaccia was a really nice touch, and paired nicely with soaking up the juice.

- black truffle risotto: unbelievable!! Hand-made pasta in a black truffle cream sauce with roasted artichokes - perfect combination of creamy and crunchy. Very filling and definitely shareable.

- orecchiette: wow - I could have eaten this 10 times over. Thick and creamy pasta, packed with a spicy punch from the long hots, but not overpowering as it was matched with the savory earthy flavors of the fennel sausage & broccoli rabe. 

- mushrooms: can't say enough good things about this. They based the framework of the meal around the scottish salmon dish - shitaake mushrooms were prepared on a bed of vegetable foie gras and finished with a miso pho broth. Out of this world!! So appreciated their accomodation to a vegetarian request and the use of local, seasonal produce.
 
- smoked pork chop: this was a home-run for me. Really slick plating, packed with flavor. The pork was cooked perfectly, and the juicy meat was matched with a delicious spicy/crunchy coating. Furthermore, the apple chutney really cut the savory/salty flavor of the pork and provided a nice fresh touch to the dish. 

From start to finish, I was just totally impressed. Would highly recommend checking this place out!

On the plus side - it is BYO! So take into consideration what you would save on drinks, and get that extra appetizer (or 2)

Keywords: 40 Oz. Prime Dry-aged Porterhouse.Risotto

This restaurant has been on my bucket list for a very long time.  I finally ordered here with my brother in December, and got takeout.  We ordered the new risotto and the aforementioned porterhouse for two.  The risotto had truffle and Jerusalem artichokes.  It was very interesting; while it lacked in the truffle flavor, i enjoyed the artichokes in the risotto and overall it really acted more like a carb for the main entree, the porterhouse.  I don't exaggerate on Yelp often, but this was the BEST steak I have had from a restaurant during the pandemic.  It was cooked perfectly and seasoned amazingly.  The flavor in the meat was phenomenal, and the steak is accompanied by potatoes and mushrooms, both very delicious sides to go along with the steak.  This meal was one to remember for sure, and was well worth the wait.  Will definitely try to come back after the pandemic comes to an end.

Can't speak to the food but not impressed with their "first come, first served (but not really)" policy. After patiently waiting in line for them to open at 5, they told my husband and I we would have to continue to wait while they let tables for four sit empty to see if a larger party would come. That's not a great policy to begin with, but they could at least be upfront about it on their website, which we made sure to check before heading out. On top of that, both women at the hostess stand were not particularly friendly, borderline rude.

Hearthside is a must-dine restaurant in South Jersey. Reservations are very hard to come by but if you are lucky enough to find a spot (during non-Covid times) - do NOT cancel the reservation.

The restaurant is BYOB and parking is street parking. The Patco Parking Lot is just a short walk a few blocks away, which provides ample parking. Note - do need to feed the meter.

Never had a disappointing dish and the menu changes seasonally. Keeps is fresh and exciting!

Currently, tables are 1st come 1st serve outside with inside-dining reservations by phone only. Take-Out options are offered currently, which is a great option to try Hearthside's exciting cuisine offerings.
Besides being a pain in the butt to get a reservation,  I love this place outstanding training of the staff but the food is the star here. It's a tad pretentious but other than that great

Came here at 5:11PM on a Friday night and was seated at one of the last tables outside. There is currently no indoor dining and no reservations. They opened at 5:00PM and filled up immediately. Due to the 5PM rush, it was a bit of a wait to place our order. 
We ordered the wagyu beef carpaccio, roasted wedge salad, gulf prawns, orecchiette, and hand shredded fried potatoes with long hot aioli (special- not on the menu). When we were seated we were told another special they had was grilled octopus, but by the time we ordered, they were sold out. 
The wagyu beef carpaccio tasted exactly like beef pho without the soup. We enjoyed the food and would go back. 
The only dish that we didn't enjoy was the orecchiette because they were heavy handed on the salt which ruined the dish.

My wife and I met up with some long-time friends here, one of whom lives in Collingswood and has been multiple times. I'd always wanted to go pre-COVID, but reservations were very hard to come by. So our local friend went there at 5pm to put in our names and we were seated soon thereafter.

Let's just say that it wholly lives up to--and possibly exceeds--its reputation! Despite their simple descriptive names, the dishes were quite innovative, taking things in new directions of taste and texture. The wedge salad was a good example: Romaine instead of iceberg lettuce, charred on a grill, serving as a base for the conventional bacon and bleu-cheese dressing. The result was incredibly tasty.

Between the four of us, we managed a good sampling of the menu and I have to say it's one of the most impressive restaurants I've been in recently. The food is spectacular and the service is befitting.

Delicious food prepared with skill, served perfectly by knowledgeable servers. Orrechiette is a must appie. There is not one thing on the menu I wouldn't recommend except the steak which I never had. 
It's byo. It's a present you give yourself. Go! You'll love it.

I generally don't write reviews. I must say the food here is very good! I had the avocado toast with crab meat as an appetizer. Delicious!!! I also had the Bronzino & my husband had the pork chops . Both were excellently prepared. Although I would have preferred less char on the Bronzino. If you like potatoes , the crispy potatoes as a side dish was very tasty!!
The dessert selection is limited , nevertheless the gelato did not disappoint.
I've been taken to this place twice. Each time I was under impressed. Way too much salt in their prep for the scallops which I ordered. I think this is the most overrated restaurant in the area

We had a wonderful meal here.   The menu is small but has some great options.  The vibe is more upscale than the typical Collingswood restaurants.   The chicken dish was unbelievably flavorful.  The other party got a fish dish that they thoroughly loved.   Hard to get reservations which is telling on the quality of food.  It is especially good for a special dinner , anniversary, birthday or just because you deserve it !

business.name: Ken's Seafood Restaurant
business.categories: Seafood, Chinese, Nightlife, Restaurants, Karaoke

reviews.text: Went for the karaoke with a group of friends and had a great time, food was decent. We reserved the room a couple days before and were told we had it from 8pm to closing time but we're then told at 9pm that we had to leave at 9:30 to make room for another group that was never brought to our attention. Overall had a good time but they don't quite know how to run the place.

Ken's Seafood Restaurant has many traditional Chinese plate served with seafood. I went the basic route and had the Sweet & Sour Chicken served with white rice and vegetables. Very delicious entree for the price, ($12). Service was adequate as they're able to seat you with limited seating, but basic things like water never came. I would recommend this place for the food and ambiance in Chinatown.

*3.5/5

Only place around that was open for our late night post-concert cravings, and it was aight. Kinda tasted like food I could put together myself but it hit the spot in the moment. Pan-fried dumplings were nice and crispy, so special shout out there. They also give you tea to drink which is noice.

Agreed with other patrons, rude service and the owner is so arrogant. They under cooked the shrimp dish I ordered and refused to correct it. Furthermore, the chicken dish was bloody and he tells me it's been served that way for years. Worst part, they removed your review if it's bad

I want to give them no stars. First off, we all went there late, 4 people (including myself). We only ordered 2 orders of chicken wings, beef chow fun, 4 small bowl of rice, 2 beers, and a canned of coke. The amount should come up to approximately $80-95?   Nope the rip-off waiter charged us $200!? Thank God, my uncle addressed the manager, the waiter switched our bill. Like it was nothing. I guess the waiter thought we were too drunk to noticed our bill. People, please be aware.

DO NOT COME HERE. IT IS A SCAM. RUDE SERVICE. WOULD GIVE NEGATIVE STARS IF POSSIBLE.
 
So I wanted to book Kens for my birthday party after hearing people mention it having private rooms, karaoke, and BYOB. I was hesitant after seeing the poor ratings but thought I should still give it a try. Called two weeks in advance and was told very rudely by a staff that I could only book two days before the event. So I waited and called two days before the event at 4:50PM. Immediately I was greeted very rudely by a male staff yelling WHAT? 

When I tell him I would like to book a room for Saturday he tells me they are full. I explain how I tried booking much earlier in advance but was told to call back later. The staff proceeds to start swearing saying "WHAT THE FUCK? ARE YOU CRAZY? I SAID WE ARE FULL."

I then asked politely if I could please talk to the manager/owner and he replies "ARE YOU CRAZY? I AM THE MANAGER. WHAT THE SHIT YOU CRAZY?"

At that point I decided I would much rather have my birthday party at a restaurant that treats its customers politely. If this is the attitude of the manager then the restaurant is truly a lost cause. There's much better karaoke options like Yakitori Boy, Chinese food like Dim Sum Garden or BYOB like Nine ting.

It makes me sad to give this place a low score. All the other times I've been to Ken's I had a lot of fun and enjoyed the food, but this time I am extremely disappointed. 

We made a reservation for a karaoke room for a friend's birthday. Upon arrival they first sent our group into 2 different rooms without telling us, so it took us awhile to even realize that the rest of our party was in another room. Then they said they there was a pre set menu and $20 a person, $200 minimum? They've never done a pre set menu for a party before. We were disappointed because we knew what we wanted to order beforehand and were excited to be eating their food. What makes it worse is that they didn't even give us a lot of food. Fried rice, lo mein, general tsao chicken, beef and broccoli? Food we could have ordered from our chinese takeout places nearby. It wasn't even a lot of food either, we were all still hungry after and ended up going to another chinese restaurant. They were so quick to kick us out after our 2 hours too, in the middle of our session they started clearing out our table. How disappointing. It really put a downer on our night. I don't know if I'll ever schedule another party here.

This place has nice karaoke rooms but considering that if you have a party of 10 or more it's $20 per person it's not worth it. they give you like seven dollars worth of food per person  which is ridiculous. 11 people in my party and they brought out 5-6 plates for everyone to share. They started taking away out plates and I literally was like "that's it?" In disbelief I was still very much hungry. It's definitely not worth it. Not the greatest service either and it was difficult to get a room as well. There's other karaoke rooms in Chinatown that are more worth it. The food was okay, your typical Chinese food. They didn't give us any expensive dishes either with the big party, just chicken dishes, lo mein, fried rice, chow fun, that you can get for a fraction of the price at your local Chinese restaurant by your house.
We had a reservation and they double booked it leaving us no option and a terrible night. The manager was extremely aggressive and would not accommodate us accordingly.

This place is way too noise, and I smell people smoking. The food is not well prepared, I order lobster sashimi. They didn't even take time to cut it thin, they gave me big chunk and thrown on the ice, and all other dishes don't look well prepared either. They need take more
 time on it

We went to karaoke last night and had a great time! $20 per person for a private room AND food included! Remember to bring cash to pay! It's a good spot for a group of college kids for a cheap and fun time. They should show you how to work the music system though! And maybe get a few more songs. Great cheap byob spot!

Great experience! Had a reservation at 10pm, but got there at 8:45pm and they let us get a room anyways. The room was huge, food was delightful and came out very quick! Staff barely bothered us except to ask if everything was ok. Only problem was we had to ask for water repeatedly without them refilling it when they saw it was empt and grabbing our own utensils. Overall experience it was great tho. Def recommend!

Great food, great experience. The owner came out and greeted us personally, and ensured we had the best his menu had to offer on our plates. I have never met his equal, and will look forward to dining with him whenever I am back in Philly.

Not impressed with Ken's. I would recommend this for a casual drop-in karaoke room, but I definitely would not recommend it for any sort of event for a large group that requires advance planning.  

I'll start with a positive -- Karaoke rooms were spacious compared to other spots in Chinatown and we enjoyed the Chinese food. BYOB is a plus. 

There were miscommunications regarding my room reservation and it seemed like a shady way to make more money rather than a simple misunderstanding. 

First of all, you can't reserve earlier than the Monday prior to the weekend you want. I called at 4:30pm on a Monday (as soon as they opened) to make a reservation for 10pm on a Friday and was confirmed for 10-1am. However, when I arrived, I was told my reservation was at 10:30pm. At that time, we were placed in a room too small for our party and did not go into the room we requested until 11:00pm. 

I was told on the phone that it would be $20 in cash per person for the room + food and that it is BYOB. No problem. But, at 1:30am when we went to pay our bill, we were told we were required to pay 20% gratuity on top of the bill because we were in the room longer than the 3 hour limit. Considering we did not begin karaoke or receive any food until after 11:00pm, this simply was not true. By that point, half of our party had left so the remaining 5 guests had to find a way to come up with $120(!) for gratuity.

It seems that Ken's tries to cram in walk-in reservations and makes you wait to accommodate multiple groups in a night. The system was disorganized and dishonest. If you want to have repeat customers, be clear about the price and reservation. The whole night felt shady-- with cash only and no receipts provided to verify anything.

STAY AWAY. 

I am so disappointed with this experience. We were told by a friend that this restaurant offered a special deal per person for karaoke and for "unlimited" food. Immediately, we were disappointed by the stench of the atmosphere (smoke and raw seafood), the unprofessional staff, and the unsanitary amenities. 

We were promised the room from 10-1, but we did not enter our room till 11.  Stuck in a small space with a large group, dirty room, we waited patiently for our reservation.  

The food was nothing special, and again, the amenities were horrendous.  We were unable to use the toilet due to it being clogged and disgusting. Even though we told a staff member, nothing was done. 

Upon leaving and paying what we thought we were originally told was our due amount per our agreement with the establishment, we were chased out of the restaurant by the owner who demanded an additional $120. Unbelievable. My friends and I always tip for a restaurant, but being yelled at by the owner to tip $120 on the sidewalk outside the establishment is beyond me. 

Upon all of this, the bill had no charges and only accepted cash. I would love to see how this business reports their profits, as it is obvious they take advantage of their customers. Without any contract or policy, they are lucky we gave them any type of extra cash.

Needless to say, I will never return. There are so many high quality restaurants run by honest and hard working staff that I will continue to support. I will never recommend Kens Seafood.
Would like to make a reservation but cant get anyone to answer the phone. Is this place still open?
Ken's seafood is another gem in Philly Chinatown. The place is small but hey! As long as the food is delicious, i don't really care.
Service was rude. Food was ok. The restaurant is not very clean and the bathrooms are dirty. The food is reasonably priced tho.

Ken's is one of my favorite places for karaoke/BYO because the private rooms are decently spacious and the facilities are exactly what you'd expect from a Karaoke place. They have a decent selection of songs (Mandarin and English), and some are actually pretty recent.

The food itself is actually surprisingly good. We had the broccoli and beef, (General Tso's?) chicken, fried rice, and some others. They were all very flavorful and what you'd get at a normal Chinese restaurant. That's actually a good thing, since I feel that some BYO places hinge on the fact that they're BYO and the food is lacking compared to a regular restaurant.

In the end, I probably wouldn't come here if it wasn't a BYO - the atmosphere is pretty loud and karaoke like. However, if it's for a BYO, I'd definitely recommend here.

Hosted my birthday here and it was incredibly fun! A nice selection of food and a private room to karaoke! It's 20 a person + 25% gratuity. I'm not sure if there's a minimum amount of people needed to get a room, but it sure was fun. There was a bit of a language barrier between the staff and I but they were accommodating and tried their best to assist.
My only complaint is that the karaoke system is somewhat difficult to use. Took a few minutes if playing around with it (out of the 3 hours we were allowed) to figure it out. And when we did, they had an ok selection of music. Most of hits, although they were missing Biggie and Meek, and many, and I mean MANY Korean, Chinese, and Japanese songs. There is nothing wrong with that, I just wished there was a way to filter it out.

I'm a regular here but I had to write about the most recent experiences I've had here. We were a large group that asked for and booked a room. We were arriving prepared to pay for our reservation. However, apparently we did not order enough food for a staff member's satisfaction - he came into the room, yelling at us (actually yelling) insisting that we vacate the room. He placed us at a table that was far too small for our group and we lost money on our room. The staff was rude and demeaning. Of course, at this point, I wanted to tip but not much, because of such ridiculous service. When I did so, the staff had the audacity to come back up to me and insist on me tipping more. They refused to let me leave until I did (I had paid for the food and given a tip at this point)!! This kind of treatment is outrageous and disturbing. Treating customers like this is not allowed, in any circumstances. There are many better karaoke/Asian/byo restaurants nearby - go there.
The food is really fresh. The owner is very nice they have party  rooms which is cool. A good place for seafood

Ken's Seafood is a great late night or karaoke option! My go-to place for a karaoke/dinner event!

The food is good. I have never had a bad experience with their food. But it would be far from my first choice for a family dinner. Their lo mein and fried rice options are pretty good. I also enjoy their seafood, since it is their specialty. 

Besides the food, my main reason I go here is for their karaoke/food special for their upstair rooms! They have a number of private karaoke rooms upstairs of varying sizes depending on your needs. Typically, you can just call them and reserve the rooms yourself. The music selection is diverse and updated very frequently. They may not have the songs that just came out that month, but they'll have some that are still on the radio.
 
Aesthetically, it is just like any other Chinese restaurant, but you're guaranteed relatively good food and a fun time for a decent price.

Late Night Chinese Food.

Can you ever really give it 5 stars? Everything tastes so good when it's 3am. I came here a couple times and always order lo mein or something basic chinese and then i hate myself for it because this place specializes in seafood! the clams in brown sauce, crispy shrimp or lobster fried rice is the way to go here. anything other than seafood here is basic. the manager is very lively, he's usually drunk but gives some free shots. i usually hit up this place or david's after a long night out with some friends to ease the hangover the next day

I used Ken's Seafood twice to host my birthday karaoke parties and it has not disappointed. The food is great but the atmosphere itself is a lot of fun. It is BYOB which makes it so much more affordable and the systems are good. I had already given up on the other establishments that used archaic systems such as a giant book of songs or a remote that's in a different language. Another great thing is that the music video is the ACTUAL music video for English songs. 

Service is also decent; there was always at least one person available that stood outside the doorway which is nice.

business.name: South Coast Deli- Chapala
business.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Delis, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text: I have over 40 orders to pick up last weekend.  Fatima and the crew at SCD were amazing.   Each order was packaged, labeled and ready close to the promised time.  Really amazing and delicious sandwiches and salads.  The portions are huge so share with a friend!!!
Food had zero flavor. We got the tri tip salsa and Mexican Caesar. No flavor and ven asked for extra dressing and it was pretty disappointing.

Talk about food envy...my fiancé had this for lunch and the aroma was magnificent, the portion was hardy and satisfying, and the ingredients were fresh. It's perfectly satisfies a solid sandwich craving. I can't wait to come here myself. I want to try everything on the menu!

Everything about this place is excellent! The food is delicious, the staff is always super friendly, service is fast, and it's super affordable. Easily one of my favorite places to eat in Santa Barbara!! Jim's breakfast sandwich is delicious on sourdough also :)

I absolutely love South Coast Deli. I probably eat here three times a week at least. They do an absolutely awesome job of putting together a huge variety of sandwiches that literally anybody can enjoy. 

They're salads are fricken awesome too. Really sizable, and loaded up with all the good stuff. I think at deli's a lot of the time you can feel jipped when you pay $12 for a sandwich, but that isn't the case with South Coast. 

If I had one suggestion it would be this - it would be fun to have a special dressing or spread maybe that isn't a Mayo. Like a sweet and sour or some kind of balsamic glaze. But then again, if it ain't broke don't fix it. 

Also, last thing. The staff here is awesome. They take great care of you, and even in the middle of lunch rush they go out of their way to take care of you. That's great service right there, and they absolutely nail it every time

Overall - 10/10

This place is amazing.  I only wish I lived closer so I could try EVERY sandwich they had on the menu. We were in town for a long weekend and stopped here. Ever since I've been dreaming about the sandwiches. I ordered the when in Rome and it did not disappoint.  I was with 4 other girlfriends, most of us ordered the chicken sandwiches and each was equally amazing.  I highly, highly recomomend!!

Great little shop. Love the South Coast Turkey sandwich.
Some sandwiches have generous amounts of sauce/mayo. I love it :). Mayo is made there and is amazing.
Can be a little inconsistent in ingredient distribution (ex. peppers are often much heavier on one side than on the other).

Great service, friendly and helpful.

Some sandwiches are not to my tastes so it might take a little exploring on the menu to find the right one for you.

Sometimes less is better.  It should definitely apply to the Italian 3 way sandwich that I ordered on Monday while working  in Santa Barbara for the day.  If you follow or read my reviews, I love Italian Deli sandwiches or a hot bowl of Pho for lunch (I know, total extremes).  
The 3 way sandwich is way too much - too much mayo, too much wet vegetables from the excessive mayo and really wasn't that great.  If you like mayo (and I do), ask for it on the side so you can control the portion.  All I could taste was the mayo and juice from the mayo.  I won't be returning. 
Parking is easy to find and great customer service gets the restaurant 3 stars. 
Also, if you use their wifi, they will send you a follow up email about your dining experience.  I get that you have to accept their policy to access the complimentary wifi, but I have never received a follow up email.
As always amazing sandwiches and salads. What crazy is that of the South Coast Delis this is the best one. The others are really good. But this is constantly amazing.

If you're vegetarian they don't care or don't pay attention ruin to details of an order, 
I ordered a salad today and requested "no bacon, no chicken" and surprise tons of bacon tucked under the mound of lettuce. Meh
Great service and great sandwiches! We ordered the eggplant sandwich, Greek salad, caprese sandwich, Turkey avacodo bacon and all were so tasty! Just perfect for our lunch after walking some trails.

I suggested SCD for lunch today thinking I was going to order a sandwich but couldn't resist my favorite salad, Keep Kalm and Kale On...I t's the only kale salad I really enjoy. I've tried to duplicate it at home...gonna leave it to the pros. Loaded with toppings just the way I like it. Perfectly dressed. I added chicken and it was tender, flavorful and plenty of it! You all knocked it out of the park! Thank you. I will be back.

This was my second time at South Coast Deli and both times were pretty good. We had the Romaine & Gorgonzola and Greek Salads, but substituted the dressings for the Italian vinaigrette. The avocado, walnut and turkey in the Romaine & Gorgonzola was a great combo and really tasty. The Greek Salad was a little heavy on the artichokes and onions, so keep that in mind when ordering. Overall the portions are huge and everything on the menu is under $15. Would recommend for a casual lunch spot or for pick-up.
Excellent sub sandwiches!  The prices are very reasonable for what you get.  Stopped by while vacationing in SB.
If I had a quarter for every time i had a sandwich here and screamed "WOW THAT WAS GOOD" after, Id have 50 cents. And i only ate their once. So good i got 2 sammys

They have to hand us our order just like the other restaurant amazing place the people who make the sandwiches is fast the stars are for the staff they don't care maybe they'll learn something from other restaurants

Omg! Best Sandwich Place Ever! Been to a lot of high end ones and nothing beats this one! First time here and plan to come back. Service was so nice and friendly as well. Compliments to the chefs ! Yummy sandwiches. I got the Eggplant sandwich, my hubby Buffalo Chicken Sami and our son - BBQ Chicken . So, delicious and good size. Worth the price! Thank u to this establishment !

I don't normally post reviews. As a manager of restaurants, I have a love/hate relationship with these platforms. But I also think it's important to give recognition to high level performers. The gentleman (BOH) working the food line at this location this evening, was hustling more that I typically see in restaurants these days. He clearly cares about his position and the product. Bravo sir. South Coast Deli is lucky to have you on their team!

Fills in the gap for us always
Take out for social get togethers, business and family gatherings
Always consistent 
Great menu

I stood in a long line to order a stupid sandwich while waiting for my son to have surgery on his arm.  I ordered a ham & cheese with everything but tomatoes.  When I got back to the doctors office to eat my sandwich, they only put a SMALL slice of ham and extremely small bite of sliced cheese with nothing else!!!   Dry and boring sandwich for the money!!!

Was in the neighborhood and stumbled upon this gem!
I don't frequent a lot of delis as I don't eat meat and how many ways you can make a veggie sandwich?
Well this place has an amazing take on their south coast veggie sammie!  It was huge!  And I think the herb cream cheese really added a nice kick to the flavor!  
Great food, good atmosphere and even the gentlemen who took my order was awesome!  
I'll be back,
Thanks!

South coast Deli is my favorite sandwich restaurant in Santa Barbara. Thanks to fellow yelper suggestions, I decided to branch out and try a salad. I've come to the conclusion that you can't go wrong with anything on the menu here. They use quality ingredients are on consistently fresh on every experience. The Kale Salad with chicken is fantastic. It's a great value for a large salad. I especially like the topping, garlic dressing that it comes with, and the pine nuts were a nice touch. My standard go-to here is the south coast turkey on an Italian roll and I add the famous Tabasco mayo, which is delicious. If you want a tasty sandwich or salad, south coast will not let you down. All locations are consistent and equal. The service is always friendly as well. Beware of busy lines at lunch rushes, which confirms for me that this place rocks and others agree.
Rude staff. They were really unfriendly and don't really make you feel welcomed. I'd suggest the owner or manager keep an eye out.

Even if you order online pay online and leave a tip online you still have to wait in a line for 10 to 15 minutes to pick up your sandwich at the time they said it would be ready what is the point of ordering and paying online if you still have to wait in line with others that have not ordered. This is easily fixed yet for some reason SCD does not want to make it easy to pick up paid for online orders the sandwiches are good but I feel they are out of touch even in times of CovidThank you

I deliver DoorDash and am there almost every day as well as to eat. Great food but also really fast service during lunch. Their employee Richie is super nice and friendly.  He also makes a point of getting to know peoples names and connects with them.  He does his best to get your order to you and in your way. My favorite place to do pick up and deliveries for.

business.name: Farmacy Vegan Kitchen & Bakery
business.categories: Vegan, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food, Cafes, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Acai Bowls

reviews.text:
Listen. I read through everyone's reviews prior to going to Farmacy Vegan today. 

I WILL RETURN. 

Location:
-I went around 12:30 pm, so I didn't experience any parking or traffic issues. Just parked on the street and walked a block.
-Finding the location within the Duckweed Urban Grocery store was easy.

Food:
-Churro Whoopi's Pie was perfection ... 10/10
-The Classic Philly Cheesesteak was great ... 8/10
-The Jerk Pasta Salad was amazing. The only downfall was too much sauce (for me) ... 9/10

Price:
-$$ 
-I mean, it's vegan food. Anything healthy costs these days (unfortunately). 
-Don't let that stop you. Just give the place a try. Splurge one time and you won't regret it. 

Sorry, no pictures. I was hungry, and excited.

Such a gem! Great service and so yummy! The burger with buffalo sauce was so delicious. We also got the Mac and it was so good too. My husband and I live an hour away, but often think about driving back to Tampa just to get food here.
Food was fine, but what kind of vegan place offers NO recycling options?? Thought this was strange and disappointing. Won't come back for this reason.

Awesome!!! I loved my Mean Black Bean Burger!! I Loved it!!  Truly LOVED it!!   Their home made lentil and black bean patty was perfectly seasoned (at least for me.  I like spicy food). I hope they expand their menu using this patty as I am not fond of impossible burgers.  I will definitely be adding Farmacy Vegan Kitchen to my list of favorites, especially as I am experimenting with becoming a Vegetarian.  Great job!!!

A few friends and I were visiting Tampa for the weekend and while we Wanted to try a few vegan places while in town. Far Macy was hands down the best place we went. There weren't any places to sit down and eat besides a table outside but if you are looking to grab some food Togo, this is the spot for you. I tried the jerk burger with a side of sweet potato fries and it was the best burger I have ever tasted, vegan or not. 10 out of 10 would recommend. If I am ever in the area again I will be going back. Very friendly customer service as well, which is always a plus :)
Love the grocery store and the restaurant! Got the cuban, buffalo chic wrap and multiple desserts! Everything was delicious!

Visiting in the Tampa area and came across this vegan burger site.  I ordered the jerk burger, corn salad + a berry patch smoothie. It was a wonderful delight.  So much yes!  - If you're ever looking for a new place to try, pop in here you and your taste buds won't be disappointed!

Visited on the weekend for a meat-free alternative. The eatery is inside of a grocery store and it wasn't too busy. There is a small indoor dining area and there is also an outdoor seating space. I had the patty melt and it was delicious! Every bite of the patty melt left me wanting more. The customer service is also very good. I would recommend Framacy Vegan Kitchen and I look forward to my next visit.

Let me start by saying what a cool little market spot downtown that's very convenient to get to and is close to everything... the second I walked in the smell hit my
Nose and I immediately said this is going to be good! I ordered the fuego Philly cheesesteak.. I am not vegan or vegetarian or anything but this plant based food was INCREDIBLE!!!! I was blown away at how amazing it all tasted. My girlfriend got the Buffalo burger and it was equally as good. 10/10 STRONGLY RECOMMEND!! You must get something from there and it's healthy!

Highly recommend delicious vegan spot we got the Philly cheeses steak definitely would reorder them every time I visit town! We pick up a few of there Togo items the pasta salad which was so good and two cookies.

I thought this was going to be a harder review, but man was I impressed with this place! We are doing a weekly diet through summer and on our vegetarian week we chose to give this place a try. Delicious!!! I personally had the friscos melt and while I already love an impossible patty and sourdough I was impressed at how similar the cheese was to real American and the flavor profile overall. I had no idea I was eating a plant based anything! I also tried the Mac n cheese, while that didn't have the cheesy flavor I expected, it was delicious creamy pasta with a smoky kick from the topping seasoning. Very filing and definitely didn't leave me feeling like I missed meat. My co worker had the Buffalo chicken wrap and enjoyed that as well. We ordered the whopper pie and brookeo (an Oreo/brownie/cookie) to have later in the day and we aren't even fully combined those were vegan... SO GOOD! This definitely made me a believer in the taste possibilities for vegan food and was a good healthy alternative to a regular meat/cheese meal. I look forward to trying more of their menu. Bonus points for the fact that we got this via Uber eats and it was still super hot and tasty... I imagine eating there is even more amazing.

Just tried this place today after it being on my wishlist to try for a bit - and I'm so glad I did!! The food was amazingly delicious; I LOVED the farmacy frisco melt and chocolate avocado brownie and my roommate was super happy with her farmacy burger. This place is such a gem, I absolutely recommend!

Saturday was super busy, but the food is sooo good it's worth the wait. Both the freshly made and carry out items are some of the BEST vegan option you'll find. Farmacy is a must stop for any visit to Tampa!
The vegan Philly is to die for and I make a stop every time I visit Tampa. Everything seems fresh and it's always delicious.
Omg absolutely amazing vegan philly. The attached grocery is very very small. But the sandwich is worth the trip.
Food was great here, love the area & the store has plenty of options! The fuego philly was absolutely delicious!

This place is AMAZING!!! We order from Uber eats often and everything is always not only delicious, but they package the hot items separately from the frozen items. My açaí bowls come still frozen, which in a delivery situation is just awesome. They also called me to check on the food allergy I listed, as I ordered 2 of the same things (one nut allergy, one not)...talk about going above & beyond to keep their customers safe, so nice! One of our favorite things are their philly cheese steaks...it's hard to believe it's vegan! For a sandwich that is always so heavy when it's not vegan, the vegan version is surprisingly light. Everyone needs to try this restaurant, they are absolutely killing it!

This is by far the best vegan food I've had in the Tampa Bay Area! I dislike the Impossible Burger, but when that young man made the Philly Cheesesteak for me, I'm a fan now! I ate all the Smores Banana Bread, but that is the perfect end to an amazing deal. Texture, Taste, and Sweetness. Not overbearing, but just right. Try it all, you won't be disappointed!
And get some of the To-Go trays for your lunch week.

This food is seriously sooooo good!!! The cashew Mac taste better than any vegan Mac I've ever had. I remember I got my friend a "philly cheesesteak" from here once and all she kept screaming was "this is vegan!??"

Went for the first time with two of my friends from out of town. One of them is a full on vegan, she found the food very delicious! They both did! I had an açaí bowl, wasn't too crazy about it, it was hard and I had to keep stabbing it in order to eat it so that was a bit annoying. But overall a nice little spot with some good menu choices!!

OMG their Steak and Cheese is so good...and isn't real steak. So good, that when I'm craving a steak and cheese sub I just order from here and get their vegan steak and cheese! Located inside a little grocery store, lots of cool treats and snacks and drinks to try and enjoy. Always a fun visit downtown to grab a quick and tasty lunch!

I came here on a weekend trip to Tampa from Atlanta. Service is great. I got the macaroni and cheese and the frisco melt and my mom got the Philly cheesesteak. Everything was so good! Will be back next time I'm in Tampa! :)
Really pleased with their food, most of the time. I do not care for the jerk pasta, the way it is made is continuously inconsistent but most of the sandwiches I get are great!

Delicious
I always get the Spicy Jerk Burger and I love it and it never disappoints.
The place is very clean, the staff members are professional and kind , and the place is cute and small.
The donuts are great too
If your in the area check it out!

I always forget to get a photo of the food first. It's so good that I just start eating immediately lol so excuse this eaten photo of this delicious food. I'll get a better one next time.

As a newly vegan person, I went in to try their philly cheese steak. Holy f******* sh**!!! It was perfect! Literally tastes like the real thing. Highly recommend getting it with the mushrooms and onions. Will for sure eat here again when I'm back in town.

business.name: Lincoln Square Pancake House
business.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Greek, American (Traditional), Restaurants

reviews.text: Everything at this location is just OK just DONT get the FRENCH TOAST it will be plain toast nothing French about it nice staff and place just the food is a 5 out of 10 rather go to ihop or bluehill over this place
Great fun Extensive Breakfast menu . Meals are served well and quickly. Always friendly

I have tried this place 4 times, wishing it was as good as the reviews I have read. 
This last experience confirms that while the food may be decent, there are fundamentals in service that are clearly lacking. 

To the owner: If you would like a clear indication of what happened, I encourage you to message me. Basic manners of your staff are non-existent.

Every time I've been there the food has been great.  Today it was exceptionally good!  The coffee was hot, fresh and delicious.  I ordered the chicken and waffle with blueberry butter, hashbrowns extra crispy with onion and a side of patty sausage.   The chicken was well seasoned, crispy on the outside, tender and juicy in the middle.  The waffle was cooked perfect so it could stand up to the blueberry butter and syrup without turning to mush.  Everywhere I eat breakfast at I always order my hashbrowns extra crispy with onions but they seldom get it right.  These were probably some of the best hashbrowns I've had in a very long time.  But with all that being said the best thing about the whole experience was the service.   Camrie (I believe that's the spelling) was very friendly, fast, efficient and personable.   I tend to drink a lot of water and coffee with my breakfast and neither one was ever more than half empty.  Next time I go back I will definitely ask to be sat in her section.

Popped in to this place on a busy Saturday morning. Had to wait only about 5-10 minutes for a table to open up. There is a ton of seating inside and they do have signs to limit guests to staying for a maximum of an hour and a half at this time. 

Quick coffee service and ordering. A huge menu with lots of options whether it's eggs benedict, a skillet scramble, pancakes, waffles etc. They have something to suit everyone. 

I ordered the eggs benedict. Definitely a no in my book. I had my fiance try the hollandaise and he agreed it was bad. It wasn't bad as in it was going to make me sick or anything but the flavors were so far off it just tasted pretty awful. Steer clear of this menu item! The hash browns it came with were cooked perfect though and I have high praises about those! I got a side of bacon and was also impressed at how thick cut the bacon was.

The food here is excellent. I have alway had great breakfasts. I love the mini waffles and the biscuits. I have a hard time choosing which to get as my side 'carb'! Normally I get an omelette, but on this trip I ordered the Greek skillet  which had gyro meat, feta, tomatoes...and eggs on top. Yummy! I'll have a hard time deciding on my main entree now! 
Service was a little slow, but friendly.

Our son was craving pancakes when we were in town for a soccer tournament recently,  and that's how we found the Lincoln Square Pancake House. The menu is loaded with so many yummy options, it was really tough to decide what to order. We'll just have to come back again so that I can try additional selections.

I ended up ordering the French Toast, since the bread is made especially for Lincoln Square Pancake House by a local bakery, and a half portion of biscuits and gravy. My son ordered both French Toast and Pancakes, while my husband ordered a dish called the Lincoln Skillet, which was filled with hashbrowns, sausage gravy, peppers, a meat of your choice, then topped with two eggs (your choice of style). And if that isn't enough, the Lincoln Skillet also comes with your choice of pancakes, mini waffles,, French Toast, or toast. Our server was Brandy, who was very nice and patient while we asked questions and made our final decisions. 

Served with whipped cinnamon butter, the French Toast was truly the best I have ever eaten. And talk about filling! Needless to say, it's best to dine here with a completely empty stomach. The pancakes were thick and fluffy, and both my husband and son loved them. Despite being full, I also sampled a bite of hashbrowns from my husband's dish, and I loved them, particularly when topped with a little sausage gravy. My husband felt that the gravy needed a little more umpf but I liked it as is. Of course, he tends to like spicier foods than I do. 

The next time you're in the neighborhood, I highly recommend that you drop in for a bite. The restaurant is clean, everyone is wearing masks, and the service is extremely fast and friendly. Bon appetit!

The way this was handled by their social media person was indeed wrong, however the owner of the franchise did reach out to me personally via Facebook. He apologized for their social media person and said they would be handled and agreed that the response was not ok. He also sent me a gift card enough for my husband and I to make up for not only the meal I couldn't eat but the whole situation. We are going to try another Lincoln square pancake house today. I have raised my star count based on the chain owners response as of 7/26.



This was written on 7-17:Yesterday while my sister was getting treatment I ordered a Togo order at Lincoln square pancake house I got the meat lovers omelette and explained that I wanted to sub spinach and tomato for the green pepper and onion. I emphasized this. Explained that I'm allergic to onion and strongly dislike green pepper. When I use to live near by they would always just substitute it for me. I was assured this wasn't an issue. I live 40 minutes away and saved it for this morning covered in green pepper Etc it's like she just added spinach and tomato to the order. I went over it with her numerous times and explained I was allergic. Severely disappointed and threw away $12 because I can't eat this now. 

I posted this on Facebook and the person who manages their socials replied claiming my food had been replaced. A bold face lie. Since I did not go to eat this until the next morning and got this order to go, and I also posted a picture of this in my living room on a TV tray with my carpet. If this is how this company handles complaints about something when someone has an allergy this is a horrible company. Had I not noticed the green pepper and started tearing apart the omelette I wouldn't have noticed the onion and then could have been in the hospital. Allergies are no joke. I will never attend any of their establishments again because if you as a company desires to lie when a customer complains because you could have hospitalized them, then clearly you care more about your reputation then doing what is right. You care more about your restaurant then peoples lives. When I worked in the service industry and people mentioned they had an allergy we took that seriously. I would have just left this on Facebook but after the lie I felt the need to post elsewhere. If you have food allergies this establishment is not

We really like the food but we have been there twice since the reopening and many employees were walking around with their mask pulled down below their nose, while taking orders AND carrying food.  I asked our server very nicely to pull her mask up and she did.  However, the next time she came to our table it was down again.  Other servers were doing the same thing. It appears that management is not enforcing mask wearing and I am uncomfortable going back again.  Too bad because the food IS really good.
Went in to pick up an order and the two ladies up front had on masks, but they were wearing them under their chins! Did not feel that protected from possible Covid.
I loooooooove this place. Mom and I are always seated in the same booth every time. Edgar gets massive kudos for being the best waiter ever!

Friend and I went on a Sunday morning at 10am.
Place was packed but we were seated right away. I had the chicken and waffle and she and omelet. Food was fast and delicious. I couldn't finish all mine. Service was good. Absolutely no complaints and will eat here again.

First time here. Place is packed which is a good sign. We were greeted right away and sat at our table in less than  10 minutes. Our server (Tiffany) was very prompt, courteous and professional. After ordering, our food was delivered very quickly, hot and smelling delicious. Everything tasted great, no complaints at all. I do recommend their smoked breakfast sausage!  We'll be back!

Lincoln Square is our favorite low-key place to visit for brunch.  This location is very similar to Lincoln Square's other local spots; busy atmosphere, friendly staff who know how to flip a table quickly, and a great menu that creatively tweaks the traditional stereotypical breakfast dishes.  Lincoln Square recently redesigned its menu to a large 2-sided sheet (versus the multi-sheet book they used to heave at you).  Menu favorites are still there, like Martin's Breakfast Bowl (eggs & chorizo over jalapeno corncakes) and the West Coast omelet (bacon, avocado, feta, tomato and onion). They still don't charge for egg white upgrades on omelets; score! My newest favorite dish is "The Alex" skillet; it has all the meats (sausage, bacon & ham) with a spicy Mexican twist (avocado, queso & pico), all drizzled with this delicious smoky chipotle Spanish sauce. The creamy chipotle drizzle is to die for and it ties all the flavors together well.  I definitely recommend this Lincoln Square location just as strongly as the other ones. It's a great place to take a picky eater; something for everyone on their menu!
I've tried this restaurant 3 times and that's enough to give it a fair shake. Neither my husband nor I cared for the food. It was just ok. Nothing special about it

Parking is a disaster. I have eaten here for years and have never dealt with so many rude abusive people as this Sunday morning. I waited for two parking spaces only to have them taken by people who apparently cant see a Jeep. I have to say it was tempting to drag their cars over to dollar tree.  I wont eat here again.

Randomly tried this place the other day and was pleasantly surprised. Very unassuming on the outside, but the food is quite tasty. Very cheap prices. It's not the best breakfast you'll have in Indy, but it may be the best breakfast you can get for under 10 bucks in Indy.

Holy moly this was the perfect breakfast after a night out! The Mac and cheese skillet was so creamy and tasty! It was like breakfast and lunch in one bowl. Each entree gets a side, the mini waffles could have been a meal by themselves! The coffee was great, and our waiter was attentive and helpful!

This place is so good. I've always come to this little diner because it's not far from my home. I can't believe it never dawned on me to check in. I usually get the country lady which is great to eat and go straight home for a nap. Or the breakfast platter with French toast. I wish the French toast wasn't so dry though. I feel it could use a bit more egg or moisture to the mixture. The people are friendly and never mind to go the extra mile to get me the things I need. Just be aware everything you think may be considered an essential to you they will charge you fit in a heart beat. Their food is really good. Some items are a tad bit cold when you get them which is why I think the French toast is missing something as well as hash browns. Could be only myself so go try it out and lmk what you think of this place !

Every time I come to this place I have a 5-stsr experience. My parents request to come here every time they come to town. The service is always on point and the food is always terrific. Today was no exception! My server, Josh, was friendly, quick, and attentive. I ordered the juevos rancheros skillet and was so excited to dive in that I forgot to snap a photo and I ate the whole thing...worth it. If I have a big day ahead of me, I always come here for a good breakfast and I start the day off right.

Amazing food! I love this place and the environment is amazing the staff is friendly and attentive great location and plenty of places to park if you are looking for a really good breakfast place in Indianapolis look no further than this place, has everything that you could possibly want and more.
Best Breakfast around.   You can get a piece of their delicious French toast in place of toast.

I moved to Indy four years ago and Lincoln Square is still my go-to breakfast restaurant! I've been to three different locations and they're all impressive! Plenty of different breakfast options, my favorite being their southwest skillet. Their omelets are also really fun and tasty, plus they offer gluten free (and regular) pancakes as an option instead of toast! I could eat breakfast for all three meals of the day, and I'd have zero complaints if it was Lincoln Square's breakfast!

Third Lincoln square we've eaten at. 
1) food is better than you'd expect. Omelets made in traditional French style. Eggs are soft and omelet rolled.
2) have always had good service. 
3) always clean. 
4) great coffee. 
5) eggs Benedict was perfect. Sign of a place that knows breakfast.  

Highly recommended.

waffle are cool. 
The food doesn't have a lot of flavor
but the servers are friendly
then the fried biscuits are good. 
overall, the price are fair.

business.name: Aneu Bistro and Wine Bar
business.categories: Restaurants, Food, Farmers Market, Event Planning & Services, Nightlife, Wine Bars, Bars, American (New), Caterers

reviews.text:
Nice atmosphere with white booths and wooden tables, a lot bigger than I originally thought, good prices for a decent breakfast. I ordered the California Benedict and was happy with the twist on a breakfast classic. I will try lunch here sometime too.

Warning: don't make reservations online because they don't go through, make sure to call and follow up to make sure they get your reservation.

Also parking is a nightmare, so plan accordingly.

-- CLOSED --

Now a gringoized Tex -Mex restaurant run by Aneu's management. Don't know why they thought this was a good idea!

Cozy-elegant rustic atmosphere, low noise level, delicious juicy thick pork chop with buttery root vege hash and doting but brisk service. And at the last minute on Xmas eve, what a find.  The bill was a nice surprise too.

The lunch options here are very solid, with a nice selection of sandwiches and pastas.  My chicken salad with grapes and walnuts on wheat berry bread  was creamy, delicious, and refreshing, and the goat cheese and pine nuts ravioli in a cream sauce was a good indulgent lunch treat.  The pasta was tender and it came with plenty of accompanying spinach and sun-dried tomatoes; the sauce was very good but the truffle labor was only so slight.  We also split the truffle fries, which were crispy and fresh and pretty good, and the fried calamari, which was nicely seasoned and served with quick-sautéed peppers, onions, and zucchini slices.  It was crispy but the actual calamari was tender.  The staff here are very friendly and helpful, and prices are fair.  It came to ~$60 for everything, including tax, drinks, and tip.  Most sandwiches are about $10, and the pasta entrees are ~$15-18.  The apps are ~$6-10, depending on what you get.  A great place for a treat during your lunch break.  Will be back for dinner!

Attended a Christening brunch (large party, approx. 50 people) here last Sunday. We were greeted warmly and our drinks were served quickly. The butternut squash soup was flavorful and delicious.The crab and asparagus omelette was wonderful, and was served with thick, multi-grain toast and potatoes O'Brien. The potatoes were very tasty. Although we were a large party, drinks were refilled quickly.  The cake was superb- a moist, fluffy layer cake with raspberry curd filling and buttercream icing. My nephew said they get the cakes from Sweet Jazmine's. Lovely event.
good service, nice ambiance, great food

Walked in post storm for a drop in dinner for three.  The decor is beautiful, service was very good and the food excellent.  The new chef Dave stopped by the table to say hello and check on our meal.  He couldn't have been more gracious. After dealing with no power the Kobe Meatloaf entire and  the Tower of Beat Salad appetizer could not have been better prepared.  Well done.

Had brunch with Mom and nephew today. Quite until the baby shower attendees start tramping through the restaurant, use the side entrance :( My omelette was over cooked and why should a "trendy" place deep fry home fries? No one should! Moms quiche was good, and the nephews granola pancakes were good

Overall Summary: Excellent, Relaxing, Fun, and worth more visits to try the daily menu. 

What I had: Brunch on Mother's Day 

Details: 

Atmosphere: The decor is spectacular. From the dark wood floors, to the exposed brick walls offset by pops of white, and a harmonious blend of wood and metal, all bathed in the right amount of lighting...It's a place where a romantic can tuck away in a quiet corner, business owners can stop in for a drink or meeting, or families dine outside under the canopy. 

Staff: Top notch. The executive chef spent a good amount of time talking with me (unprompted), and everyone working there made you both feel at home, but someone special, at the same time. A rare and unique gift. not pretentious, not fake...just genuine, real care and concern that you have a great time there. 

Food: Brunch was stellar. Again, I can't wait to get back and sample their menu, but everything was fresh, everything was tasty, and yeah, what can I say. I was too busy enjoying the flavors that I forgot to make mental notes of all that was good! 

Drinks: TBD...But their drinks of the day and specials looked excellent and creative. More reasons to come back. 

Price: I felt like it was a win win. Even for a brunch (mothers day), the price was spot on (if anything, under) for the quality of service, food, and experience.
