Parking: TONS (no need to worry about finding a spot). A small parking garage next door, and a lot on the other side of the restaurant. Give this place a shot. Or two. Or three. And have a glass of wine outside on a warm summers evening! 

(and THAT's just the restaurant side of this business.  I can only imagine their catering / event hosting is just as superior!)

Overall Summary: Excellent, Relaxing, Fun, and worth more visits to try the daily menu. 


What I had: Brunch on Mother's Day 

Details: 

Atmosphere: The decor is spectacular. From the dark wood floors, to the exposed brick walls offset by pops of white, and a harmonious blend of wood and metal, all bathed in the right amount of lighting...It's a place where a romantic can tuck away in a quiet corner, business owners can stop in for a drink or meeting, or families dine outside under the canopy. 

Staff: Top notch. The executive chef spent a good amount of time talking with me (unprompted), and everyone working there made you both feel at home, but someone special, at the same time. A rare and unique gift. not pretentious, not fake...just genuine, real care and concern that you have a great time there. 

Food: Brunch was stellar. Again, I can't wait to get back and sample their menu, but everything was fresh, everything was tasty, and yeah, what can I say. I was too busy enjoying the flavors that I forgot to make mental notes of all that was good! 

Drinks: TBD...But their drinks of the day and specials looked excellent and creative. More reasons to come back. 

Price: I felt like it was a win win. Even for a brunch (mothers day), the price was spot on (if anything, under) for the quality of service, food, and experience. 

Parking: TONS (no need to worry about finding a spot). A small parking garage next door, and a lot on the other side of the restaurant. Give this place a shot. Or two. Or three. And have a glass of wine outside on a warm summers evening! 

(and THAT's just the restaurant side of this business.  I can only imagine their catering / event hosting is just as superior!)
Was there for lunch 2 weeks ago with a group. Service was horrendous, food was OK and bathroom trash was OVERFLOWING (and the trash can was a giant hamper). Probably my last visit

I was here two weeks ago for lunch.  This was my third visit to Meredith's new location.   My previous visits were at a similar time during the lunch hour but the restaurant was much busier.  This recent visit found the dining room virtually empty.  In fact, there was no visible staff for the first 7 minutes of entering the restaurant.  A server finally came out from the back and offered to seat me while I waited for my lunch partner.   We placed drink orders and followed it up with our order for salads.  The food arrived within a reasonable amount of time.  The presentation was good and the salads were satisfying.  What left a bad taste in our mouths was the fact that we could not get our server's attention after the salads were dropped off.  It was a very slow day and the server was chatting with the bartender.  There was way too much time from when we finished eating to when we were able to ask for the check.  That can absolutely ruin an otherwise pleasant lunch.

We visited for Thanksgiving dinner.  Made the traditional choices from the menu selection.  The food was perfectly prepared.  The service was great.  Altogether an enjoyable experience.  We will return.

Party of 11 - service was not good!  Even had a problem ordering a drink at the bar while waiting for others to arrive.  Service was very slow especially in bringing the entrees.  Food was o.k. - nowhere as good as the food under Meredith's.  Some of the items on the menu were not available.  Will not be going back again!
This is a wonderful restaurant outside the city. Very good service, great food and a nice atmosphere. Service is slow but well appreciated if you have time to relax. Be sure to try the onion rings.

Went back for the first time in almost a year and had a very good dinner.
Sat outside and had the mussels and duck spring rolls for starters, both were very good. Since we both had the bolognese , which was good, I can't comment on other entree's.  They allow personal wines at a corkage of $7 per bottle, which I think is reasonable, and the bill was only $82 with tax. So, value to price was very good, and would go back again.
Plenty of free parking and they take most plastic.
They also have a full bar and wine list if you don't want to BYO.

My brother & I were invited back after the manager had hired a new chef and really spruced up the menu. I tried the mojito and it was very good with extra lime & mint leaves, was somewhat dry but still a good mojito. We were still reluctant to try the calamari again but we both had the beet & arugula salad which was very well balanced and delicious. Instead of the veggie burger, I tried the veggie wrap with the hummus & feta. The fries were thinner, crispier than I remember which could have used more salt but I am not a huge fan of fries anyway. The veggies in my wrap were done just right in an antipasto-grilled style with a lot of flavor. My brother had the turkey burger of which he was very impressed. Our water never dry, our servers were friendly & attentive. Atmosphere was still Main-Linesque, elegant and well put together. We will definitely be returning to try more of their salads & sandwich options.

went here with another couple to catch up, and wanted to try a new (aneu haha forgive the pun!) place!  glad we chose this one, because it was great and we all enjoyed ourselves! 

first off, the service was awesome!! i can't remember much about our server, except that we were never waiting for anything, never thirsty, and were promptly attended to at all times. 

our food came out in a good time frame, just as we were about to chew off our arms, we were served bread and appetizers.  yum!!!! bruschetta and some sort of pork taco rollup things.  awesome. 

after we finished, dishes were cleared, drinks were filled and we went back to chatting, until woe is us where is dinner- oh wait there it is, right on cue!!   we ordered the meatloaf, filet with truffle fries, gnocchi, and chicken breast.  all of our meals were finished from our plates, as we were enjoying every last drop of food. 

one thing i did notice is that many of the items on the menu have truffle oil or truffles.... did they buy stock in truffle and try to find a way to use it in every dish?? 

after dinner, waitress asked for dessert and coffee (yes please!!) and we paid a big bill for something that was totally worth it.  a 3 course meal for 4 people for less than $200 is not *that* bad. 

definitely a place worth checking out.  the decor is very very nice, it kind of has a modern/old world french feeling.   

we did make reservations (which apparently wasnt necessary at 6:30pm) but the place filled up shortly after.  obviously other poeple got the memo that this place was pretty delish.

I thought this place looked good until I tried the food. The black bean soup came out cold. When I asked them if it was supposed to be cold, they took it back and heated it up. They did not apologize but the server said "I'll take it off the bill" quicker then I could tell him what was wrong. When the meal came the butterfish was way overcooked. The asparagus tasted like dirt. Before I could even tell him what was wrong, the server said "I'll take it off the bill!" The fish left an extremely bad smell. The steak came with fries and spinach. The fries were covered in a sauce which defeats the point of crispy fries. The spinach tasted dirty as well! Had food poisoning the rest of the evening! The food makes you sick! DO NOT GO!

The service was mediocre at best and less than expected for the price. We waited a long time to receive our drinks and had to ask for bread.
Imagine our surpise when the bill came and  the appetizer "special" was $20 which is much higher than the other appetizers.
The entree portions were small but  tasty.
The bread pudding was not very flavorful and spongy. It tasted like it had been microwaved but not thoroughly.
Our waitress was nice but we kept having to track her down.
Overall, do not plan to return.

Way too expensive and not very good- the calamari was more so a calamari salad & the squid was heavily breaded & fried to death. I had the veggie burger, my brother tried a regular burger and we both left feeling gross with grease and oddly not satisfied. Also my water ran dry more than once, not good. With the food out of the way, it was also your typical Mainline-air ambiance, so go here if you fit in with that sort of crowd (paying more so for the environment more than the quality of food.) We meet for lunch every week and we decided never to try it again.

Just had a very expensive uninspired meal. Ordered the valentine day dinner, lousy. Fish portion was so small I could have hid it under my fork. I had to send it back because it was cold. The lamb was not flavorful and the sides included the ingredients of the previous courses on the menu.  
The service was slow but the people were nice. 
The room is very nice. If they could get the kitchen to produce food that tastes as good as the restaurant looks they would have a great place, until then I will pass on it.

Been here for lunch twice recently, service was attentive without being in your face, food was well cooked and seating is generous, table not on top of each other that allow for pleasant conversation without feeling the table next to you is listening to everything you say. Black and blue burger is tasty and cooked to order, fried are delicious. Friends had the wrap, plenty of food, and the special sandwich of the day on foccia bread, nice and soft and again generous portion with a nice salad to go with it.
Decor has changed a little recently, but has a nice atmosphere and is good for a romantic meal or a business meeting.

Awesome restaurant with good - really, excellent - not outstanding, service, and exquisite food.  We arrived there on a reservation made only six hours prior, and were seated immediately.   The modern decor, warm paint and excellent ambiance was pleasing to the eyes.  

We shared a wonderful salad, the grilled butterfish and a special lamb dish, and washed it down with a tasty Pinot Noir.  Everything was superb.  Unfortunately, service was a bit slow.  Still, worth a second visit.

I went to dinner at Aneu with a group of friends this weekend. It was our first time eating there since the name and location change and we were all looking forward to returning as we always had a good experience at the old location. Parking was convenient, they have a free garage that is attached to the building. 

Our first impression walking into the new restaurant was positive; the decor and space was beautiful.  We were promtly seated and our waitress came to take our drink orders but they then took a bit of time to arrive. From there it was downhill. Water glasses weren't filled regularly, we were missing silverware, dinner specials weren't presented and our waitress was generally MIA. 

Apps were fair - calamari was good; truffle fries were soggy.  Salads were dry and served on warm plates.

The gap between salads and entrees being served was at least 20 minutes and we were left waiting with empty drink glasses.  When our dinners arrived there were mixed reviews. One filet was cold and dried out and was sent back. The other entrees arrived luke warm and were served on cold plates.  No one else bothered sending their entrees back, but we all should have. Dessert was fair - nothing exceptional.

What was most disappointing was that 20% service was included for a group of 6. Our service was really bad and we were all left wondering if it was a result of our waitress's automatic tip.  When you're paying $400+ for dinner, you should have the option to leave less gratuity, especially when the food and service were poor.  Had we had a different evening, we would have easily left 20+%! 

So in summary, it was an ok overall experience. Unsure if we'll give Aneu a second chance which is disappointing.

business.name: Dian Xin
business.categories: Dim Sum, Chinese, Restaurants

reviews.text: Ok WOW, so I randomly discovered this place and I kid you know it is my favorite place to eat in the city. Everything on their menu is to die for. The soup dumplings are a smash hit and what they're known for. The green beans are so fire and the chicken and broccoli is the best I've ever had. I mean just everything is great. Every time I've gone, the service has been immaculate. And now they're on Uber eats so I basically order from there 3x a week. 10/10 recommend!!

One of the best Chinese food I've had and I'm from LA. Food was sooo good and tasty. Easy menu, place was really clean and had air conditioning. We made reservations same day and only waited a few minutes. Service was great!! So glad we found this gem in the middle of NOLA!

If you're looking for a change of pace in food, this is the place!!! We joined the waitlist on Yelp, and that process was quick and easy and saved us some time. We were seated promptly. The place is clean and servers were very efficient and accommodating. 
We ordered shu mai, pork/shrimp potstickers, walnut shrimp, wonton soup, shrimp fried rice, and the sautéed broccoli and we were not disappointed!!! It was all very delicious and so flavorful! We will definitely return!

Highly recommend this authentic Szechuan spot. Everything we ordered was delicious but the hot and sour dumpling soup is a MUST. I've never had that anywhere before and it for sure will be a standing order whenever I go back. Also loved the general tso's chicken, shrimp fried rice and dumplings.

We have been here 4-5 times and each time, the food is fantastic. We started with the wonton soup and hot and sour soup and each one was so good. Best i have ever had. Then we had the steamed pork soup dumplings. They were very hot so we had to wait for them to cool a little before we could eat them. For our entrees, we split vegetable fried rice and sizzling steak. Both were excellent. I cannot wait to go back.

Recommend? Yes if you're walking around the French Quarter.

I got the vegetable dumplings, sauteed bok choy, spicy chilled noodle bowl, and stir fried noodles in XO sauce. Everything was vegan.

Vegetable dumplings were good. Adequately stuffed and a one biter.

Sauteed bok choy are always perfect. Leaves were tender, but the stems retained their crunch. Exactly as I like. I always get bok choy when it's on the menu. I find it to be a great palate refresher.

Spicy chilled noodle bowl had a tang to it. Very refreshing. Light in flavor. Add extra chili oil to kick that spicy level up a few notches. Overall great to accompany the heavier items.

Stir fried noodles in XO sauce. Saucy, but not greasy and heavy like American Chinese takeout. Also not as flavorless like Panda Express. Packed full of veggies.

I cannot recommend this place enough. The stewed beef crepe... chefs kiss. The sizzling garlic shrimp....double chefs kiss. The soup dumplings; just as good as China town in NYC. We ate everything so we couldn't even take a picture of the AMAZING food. Go. Just go.
Extremely great authentic Chinese food. Honestly the best Chinese food I've had in NOLA. Seasoned well and came out fresh and hot. Pretty small restaurant but honestly worth the wait.

Looking for something different to eat while in the French Quarter...well you found it!!  Dian Xin is located on Decatur Street with the restaurant being on the smaller side but the food & service far exceeded our expectations.  Be sure to jump on the Yelp app and get your reservation as we found that was the perfect way to score a table while joining the waitlist for this HOT spot!!

Once we were notified of our reservation we were warmly greeted, sat at our table and immediately given our place setting, offered drinks and went over the menu plus our server suggested some GREAT options.  We went with the following for our exploration of the tasty menu for that night:  
Jianbing- Chinese Style Crepes; Xiao Long Bao; Steamed Pork Bao; Salt and Pepper Squid; Wonton with Spicy Sauce

Everything was absolutely AMAZING from start to finish to include service and ambience!! We highly recommend putting this on your MUST eat here...Dian Xin was yummilicious and we enjoyed every bite!!

WHOA. Bartender recommended this spot and it did NOT disappoint! Got the hot dumpling soup and the broth was possibly the best liquid I've ever tasted - I would bathe in it. Ended up ordering another bowl and that was it. I assume the rest of the food must be good but can't say because I didn't want anything besides the soup.

I found Dian Xin for brunch. I was looking for Chinese dim sum with the carts but I wasn't let down with this choice. 

The restaurant isn't that large but it packs a big punch. It's well decorated with loads of plants and pictures of items on the menu and the service is great. 

We ordered so many dishes. We enjoyed all of things we chose. My favorite had to be the Xiaolongbaos (soup dumplings), the Popcorn Chicken and the Broccoli. The nibblings loved the food and ate to their hearts desire. 

We will be coming back on our next visit to New Orleans. 



Dian Xin
1218 Decatur St
New Orleans, LA 70116


(Review 633 overall and  177 in 2021)

Soooooo good! Just came here for some dumplings, so good ended up ordering two soup dumplings and an ordered of steamed chicken dumpling. Very delicious especially when adding the chili oil! Definitely a change from the other food we were eating in New Orleans.!

This hard to get into Asian spot is worth the wait! If you time it right, you don't have to wait - but if you do - it is well worth it. You absolutely MUST order the soup dumplings!!! Every item on the menu is very tasty - elevated above what you are expecting. The service is good, but needs a little more attentiveness. If you are walking by, and a table is available - grab it while you can!
This place is a gem! Everything we have tried has been delicious ! I look forward to going just about every weekend now.

Six of us just had lunch at Dian Xin and the food was delicious! We ordered  Xian Long Bao, the Spicy wontons, the Vegetarian Bao, the Szechuan Chicken, the Blackened Beef, Pork Fried Rice and Oolong Tea. The food was served fast, the baos were steaming and everything was incredibly tasty. We all enjoyed every bite!
Thoughtful Asian restaurant. The dumplings are wonderful and there are many healthy vegetable dishes.

This is a 5 star rating because authentic Chinese fare in New Orleans isn't what I was expecting, but here we are.  I have had similar meals in NYC but when Chas said he found a Bao spot that was the real deal, I was honestly skeptical.  I was wrong.  I'll eat that crow...and nearly anything on this menu.

We ordered the Pan Fried Dumplings, Xiao Long Bao, Crabmeat and Crawfish Bao, and the Chicken Jian bing.  Definitely will be back to try out some more of the bao and jian bing selections as well as some of the char siu.

The pan fried dumplings had a nice hard crust on one side and a doughy exterior to the other side.  Exactly what you look for in an authentic fried dumpling.  The pork filling was excellent...rich and savory and was such a nice bite.  

The Crabmeat and Crawfish Bao was clearly one of their offerings honoring the area while still staying true to their own history.  This was a very good dumpling and had I not tasted anything else here, it would have been good enough for me to come back again.  With that said, it was my least favorite item we ordered.

The Xiao Long Bao was incredible.  This flavor rivaled the ones i've gotten in NYC and were for sure a true testament to Shanghainese cuisine.  The broth inside was extremely flavorful and the meat was so tender and moist.  I could have eaten 3 orders of these myself, and I may someday.  Don't judge me.

The Jian Bing was exactly what I hoped it would be.  Basically similar to a very thin omelet or a crepe, this was stuffed with chicken and chinese vegetables and it was fantastic.  We had a plan to Shanghai that got cancelled (thanks covid) but I watched so many videos of people grabbing these from street food vendors and I had such a longing to try it.  To say I was happy is an extreme understatement.  I'd order this again many many more times.

All at affordable prices, this can't be stated enough...Dian Xin in New Orleans, Louisiana - Didn't Suck!

I LOVE CHINESE FOOD!

But I hate driving in the quarter which is why I have decided to dock off a star.

Overall good tasting food. My favorite items are the soup dumpings and chili chicken. Would probably order togo from now on instead of dining in

Highly recommend. The staff were incredibly kind, quick and helpful. Food was delicious. I was dining with two of my vegetarian friends, one who eats seafood and the other who doesn't. There are not a lot of options for vegetarians who don't eat seafood in NOLA. This place had tons of options, more than expected. And my friends loved everything they ate, including vegetarian Kung Pow chicken. We ordered the jianbing which I'd never had or heard of before and it was really great. Definitely worth trying. The menu has a lot of variety and options. We were so happy to have stopped here.

The service was fast and friendly. Then there was the food. It was amazing! This is a must stop if you are able to. Schezuan beef and griddled cabbage were so flavorful. And the Beef Chow Fun was also delicious.

Wow. Needed a break from the heavy Creole dishes and decided on Chinese. Was NOT expecting to find this calibur of Chinese food in the French Quarter. This place is authentic and one of the best Chinese restaurants I have eaten at- Traditional soup dumplings were outstanding as well as the fried rice with XO sauce. Looking forward to visiting again next time.

So soo sooo gooood! Great vegetarian options on a secret menu- just ask your server. I recommend the sesame fake chicken for something simple, and the Kung Pao for more spice and veggies. The garlic bok choy is amazing with the black vinegar provided on the table. Don't forget to order dumplings at the start of the meal, as they can take a while because they are handmade to order.

Matthew McConaughey's Voice: Alright alright alright, let's talk about the best Chinese food in New Orleans. This isn't the middle of the mall food court stuff, this is the real deal Holyfield of Chinese cuisine. Authentic as can be, they make a delicious soup dumpling, amazing noodle dishes, and a special Chinese crepe. So this is where it's at & this is what we recommend and usually get: Crabmeat/Crawfish Soup Dumplings, XiaoLongBao, Spicy Chilled Noodles, & Spicy Wontons... don't forget your veggies, can't go wrong with any of them!!

@phidingthefam

Stop reading this and just go!! Seriously, do it! This place is the best- food, atmosphere and service. I've been a handful of times now but want to make it a weekly treat because the food is soooooooooo good. From my experience you can't go wrong with anything but the soup dumplings, fried wontons and honey chicken are all exceptional bets!! Last time I tried their crab rangoon and that was good too. I highly recommend trying their chili sauce as well. If you're still reading just go in and try it... you'll definitely leave happy!

We weren't sure what we wanted for dinner and happened to wander by this place. Oh my goodness, I'm so glad we did. We ordered the crabmeat & crawfish bao along with the stir fried noodles. Absolutely delicious! I will definitely be back.

business.name: Street Side
business.categories: Restaurants, Vietnamese

reviews.text: Authentic Vietnamese! I always get the shrimp vermicelli. This place is great for when you're on the go, it's quick and delicious.

A bit disappointed by the local restaurant. I had hopes and brought out my housemate to check this place out. I love finding local gems and supporting it.
My housemates got banh mi and I got pho. I switched my order to pho last minute because it was cold outside. Unfortunate mistake. It was just ok. small portions and not memorable. We had other orders and nothing was really memorable.

Thankfully, I've seen others come by to order or pickup while we were there so glad they still have lot of customers and so maybe it was just us that wasn't quite satisfied.

Unfortunately, I'm sure not sure if we'll be back. Hoping best for this little hole in the wall.

This was my favorite Pho spot for a while, but the last two takeout orders have been disappointing. We've been receiving less and less broth with our pho orders, especially when we order extra pho on the side. I love the broth here, which is why I order extra. It seems like the "extra" I order is just taken from the original containers  Will definitely be checking out other locations spots.. I thought I found my go-to Pho spot but am going to reconsider.

I really don't want to be a hater, but pork belly Bahn mi is not something that should exist. I ordered through Uber rags or one of those so I don't know if it makes a difference but when I got it it was cold and just slimy. Cold pork belly tastes like some kind of putrid fish bait. And the texture, god don't get me started on the texture. It was grotesque. I'm not sure if it's served cold in the restaurants but it was delivered cold to me and rendered inedible. I had a cucumber sandwich for dinner that night. 
I want to try them again as I am a big Bahn mi fan so I'll reserve a star for potential, but my first experience was pretty gross if I'm being honest.

Yummy! It's hard to find- had to circle around a couple of times. Aye. But the donuts & banh mi were delicious. I had pork belly, someone else had chicken & coconut shrimp. All were gobbled quickly.    The smashed cucumbers were- meh. The flavor wasn't balanced. The edamame with the alleged "viet crack"- hardly had any on it & it doesn't stick to the edamame, so, that was also - meh. I've been twice already, will definitely be back!
The banh mi was delicious, the service was quick and courteous, and I didn't even have to go inside to pick up my takeout order.
The food is pretty good, but the guy answering the phone sucks. He hates his job no doubt. He's not friendly and has gotten my order wrong a couple times now.

Decided to get take out from this little service window spot and it was awesome! I definitely would stop by for food and even drinks! The banh mi fries were delicious. I like the sauce so much! The banh mi was a nice twist with the coconut shrimp. The rice paper rolls were delicious with the peanut sauce. The drinks were really good! I had the joyride and sun worshipper.

Love this spot dearly - awesome Lemongrass chicken hoagie that always lasts me two-ish meals. Great vermicelli bowls, banh mi fries and Pho. Dude at the window forgets my sriracha and hoisin every time so ask for some at the window before you leave. The girls never have - they always nail it. Thank you Streetside for all you do.

Don't pass up this hole in the wall on Girard! It's easy to miss if you're driving by, but if you happen to see it give it a try. 

Their Chicken Bahn Mi is substantial and super tasty. I ate half for dinner and ate the other half the next day. Bread and filling ratio is perfect! 
Also tried the Bahn Mi Fries and it was cleverly executed! Most times when you get loaded fries, the fries get soggy and not that appealing. These fries were either double fried or fried for a little bit longer so they could hold up to the toppings. They're addictive and crispy!
If you are looking for clean, tasty, healthy food please try street side. Amazing clean pho and vermicelli!

Love this place..when in doubt I always run by to Street Side grab a tofu Bahn mi and chicken spinach dumplings. Never go wrong with it and is perfect meal for my appetite. Accepting credit card, cash and venmo. Would highly recommend to order ahead of time by calling in as the orders could take a while.
I've been ordering take out quite often. The pho is great and affordable. I've also tried the Bahn mi and rolls. Love it all.
Great as usual. Their Bahn mi is fantastic. The fries are great too. Service was quick and friendly. They have a pickup window to make it easy to get your food safely.

Food: 1/5
Price: 5/5
Service: 3/5

Ordered the beef skewers, pork belly vermicelli, and lemongrass chicken vermicelli. Total was only $22.41!!! Amazing deal for the amount quantity!!

But, the food was a bit disappointing. The beef skewer ($7) had little to no lemongrass and no flavor other than soy. Most viet places would season it really well and all the seasoning would appear on the meat itself. If I had to rate it, the beef was actually the best out of the three.

The lemongrass chicken vermicelli has no lemongrass flavor at all. It looked like boiled chicken with maybe a bit of soy sauce. Definitely did not expect to have lemongrass chicken without the taste or smell of lemongrass. 

The classic pork belly vermicelli was what I expected. Boiled pork belly over some noodles and vegetables. The noodle is over cooked, broken into very very small pieces. The vegetables were old and soggy. Usually raw carrot shred and cut cucumber are crisp and delicious, but the ones in both dishes were soft and soggy. Not fresh. 

Overall, I would only come here for a quick cheap meal. If you have more time, head to Chinatown or south Philly for better Vietnamese food.
I love street side for their vegan/vegetarian options. The tofu banh mi, mushroom pho, and tofu wraps are all great and for a great price.

3.5 stars rounding down. 

Ordered the tofu vermicelli, mushrooms dumplings, pickled veggies and Thai milk tea. 

The best by far were the dumplings. They were light and had strong flavor. The rest was so so good but average good. 

The pickled veggies are veggies dipped in a vinegar sauce. Not worth the side in my opinion.

Really glad this place is nearby and happy with the price point. The customer service is on point and their menu selection is pretty great.

I had high expectations based on how many positive reviews there were but if you are someone who has had Vietnamese food in various parts of philly or even just Chinatown it's very easy to have bias and realize that while it wasn't pricey food there are other places that give better value for similar cost. Overall veggies provided (bean sprouts and in the banh mi) could have been fresher as it felt soggy and lacking in flavor. For the chicken pho the chicken was oddly cut but overall I wish they just provided more protein in the soup. For the banh mi it was a very thick bread and as a result it made the contents feel dry and minimal. Maybe if they hollowed out the bread or added more filling it would have been more satisfying. On the positive side the server was really nice and the place was very comfortable and cute so if you are going to order here it's nicer to sit in.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in the area! The food is delicious and very affordable. I highly recommend the house slaw and the veggie pho but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I have a soy allergy and they are always so thorough and accommodating. For anyone else who's soy allergic- there are many options here! The decor is quirky and adorable, the staff is great, and it's BYO!

Extremely affordable, tasty, fresh food! Can't find pho anywhere else that is this good and for this price. The vermicelli bowls are also great for a light, healthy meal. I often order takeout, but they're also a BYO which makes it a fun place to bring friends. One of my go-to's!

Ordered the pork and chive dumplings as well as the pork belly banh mi for delivery through Grub Hub. Had been meaning to try Street Side for a while, so a lazy day off seemed like the perfect opportunity to do so. The dumplings were AWESOME - there were so many flavors in there and they really hit the spot. The pork belly banh mi was also delicious, but the pork belly was WAY too fatty for my liking (and I realize pork belly is supposed to be fatty, but I mean chunks of it). Either way, I trimmed it down a bit and it was delicious. I imagine it's even better when you eat at the restaurant since take-out is never as good, but I would definitely hit up Street Side again! Plus, the prices are super reasonable!
Super cute little spot. It's not the best pho I have ever tasted. But it's pretty damn good. And you can't beat the price. Probably the best price for pho I ever seen. Great for take out too.

Been there twice. Love their dumplings, rolls (fresh and fried), pho, and noodle dishes. Veggie and with meat or shrimp.  Great Vietnamese coffee!
Pleasant staff. Quiet.  Affordable.

In a world of #shortcuts, I cannot tell you how excited I am to stumble upon this adorable Vietnamese Cafe @streetsideshop where everything about this spot is humble, simple and delicious! kudos to the chefs behind this simple, street food centered menu on all things Vietnam. #NOMSG #chickenbahnmi #chickenpho #summerrolls #yum #vietnamesecuisine #thatbreadthough

It's not the best banh mi in philly (shout out fu wah)--BUT-- it's probably my favorite in our neighborhood and an amazing deal for the price. Walk in here with $6 and you're set. There's a lot of great banh mi spots in philly and Street Side is definitely worth keeping in the rotation.

business.name: Nora's
business.categories: Restaurants, Delis

reviews.text:
I've had this review in my unfinished drafts for two years now and felt like now is the time to share just how much I loved Nora's! The cold turkey and provolone sandwich was the bomb, and it was not uncommon for me to go to Nora's once a week for this sandwich.  
Nora's, you will be missed!!
Best sandwiches in town! Everything was great! I am still thinking about the smokin turkey and party potato soup! Please come back! Dogtown is not the same without Noras! Bring Noras Back!

Good sandwiches! The Big Bad Wolf mabe should be big, hence the name. Sides are good as well. My girlfriend had the Turkey she said it didn't have a lot of flavor, mabe they could add something to it to get a little more flavor. The bread was great! I will be back though. The bad wolf sandwich is good!
Great little and locally owned shop. They fixed up my sandwich and it was delicious and service was with a smile. Recommend!!!

Nora's is such a little hidden treasure. The sandwiches are absolutely phenomenal! I've tried a few of them and have never ever been disappointed. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and can't wait to go back once the world opens up again! Side note: the gluten free bread is actually super good too and as a celiac, I have never been sick after eating here. I would give them more than 5 stars if I could, that's how great it is!
Great little place. I had the veggie melt on gluten free bread and it really hit the spot!

I love this place. It's a small friendly sandwich shop just off the beaten track in Dogtown. Good sandwiches and good salads too. The weird thing about my most recent experience a few months ago was that I went on a Sunday afternoon and they had to close early because they ran out of bread. Huh...a sandwich shop runs out of bread, lol. I was happy to have ordered mine before the shortage!

Came with my wife and 2.5 yr old. The woman behind the counter was very friendly and patient. I had the Big Bad Wolf, my wife had the Smokin' Turkey, and we got the kids grilled cheese with a juice. All sandwiches came with a side (we got chips, kid got apple sauce). Sandwiches came out quick, with the grilled cheese coming first (a nice gesture for anyone dining with kids). I tried all the sandwiches, the Big Bad Wolf was best. I would order it again. The turkey was a little bland, but still alright. I know there's not much to a grilled cheese, but it was very bland and didn't keep the kids attention long. She can be pretty picky though. The bread was really delicious, soft, and fresh. All in all, I enjoyed it and will likely return. My wife wasn't too thrilled with it.
The sandwich was delicious but the restaurant was filthy! The bathroom was so dirty- mold in the toilet! Behind the register full of boxes and dirty. The tables were dirty... yikes!

Loved the Cuban and the tomato bisque.  Their chips were awesome too- best salt n vinegar chips I've ever had.  Groupon brought me in but I'll definitely come back.  Great customer service, didn't have to wait long.

The absolute best gluten free sandwich I have ever had. I am a regular here and highly recommend it for all people! I have brought numerous friends to this place and they all love it as well. I highly recommend this place.

My wife and I had a great experience here. My wife can't have gluten, and they have gluten free bread, so that was awesome. I had the For Pete's Sake, and it was one of if not the best deli sandwich I've ever had. The perfect amount of everything! The chips were pretty good as well. Service from the lady st the counter was awesome too. She was very sweet to us and the other customers.

Solid deli.  I had the Rueben and I thought it was pretty good.  The potato salad was so/so.  My buddy got the roast beef dip.  He thought the meat was over cooked/dry and really needed the au jus, which was odd since I had just read reviews that the sandwich stood on its own without the au jus.  The brought my sandwich out fairly quickly and the. My buddies sandwich took a long time to come out.  That was odd too, but I really appreciated  the gentleman working brought us a $5 off our next visit because of the wait.  It really wasn't needed but it was a nice touch showing they care about customer service.  I look forward to coming back cause I think they have potential to get a 4th star from me, but this visit was a 3 star visit.

A great little gem in Dogtown area.  Cute space, friendly service. Exceptionally fresh ingredients! Bread is amazing and meats are tender and fresh. We had the For Pete's Sake and the Dogtown sub. Favorite side is the sweet and tangy cole slaw!!
I loved the Qubano!! Great little place. All 3 sandwiches we ordered were delicious, including my child's pb&j!
Picked up sandwiches for a picnic and honestly the Tomato Reuben may be the best sandwich I've ever had...messy in the most delicious way.

Only came here once and I ordered a House salad it was delicious. The vegetables tasted so fresh that when you take a bit into the latuce you could taste the water. Also service was great and brought our food right away this place is great for any occasion and I personally recommend it.

I think I dream about Nora's sandwiches about every other week. 

A friend took me one day because I said I had never been. I wasn't hungry on the way there, but once I stepped in I could not wait to eat. I got a hot smokin' turkey with salt & vinegar chips. The staff were very friendly and very quick. We got in just before the lunch crowd started to arrive, so that worked out well. 

The sandwich was the perfect amount of hot with melted cheese and not too many red peppers. I don't know where they get their turkey from, but it's making my mouth water right now. I think this might be the best sandwich place in St. Louis. I have been back about 5 or 6 times since then and am thinking about when I can go back again!

I moved to Dogtown last year and have been frequenting Nora's ever since. Nora's is a small sandwich shop with fast service, friendly staff, and phenomenal food. Here's what I know:
The potato salad is good, but mustard forward.
The best sandwich I've had is still the smoked chicken salad sandwich.
The Reuben is good, but I could always use more dressing :)
I always get the sour cream and onion chips as a side.
They have some fun daily specials so check out their website before you go to see what you might get. 
There is outdoor seating in the back if you want a patio experience.
I've honestly never been disappointed by the food here and it's our go to lunch spot these days. 
ALLLSOOO, I'm gluten free and you can get GF bread which means I can have most of the sandwiches.

Seriously THEE BEST sandwiches in STL.  Love these guys.  Never stop what you're doing, cause you're doing it right!

#onelove

Plain and simple the best sandwich shop in St. Louis.  The Italian sandwich shops on The Hill are great, but this has something special to it.  Not a bad sandwich on the menu, but my personal recommendations are in order; Big Bad Wolf, Tam Ave Turkey, The Dip (any of them are incredible).

Don't do yelp reviews often, which should speak to this reviews significance.  I rarely pick up my phone when at a restaurant and review it.  However, after my umpteenth visit (honestly close to 250), I felt some drive to write a review.

The place is cozy.  The service was terrific.  The sandwich was cooked perfectly.  The chicken dumpling soup was tasty, the dumplings were big and many of them.   Great place.

On street parking.
I had the hangover sandwich. Best sandwich I ever ate. Really. I'm a first timer at Nora's. The staff was Very friendly also

My husband and I were in search of a new lunch spot on a Saturday, ideally a new sandwich place! We chose Nora's and will definitely be back. The sandwiches, served warm, were huge and delicious. I had one of their turkey options and the broccoli and cheese soup and potato salad, which was just okay. Great neighborhood spot!

On first impression, 5/5.  Friendly service and so many choices.  The pictures on Yelp were enough to sell me, made me so hungry looking through em.  Through a simple mistake, the au jus for my Dip roast beef sandwich was inadvertently left out of my to-go order (they say they'll fix it next time I'm in), but a kinda fortunate mistake cuz without the au jus, I thought it would be so bland and dry and just taste like plain bread and meat.  But I was impressed how much flavor that bread and meat had on their own, and I may never have noticed otherwise.  I'll still prefer my au jus, but knowing how well seasoned the roast beef is and the perfect texture and freshness of the bread, I know it's not your ordinary dip Sandwich and i look forward to going back and having that again along with several other menu items.

House salad with balsamic 5/5
Pickle 5/5
Chicken and rice soup 4/5 (I kinda like Panera's just a little more than this one)
Friend had the Dogtown from the cold menu heated and loved it.

business.name: Los Aztecas
business.categories: Mexican, Restaurants

reviews.text: Great Mexican food!  My daughter and I stopped in on a whim and were so glad we did.  Chips and salsa very tasty.  I had a huge burrito with steak and my daughter requested a special rice and beans combo which they happily did.  Ordered some additional guacamole and YUM.  Will definitely come back!  Wish the wait staff wasn't sitting in an empty booth but seeing as how the food was hot and delicious, it was a pleasant meal.  Definitely recommend.

It may be located in a strip mall, but don't let the blocked off windows dissuade you from trying it out. This is a bona fide Mexican restaurant, and I say that having lived in San Diego and LA for several years. I've been going there for over 10 years now. It is run by a family and I've watched it get upgraded over the years, adding brightly painted hand carved bench seating. which shows their commitment to the biz. The complimentary salsa is freshly made, and good! Most dishes are sizable. I recommend the burritos Azteca or Deluxe, chicken mole, crab meat tacos, Pancho special, or any fajitas. If you order a dish with rib eye steak, keep in mind it may have 1-2 pieces with gristle -- this is common with rib eye and not a reflection of poor quality. Service is polite if not friendly. The focus is more on the food than the ambiance. BYOB. You will walk away feeling satisfied!
Simply excellent Mexican food, No frills quality food at reasonable prices

I love this place. It's set up like a Chinese restaurant so it's a bit surprising when you walk in but after that, it's pretty authentic Mexican. I had the Jefe Especial and it was amazing. The sides of sour cream are very generous, the rice is good, the chicken in the quesadilla was perfectly seasoned, there was a lot of beef in the chimichanga and the queso on top combined with the crunch of the fried tortilla was absolute heaven. Highly recommend. The service was quick and the servers don't linger, which i like.
This is not mexican food. They use ground beef  unless you're making albondigas (meatballs), real Mexicans don't use ground beef in their dishes.

Nothing to write home about... 

My wife and I just moved to the area and wanted to find a good Mexican restaurant that was more authentic versus a chain restaurant. We stumbled upon Los Aztecas and wanted to give it a shot, but that was a mistake. 

Location: The restaurant is located in a busy shopping center with ample parking. The inside is older and could use some updating, but very typical for a Mexican restaurant. 

Food: The food was just ok, nothing special. I got the tacos, which came out in less than 2 minutes after ordering. The chips and salsa were good with the perfect amount of salt. I'm assuming it's due to Covid, but I was given plastic silverware and my food was delivered in a metal pan - not really what I expected though. 

Other observations: the restaurant was completely empty, but a lot of the employees used the first couple of booths to hang out in, which to me doesn't seem like a great business model. There were also two kids running around the restaurant, which to me was extremely unprofessional as this place is very small. 

I wish we would have read the reviews prior to eating at this restaurant. We will not be returning or recommending this restaurant. I truly hope the owners read these reviews from all of their customers and take action - you have a gold mine if you can just fix a few issues.
When you pull up it looks a little questionable in the shopping center but it is some of the best & most authentic mexican food around. 10/10 would recommend

From the one time I took my family to eat here was before this whole pandemic started and I was not impressed beans were dry, rice was hard and our food just wasn't up to par who knows maybe after all this is over they can make some changes for the better. We will wait and see.

I'm not much on Mexican but this place is by far way better than most places around. Better than any place in Royersford, Limerick, Collegeville, Trappe. Best for miles around. Don't miss this opportunity!

We love mexican food and was recommended this spot. It's ok, we'll have to give a try and order something else different from here.   The wife got the beef tacos and i got the carne asade burrito with rice and beans. The wife said her tacos were pretty good. My burrito wasn't bad but it wasn't out of this world. The little one got the chicken tenders with fries. Their complementary chips were hot and fresh, very good but the salsa was blended up like a sauce. It was flavorful but wasn't chunky, all preference.
Very good, authentic Mexican food as well as some Americanized favorites. Very friendly staff and family atmosphere. Beautifully painted, artistic tables

I'm in Pottstown a lot for sports and I'm tired of all the chain places. This caught my eye while sitting at a red light. It's in a shopping plaza with a WalMart so easy to miss. My daughter & I tried it for dinner and it was amazing food. Huge menu, friendly staff (seems family owned), portions big enough to take home for lunch and free chips and salsa when you sit down. It's BYOB, not sure if you can reserve. It was very packed on a Friday dinner. We will definitely be back.

The food is authentic delicious Mexican. However it lacks greatly in the customer service area. After we were essentially abandoned at a booth after a shift change we vowed only to do takeout. That leads me to my most recent disappointing experience, another customer and I stood at the front waiting to pick up our orders and waited for over 10 minutes without seeing any of the employees. We heard people in the kitchen talking and messing around, when she finally came out it was another 10 minutes for her to bring my food out when I had called 45 minutes prior given a estimated 15 minutes.

Great flavors. Amazing service. Really unique environment. I had to go to Pottstown the other day on business. I was astounded at the number of chain or chain inspired restaurants. It came down to this place and the King Buffet, which is right next-door, which also had some good reviews. I chose Los Aztecas and I was not disappointed. The food was authentic, so if you're used to chipotle or Cal Tort, this may not be your jam. But if you know what real Mexican food tastes like, this was perfect. It's pretty far from my house, but I might go up there just to eat at Los Azteca's so if you do, and I think you should, tell 'em Big Texas sent you.

Good food for the price.  Don't get the fish tacos.  I expected a piece of fish with some fresh veggies.  Nope, it's like shredded fish with veggies mixed in.  Also, every time I have ordered anything with ground beef it tastes like the bottom of the pan got burned.  Chicken enchiladas are the way to go.

Stumbled upon this place while in PA. It's a small quiet restaurant..well when we went. They gave free chips and dip but we asked for some cheese on the side. The cheese was sooooo goood! The food here came out pretty fast and it definitely had an amazing taste. Super authentic. I would recommend this place to anyone around the area. The prices were super reasonable also.

Well, where do I begin?  You see the five stars up there, I wish there was six.  I've traveled to Mexico many times over the years and have lived internationally where I've had a lot of Mexican cuisine.  Los Aztecas is quite simply the best Mexican food I've ever had.  When I ordered, I asked to have my plate "as the chef would have it for himself/herself". If you are anywhere near Pottstown PA and you appreciate traditional Mexican Cuisine, get here.

Stumbled upon this place while in PA. It's a small quiet restaurant..well when we went. They gave free chips and dip but we asked for some cheese on the side. The cheese was sooooo goood! The food here came out pretty fast and it definitely had an amazing taste. Super authentic. I would recommend this place to anyone around the area. The prices were super reasonable also.

The best Mexican in the area. They are consistently quick and the food is always delicious. The super fajita quesadilla is my go to and you can't go wrong with the table chips and salsa. I love this place!!

Los Aztecas is a tough review for me - very tasty food but not very clean and the venue a bit tacky.  The starting chips and salsa were very good, not the tasteless fair you can get at other similar establishments.  My wife ordered lunch special #4 (Chile relleno, rice and beans, $7.50) and declared it great!  She knows as this is her favorite Mexican food.  As this was our first time, she was not sure that would be enough (it was) so she ordered a side beef tamale that she didn't like.  I thought OK but not great.  I ordered the Burro de casa lunch ($8.95) that was great!  It's a burrito filled with grilled chicken (or steak) and vegetables, topped with melted white cheese, and served with refried beans (or rice).  However, while I was trying to enjoy the food, my eyes kept being drawn to the food and sauce spattered on the wall right next to us.  Maybe the whole place is not like that but this was our first time and was what we saw. So, we will probably give it another try, given the good food.  However, if it seems as dirty next time, we'll not be back.
Food was terrible, expensive and sloppy. All of the food was watered down. I try not to give negative reviews,but if u want AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD go to #3Brothersgrill
We just moved to the area and looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant. Look no further!! This has to be one of the best places we have ever eaten. We found our go to place to eat!
This is my favorite Mexican food place around. Great price, great service, great food. The cheesy crab dip is the best appetizer, and the enchiladas are great too

Los Aztecas has to be one of Pottstown's secrets with regard to restaurant eating. Considering that it is surrounded my fast food locations & Walmart (as well as having current construction around it), this venue is almost one that you can pass right by it. 

The decor is fairly standard for a Hispanic restaurant, and very clean. You'll be served with homemade chips that are light to the touch, and mild salsa. Only one choice of salsa here, not several. No cervezas (beer) or other alchohol here, which is kind of a bummer.

I ordered the Vallarta Special, which is an assortment of shrimp, fish, & rice. It is served with a side if garden salad and ranch dressing. If I had the choice to change dressing, it would be with anything but the ranch. The ranch just wasn't good on this night, which spoiled the garden salad. The remaining entree portion certainly made up for it, given that I couldn't finish it. Don't let the medium-sized portion fool you- the Vallarta Special is certainly filling! Its definitely worth the nourishment, of which I think is the best overall value that Los Aztecas has to offer. 

Customer service is really good here, so be sure to tip well. The food was so good that you'll more than likely skip breakfast.

As I've said in the past, this is the best restaurant in the area that has a great accommodating Mexican vegetarian menu. There is about seven or eight vegetarian options, however you can always order something else on the menu and requested to be vegetarian in nature and the staff is very accommodating and providing it for you. As a celiac who is also vegetarian the options I have and eating food here are great, and I order take out quite often!

business.name: Fountain Grill - Safety Harbor Resort and Spa
business.categories: Mediterranean, Restaurants

reviews.text:
The spa is great! Friendly staff. The only thing that's not great is the food. 

I would definitely visit the Spa again. The area is beautiful.
What can I say for 20+ years the Spa has struggled. The restaurant is not a place to go.Mediocre food at best and consistent poor service. Sorry.

First off this place is in need of a major update, it looks as if it never left the 90's. Fortunately I was given a gift card to come here and didn't have to spend my own money on this experience. Everything seemed to be broken, the locker room smelled terrible I was scared to even take my flip flops off because of how dirty it was. Went to get a pedicure, which was laughable because nothing worked and they where practically out of nail polish colors. Had lunch in that outdated dining room. I decided to order a burger because I was too afraid too get anything else. I specifically told my server what I didn't want on my burger and I requested a sweet tea. She brought out the exact opposite and no sweet tea.... The massage I received was decent but I definitely wont be back. I'm surprised this place is still open and people actually come here.

Probably not the best place for vegans, but still a nice option for a pandemic friendly lunch.

There is a pretty good sized outdoor seating area in front of the restaurant, which is nice since I'm still avoiding eating indoors. They were pretty busy on a Saturday at 12:30 p.m. You can tell everyone who is there for their spa, since they're wearing white robes (like my friend was). 

Luckily, not many people want to sit outside (it's Florida, who would blame them), so we easily got a table. Our waiter was pretty swamped, but he ended up comping our mojitos, which was super nice. The mojito was pretty strong, so I enjoyed it.

Since I'm dairy free for my breastfeeding son, I went the safe route and looked for a vegan option. There's only one on the menu so that made it easy for me. I am impressed that they denote options that are GF, Vegetarian and Vegan. 

The Vegetarian option is the Vegetable Stir Fry. I added shrimp, since I'm not vegan, just dairy free. It was pretty good, but if I wasn't dairy free I wouldn't get it again. It is very sauce heavy. It is very filling though so I definitely didn't walk away hungry.

Overall I do really enjoy this place/atmosphere which is why it's on my rotation of places to lunch with friends!

Staying at the Safety Harbor Resort & Spa in mid August 2021, we'd tried to get an appetizer early Saturday evening but our attire of spa robes were not allowed after 5pm. Luckily, we found the lobby bar more welcoming with a small appetizer menu. So our first and only visit to Fountain Grill on this weekend was Sunday morning... and yes, in our spa robes! We sat outside facing the street and enjoyed the overcast morning. 

The Bay Breeze resort package that we'd reserved was supposed to include a breakfast buffet for every night of our stay, per the Safety Harbor Resort & Spa website. However, we were informed that the package "buffet breakfast" was substituted with the Traditional Breakfast at Fountain Grill (menu: $11), or we could receive an $8 credit for another breakfast entree, or get $8 toward the Sunday Brunch Buffet (~$36). 

I enjoyed my breakfast and it seemed worth $11, in spite of the misrepresentation with our package. To be completely honest, I was delightfully stunned with the excessive amount of bacon I was served! But, first, our server was confused about which plate was mine & which was my friend's when bringing out our food - the only difference was how our eggs were cooked. And still, my friend had to send her plate back because neither pair of eggs were medium well (both of ours had been cooked over-easy). Then her replacement eggs were still not correctly cooked but our server was incredibly indifferent & dismissive, so my friend ate around the uncooked yolks. 

To top off the lackluster service, we were charged a mandatory gratuity of $2.50 apiece... which our server did not earn nor appreciate. In fact, I found her to be one of the most lackadaisical servers I've ever encountered - she was completely disinterested in serving my friend correctly-cooked eggs, probably because she knew she was getting that tip regardless of her efforts. At least coffee was included, and it was outstanding.
We ordered breakfast, everything was fine until we found a long hair embedded in my wife yogurt plate. Disgusting. We just left.
A great place for lunch, or after a spa treatment. The update by new owners is telling.

A friend of mine and I walk nearly every morning in safety Harbor and had been stopping at the Fountain Grill at least two times a week for breakfast. They used to have a waitstaff that was proficient and available. Now when you enter the restaurant you have to look everywhere for staff to serve you. Often times the waitress is delivering room Service or preparing for a conference breakfast and doesn't return for 10 to15  minutes. It seems the wait staff has so many other things to do in addition to providing service to breakfast customers that they are obviously not happy with their job. The attitude at the restaurant for breakfast has changed significantly and we are tired of having to beg for someone to wait on our table and contend with a less than friendly attitude. There are other restaurants in Safety Harbor that provide breakfast with efficiency and timely, courteous service. Fountain Grill is a beautiful facility but needs more attention to customer service before we will consider returning and recommending the restaurant two friends and neighbors.

I've been here twice in 3 weeks. Weekdays are less crowded but service has always been great. They usually have spa packages that include lunch & champagne. The outdoor seating is lovely, reminds me of Italy. The food has been consistently good. Although, I've only had seafood dishes. I noticed the indoor seating had plenty of tables to seat big parties as well. You don't have to be a hotel or spa guest to patron the restaurant. It's worth the drive especially if you're looking for a less crowded restaurant during COVID.

Though my 2017 review still stands, thought I'd update since I was recently here.  I stopped in for a late lunch, choosing their signature crabcakes and slaw from the appetizer menu.  It was beyond perfect, fresh, flavorful and delicious.  They had plenty of outdoor seating for an added layer of safety during this pandemic era, but I chose inside since it was virtually empty.  The only other customer was a Bridezilla and her spouse-to-be, taste testing potential reception foods with a wedding planner and kitchen manager, an interesting floor show.  (Think "I don't like onions so no one at the reception needs onions on their salads." and "gluten-free people don't need to attend my reception cuz they aren't getting special meals")  My service, though, was speedy, masked and friendly.  My only regret was that I wasn't here long enough to enjoy multiple meals.  If I had to find criticism, I wish their doors were open on the hotel side.  They're heavy and being open is more welcoming.  It actually looked closed being shut and the absence of guests.  (I do hope the later guests had an enjoyable reception with fine food.  Lovely location.)

Our family enjoyed the delicious Friday Italian night buffet.   The pasta is made to order and includes fresh vegetables, shrimp, and chicken.  A salad bar is included as well so it's a great value at 19.99 per person. We felt like we were going back in time 50+ years in this charming setting and we especially enjoyed our waitress Toni!
Service is SLOW SLOW SLOW SLOW. Food is good but takes ages to come out. Sometimes the waitress disappeared and couldn't be found.

Beautiful, elegant surroundings. Excellent food at reasonable prices for lunch. Yesterday, they were short handed because a waitress called in sick. Joan single handed took care of the whole restaurant. She immediately gave us water and menus. We hardly waited for her to take our order. Our food came out on time. It was hot and delicious. I highly recommend the grilled salmon and the turkey Ruben. Running a restaurant with a full staff is hard enough, but under these circumstances, it was truly exceptional.

Not your typical resort expectations!  Slow , slow, slow service and food that is just adequate at a price point that commands more.  Better choices in the town within walking distance even after 8pm.

The food and service are excellent. Crab cakes have won awards and I order those frequently. The Panini are fabulous and the basil pesto on panini is fresh and very complimentary to the rest of the sandwich. Service your professional and helpful and if you do the outdoor seating area is very attractive. Highly recommend.

Dinner tonight was excellent! Kudos to the chef and to our server, Aaron! Aaron not only provided great service to us, but I also saw him run all the way across the parking lot to return a left jacket to a fellow patron.

I really enjoy this place.  It's a beautiful setting with a great outside seating area if the weather is cooperating.  I agree service can be a little slow but I'm never in a rush when I'm here so it doesn't bother me.  I've had multiple items off the menu and everything has always been good.

We enjoy the food and atmosphere but the service is incredibly slow. From the time the hostess seats you and a server greets you and you actually get a drink can be over 30 minutes even when there is no one there. Management needs to make sure that even though it is a smaller restaurant the service quality is still a priority. It would probably be less dead if they did this.

We stopped by for dessert after dinner at another restuarant. I give 4 stars for the food and decor but 3 stars for the service. The cappuccino was delicious; the best I have had. It is served with rock candy which is a nice touch. The hazelnut cake was delicious. It tasted like Nutnella. However, the service could be improved. It was not busy at all yet we had to wait for the hostess to seat us. We had specified that we only wanted dessert yet she gave us the dinner menu and no dessert menu. It took a while for the food to arrive. I would recommend the dessert but service could be improved.

I live a few minutes from the Safety Harbor Spa. It is a beautiful location so we decide to support a local business for Thanksgiving. We are a family of two so we always eat out for holiday meals. I booked the reservation weeks before the holiday and arrived 10
minutes before our reservation. The meal itself was a prix fixed meal at $35 per person. Not a huge price but expensive enough to expect decent service. As soon
as we checked in, we were told there was not a 2 person table available so they could set us at the end of large families table that had two open chairs. WHAT???? I don't want to have dinner with my extended family much less a strange family. They didn't look thrilled either. When I refused that arrangement, they offered to pull the small table away from the larger party. Basically, the table is now two feet from the other party and half way into the check in area. The only other option offered was to have dinner in the lounge which was full and extremely loud due to live music. We finally got the manager involved and he found a table outside on the patio and set up a heater to keep off the chill. We order our food. The soup ( lobster bisque) tasted fantastic unfortunately neither of us got even a pea sized piece of lobster. I am willing to forget this because it is hotel dinner not 5 star. Once the food comes, the waitress who hasn't been back since dropping off the soups was smart enough to bring drink
Refills. We got one turkey and one salmon. The turkey was okay some pieces were rubbery but it had a tasty gravy. The mashed potatoes were dried out but with some added butter they were decent. The salmon was way too salty and mediocre at best. 
I am telling myself at this point nothing is perfect but for an $85 meal for two I am not real happy. Then disaster strikes!!! I look down and see something on the side of my glass. On further inspection, I realize it is dried food stuck to the inside of my glass. And it has friends!!! A smear of food dried all the way down the glass and another clump around the bottom the size of a Lima bean. Not a little speck but a significant piece of food stuck on the inside of my glass. After waiting 5 minutes to get the waitress back over, she tries to tell me it is a lemon seed. When I put the glass in front of her face, she said "eww that is gross" "sorry about that, do want another drink".  Yes, oh course I want another drink. I am trying not to think about how the food got in the glass so I don't throw up the mediocre dinner I am paying $85. She did bring another drink in a clean glass. No further apology or acknowledgment of the incident. I expected at least an apology from the manager. We had to
Put in our dessert order three times because the waiter forgot the order and we asked for coffee. It was good coffee but the carafe was filthy on the outside. Coffee stains and crud in the cracks on the outside of the carafe. Even greasy spoon dinners wipe down to carafes before serving you coffee. Overall, it was more like truck stop  service than elegant hotel service. The food was just mediocre. I wouldn't come back at $40 per person. It is a shame because the setting is beautiful.

Our first time here and the food and service were suburb. The spa and resort surrounding the restaurant are decorated in Classical Greek style and the restaurant is no exception. From salad to dessert the quality of the food was impressive. We will definitely return.

My wife and I have been to this restaurant before and the service was excellent. This time we went in for drink late evening after playing tennis at the spa. We're not big eaters (wife weighs about 107 pounds) and were tired and not really hungry (from the tennis), but we ordered a couple of appetizers while deciding on a drink. It seemed to take forever for the waitress (our receipt says "15 Madeline") to get back to us. When I ordered the drink, I feel I made it very clear that we would be ordering "just the margarita". The waitress seemed disappointed and then said something like, "No entree?" (even though I feel my order was VERY clear) in what I felt was a condescending, passive-aggressive manner. (It did NOT seem like she was just trying to make sure she had the order correct.) I don't recall seeing her again for the rest of our dining. When my wife and I were finished, we waited and waited for the check. I had to ask someone else working in the restaurant to get the waitress to bring our check. When she finally brought the check, she (in a manner I felt was incredibly snide) asked my wife, "Did you get enough to eat?" It seemed like she was trying to be as insulting as possible without being so obvious as to get immediately fired. I can't really ever seeing a server who seemed as "passively insulting" about the amount of food ordered.

The Fountain Grill has always been one of my favorite spots!
The food quality is good! Seems like a major overhaul is underway. 
Many new and inexperienced servers. Training is importaint.
Suggestions for manager for training.
1 know the menu
Inside and out. Our server was clueless, forgetful and deaf, lol.
All we need is food and water refills.
Basic skill; learn the menu.
And if you don't know.
Say I don't know.

Bathrobe-clad spa clients and old spanakopita were the features in the Fountain Grill when we lunched recently.  The wait staff was attentive, but the food was mediocre at best.  The grouper dish was mostly veg with a bit of fish.  The tuna melt fared better but was average.  Restaurant should consider a private section for Spa clients- I don't like dining with naked people in robes...

While my "true" rating would be more of a 4.5, I'm rounding high due to the fine service I received over 3 breakfasts, 1 lunch and 2 suppers in this establishment over a one week period.  The place is decorated well with welcoming ambiance, inside and outside, including cloth napkins and polished silverware.  Hostess greetings were friendly and waiter help came swiftly. (My faves were Jamie & Dexter.)  The views are spectacular.  

Breakfast can be the elegant but inexpensive continental buffet at $8 for fruit, cheeses, yogurt, many juices, cereal, toast, bagels or homemade pastries; or it can come from the menu.  (I enjoyed a fabulous fruit/berry parfait one day.)  The only thing that had me aghast was the men using their cell phones on speaker for business meetings in the middle of a pleasant meal for others.  Not the restaurant's fault.

Meals come from a fixed menu of about 5 pastas and 8 entrees plus a myriad of appetizers, flatbreads, soups and salads.  Everything I ordered was pretty to look at and tasty as well.  I especially liked the mushroom pappardelle.  I thought the chicken was a little dry in that entrée.  The invasive smell of fish was yucky on one day making me never want to order fish there.  (Not that something was wrong with it, but the fishy smell was not pleasant.)

They have many nice dessert options and run a 2 for 1 appies on Wednesdays or free wine with entrée.  Homemade sourdough bread is offered at the meal.  Costs run $15-30.   A criticism would be that they don't have a "spa listing" with scrumptious options for the dieter and spa user--portions are huge in all of them and picking yourself is difficult amongst all the temptations.  I preferred 20 years ago when it was a separate menu.

business.name: Dough Nation
business.categories: Cafes, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Restaurants, Food, Desserts

reviews.text: Ice cream was the best ice cream I've had in a while! They had so many options and I can't wait to go back and try the others.

Don't let the name fool you, this sweets shop has more than just cookie dough! They offer ice cream, milk shakes, cookies and cookie dough. I got a milkshake and ice cream cookie sandwich! You can customize most of the menu to your liking as well. Employees are friendly. Make sure you swing by next time you have a sweet tooth!

I live in NH and my sister lives in Tampa. For her birthday I had cookies delivered to her house and she loved them!! Said they were well packaged, and that the cookies were soft and gooey. Super easy to place an order and made a great gift :)

O. M. G!!! I didn't even know this place was right here in the middle of Carrollwood (in the strip mall with Noble Crust)! 
We have been craving really good cookies for weeks.  We found this place on yelp! 
As soon as you walk through the door, the amazing smells greet you! They had just taken a batch of Reese's Pieces PB Fluff cookies out of the oven! ONE PLEASE? Rounded out my cookie trio with a Sugar Cookie and a Chocolate Chip Cookie! My son got a small cup of cookie dough...got to pick two flavors so he chose Sugar Cookie Dough and Chocolate Chip Dough. They are so surprisingly tasty! The Sugar Cookie Dough is my favorite!  Great service, pricing and treats! Check it out!!

I seen this place on the news and I've always wanted to try it. This is heaven for anyone who loves cookie dough. Dough nation offers a variety of cookie dough flavors customers can combine with ice cream. They also sell individual cookies and pie slices. No inside seating due to COVID. However, two small tables are located outside the front door.

I purchased a medium cup for $7.50 that allows customers to pick 4 different flavor combinations between ice cream and cookie dough. I had oreo fudge, sweet and salty dough with peanut butter fudge and cookies and cream ice cream. I almost couldn't finish the cup there's definitely enough sugary deliciousness to share with a second person. I will gladly visit Dough Nation again and support their profits going to charity

Had the pleasure of checking out this place in Carrollwood today. I had heard about it from a tik tok I came across. I was so excited I got to try out their newest item - the 2020 Survivor Shake! You get to choose your cookie dough, ice cream flavor and then a hot chocolate or caramel vaccine shot. The shake is huge and so cute you almost don't want to eat it!

They have a ton of other things to choose from including vegan options. 

The owner/staff is so welcoming and friendly. Open now with safety measures in place. Please support ur local businesses!
Large variety of ice cream and cookie dough and staff are super friendly, so glad I don't have to go to downtown for this now!
very cozy and a good vibe to be in. guy at the counter was very nice and very helpful. good ice cream and cookie dough!

Enjoyed a post dinner treat going to Dough Nation the other night. Various choices of edible cookie dough and have option of adding in a second flavor or ice cream to mix it up a little. If you're not sure what to get the staff offer possible mixes that are popular or from personal choice. I had the M&M dough and peanut butter ice cream. Tasted great!

The cause is very noble, love the idea behind it - All proceeds go to Metropolitan Ministries.

My love affair w/artisanal ice-cream, cookie dough sandwiches & milkshakes is fulfilled at Dough. :)

Go with one of the three choices because their ice-cream sandwich coupled w/a milkshake is very rich & sweet - $15 for both; My hubs & I had to throw the rest away - couldn't finish it all in one visit. 

**I learned this time around! I only ordered a Small (2 scoops) - Raspberry Truffle (5/5 - great mix of the two flavors w/the truffle shining through in comparison - very tasty & my favorite - def. a reorder) & Salted Caramel (4.5/5 - another nice combo of savory & sweet).**

Dough has so many flavors & the biggest compliment I can give them is that there's diversity; I don't want the same ice-cream as the ones I get from the store, totally defeats paying premium prices! 

The inside was so clean & modern w/masked employees, especially loved the "Eat the whole thing & don't feel guilty" signage.

Ice cream and Cookie dough? What's not to love? We walked back and forth along the cases trying to decide what to get! So many yummy choices! Delicious edible cookie dough topped with amazing ice cream! Lots of other ice cream treats too! And proceeds benefit metropolitan ministries!

Dough Nation serves up delicious ice cream and cookie dough flavors.  Their portions are always a great value for the price, and always serve with a smile. The staff are consistently helpful and the interior is always kept spotless clean.  Their menu also include smoothies and fresh made espresso and coffee.  

This place is quietly serving up some tasty mouth-watering flavors. This location is designed more for take it to go style, which is well suited to the current COVID-19 social distancing times. There are a couple chairs outside for one small group of customers.

Man on mannnnn......I have never been to a place that serves you the cookie dough that you actually want and the Ice cream that best suits your preference for the cookie dough. Too much and you can't even get to the cookie dough, not a problem. You can take the dough home and bake it.If you have a sweet tooth, creative mind and taste buds that love flavor. Here you go!
First, what a cool cool concept. We love that they have GF and Vegan cookie dough options and that proceeds go to charities in the local area. Everyone loved everything they chose. We'll be back!

I love dough nation and am so happy they moved to carrollwood. The dough itself is tasty, though I wish they had more than two vegan options (but 2 is still a great start!). The service is always awesome, and whoever is working is friendly. Definitely check it out for a sweet treat!

It was just okay for me. My 9 year old nephew was in town, and like any kid, was craving ice cream. I went to their website and discovered a great deal for the month of July. 50% off of first online order. I signed up, placed an order for 3 items and selected a pickup time.  Normally I would've just ordered something for my nephew, but since it was 50% off, I thought why not. I ordered 2 small cups and 1 ice cream sandwich. My nephew loved his blue Cookie Monster ice cream/cookie dough combo. I wasn't crazy about either of the other orders. They were over the top sweet. Maybe I just wasn't in the right mood for extra sweet. I will give them another try, as the establishment is adorable and all of their flavors look tasty.

Dough Nation is probably one of my favorite dessert shops of all time. Not only do they have vegan options (2 flavors of cookie dough) for a cheap price, but they also pack so much dough in the cup that I end up saving it and having leftovers the next day. All of the employees are always friendly and it makes me feel better to know that my money is going towards funding Metropolitan Ministries, a local non-profit organization I used to volunteer at as a student in high school. You can't go wrong with any of the flavors and don't forget that you can get more than one!

If you've ever risked getting salmonella because you love raw cookie dough some much, then this is your place and you can do it safely! The ice cream is delicious and not  too sweet, and the cookie dough is perfection. The decorations and colors inside are very cute and there's lots of seating. Perfect for the whole family or for date night.
