One of the best dessert options in Tampa. I love all the cookie dough flavors. You can't go wrong with any combination of cookie dough/ice cream.

Eh. Overly expensive and not impressed. Was originally excited when reading about this place and the location since convenient to where I work. Visited on a lunch break and got the milkshake-- $9 might I add!!  I got the strawberry ice cream mixed with the sugar cookie dough per recommendation of the staff member working. The shake comes with choice of a dough and ice cream which the blend together and add whipped topping. I thought it came with a cookie as well per pictures but apparently not. The milkshake is HUGE!! And overly sweet....too sweet for me and too sweet and thick to enjoy. Ended up throwing almost the whole $9 thing out. You can also just order the cookie dough and if you don't wanna eat it like it is, there are baking instructions on the container they serve it in. They don't use raw materials (egg) for the dough so no need to panic there. 

Great that they donate proceeds to Metropolitan Ministries but just overly priced. Very clean establishment and plenty of parking and seating available.

Dough Nation is where you go to eat raw cookie dough.  If you are into that sort of thing, that's great.  But, grainy, gritty, mealy ---- partially frozen raw cookie dough is not for me.  There is obviously something wrong with me.  Maybe it is the way I was raised never to eat raw cookie dough because it contains raw eggs.  However, I'm sure that Dough Nation raw dough will definitely not make you ill.

I will either purchase their dough and bake cookies with it later, or just eat ice cream and baked cookies.  The ingredients are excellent quality and the atmosphere joyous.  I will most likely return for non-raw version of their ice cream and cookie treats.

If you love cookie dough or ice cream with cookie dough in it, then this is your spot! I was really excited when my coworkers mentioned that this place even existed. I had the sugar cookie and M&M cookie dough, which were pretty good. I've realized that I'm not really a cookie dough person though. I don't mind a little in my ice cream, but I can't sit and eat cookie dough by itself. So I followed the instructions and baked my dough and those cookies came out amazing! If you're willing to spend a little extra dough for cookie dough, these come out to be really amazing cookies. Or if you've got a sweet tooth, then give this place a shot! I'll definitely return to try out the ice cream and cookie dough mix!

Soooo good! Went for the first time on Tuesday and we ordered the cookie monster ice cream, the chocolate chip cookie dough and French vanilla ice cream, and peanut butter chocolate ice cream. Everything was really good, especially the Cookie Monster ice cream. That was definitely our favorite. I love the idea that it's run by Metropolitan Ministries. I really love the edible cookie dough too.... This place is great for the kids and we'll definitely be repeat customers.

Why 5 stars? Because creating a business out of edible cookie dough is basically as genius as it gets.

   ---   ---   ---

I've been to a couple of the other locations and continue to be impressed. Cookie dough is one of the greatest tasting substances on Earth, but there's always the risk of hurting yourself from eating too much raw egg. The fact that someone invented 100% safe cookie dough with no raw egg just proves to me that we're living in the best version of society that's ever existed. 

And to pair it with ice cream just to shake up the texture? Bless you sir or madam who came up with this.

I opted for the cookie monster ice cream and sugar cookie, cookie dough. I don't know what the exact flavor was for cookie monster, but it was described to taste like icing on a cake. That description was very accurate. It was delicious. And the cookie dough was as amazing as it always is.

I'm so excited to have one of these in Carrollwood now, though, it's also quite dangerous. Good thing I didn't throw away my old 38 waist jeans.

We just stopped in here for dessert. DELICIOUS!  They have it all... cookies, pies, cakes, ice cream and even better.... raw cookie dough!  Yum 

Definitely stop in!  Everything was great.

business.name: Milk & Cookies Bakeshop
business.categories: Food, Bakeries, Desserts

reviews.text:
I came here to grab some pride cookies and support the Chew project yeg. There are only 2 people (from the same cohort) allowed in the shop at any given time so I waited outside until it was my turn. They have hand sanitizer right on the door so you can spray some before you go in, and it smelled good too! 

Inside the staff are friendly but seemed bit rushed. She kept calling me "buddy" which I found a little off putting but I guess it is a safe type of word to use not to offend anyone. Maybe I'm just old hahaha! The cookies looked pretty great! They also had cupcakes and other baked goods. I asked how long the cookies normally last for and she answered 3-4 days. I also asked about freezing the cookies and she said I could try that but the icing may get all melted and weird looking. 

I usually order cookies from home bakers and they seal their cookies a lot of times using a heat sealer to make the cookies last longer and stay fresh. These cookies are not heat sealed although I did not ask if they could heat seal them for me. I would ask that next time if I go back again. Overall it was a good experience and I may return again. I do love all their unique and cute designs of cookies (they change monthly) and they do customs cookies as well but would definitely ask about heat sealing next time as I usually buy cookies to give away to other people and it's nice if they could last longer than a few days.

Milk & Cookies is such an adorable bakery, their cookies are unreal! During Halloween, I stopped by to pick up a treats for my family and I am impressed with the quality. The sugar cookies are soft but not crumbly and the cute designs are just the cherry on top. 

The one product that stood out to me were the cookie sandwiches (my favourite being the mint chocolate flavour). It's like an Oreo but upgraded x1000. Heavily recommend!

Milk & Cookies has quickly become one of my favourite bakeshops in Edmonton. Before I had visited in-person, I spent way too much time drooling over photos of their sugar cookies and cakes on Instagram.

I ended up booking a cake with them for my wedding. When COVID-19 hit and we had to change our plans, M&C was incredibly flexible. We still had them make us a smaller custom cake and they did an amazing job. Since then, I've been super impressed with how they've handled the pandemic. They started out offering curbside only but have since opened their doors with limits on how many people can be inside at the time, staff wearing masks and hand sanitzer ready at the door before you enter. 

My go-to treat from M&C is their cookie sandwich, particularly the brownie birthday cake (which happens to be gluten-free!). It is soft and gooey like a brownie but has more of a cookie-like texture. I've tried almost everything here and I've yet to be disappointed. Tonight I'm looking forward to digging into one of their "cake scraps in a sad box" which is their cool way of avoiding cake waste.

I've been wanting to try Milk and Cookies for ages now and finally I made a stop and I am pleasantly surprised. I bought a peanutbutter corner, 2 deer shaped cookies and a scrapc box! It came to about $22 I believe, a bit pricey for me, but I'm also cheap. Even being cheap though, I do think it's fairly priced for the quality of the desserts, they were worth it honestly. The 4 stars is because I'm a cheap ass 

So, I bought the cake for myself--despite the lady saying it could easily be for 6 people-- and it is delicious. I have no complaints whatsoever about it. Mine contained brownie, cookie dough, vanilla and chocolate and i am absolutely pleased as punch. She may have been right about it feeding 6 people, but, Imma eat it in 2 sittings.

Now, the cookies, were an iced sugar cookie and both of my kids were delighted to eat a deer shaped cookies and more or less inhaled them. The only exception was when I accidentally broke the head off of my 2year olds cookie. Oops. 

And lastly, was the peanut butter corner piece, which I bought for my husband and he was a big fan! He's a peanut butter dessert fiend, so it was right up his alley. I had a bite and it was honestly so rich and sweet, definitely recommend.

So, overall, a bit pricey, but worth the price tag and I recommend you go!

This bakery is phenomenal!! I'm almost reluctant to do a stellar review so I can keep them hidden. But then I know how popular these ladies are already, so  its time to rave about them. I have used them 2x already for 2 separate occasions. They make these gorgeous cookie cakes and they are shaped into numbers. I got blessed that they had a cancellation and they were able to make it for me. Otherwise the wait is 2 months so book early. Since I purchased 2 numbers we got to pick 2 flavors (lemon/raspberry). It had a vanilla cake with lemon or raspberry cream topped with sugar cookies and decadent macarons finalized with gold flakes. I also did a last minute purchase of their sugar cookies as give aways for the milestone birthday. Perfectly sweet sugar cookies and the decoration on them was too cute to eat. Everyone fought over everything I got.

When you enter their shop they have sugar cookies, variety of home style cookies and 2 cakes. Since I know it they are booked up I took a chance for whatever cake they would have on the shelf. It ended up choosing between cookies and cream or birthday surprise(confetti cake). So i picked it based on its looks. I picked the confetti cake with macarons and it was perfection. If you ever need a last minute cake these ladies will always have 2 mini cakes on their shelf. Just call and prepay for it and they will reserve it.

I love what this bakery is doing! Such cute cookies that change everyday and such interesting flavour combinations! My favourite item is their cookie sandwiches. They also had a white brownie bar that was amazing, but it was only there for a short time. Either way, this bakery is doing some great things and everything is meticulously crafted and their cakes look amazing!

I have been having a craving for salted caramel macarons for months I swear so I decided to hunt some down and googled bakeries that might have what I was looking for. On Tuesday I was at a medical appointment and this bakery was the closest to where I was so I decided to stop in and see what they had. When I went in I was so intrigued by some of the treats they had but decided to stick to my original quest and bought a dozen macarons. 10 salted caramel and 2 cookies and cream cause they were too pretty to not try them. I couldn't even wait till I got home to try one and quickly got out a salted caramel macaron to try right away. Oh. My. Goodness! So so yummy and exactly what I'd been craving. The caramel in the center is delightful. The cookies and cream ones were good too but not quite as good as the salted caramel. It's going to be so hard to not go and buy a box like every day they are so good! I look forward to visiting again and trying some more of their yummy treats... i really want to try a cookie sandwich next time!

Cute little bakery nestled in a terrible location. Hard to get to on Calgary Trail because it's one way but easy to find.  

Milk and Cookies has a selection of cookies, macaroons and other sweets.  Cookies are always decorated perfectly!

Kids favorite: banana bread 
My favorite: brownie cookie thing (can't remember what it's called but check out the picture!!)

Looking online got me super excited to get cookies premade from Milk & Cookies for a bridal shower. The ordering process was easy. I picked up the cookies on the date I requested, they looked wonderful. However, the sugar cookie lacked flavour. The art on the cookie was amazing and detailed with everything I asked for. During this visit I bought a few goodies from the showcase, which were ate after supper that same night. Every sweet tasted stale. The cupcakes were awful and extremely dry inside. I'm not sure I'd return or preorder.

I have been following this bakery on Facebook for quite some time. I don't even know how I came across it to be honest. I was looking for something unique and not chocolate-y for my kids for Valentine's Day, so I made the trip down Calgary Trail and discovered a tiny gem in a sea of mini-malls. They have a small but lovely selection of hand-crafted cookies, muffins, macaroons and meringues that are decorated beautifully for the season and occasion. I settled on the galaxy cookies, the cupid's arrow and some meringues. They were a big hit with the little ones! Cookies are in the $3-4 range each, which at first sight seems like a lot, but these are more than just bakery items, they are hand-crafted works of art. I think they would make beautiful and thoughtful gifts for any kind of special occasion.

Absolutely loved the tiny little place with big flavour! Ordered a birthday cake, the prices are affordable and the cake was absolutely gorgeous, both in looks and taste. Ended up buying meringues and sugar cookies when I went in to pick up the cake and those did not disappoint either. The items were picture perfect.I have to admit, this is going to be my go-to place from now on.
I had the best cookie I ever had here. The brownie birthday cake cookie is to die for. Please consider stopping by for a cookie because they are worth it

I follow Milk & Cookies on social media and their decorated sugar cookies  look cute and amazing! I was at MacEwan where they sometimes have a pop up shop.  It was around noon and there were only 2 sugar cookies left; a mitten and a skate and they were priced at $3.75 each.  They also had various other cookies in bags for $7 for 6 cookies.  The various flavours were chocolate and mint, peanut butter, and chocolate chip.  I noticed the sizes of the cookies varied where some were larger than others.  The bag of chocolate chip ones I got seemed to be a little smaller.

I had a cookie later that afternoon, and as soon as I bit into it, I could taste salt.  I think maybe it was just that bite but the whole cookie was too salty for my liking.  I find things salty so I asked my husband after he ate a cookie if he thought it was salty and he said he did.  I'm not sure if it was a bad bag we got, or if the chocolate chip ones are salty but I didn't like them.  I didn't find the cookies to be extraordinary and could make some myself that would be comparable.

That being said, I would like to try something else in the bakery and hope it's more sweet than salty.

Love love love the cakes and cookies. Rachelle does a beautiful job on everything I've ordered or gone in and picked up. Her cookies make great gifts for teachers, coaches, friends. I go in about once a week to grab something for someone.

Amazing stuff!! I ordered a cake and cookies for my son's 1st birthday, and they exceeded my already high expectations! The cake tasted absolutely amazing... everyone was raving about it. And the cookies were the cutest and exactly what I wanted... and they also tasted amazing! You will not be disappointed going here! Highly recommend. Trust me when I say you will LOVE this place.

I ordered a cookies delivery to a local address (I'm not local!) -- and they arrived warm & lovely, with a pretty card attached, all according to my request.  The service was 5 stars!   Sadly, I didn't get to taste the cookies myself (that's the only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5) but the recipients were very grateful.  Thank you, Milk & Cookies!

business.name: The STIL
business.categories: Specialty Food, Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Beer, Wine & Spirits

reviews.text: My only complaint is that this place is in Idaho!!! I will definitely be coming here whenever I visit Idaho! I got the powered snow ice cream and I've been thinking about it since. So delicious, so creamy. Great spot for dessert.

Love the fact they have non dairy options as I'm allergic but they use coconut cream so all their non dairy ice creams have a coconut flavor and I'm not to much of a fan of that flavor, sometimes they can work well together . my daughter loves them though, she likes all the flavors they have to offer.
Absolutely loved this place. So many options to choose from. Probably the creamiest ice cream I've ever had, soo good! The employees were also lovely. 10/10 would recommend!
Yummy ice cream! They have alternative options and loved the people! Definitely worth a try

The Sweetest Things In Life - our favorite ice cream store in the Boise area. Interesting flavor combinations. Love their adult flavors (need to be 21-y.o. to order them). Wish their scoops were a little bigger, though. The young folks behind the counter are always congenial and polite. We always visit the downtown shop whenever we're in town.

I like this joint! I'm not a big vanilla ice cream fan, as I prefer different random flavors, but this place has a homemade, created from scratch type of ice cream. It's something about the creamery of their vanilla that made me appreciate the most simplest flavors. 
I also tried their cookies n orange cream flavor and that is one on my list as well. Pretty similar to the regular Cookies N Creme, but orange. 
This location had some renovation and construction going on around it, but in case you cant findvit based on what the outside is supposed to look like, there is a big black sign and tunnel that leads to it.

Best vanilla ice cream I have ever had. From a person whose favorite food is ice cream, that means a lot. Their fresh powder is beyond creamy & sweet but not too sweet from their perfect addition of cream cheese to their vanilla ice cream. Will always go here & always get their fresh powder.

They weren't doing samples still because of Covid...yet their other two locations were....that's insanity. I wanted to try half of the flavors...as part of the experience of going to an ice cream shop is trying the flavors to pick what you actually want. So I bought 3 flavors without trying them. 2 of them did not live up to the hype (brownie batter and apple pie). The brownie batter was good but I've had better quality elsewhere. The apple pie was slightly off to me and missing something...but wasn't bad. The vanilla cream cheese ice cream I found phenomenal and on par with the best ice creams I have had in this country such as Jenis ice cream. Overall though...not every ice cream here is of superior quality as some people on Yelp have claimed this is the best ice cream in the world
Great Ice Cream!  Unusual flavors but good on a hot day!

First day in Boise stopped here to treat the kids for doing so great on the flight here. My son has a dairy allergy, and most ice cream shops don't offer vegan ice cream. The STIL had 5 vegan options! Everything's clearly labeled and colored coded by nondairy, dairy and dairy with alcohol. The kids loved it! We loved it! If we lived here, this would be our ice cream spot. Go! You'll thank me later!

Such a great spot to sit out in the sun! The ice cream is insanely creamy and delicious. I got a recommendation for the deja vu from the employee at the counter and it was incredible! I tried the boozy ice cream, which was different but really great. If you're in the area I definitely recommend checking this unique spot out!
There are so many flavors to choose from! We narrowed it down to indulging in Cookies with Grandma and Deja Vu. It was nice to grab some ice cream on a one-day stop in Boise.

There is a long line so if you are hesitant about crowds, bring a mask. Almost no one wears a mask and social distancing isn't practice.
The ice cream is amazing. I ordered a Bourbon and honey scoop plus lavender. It was amazing. The store is not built. The building is still under construction which makes me nervous standing.

Boozers understandably love this place. But this place offers a horrible experience for families with kids. There is usually a 30 minute wait in a long line. That line is in a narrow tunnel with no one wearing masks, including staff. Staff with no masks because pandemic is over. But wait, we don't offer samples because of pandemic! Go figure! Because they don't give samples my kid ended up getting something she hated. We had to throw it in trash right there at the establishment. My daughter had tears in her eyes. We didn't have the courage or energy to get in line or go inside again.

Both delicious Icecream and alcohol! My husband and I went here for a date night a couple weeks ago and it was just what we were craving. Great flavors, staff and experience! Definitely going to go here again!

You can have beer AND ice cream at the same time? 4 beers and 4 different scoops for $16?! Say no more! 

We heard The STIL is a must-visit ice cream place when visiting Boise and it did not disappoint! We came here for an afternoon cool down snack after spending 3 hour biking in the sun on the Green Belt. It was the perfect in-between meals snack.

The people serving us were super helpful and knowledgeable and made great recommendations! There were so many to choose from it could be a little overwhelming if you have a hard time making decisions lol but luckily when we went (on a Thursday afternoon) we were able to spend more time with on one else behind us to pressure us.

I got 2 of the dairy-free & vegan ice cream flavors and they were still creamy and flavorful! I didn't feel like I was missing out at all! The Hubby doubled-down on beers and booze-infused ice cream flavors, he really enjoyed everything! I'm also glad they wrote down the name of the drink and flavors on the flight (under the cups) since I'm pregnant I didn't want to accidentally eat the boozy ones lol!

I overheard that they don't unfortunately don't give out samples to let you try, but I don't think you'll be disappointed with any flavor here . If you want to try multiple flavors at a reasonable price and add some drannnnnks to the mix to spice it up (beer or wine or a combination of both) I highly recommend the flight!

The only thing I wish they had was maybe some recommendations on pairings between the beer/wine with the ice cream flavors so you can maximize the flavor blast!
We've been coming here for the pat 4 years. No matter how full we are, an ice cream always sounds good. Their treats are homemade and delicious! Definitely worth the calories.
We visited the ice cream parlor. The ladies in the store were very nice! We're from out of town and they gave us some hike recommendations as well as ice cream recommendations! Ice cream was delish!

Went to the new bench location. Told them it was our first time. They were impatient and rude, very young and disinterested. The ice cream flavors were different but good. It's a bit over priced and the place is just trying too hard to be 'hip'.
Good ice cream. I got the brownie batter one. Big fan. If you're looking for Idaho ice cream, this is a good place to try. It's in downtown, too, so you can walk around and see what there is to see.
Great ice cream with tons of unique and awesome flavor combinations! Even had some 21 and over liquor infused ice cream. Great stop in Boise!

This is another one of my 'must visit every time' places in Boise. Everyone knows I won't shut up about The Stil. I have stickers and a tumbler to demonstrate my love. 

Despite living in another state, I think I've tried most flavors. Fresh Powder and Deja Vu are top of my list. And of course, would it be Idaho without Idaho Wilderness, a huckleberry flavor? 

The only ice cream here that has ever disappointed me is "After School Special" - the peanut butter flavor isn't that strong and the no bake cookies in it taste a bit strange.

The waffles cones are delicious and everyone working here usually seems to be in good spirits so it's got a great vibe all around.

I loved the fun variety of flavors and the staff is always helpful. Some flavors are so, so, but overall very good! Seating is limited which is understandable because the spot is small, but it would be nice to have a fun atmosphere with more seating. However, it's a great place!

I have loved the ice cream here. But tonight, while I was waiting in line I was watching one of the employees with shaggy blond hair who kept stroking his hair as he was getting people their orders with his bare (hair greased)  hands!! He would also lean down as he was scooping and his hair would touch people's cones!
I was so grossed out I lost my appetite and left. 

Everyone here is really friendly and I'm sure the ice cream is good but that was too much for me.
Delicious ice cream if you are willing to wait in a long line but the staff was great.
